review_content: Trademark of SG.The most popular park and very nice view.I wish i could come again to Singapore someday.
A half mermaid, half lion statue right by the Marina. It gets very popular so would recommend going early or late in the day.  A lot of people wait to get pictures with the statue.

No trip to Singapore is complete without viewing the Merlion. Set by the water with view across to the Gardens By the Bay this is a great stop for photographers. Image attached was actually taken from one of the bumboats that can be caught from Marina Bay Sands that gets you out onto the water for a different view point.

This is one of the must-see places in Singapore. Mainly for the pictures. But the place is super crowded. We went there at close to 6, and stayed till 8. At 8 or sometime later, there was an amazing light show covering the entire panoramic landscape in front of the merlion. That made the entire trip worthwhile. Not sure if this is a daily affair, so you may want to check before planning.
The place was so clean n the environment was so good.Me n my family enjoyed our holiday..Hope to come back again because this trip was a sudden plan so we cant go to many places in Singapore...

One of the most famous landmarks of Singapore..Quite an icon it is..This is a place where you can hang around for a bit click some photos and thats about it..water comes out from the mouth of this statue..It is basically a Lion's head and the body of a fish..You can visit if you are around..

This is one of the must-see places in Singapore and definitely some camera moments here. However, there were too many tourists in a small spot wanting to take pictures and it got a bit annoying. You can do the River Cruise here for 25 Dollars for 50 minutes - best to choose the one around 8pm so you don't miss the laser show at night. There are also restaurants which were quite expensive though. On the opposite side of the bay is Marina Bay Sands

Our tour guide got us to this park, it was nice place to watch the marine bay and also to click pictures as it has a breath taking view . There is also a river cruise which takes for a 30 minures tour. You can enjoy some local restaurants there while u there.

Keep in mind that this attraction is listed as a park, the Merlion statue is just a statue within the 2,500 square meter park. The park is decent, however the area is not a destination, but more of if you’re already in the area then you may as well visit. The Merlion statue is white in color, spews water through its mouth, weighs 70 tons, and is 28 feet high. The Merlion Park really just provides a photo opportunity of either the Merlion statue or MBS in the background.

One of the great tourist spots, instantly associated with Singapore. The statue in itself looks a lot smaller than you would anticipate, but it's one of those don't miss it places even though it can be underwhelming once you get there. Steer clear of the gift shop or some of the restaurants close to this unless you're looking to spend a lot
The area is very busy and the statue spews water from its mouth, it signifies the birth of Singapore as a fishing village I believe
Great attraction for tourists with information around and areas to be able to get nice pictures with less people around etc.
Second time in Singapore and of course I had to come back, still so many tourists despite the rise of coronavirus coming from other parts of the world in Jan.

The first place that comes to my mind when I think of Singapore. Beautiful atmosphere, picturesque 360 degree views all around. The walk from Merlion to the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands is beautiful. Truly an amazing place! A must visit for any tourist..
The walk by the Merlion, around to Marina Bay Sands, is a lovely one. Great photo ops at the Merlion, the helix bridge and the Shops at Marina Bay Sands. Worth the photo op!
Iconic Merloin statue is based at Merlion Park. An options to surf the river banks of Clark & Boat Quay is available by boat.
Most likely originating from the Malay term Singapura meaning Lion Land, the Merlion is a fish-like hybrid of the Lion and the Fish.

Lots of tourists about, but a nice place to hang around and take some fun photos. You can practice the perfect shots on your camera, see Marina Bay Sands from the bay, and plenty of other sights. Food souvenirs and refreshments available, sit and take in the fabulous atmosphere.

A visit to the iconic Merlion park is high on most people’s list when they visit Singapore.  The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. The park area has a large choice of places to eat and drink along the Fullerton road, plus you’re on a five minute stroll from Clarke quay.

If you are in Singapore for more than 3 days, you will most likely end up here. Great place for photos and place to eat. But realistically if you do not eat you are spending maximum 30 minutes here. If you do want to see the fountain show at marina sands, this is not a good location for that!

review_title: Mandatory visit if you are at singapore
review_content: AS its iconic statue of singapore , definitely visit. And you will get a good view of marina bay, fullerton hotel and raffles bay. Duck tours and river cruise options also available. And lot of dinner options avaialbe in the park, we could enjoy with view. And if its new year night, catch a place to watch amaxing fireworks
Nice and lovely place to visit and overall a nice experience with family and kids and recommended to visit once

Singapore is a gardener’s heaven with Gardens by the Bay and theirs botanical gardens. So easy to get around, great weather, and such a clean country! A shoppers heaven as their are endless malls everywhere. I stayed 4 days after my cruise and I would definitely go back!

The Merlion is the symbolic sculpture of Singapore, and it is centrally located in the City.   It is around a 10 minute walk from the Esplanade, across Esplanade bridge, and it offers great views of Marina Bay.   The sculpture is also a water feature and it's a great place to get some good photos. It is also free to visit.   I'd recommend spending no more than 20 minutes here, as it can get quite busy and it is mainly a photo spot.   Overall, it is a nice symbolic feature of Singapore and I would recommend a brief visit.

review_title: You Haven’t Been To Singapore If...
review_content: There are a couple things that people will tell you must be seen/done if you visit Singapore, and that you haven’t really been there if you miss it. Merlion Park is one of those things.  The statue itself is quite beautiful and impressive, and locals will tell you that it brings good fortune to Singapore (at least that’s what they told us!). You will need to be patient and well-positioned if you want to get good pictures, so take your time, and enjoy the people watching! You will see countless people lining up shots to catch the Merlion’s water in their mouth, hands, coffee cup...the pinnacle of tourist photos akin to holding up the leaning tower of Pisa.  There are a lot of nice views of the skyline in the area, and plenty of places to grab a quick bite or coffee nearby. As with essentially anywhere you go in Singapore, Merlion Park is very well maintained, safe and extremely clean.
Theis is a very good palce for having good photographs..One the most popular attractions in Singapore.

Located on the waterfront it’s an enjoyable park to walk around the harbour, Merlion statue/water feature is a popular attraction and great photo opportunity.  It’s a buzz of activity with restaurant, bars etc and with people jogging around waterfront.  I would highly recommend going at night time as the lights of the marina bay sands and the surround skyscrapers is very impressive.
Visit the park in daytime and at night. Amazing park with view to marina bay, formula one course, Louis Vuitton flagstone, the skyline.
Beautiful waterfront park with restaurants and beautiful views of the Singapore skylights!! Very popular place!

review_title: A gem in the crown of Singapore
review_content: The Merlion, and surrounding Merlion Park, are truly gems in the crown of Singapore. There are two Merlion's, one is 8m tall and is a water fountain [visible from across the bay] and another one just tucked away behind it. Of course you're going to take a million and one photos for FB/Twitter/Insta/SnapChat... I'd really recommend getting there early when the crowd is less dense, so you can get better snaps!  Logistically, how to get to the Merlion: Hop on to the Singapore Metro, go to Raffles Place Station. Exit the station from exit C. When you leave, do not go towards the exit opposite you. As you leave, turn left and follow the road around the corner to the HSBC office/branch. Cross the main road and go down the steps to Merlion Park

We came here one evening and admired the waterfront / marina from this point whilst taking in the peculiar but iconic merlion statue. Half mermaid, half lion...   Best point for views for of MBS laser light and water show
I guess you have to do this free activity considering it's a Singapore icon. We did the family pictures from different angles as did the rest of the crowd. Get's pretty crowded on a weekend.

Merlion Park may be iconic and a must place to visit in Singapore, but it is also full of tourists many of whom are very badly behaved. The Indian couple which pushed aside my daughter from the barrier in front of the Merlion to be able to take a better picture I really wanted to slap but my daughter asked me not to do it. Very mature for a 11 year old. Otherwise the place is very nice, especially at sunset and against the backdrop of Marina Bay Sands and the Fullerton Hotel.

review_title: Beautiful in the Morning, Wonderful in the evening.
review_content: We went here very early in the morning to stroll, watch and take photos of the sunrise rising behind MBS and shining towards the soon to be removed Merlion Statue. People here are either taking photos, strolling and jogging. The place affords a great view of Singapore’s Marina Bay Sands, Art Museum and business skyline. People can come here, take photos even with a tripod and will not get harassed by security personnels (which is very common in my home country Philippines) you can photograph anything in Singapore.   The park is free.
Merlion Park is iconic. Period. The number of tourists who flock to the place to take clicks and see the breathtaking skyline is amazing.
Everything was worth it. Wonderful experience and highly recommend if you want to visit here. If you want to relax don’t forget to come to this place and enjoy it.

review_title: The Iconic Must Visit Singapore Spot
review_content: People say that you haven't go to Singapore if you don't have your picture in front of the Merlion. Actually this is really just a photo shoot spot for me=) Better come here in the morning, since it will be so hot at noon and hard to take photo due to the sunray. You can have picture with Marina background, Singapore flyer background and also Esplanade. If you like to explore the river you can also ride river cruise. After the hot photo shoot moment, it's so refreshing to take juice or ice cream on the shops along the park. There is a stall selling ice cream with Merlion shape there. If the season is right, you can find Australian sweet cherry sold here too..it tastes so good..but in here the cherries were sold a bit pricy..you can have them cheaper at Fair Price supermarkets. But if you don't have anytime to go to supermarkets, then you can have the cherry here.

Went along here with my wife one evening after we had been out for a nice meal. Got some great photos with the Merlion and the amazing Singapore skyline around the marina bay area. The boardwalk is great to walk along and you feel very safe.  People are friendly with tourists mixing well with locals.  There are a range of shops and restaurants around the park. Remember to take your camera as its a photographers dream!

One of the best instsgram spots in Singapore. Although its very difficult to take a good picture during the day but at night it becomes much easier and the merlion lights up in different colors which makes it look so cool. The area is generally clean and also houses many restuarants. Easily accessible. A must visit for first timers in Singapore.
Be sure to visit the Merlion. It is the iconic symbol of the city and worth the photo op. Plenty of good places to view and photograph the fountain.

review_title: Crowded by day - stand out at night
review_content: During the day it was hard to get a picture due to the popularity, however on viewing from a boat at night this stood out and looked spectacular when lit up
I was going to merlion park when singapore independent day. So crowded and bright. You can see full of fireworks.
if you visit Singapore it's not complete if you can't stop by here and take photos around the Merlion Park

I went there early in the morning to take pictures. There was a crowd of tourists, but I managed to take some good shots. Also, it's cooler in the morning. There are 2 spots you can stand where you have your hands cupped in front or your mouth open so it appears as if the water from Merlion is shooting into your hands or mouth. Very cool.

review_title: I took the river boat to here
review_content: It was an amazing educational exp. one I would do again. The tour guide was very detailed explaining the impact of the historical events along the river.   It was great to learn about the different times in Singapore history. It was also great to get the story behind the Merlion and by arriving by river boat it gave you a different view.

review_title: One of the most photographed places in Singapore - not without reason!
review_content: From here you can take almost any 'necessary' photographs of Singapore as you can! Marina Bay Sands Hotel, the Lion Statue, the city center of skyscrapers, the 'floating football pitch', The Helix Bridge and Esplanade - Theaters of The Bay! Don't expect to be particularly lonely though - even though I was here during 'off-season' (well) in November, there were thousands of people on the scene. But it is not a tourist trap (well) but well worth a few minutes of attendance and attention. Would you rather enjoy the magic of the place in a more relaxed way - come here early morning or stay late until late evening!
Great pleces. But so very hot air if came at bright day. A lot of people came and so many restaurant to go if you hungry.

This was high on my to do list. When I think of Singapore I think of the Merlion. It is a beautiful statue in a nice area to take pictures, have a snack, a drink or just to sit and enjoy the city sites.
Nothing great or spectacular. See it when taking the river cruise. Dont waste time going to the park.
Go in the evening to see the magnificent skyline and the amazing area. Take a stroll around the river taking in views of the beautiful skyscrapers around the Marina Bay Sands area.

The Merlion Park is one of Singapore most popular locations day or night. As Singapore iconic statue there, it is crowded with people taking selfies. There are a lot of cafes and bars along the promenade. It is buzzing with activities and very lively. great atmosphere. There are several landmarks like the Esplanade, Singapore Flyer, ArtScience museum, Sands Hotel, Helix Bridge, Sky Park a short distance away.   It is a good place to relax and enjoy Marina Bay.   An early morning visit before 9.00am is recommended to avoid selfie seekers.

No visit to Singapore is complete without visiting the Merlion statue in Merlion Park.   Best time to visit is dusk so you get to see it in the daytime and also at night for the nightly Spectre light show. It’s free to visit, however tends to get crowded with everyone jostling for a picture, so be mindful of crowds.

well what a wonderful place to visit..well worth the short walk from our hotel to this sea front location. So much to view, great bars & so clean. see the Merlion so close up was the bonus of the trip & I would suggest to any visitor to get this one on the list of things to see. The amount of visitors in the area, though very many, did not spoil this at all.Everyone cheerful & happy takings pics etc & watching the world go by.
Best place to visit in the sunset timing and evening suitable for all ages have places around amazing pictures will have for sure

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. Great place for river cruise and the Business district, Marina Bay Sands and Clarke Quay. Ride costs around 25 dollars. In the e evening you can see the special laser show for free....

review_title: Interesting.., but not a lot of shade
review_content: Not sure if I'd go out of my way to see it. But if you are nearby..  Night time would be better as the skyline is better at night that and you would avoid the full sun.

review_title: Very Convenient Place to See the Marina Bay Area
review_content: Merlion Park is very convenient place to see the Marina Bay Area. Otherwise- not so much around here.

review_title: Merloin Park should be the very last thing on your list for a Singapore Visit
review_content: Its a figures of a Lion that has water from its mouth. Its highly overated and not really of any great specific interest other than based on an older (not ancient) myth. There are so many things to do that this item should be the very last on any sightseeing trip in Singapore.

Really nice place to visit, due to its association with Singapore it’s a must visit destination if only for half an hour. Loads of fresh air and good photographs to get. Good and drinks are readily available to near by shops along with souvenirs. Although it is quite busy it is still a lovely place to go for a walk.

review_title: Symbolic of Singapore; visit for an hour and then take a stroll to Marina Bay Sands or Gardens by the Bay
review_content: The Merlion (cross of Mermaid and Lion) is a symbol strongly associated with Singapore. This is a good place to get a view of the Marina Bay area - an area built on reclaimed land. With the iconic Fullerton Bay Hotel and CBD (Central Business District) skyscrapers in the background, you can take some great photos for your Facebook account!!  After soaking in the atmosphere for about an hour, you can walk over to Marina Bay Sands and the Gardens by the Bay. It would be a 20 min walk. You could also consider going to the Marina Barrage for a wonderful view of Singapore’s CBD.
Nice pics, fresh air and some great memories to make here. It's a really nice tourist spot but can be busy at peak periods.

Everyone has to visit the Merlion but we left it until we had a beautiful day as everyone told us about the fantastic setting to take pictures of the Merlion The Marina Bay sands hotel and downtown Singapore. They were right on all matters.  It can get a little crowded with tourists especially if one of the tour buses have arrived but if you walk towards one Fullerton it is far less crowded and you can take your pictures in peace'  A great spot in Singapore shouldn't be missed

Merlion Park is the place of the mythical Singapore lion. Quite an impressive white figure of stone. From it's mouth stream of gushing water keeps coming, falling on the lagoon below. Surrounded by steps & a garden, a crowd of people sitting, staring, taking pictures. Beautifully lighted. A must-see in Singapore.

This is a must visit place if you are in Singapore for some memorable pictures. It can get pretty crowded here.  It is at a walkable distance from other Singapore attractions such as - the Singapore flyer and the helix bridge.   There are no charges to visit the Merlion.
Very beautiful skyline n the photos look v nice because of e lightings. Many people gather n e vibes r generally positive. Many instagrammable photos.... just up to ur imagination.
A must see while in Singapore. Lovely walk around and plenty to see. The art in Singapore is truly amazing

Merlion Park is very good place to hang out with friends, family and partner. Merlion is Singapore's symbol and you can enjoy surround with good cafes, Cold bubble tea, fruit juice and coffee by seeing stunning infrastructure.
Very well maintained park with Mermaid Lion stand still to make you easy photo, what else you'd asked for?

The statue itself is very basic and overly crowded by tourists. But said that, the view from the park is worth capturing. You get to the marina bay hotels and the cbd skyline. Just visit for the views around.

The famous Merlion spot in the Singapore. Hardly a 10-15 mins spending spot. However, one can tak e a 25$ boat ride which is for about 40 Mins. The boat ride covers important places around the water body along with well timed audio n video documentary. It's worth a ride.
Merlion is one of the most notable landmarks from Singapore. Half lion and half mermaid. A beautiful view is Marina Bay.

We walked around this area on dusk and saw lots of photo opportunities including Marina Bay Sands, Clarke quay, the Singapore flyer, and the Singapore river boats. Walk behind the Fullerton hotel along the river, lots of restaurants and picturesque scenery.
The Merlion is iconic. We went on the rainy day. I have been to Merlion Park thee times. It was beautiful. We spent only 30 minutes at Merlion due to rain.

Thousands of people come here every day. The day and night view is very different. Come here and enjoy the walk and view of Marina Bay Sands light show in the evening, take a picture with Merlion, catch the water in your hands :)

An amazing attraction that draws thousands of tourists daily. Can be very busy and people tripping over each other to get the best shot. Choose a good weather day if you can. Spectacular views of the bay and Marina Bay Sands hotel.
This is the iconic statue of Singapore. We came at the night and there was a light show from the marina bay hotel. Excellent views
Merlion, lion amd fish combination. Juat a place for memorable pictures taking. Everything as per the title.
Great place for pics only if not raining. It pulls crowd so limits photo opportunity time. Great walking place and is very close to Durian- art museum.
I know you’ve got to come here when visiting but in reality there’s not a lot to see or do. It always seems to be very busy, not surprisingly, so choose your time carefully.

Check out the interesting history of how singapore got its name and what the Merlion means to them. This is a “must do” photo opportunity, you simply have to have your picture taken here if you visit Singapore. There’s not much nearby, a few cafes etc. but it is only a short walk or a quick ride on the bum boats to Clarke quay so its worth stopping off here for that photo opportunity, especially the shot where you stand with your mouth open and get the right angle so you picture appears that you are drinking from the fountain. Actually: watching everyone else posing for this picture is the best part of the experience!
This is one of the iconic images of Singapore and provides great photo opportunities. The waterfront location is close to other attractions.
If you want to avoid the hot sunny weather in the day, come here during the evening to see the Merlion glow.
My sister and I visited this place because this is the icon of Singapore. Like a must to see. We went there 8:30 in the morning and shocked to see how many people there. It was too crowded
One of the top ten attractions in Singapore. I suggest a night visit as well to take some nice pictures from this area.
Beautiful part of Singapore. Lots of food and good photos to be had here. Definitely a must see in Singapore.

We went here on a Friday morning. Lots and lots of people all jostling for a bit of space to take photos. To be honest I have seen it many times and i don't think that it is that impressive however when in singapore it is a must see. Symbol of the sea.

This statue is in the Marina Bay area of Singapore. There are many things and beautiful parks around there. It is definitely an area to visit including the Gardens by the Bay, Marina Bay, The Shoppes at Marina Bay. It can get very busy though. This is in the heart of Singapore. Very beautiful at night. Just don't jaywalk or chew any gum there. :):)

The Merlion is a must visit when in Singapore and is at its best at night. The white lion statues (don't forget the baby one!) are pristine. They are on the Marina Bay and look beautiful surrounded by the tall CBD skyscrapers and hotels. Close to the Merlion are lots of bars and restaurants so you can enjoy a drink or dinner in the location.

Worth a visit but it was always busy no matter what time we had gone down there, although it’s packed people normally move out of the way after taking photos so you’ll be able to take some decent snaps.
The views are ok but not much to do unless you take a river boat and then you will have better pictures of the Merlion
still the crowded place as it used to be since its the iconic place to take picture to show that your really in Singapore. just my second time and still the same.

I was acting as a tour guide to 2 Thai nuns, one of whom wanted so much to see the Merlion before she returned to Chiengmai. The weather that morning was beautiful. It was slightly cloudy and windy. So unusual for hot and humid Singapore. There were lots of other tourists in the area.

Visited this place plus other interesting sites around it. It was an okay place nothing spectacular or more than ordinary.  To others it is more than enough but to me, it is fine.  I will surely visit again but this around I will take time to explore better

As it's namesake - the Merlion Park is undoubtedly a place of abundance - rich with beautiful sights to see and memories to keep!   The park is famous for the Merlion statue but it must likewise be recognized for its striking gardens, well paved walkways and amazing architecture.   Best part is that you can walk for hours without feeling the least bit tired due to the neverending sights to enjoy.

Had a great run from the hotel I was staying at to Marina Bay Sands and the Merlion. At the Merlion I noticed the light show and fountain show that was a great show to watch and had a chill on the steps by the Merlion. A definite must do on your Singapore to do list.

I visited the Merlion in October 2019. I walked underground from the Fullerton Hotel to get there. It is iconic and a great photo opportunity. The view of Marina Bay is great including the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer and the skyline. I went during the day and it was hot and humid. Maybe next time I will go during the evening.

Fantastic views over the Bay and a highlight of my trip in Singapore. Being here on National Day was amazing, to see all the wonderful fireworks and displays. Even on normal days, the atmosphere here is wonderful

review_title: Lovely place to spend the eveninng
review_content: We went there as a family just before sunset. It was not hot and there was a pleasant sea breeze. Great place to hang out, the vibe is awesome with lots of people, lovely skyline of Singapore and places to eat.  We took the boat cruise from here and I would highly recommend it.
Merlion park stands opposite the marina sands hotel. Great photo opportunities, especially at night. Worth a visit.

It is not as big as I imagined it to be but it is pretty and also in a nice location. There are many tourists wanting to take photo so you gotta take turns. But it is worth it, as it is the symbol of this beautiful island state.

Whenever you think or explore Singapore You see Merlon. It has a great significance in Singapore's history and it is reflected at Merlion Park. It also has a symbolic reference for the transfer of good wishes/ prosperity in the country. Lovely place for ideal Singapore visit snaps.
We reached in the afternoon. It's worth the visit being synonym with Singapore. There are lot of photo opportunities. Feel that it will look better in the morning hours because of the Sun position

review_title: It was beautiful place to visit with icon being symbol of Singapore and always a tourism symbol.
review_content: One of the most icon structures in Singapore, surrounded by restaurants and cafe. Nice locatian to make foto. Crowded but awesome  Better to visit on a Monday or Tuesday.
Plenty of history with this Singapore icon. Lots of tourists and an excellent place to take photo snaps. Beautiful view of Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer and the Singapore skyline. Enjoy.
Day or night this place provides some pretty good views and opportunities for photo op. Recommend for first timers.
Had been to the park and the beauty of it mesmerizes. Must visit in Singapore with family and friends.

We visited the merlion during the evening and the view is simply breathtaking.This place could easily be accessed through the Singapore Bus or Raffels place mrt.Its ideal if you could stay for the marina bay sands lights show if you visit the merlion park during a evening.
This place is surrounded by river, buildings lion mouth water which sprinkles on us, spot for photographs
The park itself is not so impressive, meaning the grounds. However, the merlion is what makes it special and is uniquely Singapore.

Half-fish and half-lion, the iconic Merlion resides at the Merlion Park waterfront. Merlion's body symbolises Singapore's humble beginnings as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which comes from the same root as the word tasek ('lake' in Malay).  Its head represents Singapore’s original name, Singapura, or ‘lion city’ in Malay.  Today, you can glimpse this legend at Merlion Park. Spouting water from its mouth, the Merlion statue stands tall at 8.6 metres and weighs 70 tonnes. #marinabaysands #MerlionPark #Singapore2019

review_title: Worth visiting when downtown around the Marina
review_content: Worth a visit since it's right across from MBS. Dusk is best time so you can see MBS as sky is turning blue (they call it Blue Hour). Perfect for photos, and you can see many semi-pro photographers getting their cameras set up around this time. The park itself is not much of a park (when you think of green area). It consists of a concrete area around the Merlion at the end of the walking bridge. Would love to see more grass area.

review_title: The experience isn't all that but its cute for a first experience.
review_content: Title says it all and its more of the surrounding places that makes it worth going there. There's hella food and places to go to but definitely a good pit stop if you don't mind a conglomerate of tourists. Okrt
The original Merlion at Promenade is a nice to visit, although not a must sea. The bigger ons on Sentosa is more entertaining ans host a light show at night.
With all things in singapore you have to go see the Merlion. We went past on the bumboat ride. It's always hot in Singapore.... It's quite open here so hydrate!

With the Merlion being a prominent figure in Singaporean culture, this statue sets the tone for the entire city. Clean, tidy, attractive and sensational. Appealing to travellers of all kinds; individuals, families, friends and lovers - there is something to have gleaned here no matter your circumstance. Unforgettable.

Best to visit early because the tourist busses arrive and the area is very busy. The Merlion is an iconic sight of Singapore. Impressive close to, with the gallons of water spraying from its mouth. There are a few eating spots near by.

The official mascot of Singapore, is the The Merlion Lion - depicted as a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish. The Merlin Lion is highly recognized and is widely used to represent both the city, state and its people as a national symbol. In 2002, the Merlion was relocated to in front of Fullerton Hotel, overlooking Marina Bay - especially pretty lit up at night. The park also houses a smaller Merlion statue, known as the ‘Merlion cub’.   The original Merlin Park sculpture and its cub, are the most well-known among the seven approved Merlion statues in Singapore. Make a point of visiting this historic national symbol.

A beautiful 2-hour walk around the bay We had a beautiful walk around the Bay. We got out at the MRT station and walked counter clockwise around the bay. At the start, you could see the white Merlion statue across the bay. There is food available along the way, mostly at the end of the counter clockwise walk. It can be very hot, so be sure to bring umbrellas or hats. After the walk, continue heading straight ahead to the Fullerton Hotel. There is also a business building that has wonderful sculpture. Don’t bother with the Red Dot Museum. See my review on that. I think it’s a waste of time. If you like this review or other reviews that I have written for Bangkok, Ho Chi Minh City, Cities in Australia and New Zealand, cities in South America, and cities in Italy, please feel free to give me a thumbs up.

The atmosphere is always electric around the Merlion. There are always masses of people posing for photos. It is easy to get to using the MRT and nice just to soak in the atmosphere once you're done with the photos.

An iconic one in our family wish list. Good location and plenty of space to do your own photo shoot. this is the BEST Merlion in the entire Singapore IMHO. Better to go there during morning to noon timings as the crowd tends to be more during the late afternoons. A MUST SEE even if you do not go anywhere else

The famous Merlion is surpisingly small and, while easily photographed, rather disappointing. Even the souvenir shops nearby were disappointing, mostly selling drinks and fruit. Stop in if passing by. But not worth a special trip, with so much else to see and do in Singapore.
Decent place with good view of downtown. But too crowdy. People are just too busy posing and getting clicked which makes it feel more crowded.
We arrived just at sunrise. The photos were stunning. There were several photographers there as well. The lion was not spitting water so that was a little disappointing.
It’s a monument of half lion/half mermaid that spits water into river. Nice to look at for a few minutes but nothing more than that. I have not been impressed with Singapore

review_title: will be closed around 20 october 2019 for public
review_content: merlion park is a signature of singapore since a few year... however, to develop the other land of brani island, singapore government will be demolish merlion park to build a highway from singapore city to Brani Island..

review_title: Get Best skyline of Singapore here !
review_content: Catch the fireworks during Singapore National day celebration. It is also a pleasant morning or evening walk starting from fullerton hotel, cross the underpass to Clifford pier and towards merlion park.
While here at Singapore....a centrally located hub of ornamental and aesthetic value! Must or rather will visit when going to any of the attractions!

A crowded spot but quite easy to get a photo opportunity. People move and flow quickly, worth the effort and a lovely breeze on a hot day. It’s quite popular with tourist groups and buses, some nice ice cream and drinks a few metres away.

Merlion is an iconic symbol of Singapore, and this is a great spot for a photograph! It can get quite crowded, but it doesn't take much of a wait to get a good photography spot. One on side you can take a photograph with Marina Bay Sands in the background, and this is probably the most popular spot so expect to wait.

Best time to visit is around 7.45 or 8.45 , then you can watch the light show at other part of the river near Merina bay sand . You can enjoy the show but don’t get to hear the music . Those who are fling to see the merlion can visit the place any time and it takes around 15 minutes to see it. .
Not so easy to get too and over crowded. Ok to take some photos but much nicer to discover the sculptures along the river and note some of the old buildings.
Nothing majorly spectacular in this location. The Lion isn't that big or anything special to see. But if you're in the area then walk around and take in some of the views like marina bay sands

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. Singaporeans seem to be genuinely attached to this symbol of their island-nation. The Merlion was relocated to Merlion Park in 2002. The upper half of the Merlion is a lion, and the lower half is a fish. Singapore was first called "Singapura," meaning "Lion City." It's unlikely that there were any lions in the area, but it's almost certain that tigers lived there.. As with all such monuments, keep your expectations under control and you won't be disappointed. The Merlion faces east, which is auspicious; running water is also auspicious. I first saw the Merlion many years ago, it's worth a side trip.if you have an hour or so to spare.

Visited the iconic Merlion park. Situated opposite to the Marina bay, the place has its fair share of visitors through out the day.  There are two Merlion statues, one pewi g water into the bay and the other miniature version directly behind it.  A place with lovely view of the landmarks of Singapore  A must visit place

review_title: Seeing you off before you say goodbye!
review_content: Panic started to kick in when we heard that the Merlion, Singapore's emblem, will be taken down and will be replaced of something we don't know what. Our visit was timely because we were able to say hello and goodbye to this mighty representation of Singapore. It's true to what most people say, it's majestic, surreal and a lot of people who's trying to take a shower or drink the water from it haha!

The Merlion moved from its location since I last visited it in 2008. A lot has changed, and the new location provides a close up view of the Merlion and the surrounding Marina Bay where you can see the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the opera house.

review_title: The only thing you can’t miss
review_content: An amazing statue-fountain at Singapore’s marina. During the night there is a light show from marina bay sands.
Crammed with people trying to take photos of the Merlion lion and the Marina Sands hotel. Clean and a pleasure to visit despite the people.
It is a symbol of Singapore pride and they have done very well to make it look perfect. Actually the whole area gives such a nice feel that you can't help fall in love with Singapore.
Everything is here! Clean,vibrant, fresh,safe and accessible. There are shades for picnic grounds. Stores and souvenir shops nearby are incredible and with good price. Street foods are one of a kind.
A must see place in Singapore especially in the summer. Its very cooling stating close to the Merlion Lion status. You can get a view of the Marine Bay from here

Very hot if you come after 9 AM because there's no shelter around the photo spot. U can get the view of Marina Bay Sands from here too. There are fruit stalls that sell cold drinks too under the bridge, to run away from the hot sunlight. U can eat fruit or drinks some cold beverage under the bridge while enjoying the river and Merlion scenery.

review_title: A Must for First Time Visitors
review_content: As this is an icon of Singapore, every first timers should visit this tourist attraction. The park is spacious and well-maintained. Refreshments are sold at nearby kiosks. The restrooms are clean. Visit this place preferably late afternoon to avoid having sunburn. Early evening is the best time as the lights make the place magical. Also try to time your visit when there is a light and sound show at the reservoir overlooking the Marina Bay and Merlion Park.

Please don't leave Singapore without visiting at least one Merlions location. You can see one of those big ones in Santosa island. If you want to take home a truly Singaporean souvenir it should be this.

review_title: You have never been to Singapore if you have never visited Merlion Park
review_content: Merlion Park is an amazing place to visit, It is a beautiful iconic statue and the most famous place in Singapore. It is more historical than Universal Studio in Singapore. it's a breath-taking place to visit and take photos.

Merlion park centred on the north bank of the marina reservoir must be witnessed at night when the famous statue/fountain of the merlion comes alive with colour. take a walk along the jubilee bridge for alternative view.

One must never miss out visiting the Merlion Park which is the symbol of Singapore. I would suggest visiting it both in the early morning to avoid the crowds or in the evening to take photos with the lights at the backdrops.

review_title: Singapore will not be completed without visiting the Merlion Park
review_content: Despite the crowd, Singapore will not be completed without visiting the Merlion Park. Advisable to go there in the early morning to avoid the flock of people.

review_title: Nice but go early or after dark
review_content: It really is hot here if you go in full sun like we did. But it was fun to see the big statue and water shooting out of it's mouth. Also fun to see all the tourists trying to get funny shots as if the water form it's mouth is going into there mouths.
You must include this in your itinerary when visiting Singapore some absolutely fantastic photo opportunities
One of the must see tourist attractions in Singapore. Nice view of the skyline and the Sands hotel. Research the symbolism ...
This is a must visit place of Singapore, there is also a baby Merlion behind the main one, busy place but a must for photos!!!

This area is very crowded. And people seem to love it. It’s a statue of a lion with a fish body and it sprays a lot of water out of its mouth. It’s tough to get a picture because there are so many people. This is a hot spot for selfie sticks. I found it just ok. It looks exactly like all the pictures.

There are usually always lots of tourists walking around, taking pictures, enjoying the view. You get a great view towards the Marina Bay Sands. There are also lots of restaurants and bars to just relax and enjoy a good time.
What an amazing park, with beautiful city skyline. We visited here in December and the place was buzzing with people and has a real lovely atmosphere

Visiting the Merlion Park waterfront is a must. The Merlion, the famous Singapore landmark and a major tourist attraction is located near “One Fullerton”. The half fish and half lion symbolises Singapore. This location is fab for family pictures. However, it was crowded with locals & tourists alike. Try to visit on a weekday. By the way, there is another Merlion behind the main Merlion. It was a Mini Merlion though.   SEE photos.
In a great location for pictures and videos. Can get busy at certain times of day specially when the sun is shining

Ive been in Merlion so many times but everytime i went in Singapore i make it a point to go back and look it. I feel so relaxing while watching the blowing of water in Merkion. I know Merlion is the trademark of Singapore. I really recommended it in all travellers..
this is the symbol of singapore so it is a must see. the tourists get in line just to take quick pictures and it is very nice to see the enthusiasm

review_title: Landmark an Icon of Singapore that always will be
review_content: MERLION the symbolizing the myths and legends and the beginnings of Singapore the majestic statue of a LION at the heart of Singapore, Lion face and body of a Sea creator and facing the modern skyscrapers and the new landmarks of the country. Great venue to take pictures as a memorabilia and to look into the water the modern architecture to get away from the buzzling city.  Do expect plenty of tourist and always packed with people, there is a light show also in the evenings around 8, there are plenty to see around and few mals and many other iconic places as well.
Glad I saw it... wasn’t that exciting though.   Very crowded ... we didn’t stay around long.   It’s worth a quick photo stop and then move on.
One of the favourite spots in Singapore. The surrounding was clean and beautiful. Such a must visit place.
The most Beautiful, the cleanest and systematic place, amazing-superb view. Once in a life people must visit. I really enjoyed the Singapore staying. Thank God!!!

A place that must be visited when visiting Singapore because it is also a symbol of this country. The statue in the shape of a lion's head and fish body is now surrounded by an amazing view, different from the past conditions where there are no supporting facilities. There are Marina Bay Sands, Fullerton Hotels, Hellix Bridge and others. The sea which was dammed in front of the monument was also made a boating tourism recreation facility and in the afternoon especially on weekends there is a laser show and live music stage.
A trip to Singapore would not be complete without a trip to see Merlion. It's fun and free and doesn't take up too much of the day.

review_title: OK for a stop, watch out for selfie sticks and posers
review_content: OK to walk around, have a look at this singapore icon. Can’t enjoy any quiet time/peace -crowded with selfie stick, people looking for perfect insta shot, and weird posers

We were there when the Merlion was getting "spruced up" for a big event. But the park was lovely. They had a much smaller Merlion in a fountain, which everybody took pics of! It was a nice place to sit & take in the view of the bay.

review_title: One of the beautiful place to visit in Sing
review_content: We got a very big fun when we visit this place. Bridge connect to Bridge, river connect to river. Everything here make a big spot and a great architecture. From this place you also can easy see the Marina Bayfront. Amazing
Icon of Singapore. Gives you a great view of bay area and marina bay sands hotel. Lot of pictures op.

Views across the bay are fabulous, regardless of the statue. Be patient if you want a good photo as there are likely to be lots of people doing the same thing. Plenty of food and drink outlets nearby.
The view from here was spectacular everyone site seeing but kept on the move when taking photo's  clean and tidy area

Well nice view of Marina bay from here and Merlion standing tall. However given it is on cover of every Singapore tourist brochure, it raises expectations and the place does not live up to those expectations. So it leads to a feeling that Merlion statue is over-rated, it is good sight but there are many more good sights though less popular across the world......
I always travel to Singapore along with Group Leading them but it was my first Visit to Merlin Park this September.  Enjoyed it thoroughly with 30 min river Cruise and Scenic walk.

We visited Merlion park on 30th aug 19 around 6pm. Not too much crowded as expected, we still can get a spot for taking photos. We reached by bus at Concorde station and walked about 5-8 minutes. The view on the bridge towards Merlion status is fantastic. You can feel the windy and nice marina bay sands view on the left. We stayed until sunset and the entire view is changed with the lights on. We managed to find a place to sit while enjoying the live band from theater by the bay overlooking marina bay sands and Singapore flyer. We waited till 8pm to enjoy spectra light show. It was amazing to watch the show from the other end which we had watched at the main theatre.

Overlooking Marina Bay, the central attraction of this park is a huge white mythical half lion half fish statue spouting a horizontal fountain of water. The statue is an important symbol for Singapore. There are always lots of people taking photographs with many aiming for the right water-landing-on-hand or water-going-in-mouth photos. It has great views of the Singapore skyline and Marina Bay Sands both in the daytime and at night. We watched one of the Marina Bay Light shows from here though the Shoppes at Marina Bay is much better (we saw it from both). The steps here provide more comfortable seating though.

Merlion Park is a must visit while you are in Singapore.  Since my last visit to Singapore over 30 year's ago the Merlion has been moved not far from it's original spot.  Many tourists taking photos but wait your time to get that perfect snap.  Worth a visit at night also get a water taxi for a great view.
We walked to this park from the Marina Bay Sands which was nice. We saw the lion but not sure what else there was to see.

No matter what time of the day or night we passed this attraction there was always a huge amount of people there taking photos and learning about the story of the Merlion and why it stands at the mouth of the Singapore River. Even with lots of people there it was still possible to get up close and take a good photo and like everywhere else in Singapore, the area was clean and well kept. We also took a river cruise which gave a great view of the Merlion along with a number of other attractions.

The Merlion is the is the iconic symbol of Singapore.  The place is very busy with tourist even when the weather is hot.  The place is has great view of the Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Arts and Science museum.  This is a must see free attraction when in Singapore.

review_title: A must visit, an iconic place in singapore
review_content: Visited here with family while in Singapore, its a crowded place but worth the visit, great view of the city day & night, also can see lightshow display of Marina Bay Sands hotel in the evening. We enjoyed a lot there
Iconic symbol of Singapore. Located near the harbor road it demands a visit once. A good photo point showing your Singapore presence ;-)

If you go to Singapore, at least you need to take a picture in this place. Its place with many people there even on weekdays in the morning. In the park, there some supermarket to buy some drink or snack. Its also possible to go jogging here
we really have a good and fun trip in singapore especially after seeing this statue of lion / fish maybe.

Merlion Park Singapore: - Must see - From here, you can have full view of: + Singapore Flyer + Art Science Museum + Helix Bridge + Marina Bay Sands + Esplanade Theatre  and many things which are beautiful It is more beautiful in the nightlife.
Nice place to visit in singapore marina bay area must be visiting in singapore it regarding as landmark in singapore and I visit it at night

review_title: Just statue in a park by the water
review_content: The statue of Merlion itself is not spectacular. Those want better grip should go to Santosa.  By having said that, it’s a nice area to stroll around the water extending from Marina Bay.   I really enjoyed walking around the area.

This is the Landmark of Singapore and one should not miss to visit. You will get very nice view of Marina Bay Sands from the Park and the best thing is there is no fee to visit the park. You can click nice pictutes snd spend some time.

review_title: Great view of Mer Lion and Marina Bay Sands!
review_content: A must see when visiting Singapore! Mer Lion Park is right on the bay with spectacular views of Marina Bay Sands. Can get quite crowded so pick your times wisely!

Merlion park is located at the heart of Singapore. Place for clicking million photos. Lot of attractions and restaurants near by. Go by 6.00 pm, so that you can take photos with natural lighting and later with night mode.
Such a pretty area. Lots of crowds but well worth the visit. Lots of dining options in the area and places to escape from the Singapore heat.
This was my third visit to Merlion but first after sunset. It has just gone amazing in last few years. Landmark icon in Singapore.   Scenic and a selfie spot in Singapore

It is singapore's natonal icon and it is spouting water from its mouth it is located in a beautiful atmosphere we could take many snaps in different angles it is a place to be enjoyed.Of course it is crowded place but it a place surely to be watched for.

Always a great photo opportunity and with Marina Sands in background plus other great architectural structures you are bound to get an awesome photo. Downside It's super crowded most of the day. If you dont mind loads of pushing and shoving it's a great memory photo.

I’m not sure of the story behind the Singapore Merlion but it is located in an incredible spot on Singapore Marina, opposite Marina Bay Sands, with a back drip of the financial district.  It is free to access the Merlion and despite the large number of people around the statue, there was plenty of space and time to take some great tourist pictures.  It is well worth continuing on a walk from The Merlion all the way around the Bay - great views of one of the truly iconic city skylines of the world...

I missed this iconic item last trip. I was not disappointed. It was a lovely walk beside the river to turn a bend and see the magical Merlion presiding over the river. Lots of photo opportunities take your time. We had fun, other tourists gave help to each other and we did too taking photos and then we would watch all the different ways to get photo of Merlion. You can line it up and have your palms up “catching” the water. One lady even got it to look like it was going into her mouth. Whilst there the public are encouraged to walk through the Fullerton hotel, it is 5 star and photos are welcomed in the walk through under the chandelier there is dining available there too.

Spouting water and standing tall, the Merlion is a sight to behold. Last time I was here I must have hit it right for there weren't many people about, but today the hordes were present. Many buses were parked in the street about and all their passengers were all vying to get an Instagram Perfect Picture of them, the Merlion and the Marina Bay Sands Hotel in the background. Crazy busy.....come early to avoid the crowds.

A nice open park. Good place to relax after walking around Bay Area for almost 3 kms. Merlion statue has a significant importance for Singapore. There is another one at Sentosa island little bigger than this one. But this one looks better especially during night with lights on. Nice place to hangout with family or friends and take photographs.
I think yhis was one of the best spot for a night photography. You can also take the river cruise from there.

A tourist spot that was very crowded. Lovely getting up close to a Singapore icon. Wonderful picture opportunities, plenty of eating places nearby. Also can walk to Fullerton hotel from here. Easy walk from the Esplanade MRT station also.

review_title: Iconic place in Singapore. Never miss it when in Singapore
review_content: Very crowded place. Try to visit this place early in the morning to take good pictures. Too many tourist because it's the Iconic place in Singapore. Never miss it when in Singapore.
This a a nice central place to enjoy the Merlion statue and get a beautiful view of Marina Bay. There are various food vendirs surrounding as well. Can become crowded, but not overwhelmingly so.
This is one of the symbols of Singapore. You can't miss it.  Surrounded by skyscrapers and the beauty of Marina Bay.

Travel Diary: Singapore 2019  Merlion Park : Singapore landmark, a major tourist attraction and a super hit picture on almost all the magnets and souvenirs found in Singapore is Merlion Park. It depicts a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish. It’s wide courtyard just like the Manhattan’s courtyard near the river where almost everyone including me get their picture clicked with there hands folded, begging for the water to fall from its wide open mouth on once hand is really a nice place to be when you are in Singapore.  #travelblogger #singapore @travelseewrite @travelandleisure #singaporelove #traveltips #travelphotography #travelbloggers #ilovetravelling #travelaroundtheworld

Every first timer's must-visit Singapore landmark for that Merlion picture. Unfortunately its hard to get that perfect photo with the Merlion since there are many tourists who are also aiming for that same photo with you. Expect photo bombers and a queue. If you have the patience and a good photographer its a good site to start your Singapore instaworthy photos. Will try to perfect my Merlion photo on my next visit.

If you walk around the waterfront you can get some great views of Marina Bay Sands hotel and well as the Merlion. Its busy and a photo stop but worth seeing if in the area.  For a cheaper coffee stop head to Starbucks! Great place to take in the views.

Merlion- part Lion part fish(mermaid) statue and fountain..the symbol of Singapore, A huge attraction of Singapore gives a picturesque view of Singapore skyline and its famous attractions like Marina Bay Sands Hotel..Flyer.. A must visit for tourists...

The Merlion is an iconic national symbol of Singapore and is incredibly beautiful.   The statue has a large amount of cultural and historical significance with the discovery of Singapore and the reason it’s known as the ‘lion city’  Whilst there isn’t a lot to this attraction, it’s definitely worth a visit to take great pictures and to see a part of Singapore’s history. There are also many restaurants to eat around the Merlion and enjoy the marina bay views.  If you go to Singapore, I’d definitely recommend visiting the Merlion as it’s importance to the people of Singapore is similar the Eiffel Tower to the people of France.
Nice but again overly crowded. People taking photos everywhere. Good for a short walk around the area.

review_title: A must if you are in Singapore
review_content: If you are in Singapore you need to visit this Merlion. Nice spot to take photos. Not much shadow so better to go early.

Like Copenhagen's Little Mermaid unmissable - but a tad more impressive. Try to go at night too as there is a free Son et Lumiere from 8 p.m. Lots of good-natured but unoppressive crowds trying to take photos - especially standing in front of the Merlion making the water jet seem to come out of their open mouths. The area is relaxing and full of good but expensive restaurants and bars.

review_title: Beautiful combination of modern architecture, water and green
review_content: Since its their national symbol, I believe its a must visit to see this Merlion. Beautiful in the evening around 5.00 pm.

When you see the Merlion right on the harbour front you know you are looking at an icon of Singapore.  Looking towards the water the Merlion is illuminated during the hours of darkness and always spouts water into the harbour. The harbour boats pass close to it so you can take a photo ....... urs also known as a meeting point.  There are a selection of restaurants behind the Merlion which offer outdoor eating day or evening and from there you will have a great view of Marina Bay Sands and even the fair that is in town in February.  See the Merlion ...... it's free!!
World renowned iconic monument of Singapore. Great view of Marina Bay and and Marina Bay Sands..   Do visit both in the day and at night to enjoy the evening sunset and light works at Marina Bay.
The Merlion statue is an icon for Singapore. It is located right on the water in the Colonial area and offers wonderful photos that must end up in you album of Singapore.
In this park, you can see beautiful view, but in here so full of people and crowded, so far this area nicw
This is good to visit when you visit the Marina. It’s only a short walk. You can get some good photos. Also a great place to see the Harbour

The water area is nice to see, it’s just like in the brochures; what they don’t show is the bus after bus of tourist all wanting to take a photo of the statue.  It’s easy to find and within walking distance of MRT. If you have never been to Singapore, then this is like the thing to pop along to see, next to Marina Bay Sands.

review_title: only for clicking pics with Merlion statue
review_content: This place is actually overated nothing like this on visiting it. This place is not only for clicking pics with merlion statue looks like lion face from where water comes out from the mouth. Suitable only for abt half hr photography. Nothing special about this place

Not exactly a 'must see' destination. With a constant stream of water sprouting from the mouth of the gigantic Merlion (a play on words - mermaid and lion), it attract loads of young tourists taking selfies with the illusion of the water jetting into his/her mouth. Not a historical ornament.

After dinner we went for an evening walk down the Fullerton Road. The lake, waterfront, the fountain and the evening breeze made it an extra ordinary experience. Kids love it. A must visit while in Singapore.

review_title: Great views on a clear day
review_content: Merlion Park is a must. If you are in Singapore for even just a quick stopover, go and see it. There are amazing views to be seen from the park itself so it offers more than just the Merlion itself.  What does it represent? Allow Wikipedia to explain:  "The fish body represents Singapore's origin as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which means "sea town" in Javanese. The lion head represents Singapore's original name—Singapura—meaning "lion city" or "kota singa"."  People get upset about the amount of visitors who might spoil your photo of the Merlion itself, but really it is not that bad. There may be a lot of people there at any one time, but not more than you would find at any iconic tourist attraction. This place is sleepy compared to the Louvre.

Known as must visit place if you travel to Singapore. This place located near Fullerton hotel. Closest MRT station is Raffles place. You can choose exit G near UOB bulding. Then walk beside the river. Don't forget to capture some picture here.
This tourist attraction is a must-visit site while in Singapore. Perfect for photo ops. You're not in Singapore if you haven't been here.
I’d recommend visiting the park and seeing the iconic Merlion statue at least once. It’s a busy area full of people trying to get a selfie with the Merlion.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and the statue in Marina Bay is an Iconic Image of Singapore but that's about it. It's a fun place to get some pictures and selfies there a few bars and restaurants around. It gets crazy busy during the day with many tourists flocking to get pictures. It's the kind of thing you do at least once.
One of the finest and most famous destination in Singapore is the Merlion Park. Enjoyed my time here.

It is practically an obligation for any newcomer to Singapore to visit the iconic Merlion Park. The walkways are shady and leafy affording one the opportunity of snapping shots of the iconic statue from different directions and perspectives.

Merlion the symbol of Singapore. Has been moved from it original position.  Bigger area for more tourists and getting crowded. Judge your run to miss the crowds.  Still a great sight. Easy to find and get to.  View from the river or on land.

Very time I come to Singapore always go for a visit to the Merlion. Very busy during the day, filled with tourists and very had to get close to the attraction. A night time visit is less crowded with good night time shots. Also some good shots of Marina bay sands from across the river Nothing much else to see in this area though

Good place for Singapore people and people around thee world ..   The location of This parl in the Middle of City. and getcthere for free 55555. .. we love it.   from this point u can see all in Singapore and from here around 07.00 p. they have water fall and Fountain in front marina bay sand building. it good. for sightseeing and rest around there

Merlion park is one of the favourite tourist attraction. Clicking selfies with the Merlion is a must. I did the same. But getting that perfect selfie is a bit difficult since it's too crowded Nothing much to do here, but just chill around and enjoy the water and view.
One of the most iconic structures in Singapore. I love taking photos of this cityscape. I love looking at this structure.
The place is nice. View to Marina Bay Sands is wonderful. Nice fountain but not much more than that. I would come only if I am in the area
There is nothing except the merlion statue here. In day it's hot & humid out here,sun will make you sweat a lot. Good for photoshoot. Enjoy
Lovely park but I think night is better as you see all the lights. What's even better is to take a boat tour during the day and one at night I do each time.

review_title: Nice views - lion status spraying water out
review_content: Very nice view of the harbour, the merlion statue kind of small and alot of people taking pictures. Nice walk on bridge.

review_title: very good to see at night
review_content: if you want to see this park dramatically lit without the crowd and UV rays, visit it a couple of hours after sunset. we appreciated the place better without jostling through the melee just to have a very nice shot of the merlion and the marina bay.  they say you haven't truly been in singapore without taking a posterity shot in this corner of the city. it's free to come here and you can stay without any time limit.

A very picturesque place and popular among tourist. One must try to visit in day time as well as evening time when lights are put on. Singapore's iconic place. Not to be missed.very neat and clean place. Also there is juice stall nearby which serves juices of many fruits.

The main feature is the National symbol of our country the Majestic Merlion. One should never miss this spot if u r a traveller or visitors here. A must go for a snapshot. Then there is the River where u can take a bumboat cruise and relive the legendary ride along the river n reliving the history of the nation. Be mesmerised by the magnificent colonial structures on either side of the river and take pictures of the grandeur of the Fullerton Hotel, the once General Post Office n the former HQ of the Japanese era. The scene is especially beautiful n mesmerising when the sun sets and the buildings are all lited up.  After the cruise head on to Clarke Quay for some live music at the bars there or go a sumptuous seafood dinner at some of the fine dining restaurants located next to the River. A 5-stars experience u will not forget.
Its one of the most popular tourist attraction in Singapore.Can see a clear view of Marina bay Hotel.

review_title: Under construction but still a pretty area
review_content: Unfortunately when I visited the larger merlion was under construction so only had the small one to see. The whole area around is beautiful and having researched the photos of the larger fountain it does look spectacular.  Well worth a visit. With lots of cafes around it’s easy to pass the time here

This was the third time I visited the Park. On the plaque located near the Merlion statue it was mentioned that the original site was somewhere further inland, first inauguration was in 1972. Later in 2002 it was moved to the present location. We walked along the waterfront and found it very relaxing. Opposite the Park is the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the shopping mall, plus the Arts and Science Museum. The architecture is amazing.

review_title: Great place to take photos of the amazing Singapore skyline
review_content: Probably one of the most visited places in Singapore and can be very crowded with tourists. Excellent people watching and very close to Marina Bay and all the must see sites. Take your camera.

I visited 3 times in 20 years, Merlion still the same but the surrounding is change a lot. Many new restaurant along on the road throughout the park, unluckily did not try the night market food there because of tight schedule. I must visit next time. A photo must taken with the Merlion, in generally everything made me feel very good no matter many people visited there like me but everyone is discipline to queue up.
Nice area to see the bay area and statue. Can catch River boat trip 25 SGD per person. Marina bay hotel on opposite side of the bay.
Cool spot to visit. A lot of good picture taking opportunities. We enjoyed, good for a one time thing not repeating.

The Merlion Park is nice during the daytime but spectacular at night. To get here just take a taxi or Grab car to 1, Fullerton and walk down to the waterfront and head left. The Park is actually quite small and there are several restaurants here as well as a Starbucks Coffee. You can also make your way to parts of Singapore River too.  The Merlion has been the most iconic symbol of Singapore for decades, perhaps now taken over by the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. However, it is still extremely popular and in the evening time very crowded with both tourists and locals who come here to wander around the Marina Bay area.  Just beside the Merlion you can join boat rides in the bay and into Singapore River. Also at night time you can get the most spectacular views from Merlion Park of the tall skyscrapers of the financial district and across the Bay towards Marina Bay Sands.  So when visiting the Marina Bay area then Merlion Park is a good place to start.
Place is packed with tourists and there is the reason for it. Great place to see light show, walk around, have some food, coffee with great view

A nice scenic place on the waterfront to see the Merlion and also see the wonderful Marina Bay Sands hotel on the otherside and you can take boat rides on the river, visit nice restaurants nearby & have great photo opportunities.
There were quite a lot of people but it is not like we have to push our around. But, the view and sound and light presentation is worth the crowd.
The location is super exotic from where I come from in Europe... The service, the ambiance... I would go back for more a hundred times

review_title: Great place to run early in the morning!
review_content: I started my run around the gorgeous Fort Canning Park and decided to cap it off running with the Merlion as my background. Such a great run! Definitely the best run of my life! Running the entire stretch end to end with Merlion Statue as the midpoint is insanely awesome! 6:30 am is a great time as it is bright enought to see the Marina Bay Sands from not too far and Merlion already spewing water from its mouth. The area also has very few people enough to take in the gorgeous scenery while enjoying an uninterrupted run!
Views of SINGAPORE from the famous Merlin statue. I wouldn’t bother to pay to go to the large boat looking hotel.
Beautiful spot of the city. Visit it by the sunset for nice pictures. A lot of option to grab a coffee around here.

Merlion park can not water spray  Because merlion underconstruction between Febuary 2019 and May,6 2019  But i visit may, 8-11 2019 and i visit take photo  Day 10 may 2019   I wish i fly to retake merlion again comming soon for water spray at merlion main

For those who want to take picture of Singapore Flyer, Esplanade, Marina Bay Sands hotel and of course the Merlion this is your spot. You can take picture all of above with ease and there is no building blocking the way. Location near Fullerton Hotel, you can also take picture of Fullerton Hotel, which was a post office. Very time effective to stand in a place and get all the photo in one time

By the time I visited Marina Bay the Merlion was under maintenance, surrounded by walls, so it was disappointing I could not watch it, but a small replica is nearby. If you do not know the big one you can imagine it looking at the small one

review_title: Great view of Marina Bay Sands
review_content: It’s a nice park with many different photo opportunities. The fountain was beautiful. It can be a bit crowded, because the fountain is in a small corner like area.
A good for pictures with Marina bays samds in the background. Currently the Merlin status is covered for renovation and maintenance. There are other materials miniature status to click pictures.

It was great being at the Merlion park, taking photos and learning the history of the Merlion statue.  The place is nice, well kept and maintained and the views across the Singapore River are good with the Marina Bay Sands hotel in the back ground.  The only draw back for me was just how crowded the place is. You can't take a photo of the statue without somebody being in the way. Very many tourists flock to this place.

review_title: Worth stopping by, day or night
review_content: Some nice views of the bay and downtown, walking distance to quite a few other places worth visiting in that area.

We heard that it was under renovation when we arrived but that it would be finished in a day or two. we went there not knowing if it was open already or not and it was our lucky day! i expected it to be kinda gigantic but it wasn't that much though. the area was really crowded and the weather was windy but still kinda hot. nevertheless, still do visit. you can't say you went to singapore without seeing this one.

A visit to Singapore is never complete without visiting the Merlion Park and clicking a post card picture in front of the Merlion, which is the face of Singapore.  Visit here during sunset time, to beat the heat. I suggest a walk from Clarke Quay, along the Singapore river, where you can catch a glimpse of Boat Quay, Asian civilization museum.

The merlion park is fantastic. the place is fill with tourist. the merlion statue is overlooking the marina bay sands, so it offers some fantastic views. It is a short walk to the floating stadium and the helix bridge. I would recommend coming here near the late afternoon when the weather gets a bit cooler, great place to sit down and have an ice cream and just see the world go by.

review_title: A good view of the reservoir
review_content: It’s been some time since I last visited this part of Singapore. Truly a fantastic location to view how far singapore has progress over the years with MBS over the other side of the reservoir. Truly a very scenic place at night with the lightings.

review_title: Great Place to visit at Night
review_content: A place to visit at night when you're in Singapore. You haven't been to Singapore when you haven't seen the Merlion. In this area, you can already see the Marina Bay Sands and Singapore Flyer. The Fullerton Hotel is also nearby.
A bit of a stretch to call this a park, however worth having a look on your way to other attractions and a good location to view the city and Marina Bat Sands from.

The statue was undergoing renovation when we visited, but it is still worthwhile to visit for the views. We were there twice – once in the evening because we were having dinner in the area, and again during the day. We felt it was more beautiful at night.

review_title: Merlion Statue sees the daylight again ! 13 May 2019
review_content: Yes we can see the Mother Merlion with its baby cub again. But no water. Guess they didn’t fix the faulty water pump in time. Four stars for no water sprouts.
Great view of the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Lots of restaurants to choose from. You can take a great picture Of the scenic view!

I had holiday last year for 4 days , first day i went to marina bay ,second day i went to universal studio and for our last day i went to merlion park that time its raining but its okay beacause its worth it ...

review_title: View from it is all good.
review_content: The view of Skypark Hotel looks amazing u can catch full view but when we went to Merlion park lion was in maintaince for new few weeks it will be so sadly we were not able to get snaps as well felt so much disappointed.
You cannot say you went to singapore without your picture taken at the merlion park. A must see. Thats why eventhougj it was raining hard, we had our picture taken here.
Unfortunately the big Merlion (half fish / half lion) statue was under wraps and under repair so we had to be content with the little one! Oh well!
Located in the Marina Bay, its stunning. Great view of the Marina Bay Sands, lovely peaceful walk. It wasnt too busy when we were there which i guess made it a little more idealic.  Love the place!

Word of warning the Merlion is being renovated so cant be seen as covered in scaffolding. You may decide not to visit here with this in mind. Thd surrounds are great though so its worth a visit ho walk around the area.
We had a great day out Singapore is a beautiful place we will return one day but need to recover from the exercise lots of walking

We came to Singapore 25yrs ago and we're eager to see the large Merlion again, however it was covered as having a facelift do we had to be content with the smaller version. Park was clean and tidy. You must see the Merlion when you visit Singapore.

After searching for the Merlion, we found it was under construction and all of its structures covered which could not be seen. There should be some notification that it cannot be viewed. However, the bay is a nice place to take a stroll. There is a boat that you can take across the bay and restaurants along the waterfront.
Shame you are unable to see this and then forced to see the one on Sentosa.  Be great once it is reopened but unsure when this will be?

review_title: Hidden behind construction materials not able to be seen!
review_content: After searching for the Merlion we found it.....under construction and hidden behind construction walls not able to be seen....:(
Singapore is a bit like New York or Hong Kong: very busy with tall buildings, so it is nice to have this park by the bay to stroll, rest, admire the view on the tall Marina Sands.

Too bad it is under construction though there is a small cute merlion on the side. Marina Bay Sands is seen from here. There are restaurants around the stretch.   People are helpful to take your photo since I was solo :)
Nothing to see here, the Merlion was being repaired. That is it nothing else and it is a small statue , you could easily skip this .
I didn't see the big deal about this one. In my opinion I would rather go and see the Merlion out at Sentosa Island which is far more impressive, plus this was closed for renovations.
Merlion. Symbol of the city of Singapore.  Mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish.

So I only saw the mosaic tile Merlion (tiny one) as the larger one was under renovation (to my disappointment). It's alright. Took a quick picture and then moved along with the rest of my day. I'd say go check out the Merlion in Sentosa. It's huge and totally worth the trek out to Sentosa (especially in the mornings when you get to take of picture of it/with it all to yourself)
I don't what the big deal about this statue  Some of the attraction here get blown out of proportion.  Any how the big statute is under renovation, and my feeling weren't hurt much.  C U Around

Yes, it's just a really large statue, BUT, at NIGHT there's a cool vibe there as it sits on the water and lights up in varying shades of color! It creates a great photo back drop for you and yours. It's walkable from the light shows at either the Marina Bay Sands or the the SuperTrees as well as the Clark Quay area or the DT area close to the water! It's makes for a nice evening stroll!
You can see the big Merlion and little Merlion from the park. The little one is cute, but potentially not worth it if crowds annoy you, gets pretty packed in the park
Nice place... Fun place with good crowd. Can get the view of flyer, port and other places of singapore.

review_title: Take a photo with this iconic statue...
review_content: ...and combine it with dinner at one of the many restaurants in the area, an evening waterfront stroll along the waterfront, and then an ice cream while you watch the laser light show.  This was the perfect amount of walking, resting and entertainment for our three children—8 yo twins and 10 yo.

You go to see the Merlion, yay.......the one you see looks a little too small....thoughts of it looks bigger in the movies come to mind. Then you see the big ply board boxed off construction work and you go home.
