The Merlion statue is covered under renovation. Don’t know until when. Nonetheless the Merlion Bay Area is definitely worth a look, sans Merlion statue.
Shame it was under construction this time so couldn’t see it. Couldn’t see any information on when it will be completed.
Yup, all sheeted up,  Like a number of other 'attractions' In Singapore. Very modern city , but sadly lacking info about this.b see also art museum and Chinatown Complex

I visited it just 3 days ago (today is April 7th) and it was under construction. From little sight seeing platform next to the Merlion Statue (that was under construction) you could see the beautiful view of the lake and the hotel across. During the night the hotel will have 'light performances'; it will shine all over the city. There is hotels nearby; grab a drink and look over the buildings of Singapore. I liked the show very much (bring your camera) though the fact that it was under renovation was very disappointing. It is a very short visit ranging from 30 minutes - 1 hour.   The reason for renovation is because the statue moved places in Singapore.
unfortunately, the Merlion was under construction when we go there. so sad! they say it might be re opened on July. They move the Merlion in the mid of the sea near the harbour.
As of late March the renovations were ongoing so no view other than a small replica, not working, close by
We got to the park because we wanted to take pictures here and it is closed for renovation. They have a little merlion on the dide so we got a picture.
We went early in the morning but it was already hot and lot of people mostly tourist like me.Stayed only a couple of minutes,take pictures and went to other places.

We wanted to visit Chinatown, Merlion Park and Garden by the Bay in that sequence for our last full day in Singapore.  It was quite a 15 minute walk in the humid conditions mid afternoon after coming out from Raffles MTR Station. Actually the walk was less than 12 minutes, waiting for traffic light to change added the extra time. We thought next time, probably better to catch one of the air conditioned buses and get off at the stop on the Merlion side of the Raffles Quay Road. When we got to the Park, the giant statute was under wraps for renovation. Still the area and view of the bay is nice. Plenty of tourist were taking photos of the small statute. We waited five minutes for our turn to do the same and had a nice walk along the shore looking for the bus to take us to our next stop.
We love to Go to Aer Mancur Merlion, Hehe...  That was her bucket list and i'm happy to bring her in, as long as she happy i'm happy!!!

This is basically a 10 metre tall lion and fish head statue spewing water out its mouth. It's a landmark on the waterfront of Singapore, and although fairly impressive to me it was just another photo opportunity but worth seeing as it represents the symbol or mascot of Singapore

review_title: The iconic Merlion was under wraps
review_content: It was rather disappointing to see the iconic symbol of Singapore all wrapped up. It has been taken for renovation.  We saw the smaller Merlion in the park but it was not the same.  It was very hot in the afternoon and so we quickly took some photos and left.
Sad to say we haven't seen the statue due to renovation. Gladly, we enjoyed the surroundings and the cleanliness of the place.

There is nothing much to do except getting a few selfies for your instagram posts however since it's an iconic landmark in Singapore paying one visit is must. The riverfront where merlion park is situated is beautiful and the view of skyscrapers in the backdrop is mesmerizing besides it's a good spot to meet new people.

review_title: Beautiful Mascot with Lions Head and Fish Body
review_content: This mythical creature signifies the personified history of Singapore and the Strength of the country. It is located near Fullerton, easiest way is to take a Cab or if using MRT Rafaels Street is the closest (not very sure). This area is sublime, get yourself clicked then take a boat ride for 25 Singaporean Dollar and enjoy the ride.
Been there many times and still loves the place. Now under renovation till may. Restaurant nearby are awesome

Merlion Park houses the famous Merlion of Singapore (smaller version than the one in Sentosa). It has a nice overall feel to it by the water, not much to do here. We just clicked a few pics and moved away to enjoy the overall scenery.

review_title: absolutely beautiful area especially at night time.
review_content: is nice to visit the place in the evening with the beautiful lights and fireworks.when you finish there can go for a few beers or dinner at the area near by where the bar streets are

review_title: Great for photo opportunities of Merlion
review_content: We visited Merlion Park during a tour with Lion City Bike Tours on our first day in Singapore. It was the perfect place for pics with the clear & up close views of Marina Bay Sands & the Singapore Flyer. The iconic symbol of Singapore the Merlion was in its full glory and gaining lots of attention. But ther were still plenty of good photo opportunities.

Amazing views of Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Singapore Flyer - great for selfies! Or normal photos of course! Singapore icons!   Unfortunately as you can see, Merlion statue is under construction at the time of my visit. The rest of the area was lovely, and whilst the weather cooperated, it made my photos pop.  The area has many eateries, lots of walking, beautiful bright flowers. Not for people who can’t walk or find it difficult.  There is a small Merlion statue that I was happy to have the photo so that my walking excursion wasn’t a waste of time.
View is good. Construction work is ongoing to the merlion, so you cant experience water coming from its mouth till the work is not done.

review_title: Visit if first time in Singapore
review_content: Iconic statue of Singapore. Wildly overcrowded with inconsiderate tourist but worth seeing first hand. Expect people to be inconsiderate while there and area restaurants to be overpriced in the area. Still, visit the waterfront park and see the statue.

Unfortunately this was all covered over. I had really wanted to see this and we searched for ages wondering how we could miss it, to find it all covered up having repairs done. Was disappointed. Surrounding area is very nice.
The merlion is under scaffolding being repaired. There is a “baby” merlion fir tourists to see. The area is beautiful

Beautiful park! Amazing view by Singapore river. The big original statue undergoing construction currently but you can take some great picture with the smaller Merlion just behind the big one in the park!
This is nothing to write home about.  Small and overcrowd feature   Look at it if your in the area. But would go out your way to see it

I've been to Singapore many times, and I finally made it to the Merlion. Great spot for a photo with this symbol of the Lion City. You'll have to wait your turn to get your photo or selfie. This is very popular! But once you are finished you can have a pleasant walk around the water where you will find many shops and restaurants.
You never visit singapore is never visit here. This is the first icon of singapore, you must go to here, take a mrt and heading to raffles place station.

The Merlion is half-fish, half-lion statue near the waterfront at Marina Bay. The Merlion is Singapore’s national icon and it used to occupy the mouth of the Singapore River and it is moved to its current location in 2002. The statue is 8.7 meters tall and has a fountain of water spurting out into the Marina Bay. Singapore’s original name Singapura means Lion City in Malay. It is a very popular photo spot and is a very touristy and crowded area. It is 8 min walk from Boat Quay. You can find gift shops, cafés, restaurants and restrooms nearby. It is open all day and it is free.
This is the 3rd time we visited singapore and out of 3 visits, 2 times where Merlion statue is under renovation. A bit disappointed. But really cant do anything.

review_title: Merlion is THE SIGNATURE Landmark Of Singapore--CURRENTLY CLOSED
review_content: PLEASE NOTE: Unfortunately, Merlion is all covered up with tarps and scaffolding and is undergoing renovations for an unknown period of time.  Merlion is the iconic symbol and mascot of Singapore & the country and is located at the Marina Bay across the street from the Fullerton Hotel. This is one of THE most popular sites in Singapore that everyone wants a photo & selfie with so expect crowds day or night! Merlion I was told is a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish. You will see it on all travel brochures and advertisements.   BOTTOM LINE: No trip to Singapore is complete without a visit here. The amount of water coming out of Merlion's mouth is like a large high pressure fire-hose. Depending on the wind direction, you might get wet! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!! MY RATION: 10/10.  This location is also excellent for taking photos of the Marina Sands Hotel and the skyline. A zoom lens is helpful. Parking is limited close by the park. Taxis can drop you off and come back in 10 minutes or so. A must stop to get a photo here!
Good to see another culture and the story. Views are amazing and well worth the climb. Staff friendly and helpful

review_title: So beautiful and travel by bus
review_content: At the time I came to Sing, the Lion was being repaired. However, the view around the park is awesome ^^ and very worth to go
Merlion Park in is one of the major tourist attractions in Singapore. This park is located at Raffles place (EW14 &NS26)
The Merlion itself is covered in scaffolding and is not operating (March 2019). No mention of this beforehand on any travel sites. The park , restaurants around it are ok.

review_title: Best View of city golden area
review_content: Go here for a long walk, do not rush, take time to enjoy the breathtaking view around you. Start from merlion park, go to esplanade, take helix bridge, walk to cashino - amazing experience...
It is located right next to Singapore river.you can see beautiful Singapore sky at night time .you get too see beautiful view of marine by the sands from here.

because merlion is visited by millions of tourists, its very tricky to take a decent selfie with this famous singapore landmark. a singaporean local tip is to visit the park very early to avoid the tourist mob or very late when the the statue is on spotlight. have fun doing this selfie chalenge and good luck :)
Visited the Merlion today and it was covered under netting and surrounded by scaffolding. Not sure how to rate this but still enjoyed the surrounding views of Marina Bay.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and can't be left out on a Singapore visit. But this Sunday it was very busy here; it seemed that most tourist groups had converged on the Merlion at the same time. Anyhow we could approach the statue for a picture after elbowing through throngs of tourists. Furthermore, most cafes and restaurants on the riverside walk have become a bit upmarket, or are just fast food and drink counters. The time you could settle down at the "Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf" with a nice view on the Merlion is long gone.
Lot of people meeting at that area it’s good viewing and some of graduations Student come to take photos as the merlion of the city there to have luck and strengths .
Go to Merlion Park, enjoy views, take some photos and later on you can board to take s cruise on the Singapore Pear. One can also walk over to many nearby eateries for food and drink.

Located right in the city center, the place is surrounded by other very typical monuments for Singapore. This makes the spot very attractive for making photos and it's also very crowded. Anyway, I wouldn't say that the visit of Singapore would be completed without Merlion Park.

review_title: A must see attraction while in Singapore
review_content: My wife and I visited the Merlion park while in Singapore. It’s a fantastic location to take some great iconic photos and if you’re looking for a place to grab a bite to eat or a refreshing drink, there’s lots to do in the area. Certainly within walking distance to most other attractions in Singapore’s downtown core
If you’re walking around Marina area the Merlion is worth a trip and on route. Definitely picturesque.
What a breathtaking view of the city of Singapore. Coming at night you can see a light show from the Marina Sands towers.
Must visit the merlion park when in Singapore. Lots of tourist, hardly can take picture. Beautiful view.

This locates in Marina Bay Area. Next to Fullerton Hotel. High demand tourist attraction. There is also nice views to Marina Bay Sands Hotel. You can find couple of bars and restaurant on site so if you like to get a snack or some refreshments their are very close. There is also 7 eleven on site.
You should go there at night. See the Merlion changing color and Marina Bay Resort water and light show. Helix bridge lighted up. Boat rides going up and down the river. Lots of places to eat too.
It's a must visit place. It is always a happening place there. Tried the ice cream with waffle which selling on a bike was delicious.

Here is the place that I believe everyone who enters Singapore must visit as this is where the iconic statue of Singapore is located (the half fish & half lion). Bear in mind that this is an open area that is crowded with visitor and tourist from Asian country mostly.   Entrance is free. You can see Esplanade Bridge, Theatres on the bay, Mirror Balls and so many other statues.   Depends on your transportation, you will have to walk through a garden or something like that but fill with art statues, gallery, building and so on. Approximately you will spend 1 to 1.2 hours depends on your luck to get the perfect selfies with the statues and memories to be captured here.   Bring a bottle of drinking water for yourself as the weather in Singapore mostly heat. There's 7-Eleven nearby. I am not sure about public washroom.   There's a lot of smoking area provided, but please don't smoke near people and kids. Don't litter too.
Very nice view of the canal and city scape...loved the place..i was with family and all enjoyed..night is really better and amazing views.
We visited merlion park,very beautiful place with stunning view.The park is very clean.Iconic tourist place.

One of the most famous iconic place of Singapore with no entry fee and with lots of photo spots. Try to go during 5 or 5.30 pm when you can see merlion as well as may have a walk till helix bridge and at night enjoy the free light show.
A statue of a famous sign of Singapore. When there by mrt and walk to the park, enjoy an ice cream on hot weather while walking around and enjoying the view there
The best time is to go at 8 when there aren't too many people and the heat is still bearable.   Grab an ice cream cone at one of the local stands and enjoy your walk!
Definitely a tourist hot spot! If you don’t like crowds this may not be the place for you.   Fun place to take pictures and see the landscape of Singapore.
Went with family, a little confusing threw the hotel to the merlion, but once there best pictures ever especially of the Marina Bay Sands

review_title: Amazing day walk to Merlion Park from Esplanade
review_content: I started my journey from the Esplanade beside Marina Bay and walked to Merlion Park. Along the way, I managed to catch a short band performance at the outdoor esplanade area and jostled a bit with travellers along the Jubilee bridge. The i-lights festival was happening during this period and I was lucky to see the Merlion change colours. Overall a positive trip

review_title: Really Interesting History behind this sculpture!!
review_content: This very "popular/iconic sculpture" of the mythical "part lion and part fish" [from the sea or "mer" in French- hence "MERLION] is almost 30 feet tall and weighs about 70 tons! It was originally located at the mouth of the River... but, then moved to its current location in the 1/2 acre park [with marvellous views}... The Statues of the "Merlions" also include a smaller [about 7 feet tall] "baby". The views of the Bay and City are wonderful-- especially at night. The "Merlion" has been awarded TripAdvisors' " Travellers' Choice" designation. Nearby, one can also find a refreshing ice cream cone... Its a definite "Must See" when visiting Singapore.  I hope that this Review has been helpful.
While the statue is very crowded, you can still find a place to take selfies and pics. There are steps to sit on under the Merlion to enjoy the view. It took about 30 minutes to walk from the MBS.

review_title: Beatiful Park and Magnificent Symbol of Singapore
review_content: It'll be a good idea to visit the Merlion Park with a combined package of river cruise. I highly recommend taking the cruise first so you'll get the overall important landmarks along the river. The park itself was very beautoful with 2 merlion statues at the front and the back (baby merlion). On a bright sunny day we can have beautiful photo shoots! Great visit!
You can’t visit Singapore properly without taking a trip to see the Merlion. The park is very tourist heavy but you should be able to find a space with an uninterrupted view of the statue.
This famous park is a landmark attraction for tourists visiting Singapore. The views of the bay are spectacular, of course depending on the weather, so it's important to check that out!
When in Singapore this is a must see. It’s easily accessible and it’s free to visit. Grab an ice cream from the nearby stall and take in the views.
Stunning views of marina bay sands and the surrounding areas. Clean and picturesque park. The merlion is truly a sight to see!

We visited the Merlion Park, mostly because we were in Singapore, and it was relatively close to get to from the Marina Bay Sands (MBS). To its credit, the park actually offers beautiful views of the MBS. You can also catch pretty cool views of it from the other side of the water from the MBS. For a cheap touristy thing to do - and since it is free, why not! I was otherwise not super impressed with it. While running for cover from the sun, we did find a nice adjacent souvenir shop just a short walk away underneath the bridge overpass.

The park is very clean and no entrance ticket to get here,nice view surrounded the park. The most favorite place visit in singapore and can go by train or taxi,easy to find place. I will come back next month
Perfect for a wander around in the sunshine and a cheap beer at the beach. The cable car was fun. We had an enjoyable day.

review_title: Best view of the entire bay
review_content: Very nice view. Fantastic concept of urban and civil lifestyles. The walk from the garden through the museum and the marina shopping Centre is a must of all. Singapore is a great place to relax in armory!
Merlion Park was really nice. Good views from the Statue. There was a lot of stairs there. I couldn’t find a way up if one was handicapped

One good look at the MerLion and you will be elevated to a transcendent plane of tourist bliss, having walked miles to see a statue of a mermaid+lion spitting water. Such a statue must necessarily defy our comprehension.

An iconic tourist spot in Singapore, the Merlion park is located in Fullerton square near the central business district. There is a statue of Merlion, which is a mythical creature having lions head and body of a fish. The statue is a national symbol and spouts water from its mouth. The Merlion park is close by the mouth of Singapore river across the Esplanade bridge. The Raffles place MRT station can be used for accessing this location. A central attraction in the city, a very photogenic location.

review_title: You have to take the photo drinking the water
review_content: This iconic symbol of Singapore is right on the waters edge and is spectacular both during the day and at night. Smaller than the one on Sentosa Island, you can position yourself for a photo drinking the water from the Merlions mouth.
I liked the view better at night than in the afternoon. I found it hard to get a spot for a photo without others around, so be prepared because there are a lot of people.

It’s a great sight, which everybody wants to see, but serious problems for the disabled, accessibility is really difficult. Others describe it in detail, so I’m concentrating on the problems I faced. Took a bus to Fullerton Square, that was the easy bit. Now we had to cross the road. There’s an underpass from the Fullerton, but there’s no elevator for the disabled, just escalators. We walked some distance to find a suitable surface road crossing. 2 sets of traffic lights, so it took some time. Now we were faced with flights of steps to get to the viewing area. My wife found, after a goodly walk, one smaller flight of steps, with a wheelchair lift (you have to phone to get the staff to help). In the end, we had to walk half across the river and back again on a different bridge to avoid steps. By now we needed the toilet. Full marks, there are two disabled toilets, but oh dear they’re not suitable for many disabled people, because there are no handrails around the toilet. Things were worse than normal when we visited, because there were a lot of ramps to get over power leads for the New Year Display. At least that’s only temporary. The final problem is the many tourists walking around not watching where they are, looking for that perfect picture. It just made things more difficult. Be alert for some steps which are very difficult to spot. No warnings bumps in the pavement for the blind, and no obvious yellow paint to show the edges. If you’re disabled, there are so many good places to visit in Singapore, I think it’s best to give this one a miss. See the Merlion from across the river, or from other places around the Marina.

This is an excellent place to spend your time, especially when you are with your family or your dear friends in your vacation..  The sea lion sitting gigantically with eater falling out from its mouth is an excellent view..  Many people spend their time taking photos with their family and friends here..  Don't ever miss this place..  In my view, an excellent place to take photos and have a good walk..

This is one must visit in Singapore, been here a couple of times and every time it gets better. Evening is best time here with all the beautiful lightnings and fountains and lots of live music playing around and so much happiness in one place.
Merlion is the mascot of Singapore, in this place lot of tourists come to take pics, some cafés around. It's okay for a quick stop, but it is a little bit underwhelming. Just a fountain at the end.

A photo here really proves setting your foot at SG!  The view from Merlion is so mesmerizing. However, due to lots of people taking photos every now and then, you really need to have fast feet to get through and capture quick instagrammable photo. Two thumbs up!
Merlion Park gets very busy with tourist but there is lots to see around here. Loved the lion statue and got some great pics around here
It's a must-see national icon of Singapore. Beautiful at day time or night with the Esplanade, Makansutra and Marina Bay not too far by foot. You visit Singapore without visiting this landmark

Been past in a Bum boat at night,great veiws of the city skyline all lit up, Been out for dinner and decided to go for a walk and this is around 11-30 at night when we walked past the merlion statue and still quite a few people around just relaxing, chilling taking pictures ,selfies etc.Great spot to get a pic with the Marina Bay Sands Hotel as backdrop.... Stunning with all the lights....recomend at night as it is cooler and photos turn out amazing

It had been years since I visited the Merlion Park, complete with the original Merlion statue - a strong symbol of Singapore.  Much has changed in the area around the park, significantly from the ongoing land reclamation process that has seen this city-state grow its physical size by more than 30%.  Yes there are tourists everywhere, but there’s nothing wrong with that.  Great views and photo ops along with a lot of history - for the few that are interested.
Singapore's iconic Merlion, a tall statue inviting the travelers at the bay. Its a fun park to walk or sit and enjoy the view of Singapore.
A brilliant place to stop and grab a few photos, it’s an extremely touristy spot, as expected. It’s best not to hang around too long.

This is a lovey area of the city, lots of people just exploring and chilling on the tiered banking.  Great place just to chill and take in marina bay. A few good bars etc just along marina bay right near the park
Very lovely place for outing. Even solo visit would make you feel so enjoyful.   Especially world class coconut ice cream i found there in some kiosk.

I walked over here on a Saturday late morning. Was a good stop, however, as I was Ata peak time there were many tourists. Probably better to see during a weekday or evening. Nevertheless Tyger are some good picture spots.

review_title: Gorgeous view and scenic spot to take pictures
review_content: There are pros and cons for being there early.   It's hard to take a pic of the Marina Sands Hotel because of the direct sunlight but there are fewer tourists taking selfies.  For nighttime: Becomes crowded but the lights are just too pretty

review_title: Unusual amount of continuous crowd size
review_content: Because the Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore and befitting it is now located in front of the Fullerton Hotel looking across the waters toward Marina Bay Sands, it attracts a continuous crowd seeking to take selfies and admit-tingly, some most photogenic proof of "I was there" shots.
Place is always crowded with 80% of the people busy clicking selfies in the same pose, which itself is funny to watch :) Despite the crowd, it's very neat & clean and beautifully done

review_title: Finally we take a picture with this Merlion
review_content: After several time visit Singapore, we don't have a chance to take a picture here. So, this time, I told my kids that we have to go here only to take picture.

This fountain has water coming from the mouth of a mythical creature comprising the body of a fish and the head of a lion. The creature is the mascot of Singapore and is believed to protect the prosperity of Singapore. It is part of the promenade overlooking Marina Bay and is the most popular attraction in Singapore. The area around it, particularly the viewing platform can get quite crowded. Best time to visit is early morning and at night.
One of the tourist attractions you have to do when in Singapore. Loads of people there so make sure you go early.  Tip-go to Starbucks,they have a awesome view from their cafe.
Nice walk for a little green break from the Esplanade across the Jubilee bridge to the Merlion Park. A photo of the Durian if you like.

review_title: Statue on the bay with a water feature
review_content: This is situated in the open bay area which is really a Statue of Merion the symbol of Singapore with water gushing from it mouth.. Surrounded by restaurants and stalls.. But actually not much to do. Just hang out so can prove to be quite hit in the day

We went here, and we also tried to understand what is the attraction behind Sentosa Island in general, but utterly failed to understand. The whole island looks like a run down resort from 70’s in Easter Europe. They have some water park and the universal studios, but otherwise we felt like the only suckers who got fooled by going to this place
Merlin Park is also attractive place for tourists to walk over. Visitors of Santosa enjoy photography and walk through this area.

Wasn’t sure where this was then saw it from the Singapore flyer so went to see it close up. It’s very busy as when we arrived it was raining but that didn’t deter people there were people of all ages jostling to get a shot. Nearby are take always, ice cream stands, restaurants and of course a Starbucks. Shame there is no bench seating.

Surprisingly, my husband and kids hadn't visited the Merlion Park any of the almost 20 times we've been in Singapore. We finally decided to see the Merlion up close after Crazy Rich Asians came out. We went at night so it wasn't very hot and there weren't too many people around.   The Merlion is obviously cool to see, being the symbol of Singapore. Great photo ops at night.  If you are also looking for the locations where Crazy Rich Asians was filmed, there are quite a few within walking distance of the Merlion!

This is a small concrete-floor park with a total area of 0.25 hectare. It is home to two Merlion statues. They are legendary statues (and symbols of Singapore) with the head of a lion and the scaly body and typical tail of a fish. The statues spout water from their mouth. The larger of the two spouts water into Marina Bay and is especially beautiful to watch at night when it is lit up in changing and rotating colours and enhanced with musical sounds. It is also a good location from which to view the city’s night skyline. Unlike most parks, this has little grass. Most of the ground area is covered with concrete.

review_title: A morning stroll  at sun rise is awesome
review_content: The visit to Merlion Park in the morning at sunrise is awesome. You get a good view of the Merlion and also the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. A good place to jog and capture beautiful photographs of Merlion
We came we saw we selfied, not a great deal to see, but of course you need to visit as it is an iconic landmark statue.
the place usually crowed on holidays, hence plan your visit if you would like to take a good snap in front of the icon

You can't get a more iconic attraction than this but it really only serve just one purpose during the day, for tourists to take the iconic photos and move on. It is really too hot (acres of concrete) and exposed to stay for long. If you want a relaxing stroll, come late in the evening when the heat of the day has eased and the light of the city is more mesmerising than the harsh lines of the day.
Merlion Park - Overseeing Singapore River.   Merlion - Mermaid tail & Lion head. Mystic animal. Icon of Singapore. Singapura - Lion City in Malay language.
View and picture opp. Nice way of having dinner there with your loved ones. Boating can be fun too. For me, it was average as it was quite sunny and crowded.

Always wanted to visit this area, some nice photos to be taken here. The Merlion was not as big as we thought (not as big as the Merlion on Sentosa Island) but still very much worth a visit.  Great views of the other local tourist attractions from this point, also food, drink stalls and toilets right near the viewing deck. Very much worth your time to have a look.

Since we were not staying nearby, we got off the Hop On, hop off bus to visit here and we were glad we did. What a great location right on the marina in front of the Fullerton and with the fantastic Marina Bay Sands across the water. This would be the spot to be to see the laser light show at night!
Completely invested for tourism, this ridiculous statue lords over a nice water-side park. Good place for photos.
An underwhelming fountain, ok to see from a distance. Nice harbour views. I wouldn't make a special trip to visit this.
You should take a walk around the Merlion during the day and at night as well, the view to skyscrapers and marina hotel are great you can enjoy a drink in coffees and restaurants nearby
My visit was very quick .. the area was crowded .. however .. it is worth to visit .. worth to go and see the area ..

review_title: Merlion! What a great symbol for Singapore!
review_content: During my visit we walked around the park numerous times and enjoyed a summer evening fireworks show with music. I am pretty sure those events are available year-round given Singapore's climate. They also have a great ice-cream stand. :)

Iconic statue which needs to be photographed with during the Singapore trip. The place can get crowded and it may be difficult to manage a clear shot with nobody else in the background. Also the place can get really hot.

It has to be on your list of things to see when in Singapore.  It's a great location, with good views but you won't be alone, it feels as though every tourist in Singapore goes there but as long as you're prepared for it to be busy you'll be OK.

It was a quick visit as quick as 16 hours. But I was able to atleast get around some of the most visited spots in Singapore, the Merlion Park that is. This park is pretty busy day and night. The amazing view of Marina Bay, Merlion Park is situated in just one location where you can take unlimited photos like everyone does. This place is very accessible as we all know their transportation system is superb!
The merlion is the icon of Singapore. Transportation to Merlion park is convenient. But it is full of tourists.

If you choose ONE place to visit in Singapore, this is it as you will see the national symbol (the Merlion lion) and some nice spots for pictures. It is crowded, hot and muggy (like everywhere else) but safe and clean and you will leave with good memories. Definitely a must-see.

If you go in the evenings, this is a great place to relax. In the afternoons, it's mostly scorching hot around here and you might just want to run and find shelter. It's been crowded but really beautiful every time I have been there. If you can find a spot to sit, you can enjoy the breeze and just wind down. I would surely visit again soon!
The Merlion is a very popular tourist attraction in Singapore, so it was a must on our places to visit while in Singapore. Have in mind this place is always packed with people!
One of the must see sights of singapore. Always people there though so would be pretty tough to get a photo by yourself. Worth a visit
Nice place to walk around and get nice view of the city. Ythe ou can take nice pictures of the merlion and the city buildings.

I guess it is a must do in Singapore but not much to see. Other than view across to marinavbay sands. Would be good for evening light show but probably packs out as was busy in the morning with busloads

review_title: Cool park with great views of the city
review_content: Really cool park with great views of the city and the merliom monument. Great to take pictures here. Go in the early morning to avoid large crowds of tourists
Took a mid morning walk from hotel to the Merlion and then onto Clarke Quay. Lots and lots of tourists. Good experience and worth seeing but may take a while to get that perfect photo

The Merlion Park is not actually a park, but a statue of the Merlion with a constant jet of water coming out of it's mouth. It offers a good view of the Marina Bay Sands and surrounding Singapore attractions.

review_title: Fun if you like crowds and touristy stuff
review_content: As a local, this myth was probably due to poor eyesight. Lions and fish don't breed well, so maybe this was a lionfish? Anyway, it just spits water and tour buses come here so it's crowded most days.  Personally, I'd avoid unless you're visiting the casino, Esplanade theatre or Fullerton Hotel anyway. Don't go out of your way, the biggest version is on Sentosa Island.
Its just a park where you can see the Merlion and in the back drop is Marina Bay Sands. the views are amazing and good photo opportunity

review_title: A beautiful place with amazing view
review_content: A must visit place when you are in Singapore. We went there around 5 in the evening.It was crowded. But after clicking some photos, we stayed there for more than 2 hours. In the evening when all lights are on it is really an amazing view from the park. There is a baby merlion in the park, dont miss that.

When thinking of Singapore, you automatically associate it with these lions. Great place for a selfie or that staged shot, however everyone else thinks same. Always tour groups and crowds. Get in, get your photos of the lions and surrounds, then get out.

review_title: Iconic but rammed wirh selfie tourists
review_content: Iconic symbol of Singapore. Swamped by hordes of tourists weilding selfie sticks. Flying visit recommend.

It is impossible to visit singapore without visiting this place. Because i've skipped this place in my visit before, i wouldn't miss this place this time. With grab we're easily dropped to this place from our hotel. Not much to say because we come here in the afternoon,before our flight. We should come here in the night for the light show. Maybe next time.
Whilst it has gr8 pictures to be taken of Marina Bay Sands, Ferris wheel & the river, it would be nice to have more shady area as I find it really hot & couldn’t hang around for too long.
U can spent hours around the Bay to look around or sit next to Merlion. They have some free performance but make sure to check the schedule first.
lots of tourist lining up to have a picture of the merlion, your singapore experience will not be complete wirhout visiting the place.

review_title: Not sure what all the hype is about?!
review_content: So busy and touristy!  Good views of the bay and finance district but you can see this from anywhere around the area and marina.
Great place to take pictures and also be creative with the Merlion. Worth a visit when in Singapore. Early mornings are probably the best time to avoid the crowd

Not too much to say about the Merlion, it is the symbol, the icon in Singapore, if you go to Singapore you have to visit the merlion. It is in Marina Bay, you have an amazing view of the Marina bay sands from there. Very interesting to visit.
A good place for photography and a leisurely walk. Try scooter rides for more fun . Can be crowded at times and taking pictures becomes uneasy but its worth all this for a photo with merlion.

I love my parks in the UK but from the moment you see the stone lions at the entrance you knew this would be a treat.  Lots for children to do and play on. There are areas where people play marjon and yoga. Fountains , flower and trees. Eating places and benches. Very influenced by Victorian life styles.  Free to get in and lots of locals and many will talk to you on English.
Great for resting and capturing. Open and welcomed every time you wish without restrictions. Good air condition because of wind
Really nice park with lion sculpture/fountain, nice place to just sit under the trees and relax and take in the spectacular views of the city.
We went to see this Outdoor Activity and the Surroundings sights of the Buildings and the Water. It was very crowded.

review_title: One of Singapore’s Iconic Landmarks You Should Not Miss!
review_content: We’ve been to Singapore countless times already but only got to see the Merlion Park now. The merlion itself is a sight to behold. The view of the Marina Bay area from the park was also amazing.
Hi! i was here on January 2018 ! but sadly underreconstruction but still very happy with the view around.. really love to hangout to this place!   i went here by walk from my hostel..

review_title: Singapore's iconic statue and customary photo op
review_content: Singapore's iconic statue and customary photo op and its Free !!. Its bit crowded, especially if your time coincides with any group tour visit. One can get a good view of Marina bay Sands hotel.
A commanding statue in the Marina Bay Area near the Fullerton Hotel. Half lion and half mermaid/man this statue stands proud in brilliant white.
The park itself it's ok, it offers good views of the bay. And of course, Don leave without your photo drinking from the Merlion.

review_title: Symbol of Singapore - a sight to behold
review_content: The place is called Merlion Park for it is not the site of only one, but two Merlions (derived from the French words Mer and Lion). One is quite big, while the other is small, both facing opposite directions.  A visit to Singapore is incomplete without visiting Merlion. Since we missed the chance to visit Sentosa Merlion, we decided to walk up to Merlion Park from Sands Skypark Observation Deck entrance located at Hotel Tower 3 of the MBS Hotel.  It is a bit crowded, but it is natural to expect a crowd, for it offers a very good photo opportunity. People take photos, cupping their hands together and making it appear in the photos that the water is falling straight into the cupped hands.  Worth visiting, but don't specially plan to visit it solely. Club it with one of the major attractions - like Sands Skypark, Gardens by the Bay, Little India, Chinatown, etc.

A great statue (half fish, half lion) with a fountain that makes for multiple photo ops. Of course, the main one is to stand so it looks like the water is landing in your mouth and you are drinking from the fountain! It was a little crowded but it was easy to get a good photo. The place was clean and I felt safe.
Good to see but I’m not sure that I’d go out of my way to view did a nice walk from MBS to boat and Clarke quays so an easy diversion
I came across Merlion park when walking. The Merlion, yes mermaid lion, is a continuous water fountain. If walking it’s worth stop but would not drive there as special trip.

Beautiful view of marina bay sands, the water, and lots of beautiful buildings. There are cute boat rides next to this location. I went with a gf and we took tons of pics. They have coffee, water, and icecream close by also for a snack.
Interesting to visit but not really a park as such, we walked to it over the Jubilee Bridge as part of a round the Marina walk.

I think everybody who come to Singapore always go to this place to take picture of it. You also can see MBS and take picture as well. Overall you can have your morning walk around this area and it was nice surroundings
We passed the Merlin on the way home to our hotel via the marina bay. Lovely fountain in a very clean area.

I guess this is a must see attraction for tourist to take the obligatory Merlion spouting water into your mouth. There is no shade and the place is full of tourist taking selfies. Very crowded, so expected unobstructed photos without a lot of patience.

All tourists of Singapore should have a photo here. It's a symbol of Singapore. The only thing I dislike is the climate. It's so hot in this place. Thank God, there are some benches where we can sit under some trees. Don't forget to bring an umbrella when you come here. Food here is quite expensive.

Crowded, bustling, and claustrophobia inducing was my experience at Merlion.   It is quite a small park existing of a circular stoned walkway surrounded by overpriced restaurants and a small pier so that you could get a frontal view of the lion. If you’re wanting a view with the lion and Marina Bay Sands in the background, you will get the back of the lion with a plethora of selfie taking individuals in the foreground.  I think they should aptly rename this park ‘Selfie Park’.  I am still glad to have gone, though, because Singapore is full of Merlion paraphernalia and now I feel a bit more Singaporean.
It’s okay for a quick stop. Star bucks and few bars cafes nearby over looking the water. Good view of the three tower building.  Was fairly popular but a little bit underwhelming.

review_title: Statue of White Merlion, in the Heart of City
review_content: No Singapore tour is complete without visiting it. Nice photography location near the Singapore River. From here one can take the ride of River also costing $35 per person. It is during site seeing tour. Again your travel agent will not include the river safari cost, so ask your travel agent to add this also in package
The Merlion at the park is like the heart of Marina Bay attracting huge crowds everyday... vibrant Singapura!
One is the famous Merlon . Get ready for your camara many beatiful building all around walk down to the street will get a lot of beautiful pictures!
Get ready with your camera and poses, a must visit and most visited tourist site in Singapore. Visit Merlion park during the day and during night time, and compare it for yourself.
Sweet place to take photos and enjoy the sights seeing surrounded by back water and top 50 global baking complex.
Visit to have view of Singapore masterpiece and Marina bay sands. Visit at 8.00 pm or 9.00 pm to watch the laser light show. Everyone visiting Singapore should not miss the show
I visit Merlion at Friday and it's so crowded as usual. And i remembered there's a lot of China tourists there omg and it makes merlion more crowded and louder than usual lol

review_title: Take a photo and move on
review_content: Not really much more to say. Good for bragging photo opportunity and not much else. Especially with jaded teen boy in tow.

review_title: Must visit place in Singapore! Best time evening
review_content: The best time to visit this place is evening so you should have a walk near a park and there are so many good restaurants near to this place  Having some crazy pics .. and then the people can do boat rides  Before you smoke there is a only a place to do so ..   having a walk near by this place is amazing .. the Singapore parliament, Supreme Court and other important Govt buildings near by ..
was here this january.. so clean, fresh and many people.. i love the situation here.. i went in the morning for jogging and really a good place to hangout..
Careful with the kids - not so easy to make one’s way here with a stroller under the scorching sun & among herds of tourists!

This place was very busy at around 10am. Lots of people trying to take photos as you can get a good photo of the Marine Bay Sands hotel from there too.  Good spot to watch the nightly water and light show.

Well the merlion park is the icon where every person visiting Singapore goes to. Well, I don't know much of history of that place so not aware of it's importance. However, it's a nice place. You can buy an ice cream and chill. We had walked from the Marina Bay Sands through the helix bridge to Merlion Park. It's a beautiful walk by the Marina Bay. It's well lit up at night. The place is bustling with people even at night. We had then taken a river cruise through marina bay which starts from Merlion park. It was amazing.

Restaurants near by the statue. The huge merlion statue is in Sentosa Island. But this one is the iconic one. It at the opposite side of Marina Bay Sands and it it a great place to take photos as well. Take the MRT or walk from MBS depends on you.
A small statue by the sea and a lot of tourists. Must see - well... Very nice scenery though. Singapore’s most well known place I think.

review_title: Great place for a photo opportunity, and not much else
review_content: With great views of Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer, this is a great place to go for that iconic Singapore holiday photos opportunity. Unfortunately there isn’t much to do in the area. There’s an expensive ice cream shop. Starbucks is closed until later on in the month. There’s a couple of expensive food places. And that’s it. Not a lot of shaded areas, and therefore little reprieve from the Singaporean weather.

review_title: Tourist spot for sure but there is a reason!
review_content: Great views and probably the most iconic spot in Singapore, always packed with tourists doing the tourist thing but if you are visiting this then you are probably one too - so soak it up and enjoy it! Wonderful spot.

Must place to visit if come to Singapore. It is better to wear comfortable clothes since it is hot and packed with people. Better to bring water. For muslim traveller, bring empty bottle since there is no pipe in the toilet.

Go visit the Merlion Park at night and you will not be disappointed! You will be in awe not only at the majestic Merlion statue but also at the dazzling shimmer of the Singapore River and skyline at night. Don’t miss the laser lights show starting at 8pm!

I'll get straight to the point. The Merlion is just a statue.  But it is so iconic and synonymous with Singapore that a trip to Singapore without seeing the Merlion would feel incomplete. So, go!  The closest MRT station is Raffles Park. It is a 8-10min walk from there.  There is no entrance fee.  You can see Marina bay and it's a good place to view the Marina Bay Skypark Casino (surfboard) building.

Will be on the list of all tour operators but I think there are better options to spend time in Singapore, but if u have time on hand then you could just go and spend time with some restaurants around get a view of the bay and just relax.

Singapore comes from the malay word "Singa", which means lion. Now you know why this icon is a lion. If you are walking to the place, look for the Marina Bays Sand Hotel - its the tallest building there and visibile for miles. Although the Merlion is THE photo opportunity spot, there are many others you should not miss - the Marina Bay Sand Hotel offers an excellent photo backdrop, as does the Lotus building. Make sure you also walk the Matrix Bridge. If you have time, take the harbour cruise. Sorry, dont know how much it is - I did not have the time to experience it.

review_title: The MerLion Is Synonymous To Singapore
review_content: The Merlion experience in Singapore is a definite must! Do attend the river cruise post that, it’s a wonderful experience as the boat takes you along the shorelines and shows you different sides of Singapore!

The Merlion is the icon of Singapore and it beautiful to see in person.  Unfortunately we arrived around 11am and there already a lot of people there taking photos. It difficulty to get a good shot with the amount of people around and to add on top of that, it outdoor so it can be pretty hot which may cause frustration.  Overall Beautiful View, highly recommend check it out!

This Merlion is the icon of Singapore. It overlook Marina bay sands and is connected to Esplanade theaters by Esplanade bridge. Visit this once when you are in Singapore. It is at the heart of Singapore.

This is a great area to walk around either during the day or even better at night when the whole area is lit up. There are loads of bars and restaurants to choose from and at least when we were there, free open air entertainment.

Many people at all time at this iconic spot of Singapore, the pedestrian bridge expands more views to the Merlion and surrounding skyline of the city, along with nice harbour view and the famous Marina Bay Sands (MBS) and Singapore Flyer at the opposite.  The late afternoon to early evening visit should yield the picturesque views of this nice place. Pictures of twilight dark blue sky with the lighting up Merlion and surrounding area would be visitor rewards, and just keep waiting a bit more to get the light show of the MBS as a bonus
This attraction basically tours u in boat in the lake way of Singapore telling about the history. Basically to see Singapore three ways are there 1. Water 2. Road 3. Metro. Enjoy this three ways

If you wish to get a close up photo of the Merlion, you will have to brave the hordes of Chinese tourists and be prepared to push your way through; 10.30am and the area was crowded. We decided to venture elsewhere and were happy with our photo opportunities from the calm of the cruise boat later in the day. Lovely statue with the head of a lion and the body of a fish, perched proudly on a wave with water streaming from it's mouth.
This is a famous icon & most visit tourist place at Singapore. Many good views for taking selfie by visitors
First time in Singapore, lots of high building and modern mixed with Chinese culture, Food was great and night Life was fun.

review_title: It's a statue with a great view
review_content: There are a lot of strange mythical animals around the world. I am sure you have heard of centaurs, unicorns, dragons and even phoenixes before. In Singapore, we have our very own mythical creature too and it's none other than the Merlion!  Born with the head of a lion and the body of a mermaid (don't ask me how that happened, we're still trying to figure that out), the Merlion is the tourism ambassador of Singapore. The official Merlion can be found at the centre of the city-state, between the Marina Bay tourist area.  It guards the entrance to the Singapore river, overlooking popular tourist destinations like the Marina Bay Sands, Esplanade, Singapore Flyer and is within a short walk away from the Fullerton Hotel and the National Gallery Singapore.  The Merlion enjoys spewing water out from its mouth most of the day, for reasons we are also still unsure of. Maybe it's because of all the partying nights. Legends say that in the night, the Merlion will quietly slip to Clarke Quay, Singapore's premier clubbing and drinking district to wind down after a tough day of being a tourist attraction.  Clarke Quay is also not that far too, only around 1-kilometre walk along the river.  Jokes aside, if you are considering to visit the Merlion, bear in mind that it's only a statue overlooking the Marina Bay area. There are some cafes nearby for you to sit down and enjoy the view, or you can choose to sit near the steps of the Merlion, but there's not much else to do here other than to take photos and enjoy the view.  If you fully want to enjoy the Marina Bay experience and see the Merlion from a different angle, I suggest taking the river cruise that allows you to tour the different landmarks along Singapore River. If I remember correctly, you can also embark and disembark at different pickup points. But check with the counter first.  Or if you're feeling adventurous and don't mind a little walking, you can choose to walk along the bay area and visit several landmarks at one go. There's the Esplanade, Singapore Flyer, the Art Science Museum and Marina Bay Sands all within walking distance. Might take you half a day to one full day to cover everything.  Singapore's weather can get quite hot or rainy so bring an umbrella just in case.
Beautiful Tourist spot. Way too crowded as this is a busy tourist spot. Nice place to snap some pictures.

Worth a quick stop to take a photo, but it's often overrun with tourists. Very beautiful area, perfect for photos and walking. The statue itself is ok, but it's the surrounding views that make the visit worth it.

Though we were tired (flew in (17.5 hrs) from LAX to SIN) earlier in the morning, we decided to continue our sightseeing. This evening’s stop was Merlion Park overlooking Marina Bay Sands Hotel, as we eagerly waited for the light/laser show. I recommend sitting on one of the stairs leading to the water (next go Merlion) as it provided a clear view of the Hotel, Singapore Flyer & the bridge. I recommend getting here an hour before the show & enjoy the area (& food).

review_title: Great walk from Helix Bridge to Merlion Park
review_content: The park it self felt overrated. It was small and crowded. But the walk from Helix Bridge to Merlion Park was great. The walk had great view, wind and places to relax here and there.

Visit this place in the evening before sunset, get favorite pictures near merlion and spend time till the area gets lighted up. There are many free shows nearby, and specifically do not miss the laser show.

review_title: Day & Night view is so beautiful !!
review_content: Every time when i visit Merlion Park, the view from here always surprise me :) walking around from Merlion Park to marina bay sands hotel during the windy night is so great!
If you are in SG you need a picture with the Merlion and that’s about it. Go there take a picture and leave
This is a beautiful park to visit in Singapore. The place has great options to spend time for family, kids. There is a walking path for other attractions near. Good to spend around 1-2 hours here.
This is a good place for dinning out lots of international cuisine restaurant along by the water with night light show across marina bay sands

Across the water from Marina Bay Sands hotel is Merloin Park which is a must see while in Singapore,it's a free attraction but has the tendency to be very crowded due to not only the merlion but also the myriad of restaurants along the waterfront,take you're camera as there are a lot of photo opportunities

It is a symbol of Singapore without doubt. Every tourist visiting Singapore comes to this park and take a picture, and so do I. If you have time, I recommend you to walk to Marina Bay Sands, which is on the other side of the bay.
It’s a must to visit this iconic Singapore symbol. It’s a bit crowded at night though. There are some restaus and cafes nearby too. It’s a good place to relax after a long tour/walk.

During our 12 hours transit in Singapore on our way back to Dhaka from the Maldives, the first thing we did was to pay a visit to the Merlion Park. This is truly the icon of Singapore and a photo with it would be a cherished one during your visit here. The place is full of people almost all day long and we had to struggle for a good photo for a while. Fortunately, we had a few good clicks and would love to spend some more time around the area if we happen to make a visit again to Singapore!!!

You can't really visit Singapore without going to see the Merlion. Busy area with lots of tourists all doing thier selfie shots but still found a little spot to take mine. Also worth visiting the area for the great views
the evening view is perfect... the light shows and the view on the fullerton and the merlion is a must have for singapore stop over.
Didn't stay long since I was with a tour group, but this is a great location for pictures of the Singapore harbor area. You can see the Skybar for here as well. Lots of tourist.

This is much more than a retail park. It has all sorts of recreational offerings. You can shop, enjoy a beer, some food, a stroll in the park or simply take in the view over the Bay. The famous Merlion spouting water into the bay is legendary.
This is a really nice area to just walk around Singapore in general is a very clean and safe place to be. Lots of tourists flock to see the Merlion statue just choose your time wisely.

Merlion park houses the symbol of Singapore - The Merlion. Good place to take some family photos with the mythic creature in the background.  Feasting on an ice cream and soaking the atmosphere around it makes it worthwhile. View of high rise buildings and marina bay sands is quite nice.  There is an option to take a bum-boat ride from the pier. However, they were accepting only cash so decided against it.
To appreciate this attraction it helps to understand the story behind the merlion. That said it is a popular attraction in Singapore and often quite crowded
This was another attraction i was looking forward to seeing, very busy of cousre but a great advantage to see the wheel and other landmarks as well,worth seeing

review_title: A Crowded Place To See An Average Sculpture
review_content: One of the reasons we decided to go into the city and leave Changi airport was because of the Merlion. I’d seen so many pictures of this creature all over the airport on postcards, cookies, and more. It seems like such an important part of this cities identity. Certainly we wanted to see other parts of the city, but this was one I couldn’t miss... or so I thought.  I can’t tell you what I was expecting, but I can say that I was disappointed. It’s a very crowded waterfront park with a large cement sculpture spitting water. The sculpture isn’t overly detailed or that impressive. There’s no information about what it represents or why it’s ever there. The one nice feature is that there’s a slightly nicer, smaller version of the sculpture behind the large Merlion that’s worth seeing. I’m convinced that some marketing company is behind the popularity of this strange phenomenon. There are amazing things to see in Singapore, much more interesting than this.
Nice promenade along this part of Singapore. Not very attractive for a tourist but it is a nice stroll in the centre of Singapore. The statue of the Lion takes a lot of attention from the locals.

review_title: Laser show .. dont go there for it . Go there only for the nice breeze
review_content: Laser show .. dont go there for it . Go there only for the nice breeze. Its the sitting area n organized shore side . Let the nice cool breeze n rain splash you..  Laser show is absolutely useless.. dont wait for it..

Most recognised sculpture in the city, this place is quite cramped with tourists since it is probably best spot to take photo of SIngapore cityscapes. There are also many restaurants and cafes along the sidewalk nearby the park.

Large fountain basically. Loads of tourists there. It is somewhere to visit as part of a larger visit to Marina Bay area. We preferred it at night time when we saw the laser show off the Marina Bay Sands hotel.

review_title: Take an evening walk to get a great experience...
review_content: One of the best things you can do in Singapore is to take an evening walk around Marina Bay. Cross pedestrian bridges and walk with a view to the magnificent Marina Bay Sands and enjoy the 26 foot high Merlion fountain

With all the mega sized sculptures among the mega scrapers I expected Merlion to be on the Mega scale. He probably was back in the day. Compared to the Mega Lotus across the bay Merlion is a modest 20-25’, cute fountain pouring into the bay. Worthy of a look see for photos. No shade so its difficult to stay longer than a few minutes on the white concrete decks when the sun is high. There are vendors of cold water & ice cream close by and a sidewalk cafe under the over pass.
You can’t miss this photo location if you are in Singapore. The view of the bay is amazing from this location and even better if you go at night.  Children love it
The icon of Singapore. The mandatory place for the first timer. Good view but it was super hot when we visited it.
Legendary Merlion is an icon of Singapore. Must visit to take funny pics of drinking from the spout of water.

This is the signature spot of Singapore. Day and night views are different. We went there in evening and enjoyed a lot. No entry fee and any limitation up there. Take some good snaps for the momeries.
Merlion Park should be your first stop in Singapore. Very popular place for a Kodak moment. A nice view of the sands casino. And at night with the lights and the skyline in the background is amazing.
A nice day down by the bay. The Merlion is the symbol of modern Singapore. Nice walk and great background available.

very amazing, it was my first time and always on my bucket list now its happen , Me and my hubby had long stop over so we decided to stay and book a hotel which is closest to merlion park , We really enjoyed our stay the view in the bay and of course the light that turn on at night so amazing really love it and the whole place so clean , love to comeback there one day.
user_location: Tauranga, Bay of Plenty, New Zealand

review_title: A snapshot of what Singapore is
review_content: Everytime i go to Singapore, i never fail to drop by the Merlion Park. It has an exhilarating view of what is to be an urban haven. It seems that the Merlion is always looking at the view surrounding him, from the Esplanade to the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, and the tall skyscrapers. It also gives a good view of the clean Singapore River.

review_title: Please carry good hat and umbrell
review_content: Awesome place if visited in eveningd ..day time tend to be too hot. But the walk from MRT station ..downtown is great....there are good cafe and eating places around the place. Its a fantastic landscae and panoramic view to click. Just ensure you are well covered up if you visit in day tome and are wel hydrated. One can take a strol and wlk upto singapore flyer and also to marina bay mall. Pretty expensive but worth visiting (with canals abd great decor and brands) Its a 3.5 km walk if you mske the complete circle.
Great picture spot in the city to catch the Merlion, Marina Bay and the Science Art museum.  A little bit too busy with selfie sticks, but what can you expect.
It was good to return to Merlion Park. I previously visited here 6 years ago and was good to see the changes to Singapore skyline. Easy to get to (metro) and a pleasant walk around the bay.
This is a great place to go to see the evening laser show at Marina Bay Sands. I was there last night and there has a great atmosphere and view. Lots of eateries too.

I been to Singapore like 5 times now and this was the first time I went to visit the Merlion. I suppose staying at Marina Bay Sands just across the bay has made it sort of harder since when things are so close we tend to put off visiting them. I think this statue is pretty cool and cute.   It of course represents history for Singapore but it’s also a pretty amazing statues and pretty large if I might add. It tends to hold a type of majestic almost superiority of over Singapore.   So please visit this place and see for yourself.

welcome to singapore. Almost everyone who visits Singapore wants to take pictures and travel in this place. Merlion park is one of Singapore's mainstay tours that can be visited 24 hours and free of charge.

They have installed a magnificent light show at the Merlion which is really awesome. You should go there after it gets dark. Also you can see over the bay towards the fountain show of the Marina sands hotel across from the Merlion.
Loved it! Best chillie crab ever too. Lovely spot and highly recommend. Lots of restaurants. Great for the kids too. Client se to universal studios and other amusements.

How can you go to Singapore and not get a photo of the Merlion. Best viewed as part of a walk around Marina Bay to take in all the sights of the Singapore skyline. Better still early evening to avoid the heat of the sun and catch the white Merlion against a darkening backdrop.
Got off at Raffels Place and walked over. Note an underpass next to the Fullerton. Great photo opportunity and view across to Marina Bay.  Worth the trip. Expect it would look great at night.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and the statue/ fountain is something to admire and Merlion Park also gives a fab view of Marina Sands Bay and the Art and Science Museum. I got to the Merlion at about 9am and it was bustling with tourists and I had to fight to take my obligatory photo and selfie, but it was worth it. To fi d Merlion Park get off at Raffles Place MRT take the OUE link and it will pop you onto the side where the park is- then just follow the signs and the other tourists.
Lovely views of the city great to see the iconic symbol of Singapore. A nice are for a stroll. If I was to visit again I think I would personally hire a bike for getting around and viewing this area.

A short visit is really all that is needed to snap a few pictures of this iconic statue.   There are also a few other items in the area (all within 30 minutes walking distance) which you can visit all within a short morning, such as the Fullerton hotel, etc. Must visit for first time visitors/tourists.

review_title: Great place to have an evening outing
review_content: Singapore’s iconic Merlion statue is situated here and your trip to Singapore is kind of incomplete without taking a picture here with marina bay sands as the background. Recommended to visit here during night time. You can also enjoy the spectra laser show over the Singapore river from here. It can be overly crowded sometimes but definitely worth a visit. It’s one of few attractions in Singapore which has free entry.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore.  The Merlion statue in Merlion Park is about nine metres high. It fronts Marina Bay. The statue has a head of a lion and a body of a fish. It was relocated to its present location in 2002 from its previous location at the mouth of Singapore River. The park is by One Fullerton - another landmark place.  The park is a very popular place - and there are lots of visitors trying to take photos of the statue. I recommend a visit - and if you want to avoid the crowds - go around noon time as it is quite hot - but at least the number of visitors is small.

It's Singapore, so you have to see the Singa a.k.a the Lion. I visit right at noon. It's quite hot but the view is great. There's the big and also small lion statues, with the river/sea and buildings as the background. Not so many people at noon, so the queue to take photo is not that much.
An architectural wonder with perfection style and beauty. A must visit. The surroundings are well maintained and view from the top is panoramic
this place is simply amazing and it will leave you completely mesmerized I would personally recommend this place to be visited along with friends and family

First off, it's not that big. Then, it kinda looks like it's vomiting in the bay. And never stops. And even if you did find it impressive or beautiful, then good luck getting a picture because there's like a million people trying to take selfies in front of the stupid thing.
A MUST visit hotspot in Singapore! The waterfall lion is just small but yet that’s the main attraction there and the main reason tourist are there for.
Yes sure, you must visit here if you travel to SG. And off course take a selfie. Its always crowded day and night

review_title: The night view from sidewalk is the best
review_content: I recommend the night view of both MerLion and Marina Bay Sands from sidewalk, Jubilee Bridge. At night, MerLion is lightened with various colors by projection mapping minutes by minutes. I like every colored MerLion.

Tourist spot. Can see marina sands tower from here. Crowded most of the time with the amount of tourist. Take note of the weather when visiting. Can be pretty hot during afternoon time due to its surrounded by sea water. Typical tourist attraction area that you wouldn't to miss.

It's so over the top - crowded but spectacular. The photos you can take from here are insane - you get the whole city practically in one shot (panoramic of course). I could have spent hours here - it was a hot day and if you stand close enough you get a little shower from the Merlion - it's perfect.
This place is so lovely. Too crowded but it's a big wow. Visited it after the lights show near Marina Bay Sands
Hurray, the Merlion was uncovered this time- it was covered up for maintenance last time we were there. Got my traditional 'drinking' photo, along with hundreds of others. Now, I'm happy.

What an amazing place to be. We were fortunate to be there while there was an amazing light show from the magnificent boat-shaped hotel opposite. It was one of the highlights of our stay. Too beautiful for words.

review_title: Best view on Marina Bay sands
review_content: Come here early morning for run or biking snd make pictures. Almost nobody before 9 am . Can have a coffee with amazing view and sunrise.   Evening is great too. Singpore skyline and MBS lights.
The design of the Merlin is very cool. Came here at night at the light show and it was full of people, entertainment and energy.
This park has an awesome view of Singapore beside the famous Merlion Statue. Come early so you will find this place isn't too crowded.
Merlon Park is in the heart of marina bay Nice place to walk or take around by boat Many nice views and many shops and restaurants around

review_title: Very touristy and crowded but a must as a symbol of Singapore!
review_content: No matter when you go, it's busy unless super early in the morning. You will struggle to get a clear shot. Tourists all trying to do photos for their FB or instagram! Nicer at night. Do a boat cruise which takes you near it and you get a better photo from there. Lot's of shops and restaurants, cafe bars near by
Merlion Park on the waterfront is a nice bit very crowded spot. Both large and small Merlions on show. Great views of the stunning marina architecture a bonus.

The Merlion used to be the most popular land mark of Singapore. Now, it’s the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. But it continues to draw huge crowds from all over the world. Very instagramable indeed. It’s beautiful.

It was really a nice place beside the sea which can offer you memorable photos. Nice sea view and of course crowded but still relaxing point to sit down and enjoy the scenery of Merlion , city and sea. But the restaurants were too expensive. I bought two small bottles of water from a restaurant for 7.5 singapore dollars which was much more expensive than other parts of the city! Except for this one , everything was all right.
The Merlion is very cool and it has a littler version only a few metres away. Definitely worth a visit. It’s very popular with tourists, but not unbearably crowded.

Whilst visiting Singapore for the first time stopped off here for the obligatory photo with the Merlion. As well as the main one spouting water there is also a smaller one in the same area.   The location is also a great location in which to take a photo with Marina Bay Sands in the background.  Must do for every first time visitor to Singapore

review_title: An absolute must do in Singapore
review_content: This is one place you have to visit. In truth it’s a little underwhelming, but if you don’t come your visit isn’t complete.  It’s always busy, which shows its popularity in Singapore.  Make sure you visit!!

review_title: The Most Iconic Image of This Southeast Asian City State
review_content: Without a doubt, the most identifiable image of the country, and commonly seen in brochures, ads, and even on fighter jets (as seen at the Air Force Museum).  Set right on the waterfront, this little showcase is a must see when visiting, and this was only my second trip to it since I first saw it way back in November of 2009.  However, this time, I got wonderful night shots (and with a much better camera than the last time).  This installation is cool to see too, because the downtown area of the city creates and awesome backdrop (although I think I'd say it looks cooler at just before sundown with just enough light in the sky plus the statue, plus the lights from the buildings in the background).  However, as previously mentioned by many others, yes, as this IS probably the most emblematic landmark in the country, it's going to attract quite a crowd and thus, there will most likely be many many people there all taking their selfies and group pictures in both the day or night. However, it's not like you can't get good pictures in between as most were very considerate of others who are also trying to get their own memorable snapshots.  Also, if one gets off at the City Hall MRT, follow maps, and even street signs, you can easily reach the Merlion, is a great place for a photo shoot and admission is completely free!  A must go to if visiting the Republic of Singapore.

review_title: The first icon of Singapore and still is everyone’s soft spot
review_content: It is the legendary Merlion. Doesn’t matter that now Singapore has established a lot more iconic places this is still the one you have to see and snap a creative selfie with. Enjoy the amount of people being there to try to be creative. It’s entertaining.
A nice spot to visit and some good places to eat and drink. We enjoyed the American place - Overeasy. Good food and service.
I walked from my hotel so got there about 10am and there were hundreds and hundreds of people. It’s symbol of Singapore and everyone wanted photos. You have to go see it.
actually nothing special, just because of it is Singapore icon, so if you don't come to this place then you haven't been to Singapore. so crowded.
The place is very touristy. I recommend to go there at a night time to take beautiful pictures. Nothing special in the area but still yet if you are in Singapore it is a must do thing

I came here with my 2 y.o child and took Raffles Place MRT station as our destination from Bugis.. Because we brought stroller, we looked for lift.. From lift exit, it was very very hard to find where this place's location.. I found nothing about direction.. So I had to ask some people..  After getting direction, we also have to walk about 15 mins to reach this place.. Again, there were no clear information about this location.. We depended on asking people..   This place is a Singapore's icon.. It's a good place to get some photos.. This place seems to be crowded all the day.. Just find the best spot to take your pictures.

Frankly it is not very accurate calling it a park. It's rather a little square overlooking the Marina Bay with a fountain statue (actually 2 statues since there is a smaller statue in the back) right in the middle. The fountain statue though represents the symbol of Singapore, the Merlion, combining the ties between the island and its people to the sea, as well as the historic name the "Lion city" in malayan that is ironically the old name given to a place where lions never existed! This Merlion was allocated in the mouth of the Singapore river but it was relocated here in 2002 and it sprays the water right back to the bay As usual in Singapore, you better visit by night to enjoy the lights and the atmosphere and definitely this place is on your way while visiting the Marina Bay, and for sure it is a great idea to get some photos with the fountain in the background sending its water right over your head or directly in your mouth ;)

Merlion park is very nice place to walk around and see the beauty of Singapore this is best way to spend time in evening and the lion statue is looking awesome front of lion statue Marina Bay hotel are also looking great

review_title: The ancient & new symbol of Singapore
review_content: This statue doesn't recall only the fusion between the ancient fishermen village with the old Sanskrit name of Singapura Reign, it represents still nowadays the strong and valid spirit of integration that You can breathe in each single corner of Singapore. Enjoy its view, discovering how & why Singapore is a really unique & successful melting pot!
Its a must visit when in Singapore preferably during evening hours especially when travelling with family.
Very busy but great views all around.  We hired an electric scooter to go around Marina Bay Sands.... I recommend.

I went there couple of times. It is a nice walk from Marina Bay hotel towards it. Plenty of people there by evening. I guess because you can see the night time light show displayed by Marina Bay. Take some nice photos and take your time. You will love it.
This is the most important place to visit in Singapore. Without this your visit is not complete. Very nice structure in a waterfront.
It's must visited spot when you're visiting singapore. Taking picture in front of the Merlion is mandatory
Been here before it was Renovated and still the place takes my breath away! We had so much fun trying to act as if we are drinking from the throwing GIGANTIC LION..a must place to visit.

Merlion is like the face of Singapore so your trip remains incomplete without visting the same. You can visit at night time, enjoy the place and there are so many Cafe nearby so you can sip coffee with your loved one.

review_title: Time to chill at iconic Merlion of Singapore on Marina bay
review_content: Iconic Merluon of Singapore is combination of lion's head and a piscian body. This Merlion is said to be the copy or a large Merlion at sentosa island. However, even this is huge.   There is a large waterfront in front of the Merlion, coming from the Singapore river. Arround are small foot paths and some shops for food and sovineer purchasing. In this area a lot of sculptures are seen. Many iconic Singapore land marks including theatre, gardens and museums are around this area.

review_title: Nothing great! ok if you have nothing else to do
