review_content: hi, the park is nothing great and you can see the Merlion even at the Sentosa. There are so many things to do in Singapore, you can easily give this a miss. Might as well relax or visit the the other hotspots..

My friend and I came here almost midnight. We thought that it will not crowd, but still many tourists there. We enjoyed the light of downtown and Merlion in the night. Such an exotic memorable to spend time here in the midnight. Lucky us that this merlion park is close from our hotel that we stayed. It has Bar and Resto surrounding the Fullerton Area. You can reach it by MRT too. Many choices and easy to reach Merlion. I fully enjoyed in this place and recommended to visit during in Singapore.

When you think Singapore you think Merlion. This mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish - represents Singapore to tourists. It's good for a short visit maybe about 15 minutes. Get yourself clicked with the Merlion if you can find some space in between the flooding of tourists at this spot.
Certainly impressive sight from the cable car or walking into Sentosa Island. Fascinating to see & probably best time to go would be morning or late afternoon when weather is cooler.
This is an iconic place that I’d recommend all tourist to go. early morning or late afternoon would be best timing to avoid crowds and heat.

There are some stunning photos on the net and it was good to see, but if you are tight for time, don’t panic if you miss it. However, if you combine seeing the Merlion Statue with the light show on Marina Bay (most nights at 8pm and 9pm - 15 minute show) ...then it’s well worth it! We arrived around 6.30 pm, had dinner at a top place called Over Easy then saw the show at 8. perfect!
With thousands of tourists mulling around in the heat, the Merlion Park is nothing to rave about. The view of the Bay and MBS is quite alright.

a singapore icon a must see in singapore  we actually went here on our bike tour of the city which was a great way to visit and take photos the boardwalk gets very busy with tourists but its still not that bad that yoh can’t move. very nice spot in singapore
To go to merlion park just stop at redline mrt and stop at raffles place exit B and walk to fullerton bay hotel. At the junction cross the road to one fullerton and down the stairs to merlion park.
Amazing day out,everything is so organised at the venue and extremely clean we really enjoyed the laser show

I loved this area... especially at night. With the lights its so pretty. A gorgeous stroll along the marina with many restaurants to stop at or just watch the light show for free of marina bay sands...100% recommend
The pride of this Nation State and a great experience. Don’t forget to take lots of selfies. Night and day.

Actually quite impressive, a giant statue of a mermaid lion shooting out water. Tons of tourists are there and will jostle you to get out the way so they can take selfies. Worth a stop and a quick snapshot if you are taking a walk around the bay anyway.
We finished our river cruise here and had to wade through other tourists to get photos of the Merlion
Can have a good view of Marina Bay Sand, the Esplanade and waterfront view from the Merlion Park.  And also to take a photo of the Merlion at the park.
If you bump into it fine but going there for a selfy do not waste the time  Lovely statue fun place etc

I feel like merlion is definitely one of the landmarks of Singapore. Be prepare for the crowd though. We went in the morning around 10-11am and there were already a lot of people. It’s hard to get a good picture tbh. We walked from Conrad to the park, not too bad of a walk. Best of all, it’s free :) plus, you get a nice view of marina bay hotel from the park.

You must go to the Merlion if you ever go to Singapore, and I am gonna tell you why. It is the mascot of Singapore, and there is a very good view from there of the rest of Marina Bay. Also you get to take THE picture with the fountain.
This is one of the most famost place to visit in singapore. And more beautiful in night time. And u can take the boat go around to see the statue will very very special

The Merlion statue is a must see while in Singapore. It’s fairly easy to find. The statue is fairly decent sized. This area seems to always be busy with people. The nearby Fullerton Hotel and other buildings, along with the waterfront, make this area a favorite to visit.

The tour of Singapore is incomplete without visiting the Merlion Park which probably most famous landmark. The location is excellent overlooking the waterfront & Marina Bay sand hotel & surrounded by many eateries etc. Great picturesque view for clicking shots!
The Merlion is icon of Singapore tourism. It is a landmark and must-see attraction. The attraction is crowded but the statue is quite good.

Most people who visit Singapore want to see the Merlion. As a result it is always busy, early morning, afternoon and evening. There are ways to where you can take photos without too many people in the shot. Just be patient and enjoy the bustle.

Me and my family took a taxi here from our hotel in Bencoolen, and as soon as we got off, there were tourists everywhere. We walked around for a bit, enjoyed the views, had ice-cream and took photos. I don't know what else to add that has not been already said before. Just incredible.

review_title: Merlion is cool, Park is average
review_content: The Merlion itself is pretty cool. We liked it a lot, despite the masses of people who also wanted to see it. Remember that culture is different in Asia than in Western countries; don’t assume that others will avoid touching you or will stand in line. There’s very little personal space and if someone can squeeze in front of you, they probably will. That’s not rudeness, that’s simply how it’s done...don’t get upset. Do be aware, however, that you’ll have to spend some time waiting to get that perfect photo.  Gift shops in the immediate area are obscenely expensive. A small wood Merlion statue was $88; you can get a similar one in almost any tourist store for less than $10. There’s very little to do at Merlion park apart from checking out the Merlion and enjoying the small flower gardens, but it’s nice to visit.
Merlin Park overlooks the Singapore river and Marina Bay Sands. I by passed this on my way to The Singapore Flyer. Great views and at night there is a light show off Marina Bay Sands.
This is my second time i go here. And i am still amaze, i feel its my first time again coming in Merlion Park Highly recommendable if your first time going to Singapore

review_title: Get there early before the crowds of cruise ship passengers
review_content: We would definitely recommend visiting Merlion Park rather than seeing it from a far distance and definitely visit early in the morning before all the crowds.
Who wouldn’t want to have an iconic selfie with the merlion? Must visit late afternoon for a stroll, have a drink and take a boat ride to the Clark Quay for much fun!!!
We came upon the merlion when we first arrived to the city while taking a walk. Very cool but its always super busy.
Special location, Good view.. for Photo group, Couple, Family Or Partner .. Around the world.. For Relax.. Have look Sightseeing and landscape.

I have no hesitation in saying that this is the best attraction of Singapore. The area of Merlion park and surroundings is the only area in Singapore which is full of tourists everytime of the day. Other parts of Singapore like the downtown and local areas are not so good.. this is the place where most people visit on their trip to Singapore.

First time i went to singapore. Merlion detination is last day and at night. It was so many people visit merlion. I think it must be so famous or maybe because of summer vacation. Surprised that night has a firework event. So beautiful scenery. I can see flyer, flower dorm, garden by the bay, marina bay sand, museum with unique building, many more and of course merlion. To go there. Better stop in mrt station esplanade. And walk to park. Anyway it was great experience in Singapore. The event was on 28/07/18
A majestic Merlion (lion head with mermaid tail) at the waterfront.. Beautiful relaxing place.. This is a landmark of Singapore and it is worth a visit.

review_title: Too many people in any time of the day
review_content: It is a landmark in Singapore but there are too many people that visit it and it’s hard to get a decent photo because of the line.  If you want touristy place, this is it! I would recommend if you come only during early morning where there are lesser people!

review_title: Wow what a place to be !!!
review_content: Superb feeling, just going there is an amazing experience seeing all the people from different parts of the would simply clicking the merlion wow,,,
It was a joyful moment spending my vacation at Merlion Park. Not a quiet but beautiful place to relax after a day visiting the city.
I think this is one of the most amazing places I’ve seen , the district is just beauty the peace and people   I hope you can understand from my photos
Merlin the landmark of Singapore is amazing, situated near the waterfront it adds to its charm . A must photo stop.

We came here to see the legendary Merlion . We thought it was simply an open space . Yes but surrounding it are multiple restaurants and store for Cold drinks . Opposite the Merlion Park is the Marina Bay Sands . I have seen people having mats and picnic stuff with them , so I guess it is really a park. We didn’t spent a lot of time here due to the time ( past noon) and my kids are sweaty and of course complaining about the weather ( hot ) .
Seriously, in the scheme of things, visiting this monument was questionable, so many crowds of tourists to get through and in the end I really had no idea what the point was

review_title: Spectacular views at the Merlion Park
review_content: It was a hot and humid day on my first day in Singapore. I was on a long weekend primarily to see Arsenal FC on their preseason tour so I'd done little to no research on the city before arriving. I was searching for a good view of the Marina Bay hotel with its ship atop when I arrived at the waterfront and the view hit me. Beautiful view across the water, dozens of people posing for photos and the Merlion stood majestically spouting water into the harbour.   A great walk in the sunshine, views of the harbour and city skyline plus the Fullerton Hotel in one direction and the Marina Bay Sands in the above - breathtaking.

review_title: The landmark of Marina Bay and Singapore
review_content: CYC+CG ( 18.07.14 )  This statue was the landmark of Singapore, so we visited this area for watching it and view of this area. The statue was simple, but the view of Marina bay was very good. It was inconvenient to enjoy because of too many people, but it was worth to visit and enjoy. The view of night was very good to us.

If you are in Singapore, don't forget to take pictures with Merlion! The landmark was situated near popular places, so there are many modes of transportation you can take to get there. Tourists often flocked at Merlion during the day, so help yourself combat the heatwave by going there at night. 100% recommended for night mode photography!
I really love the Merlion, I think it is resllyw cute. But the area is very crowded and it is hard to get a decent photo so better to see it from the water.
Tour group having a walk to see the monument. Worth the visit but not a great attraction. Food outlets available.
Average park near the Singapore river. Enjoyable specially in the evening when you see lights around.
You will found it near the fullerton hotel. The nearest MRT station is Orchard Place. I prever going there at night since i can see Marina and all the lighting of the surrounding area of this place.
Here's a chance to snap a photo with this very popular landmark, enjoying the surrounding scenery around the bay.
We reached there after a long walk from Marina Bay Sands. Nothing great....but puts a checkmark, thats all !!
This is the symbol of Singapore. I konw in place that imitates this symbol in Vietnam. Go to singapore you must come here

review_title: Take some photos of the Merlions
review_content: This attraction is right on the harbour, standing on reclaimed land. The big Merlion; named Mama Merlion, is the original one which stood on the waterfront (before the big land reclamation project), standing behind her is The Cub (a female, they say) and the only Merlion facing away from the sea. This is a fun place to take photos, and there are plentiful near-by places where you can get a cool drink. In reply to the Trip Advisor questions about fees and dress standard: there are no fees to pay at any Merlion venue. Common sense dictates that you dress reasonably wherever you go in Singapore... the locals don't particularly want to see visitors in grubby / skimpy outfits. What next?! Now that you've met Mama Merlion and The Cub, you should walk up to the top of Mt Faber to meet Elder Brother Merlion... and of course you'll take a trip to Sentosa Island; the ideal opportunity to meet one more member of the family; Papa Merlion. There's another, rather diminutive, Merlion at the Tourist Info Centre. If you have an inquiring mind, you can do the research on the computer and find two unofficial Merlions guarding the carpark at Ang Mo Kio Grove, and three unofficial Merlions in Woodlands; two are in front of a garden shop / plant nursery, where you can meet the gent who created them! And one more just around the corner in a sort of Merlion shrine. Having done all that, you'll want to visit the Mustafa Centre; the discount department store near MRT Bugis which is open 24 hr / day. That's where you can stock up on Merlion keyrings at $2 a piece!
NIce place to visit, specially at the night time, so you can enjoy the lightings. the place is nice place for photos

Merlion Park is one of 'must-visit place' when you visit Singapore. You can see the Icon of Singapore, Merlion (half mermaid half lion). There are two Merlions that you can see, one is big and one is small.  Don't forget to take a picture while you are here.
Great location to add insight about history of Vietnam. Recommend to visit this place when you visit Ho Chi Minh.

Lots of people, best seen from the water on river cruise. Some nice restaurants in the close vicinity and easy public transport access. Gorgeous at night when you can see the laser show at Marina Sands also.  Another Merlion also seen on Sentosa
You’ve never been to Singapore if you never visited Merlion Park.Merlion is a statue of fish with the head of a lion,which is widely used as the symbol of Singapore.
Although there is nothing much to do at this place. but this is one the tourist spot that you visit during city tour and get yourself clicked with Merlion. Beauty of the place is worth capturing.

Not a lot to see but just to say you have been there and got pictures....Much better by night with merlon lit up and spouting water.....never get tired of seeing it from river.... A special part of Singapore... for me anyway....

review_title: Good place to sit and relax
review_content: Hi I had visited this with my daughter and wife in the evening  It got really beautiful once it gets dark There is nothing much to see other than the iconic Merlion and the bay sands behind.  The view at night is really beautiful  You can spend upto 1-2 hours here not more according to me.
Early in the morning on my runs was the best time for this. Hardly anyone there around 7am. Just beautiful Singapore at its best.

Amazing Merlion Statue where you can take iconic pictures to memorialize your trip to Singapore. Or you can people watch as they make their poses as well as relax and watch the boats in the bay or have a snack. From here you can see the Marina Bay Sands Spectra show, but it will be backward since it is facing the rear of the show.
Walked down to Merlins park on our first night in Singapore and took some good pictures area however was very full with lots people taking pictures

review_title: one of the best place i have ever been,i didnt had much time to explore much but still i went for a quick ride!!!
review_content: i met a local guy named charlee who gotta own cab,if u have short time just talk to the local taxi drivers to show u around!!!

The surrounding area itself gives the atmosphere of wanting to be there with a happy mood even though the body and mind maybe tired. A good place to be with family while enjoying the scenic views of Singapore.

We took our 2 small children to the Merlion. It was extremely busy with apparent bus loads of tourists arriving, but open enough not to be oppressive. It is an iconic site, heaps of photo opportunities and quite a few shops in close vicinity. No Singapore trip is complete without the Merlion photo and posing to “drink” the water spraying out the merlion’s mouth. Kids loved it.

Merlion Park is Singapore symbol or landmark, a must visit attraction. Merlion means, lion's head and the body of a fish which spouts water from its mouth through the day. Merlion statue is located at the bank of back waters and surrounded by tall buildings. It is always crowded with tourists. Marina Bay, Marina Bay Sands Skypark, Gardens by the Bay, Cloud forest are near by important tourist attractions to visit along with Merlion park.

I went there when i had a stop over going to Bangalore india. Merlion is not hard to reach out! Went by train from Changi to city i walked 10 minutes from the train station to merlion and then back. People are very helpful specially indians.

Whether you're familiar with the past history of Singapore and what the Merlion symbolises or if you're just passing through this is a lovely area of the city to visit. Grab a J cone and walk around the bay.
Located near the corniche area. Good enough to have an evening walk. Large number of restaurents / coffee shops..

Merlion Park is good place to go in the evening. There are many restaurants to have dinner. We enjoyed our Starbucks coffee in outside. We were lucky that defence forces were practicing for their national day. We enjoyed aerial activities by fighter planes and Singapore flag by helicopters. Weather can be enjoyed here.

The Merlion Park is located in Singapore between the Fullerton Hotel and Marina Bay. From there you have a wonderful view on the skyline of Singapore. basically disease the financial district and all the parts of the Marina Sands Bay Hotel which looks like a Surfboard resting on three pillars. There are a lot of bars and restaurants around so you can spend your day and your money there easily.
There are 2 merlions. You try to take pictures with the big one pouring water on you. Also walk around there to find nice bars and restaurants.

A must-visit attraction when you are in Singapore especially for the first timers. Expect a crowd even in the weekdays. Accessible via public transport but if you are driving, best park in OUE with rate SGD3.75 per entry after 4/5pm on weekend. Walk along from Fullerton Hotel towards Merlion Park.  Besides the Lion with mermaid tail, the background of Marina Sands Bay won't leave you regret. Be there at 8pm for a lights show.

The statue is big and the water will fall from its mouth. River view with modern building behind is very unique. But, there’s over crowded and the sun will melt you if you are visit during afternoon time. I would suggest you visit on evening or early in the morning.

Anybody visiting Singapore the Merlion Park Is a must visit . It’s fairly quiet during the day but it’s all lit up at night and a real spectacle all lit up . There are plenty of restaurants and bars around to people watch afterwards . Great photo opportunity

The image of Singapore, the Merlion is a wonderful fountain of a half lion half mermaid that shoots water out of its mouth into the bay. This is probably one of the biggest tourist attractions of Singapore as it is the symbol of the city. It’s very easy to get to with tons of restaurants and shops surrounding it. The Merlion always has many visitors no matter the time of day, but go there in the morning to get a nice sunrise photo with the statue! You will get to see all kinds of tourists doing many different poses, and this alone can be entertaining.   Easy to get to from raffles place MRT station (Red or green line) and the Bayfront station (Yellow or Blue) if you wanted to walk around the bay to it! Fun to visit and a great view of the city from all around the Bay Area!
It was a nice attraction and quick to visit. Definitely good to tick of the views from the top are lovely.
merlion is a landmark of singapore itself. you have not been to singapore if you have not taken pictures here. lies the marina bay sands. many ways to come here. more beautiful when the night
- nice area now to walk around with lots to see. It has been a few years since we last went - enjoyed out visit back

Merlion is the first thing that comes to my mind, when I think about Singapore. This the most publicised tourist attraction. You can actually visit this after spending your afternoon at gardens by the bay. The attraction is free to visit and is very clean. It is very interesting to see the Merlion closely and observing it's intricate details. There are enough food eateries near this for refreshment.

You must take a picture with merlion statue, this is most famous landmark at singapore. You can also see another landmark of singapore here . If you visit at sunny day dont forget to bring hat or umberella and sunglasess, its very hot here.

review_title: RECLAMATION AND URBAN PLANNING PAR EXCELLENCE!
review_content: Last month I visited Singapore for the second time. My last visit was in 1998. I was very impressed with the many projects that resulted from land reclamation. The Gardens by the bay, with the artificial trees is a MUST SEE, especially at night. The Esplanade, Merlion Park and ArtScience Museum were beautifully done. Level 33 bar, where we went to quench our thirst, offered breathtaking views of the area! Do not miss this area!
I think the merlion itself is pretty underwhelming but the area around it is lovely to have a wander.
We parked our car at basement and walk to Merlion Park. We have walked quite short distance and it was too crowded.

Took a walk from MBS over the Helix Bridge to have a look at Merlion Park. Took a couple of photos of the statue and then walked back. Great views of the river and MBS. Its free so worth the visit. Only stayed for 5 mins though. Don't bother paying for a tour to take you there. Its easily accessible.

The statue of half lion half fish that becomes icon of Singapore is right on the water, with the great view of Marina Bay Sands, the flyer, Esplanade and Art Science museum. Definitely a nice place for a Instagram worthy kind of photo. Great view day and night. Don’t miss the light show!
There is nothing great except of its history yet we visited the place. No enterance fees. We completed the corum of visiting this place. Worth for some fun
Go to Clarke Quay and go on a river cruise...you can get fantastic photos from there...then jump off @ Marina Bay and check out the shopping!
Iconic statue of Singapore. It's good after years this still attracts tourists and visitors. Would say the walk towards this attraction along the riverside is best.
One and only, the most famous Singaporean symbol. Must hang around and see the statue, and of course, the view of Marina Sands Bay hotel from Merlion park is also amazing.

As a kid all I knew was the Merlion represented Singapore. But it’s beautiful when you climb up the Merlion! The view is amazing. You get to see view of the Sentosa island.   There’s also a lot of souvenirs. It’s colourful and beautiful! You can either take the elevator or walk up the stairs.

Everybody is here, everybody is taking their picture drinking from the MerLions spouting mouth! A great place to meet up with your lost traveling companions or just people watch. A must see for any traveller.

We visited Merlion Park in January and we walked quite a long way from the train station to find out that the statue was covered for maintenance. It was ashamed but the view around the area was nice. Too crowded though.

review_title: Too many tourists but worth a watch
review_content: MerLion - Body of a Mermaid with the head of a Lion. Try going early in the evening, there will a lot of people so make sure your photo angles and cropping skills are pretty good. It is a good 20-30 mins walk from Clark Quay but it's a pretty nice walk. You also get a good view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel.
I really enjoyed it even thou the day was hot and humid. Do not miss it, even the little one is very cute.

Well, the park was nice & clean. There are restaurants & cafes with views to the water and Marina Bay Sands across. The entrance is free. Sooo many people around the statue. Maybe if you come around 7 or 8 AM the place will be less crowded.

I came here at 12am midnight so it was easier for me to take a picture. Im not too sure how it is during the day time but nighttime was beautiful, seeing the merlion shining and the sparkles of Marina Bay Sands from afar. And not to mention away from the crowds. It was quite peaceful. There are multiple Merlions in Singapore, but to get that "ICONIC" Merlion, Marina Bay Sands & Lotus in one photo, the easiest way to get there is to  1. Get off at Raffles Place MRT. 2. Exit door G of Raffles Place MRT 3. Turn right and you will see the Fullerton Hotel and walk towards it 4. Once you get to the Fullerton Hotel, walk to the front of the hotel till you see "One Fullerton". 5. Cross the road to the other side and you will see the Merlion.

Visit the Famed Merlion Park for some cool and stunning photographs. The whole area is a treat for the eyes, especially at night with the towering sky scrapers, Singapore river , Marina Bay Sands Hotel , all illuminated with bright lights.

review_title: Always a good place to spend an evening
review_content: Going to Merlion park is always a pleasure. The Singapore emblem is top on the river, so we spent an hour watching the surroundings. In the evening the Merlion statue came into life with lights. If going there do not miss the laser show from Marina Bay Sands happening daily at 8 and 9 PM.
Hi guys. Im really happy with this view in the middle night and many food street in here. If you want to take relax, you can buy some ice cream and other else.
Walked to the Merlion from the Pan Pacific Hotel. It was an easy walk and we saw a few things we had missed in the area. The Merlion was fun to see and there are lots of chances to take pictures.

review_title: Beautiful place, too many people, overcrowded
review_content: As promised, the Merlion is beautiful. Lots of great photos can be taken here but the crowd is too much. Not sure when a good time to visit is but definitely not at noon. People were standing in the way most of the time. Great experience nonetheless.

review_title: A Must Visit to the Singaporean Symbol
review_content: A must visit if you visit Singapore as Merlion is a symbol there. A deck has also been created to watch the sculpture well. The atmosphere is also excellent with the views of Marina Bay Sands and science center. There are also places to get food nearby, so that you could have food while having a rest.
Nothing much to talk about as it is the landmark of Singapore. It is the must visit place in Singapore. The Merlion park is what defines Singapore.

We all know what this is. In every advertisement of Singapore, we have noticed the majestic half lion- half mermaid icon roaring fountain from its mouth. Singapore is incomplete without this masterpiece. The Mythical Merlion has a tale to tell the tourists. The body represents Singapore’s ancient business, fishing and the head represents Singapore’s original name, Singapura, meaning “the Lion City”.

review_title: Perfect location for taking photo of Singapore’s landscape!
review_content: Merlion Park is located near The Fullerton Hotel and The Fullerton Bay Hotel. You can take great photos here of the Singapore Landscape and Marina Bay Sands.   For dining options, you may find PS Cafe a suitable choice for lunch and dinner too. There is a few Starbucks outlets near Merlion Park - one at Waterboat House and another near The Fullerton Bay.  It is advisable for you to go at night as it will be pretty crowded in the day and scorching hot and humid too.
Your visit in Singapore will not be complete if you will miss the Merlion and take the mandatory selfie.
Merlion Park is definitely a must place when you visit Singapore. There are a lot of great photo backgrounds and cool iconic places. I want to visit again!
It's the symbol of Singapore identity and once you reach there it's feel so wonderful and unutterable words that defines this place beauty , a must must must visit with family !
Very nice to see, symbol on Singapore and great water feature. Easy to get to as on the harbour, worth going and finding it.

Went to merlion park during our city tour. It is one of the most prominent symbolic of Singapore. The place was located such that there was an open area from where people can click pictures of merlion and can sit and relax. However when we visited it started raining so couldn't spend much time. But Overall nice

review_title: Worth a visit to the Singapore's famous Merlion
review_content: My wife and I have recently travelled to Singapore, our first time visit to this beautiful country.  Before we left home, friends suggested we visit Merlion Park and as the name suggests the famous Merlion is located on Marina Bay. The Merlion lion represents a half fish and half lion.  Merlion Park is easy to get to and we travelled there and back via the Hippo hop on and hop off bus which stops across the road from the park. The park is very popular with tourists and with crowds of people trying to photos with this statue. You can also see the Merlion by taking one of the boat tours of which the main pier/booking office is only situated about 50 metres away. We were fortunate to do both and got some great photos.  This is a free attraction and definitely worth a visit.  Cheers, Paul.

Merlion Park considered as the main attraction of the Singapore and it is also known as the identity of the Singapore. Your trip remains incomplete if you have no plan to visit this place. Access to the location is free for everyone and it is centrally located. The view from the Merlion Park is just awesome. You can see the High Rise Buildings, Iconic marina bay sans, Singapore Eye etc. You can also have a look on Baby Merlion which is located near Merlion Statue only. Various main attractions are also near to this place. To visit here, you can plan your trip easily and club with other attractions like, Singapore Eye, Skypark, Graden by the Bay etc. The place remains crowded in evening. 30 Mins stay is more than sufficient. Must visit place for everyone.
Recommending everyone to visit it during the night! You can watch beautiful dancing fountain and also take beautiful pictures. You can also ride the boat along the harbor.

review_title: Night time is the best time
review_content: I'm so glad we went at night. There was a breeze and we could see the light show at the Marina Bay Sands. It was so beautiful to the Merlion at night. Enjoy some ice cream, and a seat on the steps and relax.

The merlion is a magnificent monument - the half fish I think symbolises the sea and the lion is what was seen by a sumatran prince when he visited singapura as formally known. Singa also means lion in sanskrit and malay. The place has a great photo opportunity

I think there is no need to describe it. Only i will share my experience. I visited here in March 2018. Very nice place. The view around the Merlion is very scenic, carry good camera to capture. I visited here in evening time, so i could see a light and sound show. I love the place. No need to say i would recommend this to all.
A must visit in S'pore, due to its name; Mermaid-Lion. It would be a magical moment when you may find a spacious spot for photo taking. So reachable from Rafles Place, about 15 min

As with statues such as the little mermaid, this is what says you have been to Singapore. Althoughth the city was relatively quiet when we were ther, the statue was teeming with tourists, trying to get the best snaps... me included.. Nice area to sit around and have a beer, and people watch
A tourist attraction that you must visit.   From here you can walk to the shopping centre, the wheel and other tourist hot spots.

This glorious statue was all by itself on my first visit to Singapore - 40 years ago. Now, all around its space is reclaimed by pathways, bridges and buildings. I am sure Merlion feels encroached in, just like thx lions in Africa,  Yet, getting up close to this magnificent statue, makes you feel like it has become a close friend.   Please come closer and take a selfie with it, and pray, you will come back one day.
Singapore has come a long way from merlion being one of the most important tourist attraction. It’s good to go if you want an open view, lots of tourist and that ‘I was in Singapore’ pic.

review_title: Very nice place to spend your evening
review_content: I highly recommend this place as a must go place in Singapore. I suggest every one to visit there in evening time. Very nice place to relax after a tired day.
Stanning Park. Very clean and full of things to see and do. You can use the cable car to go to the 4 part of the park. The view is incredible! Make sure to have water and wear comfortable clothes.
Nic small park with the Merlion statue over the bay. Just "should visit and take a selfie" :-). Very nice view on Marina Bay Sands and other futuristic buildings.
The visit to Singapore is incomplete without visiting this place.  Taking pics by posing u r drinking water which is flowing from the lions mouth.  The view is great and it’s must visit
The only amazing part of this is the fact you can look across to the marina Bay Sands which is such a impressive building

review_title: Park here for a while Merlion
review_content: Merlion is the truest icon of Singapore  We visited on a very shiny and hot day We travelled by the river to reach and we spent a great time watching the city scale the sculpture as well as the sea

Nice place to wander around and enjoy the sights but the merlion is a bit of a joke. A pointless statue squirting water from its mouth. I was asking myself if it was a joke when we visited and saw droves of tourists there posing for photos.

it was place well maintained and excellent place for photo shoot .even in the hot afternoon the area was open and heat was not felt .i thinkyou should go in the evening but tourist do not have option as they have to cover all in short time
Lovely little park with the famous Merlion statue. Great views of the Marina Bay Sands. It's full of tourists, but that's to be expected. Worth seeing once or twice.

review_title: Best place to view Singapore skyline and the Merlion
review_content: I often bring friends who are first time visitors here as it has a splendid view of the bay encircled by the Marina Bay Sands hotel, the Singapore Flyer and the Business District. It is also the closest where you get to the Merlion. Instagram worthy but also rather crowded. Light shows on the bay every night - a bit touristy but they love it nonetheless.   I usually take them for dinner at Palm beach Seafood restaurant to enjoy chili crab and pretty good food. A bit more pricey than usual but food is good and it has a great view outside. It’s usually packed. so book in advance to sit outside to enjoy the view.   In the day, nice place to enjoy beer, coffee etc at the many al fresco cafes and take in all the activities in the bay - sports, river boat cruise etc. If it gets too warm or too wet, sit inside the air-conditioned areas. I like the Ps Cafe on Level 2. To get there, take a cab to One Fullerton or walk from the nearest train station or bus stop. It’s also a nice walk from the Marina Bay Shoppes (where the hotel is) to One Fullerton (just follow the Merlin spouting water at the opposite end) - a scenic 15 minute walk.   From One Fullerton you can also take the basement travellator to the Fullerton Hotel - which used to be the General post office, a relic left from the British which was conserved and converted to a spectacular hotel. Around that district, wander around and you find more conserved properties beautifully restored and maintained which are now museums, concert halls and galleries. Bring along a bottle of water and a small towel and wear comfortable shoes. It is hot and humid over in Singapore.

If you are at Singapore and you have not been to Merlion Park .... its like not being to Singapore.  Mirlion Park is to Singapore, what India Gate is to New Delhi, Statue of Liberty is to New York, Eiffle tower is to Paris..

As mentioned it represent Singapore due to Stamford Raffles. Is nice to take a photograph and also along the park you are able to see the most talk about Marina Bay and in the evening at 7pm , one can see light up from the top of Marina Bay. You can find variety of food along the park - local cuisine, seafood restaurant, Japanese restaurant etc....

review_title: Nice view but not a must visit
review_content: It is a nice place but only worth a visit if you have covered everything else. You will also see the Merlion in sentosa so can skip this as well.
A must to see. Singapore's famous merlion status is the symbol of Singapore. The water spray from the spout was refreshing in the Singapore heat.

Merlin park is such an institution of Singapore-just have to tock it off your list. There are a lot of fast food places there now,so not as open as it used to be. Probably best to see it from the water

Well my tittle says its all Half Fish and Half Lion is Merlion park. The best time to visit this place is in night in after its quite hot and humid. Well it was really crowded and people from all over the world come to visit this beautiful iconic masterpiece.  This is really best one and sit and have sip of beer in near by restaurant and enjoy with his family and friends.
Worth a visit for some touristy pictures. Some resteraunts and bars in this area to. Free entry, nice in the warm weather.

review_title: Half Fish - Half Lion - Iconic Merlion
review_content: It's fun to see Merilon, half mermaid & half lion, proudly standing, it's one of the world's famous landmark. It's huge, a major tourist attraction & overlooks mighty Marina Bay sands & it's located in front of Grand Fullerton Hotel...it's a landmark, it's iconic, you'll find huge crowd clicking slefies, taking photos all the time, its quite a fun & it's open all the time for visitors.....no tickets required.  Kids will enjoy a lot. Food & drinks are available nearby.
This is the iconic Singapore Merlion, a mystical being that is lion and mermaid. Tourists from all over the world come to take a photo with it as the background, somewhat like the Copenhagen mermaid.
One of must go place in Singapore, especially for first time travelling to Singapore. Location access still make me confuse from MRT location. Please make more guide for tourist.

An impressive statue with a great history attached. Recommend early or late in day as it was super busy with tour groups.   Also don’t be silly and try climb underneath it I watched a women fall in the water trying

We started close by for a business trip, so walked down after dinner one night. There roads can be tricky, so it might make sense to take some of the mall sky was to cross busy roads. Around 8:45 you experience the light show at the marina Bay sands resort from Merlion park. Lots of fun walking jogging trails by the water to stroll.

We got a river cruise to Merlion Park , from Clarke Quay, then we spent about 3 hours wondering around the Fullerton area, then crossed the bridge to try and see the F1 track( couldn’t really) . We really liked it around the Merlion Park and think it should be given a higher rate on the things to do in Singapore . We really enjoyed.

review_title: Starting to get a little dated.
review_content: This is the iconic tourist spot to visit; and whilst still incredibly popular it is starting to get a little dated when compared to the new tourist attractions. Perhaps in need of an update - but I am sure it will always be popular. Worth a ‘selfie shot’ with some good views across the Bay.

There were a lot of tourists when we arrived at Merlion Park even if it was high noon, so getting a photo exclusively with the Merlion is almost not possible. But it was a pleasant experience. I would definitely come back. Just do not bring small kids when you plan to go at noon and in the Summer.

This is a place you should visit. This must be the most photographed Merlion in the world. Heaps of people around just snapping away.   Great view of the skyline and Marina Bay Sands. Get a coffee and sit and watch the water for awhile. Very relaxing place to visit.

review_title: Merlion - Signature and Symbol of Singapore
review_content: Merlion Park - The Signature and Symbol of Singapore. No better place to enjoy amazing Singapore skyline, beautiful waterfront and astonishing views of the the Marina Bay Sands and the Gardens by the Bay. Holiday Trip to Singapore is incomplete without the customary visit to the Merlion Park. It gets more and more beautiful as the evening sets in. TRULY SINGAPORE
The park is modest but the monument is worth a visit to admire.  It’s hot and worm around but enjoyable and worth a visit

The Merlion park, is right opposite the 1 Fullerton hotel. Its also a place where you will find a ton of tourist taking photos of the iconic Singapore Merlion. There are a lot of restaurants here, so you can chill out over a meal or a few beers.

review_title: Singapore landmark and major tourist attraction!
review_content: Hello guys, we travel from Aljunied MRT to Raffles Place MRT and walk 10minutes to Merlion Park. Train service is so convenient in Singapore..  This place was flooded with people as this is the major tourist attractions. Nothing much here just some pictures. Get your sunglasses ready because it is real sunny and hot !
It was a great experience I would recommend it if you have a day available as so many activities to do at each stop

MerLion is a word made from Mermaid & Lion. Merlions in Singapore are overlooking water bodies with water spring coming out of their mouths & are one among major symbols of Singapore. This park is near Marina, esplanade theatre, Singapore eye giant wheel etc. eating joints are also there.

review_title: Go first thing in the A.M. to miss crowds
review_content: Had to see it as it is the mascot of Singapore, but was a quick take a picture and look around type thing. Just a statue near the water, so kids will get antsy to hang around. I went super early and it was empty, but it fills up as the day starts. I hear it can be quite crowded, so if you want to miss that, do it first thing and move on!

A must visit place in Singapore due to the significance it holds  A nice walk upto the park  Try and visit at night as you get a good view of the entire bay and it’s fascinating  Be aware if older people are visiting there are quite a few steps going up from the park upto road level and no lifts

A must if you are visiting SG. It is right by the waterfront. From here you can see the SG flyer, MBS and Durian-shaped esplanade. There are bars and restaurants right next to the Merlion. I was lucky to be here during the light festival. This place was packed at night.

Was hoping the Merlion represents something special for Singapore, but research indicates the Merlion was first used in Singapore as the logo for the tourism board.and is the unofficial mascot of Singapore.

People are expecting too much from a lion statue that spews water 24/7?  This place symbolizes Singapore. What good about the place is that they have kept it clean and a lot of spaces to walk by and take great pictures.  Visitors should definitely see this place both during the day and at night.
It was ok. Nothing special. Merlion is something Singapore only so it has made three place to be as a tourist. Lots of walking from MRT, less walk if you choose bus.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore, hence seeing this is compulsory. Situated right in front of 1 Fullerton, it has a picturesque location. Do visit in evening for the best effect.  Visiting this is free of cost.

review_title: Good place to snap a few pics
review_content: Usually very crowded a lot of tourists but it’s a nice place to take a stroll take a few pictures. Loads of restaurants and bars at night the place looks really beautiful with the lights. If it’s your first time worth a couple of hours as it close to many other attractions.

Singapore is known for its icon of lion-headed creature and legged fish. The Merlion legend has become synonymous and it is a must for tourists to record memories if visiting here. Do not forget to make it as a souvenir to your loved ones.

The Merlion Park offers a good view of the Singapore skyline, Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the Esplanade area. There are a lot of restaurants nearby. This area is best seen in the late afternoon/early evening so that you get a view when there is still sunlight and when the lights all around get turned on. There is also a light show on the Merlion statue itself which is a sight to see.

I crossed this place on one of my early morning runs and was surprised to see a lot of tourists clicking pictures. The sunrise pictures around that area are beautiful, especially with the Marina bay sands building in the shot.
This place is usually crowded beacuse it is one of the standard tourist must-have photo in Singapore. Visit early in the morning if you want to have more tine to take photos without too much crowd

Visited the Merlion as part of a city tour on our first day in Singapore. Our visit was the first stop on our tour and it seems to be a popular time to see it in the morning. We were there around 0930 and there were large groups of tourists all clammering to take photos of the statue and also of MBS which is on the other side of the bay. Looking back at the statue in the afternoon, the crowds had pretty much gone so it might be a good idea to schedule your visit for later in the day. It's definitely worth a visit though as one of the iconic sites of the City.

review_title: Have to go for a pic
review_content: As a tourist u have to come here. Vast view of the Singapore river and marina bay sands. N the icon of Singapore, the merlion. U will see all the tourists here trying to get a pic with the merlion. Take a walk (or run) around the water. Passing by Fullerton bay hotel (not the old Fullerton hotel), go up to rooftop bar (called lantern) for a drink (v exp) and absorb the amazing view From there, then mbs, the helix bridge etc... nice walk here.
Best views of the city from the merlion park.A nice placevto hang out with friends and family,dont miss this psrt of town,easily accessed by bus or mrt.
The walk in this area is very nice lots of restaurants around. The view on the buildings is lovely.  Very touristic
Really enjoyed the park and could have done with much more time than we had. Would like to go back and spend more time there.
Merlion is the symbol and god of Singapore. That’s because there’re too many tourists here, it’s so difficult to take photos except other people. But the statue is very scenic.
When you visit Merlion Park and get inside The Merlion and you pull the bell, you should have in mind a wish. My wish was to come back in Singapore, it was my best trip ever.

review_title: Great photo op with Marina Bay Sands
review_content: Lots of restaurant surrounding the area. You can get great photo of the Marina Bay Sands from here. Not too far walking from bus station.
Small place to attract million people every year. It is nice and clean and you can see the view of all the whole Singapore.

review_title: Go on a boat cruise with family and friends and see something different
review_content: This place shows you something different, go on a boat cruise with your family and friends. take nice photos

review_title: When we embarked on a visit to the Universal studio and trying to get to explore the place, we ended up at this park too
review_content: The place is quite expansive, you need like a month to visit every corner. It is a must visit for all the visitors.
Merlion Park is full of tourists and selfy sticks - you’ll have that. It’s very pretty and you can get a great view of the skyline and city. Many bars and restaurants near by.

Almost every other tourist has, one time or another, has a photo taken of or with the Merlion whether near or afar. We went as near as we can get via Fullerton Hotel, where a nearby MRT is located. There were close to a hundred other tourists in the area taking clever pics with the famed Merlion. We spent more time in the area (early dinner at One Fullerton) but otherwise, this is a 15 minute attraction.

My fourth visit to Singapore now with 2 teenagers in the mix. Lots of.changes on shentosa and getting information from staff about directions, good packages and just good old directions.was.frustating. staff didn't know, there seemed.to be certain amount prejudice. With the island now.bigger with its pdfeeing wouldn't hurt to get some information kios around the place to give information and.directions.to.people.
Visit during late evening...  the lights, the fountain show, the boat ride, the ambiance, the calmness,,,  you will just be lost in it.  must visit.

After a long wait time finally traveled to Merlion Park with Family. This Place is often Crowded with Tourist so have to find right spot to capture a photo. Always end up having may peoples around in the solo pic.
This spot is where you'll be able to snap your Singapore postcard photo. Also a nice place to hangout for a drink or lunch/dinner.

This is one of Singapore's highlights. Take your time to explore the area and enjoy the sites the sounds and the views from different angles of the park. It gets crowded but well worth the stop. To many photo opportunities to take advantage of. Enjoy.

This place is located at a prime location however you need to know how to reach there...Best time to be there is at the evening when lights are on...it looks really great in the evening with lights...

One of the iconic sights to see in Singapore, you really cannot miss this. You can either walk to Marina Bay or visit on a river cruise (we did both). Very popular place but plenty of seating on the steps to chill and take in all the buildings around.

review_title: Singapore icon on a rainy day
review_content: The Merlion was a must see on our recent trip to Singapore, but we didn’t get an opportunity to visit until the last day. The Merlion visit was not dampened by the storm and we enjoyed the iconic Merlion statue. The Merlion needs to be ticked off on your attraction list for Singapore. Recommended despite the torrential rain. Bring an umbrella.

It had been perhaps 10 years since I had visited this tourist spot, but the development surrounding the Merlion and its forecourt has transformed the area into a real lifestyle precinct. A great spot!
great place to take picture , you will get the MBS in full view , some skyscraper surrounding Singapore
There are two merlions..one here and one in Sentosa,good for those tourist posed photos ..nice walkway for walking too

This place is very cozy to be with you love or friends!   The area have an awesome viewpoint over the marina bay and you have a lot of restaurants and cafes here.   A tips, find Starbucks there you have free WiFi and a stunning view! + great coffee!   The popular attraction have a lot of people there pretty much all the time but if you want some alone time with the tiger just sit down and wait until the wave if people have take the photos the you can do some funny shots!   Let me know if you want me to visit something else in Singapore.  If you want to see more pictures from my trips please check out my Instagram/whaatzzupp  Thanks for reading,  Until next time see you soon!   Location: **** Photo friendly: ***** Tourists: *****
The Merlion Park is one of Singapore's tourist attraction, located near the Central Business District. Quite busy but with plenty of restaurants around the area to relax.
You have to visit As it s a symbol of Singapore. It s beautiful. There is a restroom and it s really clean!
National symbol of Singapore..if u rvisiting singapore dont forget to take a piture here at night..with all the city lights.must visit.
One of Singapore’s iconic sight seeing spot with many picture and video taking opportunities. Sun sets here are amazing with the super sky scrapers in the horizon!

The Merlion landmark icon is a mythical creature with a lions head and a body of a fish. Definitely a major free tourist attraction as the area was quite busy during both the day and night visits. This is probably one of the best viewing location for the stunning light spectacular Spectra - led, laser and music show at 8pm.

Kind of a must to visit here for stunning night view. Being here, The Gardens by The Bay shines at night and serves as a great background to take photos together with the Merlion.  There are so many different spots to take photos with the Merlion and at the surrounding, there are lots of restaurants too. We had a drinks at the hotel rootfop bar and that was nice!

All who visit Singapore the Merlion Park near SBS is a must visit site. It is amazing to see people from all over the world there. A very clean and well maintained place. You must rry the sandwich ice cream and dumplings sold at the hawker center around the Bay. You can take a good walk around and visit the science museum, the formula one track, the marina Bay sand, where you can go up to the view point and take an airel view of Singapore. The gardens by the Bay. The views are just breathtaking. You can plan a day and night visit to enjoy the lights at night too.

There is a sense of mystique about the Merlion however the truth is it was designed in 1964 by a member of the Singapore Souvenir Committee as the logo of the Singapore Tourism Board. So rather than being a historic representation of the City it’s a glorified souvenir. In saying that the 8.5m high statute, erected in 1972, is one of the most recognised statues in the world. It seems that everybody who visits Singapore ends up with a least one photo of the Merlion. Located at Merlion Park on Marina Bay, in front of the Fullerton Hotel, there is a pier extending alongside allowing you to take photos of it from all angles. There tends to be a crowd no matter what time during the day that you visit. If you take a bumboat tour you can even take photos of it from the water. There is also a smaller 2m high statue standing behind the main statue, commonly referred to as the “Merlion cub”.

The picture of Singapore’s Merlion is iconic and you’ll see photos of it everywhere. There is another Merlion on Sentosa Island but the original one stands by the edge of Marina Bay and is easily accessible from all three sides, with the statue itself facing out over the water. There is no charge to view it and you can spend as long as you like, mingling with all the other tourists, getting your photo shots. We sat on the steps by the water just by the side of the Merlion and drank in the views across the bay towards the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The statue is a must see of course but there are plenty more sights to see in Singapore which are more creative and inspiring. As a starting point to a walk around the Bay however it’s certainly worth seeing.

review_title: Free and open twenty four hours
review_content: It is walking distant from the mrt , Fullerton hotel and garden by the bay. We take our time to get photos and find perfect angles to see the merlion. There is no fees and open twenty four hours. No worries about the time limits and the lines. Go there anytime you want, you can stay there all day with your snacks and loads of battery charged to take pictures. That the feeling of having free entrance and open twenty four hours. Be mindful for others while taking pictures.
Ideal Park to walk around after an exhausting day at Singapore. Be prepare with the right garment, as showers or high temperature are very often.

This is well known and photographed image of Singapore is on Sentosa Island. You can go inside the Merlion and gets views from the top and also from its mouth. There is a small gift shop and cafe in the base.
Merlin park is literally just the big Merlion and baby merlion together. If that's what you want to see than its fine but it does give you a good view of Marian bay and the surroundings.
My cousin brought me, my sister, and my niece there after dinner. The place is packed and the view was really nice. Wonderful breeze to go with the wonderful view.
Iconic of Singapore! Before i think its not too big, but after put off my legs at the location, i think that i'm so wrong, its big enough.
Worth stopping by for an iconic phot but it is just a statue. More interesting views in the surrounding area.
So crowded here, so much people want to take unique n funny picture.. And we can relax in this place just sit down and feel the wind.. so nicee and recommended place..

After dinner we went to experience the Merlion; the light show was unique and displayed the speciality of this stature. The surroundings were well lit up and the cleanliness is par excellence. Extremely serene place to have a good date.

review_title: A bit too crowded, but a must see
review_content: This is one of the must see in Singapore of course, but it can be a bit too crowded. You only need to spend about 30 minutes here. The Merlion is the iconic mascot of Singapore.
Good to walk around and enjoy the lovely Vistas of Singapore. From there head up past the Restaurants on the left bank of the River. You can also take a Ferry ride at Fullerton Hotel.

We came there on sunny day - it was crowed and only see Lion status. Not much to see around but came back at night, it was great when they showed light art festive there - lion turned on different colours and you can see light art of opposite building. Highly recommend to come there at night
It’s not much to see really, the statue is pretty small but still something you have to see when in Singapore. Lots of tourists so come early! Nice area though!

review_title: Glad we went but very crowded
review_content: Went as part of a city tour. Its iconic... so had to been seen. Ok for a quick photo .... but there are other things in Singapore that were more interesting for me.  There is another Merlion on Sentosa island too... you can climb up that one and ring a bell for good luck.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and represents the founding of Singapore. Legend has it that a prince landed on the island and saw a lion (which he had never seen before) so he decided to name the island Singapura, which in Sanskrit means Lion City. The fish tail is a nod to the fishing villages that used to call the island home. This is a large area that overlooks Marina Bay. Lots of tourists - including us! If you're in Singapore, how can you not go see the Merlion?

The Merlion statue is the reason to hit this spot...along with a plethora of tourists! Avoid Sundays unless you really like to jostle to get a decent view/ photo. Good spot to watch the nightly laser show at Marina Bay.
Nearest MRT station is Fullerton road. Great view of Marina Bay Sands. Recommend to visit during sunset to get great visuals.

review_title: Its Singapore's symbol so got to visit
review_content: Its the Merlion. Different from Sentosa as it emits water from its mouth. Also its Singapore symbol so you have got to see it. There are two - One the big one emitting water directly into Marina bay and a small one made inside a small area nearby the big Merlion. There are good eateries nearby and you can see the famous Marina bay sands from here. Gardens by the bay are also nearby so combine with that trip.
Be sure to be here to get a photo of the Merlion in front of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Especially when the water show is running. Only negative is that the restaurants here is very pricy.

What a story: lion or tiger, or big cat...  the merlion and its legend is nice to see and taking a 5mn walk from Raffles city through the underpass is rather convenient : no excuse for not doing it ;)  What YOU want to check is the light and laser show every day at 8pm that goes on in MBS: watching it from Merlion side is really nice  Enjoy!

The Park is breath taking. I have the opportunity to see the place on New Years Eve and the fireworks are spectacular. It is a park within the heart of the city. Safe to walk around and it's just perfect place to relax.

review_title: The Merlion is the Iconic symbol of Singapore.
review_content: The park is a great location to visit and take some beautiful and fun pictures of Singapore. Make sure you go out on the overwater walk way, to take some excellent photos of the Merlion, with the Fullerton Hotel in the background.

The Merlion of course is a symbol of Singapore. Don’t go out of your way to get here but if you’re nearby it’s certainly worth taking a look at, especially if it’s not too crowded. Large statue spewing a lot of water every minute.

Singapore icon that you should visit when come to Singapore. I came here when there's Ilight festival, so it very crowded here. But the Merlion was soooo beautiful, coloured with laser light with many kind of theme. Beautiful at night, it looks like the merlion have fashion show.
Must visit place for tourist, an iconic for Singapore. Very crowded when holiday season but worth to visit.

review_title: A place not to be missed from your itinerary.
review_content: Visiting this place both in the day and in the night gives you a sense of accomplishment.  In the day you can walk along the waterfront and snap some nice souvenir pictures of the Singapore Icon, The White Merlion overflowing water splashing into the sea. Along the waterfront are food joints and drinks cafes. There are quite a nice selection of food and drinks including Seafood.  In the night, you will see a variety of beautiful colourful Merlion depicting various Singapore Places Of interest in the form of light rays shining on the Beautiful Merlion. It is definitely cooler walking along the waterfront and enjoying the night scenes around it, including getting ready your camera for some nice shots of the surrounding sceneries from the Waterfront. Hope you have A great time there.  Ad.

The park which is actually very small if not including the bay ;-) is home to symbol of Singapore, close to some other attractions and river cruise locations, overlooking the sand bay marina is a nice place to visit. You can plan a longer time as there are some other attractions around.

Great views from the Merlion of the surrounding area of Marina Bay, impressive statue. Busy first up as lots of tourist buses stop and visit and you are fighting to get your photo. Later in the evening, not so busy

review_title: A lovely walk around the marina and river
review_content: We walked along the river from Clarke Quay which was very pleasant. The Merlion Park area itself was very well maintained and a pleasure to visit. I highly recommend a walk around this area.
The statue with the lion head and body of fish is the icon of Singapore. But it is not too large. You can see impressive view of Sentosa from two levels.
Visited in the evening. Very colorful lighting. One place you should definitely visit with friends and family. It is very safe during night time as well.
Great place to stretch you legs following a long flight. Plenty of places to eat catch a coffee albeit food can be expensive
Centrally located. Great stop for photos and its always busy with tourists. Cafes around for food and drink. Boat rides available nearby too. Its a lovely fountain and close to the CBD.

review_title: Every one love to visit Merlion during Singapore trip
review_content: Who doesn’t want to visit Merlion in Singapore trip..that too in the night it’s superb with lightning. Been there for 2 hrs in the night during my SG trip. Nice lighting show on the Merlion. Over the riverside nice location to spend in the evening with lots of restaurants, boat riding and palaces to sit.. overall very good time pass

This is one of those icon places that sometime during your holiday you will see either from the river or from the distance even if you do not make a special trip to the location of the Merlion. Although not a knock your socks off experience and not quite the same as standing in awe at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington DC the Merlion is still worth taking a look at.
The area around the Merlion Park comes to life a at night with the many bars and restaurants. Seeing the Merlion illuminated is quite spectacular. Also worth seeing from the river by boat trip.

For years the Merlion has become the symbol of Singapore. The structure itself is pretty impressive and makes for a great photo spot. Great views of the water and several food and bar options in the area. Expect to pay a fairly high price for those things though based on the location.

I wasn’t WOWed by Merlion Park but I am glad I saw it. It was very overcrowded with little regard for the masses of people trying to take photos and get a good view. However, the view is quite lovely. The restaurants nearby look great, but Clarke Quay has much more variety and a better atmosphere if you’re looking for a place to eat near the water. Only need 10 minutes at this place!

Merlion Park fronts the Marina Bay. It is in the downtown area of Singapore. The iconic Merlion statue stands 8.6 metres high and weighs 70 tonnes. It has a lion’s head and a fish’s body. The Merlion is the national personification of Singapore. Its name combines "mer", meaning the sea, and "lion". The fish body represents Singapore's origin as a fishing village when it was called Temasek, which means "sea town" in Javanese. The lion head represents Singapore's original name—Singapura—meaning "lion city" or "kota singa". With plush hotels, theatres and facilities of boating and walking by the bayside Merlion Park is a major tourist attraction. The light show in the evening is very impressive.

review_title: Visit the icon for a photo
review_content: Not really much here but on the rim of Marina Bay so worth a visit for the obligatory iconic holiday pic. Easy to get to and quite busy with tourists. Plenty of room though to move around. There are restaurants and cafes in the vicinity

Santosa island has lot of things to do.  You can do the Merlion walk from universal place downwards or climb it up. we choose the upwords trail and enjoied it most. we took lots of pictures which means you gave a lot to see. Musaic sculptures, curved mirrors, metal plants and ofcourse Merlion. Dont miss it.

review_title: Good place but timings should not be Noon
review_content: As per our itienary we visited this place during afternoon, the time when sun was at its peak and therefore it was diffcult to stay there for a long. However the place is quite good offering a lot of spots for photography, and enjoying.
I'm so happy cause it's a nice place for traveller. Every travellers first come to Singapore and see that's . And travellers satisfy about his travel. I hope. I'm so happy.

The merlion is Singapore’s icon and visit to park is almost a certainty for all tourists. Park is often crowded but there’s also a quieter spot near the bridge away from the merlion. There’s a small mall next to it.
Take a walk from the MRT station & you'll find the Merlion park. It is so beautiful late in the evening. Don't miss the light show!

There are lots of things to do when visiting Singapore . From visiting Universal Studios and Sentosa , shopping to your hearts content , a food trip of different cultures, to accessing multiple attractions. A visit to Merlion Park is highly recommended since it represents the country’s icon . An added bonus is having photo ops to surrounding important sites, such as Marina Bay Sands, the Fullerton , Singapore Flyer , Esplanade and the Art Science Museum. With the Merlion you can do several poses , but be ready to navigate throngs of people/ tourists. Better yet , come early to have the many different photo experimentation all to yourself .
The statue is small. The space is crowded. Make a stop here if walking through marina or Raffles. Don’t go out of your way for this.

It is nearly 9 foot tall structure with head of lion and body of fish. Located in Bay Area, close to Fullerton hotel. Provides good view of Marina Bay, Financial district and Singapore Flyer. Nice place to click pictures. Can get bit crowded but a fun place overall!
Try taking weird photos with the Merlion. If you do not want to have too many ppl in your photos. Go in the early morning

The statue is part of the Bay area. We walked through the underpass from the Fullerton Hotel, to the waterside. Just a few minutes along, past a collection of restaurants with outside areas, you come to the statue. It's fun to go there and have your picture taken, especially on a sunny day!

review_title: Mesmerizing Place & Breathtaking Views of Marina Bay
review_content: Must place for all tourist where the Merlion status is situated and get a wonderful view of Marina Sands Bay, Singapore Flyer, Singapore Financial District.  We were lucky to get rains which change the climate awesome.  It depends on tourist whether to take boat ride of marina bay, worth giving a miss as you can enjoy neat the shore with all pics and views.

We sat here after completing the 3,5 km walk around Marina Bay it was a nice place to watch the light show at 8,15pm and to see all the Illumi lights across the bay. The merlion is awesome, free to look at and a nice way to end the walk of the bay
Lovely area to view the Merlion and to enjoy people watching. Merlion is beautiful and so fun. You can see it on two sizes and take great photos.
we took the metro to Raffles Place MRT stop and walked to Merlion Park. From the Merlion Park you get a great view of the Marina Bay Sands across the river.
As expected, too many people around the famous lion, and it was Sunday when we visit, but it amazed me how people are so polite, waiting for each and everyone’s turn.

I arrived early in Singapore around 8 am with nothing to do until my hotel check in time. I decided to spend my time strolling around the Merlion Park. The park is very nice and beautiful but very crowded with tourist. I prefer to enjoy the view from the Esplanade Park. Its not very crowded and you can still view the Merlion statue.
Walking in this town is a great experience. The park is very beautiful and the statue is "strange". It's iconic, for sure but not special in any way. The place was quite crowded.
Really enjoyed walking around and viewing beautifully decorated landscape. Merlion statue (there are 2, one small and one very big) are gorgeous.
Simple park type atmosphere with a lion statue/fountain. Was told that it's a famous landmark so I guess it's worth a stopover if you're nearby anyways...couple of eatery options nearby.
I never knew there is a small merlion behind the big merlion until the O-Ride Segway tour guide told me. The small merlion is cuter, hahahahaha.

A bit of a ride to get here, but I don't regret coming here. Everything was nice except the humid weather. The place was already very crowded and add in the weather, I got a bit cranky in the end. I liked seeing the merlion though. So big!

This place really crowded, a lot of tourist taking photos here. The statue itself is not impressive in my opinion just small statue near marina area. You can visit this place, helix bridge and garden by the bay just by walking.

Great place to get a photo with the Marina Bay Sands in the background and is apparently a great spot for sunrise, we missed out due to the weather being pretty crappy unfortunately. Gets very busy though so try and get in early to beat the mass crowds.

I went here on last month holiday with friends and family. a must go place when in Singapore. The place is always busy with people. not the first time to Singapore but still the special place always need to go.

They said if you don’t yet visit Merlion mean that you never been in Singapore. This park is good for taking picture, you can take pictures with the merlion, the marina bay, Singapore flyer, and ArtScience museum. It’s quite hard actually to find this park, i’ve lost my way before find this. The nearest MRT station is Raffles Place, and then you need to walk pass the Fullerton Hotel.

Got here at 8.30am and it was already VERY crowded as everybody wants to take photo at that particular spot where you can see the Merlion and MBS. Suggest to go way earlier before tourist flocks into the area!!  Other than photo worthy it’s really nothing spectacular at all. Nice view, nevertheless.

review_title: Beautiful views of the icons that is Singapore
review_content: Chicago has the Bean, Seattle the Needle, SF the Golden Gates, and Singapore the Merlion. What I love about Merlion Park is the visitors it draws, showcasing the diversity that is Singapore and those who visit. It is a great place to take in the dramatic skyline of the Marina Bay, Art and Science Museum, Helix Bridge and of course the symbol of this beautiful city. Yes it can be crowded, sure it's "touristy" as those in the first line of this review....but there's something about this park and what it symbolizes here. One visit is enough, but the memories will last for a lifetime.
Singapore famous statue. Lots of tourists and local people gather around here. You can also view from merlion the marina bay sands and the dome across. Great for photos and taking videos as well.
Here is the symbol of Singapore - Rio-Lion and has a nice view of Marina Bay.  From here you can take great pictures and board the Singapore River cruise.
As a symbol of Singapore, a must visit place. Beautiful and majestic. Just walked around on the bay to sky tower. Totally scenic on a evening

We went first thing in the morning and it was already busy and very hot. Took some amazing pictures and had an ice cream in the shade under the bridge. The kids had fun trying to get their ice creams using a claw from a vending machine.
Definitely worth seeing to gain an in sight into their culture as this the lion is the symbol of Singapore
An iconic statue which represents the place. Very busy with tourists all wanting the shot of the Marina Bay.
A lot of tourists but nice to walk around and enjoy the beautiful park. Visit after the sunset for a great view towards the city.

review_title: Can't see what the fuss is about
review_content: I read this is a great top tourist spot. Well, it's on the waterfront, have to walk past if travelling from MBS to city by foot or train It is a fountain from lion mouth Is lit at night On its own  I viewed night & day  Only my viewpoint, but I just found this uneventful

If you go to singapore and dont click a picture infront of merlion then your trip is incomplete i guess. It is located just opposite to the fullerton hotel. You can take a cab and reach there. You can chill in starbucks too.
The symbol of Singapore, the icon. Well, visiting Singapore and not see it is a big miss. Always crowded place with tourists seeking for taking pics and selfies

Spent probably 10 minutes. It’s your typical tourist trap with a significant amount of tourists that it takes significant patience to get a decent picture.   Would recommend when the sun is at its highest if you can bare the heat for less people.
A must recommended place for all travelers to Singapore. Location and the scenic beauty of the Park is awesome.

So, for those needing information, a merlion is a head of a lion and the tail of a mermaid. This merlion is perched facing the Convention Centre on the opposite side of the bay. It is a nice destination point to visit when walking around the bay. However, after seeing it, there is not much to do there but continue the walk.

Merlion is so well know in Singapore but not worthwhile taking time to go. Of course the view of Marina Bay and Marina Bay Sands hotel is outstanding so it may be worthwhile to go there just to take your photo with that view.  You can walk from Raffles Plaza MRT station but the signs are insufficient and you have to ask several times to get there.  In the same area, there are National Gallery Singapore and Raffles Hotel etc so may be you want to visit that area anyways.
Singapore nation icon, awesome view of Singapore landscrapers from this place. Several things to see nearby.

Excellent place to spend some 1 hour . The main attraction of the visitors is to be photographed by the side of the Lion, the symbol of Singapore Government.  The place was being renovated for a Festival. The place was crowded and people had to wait for their turn to take selfies and photos.

This is my second time in Singapore and this time with my husband. I took him to Merlion Park. I think Merlion Park is best to visit at least one time during daytime and one time at night. Take a goofy picture like you are drinking the water during daytime. In the evening wait for the show across from the Marina and you will get a SPECTACULAR view. While at the park, go visit the popsicle/ice cream shop. It is kind of expensive but I tell you it’s worth it specially on a hot day. Well, Singapore is always hot.
it’s actually worth walking around this park most especially at night . lights of multiple buildings are very fascinating with show and fireworks i think every weekend

This Merlion sits guarding the entrance to Singapore Harbourfront on Sentosa Island.   We saw it from the cable car at dusk and it looked so majestic all lit up and huge. It is the oldest and biggest Merlion – which is half lion, half fish, in Singapore. The lights are programmed to change colour every few seconds so it is great to get up close and personal. I believe you can also climb it although we did not have time, but it was great to say we had been there. The other Merlion spouts water and is set at Marina Bay - a perfect picture opportunity.

review_title: a must do at least once !
review_content: Visiting the Merlion and seeing it spout water is a must do iconic activity when visiting Singapore. The experience is tantamount to visiting the Golden Gate Bridge in San Francisco, or the Great Wall new Beijing. The only problem with visiting the Merlion is that after 15 minutes of taking photos there's really not much else to do. Therefore, this activity alone wouldn't be worth it if is wasn't so close to Clark Quay or the iconic Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The Merlion is perfect brief activity while strolling on to other parts of the area. And for this reason alone, it shouldn't be missed. I would not recommend visiting here if it was 'out of the way' which it is not.

The merlion is the symbol of Singapore, so come here and take a picture of the giant Merlion statue overlooking the bay. Obviously very popular with tourists. They have built a small pier into the bay so you can take better photos of the statue with the skyline in the background, so that was nice of them. Worthwhile of a 10-minute stop in your exploration of the city.
People every where but you get very good views on the statue and the marina sands. Good picture opportunity as you can stand out on little jetty
