review_title: First  stop for visiting Sentosa Island
review_content: We went during Chinese New Year celebration and the place was well decorated with Snoopy,beautiful flower all over,lot of fun activities and being weekend and holiday time,the place had lot of visitors!Its a landmark and water coming out from lions mouth is actually symbol of abundance. It represents Singapore..so a must on list.
A very small statue but it is interesting to see. Come here night and day to enjoy the scenic views of Marina Bay Sands!

review_title: Worth a look as part of visiting the area of Marine bay
review_content: Full of people with selfie sticks and lots of people taking photos of other people making "V" signs. Its part of the bay so things change here over time - displays and exhibitions.
A spectacular fountain in the heart of the harbour area, the statue is well worth seeing and a nice area to walk round.

Merlion Park is nice and represent an iconic part of Singapore, though in reality, this is not the original Merlion Park, as it was relocated when the adjacent road was buit, cutting it off from it's prominent position.  The problem is that people have a habit of stopping walking suddenly or hanging around and blocking the path to take photographs. In reality it has become a place to take photos rather than something to look at and admire.
Love the view! Singapore has a very beautiful statue as their trademark. I could also take some photos with Marina Bay Sands as the background. Stunning :)

review_title: A place you shouldn't missed in Singapore
review_content: This place is absolutely amazing there are so many different things to see both day time and night time. You have go at the day time you can take a clear picture of Merlion which is represented Singapore and during night time they also have shows starts from 7:30pm a show which you shouldn't missed.

review_title: Very quick trip up the Merlion!
review_content: To go up the merlion is pretty pricy for a quick ten mins trip! We got it for free after winning a ticket but wouldn’t pay the price for it otherwise. Nice to see the view but not that amazing.

review_title: Have to see the Merlion when visiting Singapore
review_content: This is the unofficial mascot of Singapore, and was used in their Marketing until 1997. This large statue spouts water out of its mouth and is part lion and part Mermaid. The area itself is a nice waterfront location to walk around, and there are plenty of outdoor things to do nearby.

Great ice cream shops there, beautiful statue facing the Singapore River, plus there is a small replica behind it called the Baby Merlin. Conveniently located within walking distance from the Fullerton Hotel.

The Merlion was created for making image of the Country and stands tall on the Singapore water front welcoming people travelling by waterways. It is the biggest attraction of visitors to the Town. There are c=facilities of all kind, eating relaxing, cruise etc. There is a large one air theater very close to it. From the park one can go to the Marina Bay sands side through the Helix Bridge or even one can walk to the Singapore Flyer.
I'm looking forward to this place because of course as a tourist this is one of the place trademark so we were so disappointed that during our trip its under maintenance/renovation.
We arrived to find Merlion all covered up for renovations, bummer. The park is nice and we took a boat ride down the river and listened to all the history. Boats were very comfortable as well.

The Merlion statue in this park is the best placed statue in Singapore since the backdrop would be the best scene to capture the heart of Singapore.  The park is created purely for taking great pictures.

review_title: I loved seeing the famous  Merlion!
review_content: It was so fun seeing this iconic sculpture while in Singapore! And since I am an Artist/Sculptor by trade, it made it even more special for me. We recommend going!!!

If you are in Singapore, and have not been to this place, then you never been to Singapore! The most iconic place of all times! And best time to visit is late afternoon! There you have a lots of things to do! Can spend an hour with good food with a view! Or without spending much, hanging around, walking all over the place, but best not to miss a small cruise! By 8 pm there is a fountain and light show at marina bay, if you aren’t there you can enjoy a part of it from merlion park as well. And one must not miss it!
Busy little park with lots of people taking photos. Ice cream vendors nearby. Handy to Clarke Quay. The mosaic walk however is at the other Merlion at Sentosa Island.
Singapore's icon, a must see! Not much of a "park", more just a statue with walkways around it. A short visit is enough.
this is a icon from this country, yeaaaay singapore, beautyful country, but this place so many people visited, but if u take a picture no prob, u can, by the way many people take a picture so uniq
The Merlion - Mermaid and Lion - is a landmark of Singapore. It has come to symbolise Singapore. And, as such finds a pride of place in all things connected with Singapore.
If you are in Singapore you have to make the trip to see the Merlion. Good place to take pictures of the Impressive Marina Sands.
This is a beautiful monumental statue, don't take the river cruise instead walk along the river side full of beautiful sights all along ,
It is a place for you to take a photo. but nothing speical for me...the city is boring and not a big fans for me
Its nice to walk in the bridge going to merlion. We did this for a souvenir photo. We had fun taking pictures here.

'Singapore' or 'Singapura' as I understood is Malay word for Singa (Lion). Pura (city). So this Merlion has a special meaning for Singapore such as the 'The Little Mermaid statue' in Copenhagen, Denmark

So there is the huge fish...spitting water. A staple of Singapore! A must see plus check out the view from the steps, take a selfie and ask your friends (or a stranger) to take a picture with the optical illusion.

We walked our way to this place instead of taking a boat ride.. the structure was under maintenance and closed so we were unable to take any pics for memories.. this made the visit a little disappointment.. so before you go just inquire once..
Good and beautiful place for it very pretty too much plants. There its amazing place also I’m and my family real enjoy place
Singapore is so clean and the walk along the river has sights to see, restaurants and vendors and feels safe.

review_title: Wonderful photo opportunities with the Merlion
review_content: The symbol of Singapore, the Merlions found in the park, provide wonderful photo opportunities. The park is always crowded but you can get great pics of the Merlin and Manila bay.

Merlion is head of lion and body of mermaid. Mascot of Singapore, first used as a symbol by Singapore for tourism. A popular spot for tourists to visit, if you don't have a plan to visit sentosa then this is the only place you will get to see Merlion. From here you get the scenic view of Singapore river, marina bay all in one frame.

This is situated at a very picturesque spot by the quay. Nice place to spend the evening. This place has a great vibe in the evenings. Lovely lights and good place to get some really cool pictures . Some very good restaurants around here too .
It's a foundation on the promenade another photo opportunity. Nothing else really to say. Around this you get good pictures of marina bay and marina sands

The symbol of Singapore, nobody would ever miss visting the country's emblem,not only that you could see the Merlion but also in the background a glimpse of the marina bay and the opera can also be seen here. Sights here is a wonder to behold. But this is not the only merlion that you can see. You can also see the tallest merlion in sentosa
One of singapore's landmark best view in the morning! this place is a touristy area so i suggest you go in the evening to avoid the crowd in the morning.

It’s the icon of Singapore and must visit while you are there , the view was fantastic especially in the evening when all the light is on .. very busy with tourist and be ready with extra camera for selfie
Took a picture from a distance and that was ok with me. This was not a must see on my list but I got a picture !
We thought this was a bit over rated, not that you need to spend much time here. The food outlets around were plain & overpriced, Not much atmosphere in this area
The mythical symbol of Singapore, it’s a tourist attraction but quickly viewed. Best seen at night. Not much to say really, it's a statue.
Twice I see this Merlion Park in different month and different year but it is always close. Its just annoying. Why it is always under renovation?
This is my second time to visit merlion park. You should visit here in day time and night time. Oh,yes. If you can take the ferry it will be fantastic.
This was a spot we could have skipped. Although it is nice to see the Merlion, the park was really crowded, making it difficult to take pictures or enjoy the experience.
Come at evening time when there are light shows displayed on the merlion, very beautiful and great for photo taking
Nice peaceful place to spend hours idling around even post midnight Landscape photographers paradise

review_title: Everybody who visits Singapore must have a picture with this Merlion!
review_content: A long walk if you really want to enjoy walking before reaching this place but if you just want to have a picture, take a bus or taxi and you will be there in few minutes time.
This place is picturesque during the evening. It gets real hot and crowded during the weekends.   Its really for people who needs some Facebook photo updating.

The statue was under maintenance, sadly, when we went there early February. So we ended walking around the park, chasing pigeons and taking photos with the view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. There are places for you to sit as well as drink/snack, if you just want to relax.

Great views of the Merlion from a variety of angles for the photographer and of other city sights including the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. We had a bit of difficulty finding it as you must traverse a main highway using the tunnel which is accessible in the basement of the Fullerton Hotel.
The statue of Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. It's a pity that the statue was under renovation when we visited the park. However, you may enjoy the bay view and the famous Marina Bay Sands.
The walk from the mall round to look at the Merlion was lovely,the weather was just great and it was an opportunity for exercise,the whole place was just lovely,love the water,the walk. Just great

Statue was covered by scaffolding .   The park was nice though as I walked from Fullerton Bay to Marina Bay Sands, passing the Merlion Park and the crossing bridge.   A lot of people jogged and walked on the path, the others just sat on the stair to see Singapore river .
Good place to hang out and amazing view of Marina Bay Sands. But please be noted that the big Merlion statue is currently under maintenance.

This place has a great vibe in the evenings . The night we visited this place the weather was great which made our visit even better . Lovely lights and good place to get some really cool pictures . Some very good restaurants around here too .  Definitely a must visit when in Singapore.
Too bad I didn't have a chance to see the statue,it was due maitenence.The park itself is worth seeing and gives you good views.

It seems a must to see. Most people stand on their side with their   mouth opened to make out you are having a drink from the water spurting out of its mouth into yours. Nice area to walk round and you can sit down relax with a drink or a ice cream. The Merlion Lion is a nationl icon and looks over the bay as protectio6. On sentosa island you can limb up the top i believe. Sentosa island is a must to visit as well plenty to see and do.

A visit to Singapore must entail seeing the famous MerLions not far from Clarke Quay and facing the famous landmark Marina Bay Sands.  We’ve seen the MerLions on our very first visit to Singapore and the area has altered quite a bit with the development of the bay.  Half lion, half mermaid they are most unusual - it was very crowded with tourists sitting on steps and on the ground that it appears to be an area to congregate as a meeting point or to stop for a sit down and a packed lunch!  It’s spectacular and a must just for a photo if you can get near from the tourists.

Apparently there are 5 Merlion's we sadly only visited two of them the one on the bay and the one at Santosa. Entry to the Santosa Merlion was included in our Santosa multi pass but I think single entry was about $20. Loved sitting in our Mandarin Oriental Marina Bay room watching the Merlion change colours. The display went till about 11pm each night. Nice to stroll around the bay in the cool of the evening.

We came here at night and noon. Its better at night since they have the color lights switched on. When you are new to Singapore, this is a must visit.  BEWARE of a stand in the 2nd floor who has parrots to showcase and ask you to touch them for free but they tricked you to be photographed and force you to pay! When I asked how much, the chinese lady kept on avoiding me and put the pic on the bag while asking for $50 for 4 pics. I said I just need one, and it costs me $25 a piece. What a ripped off! Its nothing special and its expensive.

It a worth a little stop here while in Singapore as it is their symbol...the Merlion. It had been covered with scaffolding and netting when we arrived (repairs?) but now is unveiled, likely timed for their new year. Very pretty in the marina area.
It looks nice and tasteful, well worth walking over to se it - but best seen from one of the bumboats.
When i visited this place i expected this place to be iconic & beautiful but was disappointed seeing it beacuse the merlion statue was dilapidated.. It needs Renovation & to be repainted.

Our timing to visit this iconic symbol of Singapore was poor as it was under a scaffolding and being repaired. The views of marina bay and the light show were nice but it was disappointing to miss the merlion itself
Merlion is symbolic of Singapore. Great place for lot of photo opportunities and provide good views of Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer and Welcoming Hand of Singapore's Lotus
The scenery is good for taking photos, all the people there will make a pose where they drink the water straight from the lion

review_title: Pleasant Little Park by the Merlion Statue
review_content: We stopped here for lunch at one of many lovely outdoor restaurants. In the park is a working miniature replica of the Merlion with the actual statue just beyond.

review_title: Normal place to sit and relax
review_content: We went there in the afternoon. Since it was sunny and humid we couldn’t do much over there.   It has few cafes with chairs where you can sit. Can even take a boat ride to old city guided tour which lasts for 30 minutes.   Overall it is simple nothing extraordinary.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. We visited during Christmas time. It as crowded for sure but we took plenty of pictures. It has awesome views around with sea, marina bay sands and good restaurants around.  You can never go unvisited this place when you are in Singapore.

What has the head of a lion and the body of a fish? Answer: Merlion, the national icon of Singapore. Merlion can be seen spouting water from its location in a park that bears its name. This mythical statue’s body is said to symbolize Singapore’s beginnings as a fishing village and the head represents Singapore’s original name “lion city”. Originally, the statue was located at the mouth of the Singapore River but it was moved to its present location in 2002 to allow it to be viewed from the waterfront away from the bridge that was blocking the view. It was created in the 1990’s around the time Singapore was not longer a British colony. Merlion is a “must see”
Good place to hangout. Excellent view and photo opportunities. Nicely cleaned and maintained place. Must visit, good for walk.
I had seen it a few years back, this time it was covered for Repairs. Spent some time on the river front. It was to open in a few days time
Walking in the park which is landmark of SG was very Good enjoyed it  This is one must see landmark , walking along the side of the waterfront was also a great experience

review_title: I love the Merlion - but try to go early when it is quieter.
review_content: The Merlion has sat in several different locations, & the area around it now is nice if very touristy. Do go & see as part of a stroll along the Bayfront, but expect the coffees etc to be costly. The Merlion represents Singapore & as such pretty much every tourist goes there - so choose your time carefully.
The Merlion is one of the main attractions in SGP but it essentially is an average sized sculpture on the waterfront. Tourists flock around this place and click pictures with the Merlion.

A very nice location in the center of the city. One could take a 45 min boat ride in this place. Unfortunately we could not because of shortage of time. There are nice restaurants surrounding this place . A must see place in singapore.

This park is easily reached using the SMRT. Use Raffles Place or Marina stations. The park is very close to a harbour side walk round the Marina. There are lovely views and close to the Merlion statue itself there is a row of harbourside bars and restaurants with a wide choice of dining options. There is a modest premium on prices because of the attractive location. Also nearby are Raffles Hotel for that iconic Singapore sling, the Customs House and Fullerton’s Hotel. There are boat trips round the Marina. There are also some interesting statues nearby. See if you can find Sir Henry Raffles himself seated in discussion with two other figures or the bronze of small children tumbling into the water.
Can't understand why all the fuss. People going there like sheep. Expensive show off waterfront but nowhere to sit for breather. Not for me.
Yeah wouldve been heaps better had it not been covered in tarps and scaffolding haha..Merlion Cub is all good and locale is pretty nice in general.

review_title: Iconic....but only nice in the early morning or evening
review_content: It is one of the iconic items in Singapore that you have to see, but the problem is everybody knows that and it gets at times so crowed that it is really no fun. I can recommend early early morning, noon when it is hot or late evening.

From the Flower Dome, we came to see the Merlion. As usual, it has a lot of people around trying to have the perfect shot of the water coming from the mouth of the Merlion. Really fantastic and enjoyable.
Loved loved loved this day out lots to see and do easily accessible  Relaxed atmosphere plenty of refreshments available at regular interval
The place is full of touring coming to see Merlion. However to restaurants with beautifull see view is worth to try.
no visit is complete without visiting Merlion park. The view of marina bay is amazing. try to visit around dusk to view day and night effects around merlion.

My friend and I, we happened to walkthrough the park from the Beach station bcs they were too many people to board the train. It was quite a hike but since it was night time, no problem with the heat there
A place which is a compulsory visit when on a singapore tour. The symbol of singapore..a trip to singapore is incomplete without having a picture clicked infront of the merlion

review_title: Free park but Merlion under renovation again
review_content: Just went yesterday with friends visiting and it was all covered up for renovation. Best to check the website to see if it is open.   Regardless it is a free park and nice to talk around from there all the way passing esplanade and towards, marina bay, sands where you can take a train, bus or taxi back :)  Not recommended if it's raining as there is no shelter! Take an umbrella in case of RAIN!   SINGAPORE is "blessed" with showers that come and go quickly!
This park has located near the Marina Bay. There is a small Merlion figure in this small park. If you want to see bigger one you can find it in Sentosa.
True phenomenal landmark of Singapore. Very easy to be reached. Tidy and clean. Nice place for selfie and enjoying Strait of Singapore.
This was a great spot to see and be night and day. Watching the boats on the water. Just watching everything you could do. The lights open up the city at night. Beautiful ..
Great attraction to see in Sentosa. Enter the lion to watch a short video and then take a elevator up! The views are amazing

review_title: No water from the Merlion when I visited
review_content: Disappointed that the Merlion was under maintenance when I visited - no water sprouting out. They should have advertised this so as to avoid disappointment. Otherwise a good place to get beautiful background photos of MBS etc.

review_title: Can’t miss the symbol of Singapore
review_content: This whole area is interesting to walk around. Gets very busy on weekends so I would advise going on a weekday if possible.

The Merlion (half lion, half fish) is a mythical creature and the statue is one of the places to visit whilst in Singapore.  Ultra clean park looking out towards the Marina Bay Hotel. The park gets very busy with visitors and gets very hot - not many places to shelter - take an umbrella to 'hide' under.

review_title: not to be missed during ur trip
review_content: this merlion park is an iconic attraction in singapore. take MRT and stop at raffles place. the view is amazing with marina bay sands, singapore flyers, the esplanade and the artscience museum all in place. the crowd is huge, so you got to have some skills to take great photos. tourist spending their time here and even picnicking by the river. there are cafes, starbucks, 7 eleven to get some snacks or drinks. we had instant noodle! the park is well maintained and good for 1 or 2-hour stroll by the waterfront. tips: take panaroma shot to cover all attractions in one frame

This is the symbol of Singapore and so it's a must do activity when you visit this country. The beautiful and clean park was very crowded almost all the time. It's a great place to relax and to take a few pictures of the face of Singapore, its surrounding skylight, and the harbor.

We spent our last night here and what an amazing way to end this trip. Be there around 8.30pm so you have enough time to enjoy the amazing Merlion and surrounding buildings -in their glory. At 9pm make sure you are positioned to get a good view of Marina Bay as the awesome laser show will entrall you..

The park is definitely a must visit when you are in Singapore - as it features a great statue of a mythical creature called Merlion - half lion, half fish right at the bay. The view of the Marina Sands Bay hotel and all other surrounding tall buildings here are also excellent!

it is the famous statue in Singapore. Everyone comes to visit the Merlion. its nice a touristy thing and since its water around so its slightly cooler around it and it feels better because of the Singapore heat.

On our recent trip to Singapore we visited the park and appreciate it for its cleanliness and view. My teenage daughters loved the small waterfall and the stairs through which they were able to have a view of surroundings. The zigzag water fountain was also the star attraction.
Travelling to Singapore is incomplete without a visitng Merion Park The iconic Merlion and the view of Marina Bay sand is perfect.
The merlion is one of the most famous landmarks of Singapore. This is one of my favorite attractions in Singapore
Visited here in February 2017. My partner and I spent a couple of hours walking around. Great photo opportunities, everywhere spotlessly clean. An afternoon well spent.

Majestic Merlion with high rise buildings around which definitely make you fell awwwwwwwwwwwwww....... The place is crowded but still if u r lucky enough u can find a place to click a pic with this Merlion. Best time to visit is during the evenings after which u can relax and watch the laser light show which happens around 8.00pm in the Merlion park.   No entrance fees required.

You have the opportunity to see Singapore from Merlion Park - a different View of Singapore Skyline  Extremely festive and busy over the High Season  Restaurants and Amenities near by  Directions and Map Boards on route to Merlion Park well displayed  Took the Underground from the Marina Bay to Raffles Place - then Walked to Merlion Park  Atmosphere extremely good
It is just another spot you would do as a tourist.A place where you can stroll by the river and pick up a bite as well, or a coffee
Merlion is a great land mark however it is very busy and full of tourists. Unfortunately you are not able to get a photo with no one else in the back ground

review_title: Go to get a good view of MBS
review_content: Merlion Park is famous for Merlion who is the symbol of Singapore. The park was packed on the rainy day we were there, but that didn’t bother us. About a 20 minute walk from Marina Bay Sands or a quick taxi ride (less than 10 SGD) go for the pics. Theres a number of food joints in that area and it’s close to mall.

review_title: One of the most visted Attractions in Singapore
review_content: If you have the opportunity to go there in the early morning hours you will have less crowds of tourist group from China and other countries. Also, as it's one of Singapore's Major attractions it is almost busy anytime of the day. In the evening you might enjoy the colourful light show on Merlion and MBS.

review_title: Take the bum boat for a better view
review_content: Visited when there were not a lot of people around but hard to get a shot with out a person in the pic. a few days latter we did the Bum Boat from Clarke quay and they gave the better view and pics.

Merlion Park is one of those places which you either love or detest ! Although children seem to be entertained by the figures and statues at the corner of the bridge, many people find them somewhat ugly and even grotesque.

The Merlion represents the Spirit of Singapore. The diversity and strength of the people and the ocean at the tip of the Malaysian peninsula. This is the most important port separating the Orient and the Indian Ocean. A great photo opportunity and gathering place.

A visit to Singapore is incomplete without a visit to the Merlion .. A must place to be .. The Merlion is the icon of Singapore .. It is along the riverside ,, very crowded ... nice pics around to be taken .. faces the Marina Bay at some distance ..
You can ride boat from merlion park...  Free place to go and take photos...  Foto dari Merlion Park bisa dapat background Marina Bay Sands dan Esplanade.
Loved to see the Merlion #statue on the memories of Lion #The nearby Gardens by the bay Hotel and lake side view is really mesmerizing #Mutton visit when you in Singapore

As one of Singapore key landmark it is obvious that people from all over the world would come, see and take pictures. It's a public place and basically managing the visitors flow would be a challenge probably recommendation on best time of visit to spread out the visiting time
Nice place, many people, nice foto.near river, you can make foto with Singapore flyer, in front, also the hotel with like boat on top,the best fotos..

You can just read its story online and look at the photos. I regret walking there under the sun. A very small statue, looks like it is made of plastic. Very touristic area. You could better skip the park and go to the Marina Bay directly.
The Singapore Merlion is a "must see" attraction and a great favourite with the "selfie crowd" with great views close by.
Great place for a nice walk and photo op. There are souvenir shops and casual eating places around the area.
A trip to Singapore is incomplete without visiting the merlion park.great location to take pictures.try to visit both day and evening time.good place to sit relax and enjoy the view.
Cannot be missed if you are in Singapore so much to do and see you will need at least half a day to take it all in.

Loved everything about today   Cable car ride to Sentosa from Mount Faber to Sentosa .. fantastic riding high over the harbour was specular .,   First stop the Aquarium .. World standard .. not only for kids I loved the experience of getting close and personal to massive hammer heads sharks and a school of other fish ..  Universal Studio you must go early and avoid the weekend .. nothing to rave about ., but my son wanted to go .   Lovely to take a breather and have a snack and beer on the beach area of Sentosa at one of the bars ., a little pricey but it’s holidays after all .  A little difficult to catch a Uber on the way back as could not get wifi but the taxi ride back to the Hyatt was only 12 Sing Dollars

This Mermaid-Lion statue is Singapore's Icon. Nice view to take a photo in the morning and the evening. The grand statue with skyscraper building in the background was a great view. Nearest MRT to this place is MRT Raffles Place Station.

We were so lucky we got here just before the storm was about to strike. Some wonderful photos and depending where you stand, you can get some incredible shots like holding the water coming out of his mouth etc - a highlight to our stopover.
One best place to take pictures as part of your memories. You can see the happy faces of people while taking their shots.

review_title: Take some photos and remember for life,
review_content: Very crowed at any time you Go. People only come here for taking photos for memory nice view and good place to be .
It's beautiful place to visit! Specially evening is better to enjoy the city view with tall tall building. Specially evening time is my favorite I did with day light and nigh light!
it just a big statue, mermaid and lion are combined in a body. There's no special thing in this park. but, it's a beautiful park..
One of the main attractions for any visit to Singapore. Lots of tourists but worth a stroll with many restaurants nearby.
Awesome park. Merlion is right there and huge with water gushing from its mouth. Seems to attract alot of people was busy when I went at around 2 pm. Must see
What can i say? If u never been in singapore this is the place for you. U can take a cool picture in here or take a boat from here. Or u can take bus tour from suntec mall
Went here as part of a company function and it was a great resting spot. Great for people watching and taking a break. Some restaurants, but nothing special.
Took a taxi which dropped us off at a loop type taxi stand. Really busy but worth the view. Loads of restaurants and was easy to get a taxi to our next destination.

Lion is beautiful. It is a bit if a missuon to even try and get a picture if only the lion never mind the lion with you and your family. Hundreds trying the same thing. Parts where still barricaded off even 2 days after new years. Better to view lion from one of the boat rides. Much better for photos.
Great opportunity to take a photo. This is the main highlight of your trip to Singapore and it should not be missed. You can visit this place anytime of the day.
It is an icon statue. A lot of tourists but worth visiting. The area there is nice to walk around. A the promenade you can have a nice view of the Marine Sands Bay.

I visited this famous statue from the water while on a tour. It was extremely crowded and everyone was looking to get a photo with the Merlion, a symbol of Singapore. It was beautiful but touristy. Pics from the water looked better than others pics from the land.
This is my 3rd time to Singapore and i always take picture at there with different friend also Lot of tourist but its fun to go there You need to walk little bit far around 800m from MRT
This is a must see tourist attraction. There are good restaurants around and every tourist needs a picture of the Merlion.
You can not miss the place while walking around the bay as this is probably the place where you meet plenty of people no matter what time you go there.
Beautiful statue with smaller version immediately behind it. Great photo opportunities to catch the water pouring from the Merlion's mouth. Be prepared for crowds though!

This is the national icon of Singapore, located in the Merilon park in the Marina Bay. The status is Half-fish and half-lion statue. The fish part resembles Singapore's humble beginning as a fishing village and the lion head resembles the actual name of Singapore (as Singapura in Malay). The statue is facing east which is believed to bring prosperity.  The statue looks amazing at night when its glittered with light. The lights from the Singapore skyscrapers near by and marina Bay Sand hotel adds a different charm to it. You can spend hours here sitting on the park arena or on the banks of Singapore River enjoying the amazing view. The nearest metro station to Merilon Park is Raffles Place. You can take exit G and walk all the way to the park. The walk is bit long but offers some amazing views as well.

These statues (there is more than one) are quite the attraction as they draw a large crowd. There is the very visible large Merlion next to the waters edge. There is ample space from which to get good photos.

review_title: One tourist spot which should not be missed!
review_content: Conveniently located, this is one tourist spot which should not be missed. I could not resist myself getting captured against Merlion, the mythical creature with a lion’s head and the body of a fish that is widely used as a mascot and national personification of Singapore.

The Merlion statue is iconic to the city of Singapore and you can see its image on practically everything associated with this country  well this place is right on the Bay and the iconic statue has a fountain flowing out of the mouth of the Merlion  it is a very scenic spot, always full of tourists who are there to etch their photographs in history  this is a must visit place not for something spectacular but just The feel of having been to this beautiful city

Great photo opportunity. Moreover, a second smaller Merlion is just behind. Best pictures are taken from the walkway above the water, with the Merlion just in front and the Singapore skyline just behind. During the summer, you may refresh yourself from the fountain spray at the Merlion's base.

You have to have a picture with the Merlion in the background. It used to be a much bigger attraction a couple of years ago, but much more is now available to see. On Sentosa island, visible from far, the mascot is bound to catch your eye. It is lit up very well at night and the falling water is serene to just sit next to for a few minutes after a tiring day at Sentosa island.
amazing park with the huge structure of Merlin. glittering, scintillating and thrilling. what a colourful show in the evening. spectacular.

review_title: More than a sculpture! Don't miss the views
review_content: Tip: try to plan your trip to the Merlion Park with your visit to Marina Bay, they are within walking distance and can be enjoyed as a whole.  The Merlion Park is one than a sculpture of the Merlion which in itself is magnificent and iconic. Take the time to enjoy the surrounding views as well especially Marina Bay and Marina Bay Sands right across. These views are especially breath taking at night with the Merlion elegantly lighted up. Think about this, just a little over 4 decades ago, when the Merlion was erected, there was no Marina Bay as it exists today, no tall skyscrapers behind, where Marina Bay Sands now stand was just reclaimed land. The Merlion would be proud of the progress it sees over time which is now made available for all to enjoy.   If you can spend an afternoon to an evening at Marina Bay, start at the Helix Bridge and walk towards Marina Bay Sands, then keep walking all the way to the Merlion Park, it will be one of the most unforgettable and enjoyable strolls you will ever have. Plenty of photo opportunities.

As the Merlion is Singapore´s landmark it´s a must see when being in Singapore.  From the platform next to the sculpture you have a good view over the bay with Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Singapore Flyer on the other side.  As it get´s quite crowded there it´s sometimes not so easy to take good pictures.  The restaurants, cafés and bars are quite overprized there and typically tourism spots.

Located nearby Marina Bay Sands, this place is really worth visiting. This attraction is good for photography. The place is quite crowded with tourist and it is more advisable to visit this place in the evening as it is not so hot. There are also delicious restaurants located nearby the Merlion Park.

When you are going to Singapore , Taking a picture in the Merlion is a must. and of course this makes the place a tourist magnet where people strangely post in order to get a nice picture. The merlion is an invitation to the "Singapore Culture" but I suggest on going to Sentosa's merlion because you will really know the culture from their.
Best to get a taxi to this place and start a river tour. You can get very close to the Merlion while waiting for the boat. Boats come regularly and the 45 minute trip is really interesting.
Good place for taking photos of famous Singapore Buildings Always crowded Free of charge Light show of Marina Bay Sands in the night is amazing
It was my best tourist place in Singapore. I'd love to go next time whenever possible. It was an awesome tour.
This was a great place to visit lots of crowds so we didn’t stay for very long just the customary tourist photos and wandered along checking out the beautiful buildings in the area

review_title: Oldest point in Singapore - standing still strong
review_content: The Merlion is part of all tours of Singapore, you can see it while travelling or include it in the itinerary. Time required is 10 minutes and also you can take a cruise from nearby point.
Amazing touristic attraction a must see in Singapore. It's very vivid, and you can take picture with the symbol of Singapore (Merlion) and with the other significant buildings around.

Located by the waterfront, we walked here after taking in the sights from across the bay at Marina Bay Sands. Iconic Merlion fountain spouting water made for a great photo opportunity, though the park did get pretty busy as others had the same idea. Good thing there is a little Merlion fountain within the park nearby, for a smaller photo op. Good for a quick visit, easily accessible, though watch the midday crowds if you want a quieter visit.
this is the thing to do if you are first to singapore. take pictures with the icon of this country. merlion. as always this place is always crowded by tourist.

review_title: The symbol of Singapore and a must visit site
review_content: You cannot claim to have been to Singapore unless you have a photo of you taken in front of the Merlion. Just be aware, with so many tourists visiting this site, you are unlikely to get a photo of just you and the Merlion. Lovely views from the area and plenty of eateries.

This is the Merlion (mermaid - aquatic, fish type woman, merlion - aquatic lion). Singapore gets its name from the lion. If you are visiting Singapore, you must visit here.  There is no charge/fee for visiting this place. You can view the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer and all skyscrapers of Singapore from here. There are boats rides starting from here. Lots of free space and sitting space available. Restaurants are available for snacks or meals.
Merlion Park of Singapore is iconic city and Country of Singapore where many people gathered here mostly to taken pictures with the Merlion Statue as background.?
Sure, you’ve got a get a pic a Merlion Park because it just screams Singapore but get the pic and run. It’s a tourist trap with no shade, surrounded by massively overpriced restaurants.
Great views from the Merlion park of the city & if coming to Singapore a must see st least once. We got a Hippo jump on & off bus pass which most of the routes take you to this area.

Just infront of marina bay,singapore flyer and marina bay sands hotel and near to many good hotels,makes it intersting enough to be a must see place.also dont forget that its symbol of singapore.its full package!
Was really great to see . The views on the harbour are really lovely. Was very busy when we went . Hard to get pictures . Lovely walk along the bay .
I visited there but it was not worth seeing unfortunately. But maybe this is just a personal opinion. Everything in Singapore was very artificial so I did not enjoy the whole travel.

review_title: Beautiful how everyone loves this guy!
review_content: The Merlion is the iconic symbol of the harbor! You will love the camaraderie between all the many people watching him, and the water shooting out of his mouth!
Everything is very organize. This is my favorite city among South east asian countrys, Merlion park it symbolizes singapore. And a great view to look the city as well..

review_title: A fun place and a perfect place for some cool pictures
review_content: The sweeping views from the Merlion Park across the expansive Marina Bay area are unmissable. Marvel at the collection of architectural icons that dot the impressive skyline.
So its beautiful, its free! Check out night and day views both are awesome! Clicks your pics enjoy the site!!
Symbol of singapore... i never boring to come and took photo with the lion statue.. Such amazing place with singapore icon and its free !!!
Get ready to fight the selfie sticks and tourists to get a good shot. You will be lucky to get one without anybody else in the way.
You haven't visit singapore if you haven't been here before. But the view was beautiful and clean. Don't forget to bring umbrella or wear a hat.The place is opened and hot.
Singapore is what we all think of when we see the Merlion. Lovely creation near Fullerton n next to bay is a must visit place
Merlion Park is a typical selfie-point of Singapore. The location is quite nice which is across Marina Bay. There are many good restaurants and pub joints nearby.
nice lions show at night,. with lighting enjoy music going on here plus show so not a bad idea to go in the evening and enjoy.

My first visit to merlion statue, it was so hot and a lot of tourist, so you barely can take nice picture without tourist blocking the way but this place is the icon of singapore so its a must-visit place :)

review_title: One of the famous spots in Singapore!!
review_content: I would call it as a little more than Average place.. as the only thing you have is a Merlion statue on the bank of huge water body a view of Marina Bay sands. This place is very crowded and cant't be listed to spend some long time here. You may spend a little time clicking pictures and move on to some other place.
Calling it a park is stretching it. It's just a small tourist trap area to take pictures of the merlion by the water. There's a mini replica of it too next to it, not sure why

Located across the street from the hotel Fullerton this is where all the tourists get together for a picture. One merlion against hundreds of tourists. All the tour busses stop there. They build a dock so peoples can get almost in front of it. Small crowded place with everyone jockeying for space. Lots of restaurants around. One idea to skip the crowd take the river tour, the boat stop right in front of the merlion.
Pleasant little spot seeing this statue - extremely busy and popular with the selfie takers and other photographers. Only worth it in the sun, I'd say!

This is one of the mandatory spot to take picture in Singapore. You aren't in Singapore if there is none of the pic here, though nowadays this place is not so popular anymore. Merlion Park located at Esplanade Drive, near the Fullerton Hotel, other office buildings and Esplanade, you can also see Marina Bay Sands from here. Overall, this place is an iconic place to take selfie.

I have visited Singapore many times but this is the first trip I have gone to see the Merlion. It is a VERY popular attraction so be prepared for large bus fulls of people at various times during the day. If you have some time though, you can wait and have it less crowded. It is definitely worth seeing and I am glad I made the effort this time. I called in to see it while I was doing a self guided tour on one of the Neuron Electric Scooters you can see around Singapore. It’s one of the quintessential things to do in Singapore.
Great statue but best viewed from a bumboat on the river to get clear views away from tourists. An iconic symbol of Singapore.
great place for view of iconic Sands hotel. Must get pic in front of fish/lion. Good pot to rent a boat that goes along river. Near downtown.
Falls in love with the night view at this park. It a must visit place for everyone who visiting Singapore.
For all tourist, there is no fee to visit this place but its really beautiful in the night ..and there are nearby building you can see along with the park.
Best picture os across the water, from the stage. You c capture all the skycrappers together with the merlion
We went there with my family to take a few pictures. The place is very nice lots of restaurant to dine.
nice view, and nice place to stay at night. A top hotel behind ...Fullerton, very classic and good aspect.

Merlion Park should be visited at least once by every visitor to Singapore. The Merlion is the city's symbol and so should feature in all tourists' holiday photo albums.   Next to the Merlion is the fabulous Fullerton Hotel and nearby a very unsual statue of boys playing and in the action of jumping into the Singapore River.

This is a must visit place in Singapore. The Merlion holds great history in Singapore. Its a spacious park with many restaurants around for you to sit and enjoy the view. There is also a river cruise.
Obviously had to be visited but this landmark was much smaller than expected. A nice walk around the marina and across the jubilee bridge allowed us to see it from different angles.

review_title: A must visit attraction in Singapore
review_content: The Merlion Park is a must visit attraction in Singapore. Its a very well known place and attracts a lot of tourists.

review_title: Nice place, but consider as a must site
review_content: Nice place, most of the time is overcrowded with people who try to get picture. Recommended to come early in the morning when almost no body there. Walking distance to the Marina Bay, Esplanade, Suntec city mall and the CBD. Visit time is only a few minutes but quite an effort to get there

It was raining when I made that Day 1 Tour! Picture taking was not easy with the Flimsy Raincoat,provided by the Tour Guide. However it was quite enjoyable climbing the Highest Point! I would recommend this Tour To Other Tourist like myself and perhaps when I come back to Singapore as a Tourist again, I will Revisit it along with the Other places that I Missed out on, due to limited time!

review_title: One to check off the list, but probably not worth any great effort to see
review_content: We had tried to find the Merlion a couple of nights before we transferred to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, but we got a bit lost. However, it was whilst peering over the edge of the Infinity Pool of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel that we spotted it.  So we resolved to go see it prior to heading to the airport on our final day in Singapore.  Unfortunately, on that final day, it was CHUCKING it down with rain. It was a good few hours (spent wholly at The Shoppes shopping centre at Marina Bay Sands) before the rain died down enough for us to venture out.  We crossed the Helix Bridge (arguably an attraction in it's own right - if you're into bridges and architecture), which took us by various other sights such as The Float (world's largest floating stadium and stage), The Bay Grandstand, The Esplanade Outdoor Theatre, The Waterfront Promenade, and the Esplanade Bridge, before we reached the Merlion situated in Merlion Park.  Now, I've read reviews of how busy the place it, however, we went around lunchtime on a Tuesday, and it wasn't nearly as rammed as I've been led to believe that it could get. We easily took our pictures of and with the Merlion, and helped others take theirs without much bother.  Was it worth waiting out the rain to visit? I want to an emphatic "yes", but I can't. I can't say that its worth spending a great day of time or effort to get to, but that said, I am glad that we went, if only to tick something off our list.  The park itself is quite nice, and you can see some stunning views, but after visiting something like The Garden by the Bay, most other park type areas pale in comparison.
Old, but still popular among tourists and visitors. Take a Eat and Cycle Ride and make the Merlion your last stop. Very crowded with China tourists.
The most popular site in Singapore. The park is very clean and always busy. Photo opp for sure. Check the history of the Merlion which is the name of the statue. What Singapore is all about.

It's a great place o visit as photo's are nice to be taken. The night view from the park is awesome. Its a great place for people to walk around and have a peace of mind. Good parking service are available.

It’s my second time to visit this park.. and always always and always crowded.. try so hard to get the good picture without stranger join the photo Lots of people was taking picture, or just meet up with friends
Either day time or night time. Merlion Park is a must to visit. You can enjoy the stunning skyline of Singapore. There are shops and bars nearby as an additional value.
Well if you go to Singapore you must visit Merlion Park. Really nice view of all Singapore center. Nice to walkaround with family, friends or couples.

Merlion as name suggests is a artificially built structure of a lions head and fish body. It keeps throwing water from its mouth which joins back the river on whose bank the structure is being built. It's a favourite among the tourists. Best time is to go early in the morning when it's not very crowded and you can click infinite pictures as people do try different postures to capture it. In the evening it's well lit and nice to watch.

review_title: One of the attraction in Singapore
review_content: Good for photoshot, crowded place. A must visit destination. Symbol of Singapore, nice view on the banks of the river. Will have a good view of Marina Bay Sands

review_title: check it off your list, other than that...
review_content: nothing special. the merlion sits at the end of a promenade extendeing down from The Fullerton hotel. it wasn't that crowded when i was there (a thursday night in early december). my wife and i were able to slip in find a good spot and take a selfie. i think the best thing about this "park" is the views of the Marina Bay Sands hotel.

review_title: An iconic Singaporean feature worth a look
review_content: A popular place to have your photo taken with this mythical half fish, half lion creature. It stand overlooking the mouth of the Singapore river and has a viewing platform all around so snap shots can be taken from any angle. Lots of opportunity for the trick shots of the water cascading from the Merlion's mouth.

When the first time i see the Merlion statue, i talk to my friends "are you sure, this is the MERLION ?" because when i see people taking a picture of this merlion, it's really look like REALLY BIG, but when you see it, it's not that BIG, i mean it's big but not as big as i think. But still you can enjoy the cafe near merlion.
It was good once upon a time. But right now its very hot and very crowded. So may tourists flocking and clicking selfies. Avoid

The Merlion is nice to look at. After 5 minutes, you've seen it and will move on. It is on the other side of the water from Marina Bay Sands Hotel which gives you a perfect photo opportunity of the hotel.
You can visit the park to see the symbol of Singapore. Its a park where people come to sit and relax. Students come to study.
The statue is on the Singapore River and open park area. Plenty of photo opportunities here. Worthwhile seeing the Merlion.

What a fabulous dtructure and it stands out in the harbor, you can see it from a long way and to stand on a bump boat so close to see it in more detail was terrific the Merlion is a must see while in Singapore

Very busy tourist attraction, but quite beautiful at night. I believe that these are not the original statues (please correct me if I'm incorrect) but it's better to see them if you know the legend behind them.
Go there to see the Merlion which is the symbol of Singapore, just to take pictures, there is a nice view from there
Merlion park very pretty at night. You can get great selfies here. The coolest photos in Singapore come from Merlion park.

Merlion Park, whether if it’s day or night, is one of must see destination in SINGAPORE. it is no surprising that even when you wish to take a perfect photo or a selfie, it will be a challenge as this place is packed day & night. don’t forget to take an evening stroll as the sky fell into darkness along the promenade for a cool breeze.

The Merlion Statue is right on Marina Bay, across from the Marina Bay Sands hotel. It is a classic symbol of the city and also serves as a fountain shooting water into the bay. It is a major tourist attraction, and is usually quite busy. We visited and night and during the day, which gives a different feeling with the lighting. Definitely worth a visit, but be prepared for crowds. There is a larger Merlion statue on Sentosa Island which is also fun to visit. This is the one that most tourists go to see. The Sentosa version although bigger does not have the water feature coming out of the mouth.
Day and night nice to watch. Made a boot trip and passed by. Very inpressive how it's made. Go see..

review_title: A must go attraction in Singapore
review_content: We came to the Merlion Park in evening. You will be able to see all the lighting on the building around and across the harbour (the Sands) and the Singapore Flyer etc. It is the symbol of Singapore and a nice place to chill out after dinner.

The Merlion is bigger than I thought. It's highly accessible --- basically in the urban center so it can be part of the city tour.   I went at night, and the lighting made the Statue even more stylish. I used only my mobile phone for photo but that was good enough!

Other than Marina Bay the most famous attraction in Singapore is the Merlion Park .. It is the most sought after place in Singapore for tourists .. The famous lion with water flowing through its mouth .. It is a neat and well maintained .. lies next to the Singapore River and is at the walking distance from the Marina .. Must visit for sure .. Most of our souvenirs are the merlion

review_title: Amazing fountain and statue on the bay
review_content: To see the city Merlion, the symbol of Singapore- wow! It’s so majestic on the edge of the bay and a wonderful photo spot - near the bay and Singapore river. Must see day or night!
Of all the times I visited the Merlion, the sunset moment is the best. Set against the backdrop of the cityscape, it is such a relaxing sight!

Took the hop on hop bus to Santosa Island - loved it - even tho hubby and I decided to walk to the beach after going around the place and got lost and walked for at least an hour before we got to the beach lol

A must see when visiting Singapore, the Merlion is a key tourist attraction, known the world over. It is set next to the Singapore River, is kept squeaky clean and provides an excellent venue for memorable photography. There are nice restaurant located within its vicinity for a quick bite or coffee.
We enjoyed going up in the Merlin and looking out from it’s mouth. Great little film before you go in to explain what it represents

review_title: Simple and fun to take artistic photos
review_content: This place is just for taking photos. People creativity are at their highest here to take interesting snaps with the merlion. I would also recommend, that if you have not done the ferry in Singapore, this is a good place to take a ferry ride also and use the ferry to drop you to the other stop, so to use your time in the best manner. We used it to go to gardens by the bay, which was on the other side of the river for 6 SGD .

Because this is one of the singapore tourist destination so everyone thinking that they need to come here to completed their visit in Singapore because it is Singapore landmark. Maybe better you visit after dark because in the afternoon or morning it is very hot because it is an opening area. It is not a good decision to come here in the rainy season.

One has to at least walk past the Merlion once on their visit to Singapore. After all, Singa Pura means Lion City, and the Merlion has guarded this city since before all that fancy architecture just across the water came into being.   Whether you're staying up the Singapore River, or over in the Marina Bay area, the Merlion is an easy spot to pass by on a walk. It's located very close to many of the Old Singapore buildings too.   A very pleasant spot to stop. Eateries abound there, ferries stop there. Easy to pass by, easy to get to.

This is an iconic and historical place for Singapore. It is one of the most photographed places in Singapore and it has lots of nice coffee shops and restaurants around this area. If you have not taken any picture from Merlion Park, that means you have not visited Singapore. This attraction is also very near to many other attractions such as the Esplanade theater, MBS and also the Singapore flyer.

November is really wet and rain season so it would bea good idea to tuck in an umbrella or raincoat. Still this iconic Singaporean symbol is the place to go, with which includes a spectacular 360 view of Marina bay. The attractions around are pretty much interconnected and mostly free.

We are glad we came to visit this is part of our evening stoll across marina bay at night when all the buildings are surrounding areas are lit up.  I think during the day would not be as impressive. Would definitely visit the statue as part of the wider visit to the marina.

When you see Merlion,you can tell that it's Singapore,because it's a well-known marketing icon. It's near other known attractions,and can be accessed easily by walk and SMRT. There are lots of restaurants and coffee shops in the park,and most people come to enjoy them in the evening. The pictures you will see in common of people taking photos of Merlion,is opening mouths receiving spouting water from it. You can see the attractions nearby such as Singapore Flyer, Esplanade theater and Marina bay sand.

I visited this place in september 2017.It should be visited both during day time and in night for fantastic lighting view of highrises in marina bay area.One can have a fantastic view of marina bay area from this place.You can also take a boat ride from this place .
It s my 4th visit in Singapore and I never miss visiting Merlion Statue. The place was still crowded though it was 10pm

review_title: There is one best way to see the Merlion
review_content: I know this is a must see one time for travelers but be prepared. It’s crowded with tour groups and everyone is trying to get a Picture. Doesn’t live up to the hype this way. Later I took a water cruise and this is how everyone (but not too crowded) should see the Merlion. From the front front side and lit up it is beautiful and deserving of it symbolizing Singapore.

The emblem of Singapore-The Merlion stands out. A must Visit and a selfie is a must do with it in the background. A view of the Maria bay sands in front and teh city sky line behind makes it a favorite with photography enthusiasts. Take a walk around the park and teh old river bridges.

review_title: See two of seven official Merlion statutes
review_content: Always crowded and busy, the Merlion is the official mascot of Singapore based on an old tale. There is a Merlion cub statue located in the park behind the real statue.
A selfi with Merlion is a must for Singapore. Nice place fully surrounded by tourists. A good view is offered from Frolino hotel.

Obviously it was packed!!! It is Singapore! We walked to merlion from MBS to take some quick selfies, but didn't go into the park area as it was about to storm. It is definitely one of those things you MUST visit on your first trip to Singapore, but probably your one and only time. If walking from MBS way, make sure to grab a coconut ice cream from the little kiosk on your way

The Merlion is a great attraction in Singapore. I am a photographer and this is the perfect spot to photograph the Merlion together with the Marina Bay Sands and the city. The Merlion is best visited during the night as the surrounding lights provide a great atmosphere.

The Merlion is a symbol of Singapore like the Opera House to Sydney. Every tourist must visit for a good photoshoot. It is fronting the iconic submarine above the cloud(Marina Bay Sands) On a nice not too hot day, one can spend hours just chatting or have a drink or meal at the various Cafes, Restaurants and Bars looking at the beautiful sight of Spore's concrete jungle.
The landmark structure of singapore is a good photo opportunity. Located in the center of singapore, you can visit this place once.

Overcrowded with tons of Chinese tourists with their selfie hands in your faces. Waste of time waste of stone waste of space ugly to look at. It's a weird creature puking some dirty water in a brown Bay. Disappointed... DO NOT GO.
This was simply awsome at night lights amazing must see We spent ages there just Singapore we could go back another hol so much see do

review_title: Just a concrete lion fountain spewing water into the bay
review_content: Biggest downside is that it is not very easy to access by public transportation. Significant walking after your get off the bus or MRT, and then back to the transit stop. I suppose it was interesting but not really worth the detour if your are visiting Raffles (which is now mostly closed for renovations). .
Totally worthwhile trekking to find this iconic Singapore landmark.  Difficult to find at first, but once you do, it's amazing!  Take the right exit out of the MRT and you'll be right
Although it is a very traditional attraction in Singapore but you will never miss this signature of Singapore.
Very nice are, especially in the evening. Enjoy a nice walk along the river and enjoy the view and lights of surrounding skyline.
You cannot visit Singapore and not visit the Merlin. The bay offers some great photographic opportunities.

Merlion is having a head of lion and body of fish..there are two statues..one is the bigger one and other one is smaller cub near the bigger one. It's located near the bridge and it's inside a park as it's name.. beautiful to see it once and tourist take time to visit this place.
Iconic Merlion is a must visit to have harbour view and also beautiful sky line of Singapore view. It has nerby good class restaurants and place for excellent photoshoot. Must Visit.

Singapore is very famous for its merlion statue, if a vacation to singapore must capture the image in front of the Marlion statue. Marlion park can be reached by using MRT, MRT which is close to merlion park is MRT Raffles

A visit to the Merlion is essential to the fabric of any visit to Singapore.  Located in a beautiful little park area, surrounded by restaurants, bars, coffee shops, etc., the Merlion comes to life as people stop to snap a few photos of the city's landmark.  Gotta be there....

There isn't much special about this place. Its just a fountain in the shape of a half lion half fish. A rather crowded place with tourists taking selfies and blocking the view. If you visit early in the morning it may be a bit less crowded. Entry to the park is free.

If you want to see the statue and get a great photo. Do it on the bum boat ride from Clarke Quay. You'll get a great shot and get to laugh at the people trying to get a selfie, which is equally accomplished off the boat. If you want to get photos with a Merlin, go to the one at Sentosa as it's a better view and attraction all up.

Well, yes it is a nice statue but the park is extremely crowded and you can not have a photograph with the statue without an Asian tourist. Let's accept it they are very rude when they travel with groups.
You have to visit this place if you're in Singapore. Very iconic. It is certainly a picturesque location. Try visiting in the morning. As there is less crowd and the weather is also good.
Very touristy spot. Nice to walk around and iconic photo op. Lots of restaurants and nice outlook over Marina Bay.

review_title: Must-do but really touristic and average
review_content: The Merlion park is the one thing you can't miss when in Singapore. It's crowded here, but watching people can be fun as well :)

Loved everything about it. Easy to get to as we were staying in the Marina Bay Area. The park was not very crowded as it was cloudy and also because it was a weekday. Ample restaurants line the area and you can take a river taxi or bumboat for an enjoyable 45 minute ride that covers the marina bay sands hotel area, the city, Clarke quay, boat quay areas. It started to rain on our cruise but otherwise this was a perfect outing.

I've been to Singapore several times already and I've done the touristy stuff during the first.  This was my first time though to frequent the Merlion. I only took a snap of this from a far off vantage point during the first time.  It was okay though flocked with tourists considering it was halloween.
One of Singapore’s many landmarks this was a fun icon to see and it also has great views of Marina Bay Sands and the harbour front area, it’s a nice walk over the bridge to see the Merlion.

Not particularly something to see in itself. Part of the gorgeous marina which is pure magic at night but this is nothing special just a half mermaid half lion fountain!  Nice to see as you walk past but no need to stop

review_title: An Icon not to be missed!
review_content: There has been significant changes in Singapore landscape from the first time that I have been there 10 years ago. Too many attractions were put up and to many places worth visiting. However, for those who are first timers even those frequent goers, I think Merlion Park is something that should not be missed.  It may be an old structure there but this means a lot to Singapore as it symbolizes the lion economy of the said country!

It is the logo of Singapore, you must go there for picture. Note that it is easily get lost in Singapore. The road are complex. After get off from MRT Raffles Place, ask people and turn on GPS. Singapore is hot, the water there is expensive, so prepare plenty of water is recommended. Take a picture that use your mouth to catch the water from Merlion, it represents catch the money :)
very good location for a timepass. nice place to pose for photos. worth a visit during sunset as the whole area becomes cool
This is really popular! Don't forget to come with your camera to snap some shots with the Merlion fountain! Also, you might get a little sprayed on.
Merlion Park is a must visit to see the symbol of Singapore. its crowed during the weekends and best to visit in the weekday.

What happens if you add the mermaid and lion then you get Merlion. This is an amazing work and standing tall its wonderful. Another great view if you happen to climb up, even otherwise you get a great glimpse...

review_title: Cant miss the Merlion when in Singapore
review_content: Merlion park is another must see when in singapore. You just cannot mis this one. You can spend an hour or 2 at this place and click good pictures around this with the skyline .

A must see whilst in Singapore. Very busy most of the time but it's a bit of fun with a lot of history behind the reason the Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. We walked past most days and it never failed to make us stop and take a few more photos. Trying to capture the water in our mouths photos were great fun.
I walked from my hotel to this attraction on a typical humid day in Singapore. Was disappointed that water was overpriced & a shaded place to sit & take in the view was unavailable.
Nice view. Went afternoon as part of city tour. Wonder how would it look in the night. Especially the boat ride. Don't miss it.
Well worth the walk to park. Well presented and clean. Great spot to catch the ferry around the bay.

review_title: A must to see in Singapore!
review_content: Just a few days with my friends in Singapore! Good city, very organize, clean and a lot of activities to do at daytime and nighttime as well.  It is worth it to see the key attraction of Merlion if you prefer walking or by boat. This is one of the icon symbols that Singapore has and from this point, you will be able to take a lot of pictures from the high buildings, the famous hotel casino Marina Sands and the other main buildings including the opera!

review_title: Went there coz I just should do it (?)
review_content: They say you don't go to Singapore if you don't take a pic at Merlion lol. So I did. I went there around 9pm and it was better coz the Marina Bay Hotel just started its Lighting Show. Looked wonderful yet so many people there. can take bus or MRT and going by foot to reach there.
It’s very good spot opposite to Marina Bay. View is very good.  Merlion is symbol of Singapore City. It is must visit place during Singapore visit
Good place to visit, part of standard city tour itinerary. It was good place to have photos as a memory for Singapore trip.
It is so amazing statue in the middle of marina bay sand. Must visit place and take selfie and photos with family and friends.

review_title: Perhaps the most important landmark in Singapore
review_content: I first visited the merlion park was back on 2010. I still remembered taking photos with my brother. It's definitely the most important landmark in Singapore despite the existence of the huge Marina Bay Sands building.

Made the trip to see the Merlion on foot,which took a while but was good exercise. Had to do the mandatory photo of posing in just the right position to give the impression that the fountain is pouring into your mouth. Restaurants and toilets nearby. Gives a good view of the other side of the bay. Worth a trip for a bit of silliness.

We often walked around in the night and one of our favourite places to be after dinner was the Merlion Park. Besides the famous Merlion statues, the park also offers a great place to sit and relax. While there do not forget to try the coconut ice cream served in a coconut shell. It is a must eat.

Supposed to represent the animal that the person who discovered Singapore saw when he first came to Singa Pura as he called it it’s a lovely place to visit with the family and pose for some amazing photographs especially with the water flowing out of the mouth of the structure.

Not as amazing as many other sites in Singapore but thankfully due to it's location close to other sights it's one of those you must see just so you can say that you did. Good photo opportunities as well
Walking around in Singapore we walked through this park. A really touristic attraction. By night really nice to see.
This is Singapore. This is the symbol of Singapore. Such a pleasant place to visit for the whole family. It comes alive as early as 6am. Definitely worth a stop, a photo, a selfie.

review_title: This is a must to see on Sentosa Island
review_content: What a brilliant idea, and especially in the evenings when every 30 minutes there is a light and music display which is free of charge. Easily located by the monorail station and this an unique attraction.

review_title: Nice Place to Get a Few Photos
review_content: Good fun getting pictures of the lion from all of the possible angles. There are many tourists striking poses for photos here.

The Merrion Park is a must see when in Signapore. To get there you can take the train then a short taxi ride. The park is on the waterfront with spectacular views of the famous Marina Bay Sands hotel and a museum. There are bars, restaurants and shops close by so there are many things to keep you entertained. This area is absolutely perfect to take pictures (see my pictures).  This is a must see when in Signapore!
Nice place. Many tourists come here to relax and take iconic photos with the statue. Walking distance from other attractions.
Merlion is Singapore symbol, it's a must when visiting the country, very good views from there. It's not necessary to spend that much time on it if you're short on time.
Interesting little park with a "Merlion" statue on the bay. Nice area to stroll around on a lazy Sunday afternoon.
My friend guided me for this tour in Singapore iconic Merlion Statue. This area are having so much tourist which is to take a photo with the Merlion.

review_title: Iconic place and a must visit
review_content: Go to this place only because of it's iconic stature. This is a must visit while in Singapore as the merlion is inextricably associated with the name "Singapore". So go there and take a few pics with the merlion in the background.
We have been here because a tour boat dropped us of here. Its nice, great view on the bay but very touristic and busy. Nice for a pic and a close look on the Merlion and than move on.
This has to be high on the list for places to see in Singapore as it's one of the most well known attractions. The history behind the Merlion is interesting and a great photo opportunity.

review_title: a must visit this iconic place
review_content: this place is a must visit if you go to Singapore. In addition to its location is very easy to reach, this place is a free tourist destination of course

A stroll along the Marina will bring you to the Merlion Park, it is generally well patronised so you need to be patient to get a picture. There are some good photo opportunities here there are a number of eateries nearby for a meal.

Merlion park is a definite must see .. this area alwsys has lots of people taking pic and is right by the water ..with of course the Merlion in all its beauty spouting water.   This area has lots of restaurants and you can even enjoy a ferry out and get a better view of the Merlion and the entire area.

review_title: Happening place, nice view and light show
review_content: Being local, I have not been here since years ago and chance upon it last night while taking a stroll from old parliament house. I think singaporean should visit these places more, the photo op and view are stunning, weather not too hot or cold, lots of tourist and kids running around the park. The view of the merlion is great from many angle, then there's the light show every night I think around 8pm, so pay a visit to the place by yourself, don't need to book a tour, you can walk from cityhall MRT station or Raffles MRT station about 15 minutes. Lots of pub and eateries along the park so don't need to worry about food or drinks, clean toilets and after the show, take a nice stroll to the singapore Esplanade and eat some local food around there or a quick shopping stop at Marina square.

This place is so called one of 3 most disappointing places.  But, if you don’t expect too much, I think this is a fine place. The Merlion statue is after all famous. Water is refreshing especially when heat is there.  Also, I watched the night laser light show in the bay from this park. There is some distance to the main venue, but it looks the whole bay is the venue. Nice show it was.

To anyone visiting Singapore one land mark should definitely be the Merlion park. Though the history says there were no lions in the land the merlion sure belongs here. With world class hotels giving access to public to access the park the place has an air of elegance and splendour
Merlion worth a visit id you're in Sentosa. Didn't go into statue as it was closed when we were there.

The Merlion attracts a lot of tourists, so it might be a little hard to get photos without other people in them.  The view from this attraction is good, you can see the bay and the Marina Bay light show from here
Great river and harbour walk all through this area. See the Merlion and across to Marina Bay. Great paths but tourist numbers build very early in the morning so come here early.
Whilst in the Bay Area, you must visit and see this important statue. Some great views across the bay, a very vibrant area At Night, with lots of restaurants including street food.

Half-fish and half-lion, the iconic Merlion resides at the waterfront Merlion Park, is a Singapore landmark and major tourist attraction.Nice place & definitely a must visit while in Singapore. The view around the Merlion is also beautiful. You can also see the most spectacular hotel in Singapore " Merina Bay Sand " from this point.

review_title: EXCELLENT MONUMET - Must See (Multiple Visitor) when in Singapore! 8.6 Mts TALL (70 Ton), a Photographic Excitement!
review_content: NOTE: The MER-LION was a marketing icon of Singapore - A mythical creature with a lion's head and a fish's body, the Logo of Tourism!  Started in 1972, by Prime Minister Lee Kuan, the original Merlion statue used to be at the mouth of the Singapore River, with Anderson Bridge as its background. On 25 April, 1997, it was relocated to the current Merlion Park, near the Marina Bay.  .. Very Busy Place .. Very Well Maintained .. Excellent for different types of photography, day & night!, including SELFIES, Panorama, etc. .. The Breeze and the surrounding atmosphere takes anybody out of this world!!

Spent an afternoon walking around here. It’s great if you want to get 10,000 steps in. A huge variety of eating places but all catering mainly to Western culinary. From the entrance you can take the boardwalk all the way around to Marina Sands shopping mall - this is well worth a look through.  There is not much shelter so be sure to wear a hat and take an umbrella - especially on a hot day! Taxis from the main entrance take a while - there is a long line, but plenty of other transport modes into and out of the park.

This place is possibly the most touristy of them all. The Lion is there to welcome visitors to Singapore and hundreds of people are there getting selfies with the lion, “drinking” from his waterfall mouth.   Despite this area being so busy, it makes for some great photos and the scenery is really great.   It’s definitely a must visit while in Singapore.
We walked from our hotel to the point where the Merlion is (6km) and were glad that we did , plenty of visitors at about 8.30am (Tour Groups) , my wife is smitten with the ICON of the MERLION.

Good place to view the panorama of the bay... of cours here the main actraction is the lion fountain but also the nearest bridge and the walk around all the bay are amazing...good place to spend couple of hours
Nice place, went during the day. Not to crowded, but nice. A family activity. Places to sit and eat a lunch or sit and people watch. A few restaurants along the way.

review_title: A good spot to shoot some interesting pictures
review_content: I have been here many times and I still like to go again. A nice spot to shoot interesting pictures of Singapore city

It is must visit place if one is visiting Singapore...It is located at Marina Bay Sands...From Singapore Flyer it is walking distance...Don't miss it if one is in Singapore...It is easily accessible by local transport...The place offers marvelous view ..
