I have been here over and over but never feel bored. This is the Singapore icon statue, crowded with visitor over all times. Hard to find spot to get clear picture of your own due to population. Well, enjoy the moments here are very nice

This was a good walk along the riverfront in Singapore. Lots of tourist go here so it can get very crowded. Early morning was best, both for crowed and heat. This is also a place to see the Sands Hotel the Cruise Ship on top. You will be close to many of the towns attractions so have your day planned out. Lots of great restaurants in this area also as well as shopping.

The area around the Merlion, walking along the river bank is stunning, especially at night where crowds gather to eat and drink at the many restaurants. Keep in mind kitchens close around 2.30pm and re open at 6pm. But you can always buy a drink and enjoy the view across the bay of Marina Bay Sands and the Iconic 57 story high hotel. If you are wanting to indulge, a drink at the roof top garden of the Fullerton Bay Hotel gives you almost 360 degree views. A cocktail costs around $26. My daughter and I rented electric scooters from behind The Merlion Sculture. $39 each for an hour, but well worth it! They were so much fun and you are allowed to go anywhere! We scooted around the entire bay at night. It was spectacular!
selfies at merlion park is fun. seeing the porcupine shaped entertainment center is nice. view is wonderful  exciting views of the water and casino  gardens by the bay, hotels etc and city

The Merlion itself is good, a very popular attraction, a lot of tourists. Easy to take photos, opposite is Marina Bay Sands. The Merlion is also good at night, the spot to be to see the lightshow at night at around 8pm. Closest Mrt station is Raffles Place or walk from Clarke Quay Mrt station which is a scenic walk especially at night.

review_title: A must see attraction of Singapoore,,, nothing much
review_content: It is a place not to be missed during singapore trip, as it is considered to be their national pride. The place is crowded. We cannot even take a clear photograph of Merlion. Go, watch it, get a picture, walk for a while and just come back to relax,,, Not much to do here,,,

review_title: During the night or/and very early in the morning...
review_content: ...would be the best time to visit Merlion. We stayed at the Fullerton hotel, 5min far away, so we came here 2 times by walk (morning and evening). If you come early in the morning, there are not soo many tourists, so you can take nice pictures of Merlion. In the night the view is a different one, for my taste better (with the lighted Marina Bay Sands in the background). Well it seems like it is a very popular place by the tourists, as it is almost always overcrowded, but it is not the best place in the city...for me nothing special.

review_title: Lots in the area to do
review_content: This area has changed so much and there is so much to just walk around and see. The development in the last 5 years blows my mind. Also a definite need to selfie with the famous Merlion statue. Lots of places to grab a bite or drink. Not far from the temples and downtown type area when out touring but plan for HOT.

review_title: Walking on the road between Singapore Flyer to Merlin Park
review_content: There is an wonderful stretch of road between Flyer to Merlion Park. Start at walk around 6.00 PM to have a beautiful scenery. The walk starts from The F1 track goes along the water and ends with Merlion park. You can see the Marina bay sands hotel at different views and different sun shade. There are ample places to sit and enjoy the view.

review_title: A little crowded and overly commercialized
review_content: I think the statue doesn't present much, but a place to take pictures on. It's iconic really, but should give out more details as to their essence in Singapore culture.

It's for the first time visitor, for the mandatory selfie with the Merlion statue symbolic of Singapore. Walking distance from Gardens By the Bay and Marina Bay Sands. So no need to plan a visit separately.

review_title: One of the best places in Singapore
review_content: Worth a visit. If you can afford, spend at least half a day here. A lot to explore on foot. Well connected with SMRT and taxis. If you miss doing this and nearby places, you have actually missed one of the best locations in Singapore.

review_title: Symbol of Singapore to the world
review_content: Enlighten to read the significance of Merlion.. Interested to find mention of Indian demi-gods. Good place to walk around and take some selfie, crazy selfies by tourists

No matter if you come here at night or in the day, there is always a nice view awaiting you. Even though it may get a little hot in the day, you can always chill out at the nearby restaurants and admire the view of Marina Bay Sands. At night, come and see the lights opposite of the river

review_title: You have to get a picture here
review_content: Yes, add this to your agenda. Easy to find and access, great spot for pictures and some great things to see here. If you are not used to the heat, take a hat.
At any day, this place is buzzing with tourists. The area in itself is pretty small and nothing exciting! A photo click since its the symbol for Singapore :)

It's a must to get ur photo taken here when in Singapore but don't take too long as the crowd of tourists can get thick at times. Hope for a cloudy day because it can get real hot with all the bare pavement around.
I have been in singapore meeting lynch friend and as i have observed his work him and his wife looked great. Merlion park indeed is excellent.

I guess this is one of the places tourists will go to - to see the Merlion. It's just a big statute of a creature that does not exist in real life - and it's spewing water into the sea!  But we all still went there and took photos.  It was quite a nice place and you can see Marina Bay Sands on one side and the Esplanade on the other too.
A great evening out watching the view over the bay and enjoying an ice cream. The Merlion delivers spectacular photos in the evening.
If you are in singapore you must go there. very nice the bay. really nice walk. a lot of nice restaurant and bar close to merlion

review_title: Merlions, Tigers, and Bears, Oh My!
review_content: One can't visit Singapore without a pilgrimage to the Merlion (mermaid lion). I took a long walk along the river to arrive; remember it's usually very hot and humid, so bring your water. It is definitely crowded with tourists, but it is, after all, the symbol of the city, and worth a visit for sure. It has good views of other parts of the city, too.

review_title: Great views and photo opportunities at one spot
review_content: Capture the Singapore waterfront skyline from this spot - the Merlion, the Esplanade, Marina Bay Sands. Plan your onward journey from this spot: where will you be heading to next: the National Gallery, the Gardens by the Bay, the malls at Marina Square, a concert at the Esplanade...?

review_title: One has to see the symbol of Singapore
review_content: Of course no trip to Singapore is complete without visiting the merlon. However, this is also what ALL tourists think, so the place is absolutely packed with tourist buses and huge crowds, which does take away a bit of the fun. However, worth the visit for a few quick snapshots.

Of course this is a must visit icon of Singapore! We walked here along the river in the morning and got there at about 8am. The viewing area is very exposed to the sun, and it was already crowded with tourists. Not a big problem because you don't need to hang around too long anyway. Take your photos and move on.
This monument it's only for getting pictures and post them on social APPs. It can get so crowded but those good pics really worth the visit and the wait.

review_title: Don't go home without a picture here.
review_content: Better to go here early morning to catch the sunrise and only few people at this hour. Other attractions are near in this area like the Helix bridge, marina bay sands and the gardens by the bay.

review_title: Early morning visit - great photos at 7am
review_content: We arrived in Singapore at 4am and so on first morning walked from hotel to Merlion Park. Got lovely photos of sun rising with Merlion in foreground and Marina Bay Sands hotel in background. Nice spot to watch the sun come up - not crowded.
Merlion is the Icon of Singapore. This is one of the must go place to have a photo infront of Merlion. It is more attractive in the evening when it is all illuminated.
Easy to find this place,near the mrt station,have a wonderful scenery with a marina bay sands and singapore flyer as a background.
Nice area. But very crowded. You must go there night. And you must watch laser show. Awesome show. Nice.

review_title: This is what Singapore is Famour for.
review_content: People everywhere and hard to get a photo without someone else in it. People used to know Singapore by the Merlion before the Marina by the Bay was built. There are a few restaurant's near by. Its nice to just sit there and people watch or watch the boats. You can get on and do a harbour boat cruise from there which is 40 mins. To be honest its nothing spectacular but it is a must see even if your do a cruise by on a boat cruise just to say you say it.

review_title: Have to see if in Singapore
review_content: You have to go to Merlion Park if you are in Singapore. We have young kids and they enjoyed the area. There are a couple of nice little shops there, icecreams etc...There is a very nice view of the harbour also and boat rides available...
An awesome creation worth a quick stop.   The park was packed on the Sunday I visited.   It’s a beautiful structure.

Lion is the national animal of Singapore and hence this park is honour of it. This park doesn't have parking but since it is on the bay it is lined with several restaurants. There is a Japanese cuisine restaurant too and people can enjoy the view and bay. On the other side of the bay is the famed Marina bay sands hotel. The nearest metro seems to be Raffles place, but looks like it is on one of the main roads of the city without parking. Summers can be hot while rainy season could be really wet. Carry a small umbrella is adviced. Like every place it's always better to carry a selfie stick which comes handy for taking pictures.
You can't come to Singapore without having you photo taken with the Merlion. Very clean and well maintained, and some great photo opportunities. Make sure you visit by day and at night.

review_title: Interesting  corner of the bay typically
review_content: Typically of Singapore immaculately kept. Adds to the interest walking around the bay .Good spot for photos

Some lovely night shots to take here. You can walk around in perfect safety, we were there around midnight and still quite a few people taking selfies with the sculpture in the background. Lovely views of Marina Bay as well. We were there days after the GP so the light framework was still in place adding to the atmosphere.

Amidst beautiful riverside views, this park is fun. Kids enjoy and its clean nice and full of tourists. One can see marina bay sands, beautiful pink flower bed alongside bridge, good restaurants like Pelican. Fun clean nice place.
Lovely weather in September. Ice cream and a little walkie around the lake was just perfect for our little girl....

Merlion Park is one of those iconic Singapore spots that one really needs to just go, walk around and take some photographs with the Merlion Statues, Marina Bay Sands, Fullerton Bay Hotel and more. Rain or shine, there will be many other people doing the exact same thing. Great spot for people watchers too.

review_title: Great way to start a visit to Singapore
review_content: This is the symbol of the City with good reason. It sits now in Marina Bay after having been moved there about 20 years ago. Half lion, half fish. I went in late afternoon and then hung around at the Starbucks a block from there so as to see it again lit up in the Harbor.   There are some great view points in front and around the side of the symbol. There are loads and loads of tourists all wanting the same photo you want too. It works out ok if you are patient, you can always get your favorite shot.  The Park is easy to get to walking or by other transpo, to me it was fun to explore that whole area, including the nearby very well noted hotels. I also tied this visit with a trip to tour the Singapore River, there is a river tour stop within 100 meters of Merlion.   Also, this is a decent viewpoint to watch the light show, it will be crowded but the light show is really across the Bay at the Sands. Fun to see it though from this perspective too.  Definitely worth seeing, no cost.
You must see the Merlion - we come and visit each time! There is a nice area to walk around and it is a nice photo too. Always busy but a must see.
Everyone who will visit Singapore must go to this place. Very good attraction for tourists especially who loves taking photos.

review_title: You Can't Visit Singapore and Not Take a Photo of the Merlion
review_content: This is a Singapore icon that you need to take a photo of. Usually pretty crowded but plenty of room to get photos from different angles. Nice to see both during the day and at night when it is light up in different colours. You get a great view of some other classic Singapore attractions as well like the Flyer and Marina Bay Sands.

This is the iconic Singapore Dragon which is a huge water fountain opposite the bay from the Marina Bay Sands hotel. The whole area is accessible on foot but there is SO much to see you need to take comfortable walking shoes and be reasonably fit. The laser light show here at 20.00 each evening is truly amazing - don't miss it!

review_title: A symbol of Singapore.....worth a look
review_content: I'd not heard of a Merlion before but it's basically a bit like a Mermaid only part lion. To the locals it's a big deal and as well as this park in the centre of the city there is a larger statue on Sentosa. It's very busy with lots of people getting their photos/selfies. Great views of Marina Bay Sands across the water. It's worth 30-60 mins of your time

Our bus dropped us over the road which we very carefully negotiated. There was quite a crowd there but we were still able to clearly approach and see all the lions in the park, and even pose for some typical tourist photos.
Always nice to come back to the Singapore Lion, which has changed place since I first visited Singapore. An icon in Singapore!

After a days work an evening stroll around the park and surrounds is a must. The light shows on the various buildings, the Merlion and other sites keep you interested. Stop by the hawker market for some dinner. If you enjoy night photography there is no limit to the shots that be taken.

Love this place , marlion = Singapore . It resides in singapores soul...  Beautiful river side accompanied with marlions happening crowd is make it worth visiting .  A must visit attraction in songapore

As the symbol of the city, you have to see the Merlion statue.  It does get SUPER busy, however most people are generally pretty good. They take their photos/selfies and then move on. You won't have to wait more than a few moments to get your own shots.  That said, if you can come early in the day, you'll experience smaller crowds. There's also no shade, so an early visit will be much cooler and more pleasant.

review_title: Worth a peek one time, only...
review_content: ...but the heat and Chinese tourists will kill you. Theyve set up some mini-Merlions around it to entertain the kids.
I recommend to visit in the evening as than you can see the lights and it becomes very lively here. .

Worth a trip to see the Merlion. Was extremely busy but we were able to take lots of photos. Nice walk around & you have the water to look at to. Places to sit & you can buy drinks & refreshments from little kiosks.
We enjoy the santosa island very much  We visit the beach for some beer and came with cable car to there with amazing view on Singapore ports  Take a visit

review_title: Very scenic with great views of the Gardens by the Bay hotel
review_content: We spend a a couple of hours there during the day and then a couple of hours in the evening to see the light show. It's very pleasant place with lots of restaurants, downtown business center around, and riverboat trips. Must see it both during the day and in the evening. The light shows are twice in the evening at 7:30 and 9 pm.

I came here with my friends around 4pm, and yeah it was crowded there but there still some space to take a picture and sit comfortably on the stair... we were sitting and watching the building in front of us until they turn on the light and become very beautiful, i think it was one of the best city sunset
Anyone visiting to Singapore this is must visit. Photos to be clicked here. One can walk here. There are cafes around to sit and have a beautiful view.
Went here at night... Amazing. Definitely Worth your visit . Busy but you won't be dissapointed Views to Marina bay Go at night for the lights Short walk from a MRT or the Fullerton

Singapore has the word Singa which means lion. So, one feels it's a must to visit the Merlion Park and take selfies or pictures. Many films feature a scene at this area and taking a picture with the Merlion as the background is kind of a ritual when visiting Singapore. Explore also the areas surrounding the Merlion Park or the Central Business District.

This is one of those things that you must see but is not as impressive as it seems. Don't get me wrong it is a great sight and well worth visiting as is a famous part of the Singapore Bay area but as far as parks go, it is not something to jump at. The great part about this venue is that you can get a fantastic view across the harbour back to the Marina Bay Sands area which is a great view.  Worth the visit but don't expect a traditional park in the sense of open space and greenery. Just my opinion.
Bit late to take a Photo Group when we visit. But's ok. One icon from Singapore that should visit when you come to Singapore
Very busy fito shoot place. Merlion not very impressive but the views over the Bay, of Marina Bay Sand and the business centre certainly are

Your trip to Singapore can still be complete without a visit here. The surrounding views are great, making it easy to get a glimpse of the country's other famous attractions. But truth be it's just a sea lion statue that sprays out water, albeit a very symbolic one that's represented as the national icon. Very tall, very heavy, and very white, giving it a major presence within the park but also completely flooded with tourists which can make private photos with a loved one a bit of a challenge. Lots of nearby restaurants and cafes on the promenade, but on the pricey side with the location being a key factor. No cost, easy access and a paltry 20 mins is all that's needed...

I thought the merlion was nice but ultimately the area as a whole is pleasant. Especially during the evening so you can the city lights and walk along the esplanade. If your hungry there are plenty of restaurants you can choose from. There is a lighting show for you to look at onto which adds a little extra value to your visit.

ok, it's a large water-spitting white lion... not over-impressive but altogether ok. however, difficult to take nice side-view pix of it due to the lighting. and, of course, lots of tourists around the area. if followed by hi-tea in the nearby fullerton hotel, worth a visit nevertheless
Nice area to have a walk, plenty of restaurants and cafes and of course the merlion. Great views over to the Bay Sands, the gardens and the flyer

The park contains a good size statue of Merlion - half mermaid and half lion.This is the only merlion with water coming out of its mouth. Soothing to look at. One can have a walk on the bridge on the opposite side of the merlion too.
Came in blistering heat so didn't like the experience , limited food options, very expensive for soverners .Get a compulsory picture & move on
Unless you're in to mermaids or merlions this isn't a big attraction. Good for a quick photo or a 10 minute stay then move on

review_title: The Lion will wet you but never bite you!
review_content: Just one of those places you have to visit. The Merlion is the icon of Singapore; he's half fish and half lion. Merlion Park is situated in front of the Fullarton Hotel.
This is a wonderful place to watch the sunset over the bay. it does get a little crowed and understandably it comes clear why when you start to take the views of the Sun going down.

This is a popular tourist attraction and is one of the THE landmarks of of this city state. The lights at night are incredible Great place to take photographsOverlooks the marina Bay Sands and Marina Bay.
for surw it isn t one of the best place to see but the position in the panoramic walk is really really nice. beat9ful the view on marina bay sands. tge statue nothing special
This was the only really crowded place I experienced in July. Tons of people were there taking their photos.

There are so many super places to visit in Singapore and the Merlion Park had a lot going for it. It's free, always warm, mostly sunny and you get superb views walking through the safe clean paths and a bit of exercise will set you up for some afternoon tea in the Fullerton Hotel or other eateries. There are memorials and statues relating to historical figures and events with plenty of descriptive information. And of course the Merlion! When we were there they were setting up the gantries and fences for the Grand Prix so we had to skirt round them but it was a small price to pay for a beautiful walk in this amazing city state.
Nice place to roam around, click photographs , nice skyline of the city can be seen. worth a visit and good.
A must visit when you go to Singapore. We went at night to see it with lights show. Many are doing photo ops but it has enough space to accommodate everyone.

Been there for two times but I couldn't stop lovin' the sight of Merlion Park. So many people there with different activities and for my 2nd time, I enjoyed the sunset from that place. I'd like to say Singapore is one of the best places for street photography. Merlion Park, the iconic place in Singapore, proves me about that!  When you're in Singapore, don't ever miss this place. Even though you're not a fan of selfie (just like me hehe) you can enjoy every details of this most popular spot in Singapore. Ride the boat, buy some coffee, listen to the sound of water fountain or just sightseeing. Can't wait to go back here!

Obviously the Merlion statue resides in this park. You see Merlion, in many different guises, in all the souvenir shops, so you really should take the time to see it in the flesh so to speak; one visit is probably enough though. We first saw it from a Bumboat in the river, probably the best place to get a photo from, but we still decided to visit the area on foot. It is quite crowded but we found that people were friendly and the atmosphere quite festive, lots of smiles, lots of laughter.

For the icon of Singapore, you have to see this at least once during your visit! Wouldn't say you would need to visit this more than once, but it's still a nice area to walk around if you do end up here :)

This is one of the prominent places in Singapore. So expect to encounter many people here. But, there'll be no problem taking a good picture here and be sure to go to the deck (at the middle) above water to get a great picture with Merlion (from its front).

review_title: A nice stroll by the Bay
review_content: The Merlion statue sits in this park and it's the selfie Mecca for many. The Merlion is Singapores lucky mascot and it's a nice statue in a lovely location by the bay near the financial district. It's very popular so if you want to get that selfie you will need to be patient.

You must visit the Merlion Park when you go to Singapore. I visited twice and i found that if you visit around 7.30am there's practically no one around so you can take as many photos in as many poses as you wish. Generally later on in the day it gets very crowded.
I gone there with my wife after riding cable car. Small park. Just near Universal Studio. Nice place to take rest. Otherwise nothing to see

We visited the marina area in the evening which was delightful with all the surrounding lights and a lovely breeze coming off the water after a warm walk from our hotel. The Merlion water feature is very striking and placed well in regard to the Anniversary Bridge, the Fullarton Hotels, the Marina Bay Sands and the Gardens by the Bay domes.

This one of singapore landmark, if u dont take photos here its mean u not go to singapore. Fish with lion head is the statue where people always take shoot when they go to singapore. In this area,u can buy a merchandise or pay to seightseeing singapore with boat

The place is always crowded and so if you wanna do photography you need to be very patient with people. There is a boat ride next to eat which is quiet good as it takes you to the river which passes by the old city.

review_title: Not to missed when in Singapore
review_content: Merlion Park is located on One Fullerton road and considered as one of the famous landmarks you shouldn't miss when in Singapore. The ambiance is very nice and the park is well organized. I would surely bring my family on my next future visit in Singapore.
must have picture if youre in singapore, tourists always takes a picture of the merlion statue, its evidence that you were in singapore :)

Found this walking the circumference of Marina Bay Area. Very busy here in the evening with tourists flocking to take photos. Nice statue and pleasant area for shops and restaurants around it. This is a unique icon of Singapore - moved to this location in 2002 and sits proud and tall and the water spout working well from its mouth. Great view of Marina Bay Sands from here too.
There is a big merlion and a couple of small merlions in the park. Always packed with tourists.   Nice if you can walk around the area as there are special bridges nearby and a small mall.

review_title: The official 'mascot' of Singapore not to be missed
review_content: You've seen the pictures, if you spent even one day only in Singapore. It is the lion head on a fish body, or a mermaid's tail, to make it sound more romantic. Just kidding;) It's very close to the Raffles City MRT station. Right next to the Esplanade bridge on the Fullerton promenade. You will walk by, I'm sure, and see it, maybe even take a selfie next to it, as pretty much 99.99% of all passing by tourists do, including myself... 5 minutes is enough here before you get tired of the masses and swinging selfie sticks. Watch out!!!
i come to take a picture because this is the icon of Singapore and so many tourist go there to take a picture. the place was so hot, but lovely place to take a picture
First time i came here, and it's adorable. Great view. Minus point is only distance station MRT (for MRT users). It takes so far for stations.
Walked round the promenade. Beautiful part of the bay. Was very hot the day we went but refreshing to be near the water.

review_title: Merlion park is nice, but nothing spectacular
review_content: Interesting statues and history, but overall it's just a park/promenade that caters mostly to the tourists. Lots of restaurants/cafes/bars. It's a HUGE tourist draw, so gets pretty crowded around the Merlion. Worth a stop for a few minutes, but nothing more to do around there otherwise.
Timing may be everything as the fountain when busy is so crowded it detracts from the history of the monument. Early morning better.

Loved the experience of Merlion Park. What's nicer than enjoying a nice stroll in lovely weather with all the delightful scenery around. Very relaxed and many tourists just enjoying quality time there.
This is the last place I visit in Singapore. The view from here is amazing. Unfortunately the merlion was not working due to maintenance.

The most visited place in Singapore. They say you have never been to Singapore if you didn't have a photo taken here. The view is amazing - Marina Bay hotel looking fine across the river as well as the Singapore Flyer. The breeze of the air is refreshing here and it is a sight to behold!

A bit hard to get to with Grand Prix preparations underway but it was nice to see. Of course there is the merlion but there is s nice plaza area, the cleanest public toilets and a range of eateries. A Singapore must do.
This is a symbol of Singapore. This is a attractive sight for all tourists. This is a must see place in Singapore.

The Merlion Park is a staple tourist attraction and you should include it on your itenerary. The famous Merlion Park lived to my expectation and it is impressive how they managed to maintain the orderliness and clealiness of it. Not to mention that it's very accessible via MRT Raffles station.
A must do ... didn't take long but we'll worth the effort. Good views and photo opportunities. Take a river cruise too

To be honest this is a bit out of the way and we found a bit difficult to get to but you cant go to Singapore without getting a photo taken by the Merlions, in the same way as you wouldnt not go to Raffles

review_title: always wanted to see the merlion at the merlion park
review_content: Ever since i have been looking, planning and reading information about singapore, the merlion and merlion park used to pop up everywheere, so it was the must see place in singapore.  Visit this place either in the evening or at night, cool breezee along with singapore skyline in the backdrop and water flowing from the mouth of the merlion makes it a good place to spend some time and get the must have photos of singapore landmark.  Many restaurants are line along the merlion area but didnt try them.
Definitely a tourist place. There's a big Merlion by the riverside with buildings from the central business district as the background. Come here early to get a good selfie with the Merlion.

I guess this is one of the most visited attractions in Singapore!  Its a Free of Charge attraction  You can experience a river cruise on a "Bum Boat" from the Merlion Park  Recommended for families with Children!
Merlion Park will give you a view of marina bay, flyer and banks/offices. The area has lots of eatery and nice seating facility. Jus grab a place at any of these joints and enjoy the view.

Located along the waterfront, this symbol of Singapore is very impressive. Photo taking is available, people watching is in abundance and the sights of the center of the city unbelievable. Must see activity! This area can be best seen from the water on a sightseeing boat at night!

We went twice to see the Merlion, once at night and once in the daytime. It was packed in the daytime and was difficult to take decent pictures without photo-bombers! At night though, there were very few people about and we got great pictures. A must-see in Singapore!
The Mer-Lion. One of the many things which you should do is visiting this place. Few snaps of this beautiful piece of art will make your trip memorable.
We love this place after sunset very nice background with the tall lighted buildings.The place is very relaxing

A must see, since its the emblem of the city. There is a smaller one next to it, there is also one in sentosa island, but this one got view towards the bay and the marina bay sands... In the end, its just a piece of concrete that spits water..

The bay and its skyscrapers is certainly a beautiful place to visit, but the Merlion really looks like an artificial local monument created to be a soulless tourist trap. If you come to Singapore and don't see the Merlion, you most probably won't miss the attraction. However, do spend time walking around in the area, it's worth it. Amongst other artificial tourist traps in town to be avoided (in my opinion) is the Singapore Sling cocktail rip-off at the Raffles Hotel. There again, prefer walking around or have a room or lunch/brunch/dinner there, the Raffles still remains a very special place in Singapore.
A very nice park with a beautiful view too big. I would suggest that you go to the sun's time and wait until 20.00 for the show with the fountains...!

Merlion Park is one of the major tourist attractions in Singapore. It is home to Singapore’s mythical beast, Merlion, which has the body of a fish and the head of a lion. At night time, the place is well lit; coupled with the gentle breeze and the bright skyline, the beauty of the park is further enhanced. You can even go under the bridge where there are cafés and gift shops to purchase some lovely souvenir items.  To get to Merlion Park, catch the MRT to Raffles Place station on the East West Line. Take the exit towards the United Overseas Bank Plaza and from the middle of the plaza, you’ll see the Fullerton Hotel. Merlion Park is behind the hotel.
The Merlin park is really nice with the Merlion statue and the view of Marina Bay Sands, etc. but it is really really crowded.

Singapore was named after the lion. So the Singapore tour will not complete if you don't visit this place. This is the main thing of The city. This is the center of Singapore the merlion park in marina bay and just walking distance from this place you can go to gardens by the bay or Singapore flyer. So you can do the all the tour in just Day on this area.

This is our first visit to Singapore and Merlion Park is a must visit. It's a $6 ride with taxi from our hotel in Aliwal street. We came to the park twice. Once in the night time and once in the morning. At Both night and morning time, the park is packed with tourist but it is more beautiful in the night time as you can see the lights from surrounding buildings. You can find few expensive restaurants around the park.

This is a popular spot to get the iconic "funny" photo with the Merlion as well as the combo with Marina Bay Sands. The Merlion, half fish and lion is iconic in Singapore. Nearby the statue is a smaller version known as the Merlion cub.   It is definitely worth visiting at least once, but be prepared to fight with other tourists who all want to get the best shot. It is ideally located and near the Fullerton Hotel and provides some amazing views of the Bay. The nearest MRT is Raffles Place Interchange which is a 8-10 minute walk from the park.

review_title: Good place to spend few hours.
review_content: Merlion park is a happening place where tourist as well as residents come to spend time and click pics. Not more than an hour can be spent here though. Area around is mostly commercial and houses offices and banks.

Famous country/city monuments are touristy & crowded, how can you not visit Singapore and not have that all important selfie with the Merlion - at least once. It was extremely crowded & overcast & we get that photo.
You can enjoy view of the city here. Very crowded and full of tourists, but still clean. It is one of the most important things to donin Singapore.

They narrate the story how Singapore came into existence. They allow you to go to the top of Merlion and that's just crazy. The view from top is awesome. Entire Singapore is visible and looks beautiful by the sea.
Nice little tourist spot on the edge of marina Bay and Clarke quay. I would recommend the river cruise that gives you a bit more insight into the history of the bay
Merlion is the icon of singapore so this is the landmark place of singapore! At night it gets really crowded but personally it is more beautiful at night because of the illumination.

review_title: Worth a visit but don't go out of your way
review_content: Well worth visiting to see the Lion spraying water (Singapore is the Lion City after all) but I wouldn't necessarily go out of your way to visit. It's always very busy, day or night, so you need to be patient to get your photo(s)
The place is fun for taking pics. Generally had a great time taking pics. Area is mostly crowded with people enjoying the view as well. Great for pics.

It is Singapore's icon, the Merlion! Usually if you bring someone that never been in Singapore this is a place that they must visit to make the visit complete.  When I brought friends last February the Merlion was underworked , but they prepared the smaller Merlion on the other side.  But in general, from this place you can take all iconic pictures of Singapore like the Singapore national museum which is pretty elegant , the Fullerton hotel building, Art Science museum, OCBC center, Marina Sands hotel, etc. Because this is a huge open spaces that you can take every angle of iconic buildings in Singapore.  So if you are rush, come to this place and take all of Singapore iconic buildings !
Across the street from The Fullerton Hotel. Beautiful view of the Bay and Marina Sands area. The statue is large and makes a nice photo op. It's close to Boat Quay. See it by riverboat as well.

This is just the pedestrian side of the bay but plenty to see and do. Boat rides circle the bay. Restaurants line the front. Lots of tourists and it's hot ! There are bars and ice cream shops  Pretty place but nothing special

When you walk here you are close to the business district with skyscrappers and on the otherside clear view to the Marina bay sands.  The lion/fish statue is the same as the little mermaid in copenhagen harbour: nice but if you missted it..... don't make a big deal about it.

review_title: Must visit to see the Merlion
review_content: Merlion Park is. Historic place so one must visit, and as per today's prevailing standards take a selfie with Merlion! Additionally, the park and the surrounding area is a must visit with numerous wonderful attractions all within walking distance - Marina Bay Sands and its Shoppes, Marina Bay Gardens and Foray Grove, ArtScience Museum as well as Cloud Forest.   Must visit tourist spot but also wonderful attractions.

review_title: awesome place at marina bay merlion
review_content: very nice place neet and clean. if you what to go to this place by MRT getoff at ESPLANADE, take exit and it will be walking distance.

A must for those wanting to document there travel with a picture. The surrounding walk around the marina is near parks and gardens but with the other dining and shopping options a distance away along Orchard road there is limited other activities to recommend visiting for any period of time.
Kids love it!! One it has an interesting shape and other it is so distinctive that it would stay etched in your memory.  Had last seen it about 12 years back and it was good to visit the place again.

review_title: If you are there you must take photo with Singapore icon
review_content: If you are there you must take photo with Singapore icon   Nice view and place but need to take care of the wheather as it is hot some time and not suiting children

review_title: Must Take a Selfie for Tourists
review_content: Review by Dr Sim. The Merlion is just a statue but recognised around the world. It is a must for Tourists to take a selfie. Take a ten minute stop to take a photo to show that you are in Singapore. Regards Dr Sim
Really crowded and hot. But can a good view of all the architectures/buildings around eg. Esplanade, MBS, CBD area.

review_title: You get to see a nicely kept symbol of the Lion City
review_content: Nice place to visit during the day or in the evening. You can take the lift up inside the Merlion to get a view through its giant mouth. Quite an exciting place for kids!!
Went at night to see the Merlion. Great photos with the city scape. Worth a 10 min visit to this iconic location.

Visit the Merlion at night time. It could be crowded but very beautiful view at night time. A lot of restaurants on the side but can be pricey. Avoid weekends and try going here on weekdays instead. You can have a better view and pictures with lesser crowd.
From the Merlion Park can see the floating platform, Marina Bay Sand, Singapore Flyer, Esplanade and city view.  Short walking distance from Raffles Place MRT.
We were there midday and it was very crowded. recommend you go early morning. Great views of the harbor area. Basically just a concrete viewing platform.
A must visit to this Singapore National Symbol. Great views of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Financial District.

This park is really more of a viewing patio for the statue and a promenade of shops. The Merlion is fun to see up close, but there is not much else to see. It is very hot, as there is limited shade. I would stop by, if in the area, but not worth a separate trip.
It was very busy near the Merlion. People were jostling each other to get the best photos. Only a very short time needed to visit, but a great view across the bay to Marine Sands hotel.
Nothing much to say but the symbol of Singapore. Take your time out to click photos as the background buildings are very nice. Gets very crowded though.

A must visit place in Singapore. A perfect place to take pic of Marina Bay Sands. Take a rest, read a book and have coffee. It was quite crowded and full of tourists taking pic. It is very hard to find a good spot as everyone occupied every corner. I suggest everyone to go in the early morning, 8-9am.

I just loved this place. When I reached here I was mesmerised by the view and could feel that I am actually in Singpore. You can see theGarden by the bay, Marina Bay Sands and Singapore Flyer from here. There is Merlion statue. This place is excellent for taking pictures. Go at such a time hwen you can see the day vire and night view both.
Great for taking pictures. Just don't forget to bring a wide hat or an umbrella and to put some sunscreen for protection.
It's ok for a quick photo but not much else to do around there. Full of tour groups! The merlion itself is ok but not as grand as the one in sentosa.
Strategic location for must-have-photo when pay a visit to Singapore. Too crowded during weekend. Kids can easily get bored. The activity is just taking photo and watching people taking photo.

For the first time I come to Singapore, I have no time to see this Singapore Icon. No regret in my mind, because I know, someday I will back to Singapore and take a picture there. And..yes right! I come to Singapore again and take a many picture here. I think this place have its own charm that make you draw back there.

The Merlion is not a mythical creature entwined with local folk tales or culture. It is a cynical trademarked marketing tool of the Singapore Tourism Board first created in 1964. The best part about it may be that you are expecting it to be quite large, but in reality is no bigger than it deserves to be, and does little to block the view of the marina itself.   Many Singaporeans are quite critical of this inauthentic, artificial attempt at patriotic myth making. Personally, I think it would be best left as an understudy mascot for the Commonwealth games, in the case that one of the Bishan Otters are ill one day.   Bishan Otters. Now there is real SG symbol I can get behind.

We saw the Merlion from the water as we took our boat tour of the Bay. It's apparently quite old and famous and a part of Singapore's history. To my mind it's a nice statue, in a pretty part of town, spouting water from its mouth
I think it is very big but not. It takes about 15 Mins to visit.  Nothing special, but the view from here is stunning.
If you have come to Singapore and not visited merlion park you've seen nothing. Beautiful place and good for clicking lots of pictures. Must Visit

Yes is can get rather busy. But it really is worth it. The views of the city and across to Marina Bay really are worth it. Merlion Park is one of the things you have to do when you go to Singapore. It is not a far walk from the MRT and there are plenty of places close by to get something to eat or drink. Don't forget to get a picture of the Mini Merlion just behind the big one.

I have been to Singapore a couple of times but last year I finally visited the fame Merlion at Merlion Park instead of crusing passed it. Nothing much to be expected except for photographic memories of visiting the Lion City. But beware the heat and huge crowd! I escaped to the souvenir store nwarby and got myself a fridge magnet for remembrance. Visit it at least once, and that would be enough. Cheers!

Merlion park is one of the landmarks on must visits list in Singapore. It's symbol of lion with fish body just on the harbour facing marina bay and Singapore flyer. Just adjacent to it is the jetty where we can buy tickets and board boats for river tour of Singapore bay. At evening it's very pleasant here with amazing views of the Singapore skyline and bay in front. Best way to reach it is via esplanade mrt as it's just walking distance from there . It's nice to sit at evening with good breeze and sit for some time with beautifully Singapore skyline views lightening up in the evenings. Also just near by lots of high end and stylish harbour front restaurants near by if that is your area of interest.
one of the symbols of singapore. nothing special. crowded with people. a nice place to take a photo of singapore's sky line. if you are short in time - skip it.

review_title: Too touristy and hot hot hot
review_content: If you want to be a typical tourist you definitely need to come here. It's full of tourists taking selfies in the noise and the heat. Merlion statue is quite small comparing to what we see on pictures. Great views, but you can have the same great view in many other places in beautiful Singapore.

review_title: Just a place for selfie fans
review_content: Had a good view of the marina bay sand hotel. They have a night show over there. The perk had a wooden places where u can wait and enjoy the river. The cruise service is there and will be a great idea to have a ride.
Came across this Merlion while wondering the streets. So big and perfect for a photo op. Could see great views of the harbour and the marina bay sands. Put it on your list of places to visit.
Nice view around the city and Singapore was very hot but close to the river you can have fresh air and feel better

The Merlion is a water spouting mythical creature on the side on a concrete quay - not a park at all! It is crowded with tourists so be prepared. There is little shade except to linger under the bridge. You WILL get wet if you go within a couple of metres of the lion with spray depending on the breeze! It was quite refreshing in the July heat!

review_title: The number one must in town
review_content: You haven't been in Singapore if you haven't seen the Merlion. It's the most iconic view of Singapore and you get great views of the Marina from here as well. If you want good shots of the Marina Bay Sands hotel, this is the spot to take them from.
The Merlion park is the simple of Singapore, it is located in sentosa and you should definitely go and see it.

I took the MRT to Raffles Place station and then walked along the river past the Fullerton Hotel. I then crossed a busy road at the lights and walked straight ahead and found myself in Merlion Park.  It was very crowded, but had a nice, friendly atmosphere. A young couple was having their wedding photos taken and lots of people were cheering and congratulating them. There were also quite a few tour groups.  It was very hot but there were a few places to buy drinks and food if required. As there's not much shade I recommend that you wear a hat or take an umbrella.  After having a look at the Merlion I continued my walk around the river to Promenade MRT station where I took a train back to my hotel.  The view from Merlion Park is amazing and next time I'll go at night to get a different perspective. Definitely a 'must see'.
The Merlion is an iconic symbol of Singapore. When we see the merlion either on a postcard or a moulded chocolate we are reminded of Singapore. The views at night of and from the merlion are great.
This is a must see attraction in Singapore. Man made but well architected. You can take poics from the mouth of the lion as well as its head. The 4 teeth correspond to the 4 cultures in the city
Not only is this one of the most recognisable landmarks - but iTs in a very nice area with lots of other interesting places and parks to see.  Perfect area to people watch!
A very easy to spot place that's located near to MRT. Would advise to visit on weekday as it wont be so crowded with people.

Merlion Park is a great place to spend the evening in Singapore. The iconic statue of Merlion is a popular place for all the tourists wising for taking back unique photos representing Singapore. There also many restaurants facing the waterfront to have a bite. Overall a good place where a lot of locals also come to spend the evening.
Go at night to catch the beautiful lights that this park has to offer. Simply beautiful! Nice dining areas around as well. A must visit!

The Lion head with the mermaid body is well represented of Singapore for many years.  A touristy place and many out there to take pics of the merlion overlooking the singapore river.  Go in the evening or early morning to take pics. Less hot and more enjoyable
A wonderful day out and plenty to do for all the family make sure you got your camera, the restaurants close by are amazing with great views

Well, it is a pretty new and small statue of a lion and fish spitting water from its mouth. it is supposed to represent the symbol of Singapore but the city is much more beautiful than this. To be frank... it doesn't worth the visiti and if u are in town only for a short transit, you can skip it.

One must not leave Singapore without having their pictures taken at the famous Merlion.  The place is just located near the bay where you can rest, stroll or have your photos taken as a sort of a memorabilia for your visit to Singapore.
Saw it on a boat tour down the river wouldn't have gone out of my way to visit. Was a good sight to see and take a few photos
It is a must visit area. Take many photos. It is so calm and beautiful.go there at night . And have a drink.

This is one of the most famous photo spots in Singapore. Overlooking the Marina Bay, it has gorgeous skylines and beautifully lighted at night. The Merlion throwing water is the famous pic everyone clicks.
Really nice views of Marina bay, highly recommended. This is an iconic statue that is a must see when you come to Singapore!

When i was young, i know only Merlion next to the word Singapore, if we saw the Merloin in books, TV, or articles we remember to think about Singapore, I was here many time in this place from 1996 until June 2017, with my kids and family. Its wonderful and unforgettable memory and the continous development of the area become completely change from 1996

You are not going to be alone here, but nevertheless, this is a must when in Singapore.   The Merlion itself is nice, but taking in the whole Marina Bay Area is fantastic at night ... the skyline, Fullerton, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer and the Esplanade Theaters ... captivating!

review_title: It is cool and silent place with Big merlion and 1 small
review_content: Merlion is identity of Singapore. Half fish and half lion.. mermaid + lion = merlion  Place is cool and quite.. u can see Singapore flyer and marina by the way from here.  Selfie with Merlion is must to prove that u visited singapore.
There is a big Merlion statue. That is the Singapore City Symbol. Cool, travelers must to visit this merlion and take a photo with that.
Nice photography.  Outdoor.   No food available there.  Taxi available there.   Historical Site.  Overlooking Marina Bay Sands

I've always thought about how the merlion looks like in person and I wasn't disappointed when I saw it right before my naked eye. It is not that special but hey did you ever go to Singapore without your photo being taken here?  Strike that merlion pose!
It's a must see attraction but was it an anticlimax. That's going to be down to personal opinion. It's not huge I'll say that. Easy enough to get to so why wouldn't you go?

Came here with my Singaporean friend who gave me a tour of the best spots...he said this was an iconic part of Singapore as it's the only thing that is distinctly theirs. It's packed full of tourists hopping off their day trip coaches, and people doing millions of selfies.

This place is going to be filled full of tourist as this is where the iconic Merlion is. You dong have to spend a ton of time but a must if you come to Singapore. Come in the evening and after getting a selfie hit up one of the many bar/restaurants for a drink and a snack.

review_title: SG trip is incomplete without the Merlion visit!
review_content: The Merlion is a must visit, iconic fountain in the unique shape of a Merlion, flanked by awesome skyscrapers, bayside, and amazing cityscapes!   Gets super crowded with various tourist groups in the evenings, but it's supercool to be here. The area is surrounded by restaurants n Starbucks too, is a few steps away for coffee lovers
Visited Merlion Park during the day and enjoyed wonderful views of Merlion and Marina Bay Sand Hotel.  This is the Singapore's mascot and it must be on your list.

Tourists everywhere with one goal! Get a cool picture or selfie with the Merlion. How can you not do this? From here you can book a bumboat river ride and that was worth it! The best thing about this park, besides the photo opp, was the toilets! There seemed to be only one, but there was never a line and it was always clean (went twice).

review_title: One day travel to accompany friend's job interview
review_content: The weather was pretty dull that day . Our day started with rainy and by the time we were heading for sight seeing , everything was suddenly turned out perfect !   Lots of tourists mostly vietnamese and indonesians but everybody had a great day

review_title: A must visit for your picture album!
review_content: This is the place to go in the evening for that picture perfect shot of the Marina Bay Sands hotel, and of course the Merlion itself!
A must for every tourist visiting Singapore. The Merlion is stunning but smaller in real life than expected.
Great spot and view of the water. Great place to wander around for hours. Good at night time or early evening.

review_title: Super awesome view. The best of Singapore
review_content: Place visited by all. Capture the best of the selfie moments with meri lion in the background. The view at sunset and when it gets dark is even more awesome. Walking distance away from Clarke Quay the ever happening place in Singapore with its bars and pubs for you to indulge into the wines and spirits. For the ones like me with special interest in history plenty to discover. Can go to Esplanade also near by if you are an art lover. Can spend half day at meri lion and near by areas. Also have adequate memory in your camera you won't be tired clicking some quality pics.

Can't miss this landmark. Little difficult to find but MRT helps. Basically heads to Battery road and find Fullerton hotel (was Post Office once). This place is opp. hotel. Nice spot where you can see Merlion, Sands bay and Sing Eye. Best time to go is just before Sunset. Take pics during light and then in the dark when its lit. Weekend would be good time to go.
We saw the park on a Sunday afternoon along with a great number of other people. The statue of the Merlion is such an iconic artwork for the people of Singapore,

review_title: great place to enjoy sunny days
review_content: with a lot of tourists merlion park is quite a perfect place to enjoy and chill out and get a cruise trough the river to enjoy the view.

Certainly an exciting place to stroll around and relax before you do the more touristy things and shopping. The Merlion is so iconic, so if you are a first-timer to Singapore, put it on the list, you won't be disappointed.

The Merlion is a symbol of Singapore as Singapore is known as the Lion City. Although it is just a sculpture you should visit it because the area has great view of the sea and there is also a smaller Merlion and lots of restaurants nearby too. Basically you can take lots of pictures there, including the floating platform where Singapore sometimes holds its National Day there on the 9th August every year. You can also see Marina Bay Sands hotel in the background. Good place for taking pictures

The Merlion is recognized by Singapore Tourism as a well known marketing icon, as a mascot and national personification of Singapore. In the statue of Merlion at Merlion Park it is depicted as mythological structure having a head of Lion and body of the fish. It is most similar to heraldic Sea Lion. The original Merlion statue was installed at Merlion Park during Year 1972. The statue is about 8.6 metre tall at Merlion Park, The water fountain flow from the mouth of statue continuously. This is must visit location while in Singapore, as it is considered a icon of Singapore.
Its great to see Singapore's lion but it was a little too busy which was unfortunate but go place to take photos

Beautiful clean and well worth more than a stop over when you passing through .... many attractions to see and things to do ..... Merlion Park is just the tip of the iceberg in this country. I have been here a few times is pass through's and stop overs .. be a local and enjoy the culinary delights from the street hawkers or if you want a seated place may restaurants are there for u to pick from.The arts can be experienced in many fine Museums (The Singapore Art Museum)(National Museum of Singapore) and their is even one for the kids .... and also it has a growing art scene for those whom enjoy the theater ... You can spend money here but also for a few dollars only you can enjoy the may cultural pleasures this country has to offer. I recommend you go to Universal Studios at one of their theme parks ... there is not enough space for me to comment on here .... i recommend you go and look and try for yourself,just as i always do .....

review_title: Boat tour is best way to see the Merlion
review_content: When in Singapore you have to see the Merlion. We took a boat from the quay and were able to get the best views and pictures of the Merlion and the park. Rather than fight the crowds, I suggest the boat trip.
This is the cult in Singapore! If you were in Singapore you have to see Merlion statue and take a photo with it :)

review_title: One of the main attractions in Singapore
review_content: The 8.7 metres tall half-fish, half-lion statue has become the icon of Singapore as it depicts their history and has many stories to its origin! It a must place to visit if you are in Singapore!

If you want to have an instagrammable spot for free in singapore, this place is definitely the right one. You can take a famous merlion background here. Also the famous marina bay sand building with beautiful color in the night.  This place is easily reach using mrt though.

This is the usual tourist hotspot that is disappointing when you get there. It isn't a park and is just a statue on the waters edge with water shooting from the mouth. Trying to take a decent picture is impossible with the hundreds of tourists all just standing around. Only visit if in the nearby area, if not then don't waste a special journey here.

Singapore is just a stone's throw away from the Philippines! One gets there within four hours from Manila or three hours and a half from Cebu by plane. One place I would recommend for first-time visitors would be the Merlion Park in the Marina Bay area. It offers you a wonderful view of the modern city, overlooking the famous Marina Bay Sands hotel, the Esplanade (mall and theater), skyscrapers, and so forth.  One must-see monument in the area, of course, is the water-spitting Merlion statue. It has become the symbol of Singapore itself since the country gained independence from the English crown way back in 1965. It depicts a mythological creature, half-fish (reminding us of the humble beginnings of Singapore as a fishing village) and half-lion (representing the local people's bravery and capacity to make giant leaps towards modernity). Another story has it that when the first Malay inhabitants arrived in the bay, they encountered a lion in the fishing village, which explains the half-fish, half-lion image.   There are many Merlion statues in Singapore. You may also want to visit Sentosa Island for a bigger version of it. However, the one at Merlion Park, which stands 8.6 meters tall, offers a more scenic view -- ideal for photo ops (although the area often gets quite crowded during the day). There is also a baby Merlion statue right behind the bigger one in the same area.  Once you get to Merlion Park, walk your way around the whole bay area until you reach Marina Bay Sands hotel on the other side, and from there cross over to visit another famous tourist spot in the city: the Gardens by the Bay.  Merlion Park is an open-air destination, so no need to pay. To get there, the easiest way is to take the MRT and get off at Raffles station and follow the signs to the park.
It's Singapore Pride But Tourists have calculated time and time is expensive .  May visit , if plenty if time in hand

review_title: Good to see if you're sight seeing but hot!
review_content: We spent a little bit of time at Merlion park. We are glad we went and took our kids ages 2, 8 and 9) but it was hot and pretty crowded. People love taking pictures with the statue so it was very crowded on the best picture-taking spot. We spent a little bit of time, got some ice cream and then headed somewhere more exciting for our kids ages 2, 8 and 9.

For those who visit Singapore for the first time, this is usually a must see and photograph place to visit. Awesome views of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the tall buildings of the CBD(Central Business District), along with the opportunity to take a boat cruise of the bay. There are a few spots to eat, but frankly if you visit this famous tourist attraction, that's probably not your number one reason for visiting. This park is easily accessible by MRT, taxi or Uber(cheaper option after the MRT). Probably the best time to visit is in the early morning or late afternoon hours, if you're not a fan of the heat and humidity along with a strong tropical sun. This is one of those places that you will have ample opportunity to get a great picture and enjoy a nice walk along the water while admiring the architecture and the Merlion statues.

We took our time going the park and the gardens and taking photos there are a lot of attractions within the Merlion Park and its a must see visit when you come to Singapore.  Take a bottle of water with you as you will be doing alot of walking
You have to try and cram everything in..... it's worth a visit. The heat got to me so take lots of water in your backpack. Take your camera to.

A night view of the Singapore sky line can be done here. Or a good view of the greenish Singapore river.  Merlion Statue is ordinary despite its size. Nice pubs and restaurants around.  Don't visit during day.
We visit Merlion at Marina bay during the night because not so hot and the view look great more than day time!! No entry free! We took Mrt. get off at raffles place then walk direct to Merlion park.
A cute merlion statue and a nice view of the bay provide nice backdrops for your photos. What's not to love?

Nice place to visit. But not at day time. One has t visit after 4 o clock because it is very hot in morning time. Its a place where Merlion statue, the symbol of Singapore is there. Can get pics with family or near ones.  We visited here in city tour and we got only 15 mins to see this and get pictures.

review_title: Wouldn't be a trip to Singapore without seeing the Merlion
review_content: You can take a lovely walk right along the bank to see the Merlion. Particularly nice to see as the sun sets! You don't need long here, but it is a must see!
It's was great night before leaving Singapore.one point you can see all the extremely beautiful architectural beauty of Singapore. Night with the lights make the place more beautiful.

The Merlion is the mascot of Singapore. And your trip would be incomplete if you dont visit the Merlion statue at the bay. Its a beautiful big white statue of half lion and half mermaid/fish. Take a lot of photos here and especially the one with the perspective of the water going in your mouth(instagrammers would know). beautiful sunset views and may get crowded..I went here late night...it was very serene..and less crowd..
If you visit Singapore for the first time, this is a must-go attraction to take some photos with the merlion.
Very nice place. Good to be at afternoon. Can enjoy Singapore cityscape. Good photo taking place. Young children enjoy a lot.
Just a neat spot to take some photos, be sure to time your photos for sunset because the casino across the bay looks great. Its a quick walk to Boat Quay for dinner afterwards.

review_title: Merlion, well known attraction in Singapore
review_content: Well-know attraction in Singapore. Nothing much to do there, only for photo taking. Also manage to take the photo of marina bay as background.

This is jewel in the crown for Singapore success story. You need to be there to feel it. Go on, and if you 're lucky to have not so dry humid day, you will love it. Glitzy skyscrapers all around, merlion lit up.

review_title: Great place for a walk or run
review_content: Well designed for a stroll or run. Many couples and families out enjoying the park. You could spend 30 minutes or a few hours if you explored the entire area.
We took the Underground to the Famous Merlion Statue, and it was very nice but very very busy. We went at week end. Very nice and clean, nice atmosphere.

This spot.. You can take a lot of foto.. With marina bay as the background... Singapore flyer.. The beautiful esplanade building... Also the merlion...   Of you walk near the Starbucks ... You can also.. Some heritage building...   For you who came to Singapore for the first time... This is the most favourite place to take photos...
Merlion park is very popular tourist destination.its photogenic destination.and another side of Singapore.good and pleasant atmosphere.
It was totally worth the cable ride. To experience such a beautiful park. The view from top is mesmerising.

When one is on business sometimes it is nice to just wander. I walked to Merlion Park after 9 pm and it was a perfect night. Beautiful clear evening with the various restaurants and bars offering their wares. Such a great little walk after dinner, feeling very safe wandering by myself. Definitely a nice spot to check out.
We went to merlion park in March, unfotunately merlion statue was under construction. We came at noon so we could see the beautifull scenary of lights.
it is wonderful experience to stay there in evening with family and friends,it is open place and free,there is no entry ticket.
Gets very busy so difficult to get that exceptional picture. Bigger Merlion on Sentosa island . Good bats and restaurants nearby.

review_title: Popular landmark of Singapore must visit
review_content: if you are tourist in Singapore don't mis to visit this one of the popular landmark of Singapore, this place is accessible in transportation from airport, you can use the MRT they have, and this place when i stop over in Singapore i always visit this...
Strolling around... beautiful view. You can get esplanade, marina bay sand and art science museum, singapore flyer and also merlion as a background.

review_title: One of the most polular spot in Singapore
review_content: The symbol of Singapore, already moved to a new place, the original Merlion still draws a lot of people as its is around some of the best surrounding in Singapore.

review_title: must visit land mark in singapore
review_content: these are the land marks u must visit at singapore. these are like the mandatories. its just the ico it represents it in the world famous lists. it about hte countries culture.  MUST VISIT
The symbol of the city. You should visit the place. From here you have a nice view of Marina Sands Bay Hotel.

We took a nice walk around Marina Bay and Merlion Park. You must visit to get up close to the symbol of Singapore. There is a lot of activity in the area, as it is a popular tourist area, especially at night. I recommend being there in the evening to watch the famous light show across the water at the the Marina Bay Sands. There are two nightly shows during the weekday (8:00pm and 9:00pm).

The experience at merlion park was not as per our expectation. The size of merlion was not very big and intact we have bigger Hindu idols like hanuman ji and shiv ji in India. The merlion made in sentosa island is bigger and more attractive. Must still a nice place to go once. And the view is amazing. You can see sky crappers and marina bay hotel.

If you are in Singapore, this is one thing u will not miss.. seeing the 'Merlion'. The place has brightness and shine to offer during the day but it's soothing and romantic in the evening. You'd love having a stroll there on the long stretch. Would recommend to visit at both times.

review_title: Must see symbolic park of Singapore. Nice location and beautiful view, loved.
review_content: Really enjoy looking around this Harbor front park. A nice and wide park sitting, overview whole Singapore high and modern buildings. Have to go and appreicate in person. :)
This is the most iconic symbol of Singapore in my own opinion, others are just a copy cat and a new marketing strategy.
It IS the Singapore Merlion. It is smaller than the Merlion in Sentosa. Has a nice viewing bay to see Marina Bay Sands and one can walk up to Esplanade.
It was amazing and wonderful.....avoid going in the afternoon...very sunny ....but beautifully designed and kept
Must visit at Sentosa park. Very enjoyable. And theres a light show in the night. Must see. They give a nice souvenir at the end as well.
Lots of tourist around. But beautiful place overlooking the bay. Just hang around look at the view or take a cruise of the river and bay area.
It's the national symbol.. it's just that.. nothing apart from the Merlion at that place..it's okay to visit if you find time.
Nice view from the spot Was crowded in the evening Many people wanting to take pics with the Merlion

Not a very promising place, but has a good feeler when you are at this place. There is a cool breeze, peaceful, offers you a cruise ride. Being a nation symbol for Singapore, its a nice place to take some clicks here.

review_title: Insanely busy on a Sunday afternoon
review_content: Came here today with my 3 year old son after visiting the nearby Asian Civilisations Museum. Being a Sunday it was just insanely busy with people everywhere snapping pictures. Yes it's a symbol of Singapore, but I'm not sure it's anything really spectacular. I recommend visiting early in the day to avoid the crowds.

This is not really a park but the name given to the area surrounding the Merlion Singapore’s iconic statue half fish and half lion symbolizing the cities early beginnings which stands looking across Marina Bay towards the sea and said to be ‘welcoming’ visitors to Singapore – always crowded - you can spend an amusing five minutes watching people trying to pose for that special photo! – look out also for a smaller version called the Cub which sits in a pond nearby

review_title: It feels nice to be here.
review_content: Very nice, its a tourism icone of Singapore. Nice to click pics here as you will be able to see many things from here.

Clean. Crowded. Family friendly. Just like much of Singapore, the park is an attraction and public space folded into one. It seems to attract locals as much as it does tourists, though the area surrounding the park is packed with expensive hotels, restaurants, and a highway.   Would not recommend walking over to the Marina Bay from here: too far.
This is a mandatory visit in Singapore. You have not been to Singapore unless you have visited this and taken a selfi here. Nice view of skyline, sea, high rises from here.
Very well maintained photogenic attracts lot of tourists, must see place , great scenic beauty, and fun seeing lot of people taking pictures and giving multiple and funny posses .
Merlion Park is a bustling area after dark with several restuarants and bars that come to life in the evenings.
It's easy to find, sitting right on Marina Bay Promenade. It's a fountain. Not much more to say than that.

review_title: nice for a lazy afternoon stroll
review_content: it's nowt special, its much like any other huge outdoor space with different water features. although to be fair I did enjoy walking around, it's mostly wheelchair friendly and on a nice day pack a picnic and relax.
just a small park with a fountain. Hard to find 100 words to describe it ;) But it is a symbol of Sg so it is a must have

review_title: See it by all means (but don't go out of your way).
review_content: I think the title says it all really. See it by all means (but don't go out of your way). The Merlin is a recently created (1940s) symbol of Singapore representing a sea serpent (tail) and lion (head).
i have visited this place during my tour to singapore and i have visited along with other places also. without looking this your singapore trip is not finished.
Hot and busy spot should go early or bring hand fan but can walk along the river to other places  Easy to get to MRT Raffles Place station (Exit H) and walk for 5 minutes

review_title: Must visit in Singapore best time is around 4-8 pm
review_content: Best time is 4-8 pm you can spend some time clicking pictures having a walk around the park , there are nice bars and restaurants near the place  U can take a boat ride and take a walk to the central Singapore , the main market and the financial district is near by

The best of Singapore for trip which includes Children. Lots of rides and shows. The place was super clean with lots of restaurants around . Sky train Around the place made it very easy to travel around. Must visit
Wandered down here early one morning thinking we were going to miss the crowds. How wrong we were. There were hundreds there off cruise ships but we got lots of photos. Nice attraction.
This is a must see in Singapore, we went here in The evening and the merlion is nicely lit up. Plenty of space so it's not crowded.
A lion park with waterfall from her mouth and it's a good photo taking place and thier are good restaurants

We actually took our photos from the bridge going over the harbour/river as it gave a better and more traditional view. The view from the water would have been excellent. I have always wanted to see the merlion, so that is a tick on my bucket list!

Probably a "must-do' to visit this place with the famous "half lion/half fish statue". However the place is always very busy, as everyone wants a picture with the Merlion. Good spot to take pictures from Marina bay. Restaurants and bars in this area are very expensive as you pay for the view.
Merlion means Mermaid-Lion. Very good place to visit during evening. You will get wonderful of laser show from MBS. Boating in the river is another attraction in this place.

review_title: Nice walk from Marina Bay Sands
review_content: Takes about 30 mins to leisurely stroll here from the Marina Bay Sands Hotel around the edge of the bay - when I did it there was dragon boat racing going on to enjoy too. The Merlion wasn't as big as I thought once I got there though.

Was a windy day with live band. Kids enjoy with the cruise during the sunset. The cruise driver is very good hospitality to allow my kids trying on driving the cruise for photo taking. The cruise is playing the video to show the history of Singapore and the place that we pass by in the cruises.my daugther start doing her sketching and remark in the scene she see. The whole cruise taking about 40min with SGD 15 for kids, SGD 25 for adults.  Good place and strongly recommend for family with young children.
The symbol of the city! I guess that makes it a must, even though it's a funny looking little guy! Take a pic catching the water!

review_title: A must visit place in SG
review_content: Merlion park is the centre of attractions in Singapore. The place is well maintained with clean roads and loads of restaurants and shopping centres. Views offering the Marina bay sands hotel is fantastic. Quiet and beautiful place. A must visit place in SG.

review_title: Good to see but not a lot going on
review_content: Went as part of our walk round the bay and apart from the Merlion itself there is really nothing else. The restaurants and bars around it are eyewatering £10UK for a bottle of water and a coke! Go and see it but be careful if you sit at the bars as you will pay for it.
Very popular place for tourists, and hot. There is no shade and is surrounded by concrete it becomes a little uncomfortable especially in the afternoon. Worth a visit but go early to beat the heat.
This place is very much popular for breath taking photos and the park is one of kind where the statues is half lion and mermaid which has to be surely visited to know the history behind it

review_title: Great to visit but disappointed with some tourist behaviour
review_content: Packed with tourist day and night, especially tour groups only care about them self, but this is a must see if visiting Singapore.

review_title: Nice park ! And must visit in Singapore
review_content: The Merlion park is in the center of the city which is nice to watch in the day time but in night it become all the more beautiful  So the best time to visit it around 4-5 and can spend few hours over there click photos with Merina bay sands hotel in background  U and enjoy a nice beer , coffee and icecream over there
The iconic of SG. Must visited place. It's quite far from Raffle place MRT. You can walk easily to Merlion Park

The Merlion is synonymous to Singapore, it's a must visit if you have the time. Just be ready for the hordes of tourist and the tons of camera. However on a bright sunny day, it's a wonderful place to go for a walk and look at everything.
It's OK, there wasn't much there, but it's worth seeing the Merlion as it's the symbol of Singapore.

Use sunscreen & bring water, protect yourself, it's very hot and not so many shady place around the Merlion. Not sure what is the good time to come as it always looks busy. There's some cafe around, wide options for snacks.
We went to Merlion Park twice. This was the second visit. Many tourists took picture here. We came here around 5pm ( the best time ).
The best view of Marina Bay Sands.buy beer in 7/11 and just come and admire. The best before sunset and stay after sunset.

Lovely to walk round the bay. Take in the views and stop by the merlion for a picture. There are bay tours too. Lots of nice places for lunch or a drink. You can easily walk round the bay and across some impressive bridges for more views.
The symbol of Singapore shines in this magnificent park. The majestic Merlion spouts water from its mouth and is the source of countless photo-ops.

A cool big Merlion and an adorable baby Merlion rest against an impressive backdrop, with Marina Bay Sands across the bay and the financial district not far away. Sure, you won't spend a ton of time here, but it's free and beautiful and -- at least in my opinion -- the Merlion is a fantastic city mascot.
