Merlion Park offers the best view of the Marina Bay Sands thier where various resturants and cafe however we did not eat them. Also when crossing the Merlion Bridge you get a great view of the Tall buildings of Metrpolitan Singapore recommend visisting their for photos or dineing !
The Merlion is the mascot of Singapore. This is an unimpressive statue of the Merlion with water shooting out of his/her mouth.

review_title: Singapore Visit incomplete without this one!
review_content: The Merlion Statue is the iconic landmark of Singapore and your Singapore vacay is definitely incomplete if you don't come here... The place is extremely crowded both during the day and at night, quite obvious as it is THE photo stop for every other tourist! A must visit though you may choose to spend less than an hour over here!
A simple place where people drop by for photo ops. One of Singapore trademark, every tourist make sure they have a picture at Merlion Park.
Merlion Park is always a good place to visit. More Merlions and the water is a relaxing place to sit and ponder.

review_title: Symbol of the City with Bay Views
review_content: Very busy with visitors from all over the world and that is part of the attraction - people watching! Just go with the flow, wait your turn for the obligatory photo with the Merlion and make sure you don't get poked in the eye with a selfie stick!

review_title: A Place to Gather WIth Your Friends
review_content: The statue of Merlion, the symbol of Singapore so it's kinda a must visit place in Singapore. The place is crowded with people so if you travel with friends, you guys could hang around this place and talk. But if you're traveling alone it's no use to stay at this place for long, just few minutes will do. Be careful with some people who ask you to hang around with them, you don't know if it's some kind of fraud or something else. Better be cautious than sorry!

The good thing when your a tourist in singapore is you get a privilege to avail the singapore tourist pass which is consumbale for 3 days so the choice of place to visit is yours. and with this place i suggest is a must too. no merlion no singapore! the view is breathtaking! thank you for this one singapore!

A very important landmark in Singapore. Singapore tour is not complete w/o it. There are lots of food stalls around too if you get famished. There are cheaper stalls under the Esplanade Bridge. Be reminded that feeding the pigeons is not allowed.

It's the symbol of Singapore and is so easy to get too you should really try to visit! There's great views available whilst your there,and if the big Merlion is undergoing a cleaning session then there's a smaller baby Merlion statue to see too. There's plenty of refreshment places around too. How to get there? I took the North/South line on the MRT (the red coloured line) and got off at Raffles Place (NS26) then headed straight ahead to the river and turned left towards the Fullerton Hotel (a lovely scenic walk with great photo ops). The Merlion Park is across the (BIG) road in front of the Fullerton Hotel.  Overall I'm glad I went to see it and get some great pics!

review_title: A must-see in Singapore - but share it with the world
review_content: The "park" is a small area close by the major throughfare past the Fullerton and the mandatory stop for all sightseing tours of Singapore, so come prepared for a crowd! But it does provide a brilliant view of the bay with Marina Bay Sands as the spectacular backdrop, a view which is not often shown when promoting Singapore in the media. Calling it a park is stretching it a bit as the major green components are the few trees providing much appreciated shade in the midday sun.

From the Marina Bay Sands, you can see the small Merlion Figure, walking through the river side took about 1 hour walking with strollers and kids while enjoying the view of tall buildings, hotels, and commercial properties, and the river.  The Merlion is the best spot to see how bounty the place.. with collaboration famous names in the world brands and perfectly advertised companies...  The Sg Pride!  Amazing!

I was excited to be here but not as much as I had thought I'd be. Again nice place to visit but nothing like I imagined it to be.. though it's an iconic landmark of singapore but EOD it's a statue spitting water..  But yes you can easily spend a few hours here.. but mind well it's going to be sweaty.. it's crowded and hot there..   But easily accessible through MRT. Reach Raffles Place and then walk across the bank of the river and you'll reach there.. spend a few hours clicking photos and then walk to marina bay sands (long walk but a nice one)..  You can also take a ferry..
You can't visit Singapore without taking a few holiday pictures with the statue of the merlion in the distance.This is also a great spot to walk around and take in the sights of the city.

I think the Merlion represents the old and new Singapore, but you'd need to fact check. We saw the statue on foot and by boat, and would recommend getting a night cruise and experiencing it that way. Less crowded and cooler, and really although it's an impressive structure there really isn't a lot to see. Worth a look, but plan it on the way to somewhere:)
It's definitely a tourist attraction. Wanted to check it out because most travel shows I watched featuring Singapore would show this landmark.

Your Singapore visit can not be completed without viewing this place. I visited the place on the last day and still feel that i should have gone there earlier. Nice views and Photogenic places for everyone. I sat there for quite long time and it was quite relaxing.
With a good view, a water fountain and a few shops nearby can easily spend a couple of hours. Very clean and open. Great place for selfie photos.

No doubt a popular tourist site as that's how lion city historically originated. Can be crowded as all jostle for position to take photos. It is a nice place to stroll along the esplanade and view the skyline on this part of Singapore. After that you can follow the path through the helix bridge to Marina Bay.

When you first enter this venue you don't immediately realize it's a nice place with full of surprises. As your eyes settle to the dim light inside and you notice sea creatures on display only then it dawns on you the importance of the arrangement. Interestingly enough artifacts on display suddenly come alive on your camera-eye and the pics become illuminated. Then mystery of place unfolds and you get to see the cavern in totally a new perspective. Very pleasing indeed. Next you are taken to a brief documentary which gives you a quick background info before you go up thru lift to tour Merlion mouth from within. Here you can strike the bell and make a wish before entering Merlion's jaws. Afterwards You can also climb stairs all the way up to have a look of Sentosa Island from atop Merlion. Oh I forgot to mention by the Lift you get a golden coin with Merlion face embossed for keepsake. A nice memorabilia!
Merlion park is great spot for photos and enjoying the beautiful climate in Singapore, catch one of the river boats to really highlight the beauty of the park.

Must see in Singapore!  This park is very busy location of taking photos but it was fun.   Many people watching, very crowded with visitors from all the world!  I stopped by here in afternoon, buy in the night time, it's beautiful too.   For sure this iconic and popular landmark not to be missed!   However, do not make the Merlion Park district the only reason to be.

A more of a tick in the box sight seeing in Singapore, Merlion being the signature icon here.  Walk around the Fullerton Hotel is awesome and one would enjoy taking pictures there for sure. Can go for a river cruise if you want spend $25. Having snacks at the food stalls is not a bad idea.  Would recommend to go in the evening.

review_title: great place for photography with the merlion,mbs and flyer
review_content: its a must to go place which is hardly any distance from the main city.... this is a great place for photography with the merlion, marina bay sands hotel and also flyer. after all the merlion is the symbol of Singapore

review_title: The Lion that is mixed Mermaid. Equals Merlion.
review_content: Walking around this area can be a bit packed with people and their cameras/ cellphones taking selfies etc. There are plenty of food stalls along the way and beautiful scenery.

This park is fun - great people watching, crowded with people from all over the world, taking selfies and family pictures. You have to be in a zen space if this sort of thing bothers you. But it's worth it. The views of Marina Bay Sands and downtown are amazing. I stopped by here in late afternoon and then in the dark and it's beautiful at both times. The Merlion itself is a neat story/legend. Definitely not to be missed.

Visiting the Merlion Park is a must for travelers to Singapore. It is always a nice spot for souvenir photos. However, one may have to chance a time where there are less tourists.   Always nice to visit the Park. Marina Bay Sands, The Esplanade and SIngapore Flyer can be seen from the deck. A few steps away is a souvenir shop and above it a Starbucks Coffee for weary travelers.
Best views of the marina bay and check out the history of this area when it was the waterfront of the original Singapore

We went past here by bus and by boat. Catching the boat around the harbour really gives you the best views and photos of the Merlion as the area around it seems packed with people at all times of the day
Lots of merlions everywhere. Lots of Chinese people taking photos. Not really sure what all the fuss is about.

Go to Merlion Park & you get to see some beautiful human creations.   The Singapore Flyer; similar but better to London Eye, it rotates inwards bringing wealth to this beautiful country.   The containing palm which is the business center where the palm holds Singapore 's wealth, near the Marina Bay Sands in shape of a "Wealth Containing Palm".  The Marina Bay Sands curving along as the adjacent coast curves.   Ladies can have a view & visit to Loui Vuitton outlet there.  Singapore in a beautiful country with strict rules.

Merlion park which is facing the backwaters and the marina bay sands is situated in the middle of the business hub of the city.. An enchanting place for the nature lovers who can experience the cold breeze with the astonishing buildings around. A good walk from Clarke Quay multifolds the enjoyment...

This place has some great photo opportunities for some of Singapore's attractions - Marina Bay Sands, the flyer, Art Science museum etc. Not worth a special visit but if you're nearby stop by for a few pictures. Very busy for what it is
Greet place to hang out during the day ,great for taking pictures and some lovely hotels close by where you can go for a beer or tea, worth a visit in your Singapore
Nice view. Lovely place to be. A lot of tourist. Mustsee of Singapore. Hot in the summer. Enjoy the view.
I went in the evening and found this place is very lively with cheerful crowd. You can get a nice photo location to cover Marina Bay from here
Things you have to do in spore.  Take so many pictures.  Better to go there in the morning.  Dont forget to buy ice cream sandwich singaporean classic

Must visit on a trip to Singapore. Amazing view of the skyline of Singapore with Marina Bay Sands on one end. Gets crowded during weekends. Preferably better to visit on the evening when the sun is about to set. Picturesque spot

I think no trip to Singapore is complete without a Merlion shot. This Merlion Park, I think, is the most accessible. You can walk to take good pictures, and you'll pass by the area via most bus tours too.

The whole scene here is super fun. Yes it is a little crazy with all the selfies going on, but it's worth it to see such an icon. The whole scene is great especially towards the end of the day. You can see the cityscape, the marina bay hotel across the bay, the flyer (ferris wheel), and the esplanade theatre, walk on the new jubilee bridge, and see the sun setting behind you and the lights come on the Helex bridge and the buildings etc. It's also easy to get to if you ride to the Esplanade MRT and is a short walk for the kids. Only con is that everything around there to eat is really really expensive. You might want to just get something along the way and enjoy it while you sit on the steps.
Just came here by myself and walked the promenade. It is very beautiful and it also shows how amazing this country is. The view of Marina Bay is stunning at anytime.
Its nice to take photo graph to memory in Singapore visit don forget to take photograph with your own creation

We visited the Merlion Park both in the night and day. We took a walk all the way to Marina Bay Sands in the night under lights and it was a really beautiful scene. We were there on a Saturday night and there was a live band performing too, This place is a must visit after 8 pm to see it under lights
What more you can ask for if you get to see all the main tourist attractions in one go. Flyer's Eye,Marina Bay Sans,Merlion Park and the Business centre. It is the best place to click photos.

Merlion park is mostly crowded with peoples trying to click pics in different poses.its close to flyer and marina bay so you can visit this place quickly for some pics and if you want you sit and relax in nearby restaurnets. there are also boat rides available.

Every tourist I think pass by this park. This is a good jump point for Marina Bay. Can get very crowded as pack of tourist seems to all come here.  There are two Merlion, a smaller one can be found at the side of the park.  and the most pictured statue is the one facing Marina Bay.  another Merlion can also be found in Sentosa.
This is a view and place everybody who comes to Singapore has to visit. Great views and it has a history you gotta learn. There are restaurants and coffee shops around. Price : Sgd 0

Such a great spot with the Merlion sitting proudly in front of the city buildings, a great combination of views with Marina Bay Sands opposite. A great place to be for the light show at Marina Bay Sands and also see the Merlion lit up at night.
The night view is as amazing as day. Lights in night and water sound around makes a perfect place to have a walk by the side and just sit there and have a calm evening.

Visited Merlion Park with family on my 5 year old daughter's birthday. She had an amazing time seeing the Merlion. One can get a great view of Marina Bay Sands from here. One can also take a bumboat river cruise your from here. Truly a wonderful experience.
Good place to click photos, know the history of merlion and you will love the place. Great view of Marina and financial town.
Should visit during evening time.. Nice weather + Beautiful scenery. A place you can relax after a long walk.

While in the Marina Bay Area this is one of the main attractions which are all mainly set around the bay.  All of these attractions including the gardens and the Marina Bay hotel etc are within 30 / 45 mins walk of one another.
I'm pretty sure everyone knows the Merlion before they ever travel to Singapore so just like my father, he had to come here to take the photo and enjoy the view to Marina bay.

Came here as part of a tour and this is an amazing structure in the Marina Bay Area, lots and lots of tourists grabbing photo opportunities, we also visited as part of a river cruise so you get a different aspect from the front of this half lion half fish statue
If you go to Singapore and don't visit the Merlion park, then you really haven't been to Singapore. It's the country's symbol. It's a fish! It's a lion! It's a big cat with fish tail <3
Despite the Merlion is famous as the icon of Singapore, there isn't much to expect from a statue. Only worth taking a photo, as you need to force yourself through large groups of China tourists.

i know that the Merlion has become a symbol of Singapore; and i know that the Merlion now has a cub too but braving the hundreds of selfie taking people to be able to see this iconic place takes some fortitude. It is very popular and is very busy. It is worthwhile going tothe park to see the Bay and the areas around it but don't make the Merlion Park the only reason to be there.

review_title: Drop By This Landmark For A Photo Op
review_content: The Merlion Park mainly consists of a statue of the Merlion, which is a half-lion half-fish icon. The spouting water offers a refreshing spray in Singapore's heat. You can take photographs or take a river cruise. While there isn't all that much to do, it's worth popping by if you are in the Marina Bay area, since the Merlion Park is one of the landmarks of Singapore.  The Merlion Park is accessible from the Esplanade via the Jubilee Bridge. The Jubilee Bridge itself is significant as it was opened as part of Singapore's 50th birthday celebrations.

I hopped of a river boat to take a closer look at this Singapore icon. It is almost compulsory, as it is featured on almost every item of tourist paraphernalia in the city. It is nice enough, but viewing it from afar is probably sufficient.   While in this neighborhood, stroll across to the classic Fullerton Hotel, and enjoy a coffee in the ambiance of yesteryear in the lobby.
I recommend that you visit there during night time. The view is surreal because of the show. It has music with matching lights.
Wow what a structure. Do visit this place in the evening as it has lots of cleaned place where you can sit and enjoy the cool breeze and stunning view of the skyscrapers of Singapore

review_title: Testament to the City-States Past and Future
review_content: Merlion Park is a must see site for tourists! The site boats beautiful views of Singapore's Central Business District, and also blends the old and the new very well.
One of the must visit place while touring singapore. Good for clicking selfies and stroll in the evening.

review_title: The famous sight of the city !
review_content: The white lion of Singapore, which now pulls out water for the renewal of the sea, which is quite dirty. Famous shooting point for every tourist in the city, beautiful and impressive area, relatively easy access to nearby metro station ...

A nice enough sculpture and of passing interest. It is featured in all the guide books so as a visitor you are compelled to go and have a look. By all means go and tick it off the list but combine it with a walk across the helix bridge or something else in the vicinity so you don't waste a lot of time.

An impressive monument that spouts water into Marina Bay. Very crowded with most of the Asian population wanting photographs with the water being portrayed as going into their mouths. Good views across the bay to the Arts and Science Museum and the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.
The iconic statue that represented Singapore. The statue is combine with Lion Head and Body with Fish tail.
If your on the bay, you might as well visit the town icon. Loads of tourists will join you in getting just the right photo of the water spewing king of Singapore.

This is a must see place when we come to Singapore. There is a lot of people surrounding the lion statue. I have to wait for a while to get a good spot for photo taken. I think this place is a lot prettier at night when the merlion's and surroundings lights are on, it's so beautiful.
Worth a visit if you're nearby, however I found it better to do a river cruise as you get to go right past the front and they explain the history behind it all.

review_title: Everyone goes here, but its boring.
review_content: Its got a great view of the bay and downtown, but a sculpture spitting out water is a bit boring. nonetheless, go see, you won't feel you have been here otherwise.
When you go to Singapore, it won't be valid if you didn't go here and take some pics with the half-lion-half-seahorse.

This is very popular for photo opportunities. There are great views across to Marina Bay hotel & Singapore Flyer. Opposite Fullerton Hotel and about 5 minutes from MRT. There are also Harbour cruises available and a few cafes and food/drink stalls. As it is very hot you will need to keep hydrated.

really far from bus stop/mrt, about 800m(unsure) ! there are too many people taking pictures. however its a really nice place for sightseeing, there are restaurants nearby and seats where you can view the merlion statue, marina bay and other tall buildings~

This is just an ok place. There's nothing here to see except having a selfie with the Merlion. That's it. People come here in sun. Have a selfie with the Merlion and then there's another mini Merlion. That's it.
Visited the MerLion Park at night when the lights of all the surrounding buildings decorated the night sky
It is very beautiflul when you visit Merlion Park at night. It is quiet and not so crowded compared with other place of interest.
We went by boat from Clarke Quay along the Singapore River. This was a great way to see Singapore from a different angle. The Lion was one of many things to see.
The merlion is a fairly new statue located at lakeside of marina bay. Very crowded by mostly Chinese tourists. If you do have spare time go there and take a picture otherwise leave it out.

review_title: Nothing special for the main city landmark
review_content: Make sure to know the story of the Merlion at least, since the statue and the whole location itself has zero charme.
We went both day and night and the views of the MBS and bay are amazing, also the Merlion fountain is pretty cool, very crowded and lots of tourists but to be expected.  Worth a visit

Cool place to take a picture, selfie or just to chill out and enjoy the spectacular view over the marina bay and the the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. What? You don't know the legend of the lion? Ok, no problem, here it is: "In the 14th century, the prince of Sumatra of the hindu Kingdom Sri Vjaya married the princess of the buddhist Kingdom of Mjapahir. Later on he got in trouble because of it and had to flee from Sumatra to Temasek (the city at the sea). On his way, he met a lion in the jungle. He was scared and he was ready to fight him, but after a while staring at themselves, they saw themselves at equal, turned around and passed each other. The prince was so fascinated of that encounter, he decided to rename the city of Temasek to Singapore (Singha = Lion; pura = city). From that moment onwards the landmark of Singapore was the "Merlion", half lion because of his strength and half mermaid to show the closeness to the sea. The mistake in that story would be that at this time there were no lions in this area, so it probably was a tiger!"

The place is very small and really just the Merlion statue there worth seeing. It's right at the Marina Bay so it is worth a visit when you are already in that area. Nice views all around to the Sands building, downtown financial core of buildings and the beautiful bay.
I really enjoyed the Merlion park, from its individuality to where it is located it is such an icon of Singapore.
The country symbol place is crowded but beautiful. If climate is open and clear, you may have nice time over there.
The merlion symbol of singapore is located at such a nice location. The view of marina bay sands in the background combined with the river boat ride was excellent .

review_title: Take a gondola ride to an island of adventures
review_content: Take a gondola ride across the harbour and enjoy the scenery and sunshine. Merlion Park is home to many varied exhibitions to delight and mystify every member of the family. From butterflies, insects, exotic birds, 4D cinemas, arts, crafts, restaurants, the Merlion statue lookout and an aquarium that must be seen to be believed.  Every turn delivers new opportunities for fabulous selfies or group photos to build a memorable holiday album that will leave friends envious.

review_title: Worth place to click lot off photos
review_content: Merlion Park is the place where you can the Merlion throwing water all the time. You can also see Esplanade, Floating Football Stadium, The Marina Bay Sands hotel and some huge buildings in CBD.

review_title: Must see during day and/or night
review_content: I like to walk here during day and night. Its cool for taking pictures and also take a look around. From here you have also a very good view to Marina Bay Sands and the bay.   Some good ideas for pictures you will find also in the internet...

It was a good place to hangout, taking photograps especially during late evening and sunset till night. Many shops and cafes around if you want to avoid crowds at the pier. You can take boat tour from here to see Singapore from its river

Located just east of the Fullerton Hotel is this iconic Singapore landmark that is a must-see for all visitors. When you first cross the Esplanade Drive road and go down the stairs to get to the concrete park, you will be greeted by the Merlion fountain (first photo in this profile).  When I went on a cloudy, rainy day I first saw this fountain and small Merlion and I said, "That's it?! It's so small!" Surprise. Hidden by the tree branches and the gloomy weather was the BIG one - the real one. OK, that's more like it.   The big one is really large, and definitely worth visiting and taking pictures of. Depending on where you stand you can take photos with the Marina Bay Sands in the background or with the Fullerton Hotel in the background.   The closest MRT station is Raffles Place (both EW and NS lines); walking distance.
A must for tourists to visit. Every visitor to Singapore would want to take a picture with our national symbol which is half lion and half fish.
Nice place for some fotoshooting around the bay, seems like everybody visiting Singapore comes here from around the world

review_title: Do Not Miss the Smaller One
review_content: First thing first. I checked the Merlion. Do not forget to check the smaller one behind the larger and famous one. Actually there are five official Merlions in Singapore recognized by the Singapore Tourism Board, who owns the copyright of the Merlion. You can find two of them here.

The Merlion, a cross between a lion and a fish. Quite symbolic of Singapore. This giant sculpture shoots a water jet from its mouth into Marina Bay. Very popular with tourists especially those with a bent to form poses in front of the pouring spout. Similar to the leaning tower. It is fun to watch them. Very popular and once done you can take in the Esplanade walk and other tourist vantage points.
Always great view. Place so iconic. Photo stop that tells you to everyone you come to Singapore. Must visit event come here many times
If u r gng for 1st time do visit the place... Nice place with cleaniness.. U can view marina bay from thr... Photoshot place... Nice photography...

review_title: Small piece of the river experience
review_content: Nice spot to stop and take a few pictures but you really don't need more than a 1/2 to 1 hour at location

review_title: Packed. But worth going for some pictures
review_content: This place is always packed with tourists taking pictures. Best time to go is early morning. This place, and anywhere around the bay, offer great views of the marina Bay sands or the Bay.

review_title: Nice views but too touristy for my liking
review_content: Great unobstructed views of some of Singapore's iconic buildings. The Merlion was nice but not something I'd go out of my way to see again. If anything watching the tourists pose around it make for a more entertaining time.
Very nice location next to the water. Walking distance to the MRT.  It has lovely views and a great location of talking pictures
It's very clean and there are lots of spots for tourists... though I was disappointed it didn't light up at night- unlike the one at sentona which did and looked amazing!
Great place for photos of surrounding waters and buildings top photo shots  The story of how Singapore was founded by a person seeing a lion in 1200 and a mermaid hence the name Merloin park
So many people for just a nice water fountain, yes nice but too crowded in the morning when we went. May get better latter when the buses are gone.
Beautiful location and have some great pictures with family. Worth visiting. All the important places can be seen from the Merlion Park. Great view.
A must go place for tourist to get a photo with the merlion! Good place for a romantic walk at night with your loved ones!
As a landmark of Singapore, you must visit this place ,nearly with others tourist activity and recommended for a romantic trip on night view
Your trip to SIngapore will never be complete without having a photo with the iconic merlion. However there are always lots of tourist so taking the perfect shot is quite a challenge.
The landmark of Singapore and one shouldn't miss it! There's a big merlion and a small one now. This place is always crowded so it's hard to get a good photo spot...
A good view to visit. A place to stroll in the evening. Lot of places around for some good photographs / selfies as well. Respect the place...

One of the most major attractions of Singapore. I have visited this place in the evening time. Had a cup of coffee from Starbucks and walked around. An awesome place to spend your evening in leisure with wonderful view beside water body having options of River Cruize by Singapore River Cruise Service. From here, Marina Bay sand Hotel, Fullerton Hotel, Singapore Flyer and major commercial district is easily visible and accessible.

review_title: Quick visit for photos and city views
review_content: Wonderful area to take panoramic photos from here because you can see all the major landmarks from the Merlion. Also not to busy if there is nothing happening. Lion itself nothing special and I believe the bridge was erected to celebrate 50 year independence.

We visited this in April, lovely views across the lake , you access the merlion water feature across the jubilee bridge , it get very busy as this is a major visitor attraction, there are shops and food outlets to the right, parking is a is limited from what we could see. It was mainly coaches who dropped off and parked elsewhere. Temperatures were in the 30's so take some water.  Definitely worth a visit if you stand at the end of the landing ,take picture inline and it looks like the merlion fountain is giving you a drink, bit of fun for you photos.
Just see and enjoy . only nice taking look nothing very special.But we can watch this as a special as a great.

The symbol of Singapore - it's a total must see when you come here. Despite the crowds, of you are patient enough, you can get a good photo. But more than that it's a great way to learn the beginnings of Singapore as a fishing village.
Very interesting part of the harbor area to visit especially if you young children. Lots of tourist in this part of the city. Short. Walk from the MRT and various other sites.
The famous Merlion - the symbol for Singapore tourism...it offers a good pictorial background. Do visit when around.

review_title: Great Place but not a must see
review_content: We stopped here from the Hop On Hop Off bus to see it. It is a cool thing to see but would not say a must do. Statue with water shooting out if it's mouth.

despite of constant crowd visit to this well-known landmark of Singapore, I'm impress that the nearby public toilet was so well-maintained and even easily accessible by those group that needs special care.

Merlion can be viewed close up without the crowds by taking a river boat ride from Clark Quay or duck boat tour which either one will stop directly in front of this icon on the bay....photo moment here .

review_title: Great view of SG Skyline and Marine bay
review_content: A must visit place. Strongly suggest to go in the evening to enjoy the dusk views, lighting around the skyline and Marina bay.

This place was part of our city tour in the morning but we passed by already the night before because we were told that its more beautiful at night with all the lights, true enough, it really was beautiful!

review_title: Half Mermaid, half lion......perhaps the most photographed icon in Singapore
review_content: It's a MUST! You have to walk around here and take that photo with the Merlion! You haven't been to Singapore if you don't!
A sight that is worthwhile seeing as you pass by but which would not warrant a separate specific journey to see it alone. Suggest it is used as part of a familiarisation walkabout.

We know that this is the most iconic landmark in Singapore.  So as it's name this is of course the most must visit place in singapore, if at least for the first time. Though this place is only sight viewing and taking picture, there's is a boat you can pay to have a tour nearby but i didn't try that.  As the most popular place in Singapore, i can say this place is always full of tourist.  But, i can give you tips, that is, you better to visit this at sunrise. Beside there is only few almost no one at this hour, this is also the best place to have a sunrise view at singapore. Most iconic landmark + sunrise = is just stunning

Again a wonder to visit and admire, whether you see it from the water on a river cruise or attend the Merlion on land The Merlion has been slightly moved to a new location, which is fantastic to view There is also the new baby merlion statue at the rear of the merlion

The merlion itself is very cool and there are some great photo ops. This whole area is nice to walk around and we even walked across via the underpass to the Fullerton Hotel (beautiful).  However, it is very crowded and we found the tour groups to be very rude and constantly pushing in front of us. I know they are probably on a schedule, but there is no need to be so inconsiderate. I got really sick of this and it dampened the experience.  Great views of Marina Bay Sands and a must see even with the crazy groups.

You should not miss this if you are visiting Singapore but here are my suggestions: a. visit by day - if you like a good picture and if you don't mind the blazing sun. b. visit by night - if you want a nice view of Singapore's skyline but low quality of picture.
On our recent trip to Singapore thru Make My Trip we went to Merlion Park.. A must visit photo stop for all visitors. Icon of Singapore..

The Merlion Park is conveniently located near the Central Business district. It is a major landmark. The Merlion is a mythical creature with the head of a lion and body of a fish. No trip to Singapore is complete without a stop and a photo.

review_title: A very popular focal point of Singapore
review_content: We passed by (and stopped to take photos) a few times while in Singapore. It's certainly very popular for selfies, and photos generally, and especially so as nightfall approaches. Can get quite crowded, but there's plenty of vantage points.

This Merlion Park is where the iconic Merlion statue located. Good location to take your pictures with you family or your selfies.  Its an ideal location to watch the sun goes down. It is a must visit location if you visited Singapore, albeit it's always crowded.  The location is within proximity to One Fullerton which has many dining option. Also you can start your Singapore Rivercruise from this area.

The Singapore Merlion is the national personification of Singapore. So it is basically a must go see... but... I advise not to go during the day... too hot... and way too many tourists... at night everything is beautifully lit and no tourists... best time between 11pm and midnight...

Well worth a visit even if just for the views and photographs. The views of the corporate buildings in the background make for a nice photo at night. A lot of people were attempting the 'water into my mouth' pose which was fairly entertaining in itself.   If you continue walking over the bridge you end up at the Escalade where at the weekends there are free music shows. There are also bars and restaurants there.   There are also seafront restaurants/bars along the park area (behind the Merlion statue) with great views of the Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer.
When you are in Singapore, you have to take that picture with 'Merlion', right? Well... that is what we did.  It always looks nicer on pictures and clips then when you are realy there)

review_title: Merlion Park Great Place for Photos
review_content: This spot is perfect for photos! It was crowded today with what felt like thousands of people taking selfies. Fun high energy everywhere you look.

review_title: Must stop and see the lion fountain
review_content: If a tourist to Singapore you must see the Merlion fountain which is the national symbol. Nice city and harbor views, good for picture taking.
Overall satisfied in the service during our conference workshop. Food is overwhelming. Various cuisine to choose from.

Basically this is fish's body with lion which is the symbol of singapore so when you visit singapore one must stop at this there is beautiful view opposite to it. there are many small shops close by when you walk from main road to this point. and there is a Starbucks too at the main road.  one must visit this if you visit singapore

review_title: Nothing great, but one mandatory visit
review_content: Every city has one iconic landmark, this is the one for Singapore. Avoid visiting it during day time as it gets very hot. Try it during evening. Though we visited it in day time only, and it was Sunday, so good number of people were there.  It has some nice restaurants and coffee shops around. You can visit and then have a relaxing coffee break in air conditioner :). Only thing to do here is clicking pictures, which everyone was doing. So lots of crowd around it.   There is also a river ride, you can avoid that, nothing much about it, just some rounds in the boat.
From this spot, you can see a brilliant view of the city with a lot of great buildings including Marina bay sands hotel.
Merlion Park- you have to hydrate, blobs of sunblock and use an umbrella! Tourists everywhere so pick your own special photo op with the Merlion- half dragon half fish.

This place is huge and attracts a lot of tourists. You can see people coming for evening walks/jogs. It is lovely to walk by the water with such beautiful architectures around. The picture with the Merlion is mandatory here :D

merlion park is a must for people who visit singapore. Take picture there, its an icon for singapore.  You can find also Merlion statue at Sentosa Island.. Every new year, this place always crowded full with people who want to celebrate NY

This was one place I wanted to go and when I first went the actual Merlion was 'closed' for cleaning but was reopening about a week later. The rest of the area was fine however and a great place to meet people from all around the world. There was free entertainment and plenty of spots for good views. When I returned about a week later the Merlion was open and it really seemed to add an even better atmosphere to the area. One person I spoke to actually said it was 'magical' in what it added and I thought that was a good summary.

We visited this place after universal studio and the place is really nice and relaxing and seat there for a while and then take the ferry from there take round of the river and either get down at Clark quay for dinner or come back and have dinner near merlion

A must see when in Singapore. A popular tourist destination where you can take a picture. Its also near to other tourist destination such as Gardens by the bay, Makansutra Glutton, DNA helix bridge, Botanic Garden, Marina Bay etc :) Accesible to all types of transportation. Just be ready with your comfortable footwear because you will do a lot of walking :)
We walked here from the Hippo bus stop. Had a photo and and ice cream then that was it. Nice by the river but not much to do.

Here is the symbol of Singapore. It's referred to often, signs depict it in many places & there are even chocolates made to represent it, so it was an experiences to see it in the "Flesh". A tall statue spouting water & surrounded by crowds of people. Put it on your Bucket List. Lots of other interesting things to see within walking distance.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. It is interesting but the best thing about the area is the crowds of people. And I do mean crowds. It was the busiest place we saw. I don't think you should go to Singapore and not see it.
Visited during night time.  Good Food options in vicinity Wow...Glows at Night...Good Picturesque opportunity.  Night Boat Ride is good.
If you have visited Singapore but you have not visited this place, I think you are not considered as having visited Singapore.
The Tiger that represents Singapore. Great view, good walk in the afternoon by the river. Great dessert shops around.

review_title: Ehh.. go take your pic and move along
review_content: I know it's one of those obligatory places you need to see and will probably see if you're visiting Singapore, but just go there and take the selfie you need with this thing and move along. Not much to see here folks.
Have been here before when the children were young, but still love it. Beautiful sunny day, lots of people enjoying themselves. The Merlion is magic from the ground or viewed from the cable cars.

review_title: Good spot for pictures of architecture around the bay
review_content: We went during the day and it was very hot. However, if you go to Singapore, it should be on your must do list. There are 2 merlions the "baby" and the "mother" Look around and take some pictures.

review_title: symbol of singapore a must visit
review_content: a very busy place with tourists , a must visit to get a glimpse of the singapore lion . easy acess via public transport
As Merlion is symbol of Singapore it is worth to see it. Marina is nice place for walk. In the evening weather is pleasant and light show make it more interesting.
Busy at all hours of the day (except when it rains) and great photo opportunity. Must see whilst in Singapore

As they say you haven't been to SIngapore if you haven't seen the Merlion.Did it alright but expected the view to be bigger. Very crowded. To compensate however was the great view of the surroundings and the bay. Best place to relax after a tiring day of walking. Be there around late afternoon to see the transition of lights to night time and of course the light show.

We had to see the Merlion, symbol of Singapore as long as we were here. We visited this park earlier in the morning when it was mostly just the joggers out which made for a very pleasant walk along the bay with really great views. There were coffee and souvenir shops along the way but everything was a little pricey. So if ever in Singapore do not miss this beautiful landmark.

This is a landmark in Singapore so it is expected to be a "must go" place for tourist. The place is always teeming with people so do not expect to get a picture of yourself with only the Merlion as your background.

review_title: Amazing Place and Awesome Food Nearby
review_content: Went With Expecting best and found that. Place is incredibly amazing bit busy and crowded but seems vey magnetic with attractions. .liked it and suggest to all friends

Must visit place...you get to see amazing view of Singapore...best time to visit is during evening so that you can enjoy the lights as well...because during afternoon sun is too hot...there are small food outlets nearby you can enjoy snacks there....you can sit and relax a bit there...also there is one shop nearby where you can buy souvenirs, but its bit costly...nice place...
One of popular landmark of Singapore, so crowed because many tourists would like to take picture with Merlion

review_title: Beautiful view of the entire bay
review_content: With backdrop of the Marina Sand, high rise architectural hotels, museum and concert hall, the symbol of Singapore being 1/2 lion and 1/2 fish stands tall with water coming out of its mouth, surrounded with eateries and boutique shops, a wonderful place to visit, you can spend an afternoon strolling around this beautiful park

You see this first whenever u Google search singapore or even on any singapore tourism advertisement. Merlion is a head of lion with body of fish. This place is a must visit n a pic with the Merlion mandatory.

I Hope this is the last time they move. I found it a little hard to get to it. However you must visit it try and pick your time as in the morning it gets quiet crowded. As part of the history you must visit. Great photo opportunity.

We could see the famous Merlion from our hotel and decided to walk to it. It was a pleasant walk through a mall and then through the performance art center to a large promenade around the marina bay area to the Merlion. The place was crawling with tourists everywhere so we took our obligatory picture and continued the walk around the bay.   Easily accessible from around Marina Bay and a worthwhile stop if you are in the area.

It's more than a statue of a lion, it's the symbol of Singapore. Half lion, half fish, 100% Singapore. The surrounding sights are pretty nice at night and you really get your first feel that you're in Singapore when you walk around the park at night. Seeing all of the lights, performances, and locals/tourists alike just taking photos and taking an evening stroll. When you vacation, this is the sort of mood that you want to be in. In the presence of just taking your time to absorb the atmosphere and the smell of food with the lights of skyscrapers and the sounds of people genuinely having a good time.
Situated in sentosa Merlin park offer some shade and fresh area ( below the trees and close to the waterfalls. Sometimes true garden was decorated by some sculptures etc , nice place
You must see the Merlin if you go to Singapore. There is one at Marina Bay and a big one on Sentosa Island. Merlin Park is easy to access via foot or boat or train. A must see when in Singapore.

A business hub. well maintained area. the best place to visit the green and very clean city of Singapore. very well organized city and places. safe place for tourist. taxi drivers are very friendly. a lot of easy transport facility to move around. excellent place.
It has really good views of the city and the fountain though crowded is worth a visit. Also the esplanade is lovely and the helix bridge makes for a lovely scenic walk

review_title: The Famous Merlion - Still a Sight to See
review_content: Nothing says Singapore like the Merlion statue. I was delighted to find it still spewing water and in very well maintained. It is a must see when in Singapore. Pair the visit with a walk around the bay to take in the great skyline.
Not sure what the big deal is, it's a big statue spitting water. Of all things to see in Singapore, you should take a pass on this unless you're easily impressed.

An excellent spot for photos of the Marina Bay the Merlion in its new location looks over the Bay and is a popular stopping place for organised tours and the independent visitor.The Merlion is well looked after and looks very good in its gleaming white paint finish. There are food and drink outlets nearby and toilet facilities. Less mobile visitors need to be aware of the steps which although fairly easy to negotiate can be tricky to see the step edges. The river boat cruises also stop here and a river cruise can be started from here. The Merlion Park is generally very busy but well worth a visit. The new Jubilee Bridge (pedestrian) links with Theatres on the Bay.

review_title: Good spot to visit in Singapore
review_content: This is the symbol of Singapore - Merlion. Good spot to visit. Good photo point.   Generally this spot will be covered in the city tour as a photo stop.  But do not take the river ride offered to tourists. Its not worth it.

review_title: one more technology at its best
review_content: this is one of the oldest and renovated parks here looks great during night also can be viewed from the hop on bus
This is the icon of Singapore. Very clean area, very beautifully lit and nice place to visit. Good for photography as this place has good views.

I would come here in the morning to run around the esplanade and incidentally get here at the Merlin. At night, this landmark makes for a signature Singapore photo-op because of the lights on and around the Marina Bay Sands. Worth a stroll. But if you want to avoid the tourists and to enjoy the landscape in peace, come here in the morning!
This is the place to take a picture because it is a symbol of Singapore country. It is very popular for tourist that why many people there. Please try your best to take selfies for nice photo.

Stepped off the hop on / hop off bus to take a look at the Merlion and the good views across the water towards the Bay Sands Hotel.  Definately worth stopping off to see if you're passing but don't make a special trek across town to see just this.  Nice jetty juts out which is useful for pictures if you want the Merlion in the background.
Best tourist attraction in Singapore. Quite crowded during the weekends and evenings. Walkable distance from Gardens by the bay.
This is the symbol of Singapore so see if you can. It is near to the Fullerton hotel. There is a large Lion and a small one nearby.

They are improving it ,last year April when I go there the big merlion is not yet finish , when I saw it last December it's nice and more space for tourist , if you will go to Singapore don't forget to visit merlion park..
Lovely stroll around Marina Bay and visit to Merlion, half fish/half lion famous statue. Very nicely laid out walkways to take in the Marina Bay area.
This is a nice place to spend few hours with the family and take some nice pictures from Singapore. It is a lovely spot for picnics.

After I visit Asian Civilization Museum, I see that the park was near the museum, so I decide to walk across the road to see and take the picture of the Merlion (I will post the picture of the place I visit later) and walk around the place a bit before heading back.

review_title: Great for picture taking and selfies
review_content: Great place for selfies. You can take pictures that have the Merlion poring water on your head. It part of the Marina area, it adds to the charm of the Marina.

This trademark of Singapore has a half mermaid and a half lion figure on the edge of the water body. I found it over rated and is quite painful and tiring to visit during the day... Especially with parking which is far away.

You have not visit Singapore if you have not visit Merlion Park and take the picture in the Merlion Statue. This is very popular place. You can going here by bus, taxi, MRT or other transportation. By MRT you can turn down in Raflles interchange then walking. You can take a picture with some phoses mainstream either non mainstream. You can take picture as like drink from the water that come out from the merlion. Here, you can enjoy to walk and also sitting and enjoy eating because so many bar and restourant here with view singapore river and Marina bay sands.
a must see in Singapore! spectacular view of the Marina bay! best time to go is near sunset and wait until the city lights up!
Busy area great for photography shots. Straight over the bridge by the marina and opposite the Fullerton hotel. Best atmosphere and ambience at night.
A lot of tourists but it wouldn't be a Singapore trip without a photo op with this guy. Although crowded, just have a good angle and all will be great.
This was a nice places to visit and over look the main attractions of Singapore! I would suggest it as a thing to do if you have time. I would rush to have a look at it if you are pressed for time

Interesting to visit. At the start you get a 5 minute show about the history of the merlion - which is interesting and important to know about the history! Then lift up to the mouth of the merlion to see the views then steps up to the head of the merlion where you come out and see the views. The views are very good. It opens at 10am so go then before the big crowds start!!!

It's a nice spot to have a bwutiful view from this spot. Better to go early morning to beat the heat. Gets crowded during weekends. There are big tour groups and very difficult to walk around. It's a good place to go by cycle also. There are also nice place to eat. Gardens by the Bay is very near to this place. You can just walk around.
This park has some of the best views in Singapore. It was a pretty busy place. Lots of tourist and locals just enjoying the area. Nice place to walk around.
It was great to visit this Singaporean attraction. The Merlion Park really symbolises Singapore and offers some great snaps of the statue and river. John & Gail Laney
This is one of the most iconic sights in Singapore and has to be visited. Can be very busy at the weekends , Great photo spot so take your camera.
Should be in your list for Singapore. A place for taking some snaps with the Merlion statue. The place also offers a great view of the river and high rises.

review_title: A good 30 minute stopover. Take pictures and move along.
review_content: It was part of our day trip in sentosa. We came from Beach using cable car and took a monorail for our next attraction. We spent about 30 minutes. It was very hot though. Goto the lions mouth.

The park is wide and beautiful with the Merlion statue. There is a huge number of visitors in the morning (but I'm not sure whether it is crowded at night). The park is near Raffles Place MRT Station just around 7-minute walk.

review_title: An amazing structure showing the origins of Singapore
review_content: The Merlion is an amazing sculpture which joins up both worlds which make Singapore up: the sea of trade and the land of value. It was well worth a visit as it is even more amazing in real life. If you have time get a chance to walk around a section of the big lake in the bay through the helix bridge to get amazing shots during sunrise/sunset of the city from different points of view.
A large open place with a statue of a huge merlion the symbol of Singapore spitting water into the marina. Accessible both by water and road. A nice place to spend an evening

Good view from the Merlion the skyline of Marina Bay..with MBS facing it. The Fullerton Hotel is just around the corner.  Also, you can walk to the old Parliament house and Empress Place all just within walking distance. Good place to spend the morning or even the whole day. Plenty of food and shopping within walking distance and transport available...bus, mrt or just walk.

The light that projected into the merlion is really special and nice. Not sure if this happen in march due to special event or its permanent, but definitely worth a visit at night, you can take great photo of merlion and marina hotel
Who would not want to seethis place and have a photo to make your Sg visit a legit one? So mich crowded place, we cant blame this icon!

Merlion Park is a must see attraction and should be in the top 3 things to do in Singapore. The iconic Merlion of Singapore sits there spewing water and so many landmarks can be captured with the Merlion in the background like the flyer, helix bridge, marina bay, marina bay sands etc, to name a few. Come in the day around 12 when it will be quite hot but people will be less so you can calmly pose with the Merlion. Dont forget to do the famous "Drinking from the Merlion" pose which many people forget.  Also visit it in the twilight from where you can get a boat ride for around 25 SGD and visit the entire sights of Singapore as evening settles and day changes to night to get so many wonderful images.  Also, the Merlion will start changing color and some iconic shots can be got if you are smart.  Must visit. No compromises here whatsoever.

This iconic site of Singapore should be on your list of places to visit while you are there. This venue by the water and you have a gorgeous view of Singapore from here. Very crowded on weekend but that's expected from a tourist attraction site.  If you don't like the heat then don't go here in the middle of the day when the sun is beating down on you.
We went ot have a look on a Sunday afternoon so it was very busy. You can still get some pictures if you are patient and persistent as people take their shots and move.

review_title: A must see but very crowded
review_content: It's nice to see this Singapore icon, but so crowded and people taking photos everywhere. Interesting to see once as you walk past.
if you are happy to be surrounded by hoardes of selfie takers this is the place for you. the Merlion itself is a work of art but it's a battle getting close to it!

A stunning 360-degree photo opp area with the Merlion, Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer and city skyline all competing for centre stage. The Merlion stage gets very crowded and busy, so be patient for that perfect photo opp. Handy eats nearby, we loved the ice pops, great flavours!!!
can take a lot of photos backing merlion and marina bay sands.must visit place in singapore.don't forget to take your selfi stick if u r solo.
The Merlion stands proud in Singapore. A nice area to walk around and see the sights. Fantastic views across to Marina Bay Sands. Take a boat ride from here and see the sights on the river
Big Merion is under contruction :( when l visit and many tourists took the pictures with small Merion. I took this time to walk around Mariona Bay, that is ok.

review_title: A trip to Singapore and not go here is strange
review_content: Every visit I always stop by. I guess it is the most famous enough worldwide symbol of Singapore. Great place for pictures.  All seem to enjoy spending 15 to 30 minutes here

This place was particularly busy the day I went, because it was a weekend. Lots of locals coming up to take pictures with the Merlion. It's an icon. It has lovely views out to Marina Bay Sands and the like, and shops nearby.

Well went in the afternoon of March and was very hot. There are lot of ways to reach Merlion. We chose the bus and taxi though. Nice to see variety of restaurants at the surroundings of Merlion. A nice experience.
Another must place to visit. Overlooking the harbour this area has great views of the major waterfront attractions such as Sky Park, Gardens by the Waterfront and the Singapore Flyer.

review_title: Lovely location, beautiful structure, very colourful.
review_content: Beautiful area to visit, has different levels with various activities available. The grounds are very clean and tidy, very colourful plants and the Merlion is an amazing structure and in itself very colourful.
Another icon of Singapore.. But my advise don;t go here at sunny day (afternoon), because it's totally nice HOT.. visit it at 3 pm / night.. to prevent headache because sunny
Tourists love this place..just outside Fullerton Hotel overlooking the bay..had a nice evening walk n lots of photos!
Great for taking pictures. They've added a light show, so there are more tourists at night. Enjoyable.
No matter what time of day, there is always a crowd round the Merlion - it's a selfie paradise. Be prepared to be trampled under foot - but, that said, do not miss this lovely fountain.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. So, if you are visiting the city and don't see a merlion then it is not fulfilled. There nothing much there except a huge waterbody, Merlion statue and a little greenery. It is part of the city tour and you can go and get some very nice pictures with the Merlion.  My recommendation is must see.
Must visit place at Singapore.Just had 1 day in Singapore.Also singapore river cruise was great cost me 25 dollar.
very crowded during any part of the day. it was very dark near by when we visited in June last year.
Total difference between the day and night scenery here. The merlion is so colourful under the light at night. It worths travellers' visit.

review_title: Good views of Marina bay, (an almost) must visit icon
review_content: This is a bit like what Statue of Liberty is to people visiting New York. A must see, as it has become a kind of an icon, and hence (nearly)a must see place. You get great views of Marina Bay Sands, The Flyer, Gardens by the bay etc. Good to spend an hour at the most. The views though are less spectacular than the one you see in your Statue of Liberty cruise.
very nice place to take pictures , as well we can ride boat on Clarke river , also can see flyer wheel and marina bay.
Should come to this place to complete your visit to singapore . If you like walking and see nice view you can exit from clark quake station then just walk along the river to merlion

I was there with my friend last weekend and indeed its a touristy place fully loaded with tourist with every five step you ll be blocking someone taking pictures which is quiet annoying for me in a way. Overall its a 10mins place for sight seeing and taking picture no big deal instead do spend some time looking for a skybar for night city view while sipping on margarita which is more worthy to me.

One of must place to visit, if you are in singapore. Spacious places, with merlion statue which become landmark of singapore. Always crowded, thats make us very hard to enjoyed view. You must extra patience if you want to take a picture with merlion statue for the background, because everybody want do that like you.

review_title: Tiny statue lits up at night , entertaining
review_content: They say if you haven't seen Merlion you haven't been to Singapore... Just for this reason we made sure we've come back to this small ( it can be missed easily ) statue to take photos pretending drinking water from it with a gorgeous background of Marina Sands Bay hotel ....  first we saw this half fish half lion mythical creature by the river from the boat trip we took at night . Made a mental note to walk back to it after the tour . Which we did . We walked from Clarke Quay to Merlion.... It was too busy even late at night so don't expect a photo alone with it . It's fun and entertaining to watch people trying to get a good shot of themselves trying to pretend drink from the fountain... We did the same and it was a very cool shot actually.... You're in Singapore and this is the city's symbol so you should come and take a few photos at least . There are some beautiful places to drink / eat nearby . The walk from the Clarke Quay was a lovely one too ... As it was a Saturday night it was heaving ....  we've enjoyed it and definitely recommend it...
Nice little park on the river/downtown. Great place for pics and a walk around the downtown area. Worth the time.
on May 2016, I went to Singapore, on Last day of trip, i go to Maribay to take photo with Merlion, Everyone come to take photo and share experience at there , Good view

Maybe because it was a Sunday or because it was a the last night of the iLight festival, the Merlion Park was crowed. You had to wait a few minutes to get to a spot to where you could even get a glimpse to take a photo. As it is just a photo opportunity to add to your Singapore memories, the wait was ok. There is lots to see and do along the walk around the bay. It was an enjoyable way to spend a balmy Sunday night.
It is Very Colourfull during night time..nice view,Absolutly Lovely place,defenitly will be back again..
One of THE places to see in Singapore. A must see. Great views of the Marina. Go earlier in the morning. It gets hot!

Mermaid and Lion. Thts the iconic symbol of Singapore. The experience was good. The place is not difficult to find. Raffles Place MRT Station and walk 5mins down. Theres a show where d Merlion became colourful and i enjoyed it very much. The splashes of water makes this place cooler as it most the atmosphere. Do come over and take lots of pictures. You can shoot Marina Bay sand from here too.
My family paved a visit to Singapore last week. So we went around the country. This Merlion is a must-see when you're here. Since its near other tourist spots too. Its pretty convenient to come here.

First time in Singapore, and seeing the Merlion was our first stop. It is truly an amazing sight. The Merlion is really a must see when in Singapore, I feel.  We went in the evening when it was still light, to be able to take good photos, but also it is so worth it to stay until the light show right around 7-8pm ish. We took the train which was easy enough to follow. Also admission is free, no tickets required.  10/10 would return.
This is the Smaller version of Sentosa merlion which is right infront of the Fullerton hotel, near the creek.
Really the beauty of Singapore, place you can spend lot of time for the stunning 360 degree view around the place with sea & marina bay sands hotel.

I haven't been to Singapore for more than a year so when I visited Merlion again I got excited. It got a new look. It changes color and dances to the beat of a relaxing underwater music. I think, Tourists and locals alike stay longer at the park just to observe Merlion transition to different theme. Such a positive change for Merlion.
Merlion park is very colorful during night time and you can take a very nice view of fullerton hotel , marina bay sands and also esplanade.
Situated opposite the Fullerton hotel, it was a short walk to visit this site. At night the Merlion was illuminated as part of the ilight show which was on when we visited. It's worth going to see.
it is worth to walk along the Bayside from the Merlion till Lau Pa Sat, where you can have very nice food
its the place where realize you are in singapore as its the symbol of singapore must go if you are travelling first time to singapore

The Merlion has always been special for Singaporeans and the park seems to be one of those places close to their hearts. This is especially so for families, or those who want to have a relaxing stroll through the gardens. The statues are beautiful, the fountains beautiful. On a sunny day it can attract quite a lot of people strolling around, but to me, it is worth the visit.

The place where we should go when you go to Singapore. It is always crowded with people. Good for taking picture, relaxing, and walking around. you will see the baby merlion behind the big one. very cute.
This is like the identity of Singapore!The Merlion wont go unnoticed. For tourists, This is a Park with a statue of Merlion which is like Representing Singapore.

review_title: It is what you see, nothing more
review_content: Not even worth getting up close and personal with it, just get your zoom out and take a photo from across the bay. Don't worry if you miss it

The Merlion is very cute and an icon of Singapore, but I haven't seen such pushy and deep crowds since I was at the Mona Lisa in the Louvre! There is a good view across all of Marina Bay and over towards the Esplanade theatres as well.

You must see the Merlion if you visit Singapore. It is near to Marina Bay. Place is crowded . It is the trademarck of Singapore. You will get some great pictures from Sky line with the back ground of sea and buildiings.
The Merlion Park we enjoyed very much and the two Cable Cars are a must. There is so much to see I would do it all over again if time wasn't so short. I would love to bring my grandchildren.
If I was to pick out one photo that signifies Singapore, other than the front of Raffle Hotel, it would be Merlion Park.

Last Sunday evening, we visited Merlion, the one that near Marina Bay / Fullerton Hotel. They put three projectors that accurately projecting video at the Merlion body. So, there are some the visual effects that we can enjoy also with the back sound. It started with the visual effect that makes the Merlion hair waving. This is a good attraction after they day is started going to go dark.

You must see the Merlion if you visit Singapore. It is the statue of a legendary half lion half fish and is spectacular walk across the Jubilee Bridge to get the best views. Bridge was opened in 2015 to commemorate 50 years of independence

review_title: Night light show is not that good.
review_content: The Merlion has multi-coloured moving images projected onto it at night making it difficult to make out. However the atmosphere is pleasant. Bar prices are dear.

The metlion itself is smaller than i expected but still mananged to takd lots of photos. Would recommend the boat cruise from the merlion steps to see a lot of singapore central from a different angle!
Lots of festivals in the area when we were there. Very crowded. The best pictures of it were from the water taxi to escape the crowd.

review_title: One of the most beautiful attraction of Singapore.
review_content: No matter what u do and where you go , Marlion is a must see during your visit in Singapore. Is the best place to enjoy the beauty of Singaporean Skyline and sea.
A must see when visiting Singapore but it's quite a short lived attraction. It's definitely for pictures only and you must arrive early or it will be filled with tourists (for that perfect photo).

Merlion park is the landmark place of Singapore. One must visit and click a photo which guarantees that the traveler has visited Singapore. its a happening place. One can spend couple of hours during the evening time at this place.

When ever you visit Singgapore it's not perfect if you're not visit Merlion Park. Where you can take signature Singapore holiday picture with Marina Bay Sands in the background. With recent renovation there's a spectacular lights show on the evening and make this iconic statue more magnificent than ever!!!
Nice and best place to spend evening or early morning time. Nice views and Photo place for every age people.
It's an ok site to visit. Quite boring if you were to visit Merlion park for the whole day. Although you can just jump on the monorail and head to somewhere else with much ease.

review_title: You havent been to Singapore if you havent visited the Merlion
review_content: The Merlion is the most famous icon of Singapore. A must visit to prove you've been to Singapore. During the F1 Grand Prix the Merlion had colours and patterns projected on it - it looked beautiful!

Having being told the story why Singapore got its name we had to go and visit the Merliin. Resplendent against a backdrop of the high rise Banking skyscrapers on a lovely sunny day  Well worth a visit
After hearing a lot about how this is the must visit place, I was pretty disappointed to see a very small merlion. Merlion in the Sentosa park is way bigger.

On our visit, the Merlion was covered for restoration and a small substitute had been supplied. Not very impressive and there's really nothing much there, apart from Chinese tourists. A pleasant walk along the waterfront, but that's about it.
Incase you are for a short duration in Singapore, if your flight is at late evening then you can visit this place during afternoon. its a nice clean place not to be missed.
Of course one cannot visit Singapore without a visit to the Merlion! The park area is lovely. Take time to walk the esplanade. Just a great time to have a walk.
You need to be quick in an atempt to snap the water from the lion appearing to come from you. There are lot of tourists, so just be patient Photo is a must
It is nice to hear the culture and history of Singapore. This iconic figure represents them. Am so happy to hear that SG has become one of the economic giants in asia.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore so a 'must see'. Just expect that everyone else has the same idea. Lots of people, kids and cameras. It was a good place to visit, and a great place to get a feel for the cosmopolitan aspect of this wonderful city.
If you have been go to singapore but you didn't visit merlion you will be said that you never been go to singapore. Merlion Park is the iconic for singapore tourism

The icon of Singapore- Merlion. We went here twice, morning and night. During the day, there were a lot of tourists in the area. Everyone was captivated by the beauty of this mystical creature that has a lion's head with a body of a fish.. Though for me, it is better to go here in the evening for tourists to see not only Merlion but also to see the wonderful city lights of Singapore..

Merlion Park is centrally-located; you find yourself passing it again & again during your wanders. I crossed the bridge, took some good photos, and then spotted & took a river cruise, too - just because I was passing through the park!
Just be ready for the crowds. but with some patience you can still get a decent photo. A River cruise is a nicer way of seeing merlion
My daughter insisted we get a photo with the Merlion - glad she did. Great little spot. Got there via the Hop on Hop off bus.

Went to Sentosa island & merlion what a fab day out recommended for anyone so much to do food was reasonably priced & cable car ride across the bay gives great picture opportunities also the aquarium was brill big sharks lovely rays if you go you won't be disappointed ...

I came on a short free tour while on a stop over in Singapore. This is the one thing I think of since a child when I think of Singapore and I was so much better up close and in person. Very nice spot in city down on the water but is a very busy spot with tourists.

When walking through Singapore at night you will probably have a look at Marina Bay. It´s absolutely impressive and when you´ve passed the Art Zoo you stand at the place from where the photo was taken.
Merlion Park is a great place to visit with family and friends. It is one of the most significant sight seeing spots of Singapore.

We must've reached at a really busy time it was very crowded. A significant tourist attraction so people from all over the world. Had a nice stroll around the park lots of different places can be seen from here.

Merlion Park is the original or first in Singapore. It was shifted from the original location at mouth of Singapore River about 100m away to face the Marina Bay. Officially there were 5 Merlions-2 at Merlion park, 1 at Sentosa, 1 at Mount Faber & 1 at STPB. Merlion is make up of lion head and fish body indicating the history of Singapore when it was called Singapura by Javanese's Prince after seeming a big lion, and a fishing island. At last in 2017, we can see the Merlion do same fashion show by changing the skin colour. Maybe Singapore tourist promotion board should consider it a permanent performance.

The Merlion Park is connected to public transportation (MRT, cableway, buses etc). The park is colorful and picturesque. There's a huge variety of fun activities. Joyful, colorful and a lot of fun. Alone, with friends or with family and children!

Well this is the symbol of Singapore so you must go, seriously. Night viewing is the best as they put on a light show on the surface of the Merlion and that is very nice for photos. This is worth the visit. Advice: don't eat around this area as they are very expensive as they aim for the tourists.

We visited this on a day of 90 degrees and 90 moisture and it was the Chinese New Year weekend. The place was packed with people all with selfies jumping in front to take pictures. We would go back when not so crowded.
Merlion, the iconic of Singapore is here. You can see very nice view of Melina bay. There is laser and light show at night.

Nice place, easy to access and the view is magnificent when night. Near bus station, MRT station and near many famous place like garden by the bay, national galery of singapore and many more. The acces go this place is free. Thats why i like singapore, we can enjoy how beautifully singapore with free.
Renovation is ok - but if nobody works on it and it is only covered. That's not nice. But the area is still worth going and maybe the renovation was the reason for very small traffic there.
Just a water fountain that is a symbol of Singapore. There is a walk way that allows you access to take photos and it is free. It gets crowded particularly with people taking selfies.

It is not satisfied if you visiti singapore without coming to here first, better you go on the evening or on the night when you can seeing the Merlion statue looks very manly with the light around. Also here you can take picture with best view of the Merlion statue and around this area there have some restaurant if you would like to have lunch or dinner. This place little bit crowded due there always have so many peoples only for take pictures and so on specially on the weekend and the long holidays.
Merlion lit up for light festival. Beautiful -- spirit of Singapore.  Free tourist attraction. Great location for photos of the bay.

There is no shortage of things to do and see in beautiful Singapore; visiting Merlion Park is yet another place that displays its beauty. Our first visit was on a beautiful Wednesday evening in February. Like most places in Singapore, Merlion Park offers no shortage of places to eat.   This is one of those pass through attractions. Unless you plan on dining there, I recommend staying just long enough to take in the scenery and photo ops, then walk up the road to La Pau Sat for some satay (from 7pm).

review_title: Cannot miss this place if you are in singapore
review_content: The Merlion is like the icon of Singapore. Visit this place at night. The view is beautiful. The place is usually filled with tourists and locals usually. The famous Marina Bay sands is opposite to this place. Practice night photography before you visit. You can take some really nice pictures from here

You can not really go to Singapore without visiting the Merlion. It was very busy but a great atmosphere with everyone trying to grab the best shot, it helped with the beautiful blue sky as a back drop
Worth to visit after visiting other attractions.. The weather was not cooperative though but it's worth it..
We find Merlion park is a must visit in Singapore. This is the most iconic place. The symbol of Singapore.
You can't go to Singapore without seeing the famous Merlion fountain. This is a symbol for Singapore that represents the Lion City and connections to the sea. Beautiful park area!

review_title: Great view of the iconic sculpture!
review_content: We were in Singapore for a 10 day business trip from Houston and knew we had to see the Merlion (half lion / half mermaid) before we headed home. After taking the MRT to Raffles Place, we walked toward the Fullerton Hotel to Merlion Park and got lots of great shots of the Merlion. Highly recommend for a quick visit as you get to see the Merlion and many other landmarks at the same time, such as the Marina Bay Sands Hotel (the top looks like a ship from this vantage point). After walking around the bay, we went to the nearby mall for drinks, then took the elevator up in the Marina Bay Sands hotel to the 57th floor observation deck (see my other review).

This month feature the i light Marina Bay. There are some of the buildings will be having features of lighting. The Merlion definitely will be included. It is a once a year event. Should have glimpse at least.

A lovely free attraction down on the Marina. Expect crowds but everyone keeps moving along once they have had their photo opportunity. You can have fun trying to position yourself for a photo while the merlion sprays the water into your mouth!!! You won't look silly cause everyone is trying to do it. It's a bit of fun.

review_title: Get a picture with Merlion, or you've not been to Singapore :)
review_content: Here are the tips on when you can take a picture with the iconic landmark of Singapore, The Merlion. Morning, You can get a better picture here since there are not much tourist.
