For me, don't go during afternoon, its freakin hot! Afternoon is the best time to go or night time if you want to watch the laser light show of Marina Bay Sands from there. As i've mentioned, get a picture with Merlion or you have not been to Singapore at all.
We enjoyed our visit to Merlion Park from the Singapore River Cruise. Best decision if you're not into crowds. Awesome architecture!

review_title: The Merlion was covered up so we could only see it through gaps in the covering.
review_content: The surrounding area was very nice and I can imagine that it will be worth a visit once renovation is finished.
This is a must stop if you are in Sinapore. Grab your camera, jostle for a good spot and get your picture taken with the iconic Merlion.

Aside from taking memorable shots with the iconic Merlion statues, the Merlion Park also offers the prime position for photography opportunities of Singapore’s famous skyline. Some examples of famous architecture visible from here include the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands, the Fullerton Hotel and the Esplanade. It's better to visit this place in the evening as it can get very crowded during the day.

It's strange how a marketing tool for the Singapore tourist office has now become a symbol of the city.  Our first visit to Singapore saw the statue sitting in a completely different position virtually ignored by tourists. Now with the reclamation of the land from the sea and the building of new bridges meant that the statue had to be moved and it's now found sitting within its own park. At all times of day or night there's a queue of tourists attempting to get selfies with the figure.
a must-see attraction while in Singapore, and best visited during the day. This location is one of those must-have photos to add to your travel collection.

We were unfortunate in our timing and the Merlion was taking a shower while we were visiting. We were told the smaller one behind it would be available for pictures but this too was under-going maintenance and was closed.  Very disappointing that they were both unavailable and I'm not sure why it takes 4 weeks to clean the Merlion... it sits out n the rain so I'm not sure how clean it would be anyway. On our last day the scaffolding was taken off the front but you still couldn't see much and you didn't get the whole effect without the water.  Definitely check the dates of cleaning before you go so you're not disappointed!
No visit to singapore is complete without a visit to the merlion park. It was extra special to go there after the F1 GP, with all the lights and bustling activity!
this public space is an example of a successful area for the city near the water and with one of the most amazing views the city can offer
Really enjoyed this. The icon of Singapore. Great photo opp with Marina Bay Sands in the background. Enjoy.

GUTTED, the merlio was having a clean. All covered up in scafolding and sheets, so nothing to see. There is a baby merlion, but not the same. Nice views of the bay hotel from here, and nice walk into teh CBD along the waters edge. Can also get a boat ride from here, 40 mins long, but you cannot hop on hop off sadly, so we did not bother.
It's the symbol of Singapore  Nice spot for pictures A spot that every tourist who visited Singapore too a picture

We have been there on a Sunday afternoon and loved it. The entrance is from One Fullerton and it has a lot of nice cafes which is good. The Merlion was very crowded, lots of tourists taking photos but that is Ok. We took a 40 min boat tour which I highly recommend. Eating is not allowed on the boat. A must see attraction in Singapore. You can see all beautiful silhouttes of Singapore.
Merlion was having a shower so he was wrapped up but this did not spoil our enjoyment. We went to see another Merlion on Sentosa island

Unfortunately we didnt check this beforehand, the statute was closed for public viewing due to repairs. Although the surroundings are well kept and are a good source of photographic avenues with a great view of Marina bay sand hotel and the water body.. try the hand made coconut ice cream at one of the food cart.  This place is a must visit for tourist and is easy accessible via taxis or buses
It is difficult to rate this park as it has scaffolding around it. It was in the process of "getting a shower" per the sign. There wasn't that much to see here other than the one sculpture.
Unfortunately the merlion is under construction until next month, wasn't much to see as it was fenced off but you see the harbour.
The Merlion Park is situated near Marina Bay sands. The park is very attractive. A good place to click photos. Here lot of tourists visit.
Mer lion was being renovated so nothing to see, loads of tourists made it very crowded. Unrecognisable from my 1986 visit.

Tracked down the infamous merlion only to discover he was covered up due to having a clean up. Slightly disappointed but there is a smaller one behind that is suffice, bit of a shame as raffles long bar was also getting work done, but plenty other stuff to see in Singapore

Merlion park is the symbol of Singapore!  This place is a treat to your eyes with a view of Central Business District of Singapore along with a beautiful sunset view of Marina Bay Sands!  A photo at this place is a must for an instant recognition that one had visited Singapore. One can also do a river cruise from Merlion Park (S$ 25) for a whole view of tall glazing towers of business district and Fullerton Hotel.  Merlion Park is a must visit place and mostly flooded with tourists.  A great place to be!!!

review_title: A nice place to visit when in Sentosa
review_content: It's the alternative to the Merlion statue in the Marina Bay area. It's a nice place to check out and relax when you're in Sentosa. A nice place for sure.
visit merlion park and take some picutres. Also take the opportunity to enjoy Singapore river cruise right there.
Very time for travel singapore i like take photo this merlion park. day view and night view i feel relaxed and havr funny

review_title: Beautiful place to relax and enjoy a good dinner.
review_content: This is a beautiful marina. It got busy when we went because it's close to Formula 1. We walked around and had dinner at one of he restaurants there. Loved the sunsets.
this a place that you must go if you visit this lion city. the view was stunning. the convenient location.
A good thing to visit by the river on something like the Duck tour to get the best view of the Merlion

As they said, it does not justify your stay in Singapore unless you visited The Merlion.. Me and my nephews enjoyed an hour here.. it was packed with a lot of people from different races taking their best pictures with the merlion and to add with the view is the Marina Bay sands.. A lot of restaurants to choose from to enjoy your moment. Its more fun to visit this place at 5pm..

My fiancé and I were on the way back to the US from Thailand so we decided to have a look at the lion between the flights. Unfortunately the lion was in a shower(under construction. We had a dinner at the restaurant called something easy right next to the lion. We had time to check out the music fountain, per my opinion, the music fountain in front of bellagio in Vegas is way better and fancier.

This area was nicely presented and laid out. The boardwalks are nice and you can avoid steps to get down to see the Lion statue. It is bigger than I thought and was interesting if you could avoid all the selfie takers

The merlion was under repair when we were there, but the area is lovely to walk around anyway. There is the merlion cub right beside him, and other merlions around the city, so it didn't ruin the holiday. A bit nearby, on Cavanagh Bridge near the Fullerton Hotel, we found the 3 bronze cats I'd been wanting to see, so I was still happy.
Actually its a little bit hard to catch a private picture when you capture a selfie ehhe. There so many of people that come in, so be patient its gonna be the evidence when you are in Singapore :)

Sad we didint get a chance to take a picture, because it was for construction or something. The note says Merlion is taking a bath. So people to tend to take pictures in the small merlion fountain. There is also a good spot for taking picture over viewing the Marina Bay.

review_title: Great to be here at the end of Chinese New Year
review_content: One of many great parks around the harbour , such a picturesque setting  We were inundated with Japanese tourists whilst there , who all seemed to be enjoying the park .

There is not much to see or do here but if you treat this as your starting point then walk along the waterfront to the Marina Bay Sands and visit the Art Science Museum, it is a more interesting combination. There are more food options at the bayfront and do catch the free outdoor musical laser lightshow at the bayfront boulevard steps...the skyline view is great at sunset.

review_title: lions being cleaned so it can not take pictures
review_content: I singapore actually want to photograph in front of a statue of a lion's, but unfortunately at the moment it is in the process cleared. So I worked with friends failed to photograph in front of a statue of a lion's. but one day when I was to Singapore again, I will photograph there.

review_title: The merlion was not there, he was taking a bath
review_content: We really wanted to have a pic with the merlion, unfortunately it was not available when we went there, the sign said he was taking a bath. This is really a nice place. This symbolises what Singapore is all about.

Signature place to be in at Merlion park. once at Singapore a photograph without the Merlion at the side or back is not complete. Nice place to be in for some time. on a sunny day it's hot and sunglasses are a must.
I was very much looking forward to seeing the Merlion statue, but arrived to find it shrouded in scaffolding and wrapping with signs that said "I'm taking a shower!" Nice views of the river, however.

It is the mostly visited place in Singapore, as it was known to be its icon. The place is impressive and clean. Though be careful to take a picture so near the Merlion, you might get wet as the waters go long distance especially if the weather is windy.

The famous merlion!! Every time someone visits Singapore, clicks a pic with Merlion! It is a popular spot and even I was excited to click a snap with Merlion..  It was a rainy day but I did it!  It is in mid of all high towers with best of best banks surrounded!

review_title: Visit but don't eat anywhere close by
review_content: A quick visit and then stopped for a meal in one of the places behind the lion - what a tourist trap!! and really bad quality. Ended up paying R200 for a beer!!!

Never miss going out SG without visiting the infamous Merlion Park. The Park is very clean and has a very nice view overlooking the Marina Bay and Botanical Garden. You can be very creative when taking the picture of the Merlion. There are many tourists at the park all the time, so you better strategize how to capture a good picture.

Not a great deal you can say about the Merlion.  Any visit to Singapore will include it, even if only by accident given its central location.  Situated on the waterfront, the term park is perhaps a little misleading. Its more of an attractive plaza with flower beds, rather than acres of fields and tress. Pleasant all the same.  Good viewed by day (if you can put up with having to photo it with everyone standing in front of it), and by boat cruise at night.   Plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops right
One of the must go places in singapore. Good view of Marina Bay Sands and Esplanade. Excellent for photo shots and selfies.

review_title: Cute place to snap a picture.
review_content: Unfortunately the Merlion was undergoing "maintenance" when we visited recently. The whole thing was covered with tarps so we couldn't even see it. With that being said we walked around the area and checked out the smaller version of it. Not a whole lot to do but take a few pictures. Definitely worth a stop but don't waste too much time here.

Merlion is a very nice landmark of Singapore. Surrounded by a river, the park does offer a very touching view. It is very clean and it is the best point for photo shooting. When we were there the big Merlion didn't produce any water because it has been under the renovation. Anyway, we will go back there again in the near Future.
a very good landmark to show the symbol of Singapore. Part of your itinerary and truly show case Singapore.
awesome place, must visit, dont miss it in singapore, family dont miss it, go for it for awesome exp..
This is one of the best place where I had visited on last July 2016. It was a so nice place where so many tourists were visiting and had been enjoying.

Finally the famous Merlion Statue.Not just the statue but the entire area around it is great.Just that it is almost impossible to take a pic with no one around as it is thronged by people most of the time. Great experience.

review_title: Visited the Merlion for some great photos.
review_content: Well worth a visit and easy to get to. Very popular with public so can be quite crowded. Excellent photo opportunity of not only the Merlion but all the other iconic building ie. Marina Bay Sands etc.
It's The Main Icon On Which The Singapore City Is Name After It's In A Shape Of Half Lion And Hall Fish From Which The City Gets Its Name Great Place To Visit Excellent Place

review_title: One of the places to visit.
review_content: This is normally one of the main attractions to see in Singapore but unfortunately during our visit it was covered with scaffolding and plastic so it was a bit of a disappointment on this occasion. Not sure how long the intended work is going to last.
An icon of singapore merlion , very famous . Nice and interesting to see and also the scenery also very nice
Go and spend some time in the park and see the sculpture as it is very interesting. Read about it or take a guided tour through the city as this is a landmark there.
was nice to see this in person. had an opportunity to take great photos by the structures. I felt the area was quite serene

Went there on Feb 10th, and the Merlion was "taking a shower"!! (Under renovation). What a bummer. It was not mentioned at all on any websites. At least the view of the esplanade & marina bay sands was great.

A tour in Singapore without seeing the Merlion, this is my favorite spot in Singapore, cause it made me feel and say I've finally been there. Nothing really special about it but it really has an appeal to me. I would like to visit it again.
We were walking by Merlion fountain, there were lots of people climbing on it and others being more respectful keeping their distance. great for photos.

I visited Singapore in July 2012 and Feb 2017 and both times they had the Merlion Singapore's most iconic monument coved for maintenance!! Really??? Closed for 3 weeks! They should find another way to do the maintenance.

Been visiting Singapore since young. After 40 years of visiting and finally the first time I had a close distance with Merlion :D  Have a stroll from Merlion, Fullerton, National Gallery Museum to City Hall, you will discover a nice Singapore story.

It is the zero point of Singapore. Its a popular landmark , good for photography. Boat ride in the lake is fantastic. It takes around all landmarks . Keeping the photograph of Merlin in living room with flowing water from lions mouth facing towards inside of room is sign of good omen they believe.

As it is one of the main attractions in Singapore, it is worth a visit. If you like to take selfies with landmarks, then it is definitely a place for you. It is overcrowded at times, so do be warned. The area also offers great views of some of the architecture found in Singapore. It is directly opposite the Marina Bay Sands, so many people will be spotted taking pictures of this attraction too.
Twas a very nice spot to take pictures by the sea. You can capture a very nice view of the marina bay sands, esplanade and more. An attraction worth visiting.
A must for in your SG trip. SG visit would not be completed without Merlion Park This is one of Singapore Iconic places worth visiting for.
I am recommending for sky tours & other activities as well some rides are bit expensive anyhow can be get advanced experience.
Yes it is one of the Singapore main attractions, great spot for pics and see amazing building around the bay. It was pretty hot and uncover so make sure you have sunnies and water handy.

You can not come to Singapore and not visit the iconic merlion. I use watch this famous monument on travel guides and blogs but to see in reality was something else. Overwhelming with people this is a tourist and locals hotspot !!! Everyone wanted to take a perfect picture for instagram and Facebook. But it is beautiful. A lot of eating places nearby and the beautiful view of marina bay sands opposite. In the evening it's a beautiful sight. Grab your best spot as the laser light shows starts by 8pm and this place can get very overcrowded. Highly recommend it.
It was easy to reach it via MRT. You can see the MBS and part of the esplanade. The small merlion was hit to kids & people with young at heart.

review_title: What a fun place to be and a must visit
review_content: Seeing those attractions in real life versus just in pictures was amazing. Traveled by myself on business with a free weekend and felt safe the entire time. Lots of places to sit, eat, walk.

Merlion Park is one of the main attraction of Singapore. It is very hot there. Don't forget your sunglasses, hat, cap and water. Water is very expensive in that area. Take Singapore River Cruise if you want to see Merlion from front.

review_title: It's free and in the tourist hub, why not?
review_content: Honestly this one is a no brainer for me. There are many references to Merlion around Singapore and seeing it in the flesh (or so to speak) was a must.  The best part is it's free to go look and take as many photos as you like from the viewing areas.  I will say that there were only a few times we went past that there weren't hoards of tourists there so getting the perfect photo is a challenge.  We also went right by the large Merlion on the night time river cruise. We got to see the Merlion from a different perspective and seeing as we caught a late boat about 9:15pm, there were only a few people onboard. The boat cruise is a paid activity 25$S per person I believe and some counters are cash only.  We got to Merlion Park on bus #10 which stopped just up from the statue, on the esplanade, it was just a short walk from there, but there are several ways to get there via public transport.  My vote, its iconic and free, just do it!
Merlion park is the absolute place to be in Singapore. People come from all over just to see this place. Enjoy the stroll down the boardwalk, there's plenty to look at.
This seems to be one of the most popular tourist spots in the city. Everyone wants a selfie in front of the statue! None the less, it's a must see!

This park near marina bay is popular with all tourists who love clicking pics with the iconic merlion. The river cruise from the park is equally enjoyable with many historical areas covered.Lots of restaurants near the park as well.
One of the attractions of Singapore. A beautiful place to visit during night as well with light decoration and the city glowing in different colors all around
Merlion is the Singapore's national animal. It throws water relentlessly 24 * 7 into the river!!  Quite a site ... wonderful. Do take a boat ride in the night ...worth it!

This is a great area to walk around in the evening. Great atmosphere with all the lights, views and people, including the new boat roofed hotel. Very busy. Beware of some of the seafood restaurants as they are very expensive. You can walk from here along the riverside walk which if you can manage the heat and humidity is great. The famous lion fountain is here. Worth a visit.

I have always associated Singapore with this iconic sculpture and it was one of the things that everyone visiting Singapore has to see and get that selfie with. There is a couple of places around to grab a bite to eat or something to drink.

review_title: A popular place to take photos
review_content: A busy spot where all visitors were taking photos and enjoying the views. Worth a quick visit while seeing the other sights in the city
It's hot and a bit smelly. too bad when I came there the merlion fountain is not working. Can't take mandatory picture with the merlion :(
went on a tour and this was included in the tour...we learned about the history and facts about the Merlions and its part of Singapore's history
The whole complex which includes this attraction is great at night as you will see SG glimmer and glitter in lights. Besides it's also cooler at night to hang out.

The Merlion stands on the waterfront and is visible from many different points. Despite it's iconic status, it is unlikely to take your breath away. That honour will be reserved for the ever present army of selfie stick waving tourists determined to take your eye out with their mobile phone. Nevertheless, you should take a look as the waterside walk is a pleasant distraction.
We visited this on a Sunday morning at Chinese New Year so it was very crowded but it is on the list of must see before wandering up to Clark Quays by the river where it was pleasant and peaceful

review_title: Take a River Boat Trip to see it
review_content: The best way to really see this is by one of many boat trips that goes around/past this Icon. Many tourists gather on land to take photos so it can be quite crowed .

review_title: You have not gone to Singapore if you don't have a photo here
review_content: Just like any country's trademark,the merlion is must-visited attraction. Tendency to be crowded, you may just take turns and quickly finish your photo op.

Easy to access by metro, you also catch the skyline of Singapore and Marina Bay Sands. Great photo opportunities and nice for a relaxed walk. It can get hot in the Singapore outdoors so stay hydrated!
A trip to Singapore would not be complete with out seeing one of the Merlions! Or why not see them all... think there are 5-6 official ones to look at across Singapore!

Easily reached by MRT, stopping at Raffles MRT Station, walk to the park about +/- 500 metres. Do not miss to enjoy your time here for sightseeing and taking photographs with the Merlion Statue and Marina Bay Sands Hotel as the main background

review_title: A must photo opportunity when visiting Singapore
review_content: Lots of great photo opportunities, particularly in the evening when you can get great shots of the seafront and skyscrapers. Can get busy and you may have to wait your turn for a photo

review_title: Must See if you are in Singapore
review_content: This is a must see place, it gives you ample opportunities to take pictures with the Merlion and the Marina Bay Sands hotel in the background. Evening dont miss the laser show
i visited evening around 7.30 , the sky scarpers lights view were excellent . Enjoyed whole evening with my family at this beautiful location .

The Merlion park is perhaps a must visit if you are in Singapore. There are several attractions - The rotary lifts for a 360 degree view, the Madame Tussaud museum and so many other attractions that requires more than a day. Very enjoyable with family.

It is best to schedule a visit to the Merlion Park in the morning, evening or night. The fact is that these watches traditional Singaporean heat recedes, you will be able to comfort and pleasure to walk along the bay. Do not forget to take pictures near both the Merlion, these photos later will give the warmest memories of Singapore. It should also take a small cruise around the bay on a tourist boat, a pier for tours is located right on the park. Especially popular evening boat trips, when turned on full illumination of the surrounding buildings and double-pass laser show with water effects and music.
Iconic, Futurictic, Cool.  everything looks great, clean and make the visitors want to come back to this place. Great!

The kids thoroughly enjoyed getting photos of the Merlion by doing funny poses making it look like they were drinking the water or collecting the water in their hats or drink bottles. Very busy with lots of tourists trying to do the same thing so have to be patient.

Singapore's version of the mermaid except it aint no maiden here!  U can call it the male mermaid cos its got a giant lion head and a fish tail  This park is a MUST see not only becos of the statuesque merlion sprouting water but u have the best view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel from here (that banana boatie architecture)   Go b4 noon before it gets too hot  My advice - if u drive - google Esplanade theatre parking then walk over cos there is NO PARKING whatsoever elsewhere!   Grab a starbucks at the gate cos the rest of the F&B inside the park sucks! And go straight pass the gift shop its a waste of time
It was good place to get your photos clicked. it was very crowed the day we went. from there we walked down to marina bay mall thru helix breeze. lovely walk that was.

The actual Merlion itself is a bit anticlimactic, a bit too touristy for me. The bottom line is an ok view of Singapore from the top. The entire area is fun though and has lots of options. The fort nearby was well worth the visit.
Nice area to walk in the afternoon and provide great pic opportunities at night. Can get crowded but definitely a buzzing place.
Nice view of the location. But now the merlion is want to be maintanance. Somewhere in monument blackness is looking clearly.

We visited the Merlion, purely because it seemed to be the most photographed tourist icon in the travel brochures so we thought we would see what it was all about. It is a good tourist icon to see and will give you great views across the bay to Marina Bay Sands,The Singapore Flyer and the Singapore skyline. You can go out on the jetty/pier and take a great picture of the Merlion. It is extremely busy, but definitely one of the Singapore tourist attactions to see.Surrounded by all the tall buildings it is rather a small statue.

review_title: Singapore landmark and popular tourist spot
review_content: The Merlion Park is in the Central Business District of Singapore. This is one of the most photographed landmarks in Singapore.   Located close to the Esplanade Theatre, a premier art centre and another iconic landmark of Singapore, you can get some great views of Singapore and the skyline.   The Marina Bay Sands integrated resort can be clearly seen and photographed along the Jubilee Bridge.   Whilst at the Merlion Park, do keep a look out for the little Merlion as well.   You could visit this area on your own and just explore the interesting surroundings. Many picturesque opportunities abound.   Make use of your creative imagination and snap pictures of the Merlion spouting water into your mouth or being a super man holding up the Marina Bay Sands building.   A short walk away is the 100th Starbucks store in Singapore at the Fullerton Waterboat House. It seems that this is a special store that carries certain mug designs that others do not.

It seems strange that you hear so much about this Merlion afterall it is only a fantasy creature made of concrete with water spouting out its mouth. However in context or maybe out of context with the incredible architecture that surrounds this breath taking site, the Merlion is something the average human can relate to with fondness rather than awe. The contrast is pronounced by the incredible engineering of surrounding structures. A must see tourist site and unavoidable.
It was fun to see. Actually very crowded. The mascot/symbol of Singapore. If you have time it's worth a visit.
We went here to view the light show and it was a very good spot to watch the laser lights. There were numerous eating places along the water front.

Singapore has many beautiful sights and the best place to see the fantastic skyline is from Merlion Park. The Merlion is the icon that represents Singapore; it has to be seen close-up as it rises from the water overseeing the vast bay and the fantastic architecture of the surrounding buildings.

you can't visit singapore without visiting merlion. one of the most recognisable sights in singapore and rightly so. we started our walk at raffles and went over cavenagh bridge before arriving here. after seeing merlion we continued onto the gardens on the bay
Merlion Park is on Marina Bay and it features a number of restaurants and some of the best gardens imaginable. Take a cruise on the river; it's well worth it.
The lion is the national symbol of Singapore. It is a very pretty place and overlooks the bay. A must visit place if you visit Singapore.

Typical tourist thing to do, I walked round that side of the bay and came across it, so busy I couldn't even take a proper picture there but it was ok. Stand further away either side and you stand more chance of taking the cheesy picture and then keep walking over the helix bridge to the marina bay sands and the promenade and that's much better.

The Lion State can't be visited without going to Merlion Park on Marina Bay. This Iconic Statue is just one of the must do sights. The whole area is wonderful to walk around with plenty of things to see and do. From a ride on the Singapore River to high end eating. Go by day and come back at night to see the transformation. Wonderful.
Absolute must see!! This site is characteristic of Singapore and a tourists mecca. Wonderful spot to visit.
Merlion park is a must see while in singapore. Very easy to get to and you can join the hundreds of other tourists there. But it is worth it.
The merlion is one of the many features of Singapore that people visit. Just behind the large merlion is a smaller one that doesn't shoot water but is just as good. Well worth a visit!

review_title: A fun place to visit on the river to take photos
review_content: This is the iconic Singapore tourist place. Try and line up the water in the mouth photo of course. On the river, tour boats available, easy walking bridge and esplanade with restaurants. Off course go
It's worth visiting the Singapore Merlion fountain with great views all around. Has to be seen when visiting Singapore and does not have to take long at all. One to tick off your list.

Since it is one of the tourist attractions in Singapore, the park becomes too crowded that you can't take a photo without photobombers!! LOL!! Better to visit at night so it's not very hot! Must wear comfortable clothing as this is an open area and have direct sunlight!! I thought that we will be amazed coz it is very famous that we can see in tv but will be bit disappointed because it's just like a simple park with waterfalls coming from the mouth of Merlion!!
It's just a must visit in Singapore. A very beautiful statue at the waterfront and in front of the skyline. You can take nice pictures there.
Lovely views from ground level with lovely surroundings close to cafes. Great as a daytime and nights activity to see contrast between am/pm views.

You can't leave this country without vising the famous merlion. This is the symbol of singapore, we had a walk at night from the MBS going here and it was not really a cool night even if it is January

review_title: Best location to capture that iconic shot of Singapore
review_content: Built in 1972, the Merlion statue was relocated from the mouth of Singapore River to its current site in 2002. The location is ideal for photo shot, with Fullerton hotel as its backdrop. (BTW, the Fullerton building, completed in 1928 once houses the Singapore General Post Office). Shot by day or by night, the pictures will turn out perfect. From the Merlion park, it's an easy stroll to the Esplanade, Marina Square, Boat Quay, Clifford Pier and Lau Pa Sat (Satay Club). Just let your feel takes you to where your heart desires :)

The most famous landmark in Singapore. The walk to the Merlion is quite fun, especially in a sunny bright day. The Merlion itself is busy full of tourists taking pictures but this was expected. Near the area, there are a couple of cafes and a few expensive restaurants.

review_title: Nice but can be very crowded
review_content: My favorite spot next to Marina Bay. Can be really overrun by tourists so I'd suggest visiting early in the morning.  There is a couple of good restaurants nearby and a food stall near the Esplanade.

review_title: Too Hyped for those who have seen other overseas destinations
review_content: Just a Memoir picture to have visited Singapore. Nothing great for tourists . They should add more affordable eateries around the bay
You only need to go here once. It's like a must visit for the first timer, but not for the second time. You won't have that willingness to come again
Excellent walk along the waterfront from OUE to the Merlion. Lots of tourist so good idea to go early.
It s a wounderful place to spend time and on top of the lion is a great view. Great way up to the lion many restaurants coffees and flowers.
Seeing the Merlion is a must, however be prepared to see it with thousands of others. It is difficult to get an uninterrupted view however it is worth a visit.
If you plan to visit Singapore, do not forget to put in your plan, you can enjoy nice places around and very clean.
great tourist attraction old merlion must have had millions of pic s taken, take a pic at night with all the lights about....

review_title: stay till evening for light show
review_content: Merlion Park is one of the major tourist attractions in Singapore. spend 1-2 hour there and have some nice photo. must bring your camera.
It's a nice park, not necessarily because of the lion but because of the views of the Singapore skyline

Stopped at the merlion after getting off the hop on bus as the stop is just across a busy road. Lots of people obviously had the same idea as it was extremely busy, but a place that most people will want to see. Quite a few eating places round here too.

The Merlion Statue is a must see for tourists in Singapore. It has excellent views of the Marina Bay and the City. There were hundreds of people there, and there was a good selection of shops and restaurants if you are hungry. Must see!
Watch the show from the Lion's head statue. It lasted about 10 mins. Good time to stroll as it is not that hot and there was a gentle breeze.
Came here on a beautiful day with plenty of tourists. A pleasant area to walk around well worth a visit. Another photo opportunity for all.

review_title: No improvement since last visit in 2010
review_content: I've been here on 2010 and my hubby is persistent to bring the kids to see the merlion. We go with MRT and walk from Raffles Place. It is quite a walk but the weather is nice. No further improvement of this place and even very little access for stroller or difable access. We had to pick up the stroller thru stairs. No new restaurant. We grab a bite at the small singaporean toast under the bridge. Nothing special.
We were able to enjoy this park during the day and at night. It was very busy with tourists taking photos. The park is immaculately clean.
You can not go to Singapore without seeing this. You must see it.  It is busy but beautiful. Really something special.

Visiting the Merlion is a must see attraction on your visit to Singapore. Nice viewing area overlooking the waterfront and Marina Bay Sands. Looks particularly lovely at night when the statue and the city are lit up.
You don't go to Singapore if you don't visit Merlion Park :) a-must-visit place.  Suggest time to visit: sunset time or night.

This is a free attraction which means that it gets extremely busy during peak tourist periods. If you wish to visit the park then it is advisable to do so with a guide who will be able to impart his knowledge of the history and thereby improve the overall experience.

review_title: Most important landmark and is a must visit
review_content: This was our very first attraction in Singapore, This attraction is in the core of downtown, one requires around 1 hour for this attraction and this attraction is free. There are lot of people at this attraction
The Park, and it's surrounds are ideal, however when it's a busy tourist time, it can be a harrowing experience avoiding all the SELFIE STICKS and thoughtless photographers.
It is free and make sure you get someone/a guide to tell you the history and importance of the place. Not to mention the view while you are walking along the waterfront to the Merlion is amazing!

review_title: Cool place to visit. Big tourist destination!
review_content: We walked down to this to have a look. Was cool to see but nothing spectacular. Was heaps of people around and you can see this is a big tourist destination. Good views over the whole harbour however and was a pleasant walk for us anyway. We walked down from Clarke Quay.

From my childhood hundreds of time I have seen the photograph of this statue. So, I didn't want to miss it when I was there. An amazing view more than it was on my mind. Though lots of crowd was there but I think no one should miss this icon of Singapore. Also you can enjoy the breathtaking views of the Marina Bay, Singapore flyer, art science museum from here.
I remember when this was really on the waters edge but it is now a little way in land. It is the cultural symbol of Singapore and really worth a visit - it's easy to get to by walking too
walking along the river on a beautiful day. Amazing city view. However I do not accept a small bottle of Tiger beer costing SG 16.5 at a riverside joint. Rip off.
this is one of the best spot to take photo, especially creative photos, nice surrounding, nice view, best for jogging, or just walking with your own pace

review_title: How can you go past this photo opportunity?
review_content: Apart from being surrounded by iconic things, no visit to Singapore is complete without a visit to the Merlion. Your younger children may wonder what the fuss is all about, but judging by the crowds, the Merlion remains very popular and well worth a short visit.

review_title: Amazing Surrounding. A must visit place!!
review_content: You will be able to see all skylines around Merlion. Amazing view. Nearby many nice restaurants. Loved the locality. A must visit place.

Enjoyed afternoon by marina bay and took few picks by the Merlion. Off cause the place is crowded but everyone seems to be enjoying the space and it doesn't ruin the experience, it actually adds to it. You can also grab an icecream nearby and enjoy it on a hot Singaporean day, which is everyday.

Nothing much. Very crowded every time. Everywhere you go near it is over priced. But very convenient to walk around it. Very nice city view. Its a must to take selfie with it when you go to Singapore.
Has lots of fun activities mostly for children. Families and children bustling. Many food courts, movies, aquarium. Getting there by cable car is big attraction.
on the waterfront amid beautiful architecture, hotels and shops, the Merlion spews water into the bay. THere's also a baby Merlion a little more removed from the waterfront.
You need a photo here or your Singapore trip is incomplete. Other than that, nothing special. Check it out while completing the circuit of things to do at Marina Bay.
Merlion Park is a famous tourist spot in Singapore. Half fish and half lion, the iconic Merlion is there on the water front. It is the landmark of Singapore.
One of the greatest place to visit. We went noon so it was hot, i think it is better to come at night or early morning. You can see the buildings left and right.

review_title: Honestly, what's all the hype about?
review_content: By all means, go and see the Merlion if you're dying to see this Singapore icon, although I really don't get it - a half mermaid/half lion spouting water into the bay. The surrounding cafes are sooo overpriced, simply there to rort tourists. $6.90 for a simple ice block?? No thanks

Great New Years Eve, the fire works were spectacular. Great environment close to major shopping centres, taxis are easy to access from a number of points around the park. Great place to grab a bite to eat and enjoy the view.

review_title: Never leave Singapore without visiting this park
review_content: The Merlion Park is one of the most visited park in Singapore. Here, you will see Singapore's icon, The Merlion spewing out water to Marina Bay. The park is accessible from Fullerton Hotel, Esplanade and from the Downtown Core. From this park, you will see the Marina Bay Sands just where the Merlion faces to, the Singapore Flyer, the Helix Bridge going to and from the Marina Bay Sands, the Esplanade Theaters, several high-end hotels around Marina Bay and the Singapore Central Business District. Don't leave Singapore without having to have your photos taken with the Merlion, Marina Bay Sands and skyscrapers at the background. You will also find a smaller version of the Merlion meters away from the back of the bigger statue.

review_title: Grab your camera and join the crowd
review_content: How amazing that a concrete lion that was never intended to be anything more than a statue of national symbolism has come to be so representative of the city. And of course infamy was never created without popular support. People have voted with their feet and more importantly, with their cameras.  A trip to Singapore would be complete without a selfie here. But a warning to the wise. You will not be alone.   Don't expect any fanfare and "Wow" moment. Expect to see a lion. A concrete lion. That spouts water.   And enjoy the moment for a few seconds.

If any person goes to Singapore id will for sure get a photo clicked hear.your Singapore trip is incomplete without visiting hear.Merlion Park is must see landmark & tourist hotspot at all times both day & night.it is one od most popular area of Singapore.you can get clear nice view of Singapore Skyline,Singapore Financial Center.Melion symbolizes Singapore.would recommend to do visit this place.

Way too many tourist, but great photop for the Marina Bay Sands background and the Esplanade.   Many tourist attempt the clichè photo of Merlion spurting into their mouth.  Probably the most instagram site in Singapore.

review_title: Nice place to spent a evening
review_content: Its a Nice place to spent a evening. Well known place for taking pictures, should not miss if you are going to singapore.

A visit to Singapore is not complete without a visit to the historic and infamous Merlion (half mermaid/half lion) and surrounding area. Yes it's touristy however I found the Merlion quite fascinating to watch as the water majestically gushes out of his/her mouth into the river.

The Merlion (Mer + Lion), a half-fish half-lion hybrid statue is Singapore's must-see landmark & tourist hotspot at all times both day and night. One of the most popular area of Singapore where tourists gather abundantly. One can have very definite and clear view of Singapore skyline from here as it is surrounded with skyscrapers. Merlion symbolizes Singapore. It is easily visible from almost any place at Marina Bay area. More nicely it is cost free attraction. From here very significant attractions and monuments like Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer, Water floating stadium, big Lotus and Durian structure are so nicely visible. So this is a very good spot for taking photographs. In Sentosa Island there is another Merlion which is huge in size. There is a small park surrounding the statue. Water squirts from its mouth to the river at a commendable volume and speed. Color of the statue and squirting water are changed after dusk. So it is recommended to visit there both at day and night time to have different feelings.  Visited on December 2016
By visiting this place you feel the real soul of Singapore. The water-jet coming off the statue and the laser show which you get to see is amazing

This is a busy spot filled with travellers photographing the iconic Merlion, but it's also a great place to view the architecturally unique Marina Bay Sands Complex. I did a round trip to Clarke Quay on a bumboat from here. Definitely a must see !
The Merlion is Singapore's must-see landmark which is not to be missed when visiting. Tourist hotspot at all times during the day.
Just did a quick walk thru the area to see what was around. This is more of a tourist spot to have pictures with merlion and catch a water ferry. Nothing to special but something cool to go and see
This is the most photographed area of Singapore where tourists are swamped. You can see the various structures around the city by visiting here; but that's just it.
Your trip to Singapore is not complete until you visit this Merlion which symbolizes Singapore. It is better to visit during dusk. You can also see complete skyline of Singapore financial district.

review_title: What Came First-The Lion or the Fish!?!
review_content: This iconic symbol of Singapore is a must see, if only from afar. At its current location, it is visible from almost anywhere in the Marina Bay area. But it is worth a visit to Merlion Park for an up close and personal experience.

It's definetely #1 spot to see. U ain't gone to Singapore if not coming here yet. Surrounded with skyscrapers and across the legendary FULLERTON HOTEL & FULLERTON BAY HOTEL. Also resto and quicky food booth available. It's a free attraction. OK-5

review_title: Visit at night...yhen move to the opposite side of the bay
review_content: I feel the splendor of the views at Merlion park achieve its peak at night, so I favor a night visit. I do advice you then move to the other side of the bay to witness the fabulous free-of-charge water and light show displayed in front the Scoppes at Marina Bay Sands.

It's a really good view point of Singapore. Tourist can see most various attractions from here like Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer etc. Its a ideal please to take picture with most of the Singapore monuments.

After visiting the Merlion on Sentosa we expect something more grand in Singapore. It's so much smaller than it's Sentosa counterpart. We didn't realise we'd seen it many times before from various viewing areas around Marina Bay. My suggestion is if you've seen the Sentosa one don't bother with this one.

review_title: Small, clean park featuring the Merlion.
review_content: The Merlion, a half-fish half-lion hybrid statue overlooks the river. It does not appear to be very big, but it is over 8 meters tall. There is a small clean park surrounding the statue, which is against the river and water squirts from its mouth. Worth a look and a photo, it attracts a lot of visitors but was not too crowded when we were there. We started our sightseeing from this location featuring the symbol of Singapore, the Merlion. Not too far from the Raffles Place Metro Station. Do not remember seeing many signs, so have a map handy.
Nice, clean yet very busy tourist attraction, great scenery of the city , recommended for family visits

review_title: Not As Great as It Sounds
review_content: The Merlion Park is not that great as it sounds. There is a lot of crowd and taking a photo is big problem. We went in the evening, so we couldn't see the lights. But it is still a must-see location.

A Picture is must with the Merlion behind you in different poses when you visit Singapore. When I visited it was pretty crowded. Loads of tourists ...   One need not spend a lot of time here. its easily reachable from the major touristy areas just a quick visit for a couple of good photographs and then move on for the next attraction !!!
A crowded area on the waterfront overlooking the Marina Sands. There are lots of restaurants lining the waterfront.
Very popular site seeing among world tourist. In my oppinion better goes to merlion park in night time, sometimes we able to see laser dance show on marina bay from merlion park
The most recognizable attraction in Singapore. Plenty of tourist and can get crowded at times. Good picture taking spot. Easily reached , walking distance from Marina bay area.

This is one of the major tourist attractions here, located at One Fullerton, a must see because of the iconic association to Singapore. Good photo ops as it has nice view of the bay and skyline. It is recommended to go during weekdays as it can be too crowded during weekends. Better bring along a bottle of mineral water to keep you hydrated as well, it is quite a long walk if you are the adventurous type who would do some explorations on the nearby areas (from Esplanade, Marina Square, Makansutra Glutton's Bay, The Float, Helix Bridge, to The Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands).

Its another statue like many other statues spraying water into the sea. Nothing else. Go in the evening when the sun is not directly overhead. Location is good for photography. I personally did not find it anything special or extra ordinary. Waste of time.
the symbol of singapore and the place every tourist goes to take a picture . you cant miss this one out.

It is almost a must for tourist to take a picture at Merlion Park. However there is no car park near this small park by the water front so be prepare to walk a little. It can also get quite crowded when big tour groups arrive at the same time. There isn't shade so just a short visit for the views and to take some pictures is good enough especially if the weather is hot.

Singapore means Land of Singh (lions). There are 3 merlions (Mamma Pappa & Baby). This symbol has great significance for Singaporeans. Mamma & Baby are at this point. Pappa is at Santosa. Nice place. You can see Singapore City line from here. Despite the fact that there is nothing great here, u can not miss this point, if u are a tourist.

review_title: Great place for photo opp but too crowded during weekends
review_content: Came to take photo with friends at the Merlion and marina bay sands. We came during Christmas day and it was a Sunday. Manage to take some great pics without 'extra props'. There is a Starbucks nearby to chill out after taking photos in the hot sun.

I believe any and everyone visiting Singapore must have Merlion Park in their itinerary.. Just for the namesakes (symbolism) as well as superb view of the marina  The whole view from the pier is breathtaking and unforgettable.. Including Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Singapore Flyer and MBFC

A place which is visited by all just to see the magnificent Merlion.   White ,shiny and attractive statue of Merlion .  Try not to visit during hit days as it's too hot and humid as the place is in oone and does not have shades to take shelter in the hot Sun.
a must see because of it's iconic association to Singapore. Nice views of the bay and skyline. go early and not in a weekend and you can get nice pix
Lovely place to cruise the river, grab a snack or simple sit and soak up the views. We stayed for the evenings light show - amazing!

review_title: Good place to see Singapore sky line
review_content: Nice place to stroll at evening. You will have good views of Marina Bay Sands and the financial district.
The park has good view but if the sun very bright so difficult to "hide", the background of merlion statue has good landscape, any café in these area too, the place easy to find.
You cannot come to the city and not visit here. The fountains seem to work all the time and all you need to avoid is the crowds of people.

Although Merlion is imaginary, the figurine located beautifully among marina bay sands on one side and the bank street on the other. Suggest going there after sunset and if you are luxky you can also see the laser show displayed from Marina Bay Sands. Must see if you plan a trip to singapore. There are pubs n restaurants in close vicinity so great to enjoy a drink sitting close to the Merlion.

review_title: Great destination for marina views and happy snaps
review_content: This is a great spot to visit and soak in the atmosphere of people enjoying the vista, with views all around, including city skyscrapers and across the waters to marina bay precinct. Opportunity for some good destination photos, particularly at dusk/sunset.

The area could benefit from things like local food stalls otherwise it's just a statute that spurts out water in what feels like a business district with a nice river view. But as it's symbolic so it's on the itinerary for tourists to take a picture there. Looks nice both at day time and at night time.
Shame they have mover the Merlion from it's original place, but there again the whole of Singapore has and is changing. Worth going to see the statue.

I really looked forward to go to Merlion Park when I was looking at my Travel Map but it showed lots of mistakes that could be fixed.  1) Limit amount of people in the area 2) Use some more realistic way of pumping water out of the Merlion 3) Put Photo areas

This is a great tourist attraction with many opportunities for fun photos. From certain angles you can make it look like you are drinking from the fountain, or a strategically placed umbrella can look like the fountain is raining on you.

review_title: Nice View of town and Marina Bay
review_content: Nice picture/photo location as you can take the landmark (Merlion), town view pictures and Marina Bay and Singapore Flyer all from one single place.
Your tour bus stops on the road and one has a bit of a walk to reach near the site. Worth walking unless one has difficulty in walking.
A Must visit. Amazing view of the Merlion, the Flyer, Marina Sands and Marina bay and the Esplanade.

This I a great place to start a tourist day as you are in the centre of the heart of culture and attractions with the f1 track just around the corner and musiums and theatre you will need a while day to fully appreciate.
This is certainly a must visit place.. Good to take pictures.. A part of the marina bay walk.. must visit in day as well as evening for different experience..

Seen it a ton of times in pictures, finally saw it for real. Bigger than I expected up close, but there isn't much else around. Lovely Fullerton area, but that was it. 100% tourist spot, can't even get clear picture without any tourist in it, can only see the back of the lion statue

This is one of the busiest places to take pictures of the lion on a nice day, we were able to get some good ones from the cruise, there are 3 statues in Singapore and 2 are located here, the biggest is on Sentosa.

review_title: To Merlion or not to Merlion? Just do it.
review_content: The Merlion is Singapores icon statue. We took a taxi from Shangri-La at Orange Grove near Orchard road to the Merlion Park it was a little over SD8. We were trying to co-ordinate our visit with the other attraction and also the lazer show later after dark. As such we took our pictures in daylight. A few hours later we were still nearby and took some more pictures with the dark skies and the city lights and water reflections and the stunning Marina Bay Hotel in some of our shots. Last year, we visited the Merlion but, the water was not on (most likely for servicing)When we return to Singapore next year we will visit the Merlion again the pictures are always different and the lighting plays a big part of that.

This is a very scenic area to spend an hour or two, especially if the weather is particularly glorious. It's a busy spot, popular with tourists and locals, but it's a great place for pictures whether it be of the opposing iconic 'Marina Bay Sands' or manipulating the Merlion into whatever position your creativity guides you! Some nice spots to drink alongside the merlion, too.

review_title: clean with a good view of the river
review_content: This is a good location to see Singapore's famous Merlion. going to the park provided us the chance to walk along Esplanade and Raffles, making us see the other tourist spots near it.

Iconic Singapore. Pretty touristy, but it really is a beautiful spot to be a tourist. Marina Bay Sands on one side and the Singapore skyline on the other. I would definitely recommend visiting at night when the lights are out. Definitely can’t leave Singapore without a quick snap here!
Its a symbol of Singapore. Good place to visit. Good place to enjoy. For photography. You can visit it within 30 minutes.

If You are in Singapore and you will not visit Merlion park than your tour is incomplete for sure.. It has much more to offer than just taking photo, U can take river ride of approx 45 min in boat in this park, and u will see many interesting things in your journey.. That one round u will see major tings of Singapore city.. So must visit and take boat ride..  Check out photos for more info..

I accompanied other tourists and our tour guide to the Merlion Park where we had a brief photo session. I took photos of the giant white Merlion and bought a sourvenior of the Merlion in the tour bus. I love the song playing in the sourvenior which captures the spirit and beauty of Singapore city.

Excellent place to visit especially at early morning, when there is just few photographers and early bird tourists.  I really recommend to visit before sunrise and stay there until sun is up. Best time is arrive there around 6.30, as sun will rise around 7 am --> and stay until the Merlion starts to "spit" water :D  It is even more beautiful than any photos can describe! And you just have to see it by yourself :) it is worth of traveling from little further, I traveled all they way from East Region of Singapore - took approximately 50min.  Nearest MRT station is Raffles Place, however it can be hard to find your way if you are first time in Singapore, so I recommend to check from map beforehand, and maybe upload offline map :)  --> anyhow, Singaporeans are willing to help, so just ask from anyone if you can't find your way.  ©Katri --> for the photo

This is a must do in Singapore. The best view of the bay at ground level. It is always busy! Make sure you take water though as it can get hot on a sunny day and they charge twice as much as anywhere else in the shops close by.
We visit this area so interesting the Merlion and sorroundings, very well conservated and they also have a duck that goes from land to water and we take nice pictures .
I always wanted to pose in front of merlion view of marina sands was amazing building behind merlion were looking great

review_title: Singapore visit is incomplete without visit to Merlion park
review_content: Merlion park should be the first place you should visit when you are in Singapore. Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and everyone get Merlion in their mind when they think of Singapore. The park is well maintained. The world famous Merlion is opposite of Marina bay sand. You get beautiful view of Marina bay sands and other Singapore's signature building from this park. A nice place to spend time with your family when you are in Singapore. You will get the real feel of Singapore in this place.

My wife and I visited Merlion Park on a beautiful sunny day while strolling along the waterfront esplanade hand in hand. It was a romantic outing and an excellent opportunity for photos of the cityscape from multiple angles. The statue is right on the water, with the Marina Bay Sands in the background, so it presents stunning photo ops
Merlion Park offers good venue for relaxation and exercise. The scenic view helps release stresses. The whole ambiance allows for family bonding to strengthen family relationships.

Location is excellent..nice time can be spend over merlion park..food court available also anyone can enjoy boating on the fresh drinking water..This park is neat and clean, absolutely free from dust.

i really love my trip in here with my beloved friends, have a great view and nice place. no rubbish even in every corner.  orang Indo bilang "gak afdol ke Singapura jika belum mengunjungi Merlion Park." If u're in Singapore, you must provide ur time to visit here, even though 5minutes only :) Have a nice trip fellow.!
just gone to visit dor curiosity and there it is ended checked now of my bucket list bery busy place.
Singapore visit is not complete with the visit to the location ,one can have boat ride from the place .

Located near Marina Bay, this park is home to the Merlion, a half fish with a head of a lion. This mythical creature symbolizes Singapore's humble beginnings as a fishing village. Views here are breathtaking and a good place for photographs.

review_title: Must See when you are in Singapore
review_content: Very busy and crowded area with nice views. The Merlion is directly accessible. It's a good starting point for a longer stroll around the area.

Lovely walking along the mosaic water feature down to the beachside. Lots of flowers to see along the way.  Kids, and adults, can also have fun looking at themselves in the 'crazy mirrors' along the path.
This is great central point for photos, you have the Merlion fountain, the Singapore Skye line and the Marina Bay Sands hotel. All can be seen when you stand here.

The first thing that people relate to Singapore is the Merlion. Hence it is a must visit place if you are in Singapore. Nothing much to do other than just clicking pictures. The view is amazing at night.

review_title: I suppose it is the place you have to say you have been to
review_content: It clean and it is the place that everyone says they have been to in Singapore its worth it just to say you have been there

I found the Merlion itself rather mediocre and the park around it is just concrete walkways. I'm not sure what the attraction of this is. Much better to see it on a boat trip as jsut one of the things to see along the way.

You'll find a lot of tourist here taking pictures and sitting next to the Merlion. It is a good place to take a rest and enjoying the view. You can smell the sea and feel the wind with a clear water in front of you. Get yourself ready to take unique pose with the Merlion.

went there an hour before sunset, I think this is the best time to visit, its not that hot and the hue of the sky is magnificent. a lot of tourist taking pictures, locals jogging and cycling, it was a bustling atmosphere
Very scenic place, with a beautiful skyline of the riverfront. Marina Bay Sands, esplanade and the whole stretch of buildings can be viewed from here. A nice place for Instagram worthy kind of photo!
The place was nice for a one time visit. The weather is good due to the place being on sea shore and there are lots of restaurants and cafes to sit and enjoy the park.

The most photographed symbol of Singapore is the Merlion a the Merlion park..A photograph or a selfie with the same will not complete your trip.   The park in itself is quite busy. There is a promenade that is lined with great restaurants. the ferry pick up point adds to the charm. The best sighting for the sound and light show also happens to be here.   So, be here. Especially in the evenings..the weather is slightly better

We were told this is a must visit place before we traveled so we were eagerly waiting to see this famous sculpture. We were not disappointed. The sight of it made us being in awe. Then we were even more surprised when we saw the baby merlion nearby which is not mentioned very often. The old hotel previously a post office is behind it and the famous Marina Bay Sands Hotel is on the other side of the bay. It makes the site very photogenic.

I had to be patient before taking my selfies here! There are many tourists wanting to have their pictures taken in front of this attraction. Note that there are 3 statues, the biggest and most photographed is the one spewing water!
There were a lot of tourists here, a very busy area. The merlion was good to see, particularly at night time. Hard to get a photo without lots of people around.
This was the first place we visited after setting foot in Singapore. It's nice and worth one visit. It was my first impression.
Traditional place to visit in Singapore. Popular attraction in SIngapore. Park was clean and good for photo shoot.

review_title: Does what it says on the tin
review_content: Literally a lion spewing water. Great for cliche photo opportunities but not much else to do really ...
Its near so many atractions and activities so you will go there anyway. Great photos and breeze. And the veiw is great. Read about it before getting there that way its more impressive.

We cheered with joy when she reached the complex of the Merlion statue. Never imagined, we can get going on a holiday in Singapore. Clean air, comfortable city and is also the perfect place to take pictures at any angle. Do not forget to bring tools to take pictures with the camera, enjoy your time

review_title: Photo Ops and a bit of fun
review_content: This is amongst most popular photo ops places in the city. Alarmist everybody goes here and Heer some good photos, which they then post on social media.  In my opinion this place is over rated , though good.  Most of the attractions here are paid with ticket and over priced.  A good way to be economical and efficient is avoid paid attraction and just walk around this area. Around 3 hours are enough.
A must do visit for all visiting Singapore for the first time, and featured in all the tours. The mythical beast spouts water into the bay, and must be the most photographed site in the city.
If you visit Singapore, you must visit the Merlion Park as this iconic Sigapore. Its very easy to get here and just take a quick picture with this in the background to share with your friends.

It is situated at the heart of The Central Business District. There are many cafes, pubs and eateries along the stretch of the board walk. It is easily accessible by MRT train. I suggest that you get "lost" exploring The Central Business District where tall buildings of famous banks stands. There are many Hawker centres around the CBD too. Hawker Centres are places where you can get local food and many other famous cuisines at affordable prices. The nearest one would be Market Street Food Centre. It is located across the street. You can get across by the connecting bridge to change alley where you get the best exchange rates. Fullerton Hotel is also nearby. I highly recommend you to go and try out the local fare for a song! There is this Singapore culture where one would reserve a place to seat by placing a piece of name card if a pack of tissue paper! You should experience it during the lunch crowd period between 11.30am to about 2pm. Happy discovering!

Merlin Park is a very popular destination. Located across the water from the massive Marina Bay Sands, it's probably the destination where the most pictures are taken. Like the rest of Singapore, there's a lot of food around, albeit at inflated prices. I'd suggest going at night because of all the lights on the surrounding buildings. Granted, you may not get a complete snap of the Sands, but you'll have a much nicer overall experience.

review_title: A must see symbol of Singapore and its Free to visit!!!
review_content: Its free to walk to the Merlion (half lion head and mermaid tail). You can take a bus, subway or taxi or uber to this place to admire the symbol of Singapore.

I had to see the Merlion. I've seen pictures of it but never in person...soooo, walked from Orchard Street where I was staying and made it to the waterfront...and all of a sudden, there it was...The Merlion....tall, white and spraying water. Pretty cool...well worth the hike.

review_title: What's a Trip to Singapore Without Visiting the Merlion
review_content: The Merlion is one of those things that you have to see when visiting Singapore, even if you go there every year. Depending on where you are positioned next to the Merlion, you could take some nice photos with Marina Bay Sands or the Singapore Flyer as the backdrop.
You can't stop in Singapore and not see the Merlion on the waterfront. Some great views of the city skyline and the Marina Bay Sands complex!

review_title: A good place to cool down in the evening
review_content: My family and I visited here recently in the evening. We rode the MTR which was very convenient. This park is very nice at night with Pleasant lights and cool breezes. It is a good place to hang out and watch people. I also recommend walking around the Bayfront see what's happening.
This is a standard visiting point on any of the city tours. Not a lot here but OK for a short pit stop. Packed with tourists with selfy sticks smiling at themselves.

You get a great touristy pic here and also nice pics of the surrounding buildings. Unfortunately, it was a pic cloudy when we went there, but it was still beautiful. It's full of tourists so it might take a few tries to get the perfect shot.
Merlion park statues is a symbol of SG. And it is a must watch place standing tall in front of sea. It is nearer Marina bay bus stop. It is a good place for tourists

review_title: You should not leave Singapore without a picture here.
review_content: The iconic Merlion is the one true picture that tell everyone that they've been to Singapore. But watch out, there's just too much tourist trying to take that souneir shot.

If the Big Ben Tower (Elizabeth II Tower) is to London, MERLION is to Singapore. This Park is ideal for picture taking , walking, jogging and biking.   You may also walk to various malls and other attractions nearby.   Note: There are several Merlions in Singapore, one is in Sentosa - so take your pick.

The Singapore Merlion is iconic, and your trip wouldn't be complete without a stop to see it person. Are things overpriced in the area? Yes, of course - but, stop by for a few pictures, or better yet, do a river boat ride.
Must do: visit and picture of Merlion. The place is crowded èspecially at night. It shows great view of the Marina bay and the skylines.

Just in front of Fullerton and a walk away from the Raffles station or the Marina Bay station. Lots of tourists take picture of this famous land mark. There is a lot of restaurants around if you get hungry. In front you get to see the Marina Bay sands. Very nice in the afternoon and night.
Cute lion thingy. Nice bridges, walkways, views. Lot of food and bev places nearby. Lots of space to sit down, relax, and take in the view. Tickets for boat cruise nearby.

I have visited this place a few years ago before. The surrounding area is really change now. It looks nicer with a lot of restaurants in the surrounding area. It's located close to the Fullerton hotel. It's a good place to visit.

If you are in Singapore, this is a must do! A trip to Singapore without a signature pic with Merlion is not complete. Merlion is combination of Lion's Head and body that of Fish, in simple words.  Time: It would not require much time. You can stop by, click with Merlion and move on with some other activity. But it is good place to sit, relax, view the Skyline, Merlion, stroll around.  Many restaurants are also near by. So you can plan for a evening and then go to a restaurants. Anytime is good time. Though evenings are beautiful!  It is open for public and no fee is required. Raffles Place Station is the closest MRT stop.  I personally love this place and spent lot of hours. You can walk around and see the Esplanade domes, Art and Science Meusem, Flyer, Helix bridge, MBS Hotel, Fullerton Hotel among other things!
Its just another hyped Landmark to get picture clicked . Yippeee I visited Singapore but apart from that nothing to be amazed
user_location: New Delhi, National Capital Territory of Delhi, India

review_content: The good news? It's free and easy to find (right next to One Fullerton). Additionally, it's got a great view of the bay. It's a pretty symbolic statue here and there is a neat dock that goes into the water so that you can try and get a good picture. It was kind of funny to watch people get pictures of the Merlion filling their water bottle, etc.

We had a short (45 mins) visit to the park, felt was good enough time, even half an hour will do, one of the crowded places even on a normal day, looking at the open space in the park. Do plan for snaps in different positions after researching on the net, prior to visiting the park. It is more of photo shooting area. But yeah, do not miss it if you are in Singapore.

I find this is just an ordinary sculpture. Whats important is the legend behind it and not the sculpture itself. The sculpture is not made of marble but cement, painted in white emulsion.  It is still worth the visit because of the marina bay backdrop.
Good space/place for take a picture with merlion and marina bay. Night will be good to take a photo, coz of
I Love Singapore, Very Clean city, No traffic, you don't see people eating or drinking everywhere. They can only smoke on a specific area. Best place to relax. we enjoyed our vacation in the city.
Visiting singapore is uncomplete without seeing merlion, merlion is so big, a very good place to take a picture

review_title: Nice place for an evening walk
review_content: Best part of Singapore is the way city is designed. Places like Merlion park add the feathers to the crown of the city. Be prepared to walk a lot here. So wear your walking shoes when you are heading to the part. Great place to click pictures and purchase souvenirs

review_title: just a land mark to photograph with
review_content: a place that everyone who goes to Singapore visits for sure, Nothing great about it just a photos taking spot to prove you went to singapore

What a great statue, must come visit and take some tourist pictures! Other things around to see, ice cream shops, cafes and gift wares. Great views of other famous landmarks like Marina Bay sands. We walked from the station took around 15 min.
This is the place which symbolizes Singapore. The crowd, the merlion, the water, the shops makes it a fun day. You can also buy sovereigns from here.

It was our first night in Singapore so we just headed to the Merlion Park. I was speechless when we got there. It was amazing. Beautiful buildings and the whole park is breath taking. Has a really nice view.

From herbal stores to restaurants Chinatown is alway happening. Trending seems to be Crab Hot Pots and Dim Sum. Didnt have much luck finding Duck dishes = ( which i enjoy. The herbal stores always are a trip. Shark fin, bird's nest, dried seahorses & sea slugs.

Still wondering why tourist should come here, it is a nice walk, if weather not too hot pleasant as well, you can see Marina Bay building and the statue of the Merlion you always saw in documentaries and postcards .. but at the end it is just a walk on a normal promenade made not even too many years ago, with nothing historical or too fascinating to see. Good fro Asian tourists but for European - used to history and culture and much more, it is a 30 minutes break among one mall and the other
Enjoy spending time in here for 20 minutes. too many people. I feel like i have to come here because of this is the signature of Singapore but not much to do here.
Nice relocation of the Merlion, with platform for visitors extending over the river. Lets you get close now vs. the old days.

Merlion,is a symbol of Singapore. Almost think of Singapore, Merlion is the first image in our mind. The Merlion does not really an animal. According to ancient records about the Merlion, it is a Imagine legendary animal. Merlion Park is the most popular place that visitors must come to see the Merlion. I remember the tour guide tell me, there are two poses people will use to take photo. First is the action look like you drink the Merlion water, it means you open your mouth and the Merlion is falling such as you are drink. Second is you holding your hand like you get the water. In Singapore, people think the Merlion’s water is golden water, if you drink and receive it , it will bring good luck for you. Do in Rome as Rome does. Try to know more other different country culture, you can enhance your knowledge.

review_title: Good to spend 15 minutes for a picture with Merlion
review_content: Located by the Marina Bay, the Merlion is synonymous with Singapore (aka Lion city). I see lots of your buses making stops here too so that tourist get a memorable picture. This venue has a great view of the Marina Bay Sands hotel too. Definitely worth a visit on your maiden trip to Singapore.

This is a symbol in Singapore. You never told other people visit Singapore if you never visit the Merlion park. The Merlion is a head of lion and body of fish. It is strange structure but this is a symbol in Singapore. The body of fish represent Temasek. The head of lion represents the king find lion in Singapore. I recommend that you visit Merlion part around 30 minutes. The mouth of Merlion spout water. You can find a special position to take a photo. I recommend that you come to Merlion park in the night. It is because light make the Merlion become brightly. The light make the Merlion have different image. The music is pleasant. You can sit near Merlion and enjoy music. The Merlion park have a lot of restaurant. You can buy some foods or drinks. You enjoy the Merlion Park and eat some foods. It is nice experience.
A great location looking out over the water. This location gets very busy even relatively early especially on the weekend. Great to wander around the water and stop by the Merlion.

Since we were nearing the end of our trip, we didn't have much opportunity to stay very long here, but it should be one of your stops before you leave so that you can see the famed Merlion. It's a beautiful statue and the views of the Marina Bay Sands, the downtown core and Esplanade are gorgeous. Be prepared for the crowds, though, as there are lots of people hanging out and taking pictures. If you want a great picture of the Merlion, you'll have to be patient! Otherwise, a very nice to see...and a fairly quick walk to the Boat Quay if you're wanting to do that as well.

This place is never quiet, so many tourist every time I visit. Far from stations but near to bus stop. Prepare your leg to walk from there to nearest convenience store. Thats around 800m at raffles place station. Quite tiring.
its' consider as symbol of the city, good photo stop , has two status , boating options are available

Located in the Marina Bay region this is the most touristic place in Singapore. Here you can see the financial heart of the city with skyscrapers and Marina Bay Sands ans Singapore Flyer and take nice pictures . No need to spend too much time but a must see place for tourists
I found this better at night when the Merlion and the Bay skyline are all lit up. Great place to people watch as well.

The Merlion park is along the bay and a photographers heaven. Panoramic views of the great architecture which are breathtaking. Crowded as everyone is trying to take photos of the Merlion. Be patient and you will get your chance. The restaurants along the bay are pricey. Ate at the Starbucks on the bay which was really good and in budget. Be sure to place Merlion park on your things to do in Singapore list.
You simply can't miss this as this is the symbol of Singapore. There is the original Merlion and a new baby Merlion in the park. Lots of people doing the "water drinking" shots!

review_title: Seeing the difference between day and night
review_content: The Merlion is a big part of Singapore's history and also a beatiful work of art. The caption of my review must have caught your attention and I can say that the park is beatiful in the day but more beautiful at night the perfect mix of colors and the water fountain highlights the statue itself which makes it best to take creative shots that a tourist or traveller wants.
