Before you reach the park, if you pass by the bridge through walking you will be able to see the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands and all the other buildings with the pretty lights (perfect for panorama shots or any pic you want).
A 15 minute spot to have a picture with merlion lion on your back. Took some funny pictures and enjoyed a lot with my friends.
Merlion Park is a place where a person can view a standing lion with a fountain in the mouth and withstanding is a River. It has good scenic views and is a good photo point.!

You can not come to Singapore and not see one of the Merlion! This one sits proud on the main harbour front and is lit up at night. Surrounded by bars and restaurants it's a nice place to go both day or night.
Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore. It gets quite busy, so be prepared for the crowds.Cool landmark to visit.great photo opportunity, of the Marina Bay area.Love the merlions!

The picture-ready Merlion is just awesome. From the park, you can see the picture perfect view of Marina Bay Sands and Singapore Flyer on the opposite side, with esplanade theater to your left. And of course the view of Singapore river that tells its history and culture.
A small area on the water front with 3 statues of the Merlions (lion heads and fish bodies), good or taking photo's but not much else there.

MerLion (half mermaid half Lion) is the mascot for the city of Singapore whose name is derived from Sanskrit for Lion (Singha) City (Pura).  The area is well kept and you can find it very neat and clean despite it being very crowded.  The lighting all around the waterfront makes the ambience very soothing. You can walk around here and dine at one of the many outlets which offer a wide range of options for food and drinks.

As expected, tourists and locals are just everywhere but mostly tourists trying to get a good shot of the Merlion. Good luck with getting a nice shot without photobombers. But of course, this one is a must in Sg.

One of those attractions for the first time traveler to Singapore   Locacted city side of the bay and close to old town the merlion attracts tourist from around the world  Great free activity which the kids will love

Merlion is a landmark near the Central Business District (CBD). It is a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish and it is the symbol of Singapore. It is an outdoor attraction, if it is sunny it is going to be too hot and if it rains you will get wet! A couple of expensive restaurant can be found around the area. You can even get a boat through the river.

This attraction has a nice legend corresponding to the founding of the city. Its in a slightly difficult location to travel to, but when all is said and done its a statue with water coming out of its mouth and near a very very pleasant view of Singapore itself.
Excellent Area. Very nice view for Photos. Good Place of amazing Photos and experience the overall views. Must watch place
Only a short walk behind the Fullerton Hotel near the water. Great restaurants nearby to enjoy. Make a night of it by visiting Merlion Park, dinner drinks and a boat tour,

Of course you have to see merlion if you are in singapore! However the walk from mrt station through fullerton, raffles, riverside is simply amazing. the view of marina bay from merlion is breathtaking. visit in evening for the best view.
It's a famous spot in Singapore, and you can walk beside the lake to the other famous hotel- Marina bay sands. It's worth to take a walk here.

Unless you visit in the dead of night or real early in the morning, you can forget about taking a photo with the merlion. Tourist flock there by the bus loads and you can't get a good shot of the merlion. The night view is pretty amazing though but you don't have to enjoy the view from the merlion park. Unless you are a huge fan of crowds, don't bother visiting during peak hours.
This is a great photo opportunity and the photos deliver.. However had the most tourists I've seen on this trip here..
Had the chance to discover more about the history of Singapore and the story behind the Merlion. Very nice area to walk around and several attractions within walking distance.

review_title: Snapping pictures with the iconic Merlion!
review_content: Was lucky enough to visit when it wasn't filed with tourists yet. After getting pictures of the Merlion, there's varietal choices of restaurants and cafes close by to freshen up yourself after a long walk under the sun! :)
One of the more crowded place in Singapore, but the crowds don't detract from the great views, and amazing picture opportunities. It's a beautiful walk during a nice day.
This was also part of our morning tour to Sentosa. I'm so glad to have experienced this trip, I leave with some nice memories
Merlion Park is a must see while in the Lion City. The Merlion is the main attraction here. Its nice but I will say there is a far more impressive Merlion on Sentosa Island.
Great place to visit to get a great view of the main architectural showcase of the city. Very popular at sunset. Place to star a walk along the river
This park is just for clicking pics and moving on. Nothing to see here. Merlion pics are the most overrated pics as its just to show people that you were in Singapore.
The iconic statue of Singapore. So crowded even when in the weekday morning. Near with Marina Bay Sands and Fullerton Hotel. Just for photostop.

review_title: A place to be at in the morning & evening
review_content: I was there for my morning walk after coming back to Singapore from vacation. Bright sunny day as usual with lots of tourists. A place that I bring my overseas visitors to in the early evening to see the Merlion and MBS, follow by drinks and dinner along One Fullerton or Fullerton Bay Hotel.

Hahaha because i did the usual pose of what others used to do. We went here during daytime and nightime. Because the time has something to do with the view. Because for some they like the night view but for me i like both.
Great place, sight seeing in this area is amazing,, the views towards the sands sky park is incredible.
this is a perfect place for nightout in Singapore. The leger light show from opposite site of the Merlion statue at night is spectacular! dont miss the night river cruise as well
Since this is the Epitome of Singapore, picture opportunities abound. Weather was perfect the day we visited so there was a good crowd.
You have to be there if you got a chance to visit singapore..there are a restaurants around there in case you are hungry or tired

This waterfront is an ideal place for pictures, either of the Symbol of Singapore - the lion, either of the incredible skyline. Both river and the marina at once are greatly reachable from this very well placed spot to people that has not much time to stay in Singapore. Easy to reach with the train from the airport (Raffles Place station). Shopping and restaurants well represented.

review_title: The Merlion, Esplanade and Marina Bay Sands in one place
review_content: The view is a wonder. You can view the esplanade, the marina bay sands and the central business district in one place. However, the place is very popular for tourists. Even on weekdays, the park is too crowded. It would be difficult to have a solo shot because everyone wants to take a picture. It is better to go there at night. The hawker stalls open, you can try the chilli crabs and other local foods at cheaper prices. At 9pm, the marina bay sands light show starts. You can watch it at the jubilee bridge or at the viewing deck of the esplanade. It is also less crowded and better for photo opps.
Nice view and great for pictures. With a park nearby and a museum, and the river. Great for looking back at Singapore's history. Nice walk.
If you are visiting Singapore you need to visit the Merlion... Fun time wandering around with other tourists and taking photos.

Like every attractions in singapore this is a 'must visit' place. We had a really great time. This place has plenty to offer; plenty restaurants and ice- cream parlour. You can enjoy the scenic view along with a bottleof chilled beer.

review_title: Not so much activity but definitely not worth a miss
review_content: A very rare thing about this place is that it is one of the very few attractions which are free. There nothing much to do here other than take good pictures with the merlion and Singapore Flyer in the background. Also theres a good skyline of large buildings that can be a good picture background. But This is the emblem of Singapore so donot miss it, just club it with your visit to Gardens by the bay, which is nearby (just 6 SGD by UBER).

review_title: Great spot to see the bay
review_content: This is where the famous Merlion is. One of Singapore's emblem. Also a great place where to sightsee Marina Bay and where to take one of the boats for a ride around the river.
Nothing much to see or do here. No activities nothing, just a landmark for tourists to take photographs for their memories here.

review_title: Beautiful Place  - Merlion Park in Singapore
review_content: It's a well known Tourist attraction in Singapore and it's Home to an 8.6 metres tall Water Spouting Merlion with the Head of a Lion and the Body of a Fish really it's awesome one must visit this place.
To me it's not important to go there and it's squeezed in the popular spot for tourists. So I think it's worth a visit. It's just not that exciting to me.

This park is on the Quayside and has food outlets, boat trips, shops and bars around it. The quayside is really beautiful and clean, its very well visited and the Merlion fountain is amazing. Its quite large and shoots water into the quay. There is a miniature Merlion behind the large one.  The statue is a cross between a Mermaid and a Lion hence the name!
Excellent Views Of Modern Singapore. A nice tourist spot. A Must See if in Singapore. A Symbol for Singapore.

review_title: Nice views any direction you look
review_content: Especially at night this is a beautiful location. Full view over the bay with Marina Bay Sands and of course the beautifully lighted Merlion (and it's littlr brother). A number of fine bars and restaurants.

They say you are not in Singapore if you have not visited The Merlion Park. Lots of tourist here, its hard to get a good photo. We were here at 3pm so it was very hot. The place would have been great to visit at night. I would love to go back here at night time next time I visit SG.

You can never truly visit singapore without visiting the merlion park. This is located outdoors so i suggest wearing something to protect your skin. It was so hot outside. It was fun having taking pictures of the view around as well.

The famous Merlion! This place is amazing and you get a full view of the bay and the MBS. A lot of nice Pubs and Hotels around.   It could get very crowded but I guess if one goes in the morning or before noon it should be fine.Also when you visit Singapore on summer it could get very hot..  but a must see when your there!!!

funny is you must go to see merlion when you are in singapore or otherwise you trip is not complete. But it is super small and i don't why it is here and so many people like it. The view there is stunning though. especially at night! after that you can go to clarke quay for a drink haha.

We visited this place in the afternoon and it was very hot and humid. Nothing exceptional. The place was crowded and did not enjoy the experience. Visit only if you have some extra time in your tour of Singapore.

It was August of last year 2015, it was Singapore 50th birthday and my 41st birthday at he same time. We went to KL, Malaysia and Cross border just to celebrate my birthday. The Merlion Plaza was packed with so many people, Singaporean really showed how they love the smallest but the most progressive island in the world.

Yes, this place is fully the iconic of City State Singapore. The statue is quite big and directly facing the ocean. Many tourists come and quite crowded. But to be honest its fully worth. Recommended One.
Since our last visit the Merlion has been relocated and the surroundings improved. There's even a small jetty which makes a great place to take photos.

We had a lovely evening at the merlion park, the light show was great and the view of the marine bay hotel and the bank district was fabulous. Some beautiful photos were taken and happy memories made.

It was a nice view. Of course I had to bring my family here because a Singapore trip is not complete if you did not see the Merlion. It was a sunny day and there was a lot of tourist so we had a hard time taking great photos.
Great atmosphere, bustling with tourists taking pictures of the surrounding buildings and of course the famous Merlion statue.

A night visit at the Merlion Park one of the signature places that should visit while in Singapore. We enjoy the walk going there from our hotel. It's a 5 to 10 minutes walk from Mandarin Oriental Singapore. A lot of people are going there to have a photo taken at the Merlion. Near or far with artistic touch and imagination, Voila! Having Fun!

Come here for 10 minutes to take your obligatory picture of Singapore's icon and the Marina Bay and hotel. Then move on. Everyone else will be there so be patient when trying to make it look like there is no one else there in your photographs ! Nothing else to do...

review_title: Have to visit the city's mascot
review_content: This is just a quick visit, take a photo with the lion and the great view in the back. It's central location makes it easy to then walk to Marina Bay or to stop somewhere nearby for a drink or something to eat with the lion in the background.
Great site for photographs of the whole of the Marina Bay area.....not much shade around but great for starting a riverside walk

We walked around the bay from Marina Bay Sands to the Fullerton Hotel to see the large Merlion which is so iconic for Singapore - just one of the things you HAVE to get your photo take with in order to say been there , done that! Lots of other people had obviously thought the same thing as the site was very busy. Glad we did it - it was bigger than I had anticipated from pictures I'd seen. There's a viewing platform which you can walk out on to to get photos but if you do the river cruise you also get photos from the boat as it is a pick up point. There 's a smaller merlion too just behind it in the park area.
Original Name of this country and city is "Singapura" means head of the Lion of course now it's became of logo of Singapore . A must watch tourist in Singapore
Of course it's a must have shot on your photo album in Singapore. Not much else to do around it though, but it is a must! Great attraction for kids.
I stayed around the marina area so I saw this, it would be an interesting site to see while you're visiting Singapore.

review_title: Good place for your Evening stroll
review_content: You could enjoy nice relaxing evening stroll in Merlion park area. Good scope for testing your night photography skill. Nearest MRT is Raffles place.  From Merlion park, one could walk up to Esplanade mall and through Singapore river bridge. Very nice place for evening walk( even run). Watching High rise building , which are nicely lit and enjoy the breeze of Singapore river. Don't miss this place and walk around and end your evening with good meal near river front.

review_title: Very touristy but the area buzzes with excitement
review_content: Having been during the day and evening, I think it's more dramatic going after dark. The whole waterfront area is alive with lights and people buzzing around. The Merlion statue is pretty impressive but honestly only takes a few minutes to see and appreciate before moving on to the next thing.

When I bought my Groovy Map for Singapore while staying in Bangkok I saw the Merlion and thought this was a must see.It actually took a while getting there but once there a great sight in the evening.
How else do you show that you were in Singapore? The must go place to take selfies when in Singapore.
I came to SG many years ago when the Merlion status was not surrounded by beautiful waterfront parks like it is today. This is amazing transformation!

I went there in the night, and guess what? the view was really amazing, a lot of people sitting there and also taking picture at the same time. we can also sit near the riverside and relax either. The tower across the river makes me fall in love with the place.

review_title: Getting a phot can be a hassle. But worth it
review_content: OK, everybody gets a photo of the Singapore Merlion, usually with them in it. It is a symbol that instantly say "I've been to Singapore." Don't miss out. Do it. Just be prepared to have to wait in line a bit to get that perfect shot (you know the one where the water is spraying from your mouth.)

A truly amazing place, spectacularly situated on the river front. Very popular with all ages. It was great in the daytime but more spectacular in the evening with the lights on in the bay. Brilliant sight!

review_title: Wouldn't spend too much time there
review_content: Good view over Marina Bay, the river and all the buildings around. Also good spot to see the night light show. But way too many tourists. There's a better Merlion statue in Sentosa

review_title: Quick view of iconic merlion for photo
review_content: Lots of people taking selfies at Merlion. Good views across the bay and a series of bars and restaurants along promenade..most not open until lunchtime. Most tourists find it difficult to find access across road network to reach it. We wouldn't rate it a "must see".

This is the most popular place in Singapore. You can reach by multiple way, boat, bus, cab. there are many photo shoot points. one side is Singapore Flyer, and gardens by the bay, other side Museum, art gallery, and Sky scrappers. Enjoy yourself by coffee and sea food.

A really nice setting, especially in the evenings when you have a panoramic view of Singapore's nighttime glitter. Lots of good restaurants and cocktail lounges nearby. The Merlion sculpture is fun to see as well. Accessible to several other attractions and close to the MRT (subway).
Icon of Singapore with best city view. you have to take a picture when you visit this country. Strategic location , very easy to found it.
the lion is the simpology of singapore it hase big meaning to have photo around . close to best hotel in Asia and sea food resturants. also u can visit hanging gardens

Really one of the most popular tourist point in Singapore you will see the giant Merlion (half mermaid & half lion) symbol of Singapura (land of lions) then you have many option there taking walking ride around and having plenty of magnificent photo or riding cruise of Singapore for 40 minutes or dining in many cafe or restaurant situated near by  You will surely have a great unforgettable moment

We walked along the river from Richardson Quay. You can go by boat, bus, train or taxi. The park's main attraction is the mythical Merlion, although the surroundings ate also attractive. The views are very good.
If going to Marina bay than this is a must to see best at nighttime. The outdoor lion fountain is great at night then go catch the outdoor laser light show

review_title: Swarming with Tourist wanting to click a pic
review_content: Highly overrated tourist spot. But guess anyone going to Singapore wants a pic in front of Merlions - the Symbol of Singapore. Other than that nothing much to write about. On the other side you can find the Singapore skyline with the 'Singapore Flyer' & 'Gardens of the Bay'. Go there only if you are a tourist dying for a pic to post on FB.
Good photo opportunity, we found that we got more information on the statue itself from the boat tour we have done the previous night.

Initially I wasn't sure what the significance of the Merlion was and what the big deal was about. Upon doing further research I found out the Merlion is symbolic because it personifies Singapore. Singapore used to be a fishing city and another name for Singapore is the Lion City so the Merlion is a combined symbol of the city and nation.  I really enjoyed this Merlion, it's close to the river, has great places to eat out and gives a great view of the city. Well worth a visit

Top tourist spot, not only for the Merlion but also as across the bay is the Marina Bay Sands. Top spot to take some great tourist photos of everything, including the city skyscrapers in the background

The boardwalk along the marina bay waterfront offers a sweeping view of the Marina Bay Sands, Flyer, Arts Science Museum and all the other sky scrapers along the coast. The Merlion is Singapore’s most iconic landmark and allowing everyone to get the best pictures at day or night. Watch the beautiful Laser Show from the fantastic boat ride and treat yourself with a chill beer and the best Singapore chili crabs.

review_title: View of the bayfront and the Merlion
review_content: The promenade along the marina bay waterfront offers unhindered sweeping view of the Marina Bay Sands, Flyer, Arts Science Museum and other skyscrapers.the statue of merlion is the face of Singapore and a selfie zone.Its always crowded with scores of tourists, locals. Esplanade Bridge leads from the Theatres on the Bay and can be reached by the boat also. The Laser Show in the evening is a must watch.
A must see attraction whilst in Singapore. Won't need a long time there just a few minutes. Based in Marina Bay

The park crowded of tourists and everybody took photos of the Merlion and the spectacular views of the bay and buildings. The Merlion, spouting water into the sea, is a symbol of Singapore, and a "must see" when visiting Singapore. Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.

review_title: The Merlion is a Must See!
review_content: One of the most iconic sights in Singapore, the merlion is a must-see attraction! Lots of tourists are there all day but its a great place to see the Marina Bay area as well as the city skyline. So many selfies take here - I was even asked a few times by some groups to help take photos! Haha! Really fun place!
Singapore Icon which you have to visit when you come to Singapore. From this site you also may see other iconic place in Singapore. Nice place.
A visit to Singapore is only complete after taking in the sights in and around the Merlion Park. The history of Singapore unfolds from this very river.

The only really great thing about Merlion Park is some pretty sweet skyline views and its proximity to 'big-city' architecture. The Merlion himself is not very big, and a little kitschy, even. Food stalls and shops near the Merlion are very expensive. If I only had less than a few days in Singapore I wouldn't go out of my way to visit him.

review_title: Iconoic , should go to relax in the evening
review_content: Its Singapore's symbol and is a place worth the visit in the evening . Do the board walk to reach the Merlion park , take some photos , chill in the coffee shops along the way
I visited here during the night time. The view was breath taking so I visited again on the next night.

When it's your first time in Singapore, don't miss going to Merlion Park. The Merlion is the landmark that symbolizes Singapore. The views in this area are very nice because one can see and walk through the Esplanade Theater and the Marina Bay Sands. Would be nice to visit on a daytime and nigh time.
Visiting the Merlion, a must for Singapore, you should pay attention to small Merlion as well. Cute and loved by kids :)

I'm visit the Merlion during my first trip to Singapore. Its very beautiful place to visit. This is symbolic place (Icon) of Singapore. Its very nice place from where you can view the Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer.

review_title: A Good Stop-by Choice After Dinner
review_content: If you are new to Singapore, and you want to enjoy a 30-60 minutes breeze, pls consider this Merlion Park. Best in the evening to enjoy the cool breeze and city lightings. This would be an excellent place to take very nice landmark photos of the city. Beautiful water, bridges, Singapore Flyer, skylines of the financial district, MBS & Skypark, Esplanade, and....most important of all The Merlion. There are F&B outlets nearby too.
Visited the Merlion during the F1 weekend during day light and at night, a must see. Very easily accessible.

If you are in singapore this place is must visit even the walk from raffles MRT E exit to merlion is icon in front of furlton hotel cafe. The place itself has beautiful views and if time and money permits should try the river cruise at S$25.
This is symbolic place of Singapore the mer lion park and it's a very nice place from wherein you can see marina bay.

review_title: Best to visit evening and wait for the night view of skyline
review_content: Icon of Singapore. Go in evening so it's not so hot. Have a drink and catch the night view of the area. There is light show from MBS which is a lovely sight of the skyline.
Good for photo shoot but you can't relax here. Better walk to the other side of the river. Visit the place during weekdays. I have tried going here on a Sunday last July and the crowd doubled.
Love this place as always everytime visit Singapore  Never get bored  You can see all the beautiful Singapore from here

This is an amazing place to relax. Suggest to visit in the evening to avoid the burning sun.  Closest MRT is Raffles place and from there it is within walking distance. Got some great food and juice outlets and the view from the park is mind blowing.  MUST VISIT.

A nice little park in the business district. Walkable from esplanade MRT. A nice photo opportunity of marina bay Sands and of course 1 of the 7 Merlions placed around Singapore. Not am essential trip but a nice one if you have time.

review_title: Photo opportunity and not much more
review_content: Since the Merlion is the mascot of Singapore, it's no surprise that tourists of all sorts are brought and/or flock here to take pictures. It's crowded, very crowded so be prepared to share this space with any others.

Take a view across Singapore from Merlion Park, especially at night time. Wonderful architectural structures, beautifully lit. Be careful of taking a beer in that area though - the cost could cause you some concern.

A must see location when visiting Singapore. Walk along the river and bays edge and take in the sights including the iconic merlion. Take a snap and grab a cold drink or ice cream from one of the many nearby establishments.
If you want to see the view of Singapore, Merlion park is the best place to go. Good for picture taking. Lots of restaurants and food place to sat while enjoying the view.
Good view , nice place to take pictures, good place to walk in evening and night,near esplanade great view of Singapore flyer, marina bay sand hotel

This place "must go" list i think.. every peoples go to singapore always go here..is the famous merlion park ever statue of singapore.  The place was awesome. You can spend the day here..i suggest to go here at evening about 18-19 pm to get the ambient of the city.. or you can have a dinner around this park,many resto or cafe provide here..its worthed cause you can see all view of marina bay , singapore flyer,amphitheater and garden by the bay view..all complete view in here.. in the night above 9pm you can see a little show of lighting from marina bay mall..but if yoy wat to see clearly i suggest go there to the mall beside. So its must go list.

review_title: Nice views and very historic place.
review_content: Been there many times on my travels to Singapore. the site has a lot of history and the merlion is very symbolic to the Singaporean's.

review_title: Nice to Walk Around or take a Boat
review_content: Merlion Pak, located by the Marina Bay across Fullerton Hotel and connected to Esplanade Theatre by a pedestrian bridge, is a small paved park housing Merlion, the 8.6 m tall half fish half lion white statue sprouting water from its mouth. It symbolizes Singapore's humble start as a fishing town while also representing the country's original name, Singapura, which in Malay means lion city.  The park is not big with nothing much to see and is often crowded with people wanting to take photos of Merlion. There's however a lovely view of the bay with boats passing by and the unique looking Marina Bay Sands hotel across. It's nice to walk around. You can cross the pedestrian bridge towards the Esplanade Theatre where you can watch shows, relax on the open platform by the bay, eat at the restaurants or hawkers foodcourt nearby (Makan Sutra). You can also cross the street towards the Fullerton Hotel, walk on the historic Cavenagh Bridge to the Asian Civilisation Museum or take a boat around the Singapore River or to Clarke Quay for dinner. At night the area is especially awesome when lighted and on special occasions such as New Year we can watch cool fireworks.

When in Singapore, it's one of those mandatory picture spot. It's absolutely crowded as well, whenever you go, so need to have some patience to get that opportunity. You can take a walk through the quay, have a sight of MBS from the other side and in cover Merlion as well.

review_title: just tourist icon with not surprise
review_content: clean surrounding and well plan area made this iconic Merlion still be magnet for all tourists. should visit in the evening and walk to the Esplanade or Helix bridge for sunset scene.

review_title: Epic View and brings back fondest memories of vintage Singapore
review_content: Must do activity. we visited it as a part of city tour. Get loads of snaps with merlion in the backdrop. It is the iconic symbol of Singapore.

review_title: perfect scenic shot at the Merlion Park.
review_content: The Park is located right opposite Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer, and the Esplanade Theatre. All these landmarks come together, gives you a perfect scenic shot at the Merlion Park.

review_title: Merlion Park - the icon of Singapore
review_content: Visiting the Merlion Park either day or night does not makes much of difference, as both are picturesque timing. Lovely night view of skyscrapers along the Singapore river, take a stroll and slow down your pace. Relaxing place to be in.
When walking around the quay you cannot miss the Lion by the Fullerton hotel the old post office and the bridge at the same time do the canal trip and a great historical talk will quite informative
It's a combination of two animals including lion and another fish which i don't know. You can see this place while you're in a city tour or on a night tour.

review_title: You can't miss the Singapore landmark!
review_content: Merlion park is the most emblematic Singapore land mark. The bay landscape is amazing...you can see in scene the teather, the Merlion and the Marina Sand Bay hotel..the sun set pictures are unforgettable memory.

review_title: Free, good photo opportunity and not far from the centre
review_content: well it is Singapore, so it would be rude not to have the classic photo of the Merlion and your subject seemingly drinking from it's spout right ?
Singapore Tour will never be complete going to this park. It can get crowded as it is not just popular to tourist but also for locals. Free of charge, it basically an open park.
ITS THE most recognized landmark of Singapore. very beautiful place. a lot of tourist posing for pics. we took a long walk around that area.
The Merlion statue in Merlion park lies on the bank of the river Singapore. One can take photos and walk along the river trail. There is also a cruise in the river. Nice to spend the evening time.

Probably the most recognizable landmark of Singapore, something like the Big Ben in London. Worth a visit just to get a pic with the Merlion in the background. Try visiting just before sunset do that you can see it in natural lighting as well as when it gets lit with artificial lights. The view of the Marina Bay at night from here is nice as well.

Merlion is the signature of SG,  Make this city more interesting.  Also can walk to Clary quay station,  It take about 15mins. You will see the seafood restaurant named Jumbo!  Very famous seafood restaurant in SG.
Really nice view of the Marina Bay from here with a number of bars and restaurants close by. A good 'selfie' spot can be found all over the pier!
Trip on the river to see this icon. It was a great day and took some fabulous photos. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

My friend and I went on our final day in Singapore to Merlion Park and I felt it was nice and something different to do, but very busy with lots of people. If you aren't good in a crowd, I don't recommend it, but if you are ok with people, then all good
If you went to Singapore and didn't see Merlion you just didn't visit Singapore. Always packed with people from all over the world and everyone waiting for the right moment for the perfect picture.
Cann't avoid the merlion statue during singapore visit.The walk on the quay side of the river & the photography will be the main attarction here. The lazer show during the night will pull the crowd.

review_title: Iconic Singapore must see but crowded!
review_content: You have to do it but go early to beat the crowds. A great photo that a lot of people take for fun is to position one of your party in the photo as if they are drinking from the fountain. It makes for a fun picture much like holding up the Pisa Tower.
It is the best place to take some photos in Singapore. Or you can walk along the river to enjoy the pure air.
This is mostly for photography as this the Singaporean symbol sort fo thing. But avoid going during hot noon.
I love taking pictures here specially at night. The view from if very nice. The place is self look so good .

When people speak of Singapore, the Merlion statue comes to mind. Indeed, the park is a great place to be at night, full of visitors. Can't leave Singapore without taking a picture with the lion!   P.S There is a small lion statue in the park as well :)

Its a very crowded tourist spot. It has easy access, just a 5mins walk from the nearest MRT station. Do use your sunscreen, wear hats / bring an umbrella, its really hot here, there are lots of shops nearby selling drinks and ice cream.

D Singaporeans described t as deir Taj mahal, though I thought t was kind of an over statement. But d merlion s d pride possession of singapore n one should always see d pride gems. An easily accessible spot, d merlion s located in ts own small Park which s a walk away from d roads. D Park s reasonably maintained. Be prepared for d crowd, especially during weekends.. B careful with d kids too, d railings r quite weak.. Photos n videos r permitted.d walkway to d Park also offers a good photography background.   Verdict : always visit d countries' prides.

review_title: A must see for the view across the bay
review_content: This draws a big crowd so be patient as you will get that photo of the Merlion spurting water and enjoy the view of the impressive Marina Bay Hotel, don't forget sun cream, hat and water

A free tourist spot and must visit of Singapore. You may need prepare your own umbrella. There are huge amount of tourists. I guess the only time where the place is less visitors are the mid-noon which is so hot with sun right up above your head.
This is a must see place, you get s good photo opportunity and had nice restaurants around. Good photography. Must see.
Nice statue - went based on reviews. It's right by Marina Bay so worth going along if you're there but is only a 5 minute visit. There's a much larger statue on Sentosa
Morning will be good to visit this site cuz in the afternoon will be really sunny and hot day, a typical tropical country.
A symbolise you are in Singapore, almost everyone will go there take pictures. You can take mrt stop at Marina Bay. A lot of small hawker around it.

I've been to Singapore twice but this was my first time actually visiting Merlion Park. The location was pretty and spacious, but it got pretty crowded when I visited (it was weekend). Nevertheless, the view of the Merlion was clear enough to take a photo and sightseeing. There were lots of stores and food stalls around the area too.

review_title: Awesome monument the symbol of singapore
review_content: The Merlin is truly the symbol of Singapore , most touristy place , it a place to get photos in Singapore , awesome must visit place.
The setting of the Merlion in the water is lovely and a good photo opportunity. There are some little cafes and candy stores nearby though they are very expensive
On your first visit to Singapore, Merlion park is certainly can't be missed. Come in during daytime to get a bright and clear photos, don't forget to bring your hat & sunglasses.
We walked the Park as part of our Singapore City Tour. We enjoyed the panoramic views we had from the Cricket Club all the way to the Merlion LionFish. A must do.
First time in Singapore and didn't know what to expect here. The Merlion was simply stunning. Easy to get to and great views of Marina Bay to boot! I'd also recommend seeing this on a night as well.
Easy to get to and the reward is a bay views of Singapore . There are cafes and shops to get refreshments, Good views of the hotels and the banks

I spent my first evening here, sitting by the water and drinking in the sights and sounds of Singapore' We enjoyed seeing the light show, although that experience is better from across the bay at Marina Bay Sands. The waterfront restaurants and bars near here were very pricey, but it was a good spot to do some people watching and it was a lovely walk along the esplanade in the cooler temperatures of the evening.

Never miss to take photo when you are here in Singapore. This is the signature tourist attraction. The park is good enough to see but really there is nothing more to see but the view of the bay and the famous Merlion.

review_title: Good Place, fresh air whole day
review_content: walking from city hall to Merlion Park, accross River. many old building in the side and many tall building in another side. we can walk and sport and see beautiful surrounding there

review_title: Everybody Wants to See the Mrelion
review_content: This is one of the highlights of the city. People everywhere are posing to have it appear that the water coming out of the statue is pouring into their mouths. It is quite a show for people watchers.

review_title: The Merlion lends it's history to Singapore - the Lion City.
review_content: First time I have seen the Merlion - enjoyed a river cruise that passed by the Merlion in Marina Bay - there were many tourists taking photo opportunities around the park.  Took a few shots from the water - worth a look from the land or water when you are in Singapore.
Very beautiful place. Citys landmark. There are many restaurants and coffe shoos around. Beautifull views towards citys skyline and Marina Bay Sands. Highly recommended.
This is very attractive but basically the merlion is really just a ornamental water feature, but never less still worth visiting.
Nice little tourist attraction, the whole family loved it, they even give you a good luck coin, kids thought that was great, plus there are two great lookouts for photo's

It's a must see for new visitor or if this is the only time you visit Singapore. Otherwise just skip it as there are too many tourists here (or it's just me I'm not into crowd place perhaps) Small park compares to others; few attracted points (like the orchid walk) but I would rather go visit the Orchid garden instead

Specially Ordinary place. Not special, but icon of this country is here. If you planning to come here, you should prepare any hat, or umbrella because it's a hot place to visit.  I recommend you to come here on evening, to avoid your blooming skin because of sun.  Visit with child on afternoon is not recommended.

Must visit photo stop in Singapore, your Singapore's visit can't be complete without it. you will experience a good view of marina bay sands hotel, Singapore flyer and area around it.  Must visit this place !!
Good to see in the night.. as the symbol of SG, it is a must see place.. the place is flooded with tourists due it's popularity..
You should visit to Merlion Park.  It's near Esplanade bridge.  A lot of people visit here.  It's hard to take selfie.

review_title: Popular Place for Photos of the Merlion
review_content: This is one of the popular place for tourists to have photos of the Merlion statue in Singapore.  The place is usually crowded with tourists taking photos. Just be aware that this place is not sheltered. So you will have to bear with the natural elements (hot weather and humidity) when you're there during the day time.  This Merlion has water fountain coming out of it's mouth! A highlight of the area in Singapore.
My visit happened to coincide with the national day and it was full. The visit was easy however using the cable car from fabre hills. would recommend though we didn't go in the merlion.

review_title: A must visit spot in Singapore
review_content: A statue that symbolise for the city, hence you should visit the place to have some snap shots that can leave in your memories. You can find SMRT which my cost less than 2 SGD or you may find taxi that may not cost more that 22 SGD at Max if you stay longer.
One of the most visited places. Good sourroundings agood restaurants around enjoy the evening with good food and drinks

review_title: Really cool and the views wow
review_content: This is a nice park. Gets very crowed! But the views from here are amazing! This is not to be missed!!

A great place to visit and take pictures. Better at night in my opinion. Lots of great restaurants in the area. Great for people watching.  No visit to Singapore is complete without a visit and pictures here!

This park has a merlion statue. That is trademark for the Singapore. Its located near marina shop, esplanade, and more. We can walk acroos the road to Raffless Landing Site than go to city hall, funan and more.
Merlion is symbol of Singapore . One of the best place to visit in Singapore . Place is so awesome !!!!!
Beside the sea, the Merlions stand. With a mermaid tail and a lion head, the biggest Merlion looks extremely beautiful. The true landmark of singapore!

The symbol of the city is a classic must see attraction thats always busy amd surounded by expensive cafes. Head there early to avoid some of the crowds just a short walk from the MRT  Great for people watching too!

It was a nice park. I enjoyed seeing the iconic Merlion statue for the first time. There weren't as many tourists when I visited, so it wasn't very crowded. The park also has a nice view of the Marina Bay Sands and the High Flyer. I definitely recommend it.

Singapore's signature postal photo with Merlion on it is a must have in your tour photo op album   Except for the fact that it is an iconic statue..the significance of a creation with lion's head and mermaid's tail is on account of Singapore being a lion city built on a fish village  The walk around it is beautiful..with some nice cafes on the bay
This is a contrived symbol for Singapore... but to be frank I liked it better when Singapore was just the Lion City

Visited this place in December 2015. There are two Merlion Lions in Singapore. One is located in the Merlion Park and the other one being in Sentosa Island. Make sure one visits both. the one in the Merlion Park is the actual one. Its awesome. One can have the full glimpse of the Marina Bay Sands while standing on the Merlion Park. Enjoy the beauty of the place. The true sense of Singapore city with the high rise buildings and the walk by the side of the river can be felt at the Merlion Park. Visit it. If possible, visit it more than once. you would just fall in love with the place.
You must come to here when visit Singapore. Love the night view, really great and beautiful place to come. You can get your dinner here..
Very nice area, and great views, definitely worth hoping over to see this statute while you are in Singapore.
it is like getting your photo taken outside of the White House, not all that exiting but a must do, it is the iconic Singapore photo along with standing outside of Raffles

it is twice i came to see the merlion statue on the merlion park. it was the 1st time when i came here with my ngee yan politechnic on 2004 then i came second just now september 2016.  the tourists is still coming to take a photo here. the merlion statue is the main object. i came here from batam. i took the ferry from batam center to harbour front singapore the i continued to take MRT twice.  it took not more than 45 minutes from the harbour front ferry terminal to the merlion if you know well the route. just see the map of the MRT route to stop on the raffles then take a walk to merlion park accross the station

review_title: Day or night time, must see
review_content: Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and he's very photogenic, both day & night. Walk here from your hotel along the river or take an organized tour.

You would see Merlion picture on many brochures. It gives good view of buildings at Marina Bay and Water Front. Basically it is close to Promenade and Esplanade. Take lot of pictures and see lights, water and find music also.
Very nice place. Peaceful and restful walk, everything interlinks to each other. You will need comfy shoes.
Worth a stop but not much to see. This is the symbol of the city. Odd area but there are a few eateries and nice view. Again this is nothing amazing but worth a visit
Its nice to be, but if you can better during the evening as in the morning it will be hot and humid if you have to, dont forgot to bring an umbrella hat and water to drink.
What a must visit tonight the lion had beautiful colours of the rainbow exquisitely executed definitely a must see if you are heading down to Marina Bay

We went to the park late in the afternoon to avoid the heat. The problem was, all the other tourists have the same plan. So we have to jockey for position just to get a good shot. Still it was a nice experience especially at night.

The Merlion statue is in a good location around the bay, you can see it from a distance and is easy to get to. Wasn't very busy when I visited so made for some great photo opportunities.   In Summary: When in Singapore, visit the Merlion statue!

review_title: Views and food by the Bay
review_content: Iconic mystical lion head and a mermaid body feature on the edge of the river. It's symbolic of Singapore. Around the area are great restaurants and local food . A short visit is all you need.
Merlion Status Is just monument. Just to watch that & take a picture . For roaming around not more than 10 minutes . Starbucks coffee place is there.
offers good photo taking background, breezy place, can catch a boat ride along the Singapore river and cafes nearby.

review_title: Nice place to walk around and explore.
review_content: Merlion park is a landmark so it's a must visit when you're in Singapore. Other than taking photos with the Merlion you can have lunch or dinner at one of the restaurants.  As we had other plans after taking lots of pictures with the Merlion we walked to the other side via Jubilee bridge and walked on the path to Helix bridge which connects to the Marina Bay Sands shopping centre.   The coconut ice cream is great, you will see a stall on the way. They put a scoop of coconut ice cream in half a coconut shell and also offer a free glass of coconut water.  After a little walk you'll get to the helix bridge where you can enjoy ice cream sandwiches made at the spot by an old man. It's quite famous and yummy. You have great views from the helix bridge; you'll be able to see a lotus shaped building which is the science museum, marina bay sands building, Merlion, the financial hub. If you go around 6:30 - 7pm you'll be able to experience the magical lights on the bridge.

There are two Merlions here, one very large and the other quite small. It is a nice park from which you can stroll over to marina Bay Sands, up to Clarke Quay, or into Raffles Place so quite convenient.

review_title: Go for the Merlion, stay for the tourists.
review_content: Whilst the main attraction is supposed to be the Merlion statue it wont hold your attention very long. You can spend far longer watching the tourists taking their souvenir photos - tres entertainment!
Loved this attraction. It us the national symbol of Singapore, many tourists (if not all) take photo with the Merlion as a statement: I've been to Singapore!
The view is fantastic. Fancy restaurants and crowd are what we always find here. Listed as the first thing to visit if you have not gone to Spore.

review_title: This is the land mark of Singapore city
review_content: This is the land mark of Singapore city. A beautiful and clean park. A good place to take photo and everyone knows where you are.

review_title: Great place, but a little crowded
review_content: Great place at sunset to take some pictures from Marina Bay Sand and Singapore Flyer. Don`t miss the lasershow. Only 4 Points because it´s a little growded.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. The lion head and the fish fin. Every tourist who come to Singapore. Is a must to take a picture with the star.to reach there. You can take a train and alight esplanade or look out for fullerton hotel.

review_title: crowded but a landmark you could not miss
review_content: A landmark for Singapore and a landmark for tourists visiting Singapore to take a picture with. Got hot during the day, but luckily there are many stalls selling refershments in the area.

review_title: Seems everyone tries to take photo with Merlion
review_content: The Merlion is definitely the icon of Singapore, not so surprise why everyone tries to go to Merlion Park and take photo with the half-lion half-mermaid standing on bay shore. The surrounding attractions were very nice too, highly recommend to take time to walk around to enjoy the bay and its beauties.

I think this is both an iconic place and romantic spot for couples.   The iconic Singaporean Marlion statue is located here facing the ocean... Er well it's facing the Garden by the Bay now, with a mini one facing the opposite direction.   Many people take fun selfie or if each other posing in front of the statue. It is an awesome sight in the evening.   The Marina Bay Sands hotel also does it laser show on the bay just in front the Marlion.
Free attraction and popular site for that holiday photo. Did not seem to have much in addition to offer.
when you visit singapore you must go there for its historic importance. you have a nice view over the river and the sculpture is great for picture taking, for the rest it is not much

Merlion Park derives its name, due to the lion-shaped fountain, which is an iconic architecture of Singapore. When you reach the Merlion Park, you can distinctly see the fountain, that constantly spurts water from the mouth into a small pond underneath. The surrounding gardens and walking paths are kept well maintained and clean. A good place to have a quiet group outing and to spend some time sight-seeing. Visited in 2010 (not in dropdown).

Free & around Marina Bay Area, found it much busier in the evening and lots of people taking pics around Merlion. Water starts at 7am, not sure when water is shut off... walked by close to midnight and was still shooting water.

First visiting to singapore, I dont have an idea why the merlion is little bit far from marina bay sands, we have to walk from Marina Bay sands, around 2-3 km to get there and but when we arrive, we just realized that how beautiful marina bay sands is looked in front of merlion. Worth it, and So Singapore.
If you want to go to a place to take a picture this is a good place, not much attractions other than the view.
it is just a statue,it worths going there just to see marina bay sands and walk in front of fullerton hotel.
This is a great place to visit. For photoshot, for boating and for some good food at nearby restaurants.
i love singapore and the place are super clean and perfect for holiday. so many resturant all the area and so many taxi available. we will be back in singapore soon

The Merlion, part lion and part fish, is the artificially created national icon of Singapore, and its use as a logo adorns many Singaporean products.  Merlion Park is on a small promontory in Marina Bay and Features a tall white Merlion fountain, spewing water from its mouth into the bay.  It is a popular spot for tourists to have their photograph taken as it readily identifies them as being in Singapore.

All the Singapore Pictures have this as part of the pic and not a true replica of the city.. it has so much more to offer from culture, people , food and places to visit then to just get a shot with the statue...
Cool spot there is the must visit once to have chance to visit Singapore but it was so many people and may not be able to got the nice picture at night it will be better to visit because of the heat.

Do make the effort to go and see the Merlion, it's in a great location for a photo-shoot, that's if you can find a free space to take a photo ... needless to say it gets insanely busy here. Nice little gift shop nearby too.

Iconic place in Singapore to take photos. Lots of tourists. We took a boat around the harbour too which worked well as you could get the merlion from a different angle and it gave you lots at history and info about the local area. There are a few places to eat/drink/icecream around the statues. They are very expensive. Even water was triple what we had been paying elsewhere. Toilets were nice and clean though. We walked to the Gardens by the Bay from here which took about 25 mins across the Helix bridge.
It is nice to visit this area at night and try the restaurants in this area. Also great for taking photos, so don't forget to bring your tripod
Not too impressive, a lot of tourists but the view is nice. When you are in the Marina Bay Area you will see probably the most things within short time.

review_title: Great photos only need a little time to visit
review_content: You don't need very long here. Lovely views and the water is peaceful also. great for a walk around not to far from things

Great view of Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore skyline. Definitely a must to take a picture with the water spewing half lion half fish Singapore icon. Other than that, nothing much to do around there.

You've got it have your pic taken with the Merlion, but so does the rest of Asia. Great view of the harbor and an iconic photo, but be ready for the throngs that will be in front of you and all around.
Merlion statue a symbols singapore,, Merlion Park is a great place, wide views there are merlion statue, big bianglala's, and MBS (marina bay sands). Recommended place for take selfie. Hehe..
We visited here for the must-see photoshoot of the iconic merlion of Singapore. The sight is also nice, with Marina Bay looming at the background. There is a nearby food stands nearby.
A walk at the Merlion Park is must for every visitor. The place is surrounded by many skyline and walk around the bay is must. The place is really beautiful.

This is a must see while in Singapore. It is close to the River Cruise which is a good way to while away 40 minutes and learn about the history of Singapore and it is cooler on the river. Not too far from Raffles.
A walk to see the Merlion plenty of places to get photos .so nice to sit and watch. evening lovely as all lit up .
I guess it's the iconic emblem of Singapore, so well worth a look and along with the marina bay complex, you should make the effort!

review_title: Merlion, this is the big one
review_content: We stayed in Singapore for 5 days and visited the Merlion by the bay on a half day coach trip, lots to see and do, so if you want to see Singapore do book a sigh seeing trip, we will def return.
A walk that makes you sense glory of Singapore with their signature Merlion, a hybrid of fish and lion marking rule on sea and land.

If you have time it's worth dropping by there to have a walk. The place is very tranquil and there's no entrance fee. You can get great shots of the Marina Bay Sands hotel and the financial area behind one of the Merlion statue.
You should go here if you travel Singapore. Take a picture with the lion! I recommend to visit at night. Do not forget to bring your umbrella if it is raining.
beautiful views Merlion worth seeing,love walk to be hac here or jusr sit and take in the views and people watch
Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore so its worth a visit to Merlion park. Its a free attraction which is hard to find in Singapore. Some good time can be spent there.

Great place for a photo shoot ops. Free entry and lot of food and drink options. Great place to see the marina sands hotel and merlion statue national symbol of Singapore  Worst thing is no proper seating arrangements. You have to buy something to get a chair (especially for Elders )
This is a must see attraction for every tourist visiting Singapore A picture clicked at this place is a must have

review_title: Constructions for F1 but didn't hamper visit
review_content: The ultimate symbol of Singapore the MerLion. Great photo ops also for views of Marina Bay Sands and city skyline, very enjoyable
Symbol of singapore ! One must go there in evening to get good photos around ! & in night the view is awesome ! Highly recommended !! ++ =)
A best spot to say "i visited singapore" is by selfie with the merlion behind you.. So you can see a lot of people took their photo there with a lot of style.. :)
I really enjoyed my trip to singapore, first I went to Merlion park I saw a beautiful place with beautiful view. The statue of a lion is so big, thats the icon of singapore. You shoul be there btw!
It was fun seeing the merlion near the bay. After taking pics and walking around we went to one restaurant and relax. Not bad to chill in the afternoon.

review_title: Best spot to relax and enjoy the view
review_content: Merlion Park is kinda most visited place by travellers since you can see the famous Merlion statue, Marina Bay Skyway, Esplanade, and Art and Science Museum in one view. The best time to enjoy the view is before sunset, it's magic hour to take a photo and the temperature is not to hot to chill out too. And at 18.45 you will get to see a laser show there.

Merlin Park is a Singapore Landmark.This major tourist attraction centre is located near the Central Business District.The Merlin is a mythical creature with lions head and the fish body .Two Merlin statues are located at the park.There is water flowing from the original Merlin structure.We can also have breathtaking view of Marina Bay There is no entry fee for this park.This iconic symbol is regarded as the pride of Singapore.
A quick stop here to see the Merlion. This was very busy, but a must if you come to Singapore. We also saw a group of otters in the water making alot of noise.
This the mecca of photo spots. You get some of the best pictures here. Other than that the Merlion itself is quite modest and unassuming.

This is a lively park, and you can see the water coming out from the Merlion's mouth, spilling out into the Bay. The boats and distant islands make this a scenic spot, with lots of restaurants nearby and easy walking distance to the Esplanade. Splurge for some tea or coffee at the Fullerton Hotel and check out the Ferrari's and Lambourgini's that frequent the parking lot. The views are great from here, and kids will enjoy being able to run around a bit, too.
A true National Heritage of Singapore, well maintained, cleaned n awesome view!  Once you are there it means you are in Singapore yeah!

This is the place to come and see in singapore. Logo of singapore, the <erlion is displayed there. you can see Marina bay sands hotel from there. Lots of high rise buildings from there. a complete family entertainment place. Very expensive if you want to eat or drink there.

a must visit place for so many people, because you can find merlion here and take a picture together. what i love the most about merlion park is you can get a picture of Esplanade, Singapore Flyer, and Marina Bay in a glance.
Cute lion. Too many people around, hard for personal shooting. Can't you guys take photo faster??? lol

So sad that I wasn't able to have the iconic pose for this landmark (drinking water from the merlion) because it is under maintenance during my 4days of stay in Singapore. But this is where you can have the best view of Marina Bay Sands and the awesome Singapore City Skyline. There are some nearby establishment.

Well it's the iconic place of singapore so undoubtedly people will go there. But I think it's just for taking photos and that's all. Nothing special other than that and it was crowded during the time I got there. I'll say its just average

Must visit place not just because is the symbol of the city but because is also very nice and nicely located too.  Is very interesting to get to know what this symbol represents; half fish because was a fishers island and half lion because the king saw a lion when he arrived and Singapura means the city of the lion!

The park, overlooking the bay with the Flyer and Marina Bay Sands hotel is a tourist magnet. It houses two of the Merlions the mum and son. The father is located on Sentosa island and is well worth a look as are these two. A must for some great photos and remember to bring your selfie stick. The park was busy but you could still get some great photos. Top tip. DO NOT BUY FOOD or DRINK FROM THIS AREA. 3 ice lollies and a bottle of water was £14.00  Top tip, Take a river cruise from Clarke's Quay to get great photos from the water of the Merlions.

review_title: Evening light show Is the best
review_content: We went up the Merrion and the views were amazing. Ticket prices were expensive for a family.$48 but it's a once in a while experience. The best part of visiting this was the light show at night, it's free to sit and watch. Very crowded but easy to escape onto a bus or monorail. Worth a visit.

Its a statue of a lion to symbolise Singapore  Not many ppl know the history ,so didn't get to know much more about it and its more of a tourist attraction its worth a visit, if you don't have much time just take snaps and go but if you have time  There are fish in the river and restaurants and bars too ,a nice way to while away a few hours   Within walking distance of the Helix bridge and other attractions

Obviously, the site is a must-see in Singapore and so an extensive analysis seems fairly pointless for this purpose. The park, or should I say esplanade, rather than a real park, stretches along the waterfront opposite the Marina and is a pleasant hour or so of walking slowly to gather in the whole thing. There are great views of the harbour and the city skyline from the other side towards the F1 pit straight.  The restaurants and bars along the walk are overpriced; don't bother paying $20 for a beer there when you can get one for $8 less than ten minutes away - that is just stupid. Other than that, the walkway was rather pleasant on an afternoon and provided a surprisingly calming trip. The Merlion area itself is obviously a lot busier, but stepping away from the viewing platform and down towards the water offers a different viewpoint that most seem to ignore. Don't forget to cool your feet off by dipping them in the water!

review_title: THE LION WHO WATCHES OVER SINGAPORE
review_content: great walk around the whole area, fantastic photo opportunity as you can see all the well known tourist attractions, marina bay sands, the museum , theatre by the bay and the wonderful Super-trees at night. don't miss to have an ice-cream in the slice of coloured bread its only $1.20 but the durian one is delicious. or any other flavour you like
This is the iconic Land Mark of Singapore. U must go to this Landmark and ist free just 10 min walk from MRT

Its the merlion which stands tall in the waters..it is an animal with a lions head and fish tail. Basically its a fountain. At night the lion is extremely colourful with lights.. The place is good is clicking some memorable pictures. Take a walk on the shores....

While we enjoyed the waterfront promenade/marina, the Merlion by itself was just ok. Good to get in the sight and click a few pictures (try one where the water appears to spout out of your mouth) but nothing much more than a typical tourist spot.
The area is perfect for walking early in the morning or late in the afternoon. There were quite a lot of tourists taking photos, but it was still worth the visit.
A must to see overlooking the Marina Sands Hotel especially at nighttime is the best to be here with a lights display and many more to enjoy

review_title: Just sightseeing, take picture in outside and then go
review_content: Location : Merlion Park Entry Fee : Free by walking Recommended time : Anytime, expect wet season Condition : Amazing
You'll probably see this place while walking around the bay. One of the icons of Singapore. it's worth a brief visit.

The Merlion park is located near the famous Fullerton Hotel and the Esplanade, with magnificent views of the stunning Marina Bay area.The mythical Merlion is the major Iconic statue of Singapore with the body of a fish & head of a lion, spouting water from its mouth. This is located near Marina Bay, it is a major tourist attraction in Singapore.There is also a smaller Merlion statue in the park, known as the ‘Merlion cub’. A must see for tourist visiting Singapore.
Merlion is of course the famous statue, symbolizing Singapore, and a famous character to be photographed.
Easy walk around the beautiful harbour to see the Merlion up close. Really cute to fi d thdebaby merlion too!

review_title: Nice place to stroll after dinner
review_content: Highly recommend this place for a leisurely stroll by the river after dinner. Take in the cool breeze and the lights along the shoreline and feel invigorated.
Lovely island of sentosa, lots to see and do. Good restaraunts, interesting and informative. Cable car there and back reasonably priced. Avoid universal studios though

This place is great to be at as from sunset and night. Because you are able to see the beautiful lights and laser performance that they have from across at Marina Bay Sands. We took a nice walk all along there passing the Esplanade bridge to the other side where you see lots of bars and cafes.

The Merlion is half mermaid, half lion. Nice statue, with a baby merlion monument nearby. Nice pier for viewing monument and Marina Bay area. Small and simple. Only 5-10 minutes needed. Adjacent Fullerton Hotel and Singapore Bumboat River Cruise.

review_title: Don't go out of your way
review_content: Not quite sure what the fuss is about!!! Ok statue with water coming out!! If your walking by, by all means the view of MBS is amazing in the back drop but nothing to write home about... In my opinion

review_title: Very Nice Place for A Photo
review_content: I visited Singapore in June 2016 on business. My wife, son and daughter joined me. You can walk to Merlion Park from Raffles Place by passing through the Fullerton Hotel and the underground moving sidewalks. The Merlion is a famous statue, You can take many photos of the Merlion and also the skyline and the Marina Bay Sands. Near the Merlion Park is where you can get the Singapore River boat ride.

review_title: Good place to take a photograph with a iconic statue
review_content: I like the whole place. I always feed good to take aphotigraph with a iconic statue. but nothing excited here.

This place is hot, warm and sunny during the day time. very pleasant place to spend your evening till late. Good food and drink available around. Photographers need to have a tripod. In August the moon rises right behind the Marina Bay Sands which is a very pretty scene to enjoy.
It is located in the center of town! You have nice buildings all around, and a great view for pictures! A must! if you go to Singapore!
Great located between Marina Bay and the skyline of Singapore. There are a lot of tourist....it's a must to see about the view
Visit this place in the evening, a bit crowded. But nice/ enjoying taking photos with Merlion and Marina bay Sands including Esplanade. Seem that everyone loved it

review_title: Nice place for hangout at afternoon
review_content: Nice place to Waiting for laser show. Great view and the boat to cruise the river very nice. The light from Singapore flyer give more attractive view

You must go to this spot to take your selfie with the Famous Merlion. Once there you have an amazing view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, the Flyer and The Esplanade. There are High-end eateries and quick reasonable meals along this stretch of the park. From there you can walk to the Esplanade to experience some great local music, plays, and art work.

When I first came to Singapore in the 60's. the Merlion was an outstanding feature. Now poor Merlion is dwarfed by all the skyscrapers, but on a Sunday, or any day really, it is still there. You just have to look!
Nice photo spot, but a little bit crowded , i'm going here in the morning but the people has already here too, nice place, great scenery , singapore landmark

This One is must visit attraction if you are visiting Singapore. Nice view of Marina Bay and nearaby skyliners. Whether you visit in day time or night time very good place to visit. Its tourist attraction.

Alight at Raffles place MRT and turn on your location and reach the merlion park. Just 5 min walk from MRT.. While on the way you can experience scenic view of river quay and high storey modern buildings. Once you reach the park you can see this majestic animal standing tall. This place has great view of marina bay sands tower and other modern buildings... Must visit place.
Go there for a night walk around the bay ! Take the pedestrian bridge next to the merlion and enjoy the view !

been here a couple of times, my 6 yr old grandson loves it, great gardens and plenty to see, the view from the top of the merlion is great, its free around the gardens but costs to go up on top of merlion
Very crowded with Chinese tourists trying to take selfies. It is the symbol of Singapore and a nice venue to kill a few hours. Close to the Flyer and Marina Bay Sands.

review_title: You can't go to Singapore without getting a picture with the Merlion!
review_content: I didn't know this at first but then discovered there is more than one Merlion in Singapore so I got pictures with both. Either way it's definitely a must do in Singapore! He is very big and majestic and shoots water out of his mouth! You can see him at Sentosa or around where the Marina Bay Sands is!

review_title: Just to check off your list of things to see
review_content: There's really not much to see except for the Merlion Statue and the min-statue behind it. Nice selfie spot to prove you've visited but otherwise not something remarkable. Nice view of the Marina Bay from here though and a good place to take the river boat tour.
From what we could sort of see through the scaffolding the Merlion is a lovely statue. We went back the next day hoping for a better view. It was covered with a tarp.

review_title: A Place Where Use To be No. 1 for Singapore Icon
review_content: Believed it yourself and give it a try on Singapore River Boat Ride. Very nice scenery with Marina Sands Hotel on the background is so beautiful.
Love the screen display and the party atmosphere.Added fun to the holiday with the music and the various displays

We took one of the duck tours by the Merlion and was glad we did- the crowds around the Merlion statue were thick. Whether by foot or boat, you should stop by and see this iconic symbol. It's impressive in person. They have a viewing area built out to see the bay as well as get a good selfie with the statue. You a,so get a great view of marina bay sands hotel and the art science museum and the double helix bridge. There are several restaurants along the promenade where you could spend some time relaxing. The Merlion was under refurbishment when we got close, but I'm sure it looks great now.

Visiting the Merlion Park has been the highlight of our trip in Singapore. This landmark represents the beauty of Singapore. My family and I visited this place on our third day in Singapore and we found this place so crowded with tourists and it's almost impossible to get a clear shot of the Merlion statue. The location is superb with a lovely view of the Marina Bay Sands in the background. The park is quite a long walk from Raffles Place MRT station but nevertheless we enjoyed the walk along the river. It would be best to visit this place first thing in the morning to avoid the crowd.
Good spot. Quite far from the MRT though , unsure about the bus station though. The view is amazing. It's not just the merlion.

Merlion park is where the Singapore signature and symbols of lion are located. The white merlion which is mermaid lion spurts the water from it's mouth. This is one of the most taken pictures in Singapore. Just beside the Marina Bay it gives the spectacular view of the city.
The Merlion has just been refurbished and it looks fabulous. Everything all around this area is very attractive, perfect location for tourist snaps and watching the world go by. Very nice

review_title: Pretty park - great location - a nice detour
review_content: Three days in Singapore - hot - wanted some relief from the crowds - was very busy so no such a change. But worth the visit and some interesting side food restaurants. Go early.
We went at night, and with the lights and crowds it is nice for a picture opportunity. I wouldn't make a point of visiting it, but as we were passing it would have been rude not to have stopped by.

review_title: Wonderful place for an evening outing
review_content: The Merlion Park with the iconic Merlion with water gushing from its mouth is a wonderful place for any time of the day, though I prefer in the evening with a beautiful view of the Marina Bay and Marina Bay Sands across the Singapore River. There are innumerable eating joints serving variety of cuisine.  Sitting on the steps at the foot of the Merlion watching the lights come on across the bay is a beautiful experience. One may take a cruise on the Singapore River going past Clarke Quay and Boat Quayand then return to watch a ten minutes laser show in Marina Bay.  Not to be mussed at all when in Singapore.
You'll see this as you walk down the waterfront. Crowds of people taking selfies. Worth a look but don't make a great plan to visit it.

This isn't a day out. Just a quick look and a walk along the board walk. The view out towards marina bay sands is wicked. Few restaurants and bar around but it's certainly not a day trip.  Obligatory snap required.
Personally I can't see the attraction. Sculpture itself is impressive but beware hoards of coach parties wielding the "selfish stick"!
Caught up with a friend near here recently for a coffee. It was a beautiful clear day so we took the opportunity to admire the Merlion forr a moment. Not too many people on a weekday afternoon.
Iconic symbol of Singapore. Of course, the Merlion is the picture of Singapore. You have to come here when you visit Singapore. The place is well maintained.

review_title: Good river side view in evening
review_content: when you take pics from here in the background will see all the hotels including marina bay sands which brings awesome looks to you photo graphs

Don't get me wrong, the Merlion statue is something that you HAVE TO DO when you're in Singapore. However, the crowds of tourists make it a dreadful experience. We happened to get there at the same time as two tour buses of people. The selfies, pictures like your holding the Merlion, catching the water... Annoying. I don't think any of them saw the Merlion because they were too busy taking wacky pictures. Honestly, you have to go, but the Merlion on Sentosa is much better.

Not to be missed not only because the sculpture itself is impressive but also because the marina view from this place is absolutely fantastic. Come during the day and at night as well because that's when you can view the Marina Bay Sands lights, music and water show just across the bay (you can barely see the fountains though but the lights are really something).

As Merlion Park is one of the imagine of Singapore, you can easily access here by cross the bridge from Esplanade theater. It's always full of people surrounded and taking photos so the best time to come here is at night. After 9PM there will be less people and you can take as many photos as you wish without cameos. Enjoy the wind and look at the light show on the bay is also a plus.

review_title: Great photos on a clear day
review_content: Basically went to take photos, weren't disappointed with the backdrop of the marina bay sands across the bay. Didn't see a lot in the way of food outlets around the big Lion at Merlion which was disappointing. Did see hordes of other photo seeking tourists on a Sunday afternoon, hard to find a clear spot for a photo in this peak time. Probably better to pick a quieter time like the morning. Not much to do for kids by the way, ours found it a bit boring coz not really into nice backgrounds and photos.

review_title: An historic and central part of Singapore
review_content: The merlion looks much smaller than imagined but it proudly sits central to the marina bay and singapore river area. Worth coming to have a look and savour the area.
The Merlion Park is a great photo opportunity and a good place to see the incredible Marina Bay Sands and the rest of the marina bay area.

If you are in Singapore, this is a must visit. As the symbol of the city state, it attracts a lot of tourists all around the day. There's some "competition" to get a position for good photo shots; some of the tourists are quite pushy.  I am actually quite fond of the smaller Merlion in the park. It's a cute statute, just about the human size.  The Fullerton Hotel, a former central post office, gives a nice touch to the area. There are some nice sculptures by the hotel that you see on the way from the Raffles Place MRT station.

Merlion in Sentosa Island is nicer for picture taking (you can also go inside it!). The area around the Merlion park is bleak, especially on weekends. Although there is a pretty nice cake shop (Lady M) and a Starbucks just around the corner.   Photo geeks should note that the Merlion's best side is his left side. Also, with better equipment, you can get a pretty fancy shot of Marina Bay Sands from there.

If you are in Singapore, a visit to this Merlion is a must. You will get to know and see to believe. A walk along this long stretch by the Singapore Riverside and a boat ride costing around &12/- or $15/- to take in the sights in the evening will be nice (half hour ride). The financial city is thereabout including the Marina Bay areas will be good and food and transportation are easily available. Along the Riverside of this Merlion are eateries & restaurants. Lots of choices. Gourmet selection to suit your taste.
Merlion park is great. We were there early in the morning and it was busy. I think it's busy all the time.  Great view of Marina Bay Sands and Singapore Eye.

First visit to Singapore I just had to see the Merlion statue, it located in the city heart of Singapore, a very clean and nice place to visit, that shows Singapore is a first world country. though the minus part is that the Merlion is not as grand as I expect to be as a symbol of Singapore.

review_title: A must visit in the Garden City of Singapore
