review_content: Merlion Park is a must visit attraction when in Singapore as it is a significant icon of the Lion City and a legend as well. Walk around the Fullerton Bay area as well as across the Jubilee Bridge to visit the Iconic Esplanade as well.

review_title: Something  to visit on a walk by rather than visit especially
review_content: Nothing more to say. It is what it is, interesting as a land mark set in an architecturally very interesting part of Singapore.

This popular site is best visited early morning or around sunset as at these times you are more likely to get the best photos and it is usually less crowded. Furthermore, you will avoid the searing heat of the day. Don't forget to take a hat as there is little shade about and make sure you apply plenty of sunscreen if visiting late morning or early afternoon. A walk along the adjacent Marina Bay is well worth while.
The symbol of Singapore.. Great to visit place during sunset to see the light effect on it. Nice to walk along Marina Bay. Lots of activities around. Love to visit again:)

We were lucky to find the merlion park relatively quiet and could enjoy the whole bay and fantastic cityscape. We had visited SNG before and missed the merlion but were so pleased we made it on this occaision. Lots of resturants near by and boat tours of the bay/river if inclined. Overall a great free activity!

Well, it's a must visit place when travelling to Singapore. It's their #1 landmark. Although, expect to sweat a lot if you visit in the morning and afternoon. Located in an open space with nearby restos and coffee shop.

The icon of Singapore Merlion is locatef in this harbour side park. The place is more beautiful in the night with full illuminated Singapore skyline unwonding before you. The place is full of tourists and locals and is a vey popular eveninv hsngout. You have all cafes ans seafood eateries around. Real happening plsce and must visit in Singapore.
Very nice small walk to do here with different views if you walk toward the garden by the bay (not too far).

A nice spot to view the Marina Bay Sands and view the giant Merlion sculpture. A great photo spot hence it is always chockers with tourists. It's tall enough though to get some decent pics even with the crowds.
An amazing place to visit. Me and my family enjoyed the time there. The merlions sight was beautiful! :)
All time crowded with the tourist. If you are coming to Singapore, you must have a picture with it. Early morning will be less crowded.

The Merlion (a mermaid with lion's head) has somehow become symbolic representation of Singapore. It's a 8.6 m tall statue with water spouting from it's mouth. As such there is nothing else at the Merlion Park but as the sun sets and lights are put on the view becomes breathtaking. The Marina Bay Hotel & Singapore Flyer on the other side, Esplanade just a short distance away, and boats floating in the Singapore river, present a view that make a lasting image. And if you happen to be there when the laser show starts at Marina Hotel, its a bonus.  Don't forget to carry your camera along and there is no entry ticket.

We visit the park so that we can finally see the icon of Singapore. Luckily the water already function back to normal after undergo some renovation 2 days ago.  I didn't take the Merlion, because of the heat. I just wait for my guests under the tree and took whatever interest me.
This is an open air (and very little shade) park by the harbour. There is the larger Merlion statue and a smaller one just behind it. Best not to go in the middle of the day as it is extremely hot.

review_title: A Very Nice Place for an Urban Walk
review_content: Singapore is mostly about enjoying urban life and marveling at architectural wonders. The Merlion Park is not an exception.   It is basically a place where there is a large fountain with the figure of a "Merlion" where people flock in to take photographs and to take lively strolls around the area.   We enjoyed our walk and took a lot of photographs; time well spent.
A photo opportunity and fun thing to see. It's Singapore! Located right on a ferry stop which might save the legs on a hot day!!
We were taken to by coach to catch a cable car to Sentosa Island. What an amazing place! Plan to spend a full day there, as there is so much to do!
Well, it's the town's landmark and mascot of the town. A funny looking mythical creature. a most see if you visit singapore!
It is good place to visit and the view is very beautiful of the marina bay sands hotel. The pictures clicked are very good. Good place.

I'm super duper exhausted when i'm arrived at night (it's around 10pm) So i just sit at the stairs and enjoy the scenery.  (I'm taking some photos but because "the exhausted" it end up sooo bad. So i won't upload hehe)

Great view of the Harbour and the Marina Hotel and Shoppes. The view is spectacular and would even say is more beautiful on this side as you can see the skyline and marina from the Eaplanade. Loved it. Marina lights and laser show is different from this side. Great as well.

Its a beautiful park with the lion standing tall. Place is well maintained and there lot of coffee shops and restaurants around to experience.   Must place to visit for the beauty of the lion and make sure to take your camera to click.

review_title: Under Renovation Means A Unique Photography Opportunity
review_content: The Merlion is currently undergoing maintenance. That means it is a unique photography opportunity to see the statue from another perspective.
Worth visiting and you can take some creative photos alongside the merlion which has water spouting from its mouth.
Was very disappointed to have come all this way to see that the merlion was under renovations. Such is life. Got pics with the miniature one and merlion cordoned off.
just a park in the city, nicely done and well maintained, ideal to have your morning coffee break discussion
You must visit it (in fact there are other 3 ones in the city, but this is the most famous lion). Take as much pictures as you can. They will be nice.
I visited Merlion Park only to realize that it was under construction and there wasn't much tourists around. There was no place to find out about that.

The views of this place alone were amazing, but then to go up the top of the Merlion and learn of the history of Singapore was something else to behold. Was one of the highlights of our trip to Singapore.

It's not difficult to reach this park. It's walking distance to Raffles Station. The park is always crowded. It's challenging to take a good shot without a photobomber. But if you go to Singapore, Merlion park is a must. Even a few hours before your flight, you can drop by here.

review_title: A must see when in Singapore
review_content: One of the most Iconic tourist attractions in Singapore. It always busy, but a must see when visiting Singapore go at night for some great photos of the city skyline and the Merlion.

review_title: Interesting place to go. Very fast attraction.
review_content: The park is right across from the Marina Bay. From there you can see Singapore's skyline and the bay area. Take some nice pictures and in 15-20 minutes you are ready to go to the next one.
This is one of the best place to move around. You can't miss the beauty of Merlion while in Singapore. Don't forget to bring your camera.
Even though it is always crowded it is an absolute must to go there and take a photo with the Merlion, the symbol of Singapore

Definitely bring a whole lot of patience as well as your camera. This, of course, is on all the tour group's list as well as individuals, so trying to get good pictures can be time consuming. Just wish people were more courteous when walking around.

Of the many times I've travelled to Singapore I've always regretted not being able to see the Merlion up close. So this holiday it was a priority to visit and a relaxing walk from my hotel across the Jubilee Bridge allowed me to fulfil this wish. It was well worth the time spent and I would recommend this attraction to everyone.

A landmark of Singapore, is a major tourist attraction at One Fullerton, Singapore, near the Central Business District (CBD). Two structures of the Merlion are located at the park. The original merlion structure measures 8.6 meters tall, whilst a Merlion cub located near the original statue measures 2 metres tall.

Very good. A must see for everyone. Little more of guidance inside the Merlion would hv helped everyone. It's a win-win situation for Singapore govt n visitors, as the former is getting tourism n latter are given a souvenir ( a Merlion coin )

Visited in Dec. Really nice place. Places to eat are quite expensive. Really beautiful park. Wear comfortable shoes there is a lot of walking. It was monsoon season so it rained quite a bit but because it was warm rain it was actually quite pleasant.

review_title: Place to see if you are passing by
review_content: i recommend the Boat Cruise in Marina Bay, and when you do it you will cover almost all the attractions around Marina Bay and this is one of them. otherwise it is super crowded , but a National Symbol of Singapore.

The merlion park is not extremely beautiful or breath taking. There is nothing special to do there. But visitors throng the small area. WHY? there are a few valid reasons, For one, it is one of the few places where entry is free. The merlion is a historical monument . Further , the view of the city especially after sunset is breathtaking. Go ahead and click a few photographs with the merlion and the city line in the background. Nice place to spend an evening!

review_title: Great place to spend one day
review_content: It it really amazing park, but it is very crowded. It worth to get up to Merlin statue and enjoy a view. After you get a little surprise+ice cream.

I don't fully understand the major drawcard that this fountain has. It is not a huge, spectacular fountain, and yet it draws crowds to it. Most people travelling to Singapore will go to view the Merlion, but what is more attractive is the view from this side of the harbour! Looking back over the harbour at the Marina Bay Sands is an impressive sight, and it is a great location to view the nightly laser show. So, I guess, if you are in Singapore, you may as well visit the Merlion, but do it later in the evening so that you can stay to see the laser show

We visited the place sometime after the sunset. We found it was brimming with people. The view was awesome with the Singapore coastline. You can see other iconic buidlings here. Its quite well maintained and offers a great evening experience1

review_title: The place was nice and crowded too
review_content: The place was nice,lovely so crowded full of tourist,the route to there by Mrt just take the EW line then go down at Raffles Place then take Exit H,turn right the Merlion place is accross the Fullorton Hotel

review_title: Superb place with a great view
review_content: It is right by the water and offers great views of the city. It is mostly crowded with tourists and locals but very well maintained nevertheless.

review_title: The views of the Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Skyline are awesome from here
review_content: Merlion park was nice but the views of the areas especially Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Skyline are awesome in the evening. This is a free attraction and is worth visiting but I enjoyed the views around this area more than the Merlion Park itself. Depending on how much time you have, I would say 1 hour is enough unless you want to sit by the water in the youth Olympic park near the Merlion.
Merlion Park is good place to take a good picture. The Park is very clean and there is a mini food stall
One of the beautiful landmarks of the Singapore. Well maintained and well illuminated at night. Must visit in day and night to enjoy the beauty of the Merlion Park.

review_title: Just Awesome. I have no other words
review_content: Take your family with you when you visit.  A lot of tourists there but there is enough room to enjoy the park. Very refreshing and breathtaking view.

This place are hectic with tourists! It a free attraction with a nice walk around near the water. Just take your time, when you get a chance to visit then go for it but be ready with it being busy with everyone wanting to take photos of the Lion.  Remember to wear a hat/ bring an umbrella and wear sunscreen as it is hard to walk on a sunny day.
It was nice park but it was too crowd and food was too expensive. Not much too see. You should not miss it and people who saw it before, you can skip it.
The most known place of Singapore... a must for taking ur DP.. take d photo from the Jubilee bridge to avoid d crowd..

The Merlion Park actually has 2 merlions (our guide called them 'mama' and 'baby', while the 'daddy' was on Sentosa Island.) The area is quite pleasant with everyone taking pictures with the water spurting out. Makes for some interesting photos.  Also a nice place to take a photo with Marina Bays Sands and the Flyer in the background.  Quite a few shops selling ice creams, cake and other eatables around. Some restaurants too in One Fullerton Mall. Makes for a pleasant stroll.
The merlion is a must see when your in singapore. This is a free attraction. It is quite busy. Its in a great location, it is located straight across from Marina Bay sands hotel

This was the very last thing we did in Singapore and my daughter loved it. Of course she posed as if she were drinking the water just like everyone else but we had to do it! The park is clean and neat and beautifully lit at night. Next time we will see it during the day!
GO there when in the morning or evening so you will not be toasted in the hot humid weather. Get that best shot for your instagram post.

review_title: Nice Cool evening walk, enjoy the sigt of singapore
review_content: Cool walk, may be even sip few drinks by the various restaurants and bars. Iconic place in Singapore. very good city views and most photogenic place
It's been there for a long time but still draws a huge crowd all the time.  Singapore's iconic Merlion is a must see as it's in the Marina bay area.

review_title: Photo shoot stop for the tourist
review_content: The typical Merlion is featured in several adverts for Singapore and thus is a busy tourist destination. Where it is located , it provides one with another view of Singapore's coastline .
5 star for the picture...other than that, there's nothing else to do here. The merlion with water out of it's mouth looks like he's upchucking :)

review_title: Good places to get few pictures
review_content: Its a nice place to visit for getting some pictures clicked. You can have singapore skyline, marina bay and ofcourse merlion in the background. They have few restaurants around here too.

The Merlion Park is: 1) A stone statue sprouting water. 2) A statue of a creature that has never existed. 3) A spot to take beautiful photos. 4) An icon of Singapore that no visitors to the island state should missed.  Ans: All of the above! :)  Tip: - Best to visit at twilight with the Merlion sprouting water towards the golden sunset.  - Stand on the left of the Merlion for the commanding view of Marina Bay Sands.  - Stand on the right of the Merlion for the glorious of the city skyscrapers and the Singapore Flyer.
This is just a photostop , located near other interesting places. Nighttime is better for a lot of spots in Singapur. You get the beautiful Skyline of Singapur all lightened up.

was here last July 15, 2016 with my family. i was expecting to see a lot of historical stuff but was disappointed to see that it didn't have much. although the top of the merlion gave a wonderful 360 degrees view of the whole sentosa island but that was about it. its a good option but i would not really recommend it being in the must-see attractions in Singapore.

Nobody ever should come to Singapore and completely miss, skip this monument. So much history and legendary stories attached to it. Especially the story behind the founding of Singapore, the REAL founding of Singapore (not the one where some foreign business ship come make money in Singapore in 1819). This is one for the history books, way way back in time.   Legend, true or not, this is the monument to take a photo with. All tourists must come here. It is a definitely not-to-be-skipped spot for even the locals.   And if it spits water at you, you'll be lucky for eternity.

A very romantic place. Go there at night and do not forget your camera. It is a beautiful sea view. It is becoming a singapore icon. A good place to relax and propose your heart. During august it will come alive. So do not miss it out

This is just a spot by the water with a merlion statue. I have no idea what the merlion represents but it must be significant to some as many were having photos taken there. If you want to see tourists behaving weirdly it's a good spot. I walked past it on the way to the botanic gardens/marina bay sands area.
Honestly I was imaging something different, something bigger. When I arrived on site I get little bit disappointed, I think Singapore have much better things to see

review_title: See the Merlion...snap a pic...and move on
review_content: This little guy is quite popular for folks to visit when looking for an icon representing the city/state/country. The Merlion is at the end of the pier at Merlion Park...near the Fullerton hotel and across the bay from the Marina Bay Sands hotel. There are several shops and restaurants nearby for a quick bite. Good for a 5-minute stop on a walk around the bay and along boat quay.
Come here to have a good view of the morden Singapore. Good photo frame. Very near other attractions just by walking....

It will be blazing hot. And if you are bringing younger kids with pram or wheel chair, and you are taking mrt, please exit from esplenade station. Even though raffles place station is closer, but the ramp is only accessible from esplenade.
The Merloin Park in Singapore is part of the wonderful history of this country. Located on the waterfront and so easy to access by public transport all traveelers should visit this local attraction.
We went on an organised tour with our friends.  The view from the top of the lion was very good. However, the structure was a bit tired.
There is no fun, but you should go at least once. You accustomed to feeling that came to Singapore.
The signature merlion will be seen here. However the biggest one in SG is in Sentosa. This is great to be your first stop in SG to ensure that you capture the signature attractions.
Very touristy.  Large Tour Groups.  But the view and sights are worth making your way to it. Specially seeing the high topped hotel shaped like a ship from Merlion Park
SG Landmark in front SG river. In this area there are lots of good backgrounds and awesome backdrop for photoshoot.

You need to be here if you visit Singapore. Travelling to Singapore and getting your photo with the Merlion in the background is a must. Hot and stuffy in the afternoon, so be there early morning or late in the evening on in the nights.
It's the landmark of Singapore. no need to explain more. a MUST GO place if you traveled here and try to avoid crowd so that you would have a better angle with your pictures!.
The most important place you have to be when you visit Singapore, only that, there are really a lot of tourist in this area.
Merlion is under whelming. View is ok. Not worth sweating too much to see it live in person. View of marina bay better from Clark quay.

It does get a little crowded there, but what do you expect at one of the most visited icons of Singapore? It could be argued that you can't come to Singapore and not get a shot of their Singaporean emblem. Located right on Marina Bay, there is plenty to do close by.

The Merloin was great and a lot larger than I expected. Good setup in the park area with lots of seating and clean too. Get a river cruise from near the Merlion and it explains a lot about the origin of this mythical creature.
The merlion is an icon in Singapore, you must go and see him. Take a photo and enjoy the waterfront precinct he is located in. He is very popular but you can manage to get a good shot. Nice area
This is a must do while in Singapore  Great location, great holiday snaps and sums up Singapore nicely.
Great place to take memorable photos. Not only the Merlion is there, you can have the Marina Bay Sands photo shots as well.  But behold, lots of tourists hang around this place.

review_title: Best Location to get some selfies!
review_content: I have traveling with my wife on a two weeks trip to Singapore, Merlion Park is an amazing sightseeing point for singapore which give you a wide view of Singapore skyline and bay. Its a perfect spot to capture some memorable pictures and selfies. Its a bit crowdy, I'd recommend to visit during day time if you are planning to capture pictures, however visiting in night gives you a great view too unless you have a DSLR.

review_title: One Picture to Have, Keep and Share
review_content: The Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore. And if a tourist is to make, keep and share one picture of one's visit to the city state, it is a pose infront or by this iconic landmark.   When my wife and I were at the Marina bay Sands we strolled to see that across where we were, outiside the ArtScience Museum, was the Merlion, spewing fire which was just water, and paying homage to it were throngs of tourists, armed with their smartphones and digital cameras, flashing million bucks smiles, solo, tandem or group, trying to dodge the photobombers that scatter all over the place.  But it is a must see place. And when we went there, to ogle at it, truly the hordes were a plenty. This speaks volumes of the significance of doing a pilgrimage to the Merlion.  If you are in Singapore, don't forget to see it and have a snapshot with its national symbol. You will not regret it!

A sight to see with the marina Bay and Helix bridge on the background. So many tourist even if its in the evening, late night.  While others take the MRT or taxi towards the park, we walked all the way from Marina Bay sands (after the Light show), pass thru the beautiful Helix Bridge, have a glimps of the Youth Olympic Park, walk along The Float @ Marina Bay Grand stand, pass by the Makasuntra Gluttons Bay, see the Esplanade Theatre, walk along the Jubilee Bridge to reach the Merlion Park. We did it in the evening. Go there early in the morning or evening so it wouldnt be that hot.   The Merlion Cub is just at the back of the bigger statue.

The main attraction is mummy lion and papa lion it is a sign of peace money.. They say that the water coming out from lion mouth is lucky and it is also that according to them it is good sign for money to come.
I finally saw it! And learned about Singapore's history and how the country came to be, and why the Merlion.
Its very crowded place, Just a statute there, Although it is very beautiful but if you are going there in day time, the heat will suck all your energy
suggest to go at morning or evening time because it is very hot  you can take the picture at the bridge

Although this park is midway between two SMRT stations it is definitely worth the walk! The Merlion is a must see! The view across to the Flyer and hotels is quite nice. There are many places to stop and get a bite to eat or something to drink. Be sure to wear sunscreen and take a hat or umbrella-the sun is quite powerful.
This Merlion Statue is located on the bay walk, you get a beautiful view of the bay. It is crowded, however it is nice to see it, take pics and walk around.

Whenever I visit Singapore, I love to go to this place! Usually I take MRT to Raffles Place exit H, cross the Cavenagh Bridge then head towards Merlion Park, it's quite a long way but really has a nice view.  You will have a great photo-shoot time in this place! It's just beautiful!

After 4 visits to Singapore in the last 4 years we finally decided to visit Merlion Park after having gone past it a few times on the bum boats.   In short - it was fun - because everyone there was having fun, posing for photos with the water pouring into their mouths/cupped hands etc.   We walked from Raffles place MRT station (about 5 minutes) & then back to Clarke Quay (where we were staying - which was a casual 1km+ along the river).   The whole walk gives you a really good idea re how easy it is to get to things & around Singapore.   Tip: make the river walk & Merlion Park part of your Singapore experience - it's a great orientation exercise.

review_title: Stop by to see the Merlion
review_content: If you're a tourist or to your first time to Singapore it's worth a visit to he Merlion park to see the national figure and to just people watch. It's a friendly clean area with many restaurants and bars around the perimeter. We had a few drink and walked around to take some photos then headed out. A short but worthwhile visit.
Opposite Marina bar resorts on the river. Take in this site if you walk the river from the quays. This is what I did
The park is located very centrally and gives you a great view over the Bay. It was quite crowded and obviously a tourist attraction.

In SG! Mama's and child's located at Merlion Park near Raffles Place MRT and one in Sentosa. Love being here as i can take silly posed with Merlion Background. Every tourist to SG should check on this
Nice attraction. A icon of Singapore, and tell you about how Singapore discovered. Merlion coin is awesome and good Souvenir.

The iconic landmark that defines Singapore. This park is the host to the "Mamma" Merlion along with the "Baby" Merlion. Water squirting Mamma Merlion provides a great backdrop for taking pictures. The photo collection is incomplete without a picture of this place.
Totally overrun with tourists all pretending to catch water out of the Merlion's mouth but a real symbol of Singapore.
This landmark is probably worth a one time visit due to historical reasons. It can get crowded during peak hours and hot during the afternoons.

Iconic Singapore mascot, of sorts. But basically it's a big statue that spits out water in the middle of a concrete bridge. It's scorching hot in the sun and no cover if it rains. Bus loads of tourists too, all trying to get the perfect photo of the Merlion spitting into their mouths or something equally as original. The statue is nice enough, but it's just a statue. And best viewed from a nearby rooftop bar not the actual viewing platform.
Singapore's most iconic landmark. It was great for a photo and a good thing to see while we were there. The view of MBS is fantastic from this point. Plenty of tourists to dodge though.

The walk toward the Merlion was enjoyable as the view of the river and the buildings was great. There were a lot of people there so getting a good shot would be tricky. I suggest getting up on one of the seats to get a less crowded shot of the sights. You can also enjoy your afternoon tea in one of the restaurants.

We were here to take the picture with the Merlion statue. It was an iconic landmark of Singapore. This is a good place to take a beautiful photo with the Marina Bay Sands as your background. Definitely worth to come. One can reach here either by stopping at the Raffles Place MRT Station or Promenade MRT Station.

Loved the Merlions. I know maintenance must be done sometime but too bad it was the day I was there so didn't see water coming out the Merlion mouth. The park and surrounding area is beautiful though. I looked in many places in Singapore trying to find a Merlion charm for my charm bracelet and never found one ---

This is a must see and a very good spot for photos especially with the spectacular backgrounds of the Marina Bay Sands and the Eye! Because of this it's always crowded but then its all worth it and your visit to Singapore can never be complete without a pic of yourself with the Merlion spouting water into your mouth - that is if you are good enough to capture the scene!
Been to Merilion park with family!! Awesome tourist attraction!! They maintain it so well. A must visit!!

We were looking right and left from the hop on hop off bus but didn't see the famous scoupture, so we walked beside it. Lovely tourist attraction. I would recommend it to every visitor to go down to see it not only for the Merlion but for the whole view, and if you are there take a walk to the Anderson bridge to see something different.
You can't tell people that you have been to Singapore if you didn't see the lion. That said, go at night and bring a tripod for your camera for some amazing photos. You will not regret it.

Merlion Park is located at the Heart of the City. It is one of the icon of the City but except for taking a photo with it, I did not find the place worth anything.  The place always remains very crowded. The food and beverages available there are to much costly. There is one souvenir shop which also sells stuffs at 5 times price.  It's very easily accessible by Public transport. By MRT, you have to take the Green Line (East-West) or Red Line (North-South) and get down at Raffles place. Then take exit H and after coming out, move towards right. You will have the Singapore river left to you. You have to walk straight and after some time you will get Fullerton Hotel. Then you have to cross the main road and you will find Marina Bay Sands from a distnace. After crossing the road, walk towards left and you will encounter Merlion from a Distance after some time(3-4minutes).
A nice little stop to get coffee while coming or going to Clarke Quay and enjoying the water front..
Its worth the visit at Singapore.. Kids can explore the merlion close and it's ideal for photo shoots. Best to go in the mornings.

Great Place ! Its surrounded by the best of skyscrapers, lovely walk on the creek. People are loving the MERLION surrounded by the ambience. Yes, I recommend all the visitors who tour SINGAPORE. This is a great place to see. Amazing.

I accepted it to be different. How? Not too sure.   There were about 2 buses of Chinese tourists when we arrived at 10 am in the morning making it crowded to try and get that photo opportunity. But we persisted and we got a good photo.
The Merlion is not the only thing to see here. It is a great spot to take some beautiful pictures of Singapore, both during the day and at night. A must to see for first time visits to Singapore!

This is probably the most seen images of Singapore’s national icon, the legendary & mythical Merlion with a body of a fish and a head of a lion. You can enjoy its full beauty of this legend at Merlion Park. Spouting sea water from its mouth, the Merlion statue stands proud at about 8.6 metres.  A trip to Singapore is never complete without trying to compose a picture of water coming out of your mouth at this tourist site.
highlight of singapore is this merlion. nice place to click pictures.view is amazing.always crowded by tourists.

review_title: Must visit if you are in Singapore
review_content: This place is a must visit if you are in Singapore and want to take back a souvenir picture. This is situated next to marina bay which makes it an idealistic spot for late evening acivity

If it's a nice day or night out, make a visit to this park! With plenty of open space for walking around, the views at this park is pretty nice. Not only do you have a good view of the water with Marina Bay Sands Hotel in the background, you can also see part of the city as well.   The park itself is clean and pretty well maintained. I visited this place both during the day and at night and the views are equally pleasing.  If it's near the holidays (like New Years Eve), this place can get pretty packed quickly. Overall, I recommend coming here at night if you're pressed for time since the views are prettier when the city is lit up.

Well worth the visit but be prepared for large crowds of people vying for that one last photo. There is plenty of room around the Merlion so at least there's more than one vantage point to get a good look. If going by train you need to get off at City Hall station after which it's about a 10 minute further walk. You won't be bored though. You walk past colonial historical buildings which are simply stunning and a credit to the city who maintain them to such a high standard. Well worth the trip.

This iconic symbol of Singapore is a must see and is a compulsory photo shoot when in Singapore. If you are staying in central Singapore, visiting the Merlion is a lovely walk both day or night or grab a water taxi for a different view!

Take the Boardwalk over from the Harbour Front as it's an easy stroll - you can always take the $29 cable car back. Great attractions for all the family although $59 ticket for 5 attractions was enough for a retired couple ! We rode the luge, the cable car, enjoyed the 4D Log Ride, rode a Segway and of visited the fabulous Aquarium. The Aquarium took around two hours to fully appreciate.

To put it bluntly, its a sculpture that spits out water with an awesome backdrop. Yes its a nice place to observe the bayside district but every selfie loving self indulgent social media junky is there trying to get themselves into perfect self portrait of what i am not sure - its not a tho Singapore has a shortage of Merlion statues.

When we hear the name singapore, the first thing come to mind is merlion park.the place is more for taking pictures.nothing else to do there.i visited in afternoon.it was so hot and sunny.better time to visit might be after 5.30pm

Lovely setting around Marina Bay, Boardwalk from Marina Bay side to Merlion Park. Plenty of Cafes plus fine dining restaurants. See the large lion spouting water. You can either walk or catch a water ferry from one side to the other.

There is a statue of Lionfish (Merlion) . This is the symbol of Singapore. The area is situated in the Marina sand. This is the main tourist attraction of Singapore. Very crowded area. It has two different look in day and in the night.

review_title: Nice view. Great place for photo taking
review_content: It's definitely a nice place for photo taking. However, it is a tourist attraction, so there are a lot of people there. Not easy to take a photo without having other people in your photo.  Went there once in the daytime but it rained, so we took photos while holding the umbrella. Also went there in the night time, the view is good but you need a good camera to capture the nice views.
Merlion is a must see, and it's only opposite the famous garden and marina's bay! So you should definitely visit the merlion and take pictures with it!

After a long day of sightseeing, we ended our day with a stop at Merlion Park. A very popular spot in Singapore. Plenty of hotels, restaurants, and views of beautiful Singapore. Located right on the bay, you have access to the boat rides, views of the Marina Bay Sands, and plenty of locals and tourist alike in the area. The one thing you must do here is get a picture with the Merlin Fish Statue. One of the signature items of Singapore. The night was a bit muggy (typical Singapore weather), but very nice and calming atmosphere. Whether you are here for a walk, lunch, dinner, jogging, or simply sightseeing, you will enjoy Merlion Park.

you haven't been to singapore if you have not visited merlion park. crowded with tourists, you need to find and save your spot to get a good angle for capturing fotos. plus a backdrop of marina bay sands.

The Singapore Lion is on opposite side of the bay to the Bay Sands Hotel, he spouts water from his mouth into the bay all day and night. He has a walkway for photo opportunities. From here you can walk all the way around the bay
One and only Merlion or the Goodluck charm for locals is this historic spot. Place is hot and best time would be during low sun.

The merlion park is awesome. There are two merlion statue there, mother and baby merlion. We can take many photo there, but it was many people during weekend. Evening is the good time for visiting this park, considering the weather is very hot at day and the evening many light on buildings surrounding the park are turn on. It was a beautiful place to visit in singapore.
Been to singapore many times, i hardly skip this venue. Always fascinating, both at noon or night. Superb view to the Marina Bay Sands, the Merlion Statue, Esplanade, and Singapore Flyers.
It is such a lovely walk along the riverside to the park. Also, Merlion is an iconic for tourist. It is the place to take a good photo with Marina bay building as well.

Just a stunning area of Singapore to visit! Clean, beautiful, creative. Picture perfect wherever you look. I wish we'd had more time to stroll around, but if you're short of time in Singapore (we only had a day while on a cruise), this area allows you to see quite a lot of Singapores beautiful attractions. Hope to return one day when I have more time!

After all the hype.... and the merlion being the symbol of Singapore this statue seemed pretty meek. Obviously it's crazy crowded but that doesn't detract from the quick glance that is required.  Get your photo and head on to somewhere nice and quiet.

It is a unique statue of Merlion . He brings wealth who holds him in his palm. After shifting Merlion from the original position to a new one across flyover resulting Singapore economy in downward mode & is not growing.

Well, this is the symbol of Singapore but i was little disappointed as when i visited the lion was not emitting water! You get a very good view of Marina Sands hotel from here, also can take a ferry ride!

if you wish to enjoy the beauty of the "mermaidlion" you have to be there early in the morning or late in the afternoon because of the heat of the sun. there are 2 statues, one is spitting water and the smaller one is not.

review_title: Busy free attraction - get there early
review_content: This attraction must be on every tourists to do list as it certainly appeared to be the case on the day we visited.  Be prepared to battle through a myriad of selfie stick wielding tourists as they all complete for vantage points to photograph their gleaming faces with the Merlion.  Once you take your photo, don't plan on spending more than 5 minutes to take in the views or your patience will be sorely tested.  The Merlion itself is just a device invented by the Singapore tourist board, don't expect any historic value to be obtained by this park. The Merloin is a recognisable feature on many postcards and t-shirts, hence the keen interest from tourists.  Try and get to this free feature as early as possible (and I mean early) so as to avoid the bus loads of excitable tourists arrive for their 15 minute panic indused stop off.  We got off at Raffles Place mrt when we made our brief visit.
truly an iconic structure ,need to be explored in day light to have good pics of it , beautifully maintained !!!

The Merilon Park is part of a large walking complex. From here you can go along Marina Bay seashore. The place is nothing really special. The merlion looks strange, but it is still good as a background for your photo. Not many your friends will have a photo with such strange creature :-)
This is iconic of Singapore. The magnitude of this & the surrounding area is mind boggling. Though there are smaller replicas in the city, this beats them all. A must see

Nothing much but you are in Singapore, at least you've got to see the Merlion once. Take a photo with the Merlion, enjoy your casual walk on a beautiful pavement, sightseeing or simply chilling. I do enjoy casual walk here.
Merlion Park is one of the iconic places of Singapore. It is a very scenic spot, and good for photo session.

Even though it was raining when we reached Merlion park, I could not stay away from going over an capturing the image which all over the world reminds us of Singapore, cant saY I came back disappointed.
Been to Singapore many times but this is the first time visiting Merlion Park. The view is really picturesque covering Merlion, Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer and etc. Should at least visit once.
The main place when we see and say that we have been to singapor while we go there and click some different views snaps the tour to singapor endz with merlion pic.

review_title: Hot like hell during day time
review_content: This area is always crowded with people all around the world. Most of them ecspecially Chinese from China come in group and always walk together in group.  It's difficult to walk when everybody want to stay near to their group member and don't give us space to walk. Traffic jammed everywhere. Crazily hot weather made me tension. I should go again during night next time !
visited merlion park on 10th june 2016, reached by mrt ,lot of public clicking there pics hardly find gap to click our pics there wonderful experience

I visited this attraction with a tour group, there were about 12 of us. We visited a total of 5 tourist attractions & the Merlion Park was the second on the list.The Merlion Park is considered the Landmark of Singapore. According to our tour guide the first two syllables from the word Singapore which is "Singa" means Lion. That's why they consider the Merlion statue as a landmark. The Merlion statue has an open mouth spewing out water from its mouth like a fountain into the lake surrounding it. The statue is facing the water on the lake, and the area is surrounded with many tall buildings . The Marina Bay Sands hotel complex, stands out among the tall buildings & I was able to take a photo with the Merlion statue & the Marina Bay Sands hotel on the background. I will always cherish this souvenir from this place with very nice view all around , an addition to my precious memories.

Merlion Park is one of the most famous place in Singapore. We went to this place because wanted to take a picture of it. We were there for 2 hours from 17.00 to 19.00. Taking picture when the sun is setting is the best.  This place is always crowded with people, so prepare your self.

review_title: Part of the Marina Promenade and a scenic spot
review_content: Scenic spot along the Marina. Great view, great photo spot. There are vendors to get a drink or snack.
We approached Merlion Park from water while on the DuckTour. It looks as beautiful, from new prospective , away from crowds . We recommend.

review_title: A trademark of Singapore overlooking at the bay
review_content: Must visit location, accesible from several directions within the city of Singapore. Dining options at short walking distance and point of departure for a number of tours and river cruises.
I took a half day Singapore tour at the Airport they're ofer us to visit some beautiful place for free, only for transit passenger.

review_title: Admittedly touristy but still a must-see part of Singapore
review_content: The first thing you will see at Merlion Park is the swarms of tourists trying to get a snapshot of the giant merlion spewing water. Once you get past the crowds of people, though, and start to explore the area, you will realize there is so much more to see. On my visit, there was a wind symphony performing nearby as well as several street performers. There are various stores in which to shop or eat. There is always something to do in this area of town, and if you like the backdrop of skyscrapers, you will love the photo opportunities here.
Big fountain in the park. A lot of people there especially in the night. Good for pictures and for a nice long walk by Marina bay and downtown.
Take a boat trip around the river to receive a detailed historical lesson on the Merlion. A wonderful experience. Be warned, organisation of boat tours can be chaotic but it's worth it in the end.

review_title: Our first time at Merlion Park.
review_content: Such a busy place with tours all the time. It is a very clean area (as is all of Singapore). Have to wait to get the perfect shot of the Merlion. Or a selfie with the Merlion. There is also baby Merlion in this area. There are eateries around this spot. Also gift shop.
Good views Merlion Statue at one end and Marina Bay at the other. Best Place for Photography.. Suggestion would be spend atleast 45-60 mins to enjoy the beauty of this sightseeing

review_title: That's the second biggest Merlion I've ever seen!
review_content: To get to Merlion Park just take the MRT subway to Raffles Place and it's just a ten minute walk to get there. This area also offers nice views of the harbour area. Definitely worth visiting but it will only take up about 20 to 30 minutes of your day so have some other activities planned!
We can only say, come and experience it, too. Worth every inch of the way and the sore feet. We dreamt coming here and it came true.

To be completely frank, there's not much to do at merlion Park except take some selfies and admire the view, but because of the world the merlion built around itself (or maybe the merlion was built around it?), there's plenty to do just around the merlion. As the main landmark of Singapore, every tourist needs to come here at least once. The night view isn't bad either, to catch the marina Bay laser/water show

review_title: Lovely spot on a lovely day
review_content: What a lovely place, the Merlion is a true icon in Singapore and this statue is a good photo opportunity. Across from Marina Bay Sands it allows you to get great photos across the harbor. There is always a lot of people around so it may take some time to get a good pic. Be careful of those selfie sticks – they are everywhere

The Merlion is the mythical symbol of Singapore, situated at the Merlion Park at Marina Bay. The statue is a creature that is a cross between a fish and a lion, spouting water out from the mouth into the river. This famous imaginary beast attracts over a million visitors per year. The park itself has a nice setting with terraced seating offering great views of Singapore's city skyline and landmarks as well as scenic waterfront. Nearby there are lots of shops selling souvenirs, especially of Merlion icons such as refrigerator magnets, T-shirts, key chains and photo frames.
I was looking forward to the famed Merlion. As my luck would have it the place was undergoing renovation. We took a few selfies after our Bum boat ride on the Singapore River.

review_title: Free Singapore Day Tours for transit passengers
review_content: Our free 2hr Singapore Day Tour visited this pleasant waterside area for a 20minute stop. Good views over the water to the amazing Helix Bridge. Very hot, crowds of people, but air-conditioned inside Starbucks near the bus drop-off point!

Alighted here from boat trip to get back to our hotel. Was amazed how busy it was. So very many people taking pictures of the merlions and the river from here. The merlions are a great sight from the river as you can get a clear view of them.

Location The Merlion Park was quite far away from the MRT station and there wasn't much directive on the way from the MRT station. Plus, Google Map could not show the shortest path to the park. They definitely need to add signs!  Taking photos @ Merlion Park We went on Monday so it was not crowded. We were able to find spots for a group picture. However, I reckon that they have put to much light on the Merlion that the white surface of the Merlion actually reflects the light and made it more difficult to take great pictures of it. However, from the very same spot, its surrounding scenery was super stunning and I highly recommend to try taking pictures with the Panorama mode if you have one.

review_title: A very popular attraction for Asian visitors to Singapore
review_content: This is selfie stick central! Very crowded on the sunny morning we visited - not so crowded on a wet day!
U should go here if come to sin, this is the icon. But poor me when im comin to merlion its rainy and to many people around, hard to take a good pose with the lion ,, lol

This is one of the signature tourist attraction in Singapore where you get to see the Merlion. It is a nice tourist spot which is generally pretty crowded all the time. One get also get a good view of the Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore flyer from here. I would suggest going there in the evening or night to enjoy the lightings.
who ever visit Singapore must visit this place ,it is place that make your visit a complete one.view of marina bay in the distance make it a memorable one .
The Merlion Park, the land mark of Singapore, is so amazing even though the weather is so hot in the daytime. But in the nighttime it's so beautiful. i love it !

review_title: Great place for the quintessential tourist photo
review_content: Although I've visited Singapore several times, this is the first time I made it over the the Merlion Park. It's a fun place to go to get the quintessential tourist photo...the water coming out of the Merlion's mouth going into your mouth. Definitely worth a quick visit ;)

While in Singapore, do visit one of these two ( Merlion Park boat cruise / Singapore Flyer ). ( check out my review on Singapore Flyer ). The Merlion is an icon of Singapore and has the head of a lion and the tail of a fish and its essentially a trading port. The Merlion Park has the original Merlion Statue ( the other one being in Sentosa ) overlooking the Singapore River. Its where you take a history tour of some of the iconic buildings in and around Singapore on a boat. Its a guided boat cruise and you get to see some of the well known buildings during the cruise ( like the Fullerton hotel ). You may stroll around the park , but don't miss out the fantastic view of the Marina Bay sands hotel from the Park and do enjoy your boat ride !

It's your typical park where you can relax & stroll about the grounds. The shady benches are very inviting and you can people watch while enjoying the view. And of course there's the Merlion and history surrounding the statue that is the big draw here which than points you to marina bay.

review_title: Too touristy and overcrowded but synonymous with Singapore visit
review_content: When you say Singapore ,the Merlion Park comes into your mind with fraction of seconds ! We visited this place amidst full house( packed with people and taking the humidity to next level).The view view from this park is amazing ,you can see the Marine Bay and you also have the option to take small boat rides which are not very expensive!!

review_title: Merlion Park is a Must Do when in Singapore
review_content: You can't really say you have done Singapore without visiting the famed symbol of Singapore the Merlion. We had a entertaining day at the Park with plenty of things to see and do.

Everyone says if dont visit this place so you are not at singapore! The icon history of Singapore.. I came here when it almost sunset time, so we can see the sun reflection from the Marina Bay Sands..

review_title: Very busy but worth a visit
review_content: An amazing site and so many photo opportunities. It was great to experience an icon of Singapore. The immediate area is pristine and the Fullerton is exquisite. This is a must when visiting Singapore.

Everyone must visit the Merlion when visiting Singapore, it is the symbol of Singapore. It is a lovely scene the Merlion spewing water out into the sea, it is very pleasant as there are many places to visit near the Merlion.

This place is always packed with tourists getting a glimpse of the famed Merlion. I think it would be ideal to read a bit of Singapore's history to really appreciate the Merlion's significance. Area where it is really awesome, though, with splendid views of the MBS, the Flyer, the ArtScience Museum. Best to go just before the sunset, in my opinion.

review_title: Singapore visit is incomplete without being here!!
review_content: No body will believe that you visited Singapore, if you wouldn't click your photo in front of Merlion. Its more not clicking your pic in front of Taj Mahal, while you visit Agra in India. Jokes apart, this is the Symbol of Singapore, so its must visit place. I would suggest to visit in Night when all the light of the tall building forms its back ground. It gives an awesome view. You will not be spending too much time here, as nothing else is to be done here. Unless you just want to sit there and relax, looking around.

I was on a hop on hop off bus tour when I stopped at the Fullerton Hotel. It was a 5min walk on the exact Picture Location of the Merlion park. It was around 10 in the morning and the sun was scorching hot and the humidity made everything worse.  It was very touristy. So the picture spots were like first come first serve!  I was alone so I had to ask the other tourists to snap a photo of me. ;)

Merlion park is the best place to have a look around the cityscape of Singapore. Easily accessible by metro. There are heaps of people around though. A modern architectural masterpiece, Marina Bay Sands is just in front of the park which gives amazing views at night. Most of all, Singapore is extremely safe at anytime of the day. People roam around at midnight without any trouble.
Every people come to Singapore will visit this Merlion Park. Located in the CBD near Fullerton Hotel, Merlion Park is easy access by MRT Raffles Place. From MRT, just follow the direction.
One of the best places in Singapore .. because here we can take pictures with a variety of backgrounds, from Marina Bay, the Singapore Flyer, Esplanade, and much more ..
Here..we can see the country symbol (icon) from singapore. And the park is also beautiful and clean.

review_title: Merlion is Singapore and Singapore Merlion
review_content: If you are in Singapore, you have to be at the Merlion. A photo with the Merlion can become your profile pic. Though crowded, this place near the Fullerton Hotel provides ample photo ops using a selfie stick. Please note: Without a Selfie stick you may not be able to click a perfect pic with the Merlion. The Merlion park as it is called offers photo ops from many angles including one on top of the hanging bridge nearby.
Must visit once. It is a symbol of Singapore. if you want to take home something as a memory of Singapore, you may have a memento of Merlion
This landmark should be on every tourist to do list just to see it and take time to reflect away from the hustle and bustle of shopping.

review_title: The signature place to be for tourists.
review_content: Beautiful place and view. A lot of people here taking pictures. Its hard to have a clear solo picture since its a crowded place. Anyway its free so no complains. A must see for travellers like me.
Visited the merlion and seen the views. at sentosa island. you will see many merlions around singapore

review_title: It's OK but a bit of a travel cliche
review_content: The good thing about this attraction is that you can get your photo taken next to the Merlion. The bad things are that's about all you can do. Overall, there are many more interesting places that you can visit in Singapore (for example, the Singapore Flyer is close by and much more fun).
good view and the merlion still not change. i hope at nite more have attractive light so more colourfull and pretty.. cheers..

The merlion is the symbol of Singapore, and, as such, is featured in a prominent display in the Marina Bay area.  The statue itself spews water into the bay, but never fear - the ingenious Singaporeans who built this added a viewing deck off to one side, so you can still take that selfie with the lion in the background. It's a must see, though it's not the only Merlion in Singapore!

review_title: Love the Merlion, I take visitors here
review_content: I love going here because the Merlion is cool and it's great watching people take selfies and watching the landscape over the bay. I recommend grabbing some food Take-Away and then go sit on the stairs and eat. Or grab a drink and sit and spend a little time there. Just a beautiful place to take in.
And everyone talking selfies with selfie sticks! There are some nice amenities in the area (ice cream, especially welcome in the heat). The two merlions are very cool.

You haven't been in Singapore if you are not here yet, but its an outside activity so not so good while raining and will be a little bit hard for you to took a good picture because a lot of people there
Nice walk around Singapore and great to have such a monument at the heart of the city. Visited same with duck tour as well.
We stayed here in the afternoon while waiting for our next tour to see the wings of time.Interesting and relaxing place to see.

The Merlion area is a good area for photo ops, but it is really crowded! All the tourists are trying to get pictures of themselves and their friends, so it's rather hectic, but the Merlion and the history behind it is very interesting. Since this is one of Singapore's major landmarks, it's worth seeing.

review_title: Curious to see what the Merlion is all about...
review_content: The area at Marina Bay and 1 Fullerton is lovely, and I visited the bay because of the captivating night lights and high rise buildings surrounding the bay. When at 1 Fullerton, one is bound to see Singapore's symbol- the Merlion located beautifully by the promenade and spitting water into the bay. Other than this- there's nothing special to the Merlion in particular, however it's worth seeing the symbol of Singapore just to put that tick in one's own "to do" book!
I like this place. This place is awesome. Clean, good atmosphere and so many great people. But i don't like when chineese people in grup go to there. They are so noisy and disturbing.
Merlion Park was a great place to visit, however please note that this place gets rammed with tourists. Some great photo opportunities to be had here if you hit on a quieter time of day.
Something you really should see as the iconic statue of Singapore. It's free to see and good to get a photo with! Nice location also!
There are two merlions and IMO the sentosa merlion is better. The park is a good place for the kids to play around.

review_title: Merlion the iconic structure of Singapore
review_content: The Merlion is star attraction, the river cruise is around Merlion and old Singapore is worthwhile to see historical monuments and travel back in time.

review_title: another land mark of nation in world class and many more
review_content: The merilion land mark and surrounded park pictorious and show up modern cities proud to the world.when you turn youre camera to four corners you will capture major portin of Singapore city easily.Its clean and tidy always tourist crowded place, muat see when you visit Singapore at least one.
its a good place to take photos and relax and cool a little with the water spray coming from the statue
We enjoyed our walk around the small inland bay and ended up in this park that gives a nice view in evening of Singapore by night

A walk around the bay and you will pass this c7m dragon with water pouring from his mouth. Nice enough as part of a walk on the bay, but very much a tourist trap and a place to get a drink, souvenir or a bay boat trip!
A Singapore landmark and can be added onto other tours. Very busy all day use the viaduct to cross the road, and maybe a drink at the Fullerton a/c!
Lovely to wonder around, beautiful lush scenery, clean & quiet. Its a lovely break from walking around the many shopping centres & eateries.
Merlion Park the symbol of Singapore allows great photo opportunity for the visitors, try visit in the night time

It's a merlion that spits out water. Not sure how else to pretty up the description. It's going to be a zoo at the park with so many tourists taking selfies ... I would advise you taking the DUKW boat tour that will get you a better picture of your own selfie with the statue.

review_title: Famous landmark that every visitor should check out once
review_content: This is a famous statue water fountain, with great views all around of the city, bay and Marina Bay Sands. Nothing super exciting to see, but one of the icons of Singapore. Coming in the morning means less people, as it can get packed in the viewing area later in the day.
Just a nice and place for photography... place is always crowded with visitors, but a must place to visit during your trip

review_title: You need to see the Merlion
review_content: I didn't make it to the Merlion until my third trip to Singapore, but you need to see what all the fuss is about. Taxi in and out with ease from a taxi stand near the Starbucks. Not a ton to do, but a great photo and views of the rest of the park.
Merlion means Singapore! Truely amazing place. Almost all travel agencies display this in add or magazine. Actually its smaller than expected from photos.

Not so special as expected! The mother Merlion was not big, just water shower from her mouth. But I thought "This is Singapore"! Worth visit. Also the street is good to walk. Nice view, sunny weather(hot though), you can feel early summer!

This is a must visit place when you go to Singapore. In this place you can take magnificent photos of Singapore famous landmark such as Marina Bay Sand, Esplanade Theater (Durian-shape building), or make a creative photograph using the Merlion statue. Just ignore everyone else when you doing your creativity.

A must to go take photo if you are first time in Singapore. Take with the Merlion and your backdrop will be the iconic Marina Bay Sand Casino.... If evening time, bring a good camera... Sometime you will see beautiful firework or laser show from MBS.  Lots and lots of pubs and restaurants... Spend your tire day there with your friends. After dinner, go drinking... No need to waste time hop around...

review_title: Observe the rites of the cult of the Merlion
review_content: It is an interesting statue/fountain in a nice position by the harbour, but it's still quite bizarre that it gets surrounded by hundreds of tourists gawking at it and snapping away. Perhaps there is some true power in this modern god.
You never been to Singapore if you never come here. An iconic place to take some good photos. View from here is excellent and the night view is awsome.

This was an amazing place.We went on the river boat which told you all about the history of Singapore.The place is stunning at night when it is a lit up. Lovely art pieces everywhere.The merlion is a must see.Lovely places to eat & drink. Loved it here.
Merlion park is actually a symbol of Singapore. I interpret it as Singapore's symbol because it is also like Singapore: Calm like a Mermaid and strong like a lion.

Wow hundreds of people in one area with selfie sticks! It's a bit of a bustle to fight through the crowds to get a pic. Loads of tourist buses drop off at this destination for around 30 min. Worth seeing but expect to be pushing yourself through the crowds in peak time! Easy to find and get to on your own or hire a sightseeing tour! Free destination with food/drinks close by. Worth a visit with your selfie stick!

review_title: Great view of the river and City..
review_content: From here you can get a great view of the Singapore and also enjoy a small boat ride which is really nice and relaxing. The place also offers some great dining opportunities and fast food cafe's which has some great food to offer.

While on Sentosa island do take out time to visit all locations. Merlion park is one such location which should not be missed. Named after the mythological character this place holds special attraction in Singapore.
Kids loved this and the story behind the mermaid lion. Beautiful to see and well worth the visit. One of Singapore must see attractions.

nice place water coming out from Merlion mouth , big beautifull place can have lots of selfie and can spend a good tile bu walking through the bridge , crossing stadium and theater point, and can enter directly to Marina Sand Bay Mall to enter Casino. Cool,and romantic place for couple if you go at around midnight. very few people and no noise and all.......Cheers Merlion
It is the symbol of Singapore and for sure that many tourists came here to check in they are in Singapore already. Nothing special, just a statue. I didn't even take any photos at this place.

If you think Singapore, you think Merlion. Half lion, half mermaid..Chinese believe water means wealth and hence Merlion always spills water for prosperity. You can enjoy this place any time of the day. Mainly sight seeing place. Not much to do just sit and relax and click loads of selfies.
View! View! View! Though this place does not offer anything more than view but it is much go. Food and drinks are pretty bad just near Merlion Park.

review_title: Its just that. Just that statue.
review_content: Totally skippable but if you want to prove you were there, then please go visit. But its just that, just that statue spewing water.  Its just off a very important road, so make sure you have organized your transport before getting there.

Like the Eiffel Tower in Paris or Big Ben in London, one of the Worlds iconic tourist destinations and a must see when you are in Singapore. Make sure you bring plenty of water, since it is a healthy walk from the nearest SMRT stop and it is always hot with little shade and plenty of crowds.

every night at 20:00 and 21:45 they hold a laser & light show that is nealry comparable to Hong Kong Harbour. I suggest to get a good spot that places you in front of the Marina bay Sands hotel as this is the epicentre of the display. the sound can be a bit hard to hear if there is a large crowd, but the show is worth watching. The merlion itself is beautafully lit at night and if you walk to the park via the Fullerton Hotel path the whole city itself is lit up beautifully, each bridge has its own individual color and the Singapore Eye itself literally pulses as it changes color. Other cities could take note of how Singapore does the light show.
We had fun taking pictures along the river and the bay. Very fun. Spectacular views. Very safe area. I think more safe than the USA.
Merlion park was very exciting and yet you could rest and relax and take in all the sights. It's not to be missed.
Fantastic place to visit very much a big historic land mark. A must to visit seems allways very busy with people takeing pictures. Lovely walk at the side of the water and over the bridge.
A great photo opportunity. Large crowds gather to get their photo taken in front of fountain which brings old and new Singapore together.
Absolutely beautiful-especially at the sunrise. Be there in the early morning to get a perfect shot. It has great choices for places of interest.
must visit place ! free attraction and fancy place to take photo. near MBS and so easy to get here by bus,MRT or taxi.

It is a 1-2 hour activity, one can reach there thru Metro or bus, should not go there on rainy day. should take a camera to click the memorable pics, the Marina bay sands hotel is also visible from this side of the river. The Merlion statue is symble of Singapore. It is half lion and half mermaid that's why it is titled as merlion. the statue is situated at bank of Singapore river. Its a tourist attractions and a must visit in Singapore. There is a park adjoining the statue where few crystal balls are placed which are shining too much..
this is one of the very first tourist locations ever built, but still very popular with visitors, its location is stunning and worth a visit

The Merlion Park is a good place for photo taking with Marina Bays Sands as the backdrop.   There is a smaller Merlion a couple of meters away from the Big Merlion.   After photos taking, you may visit one of the many eateries at Fullerton. They served food from all over the world.   After dinner, you may want to walk along Singapore River towards Boat Quay or Clarke Quay for drinks. There are many eateries there too.   If you want across the Singapore River, you may visit Esplanade, Marina Square, Suntec and Millennium Walk. Many shops to shop.   At the back of Merlion Park is the Fulllerton Hotel which used to be the Singapore General Post Office.
Great to see and photograph this well known tourist attraction. Lovely water feature overlooking Marina Bay - has small replica behind it.
Enjoyed to play with Merlion when I surrounded there. Nice view and be the photo point when you visit in Singapore.
The merlions are so iconic, and therefore, constantly surrounded by tourists! It's like selfie central. We took our photos and got outta there!
There is a historical significance to this structure which makes it more interesting. Avoid the afternoon visit. It is hot as hell. Lots of eateries available. Good for photo freaks!

I guess you shouldn't visit Singapore without seeing the national figure - the Merlion. But, apart from taking the obligatory photo of the Merlion spitting water into your own mouth, the best reason to visit is the uninterrupted view of Marina Bay.  Be patient, and you will get great photos.  And, cool off after in the Starbucks store across the street (cross under the bridge!).
There are always hordes of people there and this adds to the atmosphere. Plenty of photo opportunities!

If you like take photo with good view, so you must going to Marlion Park..   Not enough for Marlion statue, so you also can take picture with Singapore Flyer and Sandbay view from far, its so beautiful..

We visited on our first day in Singapore, along with all the other hundreds of people. Great views of the Merlion and city surrounds. It’s a “must see” while you are there. Don’t get caught in the tourist trap like we did and buy something to drink from under the bridge, head further along the walkway and you’ll find something cheaper.
What's a Merlion? Half mermaid, half lion... Pretty pointless park. There are way better natural parks all around Singapore without these stupid statues.
Be there in the early morning to get a perfect shot. Otherwise many tourists will be there. Nice place also at night.
What a fun statue! We went during the day and it was crowded but definitely easy enough to get great photos of this unique symbol of Singapore.

One specially in Singapore is Merlion but another important thing is how to reach Merlion. If you choose bus metro its common way. But i will choose underground roads. Whole Singapore and ever building of Singapore has attached by underground roads or you can say walking subways. Singapore is the country in case of war civilians cant be harmed here because they designed there country such a beautiful way in case of road blocks or war or alerts they can go by underground walking subways. Awesome thinkers.

review_title: A must visit for first timers
review_content: For first timers, I suggest to ride a cab even though the mrt stations are in walking distance. As the weather usually pretty hot and you will need to walk a bit without any shades (for both mrt stations). Well, it might work if you don't traveling with a toddler though. But if you are traveling with kids, that's a bit mood downer.

More that the Singapore flyer, marina bay sands or sentosa, the Merlion really represents Singapore. It can easily be recognizable.   Singapore being a hot and humid country, it may be quite challenging to visit this place during the day but the beauty of this place really shines through under sunlight. There are tons of plants nearby which I think helps in making the place a little less humid. A must to visit.
As always, tourists and locals flock to this exquisite statue for a selfie. You've never been to Singapore without coming eye to eye with this "white lion"

review_title: Selfies and pics remain incomplete without being there
review_content: Go go go.... Walk n enjoy. Also enjoy the river cruise next to it.  Also at the back of this is a miniature of the lion from whose mouth the water keeps pouring.
The big lion statue has a waterfall and light on its, all day before 8pm. So check your time to visit to get the best photo

review_title: a must see attraction for 1st time visitors
review_content: travelling to singapore one must come and see the merlion. from there you can see the marina bay sands and the museum. dont forget to bring water if coming mid day

Everyone must get there photo taken in front of the Merlion. It is like going to Paris and not getting a photo of the Eiffel Tower, you just don't do it.   And it is not just the photo op you go for, it is the stunning view of so many iconic spots and sights of Singapore. Just be patient getting your photo as every man and his dog (chicken) has the same idea as you do :D

At the end of my visit to Singapore my family decided to visit the place. The recommended time to visit is in the morning around 9 am. But since we arrive there around 3 - 4 pm the place was too crowded so we decide to take a picture from the bridge connector. Luckily the weather was perfect.

Very touristy but great for pictures. Also within reasonable walking distance to Raffles hotel and other key sights. A number if restaurants and drinking p,aces nearby and you can catch the boat trips just next to the Malion statue

One of my top priorities during my short visit to Singapore was to see the city's iconic statue. Great for photos and located with near the water with Marina Bay in the background. Can be a bit crowded with tourists so may want to avoid peak hours.

You can't get enough to visit this panoramic landmark just once! Yap this place will lead you to enjoy every corner of your vision.  There you can see beautiful architectures of Singapore. It begins with Bank, Hotel even you can see Marina Bay Sands. Or you can see somekind of boat that across from the rive if you get lucky.  However you must be patient because thousands of people will get into there every time. Don't worry, I got fabulous photos in the middle of the crowd. So enjoy it!
Visit to Singapore without Merlion is not complete. It is like getting a signature of Singapore before going to more interesting places to see.

review_title: not as good as i thought
review_content: its just a statue.. its was bright sunny day in summer.. cant stand there for much time.. only photos can be taken
It's a nice place where you can see all symbols of Singapore at the harbour including the most beautiful Merlion statue, Marina, Esplanade theatre, Singapore flyer.
the most city attraction that have to visit when you are in singapore for the first time. wajib banget punya foto di the merlion ini. the symbol of Singapore
Yes there is a Merlion and another smaller one but it is a small part of a much wider panorama of sights that are a must for any visitor.
Our gracious host for the day told us that you are not in Singapore unless you visited the Merlion! Lots of tourist, expats & locals as well taking photo ops. Iconic!
A must to visit, beautiful views, and a photo with the Merlin has to be done, so do not miss this must see tourist spot.

This is a lovely area, lots of tourists, great for photo's. We took a Bumboat from Clarke Quay and got off at Merlion Park for a few photo's and a walk around. The Bumboat was a lovely trip, though a little pricey for the time it took.
We visited this during a boat cruise we were doing. Great place to learn about the history and to walk around the waters edge.

I went to singapore in the month of March 2016, so it was quite hot during that time. We went to Merlion Park late night. It was very beautiful and was not even crowded.   Best time to visit this place is at night, you can easily get a place to sit during this time and you can spend hours with your partner.

This is one place I like to stroll near my office to ease off the stress. No doubt, this place is always filled with tourists. But it's a place where you can immense yourself in the atmosphere, enjoying the moment, which is right next door to the cbd.   Bring a cold drink along and sit under the bridge to cool off and this is another way to enjoy this site!

Singapore's famous city emblem is a tourist hot spot - worth seeing, but not worth lingering long - take your photo, then go and explore somewhere else. If part of a tour expect chaotic disembarkation/reboarding with a very limited time slot at the Starbucks across the highway.
I just enjoy my time here... 10 hours stop In Singapore... Easy to get to the town by underground from Airport. Take a coffee break, just sit and watch the tourist and beautiful statue Merlion...

IT WAS HOT DAY ....TOOK THE MRT THEN WALKED A COUPLE OF BLOCKS JUst the signs that leads to a river.....then read signs again going to the park you will know you are on the right track since you will travellers going in the same direction.....do not forget to drop by the ice cream station manned by an old couple near the hotel.....try to take as many pictures........loved it!

Perfect spot for your Instagram travel pictures. View of Marina Bay Sands and the famous Merlion itself.   Nice restaurants around and great place to walk about.   Sure thing to do when in Singapore. The weather is usually hot and only a 15 minute entertainment place in case you chose not to eat. Keep your self hydrated.
This is a very nice place to see, I loved it there, it was so crowded and hot, but the place was really clean and worth going.
Nothing Speacial, yea its of of Singapore's icon so just stop here - take a photo and go somewhere after that....

Visited first as part of a well recommended City Tour with Tour East. Our guide Linda Chan was exceptional. We came back in the evening to watch the laser light show. Bit of a wait and hundreds of people but we got a spot on the steps so we could sit and watch.

review_title: I love that half a mermaid is the official symbol of Singapore.
review_content: Easy to access via MRT. You've got to see this up close. Half mermaid, half lion; merlion. It sprays water out its mouth and it's apparently a thing to try appear to be drinking the merlion fountain in photos so you get heaps of people posing awkwardly with their mouths open. It's almost more entertaining than the merlion itself!

review_title: With amazing view of Marina Bay Sands
review_content: A little bit crowded especially at night but still worth the visit. You can watch from here the light show in the promenade. We did not walk from the Marina Bay Sands because our legs were really tired but you can take a taxi, just a few minutes ride.

I prefer going to this park at night as it is not as hot and the night view is night with all the lightings coming from the financial district behind it and view of the lighted up Marina Bay Sands across the river.

This wa our second visit to singapore. we walked round the bayside up to the merlion.It was a lovely walk,plenty of places to stop and have a drink and people watch. love this area can spend allday there.

Perhaos there was a time when this seemed a special place and it may have greater significance to the local people. However its fairly basic and simple memorials in a pretty waterfront location. the pretty waterfront views would exist if Merlion Park was not there.

During past visits, being an exsmoker one notices these things, I never saw cigarette butts on the ground. Oh how things have changed. On the promenade there are 100's of cigarette butts, on the walk to Fullerton One, cigarette butts. Near the artificial soccer ground, in front of the stands, cigarette butts. I don't mind people smoking but I think Singapore council? has lost the plot, A real disappointment,

Its a long walk from marina bay sands but once you decide to walk you will pass by few more tourist attraction on the way place is crowded during weekend especially for tourist. Nice view this is one if the famous land mark of Singapore
