This is a place that we must have camera, because too much view will capture to save your moment. The symbol of Singapore's is here, so if you visit singapore, don't forget go here. No need to pay, all free.... have fun
Great views of Marina Bay Sands, Merlion statue and the Singapore skyline. However the park gets incredibly busy, not really allowing too many good photo opportunities. People everywhere.
- you will have a great view in here - great place for taking picture - the souvenir shop is pretty good but expensive - rain is your enemy
We were there at night, the view was amazing around the Marina Bay. There were people everywhere taking photos.

Merilon is an odd animal, but it is nice when it is spray water in night lighting. From the park you have great views of the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer and the Esplanade. They are all beautiful in evening lighting.

review_title: Iconic Place to visit in Singapore
review_content: Iconic Place to visit in Singapore... This talks about the emblem of Singapore and must click of photos for everyone... Will be crowded as usual as it is the one of the top visit in Singapore. Back-drop is wonderful Marina Bay Sands... Picture perfect

review_title: Your trip isn't complete without this!
review_content: The Iconic Merlion and the view from the park is priceless. Your trip isn't complete without a picture taken here!

review_title: Worth to go to see... Not Merlion... Marina Sands
review_content: This is kind of a good view point where you can see the marina sands, Giant wheel as full view. Specially after 7.30 PM you can see the light of Marina sands with laser spots. Other than that the place is little(most of the time very high) crowd in evening times.
Don't miss the iconic landmark on your Singapore visit plus a 360 degree view of the bay including Gardens by the Bay, Marina Bay Sands, and more.
Visited Sentosa Island and Merlion Park is one of the main attractions. One can go up to top and there is a short cinema on Singapore History.  It's ok for one time visit.

review_title: Fantastic Photo point by Singapore River
review_content: Merlion Park is best Photo point by Singapore river. Merlion is half lion with body of fish. It is believed that it brings luck to Singapore. For best photo stand on the side and take photo while you are facing sun. Best time to take photo is by 10 am.
The symbol of Singapore, surrounded by other attractions like the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer, Helix Bridge, etc.
A great place to view MBS and the Marina Bay Area, the Merlion is not a mythical creature worth any acknowledgement but an invention of the Singapore tourism board in the 1960's, cheesy!

White lion/fish head spitting out water in the middle of a jetty. I have visited this couple of times but on all occasions weather was very hot and humid. My advice is to visit this place at cooler times of the day.
Symbol of singapore. Must visit place in singapore. Place is so good for photo shoot and spend time.
It can get very busy at Merlion Park especially if it's a weekend but it's worth the visit.  The view of Marina Bay Sands is great and it's a nice place to sit and have an ice cream and relax.
We went to the park at night and it was well lit. There was a light show which was quite a treat to see.

Yes, as other reviewers have stated, it is always busy but a must see. The transportation is free and easy to get about. Wonderful photo opportunities. Take either or both of the cable cars for some stunning aerial views of the area. There is a zip wire for the very adventurous!!!!! Take plenty of water as hot and humid most days. Plenty of cafes etc.

The Merlion was once the symbol of Singapore, and my recollection of it from a visit in 1983 is that it was on the limits of the city. No more! But it is still an interesting place to visit with the white lion and the jet of water issuing from its mouth. Also the crowds of tourists! Eats and toilet facilities are nearby.
Good for a nice walk around the promenade or just sitting and enjoying some food or drinks in the evening, awesome view to Marina Sands Bay

review_title: Hot, Crowded, Must visit of 1st time in sg
review_content: A lot of tourists flock here even at the peak of the sun. It is no wonder since the merlion in action (water sprouting at its mouth) looks cool. Make sure to wear strong and breathable sunblock if going here.

Singapore visit is in vain if you not visit Merlion park,Home to Merlion,pride of the Singapore.It Gives Opportunity to view Singapore river,Theatres on bay (Esplanade). Also, One can visit Marina Bay sands Here.

Of course a visit to Singapore would not be complete if you didn't see the Singapore famous Merlion. We went there for a quick picture taking. The views around it is very beautiful and it is a good place to chat with different tourists from different parts of the world.

If there is something unique and iconic in Singapore, it is the big Merlion spouting water in the Merlion park; Great location in the middle of lots of restaurants; Great people watching; Enjoy the evening.
Doesn't matter how tired you are the park and the Merlion will get that silly grin on your face. The water sprinkling on everyone and a number of tourist posing with the lion
the trademark of sg that everyone is longing to see, and nice to see this place, a very good experience to date!
Nothing much there a Icon which is shown in every where. Take a pic and continue your journey. Flyer, Merlin park all are near by
Once you come to singapore, please and please go to Merlion Park in front of Fullerton Hotel. The best view is at night with lights. Take some pics and u are already in Singapore.

Well known all over the world and famous landmark of singapore. One of the best tourist attractions in Singapore city to see the mythical Merlion. Great view of Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer and the iconic Marina Bay Sands Hotel.

Overrrated and very crowded. Best view of the Merlion is from the hotel balcony of the pan pacific of from the Ferris wheel, or on a river cruise. On the ground there are 1000's of Chinese taking selfies..

A trip to SG would be incomplete without visiting the popular iconic symbol of Singapore Merlion ,it's the central attraction Venue that attracts thousands of international visitors to enjoy the scenic Maria bay and the the majestic view of skyscrapers and the Luxurious Marina Sands Bay Hotel ,another iconic structure three pillared and boat on top design..The bay has a plesant walkway around it.The water gushing out from the Merlion mouth grasps the attention of the visitors...at day as well as during night hours...I visited Merlion park at the morning hours and at night hours when the colourful lights were lit and city bay glittering..The Merlion park is free open to public and can be easily reached by MRT and bu public SBS bus ..I took bicycle for rent from my hotel to explore the scenic beauty of SG.

This is one of the famous places in Singapore, as you've seen photos many times before. You can walk from the train station. I got off the train at Raffles Place and walked about 5min to there. Food shop and some cafe are in there as well.  Not many things to see, but if you visit Singapore, you can't miss this place.

Despite the hype, I would not say it is a place so awesome to visit. Yes, it is an iconic statue of Singapore tourism, and the scenery is great, but when you are there, it would likely be: "Oh, is that it? Okay... what's next?" Quite a walk from any MRT to get there, especially if it is a hot day. Nonetheless, it is not as if it is a BAD place. It is just that, you don't have to be overly excited about it.
Not much to look at. The merlion is very small compared to the other attractions in Singapore. Best part are the views across the harbour and the surrounding shops. It is easy to access.
A short trip is all that is needed to see the symbol of Singapore. See the Merlion spouting water into the harbour, not a lot to see.

It was a quick visit in this Singapore Merlion ,we had great time taking photos and just happen there we met a newly friend my countrypeople from Philippines we had a great share of talking feels like a an old friend indeed we just met there.. Merlion Singapore reminds me of my very good friend in Cagayan Philippines...

It's a park where you can find a statue of a lion with fishtail called Merlion as in Mermaid (maiden with fishtail) about 9-10 meter high, that spits out water from its mouth.  How to get there: Take the MRT (subway) it's the easiest and cheapest is you are travelling less than 4 people, more than 4 people taxi is cheaper. By MRT you stop at Raffles Place Station exit door G, once you're exited, walk to Fullerton Hotel, cross to One Fullerton Building and you can find Merlion not far.
Nice area with many tourists you can also go on boats in the bay to see places around many restaurants and coffee shops.
I used to live here for many years so seeing the Merlion again was like seeing an old friend. I love the area they have built up around it now. It makes it fun for both old and young.

Singapore icon and mythical creatures the Merlion is a statue that resembles half fish and half Lion. It is well known throughout the world and favorite landmark for visitors to take pictures. The surrounding area also has a great view of Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer, Art and Science Building and the Marina Bay Sands Hotel with huge boat on the top. Go there in the evening is a lot cooler. We went there during the day and it was stinking hot.
Very busy place, try to go early in the morning to avoid crowd. This is a nice place to take pictures of the city and the Bay.
It is only a short walk from Fullerton Hotel but the sights of important landmarks fill me with awe. The place was full of merrymakers and activity.

review_title: The Merlion and an attractive walk
review_content: The title "The Merlion Park" is a little confusing, as it is not a park of green grass, but a monument to the history of Singapore. It is a site to visit, as well as a good point to start a walk along The Singapore River to Clarke Quay. If you tire on the way you could decide on a river boat trip and see Singapore from the river.

The beautiful Merloin was the most beautiful view in the night as it was lighted at night. The Marina bay was put to shame compared to its beauty. I dont know but the Merloin has a different vibe that when you see it, you will really be mesmerized.
The view and structure of this Merlion is breathtaking especially at night. We went there on a Friday.

A hive of activity, meeting point for tours, but great to get up close to Merlion. Lots of eateries along the waterfront too with great views of the Marina Bay Sands hotel. Friday evening fireworks spectacular from this vantage point
Get a close view of the iconic Singapore Merlion. Take some selfies. Click some picture, late night you can watch laser shoe from here. Best of all its Free.
The whole area around this park is scenic but very crowded by the Merlion spewing water. Our guide told us to see the laser shows but not enough time to visit. I would say a picture here is worth it.

review_title: Mix Of Mom Merlion And Baby Merlion..
review_content: Going to Singapore And Not Going To See The Merlion Mom And Baby Should Be A Crime. It Is Half Lion And Half Mermaid.  Great In The Day Light And Great At Night When It is Light Up...  Nice Place For Photography Too..

Its a must visit place if you are in Singapore. Symbolically represents Singapore. You can see how beautifully land is been reclaimed and build few buildings on top of it. Cruise ride starts from this place one can go for nice scenic cruise ride for 30 mins.
The area itself around the Merlion is nice. Nice walk to the Merlion and crossing it. You should not miss it if you are in SIngapore

We had a great visit and tried several of the activities, from water sliding to snorkeling. All good fun and water was nice and cool, well needed on a +30 day in Singapore.  Can recommend it to families w kids.

Going to Singapore and not going to see the Merlion should be a crime. It is half Lion and Half Mermaid. Great in the day light and great at night when it is lit up. It gets very busy there and there are lots of people all taking phots, so if you are on your own you can just ask someone to help you out. If you go at night you can see the laser show over at marina bay. This starts at 20.00
this is one of the main attraction of singapore. lots of people come here just to click a photo with the merlion. you can get to see MBS from there.

The whole Marina Bay larea is fairly spectacular however the Merlion Park section is nothing special. If you have never been there before it is good for taking happy snaps n watching the light show, but that's about it.
Lots of people everyday so be patient in taking pictures. Many loud people from different country. No other recommended down time.
I really expected the lion to be more bigger in size. There is a small lion also behind the big one. Avoid noon time as it's very hot, mornings and evenings would be much better time to visit.

review_title: To see the Merlion Park is to have seen Singapore!
review_content: The Merlion is a symbol that represents Singapore - it's a figure of a Lion sitting on the tail of a mermaid.  As to why and the historical background of all these, do visit the Merlion Park and read up on the historical background of Singapura - the Lion City!  Remember to visit the Merlion Park when you come to Singapore!  Happy Vacation at the Lion City!
Nice sight to see and get some photos. Right on the bay across from the MBS. Get's very busy during the day so try and get there early for photo's if possible.

well this is the real merlion not the one near sentosa island this piece of architecture is awesome and the spout emerging from the mouth is also awesome.well come to raffles place and enjoy a romantic sunset standing near the merlion

The Merlion park has a vast view of Singapore with an immense statue of a the iconic mascot of Singapore, the Merlion.  The view of all the beautiful and tall buildings around the Fullerton Road. The Singapore parliament. The stadiums and the beautifully architecture theatres. The Esplanade Bridge which gives an even better view of the bay. Of course the extremely beautiful Marina Bay sands and the Flier.  Tip: Do visit it at the dusk so that you can get a view of both daylight and nightlights.  This is a must visit for all first time visitors.
Visited this place as must when you visit Singapore . You can have lots of memorable photos with family, inclining marina bay sands. Nice walk and few ice creams to taste
The merloin is iconic for Singapore so at least one time into singapore you must visit. it does allow a good view to the marina bay sans hotel and around the harbour

Merlion is a refreshing site for me considering it blows water from its mouth. Go there by early morning because tourists flock in mid morning till afternoon. It is one of the major attractions in Singapore. You must bring water and umbrella to refresh yourself against heat. I recommend this place for the whole family.

This is iconic of Singapore, a place for all tourist and I do think that this is one of the best place to represent Singapore. So I will bring my guest here to at least visit this Merlion, with that in photos, everyone will definitely know where you are
Walked to see Merlion, it was quite busy when we went there, it's a have to do when you go to Singapore

Sitting on the edge of Marina Bay opposite the Marina Bay Sands Hotel is the famous Merlion Statue (and a smaller version among flower beds). A water fountain feature coming from it's mouth, fantastic photo ops daytime and nighttime. The areas around the Merlion can get very crowded at times but there will be plenty of places on the steps, on the pier, or behind the Merlion to get your selfies or other gorgeous pics.

A must visit place as this is an iconic place in Singapore. You take photos (even though the place is bit crowded) and enjoy the view while eating an ice-cream. It is very easy to come to this place via MRT. The nearest MRT is the Raffles place. There are sign boards on the MRT also where it directs to exit. Once you have got out of the MRT, turn right to Fullerton Hotel side. It’s okay to walk beside the hotel cafe dining. Then after walking straight you will meet the highway. Look for the intersection that can be seen not far from there. At junctions, it sure looks writings One Fullerton building on the opposite side of the road. street toward the direction of One Fullerton, then go down to the bottom of the stairs of the bridge. Down from the stairs you will definitely look Merlion statue.  Once you have visited the Merlion statue, you can walk to Esplanade theater over the bridge which is located on the left side.  There is another large Merlion statue in Sentosa island. But the merlion statue on the main island is the original Merlion statue.

No visit to Singapore is complete without visiting the Merlion and taking a photograph with the face of Singapore Tourism.   Always crowded. The best place to visit in during sunset. The view of Marina Bay Sands from the Merlion is amazing. Lots of places to eat around the Merlion Park
I get here using MRT. Its walking distance from MRT Raffles Place subway station. Very nice place. From here you can also enjoy the light and sound show by Marina bay sands in the evening.

Was having a quick walk around singapore and walk till the MErlion.... wow... it great to see it from near because i always see it from far like through TAXi or on AIR when arrive singapore.   Great Expreience

This is a significant part of Singapore. It is easily accessible by MRT or public transport. A lovely place for an early morning or evening walk. If possible, try to avoid noon time due to the scorching heat.

If you are in Singapore, you must take a picture with the Merlion. It is like going to London and taking a picture with the Big Ben. Situated near the Gardens By the Bay, Singapore Eye and many others.
Can get bit a crowded with happy snappers, but get in and get your pic too! Went at dusk / night. Was a great experience. Baby cub Merlion is here just behind the big one.

Too many people come here, so a litlle bit difficult to take a personal photo. But there are many other attractions can be reached from here. There are raffles site, the asian civilisation museum, and many other. Do not forget to bring hat or umbrella, it is always hot here.
The place was very crowdy. May be because we visited there on a Sunday. The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and place has very good views for good photo shoots.

review_title: Nice place to sit for a while.
review_content: Using the MRT day pass I was able to get within walking distance to the Merlion Park. It was a hot day, aren't they all in Singapore, but being by the water and having the spray from the fountain blowing around made it a nice place to spend a while sitting on the steps people watching.
Nothing much to see except that it is a Landmark site - synonymous with Singapore. Okay if you have free time. Better to visit after 5 pm and from there explore on feet the Helix Bridge.

review_title: Great Location to Visit on your Walk
review_content: Excellent spot to stop and take a photo Buy an ice cream or a cold drink any time Wear comfortable footwear and take a water bottle. Many choices to continue your walk
Singapura as they say, People in Singapore have a lot of faith in their Merlion. Evening stroll can be good in this place.
Good but a disappointing visit as they were cleaning the Merloin and it has scaffolding around some of it.

This is another iconic spot in Singapore. The park in here is really nice perfect for a leisurely walk or to relax. Gets a bit crowded at times as a lot of people comes to take pictures here. I usually spend a lot of time here while my family is busy shopping at Vivo City shopping mall.

The statue of a sea creature and lion mix is the attraction Not worth the stop unless you need a good photo op or desire to see the bay from another aspect  Shopping and eateries along the walk is sparse and lacks appeal

Go check out Merlion either day or night. During the day this place offers great views of marina bay/Marina Bay Sands hotel/Singapore flier etc. I like this Merlion more than the Sentosa Merlion as it squirts water, has a baby Merlion and is free to visit. :)
Must visit this place. Make sute please bring monopod or camera stick because this place teeming with people if you want to get a very good shot pictures.

Hard to visit Singapore without going to Merlion. Not the most impressive sight but it iconic and distinctively Singapore. Great location in the waterfront with plenty of other sights within walking distance.

review_title: It's SO freaking clean, it's unreal...
review_content: Visiting this park is nice because you'll most likely run into a tour. You can listen in to the history of the Merlion - half mermaid, half lion, and what it means to the history of Singapore starting off as a small fishing village. The surrounding buildings and park are so clean. Even the public toilets are clean and modern. The food shops in the food court are a bit pricey, but it's to be expected in this touristy, downtown, popular area. You can get a great view of the casino from here, and the ferris wheel. I was lucky and was able to get great photos without a lot of people in them, even though there were many people walking around. I'm not sure if it was the timing or season or what, but it was great.

Quite filled with tourists but worth a walk through, we did so as we were walking to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and The Gardens by the Bay. We missed the Light show, which we've heard is worth a look, I'd say to visit at night time when everywhere is lit up, far more pretty!

Any one who visits Singapore takes a photo in front of Merlion and probably this can be considered as the mascot. If you expect a huge statue or great views you may be disappointed. During the day, it is quite hot and sunny to be here. During the evening it is quite crowded. We visited on a weekday and around 5pm and hence the crowd was not too bad. Was able to take a lot of photos..
A visit to Singapore is not complete without taking a picture with the Merlion statue. There are many uncles selling ice cream on a hot day. Some cafes nearby also can be relaxing.
except for the merlion itself. there wasn't much to see anyway. Weather was hot and humid and we constantly have to find a shelter to hide.

I've seen the Merlion for the first time years ago in the video "Where the Hell is Matt?" and once I got to Singapore I wanted to see it with my own eyes (I didn't dance in front of it though, if you know what I'm talking about). This symbol of Singapore dates from 1964, when it was created as a logo for the Singapore Tourism Board. Half-fish and half-lion, the creature is meant to represent Singapore's national spirit, its roots as a fishing village and its designation as "lion city" (Singapura). The current statue was unveiled in 1972 by the Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew and currently it sits in the Merlion Park, on a promontory in front of The Fullerton Hotel and near the mouth of the Singapore River. There is a viewing platform from where you can see the statue. Since this is the most recognized symbol of Singapore we were prepared for crowds. It was crowded when we visited in January but it wasn't as crowded as I expected. We went to see the Merlion both during daytime and at night and it was less crowded at night. The view of the Marina Bay Sands across the bay is also very nice.

review_title: A must see when in Singapore
review_content: We walked the bay to reach the Merlion fountain, It is an attraction to both locals and tourists that the traffic of people was so heavy. It is a must see as it is the symbol of Singapore.

Marlin Park  is situated in the business district of Singapore. This is generally part of Singapore city tour, you can directly come here as this is the main and only attraction of the city tour.  This is a picture perfect place with lots of skyscrapers at the background you can click some beautiful pictures.  Nearby is Orchard road, which is a shoppers paradise.  This place would not take much of your time and is in the must see category
The walk towards this park was too long and too hot only to have your photo taken. Getting a decent photo is a struggle with the crowd and heat

review_title: Probably qualify as the mascot of Singapore
review_content: Right in the heart of the Central business district, this apart the iconic half lion half mermaid statue, has a fabulous view of Marina Bay Sands and most of the important towers in CBD. It can be really very crowded on public holidays and weekends.

I was not planning on visiting the Merlion at all, since it's just a token landmark and actually not a park at all. However, I did want to walk around the harbour from the riverside, over the Helix Bridge and back towards the city. This park is at the start of that route, and has some great views across the harbour towards Marina Bay, day and night. Include it in your itinerary as a place to go past, but not to spend time.
Local attraction and a must see while in Singapore.  Easy walking some great views of the area.  lots do do around this area
I wouldn't go out of my way to visit this. If you are near it or it is late at night, go ahead. Really isn't anything spectacular. Mainly a marketing tool and tourists doing the same silly poses.
no direct transportation, not ensough sign or indication for tourist, have to walk a long way, night scene is OK, but just a statue, that is !
Interesting place but be prepared for massive crowds. Lovely views over the river. Every coach seems to stop here!

What you see is what you get. It is the ideal place to be to get an overview of what Singapore has to offer. On one side you can see the city skyscrapers while on the other you get a good look of Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer. Just don't expect to get a decent photo without photobombers because the place is packed with people! Though I think it is best if you visit around sunset and wait until dark so you see the transformation of the view from architectural marvels to twinkling jewels at night.

A small attraction, the Merlion which is Half Mermaid and Half Lion represents Singapore. The Merlion Statues location is what makes this attraction very attractive, the area around it is with high rise apartments and multinational corporation, u really are in the center of Singapore surrounded by its majestic skylines.

I love the feeling of being in this iconic place that I only see in pictures before. I was so amazed to see a lot of people and everyone wants a picture with Singapore's symbol up close. The merlion is so majestic.
The landmark! Should visit if you have time. Lots of tourists, though. Pretty sunny because it is an outdoor spot. Don't forget your sunglasses and sun screen cream.

Loved this Park, real close to where I stayed at the Marina Bay Sands. The statues are detailed and fun to see, and many museums and such are in walking distance. Everyone should take a stroll through this park!

review_title: Now you can see it in Singapore
review_content: This is the symbol of Singapore and is a must see on a visit. There is a smaller merlion behind the one we typically associate with Singapore - be sure and see it.

We often visit the Merlion Park when we visit Singapore and we enjoy it's iconic history and the fusion of new and old in the area with the beautiful old, historic buildings and the classy new hotels. There are heaps of restaurants and cafes to be enjoyed in the area as well.
There isn't much at Merlion park except the two Merlions. We went just for the photo op. Maybe combine it with a trip somewhere else in the vicinity. Not worth the trip just for the statue

We took the train (MRT Bayfront) to visit Gardens by the Bay and nearby attractions around the area like Marina Bay Sands and Merlion Park. As we walk towards St. Andrew’s Blvd, we passed by sites such as Padang Field, Old Supreme Court Building, and City Hall until we finally reached the Asian Civilizations Museum just in front of the famous Fullerton Hotel. Walking some more led us to One Fullerton in which its far end is the famous Merlion Statue, which throws out water straight to the Singapore River. They say you haven’t been to Singapore if you haven’t been to this place – at least this time as far as that standard is concerned, I can claim of being in Singapore. Groups of tourists, mostly Koreans, troop to this spot to have their photo with Singapore’s iconic Merlion. Also overlooking for the statue were equally famous landmarks such as the Esplanade Theatre by the bay on the left and the recently opened Marina Bay Sands at the other side of the river. Amazingly, the sun showed up the entire day, not a trace of rain. I guess I was really heard by God. :)

We did not make it over to the Merlion Park on our first visit a year ago. I must say after being sure to include it on our second visit, we missed nothing but tourist hype!  Stop by if in the area, but don't go out of the way.

review_title: Always crowded but nice view of the river
review_content: Except in the early AM or during storms, the Merlion Park is crowded with tourists and locals who live and work nearby and pass through (or grab an ice cream from the vendors).   There's little shelter at this park so it is often hot between the sun and all of the stone/pavement.   At 8 pm each evening, a laser light show emanates from Marina Sands and can be seen at this park. The show is free, can also be seen from nearby buildings, and lasts for approximately 15 minutes.

No visit to Singapore isn't complete without a photo stop at the Merlion. It can be quite crowded during the day but is worth a visit both day and night. It is a pleasant walk around the whole quay also. On one side you have to towering Marina Bay Sands and on the other the quaint colonial Singapore.
Only thing to see there is a statue, there's nothing fancy about it. Tourists come here only because its a known place in Singapore.

review_title: Merlion statue of a lion's head and fish body so amazing
review_content: The Merlion statue of a lion's head and fish body so amazing. Beautiful architecture designs . My kids like the beautiful view of the Sands hotel.
Enjoyed our time there got some great photos and the went on a harbour cruise really enjoyed it. Well worth the visit.
merlion park is "must visit" place if you come to singapore. this is landmark of ths country. you can see nice view surrounding. i love this place

One's visit to Singapore isn't complete without a photo stop at the Merlion park. It is funny more that people taking funny photos at the park. The area is very clean and nice. We visited the park through a river cruise from Clarke Quay.  The merlion also has a cub in the park.

review_title: Nice place to walk specially at night
review_content: After waking in Clark quay and drink beer and have some food it is recommended to walk in Merlion park at late night . The symbol of Singapore is also there .

Well, you can cover this place the same night you are covering the Marina Bay Fountain show. You have to walk along the sea to cover both the places. Lightening is there to keep the atmosphere live. However, there is nothing much to do but take different kinds of photographs! And if you don't love photography just sit on the stairs along Merlion and may be you can hear the inner voice of Singapore nightlife.
Great place to visit when in Singapore - plenty to see and do .. The Merlion is spectacular... a good day out

Situated on Sentosa Island.. book your tickets online as you will pay more when booking direct.. you can access sentosa cable car from the Harbour Front and redeem your online tickets at Vivo City.. round trip online to Sentosa and Faber Hill around $29SGD pp

Well, who could resist having a picture with the Merlion when visiting Singapore, right? So, this place is crowded with people making all kinds of gestures in front of that statue. It was even more fun looking at the people and how silly they were! Anyway, this is a must stop spot for visitors and with the sights of the Marina Bay, you can't go wrong coming here. Just have to find the right moment to snap a photo with nobody else in there but you. The little merlion in the park was very cute too!

The place so crowded , when I'm there I think I see half of the world because from every country come to take picture. You need patient to take picture with good spot. I like the place because you can enjoy your afternoon sitting and see the view. You also can take many spot of picture like marina bay sand and the river. And of course proved that you have been in Singapore after you come and take picture here....

I came to Merlion Park as of the first day of my visit (ever) to Singapore. I was very impressed. It was a Saturday, but still not too crowded, just enough to feel you're in the right place. The views over Marina Bay Sands and the neighborhood is spectacular. The walk by the riverside is truly amazing and peaceful and you will want to stop many times to enjoy the different views of the Marina.  Tip: at 11 p.m. (maybe other times to) there is a light show from Marina Bay Sands which is beautiful to watch.

review_title: landmark of Singapore, but not special
review_content: The Merlion park is mostly very crowded as it is considered a landmark of Singapore. Therefore the only thing you can find there are busy tourists taking a lot of photos. Not so special at all.
This is Singapore.The symbol.A nice area to hang around.Lots of people.Good to come here in the evenings.A photo to say in Singapore.

review_title: Excellent Views of Marina Bay and Merlion
review_content: December 30, 2015 - While visiting Singapore a few days before boarding our Indonesia cruise, we had to visit Marina Bay and Merlion Park. The Park is a short walk from the closest metro stop and is in near the Fullerton Hotel. There is a reasonable size platform to view the Marina Bay hotel, the tour boats on the Mariana Bay, and the famous Singapore icon, Merlion.   It is a must see while visiting Singapore.
This would be rated higher but for the number of people using selfie sticks.Very difficult to take photographs without sticks appearing in the shot.
There is a reason that this is the national icon of Singapore. An amazing statue/fountain and worth going on your visit - otherwise - have you really been to Singapore?
Why of why I went there, i'm not sure. It didn't cost anything so I suppose that is a treat for Singapore.

review_title: Build a Merlion and they will come
review_content: Very popular and symbolic with Singapore   Get there early if you do not want others in your picture  Great photos to be had
Well if you go to Singapore, make sure you see the Merlion as it's is the symbol of being in Singapore. No tourist tro would be compete without a visit to it.

It is very much a tourist spot for one photo with the Merlion but after that you have done it. The area around is nice with the Fullerton at the back and fantastic views of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel but ultimately once you have seen it, thats it.
Nothing can be enjoyed too much. It just feels not to singapore if you do not shoot the Merlion statue.

review_title: Nice to walk around and snap some photos
review_content: We just enjoyed walking in this area, on a lovely day and enjoying Singapore. Just simple fun. I do not have anymore to say. It was just special to enjoy lovely Singapore.
Great place for pictures, but as expected a lot of people which makes pictures doable but difficult.

review_title: A must-do for any first-time tourist to Singapore
review_content: The Singapore Merlion is one of those simple architectural attractions that becomes an icon for its host city. I wonder if the designer ever knew how popular their creation would become when they first conjured such an image intended to personify Singapore's traditional fishing-village heritage along with the "Lion City" meaning of it's name.  So popular is the merlion statue that there was absolutely no way we were going to get a photo with the merlion without somebody else's body in our photo, so we made-do with what we got and moved-on, but I am so glad after visiting Singapore so many times that I final got to see for myself this iconic statue.
I do not understand why for Singapore, this is considered as a tourist spot. There is hardly much to "like" about Merlion Park, anyways tourists do come here in hundreds !

I was told this is a nice place to visit but I am afraid I disappointed at what's there. You do have the Merlin fountain and you can pick up a river boat tour from here but apart from that, there's not much here. The food outlets here are very expensive. So unless you really want to eat here, avoid.

review_title: Gotta see the iconic white Merlion fountain
review_content: Something you have to see when you're in Singapore: the iconic white Merlion fountain figure.   Highlights: - Intriguing statue - Beautiful view of the Sands hotel - Snacks close by like the famous ice cream sandwich in rainbow bread  Lowlights: - More of a take your picture and go type of thing and need to dodge the big tour groups all trying to do the same thing.  It's cool but think once you see it once, you're good
it was along the park, and we went there early in the morning and the weather was just perfect, the statue was amazing, we have a number of great pictures there, enjoyable experience!
located in the marina bay. very iconic SG statue. easy to locate and nice place to take a cool snap.

review_title: Beware of the rude mainland Chinese tourists
review_content: The merlion has become the tourism symbol of Singapore. With a backdrop of either the Central Business District or the Marina Bay Sands, you can take plenty of selfies, group pics, etc, which makes it a popular tourist spot. Unfortunately, during my visit, there was a bus load of mainland Chinese tourists who did not like to share the view - they like to push people out of there way especially if you are within their camera frame.

review_title: Just a fountain statue but you have to go there!
review_content: Not much here bar the iconic statue, which means you have to go there if you are visiting Singapore for the first time! Great views as well across the bay to the Marina Sands and other impressive building. You can also catch the boats for a river cruise. Don't go there hungry though as the food is outrageously expensive.

The area where the Merlion statue is located is lovely for an evening stroll and for taking in the sights. There is a buzz about the place. Disappointed though that we missed the light show, bad timing on our part

This is the most photographed place in Singapore I guess and it must visiting. It's a crowded place of course however it is not so difficult to wait for the best picture. I recommend to visit this place in the morning (less people) or evening.

So many tourist that it will be a bit hard to take a photo without any photobombers. But then what is a trip to Singapore without a picture with the Merlion? So it might be worth a visit. A good place to have a full view of Marina Bay as well. Go early morning or around 4pm as it can be too hot in the area.
This is an excellent area. Nice view to see Marina bay hotel, Merlion statue, many high building and people.
Had a lot of poses and shots for this one. Even my daughter enjoyed it. After a few minutes of walking here, crossing there, we really had fun!

review_title: Nice area to look at Marina Bay Sands
review_content: Clean park to stroll in and have popsicles. Except for the imposing merlion statue, nothing really out of the ordinary.
This place is the no one tourist spot in town for those of you looking to take selfies with the Marina Bay towers behind you. Place was packed.

Fell in love with the Merlion. A must see unique site in Singapore. Prepare to jostle for photo positions, having strange people in your shots and being in other peoples selfies. Worth a visit, is crowded.
Nice place to visit, noting except the iconic statue of Singapore lion.Must visit as Singapore is synonymous with the statue
Merlion is a guard of the prosperity and has mythical powers to preserve the land. This is a very touristy place and everybody is making pictures!

You have not been in Singapore if you did not visit the Merlion. Stunning and majestic, the Merlion welcomes all visitors to the bay and is now regarded an icon of Singapore itself. The park is clean and well maintained and is surrounded by open-air cafes and restaurants. Perfect for night strolls!

review_title: visit this spot is a must
review_content: Many spots, Many people if you come here in the morning. but too hot at afternoon. You have to come here at least twice, day and evening.

Went there in groups. It sure gives spectacular view. Overcrowd of tourists and sure is hot af and there is limited place to chill. But overall it is good place for sightseeing and take beautiful photos. Basically it represents Singapore, a small country but neat, beautiful and well planned. Every directions from Merlion Park you can see beautiful skyscrapers from perfect angles. It really shows how Singapore tourism has grown into one of Singapore biggest turf.
try to visit on a quite day, that's of Singapore has one, its bedlam, trying to take photos , with out being pushed and shoved, so would not take small kids, amazing sight tho.
You might have seen that merlion in every commercial or photos of Singapore. Because it's the symbol of Singapore. Whosoever visits Singapore also visits the merlion

review_title: Singapore icon which always attract tourists
review_content: Every time my friends or my relatives came to singapore for the first time, they always asked me to bring them here. You can go by MRT and get off at esplanade if you want to go direct to merlion park. The view very great with singapore high buildings background, include MBS and esplanade. One that i always hate here is the weather. It is so hot at the afternoon, so i prefer go there after at least 15.00 p.m. It was great if it is the first time you visit singapore, but you won't interested visit this place many times.
The Merlion Park was a restful place and great spot to take pictures of our hotel across the bay. There are some beautiful flower sculptures and you can take the bay ferry from here.

review_title: One of the must do's in SIngapore
review_content: The Legendary Merlion, with the little Merlion behind it (or in the picture here, in front of it :) ) - one of merlions in Singapore apparently. A tourist hot spot. You haven't been to Singapore if you haven't had your photo taken here, plenty of taxis to and from as well.

review_title: It is must if in Singapore
review_content: It is the icon of Singapore. Nice place to enjoy and take some lovely photograph. Enjoy the cafe and foodies around,
Great view, but overcrowded with tourist. Can just spend some time there to take photos, no need to spend too long

I stopped by the Merlion Park during the morning hours with our tour group. The place was crowed and noisy. They have a few eatery stalls for a quick bite. It was hard to take pictures since there are so many people standing in front of the lion. So, I prefer the bumboat ride to view the Singapore skyline with Merlion in the background compared to the walking tour at the park.
Many people and almost all of them agree, you already visit Singapore when you visit Merlion as Singapore Icon. Nice place with the view of Marina Bay.
One of the places you should come to. A bit crowded with tourists but it's ok. Have many cafe surround it. Also you can take ferry by the river.
Must do night activity. Take the River Cruise for a special lighting extravaganza view from the river. Makesure your camera has a Night Photo Option

review_title: Must visit if your in Singapore
review_content: The icon of Singapore the Merlion is the statue of Singapore great photo opportunity, a must if you're visiting this great city.

arive RafflesPlace MRT station~walk by the river battery Rd, and cross over Fullerton Rd, you may see those beautiful river view, and enjoy the sunlight with the boat on rivers glint surface. and you'll get to the Merlion ~ the great signature of Singapore, you can take photo and mark yourself in this trip. When you stand by the Merlion, you can see the sky park opposite the Marina Bay, also a great photo spot for the architecture!
Always full of tourist.. because u can say that u already visited singapore before u took a pic with this iconic merlion.. :)
Must do when you're in town. However be prepared, it is crowded, quite naturally. 30min is all you need to take some snaps.
Nothing to see but the merlion statue spitting water. There are much better things to see in singapore than this statue.

review_title: Can we change our city icon?
review_content: Paris has the Eiffel Tower, New York has the Statue of Liberty, San Francisco has the Golden Gate Bridge, and Singapore's icon is the Merlion? Can't we have something better? It is an icon created by the Tourism Board, and told as though the Merlion is one of Singapore's legends (it is not). I feel strange whenever I see tourists trying to get their pictures taken with the Merlion. I doubt it is because they find it beautiful, but they've got to show their friends they've been to Singapore. While the Merlion is nothing special, the little park offers amazing views of the city skyline. Whether in the daytime or at night when the lights are all turned on (I prefer the night view), the scenery is beautiful. Singapore is indeed a very beautiful city.

As a symbol of the city it is interesting to visit it, as is in the esplanade, it could be a part of your night walk. In a addition to the statue you will find a lot of people, during the day it is so hot to enjoy it.

This tourist attraction is very colse to the Fullerton Hotel and sit sits directly on the waterfront.  There are wide steps around the back of the Merlion and many people sit and watch the world go by - it's a great view and a great place to sit awhile and watch the world go by. There are lots of eateries nearby and it's a very enjoyable and FREE experience.

Merlion Park located in downtown city near Esplanade. Although more small size than Merlion in Sentosa Island, but for photo shoot it is more awesome because its surrounding another landmark of Singapore such as Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Helix Bridge, Esplanade. So on one frame picture you can get all the landmark of Singapore. The best time to take of picture around 6 PM - 7 PM when sun goes down and the light is up. AWESOME!!!
It is a nice place to visit during the day. There is a statue of the merlion in the middle of a pond and water flows out from it. The location is very pretty and chilled out.

the best place to see Singapore . the heart of singapore i guess . this plase is always crowd usually for the tourist to have a best photo to bring back their country and Singapore believe the water that come out from the merlion mouth its bring luck and long life . night view is more romantic . but for me i prefer on the day time even its hot , but we still enjoy it .
First evening during our visit to singapore we directly went to merlion park to saw the attractions and captured some photos with my wife A night to rememberd
Great city view ... Awesome photo places .. Crowded in the evenings .. Especially during the Weekends !!  The new bridge connector is great..

Before I know Singapore, I have already learned about the Merlion. A mythical creature with a lion's head and a body of a fish. Since, I was young I have dreamed of visiting it. Fast forward to last January 2016, my dream finally came true. I walk for almost half hour to see it face to face. It did not disappoint me. It is well taken cared of. Still so white. Many tourist like me flock to the merlion for a selfie. Located in front of Marina bay Sands. You will have a beautiful sight of the bay, the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands Hotel. It is very clean. Accessible through SMRT Marina Bay Sands Line. You just need to have a long walk to arrive at the very place.

review_title: One of the many statues but this one is 'Singapore'
review_content: Tourist attraction as this is what typifies Singapore..... a mermaid's tail and a lion in a single sculpture. The biggest site of Selfie-Takers in Singapore - and I can't blame them!! Look at the photos on tripadvisor, choose a good one and do your own version. Mine says "who are you looking at?" albeit in front of the smaller version behind ;)
It is 1 of the most iconic places to be and be seen in the whole of Singapore, and you really shouldn't miss the opportunity to experience the magnificent skyline and atmosphere.

review_title: Amazing park and views in the middle of Singapore
review_content: Go for the views and the photo opportunities, but make sure to walk the bridges on either side of the reservoir for one wow vantage point after another.
Who ever come to Singapore if not going to see the Merlion is feelings not been to Singapore. The legend symbol of Singapore so cute and lovely. And can walking along the river, so windy, so fresh.

review_title: The symbol of progress and harmony
review_content: Merlion seems to be guarding the opening of Marina Bay. It has been the mascot or symbol of Singapore. For me, it symbolizes the harmonious relationship between the different races that live in Singapore. It also signifies progress while the City-State continues to strive. A lot of photo opportunities await here. The Merlion, the Mini Merlion, the cafe's nearby, the esplanade and Marina Bay Sands from afar, and the Marina Bay waters, boats and the skyline/CBD.  This park should be missed when you visit Singapore. You are not in SG, or you didn't go to SG if you don't have a photo with it :-)

Was great to see, we were on foot exploring the city so when we visited it was super quite and nice, but not long after, bus tour after bus tour visited, so your experience may very, but nice without the crowds

review_title: Interesting because of the historical significance but way too touristy and crowded!!
review_content: Interesting because of the historical significance but way too touristy and crowded!!  Just packed with tourists taking pics ... I know the Merlion is a symbol of Singapore but it is just not that impressive looking ... especially not with the crowd around it.

Actually I went to Singapore was on 2014 with my boyfriend. And we don't want to miss to take a picture as a souvenir on this symbol of Singapore. We took a boat from the other side that is Marina bay sands shopping mall. It was cool idea to took a boat to reach a Merlion.

Lots of photo opportunities. As well as walking around one can take a boat. They operate hop on/off service. The whole area looks somewhat different from the water. One can seat on the back in the open and catch some suntan.
Great vantage point for taking pictures of Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Most people don't know it has been there longer than the hotel. It achieved its goal of a tourist icon.
Nice place to relax and take photos, Very touristy area. Enjoyed the couple of hours that we had in this area

We walked to the Merlion Park from our hotel. When we arrived, there were a lot of people and not much space to walk and take your pictures alone. It was very crowded and the heat from the sun was very intense. Good thing there were people selling drinks and snacks under the bridge, but those are quite overpriced.
This park was built to welcome visitors to Singapore so it is definitely a must visit area. It is beautifully decorated and you can take amazing pictures with all the scenery.
a great statue of Lion, the symbol of singapore, great place for taking some photos here, and you can visit here 24 hours.  a day for great photos and night for great city landscape views.
if you travel to singapore you have to take photo with merlion in merlion park you can go here is easy just use MRT to raffles place and after that exit fullerton hotel merlion is back this hotel

He is the symbol of Singapore so is a must see. Plus it's pretty easy to get to him as he's at the marina. The reason I say poor merlion is that the builings and structures around the marina seem to be all trying to outdo each other for showmanship and poor merlion has been left behind.
Merlion park is an important tourist place. You can visit this place any time of the day. You can take a cruise ride from this spot and you can find some fine eating places here.

review_title: Must visit the iconic Merlion statue
review_content: If you are in Singapore and not gone to Merlion park, than probably you will get the feeling that your Singapore tour is incomplete. The Singapore always has been represented by the iconic Merlion statue and it is everybody's fantasy to go to Merlion whenever they go to Singapore. So when i visited Singapore my first spot was Merlion. Located near the financial hotspot and Fullerton hotel, the iconic statue overlooks the Marina bay and attracts almost every tourist visiting Singapore. You can see people taking photographs from almost every corner to capture this emblem representing Singapore. Visiting the place will surely give you the feeling that yes you are in Singapore. During the afternoon time when i had visited the spot, it was so hot, so i will probably suggest people to visit either early morning or in the evening. But a must go spot.

I will say you should paid a short visit to this place to view this magnificent structure at night time as all the lighting effect really are wonderful to watch. you be able to take photos and sit near to the sea side to enjoy the view of part of Singapore.

review_title: National Symbol of Singapore a mythical half mermaid half lion!
review_content: 90% of all who visit Singapore, do come here on their first day itself ......  Its an excellent view of business district and bay... mesmerizing at Sun rise time !  has many eateries and tourists can spend good time trying to click the cliché pic which shows water from merlion's mouth falling into mouth of tourists :p
Brilliantly impressive statue which is good for photos of both the that and the backdrop of either the Marina Bay Sands Hotel or the Singapore highrise skyline. Statue illuminated at night.
Nothing special but if you are near you can go and take few pictures there. A lot of tourists there to see a statue that is not even special in eny way. I did not get what was so exciting about it?
Be prepare if you go there during summer or a sunny day. Outdoor place to catch fresh air and relax your day.
The Merlion is a beautiful monument of a great city. Nice to walk around the area and to enjoy the view. Great place for taking photos.
it is surrounded by a spacious platform, which one can use to take memorable photos. marina bay at the backdrops adds to its beauty.

The Merlion is located on Sentosa Island. It was extremely crowded on the day I went, both day and night. The site itself is extraordinary, but it truly a site to behold at night. The statue and the water lights up in various colors, making for a wonderful culmination of a day well spent at Sentosa. Definitely visit the Merlion when in Singapore.
great statue in marina bay near fullerton hotel. visit early in day as gets very busy in afternoon with tourists taking pictures
please go there early morning or after 3 pm cause is quit hot if in afternoon.a lot of people taking picture so better go early
Bring your camera and you can get great shots of the Esplanade, Merlion and the skyline. Very hot during the day. Many tourists around.

Bar none the most crowded spot in Singapore. The Iconic Merlion draws immense crowds at all hours of the day and night, each with aspirations to snap a shot of themselves with either the beast or the amazing skylines. That being said you really need to stop by - this is one of those spots that earns it's stripes!

The Merlion may be an iconic symbol for Singapore, but it falls short of expectation once you arrive. If you go, get there before the throngs of selfie picture taking tourists push you out of the way and the sweltering heat of the city swells into a pool of sweat. Visit but don't have huge expectations of grandeur.
Too crowded for great photo. But it is a must-visit in Singapore. Food is very much overpriced thro :( I spent 15SGD for a hot dog and soda.

The merlion is a great symbol of the cosmopolitan city of Singapore. The statue and fountain itself is dominated and overawed by the high story offices! Still worth going to and always take visitors to see.

review_title: See the symbol of Singapore and the view of the harbour and Marina Bay Sands
review_content: The Merlion fountain is located just in front of the Fullerton Hotel which I understand was the original post office for Singapore. The lion is a large statue and fountain and is visible from many harbour locations. you can board a harbour boat nearby for a tour or visit nearby Clarke Quay.

review_title: Good Landmark, Not Much Around It
review_content: It's a great photo-op for you and/or friends/family. It's the iconic symbol of Singapore which you shouldn't miss it especially if you're a first time visitor.   However, beyond the photo taking there really isn't much to do. During daytime it can get crowded. You don't need to spend too much time here.

Had been several time to be at Merlion Park. Last time was on Feb 2016 at evening around 7pm on the weekend. It was crowded. Something new in this place, there was a dancing laser attraction coming from the top of Marina bay Sands hotel.

Singapore's symbol has a perfect spot for real postcard photos! Both the skyline and the Marina Bay Sands can be seen from here. It's always crowded but with a little patience you can snap pictures without other people in it.
I think it is made for people with kids.. It is like an amusementpark but nothing happens? Everything is fake and plastic and it just feels like nothing..? Or maybe i just dont get it?

We visited this place on 11th February 2016. Its a very nice and a lovely place. We could spend about 30 minutes here. The Merlion is the national personification of Singapore.  The Merlion Park is located in front of The Fullerton Hotel. The Merlion is a combination of Fish boday and Lion Head. The fish body represents Singapore's origin as a fishing village when it was called as "sea town" . The lion head represents Singapore's original name—Singapura—meaning "lion city. The Merlion is female.  Merlion Park, a Landmark of Singapore is a major Tourist attraction at One Fullerton, Singapore. Its a must visit place for all the tourists.
I'd recommend you go at night or when the sun is about to set as it can get extremely hot in the morning! That or bring an umbrella.

review_title: The biggest attraction of my children
review_content: We visited Singapore just because of the Merlion Park as my daughter was dreaming about being there someday.   It was a great experience visiting there enjoying with family and friends.   My Daughter was extremely happy there.   A must visit tourist spot in Singapore.

It's your typical park where you can relax & stroll about the grounds. The shady benches are very inviting and you can people watch while enjoying the view. And of course there's the Merlion and history surrounding the statue that is the big draw here which than points you to marina bay.
It's interesting to see the Merlion up close and take some pictures, but there's not much else here. Don't go out of your way for it.
Iconic sculpture relocated from the riverside to the freshwater reservoir once the Singapore barage blocked the tidal river. Hordes of tourists with selfie sticks if you time your visit badly.

review_title: Cute, but dont go out of your way
review_content: U can seet his from a cross the bay or up close. Nothing g special about it except that it's an iconic symbol of Singapore. The small, mosaic statue nearby is more interesting. Expect lots of people crowding it

review_title: Main sight to see in Singapore
review_content: The merlion has become the iconic symbol of Singapore. Great views from there of the Marina Bay area.

If you are in Singapore go here, take your picture, and find something more fun to do. You will meet a lot of people doing also taking the one picture to prove you have been in Singapore. So just go for it :)

This outdoor park on the Marina Bay is a nice relaxing place at the very heart of the hustling & busting of the Singapore city. The place is free for entry and you can just sit and relax the glittering night view of the entire Marina Bay Business district. There are some good restaurants at the park, who serve quality food – bit expensive though. Overall, we enjoy this place and would recommend this place for a relaxing time.
They've moved this from the mouth of the river because they built a casino. They have spoilt it all I'm afraid

If you visit SG, Merlion is a must. One of the great landmarks in Singapore. The park itself is very clean and has nice view. Needless to say lot of pictures with Merlion are a must. Expect lot of crowd always, so you will need to find a good place for taking pics.

lots of tourist buses and lots of tourist, it was hard to get a decent photo without tons of other people in it. Not sure would be the best time of day to visit to avoid this. But id been to Singapore 3 times before i got around to visiting this.
Holy cow what an awesome place. Every angle, every level what magnificent views. There are so many unique buildings on the the skyline. Very clean surroundings.

Merlion is the earliest landmark of Singapore while Marina Bay Sand is the latest. To get the best view without going to the top of Marina Bay Sands hotel, go Merlion Park and Esplanade. The night view is awesome.
Great place for you to relax. With the view of Marina Bay San and Merlion, it is a great combination. You can enjoy nice weather and nice view from here.
The lights play up very well at this side of the city. There's also a baby merlion at the banks. Place is kept clean and seems safe to roam around. Lots of tourists at night.
People say if you're on SG, it's a must to take a picture with the famous Merlion. So crowd when we get there. A lot of tourist and children from school. Glad we get nice spot for picture.
A must thing to do when you are in singapore... Best time to visit in evening... Take a boat ride in the singapore river and see the view of Merlion park..
The iconic singapore merlion lights up at night with loads and loads of people coming to see it. Good experience.
It is a really nice view along the river, you can see the financial district and Marina Bay. If you go on a cruise in the evening, you can see the highlighted merlion fountain.

review_title: Icon on Singapore and no one could miss it!
review_content: If you are visiting Singapore, you will never be able to tell anyone that you did, without having a picture with Merlion! Go there and spend sometime in this very busy place.
Must visit this place!! You could click lots of different, funny photos with Merlion park behind you!! The park is free to enter.
The skyline is beautiful esp with the bay against the backdrop.. Really ideal for pictures or just relaxing, and as usual, like any place in SG, very meticulously kept

Merlion park is a great place for taking pictures or selfies. Merlion statue and Marina Bay Sands, these 2 iconic landmarks can be captured by camera at once. Best time to take pictures is at afternoon.

This is the main attraction and symbolizes Singapore. In the evening at around 8pm, there is a light and laser show from the Marina Bay Hotel which should not be missed. We get a spectacular view from the Merlion.

review_title: Another must place to visit and take a photo of the Merlion
review_content: We came here by boat as part of the river cruise, nice way to get up close and take some good photos. Stayed at the Fullerton hotel during one trip and walked across the road to in the view.

Probably the best known landmark in Singapore. This park is free to enter and a great vantage point to view the stunning Singapore skyline. Everyone takes a photograph by the stunning MerlionYou can hop on a water taxi close by and head up the river to boat quay and Clark quay and enjoy an astonishing selection of multi ethnic restaurants, cafe's and bars.
Any visitor to Singapore must visit Merlion Park to see the iconic merlion and admire the views of downtown, Marina Bay, the Singapore Flyer and the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.

review_title: Great to know it is back together after being hit by lightning
review_content: Great to know it is back together after being hit by lightning. A place we go back to every trip we make to Singapore. Good views of Marina Bay (not even built on our first trips) and business and waterfront areas.

Iconic symbol of Singapore. The place has plenty man made beauties. The marina bay sands is on the other side of the back waters and looks wonderful from merlion park. Also can see esplanade and the place is nearby clark quay.

Beautiful view of the business city..you can see all the tall builds of major banks of the world on one side and other side you see marina bay. The best use of water as lion is drinking the bay water always. Must go with kids and family for beautiful picturs

This seems to be a spot that attracts many people for photo opportunities of the Sands resort across the bay. The Merlion is a delightful sculpture that defines this part of the Singapore Bay Area! Amusing for sure!
great place for photgraphy, good views all round, you see financial district, Marina Bay, river , everthing around is so good and of course the Merlion

A beautiful place to stroll around especially in the evening when the sun is just setting. There's a beautiful glow in the sky and also subtle lighting in that area makes it a perfect setting for photographs! Amazing modern architecture as well.
Great location for pictures of the Merlion. Another good location is at Sentosa Island but this one can be combined with a walk along the water.
This statue is a iconic of singapore and if you go to singapore..everybody always go there.well..it's just as usual statue..nothing special but it's always crowded here

review_title: Nice Place and Visitors Attraction Place
review_content: Nice Location with attractive Statue. Its very unique place and Its Must Visit Place if its in Singapore.

review_title: Must visit as it's a Singapore symbol
review_content: Came here with my wife as she came here as a child and wanted to get some photos of this symbolic logo. It is smaller than the Sentosa Merlion but this is the original Merlion. It's packed with people and its hard to get photos sometimes. Was worth it though as you do get some good view across to Marina Bay Sands. It is hot (as expected of Singapore) and humid without much shade around.

I was slightly disappointed when I saw the Merlion Park from up close. It was much smaller than I thought and the water was not coming out of the Merlion Lion. In addition, the entire area was closed off. Nothing to see.
You can read the history about the statue slated there. The place was too crowded I would say but yes it is beautiful
A good view of surrounding architecture, spend some time for photographs. But tough if it's a sunny day since there is no shade nearby...
If your in Singapore this is an absolute must. Great place to see the city all around you as well as take some life memory shots. You will love the view.

It's the icon of Singapore. Take picture with the Merlion is a must do. To get here, you make take MRT and alight at Raffles Station or by bus alight at Fullerton. It's the best spot also to see the music & laser show from Marina Sand.

I came in the morning and it crowded already lol. everyone wanna take a snapshot of merlion. so it's just automatically queueing. to the merlion i took bus from boonkeng bus stop since my hostel is located in lavender. over all this iconic place is very good. near every famous places just like esplanade and marina bay.

Great spot to see the Singapore Skyline. Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and you have to see it on your visit. Totally different in day and night, both offers great views. Attraction is free. Watch out for hordes of people who come in busses as part of their city tour.
You can't skip this place if this is your first trip in Singapore. Merlion statue is icon of Singapore. You can take a photo with Merlion park and Marina Bay Sands in the background.

Merlion Park is a popular place in Singapore. It is located in Teluk Marina. The situation of this place is very crowded. Many tourist or citizen spend their time there with their family. Most of them stay there just for taking picture with Merlion Statue and Marina Bay Sands as an angle. Actually in the afternoon, the view just so so. But, in the night the view is very amazing! We can see the lights from Marina Bay Sands and from other building around this place. I suggest you to visit Merlion Park because it is an icon of Singapore.
Excellent place to visit with exciting statue and copy of it and have a great time there and enjoy with statue of the lion.

You can't go to Singapore without seeing the Merlion, the iconic emblem of the country. You can see this statue in the distance as soon as you walk over Helix bridge towards Marina Bay Sands but I would recommend taking the time to walk round to this area 10-15 mins walk) and taking the obligatory magic eye photo trying to catch the water stream in your mouth like the hoards of other tourists!! From there you can easily walk to Fullerton Bay Hotel for a refreshing drink on the balcony which makes a nice pit stop after walking in the sun, enjoy :-)

The Merlion statue is a Singapore symbol. It is half a lion, which a Siamese king allegedly saw there while visiting and half a fish depicting the old Singapore as a fishing village which it was before the economic boom. It is right by the Marina shore with the absolutely best views of the new Singapore landmark - the Marina Sands hotel. Best time to be there is at dusk and at night, specially at the time of the sound and light show (9 PM I think).

The location is very busy and vibrant with hordes of tourists taking photos. Other than that the area is attractive and has shops and restaurants to keep you busy. There is a great view across to the Marina Sands hotel and somewhere to people watch.

A must see for any visitor to Singapore. It is of historical significance and also interesting for the obvious tourist attraction. The photo opportunities in this area abound and are almost unlimited.
This is beautiful place to spend evening in Singapore. It is such a nice and peace full place where you can spend full evening and can enjoy laser show of marina bay at 08:00 hrs.

There are always lots of tourists flocking around this area. They all want to take pictures, mainly selfies and welfies.   The area is very spacious, so the crowds rarely will bother you. The views at MBS and around the bay are beautiful, you can watch the daily night light-suns-water shows from here or board for a river-cruise.

review_title: Great panoramic view of Singapore's highlights.
review_content: I was told by an ex resident of Singapore that I must visit the Merlion statue on my trip. Unfortunately when I got there it was entirely encased in a construction barrier being repaired. Nevertheless the park was nice and relaxed full of locals picnicking and provided a nice view of the bay and iconic sights of Singapore.
This is the landmark of Singapore, smacked right in the heart of the Singapore Central Business District, the surroundings were great... no wonder the place is so crowded all the time.....

Take a visit to the Merlion park it's one of singapores historic stops , lovely by day and night , not too far from city hall MRT station or the tour buses stop here too ,I highly recommend going at night once the lights are on and it's much cooler than during the heat of the day , one extra spectacle would be the marina bay sands hotel light/laser show on every evening (weather dependant) lasts around 15mins and adds to the lovely surroundings .

Ambience is awesome, laser show and music is too good. River boat is value for money. Merlion statue is also OK, nothing much special. But, place is full of tourists so, it makes it a happening place. Street food or food chain restaurants should be there.
it is very nice to come here specially during sunset. because you will see the beautiful scenery of the merlion with the marina bay and lights.these view is enhance by the color of the setting sun.

All the people go to singapore take a picture with the merlion. thats the symbol of singapore. I am sorry but I didn;t find anything extrodinary about this statue. but I did like the view of marin sands bay.

review_title: Cool place to visit when in town
review_content: Another neat place to see while you're in town doing the tourist thing, however I give it 4 stars because it was a bit underwhelming. It's one of those places you go and take pictures, and that's it. There is not much else to do but that. There were many other travelers from China and Indonesia there too taking photos, so it was quite the task trying to get a photo without anyone in the background or a selfie stick peeking into your frame!
This is a very popular location for all tourist. you get to see the Famous Merlion. It also has a good park and location where you can spend a nice evening.

review_title: good experience and explore singapore is the place i go because of the cleanliness organize honest people good service
review_content: good experience to explore Singapore is the best part of our travel with my friends organize and honest people.

This Merlion is the symbol of singapore. So mostly people who visit singapore would like to take picture here with the merlion background. Or we can take picture with the Marina Bay Sands background. Here there are one Starbucks caffee shop below the bridge. Very nice place to have relax and enjoy the view.
You have to visit this area to see the art place sky walk the merloin the city's symbol the fullerton hotel facing this area
you can't avoid people here as everybody wants to take pictures in all angles. But a must visit if you are in Singapore
What time does Merlion stop spitting water in the night? I attempted to take pictures after USS only to find out there's no water coming out of its mouth. Thanks in advance!

This is an easy and fun activity, although it can get very hot as the dock is uncovered and it gets really crowded. After taking your obligatory picture with the Merlion venture under the bridge and cool off with some $10 ice treats. The taxi stand is back up the stairs then down the walkway a bit until you see a Starbucks. It's hard to find but it's the fastest way to get out of there!
Nice views, I forgot to look after the Merlion. Very touristy, but I guess there is a reason why everyone wants to see it.

Easy to get to as well signposted (went by very friendly bus), and was very busy. What beautiful view across the harbour to the gardens and unusual buildings not forgetting the skyline behind with a mix of old and new. Had to make sure we had a picture of the Merlion and had to wait so that the 'selfie' takers were out of the way. There is a new footbridge to use plus cafes so you can spend a short time relaxing with the view.

Your SG visit won't be complete without taking a picture of/with the Merlion. There will be lot's of people who have the same goal as you so make sure to strike a pose and click the button really fast so no one will photobomb you :)
Take a trip in the elevator to the top, have your favourite drink and look at a wonderful view over marina Bay and beyond. Enjoy!
Not really a park but rather a part of the waterfront. However, it is an interesting statue-fountain worth seeing and take pictures of.

review_title: One of the best views in Singapore
review_content: Merlion Park boasts one of the greatest views in Singapore. To the front you have the Marina Bay Sands hotel, and behind you is the grand Singapore skyline. The view at sunset is great. The park itself is fairly small, and it can get crowded, but it's a great place to relax and enjoy the view.
A must see while in Singapore. The Merlion is surrounded by other great sight too. Lots of walking areas. Fantastic bridges to walk across also.
Worth a visit to see Singapore’s national icon. Quite cooling with the water spray down wind from it. Nice views across the bay.
Good place for walk and spectacular photos. Great view of Marina Sand Sky hotel. Definitely worth visiting.
Popular with locals and tourists alike and a great place to visit at sunset, before a stroll to Boat Quay for dinner. A national icon of Singapore and well worth a visit.

The Merlion is a art piece in itself, without even counting the location in which it looks over. The Merlion sits comfortably overlooking the Marina Bay, the Sands in the foreground and city scrappers in the background. As the keeper of the city's wealth, the Merlion is a wonderful sculpture to check out. It looks so beautiful also in the night light.
The most visited tourist place in Singapore, it was good place to visit and enjoyed it very much. Got good pictures and will cherish the trip memories for long time.
Great area to sit and relax, have lunch or go for a walk and take in sights of singapore. All connected to the marina bay walk, so you can do the flyer, marina bay and merlion all together :)
Or so I heard a small child say when I was there! Hilarious! Grab some stunning photos at sunset and in the evening as the light show begins from MBS.
I didn't find it too enchanting, i had a glimpse of it and it was okayish. water flowing out of merilion.

review_title: Very popular attraction even for the locals.
review_content: I enjoyed this attraction from a bus tour where you had 20 minutes to take excellent photos and also from the "Duck" on the river cruise which paused for you to get photos. A very cute icon.

Merlion is way better than I thought. It's bigger than i guessed and the view at night with Marina Bay Sands was really beautiful. In this park has two Merlion; mommy and kid. Yo should find out where a father Merlion is!

review_title: A big lion fish that is the symbol of Singapore
review_content: it is worth walking to merlion park.  if you stay at the Fairmont hotel or swissHotel Stamford, Rafles or other of the multitude of Hotels in singapore then the merlion is pretty well within walking distance either over land or past the multitude of underground shopping enroute to the MRT [mass rapid transit] system. [read train].  the Merlion park is always crowded. I ahve been there a couple of times now and other than very late at night or early in the morning it alwasy has people and cameras. Include merlion Park on your walk around the Boardwalk cirumnavigation of the singapore river mouth (bay?). the distance is about 4 k and takes about an hour. stopping at the Merlion, the Helix bridge and the Marina Bay Shopping complex makes the trip take a bit longer and providies points of interest to make the walk worthwhile. Just past the Merlion is one of cultural arts centres so another destinatio on the same journey.
