It was good place to take a picture.  Everybody needs the picture to remind the tour. So here is nice place for this.
I have no idea why this is an attraction, but it is close to some other sights so you will probably walk by anyway. Dont take a detour though
great spot for seeing the historical merlion, and lovely views , a little difficult to get to so take a map but once there great walks and views of the city

The Merlion is a must see in Singapore. I went there at night so the lights added to the drama and beauty of the place. Bonus for the area are the nightspots and restaurants where business and pleasure combined.
The park is nice for spending afternoon or for meeting point. You can alight for Singapore river tour. Stroll along the riverside from UOB plaza if you are using Raffles Place MRT
With marina bay sands and the waterfront, it has added value to the Merlion. The crowds are crazy a lot of people, tourist with selfie stick. Come on a day good sunshine to get a nice picture.

Definitely a must-see as you walk along the Marina. But keep in mind all the other tourists are there too, so it is very crowded. Try to go early, or at night as it is really nice with the city all lit-up in the background.

Nice skyline from both sides. You will have nice views from the helix bridge as well as from the Merlion itself. Theaters by the bay area amazing with the lights turned on at night. Must see.  There is a night spectacle every evening with fire, sound and laser lights from Marina Sands. Probably the best spot is from Marina Sands, in front of the mall next to the water, but the spectacle is not really good, much better the one in the gardens by the bay

review_title: I don't understand what this place is?
review_content: I get that Merlion Park is a tourist attraction but why? I wouldn't have looked twice unless there was 2000 people standing trying to get a good picture with this.  Not the best Singapore has to offer.

Instantly recongnisable as the symbol of the Lion City. A numerous landmarks are around the merlion at the Marina Bay. Ensure to have a night stroll along the Singapore river, it is an absolute bliss.
All visitors of Singapore come here: nice pictures with the Merlion and the 3 towers of Marina Bay Sands. many people...
The place is very crowded, as expected. But a short photoshoot stop is okay. It is walking distance to Marina Bay Sands.
This is a magical place, with the Merlion. You can see Marina Bay Sands hotel in the background, and there is a long and beautiful walk way to reach this place. The Raffles Hotel is also nearby.

review_title: must visit but nothing to shout about...
review_content: This I guess has to be the must visit place when in Singapore. It is their merlion after all. However don't expect much except for some photo opportunities. A few cafes located about for some drinks or snacks but nothing worth recommending. Does get crowded during peak times.

review_title: Pretty View But Smaller than Expected
review_content: The view on a private boat tour is lovely as you pass by all the amazing architecture and sculptures. However, the iconic Merlion itself is tiny. I think the fake one at Sentosa is bigger. But it's still great to see it to quench your curiousity.
So, when in Singapore, this is just a must do. It's very much a photographed icon of the area, and Singapore. People gather here all day, and night for fun.
A quite touristy place, but good for photos and a nice walk around marina bay. Stop in for an ice-cream nearby to cool down..

Merlion park is a cool little area of the city. It is congested with tourists however and the shops and restaurants in the vicinity are overpriced. We visited on a pleasant day and the statue makes for a good photo opportunity, but that is about it. Seems like one of those things you do while in Singapore- but don't be heartbroken if you miss it.

Merlion park is a must visit for anyone who visits singapore. Best to come here during the evening time as the sunset would present an excellent and picturesque view of the bay area and marina bay sands. Lot of eating places nearby and easily accessible by the MRT. you can also take a ride on the river cruise to visit other places.

Once at the Marina Bay Area you just walk around past the opera house towards the Merlion spouting water into the river. This area is nearly always crowded during the weekends with tourists and locals trying to take 'forced' perspective shots drinking the water. Best time to visit is later in the evening.

This is a must for all going to Singapore, especially for the first time. One of Singapore's most famous landmarks and of course it is free. Á great backdrop of the Singapore Eye and Marina Bay Sands. There are plenty of cafes nearby if you are feeling hot. Great for photos and then moving on to the bay's other attractions.
a must see you can walk but by boat at night is a far better option its so clean and special to look at a great spectacle

it is an ideal dream to see this palace and get pictures from any corner like i have many pictures from all around the lion and then i relax and have tasty icecream relaxly with my friend i strongly recommended this palace to be visited

review_title: There's a Merlion spouting water out of its mouth
review_content: And that's about it really. It does make for some cool photos in front of the odd edifice that is the Marina Bay Sands Resort, but that's it.
Merlion park,I think is a symbol of singapore.it is very interesting and exiting.I recommended to all of people who go to singapore,should visit MERLION PARK.

review_title: A must see just to see the Merlion
review_content: Great place to take the kids was just passing through but the gardens are lovely and it has a great atmosphere! Go up the Merlion to see the harbour just lovely
This place symbolises Singapore...and hence you cant miss it. It is an amazing place to click pics...pics come out great from all the angles...
Another must do if in Singapore, just to say you've been there. Some interesting history to be learned. Worth a few minutes stop and of course on way to the promenade restaurants anyway
Nice to visit.. Great spot to get lots of photo. Slow walk along the river bank from raffles place.. Lots of eatery to choose from.. And dont forget some pose infront of the merlion statue..

The first day we arrived at Singapore we were just looking at the Merlion from across the river on One Esplanade but before heading back to our country we went to the Merlion Park itself. there were so many people which came from different places, it was a good thing that you don't need to fall in line or there is no gates or fees before you can get in. it was really a park (for those who are not aware). the Merlion was really big and the park has a very nice spot for taking photos. views here are very scenic.

Set overlooking Marina Bay, the Merlion is a must see for all visitors to Singapore. The statue was relocated to its current position sometime ago so that visitors could see it more readily. There is plenty of viewpoints nearby. While you are there visit Singapore's 100th Starbucks store which is located near the Fullarton Hotel. Recommended.
The Merlion Park is a nice place to relax coz you have a wide view of the river with Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer in the background. Come befote before dusk so it wont be very humid!
Merlion Park is really nice place to spend a day. Really enjoyed walking and waterfall is simply amazing, has lot of photography there. One of my favourite places in singapore

The Merlion is probably the most famous icon associated with Singapore and I couldn´t think of a better place to take a stroll on a warm and balmy evening in this beautiful city. The views of the Marina Bay Sands and the light shows are spectacular, the backdrop of the Singapore skyline is out of this world and of course who could resist having their photo taken with the world famous Merlion shining brightly for all to see. Can get very crowded but well worth the visit.
So my wife and I decided to go to Merlion. One of the famous place in Singapore. The place was very crowded. From there you can see the Marina Bay sand. Nice place.
Great place to photograph the Marina Bay Sands and the harbour. The merlion the symbol of Singapore stands proudly in the park.

Merlion Park might be overrated for others but come on, your visit wont be complete without meeting him for he is one of the most visited and famous attraction in SG for free.. A great spot for photo enthusiast or simply having a great time with the family enjoying the city..
enjoy the surrounding and make brake at your exploration of singapure. Also nice the lobby of Fullerton Hotel

review_title: The view of the bay is amazing
review_content: To see the Merlion up close is spectacular although this time it wasn't working as it normally has water coming from its mouth. You can get Bumboat rides from here and the area just looks good.
Its just another place to take a few photos really. Not allot going on here just crowds of folks with cameras.

Not only can you get some great photos of the Merlion, the symbol of Singapore, but the photos across the bay to the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands are just as impressive. We went at night just before 8pm and watched the light show from Marina Bay Sands.
The whole area is great fun, for photos, views, location, restaurants, bars, The Raffles, boat trip across the bay

Good for urban night photography or an evening stroll. Nothing much if you are looking for nature photography or activities . The food along the walk can get expensive. Food at Millenia Walk/Suntec City was better priced.

This merlion park is good. When we come here we can make a picture like we drink a water. Many people do this with happiness. If you are here, you can see marina bay sands and also singapore flying too

review_title: The place you need to go when you come to Singapore :)
review_content: It was a great place to visit, but there'll be lots of tourists there. It may be a bit hard to find the right angle to take a photo without them, you just need to be real quick. lol

Wow.. im impressed by the numbers of tourists coming to Merlion Park. As a local, I dont hunt for merlion and somehow this is my first time I purposely find merlion because I go with my foreign friend for photo taking.  Frankly I'm out of words. The scene I see is like all tourists must come to this place if you say you come to Singapore before. Because this kind of scene I see it when I go overseas and I saw many tourists busy taking photos happily to capture the iconic symbol of the country.  Somehow I really like the atmosphere and the Merlion was huge. It is really beautiful spot at the sea and there are nice scenery nearby. I enjoy taking alot photos at Merlion and taking interesting photo spot of holding the water from the merlion.   You will really like here if you enjoy photo-taking. If you are not into photo-taking, maybe this may not be what you like. Because almost all tourist here are taking out their camera and snapping beautiful shots.   Seeing is believing. Hope you all enjoy the trip here.  Cheers
A scenic place within busy city. One can have a look of different attractive spots by boat from this park. Evening is the best time for visit.
It's representative for Singapore. it's a must place to visit if you go to Singapore! You will really enjoy it.
Merlion park is famous long time ago. At this park we can see marina bay. Rest at this park and see a beatiful merlion

You gotta go there because you are in singapore and need some selfies to post on your facebook...   Its not whats in there thats impressive but what you can see from there... you can a beautiful singapore from there...

If there is a one place that will definitely reminds or tells you that your are in Singapore is definitely the Merlion Park. This is one of the most visited and famous spot in Singapore that no traveler could miss this and selfie or picture with it is on everybody's bucket list when in Singapore. The place has a good looking view fronting the famous Marina Bay Sands and Singapore river/harbor and on its side are restaurants and hotels. Best Place to visit during the afternoon or at night.

If this is your first S'pore visit, or if it's your 100th like me - the Merlion is the national symble of Singapore and is a "must see" attraction. There are lots of great photo spots, just check out what everyone else is doing and you can repeat their photo ops. Try to make time to visit twice - once during the daytime and again in the evening.
This is a must visited place if you go to Singapore, the iconic Merlion Statue with an exquisite view of the landscape around it. You can also take a picture of Marina Bay Sands from this area.
Looks really nice but don't imagine that you will be able to spend more then 30min here, it's basically a statue surrounded by hotels.
Nothing too special to look at here unless you like the idea of a Merlion with water shooting out of its mouth.

Even though this Merlion looked much smaller compared with the one in Sentosa, for me personally, it's by far a more reachable and iconic place in Singapore. Maybe it is because the water sprayer that come out of its mouth. We reach this place by taking MRT to Rafles Place Station, and a little walk through Fullerton Street. You can take photograph from any angle with various exciting background while the Merlion still at the center of it. However, you should prepare a cap or umbrella because it is so hot here, especially if you visit it around 10am to 2pm.

review_title: Place where you can see the iconic buildings in Singapore
review_content: Here, you can see many things that are iconic to Singapore, such as the Merlion statue itself, Marina Bay Sands and Esplanade (the durian shaped building). A new bridge called Jubilee bridge connects Merlion park to Esplanade, so you can commute easily between those places. It's recommended to go there around morning to see the sunrise and exercise, or evening to see the lights from the buildings. This is also a good place to watch the firework (during National Day and New Year).
You can never leave singapore before visiting this! Merlion is located at the downtown area. enjoy a peaceful walk from merlion to esplanade to marina bay sands!
The park is a small piece of real estate, but the surrounding buildings make the park attractive. This place is always filled with tourist.

This is a must visit since the Merlion at one point was the only symbol that identified Singapore. We were on a business conference trip with a tight schedule. So not much time left to ourselves. We stayed at the MBS hotel. Its a nice walk around the bay to the Merlion and back. We went there close to midnight. So got a night time and lighted view of the Merlion. Also, there were not many people around. Its a nice place to just hang around. The steps next to the statue is a good place to just hang around and admire the statue.
As you know it was quite normal for us. If I visited night it would have been better experience. Big Merlion was ok but small Merlion was pity...

The lion in Merlion Park is a symbol of Singapore or Singapura -'lion city'.  If you take a walk around the inner harbour, you will come to the park. A popular place for tourists to take photos.  Worth a visit.

Make sure you go at night, the view of Merlion illuminated with the Marina Bay Sands Hotel in the background is stunning. A short walk from Raffle's MRT Station. Lot's of expensive cafes around. Areas to sit and take in the views. The area is full of visitors taking photo's, but not too crowded.

This should be part of any walkabout itineraries in Singapore for first timers. In this general area, one gets a feel of the city as a business hub that is also an Asian tourist attraction. The Merlion is an iconic figure, depicted in countless souvenirs and imageries related to Singapore, and at least you can say you've visited at least one (of the two) Merlion statues.   But you can give it a miss if pressed for time, or if it's not your first time in the garden city.

It is the location where the identity of Singapore stays. Generally the Merlion statue is the key symbol of Singapore. The location is so beautiful with lovely view of many other attractions. An ideal location for photography and selfies.
It's the iconc symbol of Singapore, many tourist struggle for a picture nearby, but it worths a visit only if you consider it as a stop over during the 3.2 km walk around the Marina Bay.

review_title: See the city waterfront both in the day and at night
review_content: The Merlion Park is a must-see for all first-time visitors. A popular attraction for locals and visitors, it is near the Marina Bay Sands Resort, Fullerton Hotel, Esplanade, making it very accessible. One can chill out with a good but relatively expensive afternoon tea in the hotels nearby, and check out the various restaurants for dinner and take a stroll along the entire stretch and even check out the Waterfront Promenade.
When you come to Singapore, where is the 1st place you want to go??? That's is Merlion, this connection with the legend of Singapore. Free place and nice view.
This park is a great place to relax in the middle of your day. It is not too crowded, the marina Bay view adds to the atmosphere. It is very clear and wide. Very recommend.

When in Singapore, you need to come to this place. It is because of this place you recognise Singapore...Merlion....Mermaid+Lion. Amazing view, Great river ride, Great look all around and must visit place

Singapore Icon (half-mermain(fish), half lion) is very famous! It's a must visti spot. We wnent there during the afternoon..It's quite hot, but after few hours (after walking around and eating dinner ), the scenery is spectacular. You can watch the lightshow at Marina Bay sands!
Of course you're not in Singapore without the merlion! :DD Complete your Singapore experience with Merlion and Marina Bay Sands,
Must see in Singapore. By the ocean, a lot of tourists there. A lot of shops around. Close to hotels.
One of must visit attractions in Singapore since it is represent Singapore: Lion sea. Recommended to go there between 7.00pm - 10.00pm. Because they got laser and music show at 8.00pm and 9.30pm.

We went there at around 11.00 pm in the night , there were only a few people, it was quite , calm and soothing experience, unfortunately merilion statue was under maintenance so could not take good pictures with the Singapore Icon
It was very interesting and exciting to walk around the Merlion Park, you will see the modern structures with the old ones.. Downside only is the heat ...

review_title: Much spoken about and hence must visit!
review_content: Everyone talks about the Merlion, so yes, It is a visit to be completed! Looks a lot better at night, and a nice place to click a lot of snaps!
It was very nice walking around the Merlion Park, the only downside is the heat, it was so hot and humid, other than that, it was was very nice

This Merlion represent Singapore, best time to visit this place is in evening, You can witness the beauty of Singapore coming into lights, couple of hours in the evening in this place can take off all the tiredness.....
The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and it is a great experience to visit it. There's heaps of tourists taking cliche photos of them spitting out water, but all that adds to the atmosphere.
In this area, this spot had the most tourist and people taking pictures nonstop. If you are travelling from afar why not stop by here as well. Personally I felt okok only
Brought my German friend who has never been to Singapore before here at night and to our disappointment there was scaffolding around the Merlion. So the pictures he took were not very nice.
This spot must be visiting when we going to singapore because this place is very interesting dan enjoyed place

Skip it. Photoshop a photo instead. We skipped it but accidentally ran into it somehow.   Westerners, go try china town at night and ask for satays, cool outdoor dining and cheap! Packed with locals and expats that know the place, awesome spot to beer, skewer, and see the real Singapore.   Enjoy.

review_title: Okay if you what a selfie
review_content: Far better places to visit in Singapore . The water spitting statue certainly is over rated and I am not quite sure it's even really worth a photo but I am in a minority as loads of people were posing in front of it. This was actually quite entertaining in itself so perhaps it's worth it to watch this . Prices are expensive around the bay .

review_title: Worth a visit after all its one of the symbol of Singapore.
review_content: Evening is the best time to visit. The crowd is awesome all the running groups were around and you will feel health conscious by just having a look at them.
Please visit this place in the evening. Not so hot. Singapore skyline is beautiful especially at night time.

The place just keeps on improving and getting better every year. The bridge connecting merlion and esplanade is a perfect spot to do photos. Make sure you have app such as tinyplanet and include in your backdrop the merlion, sg eye, and marina bay sands all in one. If you get tired and hungry, there are food stalls at the back of esplanade and bus stop.
Always lots of visitors at this statue. Normal to see wedding couples having their photos taken here too. Beautiful statue worth a quick visit.
If you love Art you may gain more from the experience. i'm not a big art lover. its very nice but dont expect anything more that a statue of lion

review_title: Must visit to take your photo against the iconic Merlion
review_content: Easy enough to get to and crowded (since a lot of tourist buses stop here) but people are pretty good about getting the photo done and move away. Few benches and food stalls to enjoy the park - if you can handle the heat.
Mandatory shot happens here. Try to take shots during the afternoon and at night; the overall effect differs.
How else do you prove that you have been to singapore? Entry is free and the view of marina bay sands hotel/singapore flyer is magnificent

review_title: Amazing place for spend your lovely evening
review_content: I stay this place since Lunch time to 9.00 PM No disturbing and happy evening Finally I saw the watering of Lion Face and the Lazzer show of Marina Bay Sand Hotel. There are some place to eat. But, do not buy any beverages (specially Coke etc) in this place. Bit expensive. Foods also more expensive. Just bring them from out. But, under the bridge / tunnel. You can only average cheap foods. (but not beverages at all). But, I had my lunch with that place. Expensive than all other places. But, cheapr than in all restaurants in upper side of Merlion Park. (in tunnel).
This is a symbol of Singapore. It has its own history and so is worth a visit. Other than that it was just a photo shoot opportunity for tourists.
Another area to visit for the Merlion statue and the Panoramic of the Sands park area and skyline. Never a bad sight during sun rise and sunset.

Merlion is a landmark of Singapore – Singapore’s national icon, and the major tourist attaction located near the Central Business District. It’s a half-fish and half-lion statue – the head of a lion and the body of a fish, situated at the mouth of Singapore River. This is one of the most favorite spot for everyone especially tourists to pose and snap pictures.  Most people will say “If you haven’t snapped a picture with the Merlion, means you never really come to Singapore!” hahaa.. Is it true?  I have been to this place for a few times and still find it beautiful. It’s beautiful at daytime or nightime. If you come on peak season, sure you will squeeze with lots of tourists.   So, what can you do here? 1. Snap pictures – Oh, this is a MUST. Snap as many pictures as you can with lots of creative poses.  2. Enjoy the View – Everything around here is worth to see. Marina Bay Sands, Esplanade theatre, Waterfront Promenade, or the Merlion itself. It will be nicer at nighttime if you want to feel the vibe. 3. Eat at nearby restaurant – There’re quite lots of restaurant around the Merlion Park. You can sit there, enjoy your dine and at the same time you can enjoy the viber around Merlion too. It’s fabulous!   Been here before? What things do you like to do when you visit this place?
This was very popular here and you could also get a ride on the bum boats, which is really nice and relaxing and informative on Singapore's history and culture.

unfortunately the statue was semi-covered, I'm guessing for maintenance but we were still able to get some photos along with 100 other people. If you can avoid the selfie-sticks, people taking photos with iPads and posing for 100 photos in front of the statue (I don't know why you need so many of yourself in front of the statue) then it is enjoyable. I think this would be a nice but crowded spot to watch the laser show over the marina.

We can spend hours and hours of time just strolling around the park experiencing the beauty of this wonderful place, we went there and enjoyed the evening sunset, took some wonderful photos and videos to cherish for our entire lifetime.  The Majestic Merlion standing tall and handsome was an absolute treat to our eyes, there is everything for everyone including a fabulous boat ride to enjoy the brilliance of Singapore.  Must visit for all age groups when we are in Singapore, especially children will enjoy a lot and why not? elders will also enjoy this marvelous park, the park attracts visitors with its sheer beauty.

I love to walk around the bay.. seeing SG at night with a nice weather. Merlion is one of my favourite. It is better to see the merlion at night. But somehow, my camera can't be focus to take a merlion picture. But I still love to seeing around. What a lovely night !

Great place to visit during sunset and evening .  It's better to get a taxi to the merlion park . From China town mrt it's around 10sgd . While returning one can search for the mrt sign on the other side of the road and follow the sign to reach the mrt which is at a walkable distance .

review_title: The best Scenic Place of Singapore
review_content: Every one will just fall in love with this Place for sure...The Merlion,The fullerton hotel,,the river..the esplande...the marina bay sands ,,the singapore flyer,,,the high rise downtown buildings....everything is visible from this point.U can't get away from this place without 10 or more pics minimum..Everything is so beautiful about the place...You can have a river safari to enjoy more ...it's bit expensive...
good place to visit as there's a beautiful view of the bay and marina bay sands. but unfortunately its always very crowded so be prepared for that and it will be pretty hard to take pictures there.

Its iconic statue situated in the middle of the city. There are many places nearby and those are at walk-able distance like Singapore Flyer. There is breathtaking view all around. In the night, there are laser show which adds more attraction !!  Loved it when I visited with family in late december 2015.
It is the place to take your picture but a lot of tourists with busses coming non stop. Just take you picture and walk to other areas with much less tourists.

a landmark of Singapore, is a major tourist attraction at One Fullerton, Singapore, near the Central Business District (CBD). Two structures of the Merlion are located at the park. The original merlion structure measures 8.6 metres tall, whilst a Merlion cub located near the original statue measures 2 metres tall
A walk around the park as part of other activities that day. It makes a change from the shops and nightlife and shows another side of Singapore.

Best place to hang out to watch the spectacular view of Singapore's sunrise and sunset.   Before I travel, I would make sure that I have taken note of the entrance fees prior to our arrival. There are online travel sites that indicate tour charges at Merlion Park per person (which I thought were entrance fee charges since it was not clearly stated). I was pleasantly surprised when we got there to see that they do NOT charge entrance fees. And that the best way to reach Merlion Park is through a cab (especially if you're traveling with your family/children).  Check out the weather should you wish to visit there. It is always best to be there on a perfect hot weather.  There are also available boat rides should you wish to complete your Singapore experience. Rates are very reasonable.  No Singapore trip would be complete without the Merlion experience!
It's the representative of Singapore island. I went there when I was young with my family and they speak Singlish which it quite hard to understand

This iconic merlion is very famous and well known for every tourists. You can take the picture at this iconic merlion. Specially if u hang around at night, it has beautiful view with lights from the buildings around
The iconic merlon is a must. It was easy to get to, we walked over after lunch at the Fullerton.One can also hop on to the water taxi.
Really the main thing about this attraction is that it makes a great picture. When I went it wasn't too busy (early morning). Apart from that nothing too special.
Although its Icon of tourism in Singapore, was a little underwhelmed. View around the area was nice though.

We decided to visitthe merlion as itvwas supposed to be shuttered for renovation after the first weekbof january. We went in the evening. You can taxi and its a two minute stroll. Behind the merlion is the cub merlion. Other option is to catch the giant merlion. However this one is the iconic. You can then stroll to espalanade area for a quick bite at the hawker style eating area or one of the many resturants
You can't go to Singapore without getting a picture with the merlion but this makes the place extremely busy and you'd be lucky not to have a few unintentional photobombers in your picture
Nice walk around the bay, clean and there is a good view of the momument + marina bay hotel. Very nice to take photo's

review_title: Apart from the historic value nothing interesting
review_content: If you pass coincidentally it is ok. The best thing about the Merlion is the good view to other attractions of Singapore.
good place clean singapore is very good place ti self lion stachu of singapore is it self good plce must go and see all city with this stachu
yes. i already enter visit in merlion park... i like place in singapore nice <3 beautiful nice.. i love singapore <3

Walk from Downtown MRT - around 15 min; nice view along the river. Crowded, everybody looking for best spot for trick eye photo. Going back thru Esplanade MRT. Recommended to come around after sunset - 6-7pm where the light at Bay Sands already shine; nice view.

View of the Marina Bay Sands was great, Merlion statue was under construction though, so we didn't get a great view of it and fountain wasn't functional. A stopping point if you're already walking around the bay.
Merlion is part of Singapore's history and accordingly a "must see" which also offers great views of various attractions and buildings.

review_title: Only Worth Going Because It's Iconic
review_content: All this is is a fountain. Sure, it's the symbol of Singapore, so that is the only reason I would go. This is in the Waterfront Promenade, so you can stroll around and see the architecture and beauty of the city.

Was extremely tired searching it out.... the nice photo shoot location but was completely drained.... preferable time to visit is daytime... nothing else to offer other than the Merlion.... however, the view around of the surrounding incl. Marina Bay Sands is wonderful.

This is the iconic place of Singapore. If you come to singapore and don't have yourself clicked with the Merlion then no one would believe that you had seen all of singapore. This place is a one time visit. Only good for clicking pictures nothing great here. According to me, it's the most hyped place in Singapore to attract the tourists. Nice place to watch Marina Bay Sands and Singapore skyline at night.

review_title: You are Visiting Singapore so you must see their Merlion
review_content: Yes there are crowds and yes it is just like the pictures, but it is still fun to actually see Singapore's Merlion.

review_title: The bay is an impressive area
review_content: This reclaimed area of Singapore has very interesting architecture very different from the coastline of forty years ago
This site is on the Singapore River and has great views of the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer. and the concert hall known by locals as the big durian. It's worth checking out.
The Merlion is a small statue, but with lots of tourists. Easy access by bus. After seeing the Merlion, you may walk to visit some historical buildings nearby this park.
We missed this place five years ago. So we decided to visit the Merlion on the first day of the year 2016. So crowded with people but we were happy

This destination along the Singapore River and bay is one of the most photograph statues in Singapore. Lots of people and view to highlight any photo taken. But can you find all the Merlions in Singapore? The three we found were, the bay, Mt Faber and the Island.
It is a good place to spend 30-45 minutes of time. Can click nice pics, have some food - nothing else to do here.

The water-spewing lion-fish freak is arguably Singapore's best known kitschy gimmick. Lions never existed on Singapore, by the way. But love it or loathe it, the Merlion has somehow become a national symbol of sorts, even entering into the local lexicon as a euphemism for vomitting.  A towering replica exists on Sentosa Island.

review_title: a lovely place for a picture
review_content: a lovely place for a short stay and a picture. Expected to get a little bit wet due to the splash from the Merlion. A short walk from the Esplanade only, so it's worth going between the shows.

A nice place to walk around and spend an evening. It has good views of the Singapore skyline, an evening Light show, a ferry ride (we missed the latter two) and a few restaurants (over priced) in the park..  The Merlion statue itself isn't very impressive... Even the spray from the mouth was missing on the evening that we visited. The place is overrun with tourists amidst a photo op!I My take - Its a place that you read / hear so much about that not going there is almost scandalous. Go there, spend an evening, take photos and tick it off your list.  I won't be drawn to it again and I doubt you would too!

review_title: Merlion Park and Tower on Sentosa Island great to visit night or day
review_content: Merlion Park is small but very interesting. It has a small movie theatre located inside the Merlion Tower which screens the history of Singapore presented beautifully catering to adults and children of all ages. The tour to the top of the tower is very good and quick but presented so well with special effects and more surprises.  The park itself has a beautiful mosaic sculpture display reflective of the sea similar to Gaudi Park in Spain.

This should be a must on your list if traveling to Singapore. Ensure that you are there in the evening as the lights around create an ambiance which cannot be missed. If possible take a ferry ride and you will enjoy the mesmerizing views.
I came here a few times. one impression: hot and very hot. need good stamina and drink much water to walk around this area. good place for jogging, cycling, and having fun.

Very nice park with a large viewing platform to observe the Merlion. Within walking distance from CBD and Chinatown. We walked there along the river front - one can also view the park from a river cruise boat. Cheers Niels & Mary, Humpty Doo, NT, Australia, Down Under

Nice place for pictures especially on the evening .... With all the lights on .... Against the backdrop of skypark n the glittering city the pictures come just great and after a small walk from there are the food joints with variety of cuisine .....

review_title: How can you miss a Merlion?
review_content: You just have to come see the Merlion. The area is not big and you can just take a photo with it and go. Great view of the Marina Bay Sands, too.

Cool but your girlfriend will take to many pictures and other girls doing the same will contently be in the way. The statute itself is pretty cool but the food is overpriced but that's too be expected at a tourist trap. Don't buy the crab chilidog it's not really a chili on it more like a lite ketchup with crab bits in it. It's really easy to get here by bus especially if you go to Chinatown first and eat the chicken rice there

This is a must see at night time as all of the buildings light up at night and the Merlion is also lit up.   There are many people there but everyone is relaxed and getting photos.  The view is great as you have the bay in front of you! You can walk there or get a taxi there.

I know the merlion is a big attraction, but it just didn't do much for me. It was extremely busy with many tourists and we got our obligatory photo with the merlion, but I wouldn't go out of my way to see it.

Wow what an amazing and spectacular fireworks display. Get there early because there are huge crowds. Amazing spot to view and it's beautiful with the bay and good architecture and on the side of the merlion fountain is where to be. Good security and crowds are polite. 8 minutes of amazing art. Would definately come back again.

review_title: Start your trip at the most famous landmark of the city
review_content: Your visit to the Land of the Lion is incomplete without having seen the most famous icon of the city - the Merlion. Sure enough, it was the first on my list of things to see when I landed in this country. Easily accessible by public transportation (I cannot stress enough about how easy it was to travel here and how well-connected the buses in Singapore are. You might have to change 2-3 buses depending on where you are staying, but it's worth it. I was blown away!)  You can view the Esplanade, the Flyer, the ArtScience Museum and Marina Bay Sands from here and it is an amazing photo op!  (Tip: try to take a photo of the Merlion Park from the other side, i.e., from either the top of the Singapore Flyer or the roof of Marina Bay Sands. You can look at other humans flitting about like little ants!)  The only downside I can think of is that the place is going to be crowded no matter what time you go. But do not miss this one for anything.  P.S: Just make sure you carry an umbrella or a raincoat with you. The weather here is unpredictable and the unexpected showers drenched us thoroughly. You may not mind it at first, but if you're travelling back to your accommodation in either the airconditioned bus or the Metro?! Prepare to look like a drowned rat and shiver miserably!
The Merlion is the Iconic symbol of Singapore and a must take photo when you visit there. The Park is in a perfect place to take in the views around Marina Bay.

Cool lookout over the Marina bay. It has an observation pier for good photo options. It seemed a little convoluted for us to get there because we had to do a lot of crossings and underpass especially due to the barricades put up for New Year's, but it was worth it after we arrived.

This place was so really symbolizes to come. You aren't going yet to Singapore if you dont come to this place. Enjoy the sunset.....take the good picture...refresh your eyes by watching Marina Bay Sands from the other side.
Beautiful view. One of the best spots to take a photo of the bay, specially at night. At 20h they have a water and light show.
This is the icon of Singapore, you can see the Merlion and also enjoy the view of Marina Bay, the park is crowded all the time and you have to be quick for a place to take photo with the Merlion!

review_title: A place to visit to say you have been
review_content: This place is essential viewing for all tourists. And they all go there. You need to take a camera and a phone (with a camera). Also be prepared to take many selfies, so best to have a selfie stick. And finally you need to practise your 2 finger victory pose, both hands, and big grin. Otherwise it's a pretty pointless attraction, neither beautiful nor impressive.
Travelling as a couple we spent little more than half hour here and it seemed sufficient to enjoy the view and take pics...
Merlion is the famous icon for singapore and it must visited when u go here, your trip is not complete if u not go here, u can go here by bus or just take a walk. Many tourist go here.

The location is a Marina Bay side and has the Singapore Land mark Merlion where sea lion facing marian bay sands hotel is continuously pouring water in the Maraina bay best time to visit is early Morning or Evening as the Sun goes down the reflection of the light on the marian hotel helps in good view and you can have exquisite pictures of family and friends it is also surrounded by tall buildings on Fullerton Road which reflects business district.

This is a very popular attraction which has a lot of history Attached to it. It is located next to the beautiful Fullerton Hotel. It's always busy with lots of people. Try early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds. Must see attraction.

Well I'm a local and I must have brought my foreign friends here countless times. And today was no exception. Everyone gets excited the moment they catch sight of the merlion head from behind. I like the sweeping view of the river spanning the esplanade to marina bay Sands with the iconic ship shape to the central business district which makes up the skyline that serves as the backdrop to the merlion. It's a pretty enough place. And there's the spray from the mouth of the merlion when you go close. The cons are that it's usually baking hot during the day and it's not a park, the title is misleading. The whole place is overrun with tourists which is just part of the fun. Hey you came here cos you know it's famous. I'm cool about the crowd, there's always enough space to get a nice photo. :)

review_title: A must visit place but very crowded
review_content: It's good to see the merlion and marina bay sands at the same spot, but very crowded. Hard to take a proper photo without any other people in it. It's just next to the habour with a great view with tall buildings as well - definitely need to pay a visit if in Singapore.
Merlion Park is one of the most visited park in Singapore.. You will see the iconic Merlion near the Fullerton Hotel.. Its accessible by walking, taking the train or a cab..

The Merlion is located in Marina Bay. It is near City Hall MRT or Raffles Place MRT. The view here is very nice. You would be able to see Esplanade, Singapore Flyer and MBS. You would see the Fullerton Hotel and Singapore high rises too. It is free to everyone to visit. Expect a lot of tourist here daily. There is no shelter here so better visit it during a sunny day. There is a new walkway bridge from Esplanade direct to Merlion so prepare to walk a lot during your visit.
If you are in Singapore, you definitely have to visit the Merlion... This crowed place is very pleasant to see all the tourist taking selfies of the Merlion and The Marina Bay
A good place to pass afternoon.You can take so many photos.Enjoy a great view.Capture a photo with all sinpore attractions in one frame.Enjoy a cruise.

Great place to unwind and see the nearby areas through a cruise. The day cruise was great, I am thinking, the evening cruise would have been nice too. Clark Quay and Fullterton hotel look great. Great place for photo ops.

review_title: Lot of hype, very little substance
review_content: Whenever you think of Singapore or see an advertisement of tourism, the first thing you see is the Merlion. I thought this would be a huge thing in Singapore and would be an interesting place to visit. Contrary to my belief this is a very tiny and dirty statue. I don't know why it is he symbol of Singapore. There is nothing attractive about it. Visit but do not spend a lot of time here.

If you want to take Singapore postcard landmarks, this is THE place! The Merlion has always been the icon of Singapore. Now the Marina Bay Sands in the background just made this place more stunning.  Here is a great place to visit either at day or night. A must see!
I've seen this on seperate days both with and without spraying due to maintenance. Its a decent size and worth going to as you also get a good view from this point!
Nothing much than what you see in pictures. A park nearby and some eating joint. However, no 1st time Singapore trip is done without visiting this landmark
If you are in Singapore and Bay area then you have to visit this place. Do go in evening. We saw MBS show from here which was nice but we could not hear the music from this distance.

review_title: Very Touristy But a Must Visit
review_content: Get on the MRT and get off at Raffles and it's a short walk to the Merlion Park. Great place for photos and it's full of tourists as to be expected. Well worth a visit during the day and at night. Amazing views of the downtown area just behind the Merlion and also the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.

Very atmospheric ,you can feel the trade winds,of the Orient and of time swirling around you!Looking south towards Sumatra and the mystery of Indonesia it is reassuring to feel safe and secure amongst one of the newest prosperous and most happy nations of the Pacific Rim!

This was ok. Nice to take photos and so on. But, this is Singapore and all made just to please tourists - that's why I expected even something more! No need to go twice, as in many places in Singapore - you just have to get back there - just because you have to!
Visited the Merlion as part of the Duck tours and it was a wonderful feeling viewing the symbol of Singapore. wish we could get down walk around, take pictures and savour the moment.

The most interesting point of point for photos time, and the water fountain show is amazing, the tower of Merlion spark of many colors at every 10th second, plus the stunning Marina Bay and Garden By the Bay Lightning in the night time. Strongly recommend to go at sunset to night time to get the best view.

This is one of the prime attractions while on Singapore, Other than the merlion, from this place you can see marina bay sands hotel, Singapore flyer, and the riverfront. Try the bread ice cream that you get her.. street food.

review_title: Iconic and crawling with tourist like myself :D
review_content: The iconic Merlion is nice to see. Though the fountain from its mouth was not turned on. Nonetheless it great to see it first time. The Merlion at Sentosa is much much larger. However nothing beats the original :)
Conveniently located at a walkable distance from MRT station raffles place, this place is an absolute must visit .'what an awesome view'

The Merlion is an iconic mythical animal that symbolizes Singapore. Merlion to Singapore is like Eiffel to Paris.  Come and visit this landmark. It can be rather crowded at times. Come early in the morning, or later in the evening, as it gets very hot in the day.

this is my second times in singapore but my 1st to merlion park, unfortunately the merlion at the time did not function as it should be no fountain to see , i almost can't see the under body of merlion (fenced) , the view so great u can see the marina sands and singapore flyer .

Enjoyed but advisable to go in the evening / night and can enjoy the park and the waterfront but when I went the Merlion was closed for renovation and should open by early next year ( I may be wrong).

Come here is a must. This is a major tourist attraction. To take photo with a Merlion. Currently it is still under renovation. But you can still come here to enjoy the scenery. Please bring umbrella just in case rain. Because this is an open space place. To come here in the evening is best . Where you can see lights everywhere.

It is not a big physical place, but its significance is as large as Singapore's History itself. This marks the entrance Sir Stanford Raffles took to arrive in Singapore back in the early 1800s. This was originally place at the mouth of the Singapore River ... a great location, you can still walk over there, it cool and nice, but it was necessary to relocate the Merlion here after a new motorway bridge was erected to ease city traffic. There were many theories that brought about the need for the move, but at its current location, it has a spectacular view with the Marina Bay Sands hotel in the background. At the right time of the year the sunrise will appear right in between Tower 1 and Tower 2. You can catch a great sunrise photo here as long as you arrive before 6:45am.

Good place to grab great photos of the Marina Bay as well as the CBD skyline, especially at night. Always packed with people trying to do the same.   At the end of a nice promenade. Adjacent to the One Fullerton where you can enjoy a number of restaurants and cafes. If it's windy you could get splashed with mist from the fountain.
the merlion is the landmark that defines singapore. it is not just a picturesque place but also has cafes and restaurants
Symbol of Singapore so one should defiantly see it the best way to get there use the Singapore cable car. Gives you wonderful panoramic view of the park.

Merlion park is a beautiful place to take so many picture. We can find so many people come to visited this place and always crowded.and then we can find lion temple.and I like it so much..to take many picture there.
The Statute is very small and not very magnificent as often presented in guides and online.  Worthwhile if you are around to get a photo opp but nothing more than that!
We visited this place on the last day of our trip. Must visit Place in Singapore. Don't return without taking a photo with Merlion . It has a great view .

This is the Singapore landmark that you see in thousands of picture postcards. Merlin park is nice view point to watch mariya bay beach hotel. Specially at night. Though the lion face is an identical tourist attraction it self, there nothing much to wonder about it.

review_title: Must do for the photo ops!
review_content: Is it the best of places in Singapore to visit? No Is it a must-visit place while you are on a short trip here? Absolutely yes! This in short is my review of the Merlion Park. The Merlion statue itself will leave you underwhelmed, but go there for: 1. The must-do photo-op with the most recognized tourist symbol of Singapore 2. Enjoy the Marina Bay Promenade and especially the laser show from MBS (Look up Marina Bay Sands web site for the exact timings of the laser show before you plan your trip) 3. Hop into one of the many restaurants and places to drink nearby 4. Take a boat ride on the Singapore river to or from the Merlion park 5. Walk over from Merlion Park to the Esplanade area  Note that Merlion Park is not a standalone area, it is one among the many attractions in the Marina Bay promenade area and should be clubbed with other activities. There are a number of itineraries that I can suggest, pick whatever suits you best:  a. Starting from Clarke Quay: Get down at Clarke Quay, visit one of the many pubs in the area and get on a boat to the Merlion Park. Time the visit so that you can view the MBS laser shown while on the boat b. Gardens by the Bay -> Merlion Park -> Esplanade: This can be quite a long and tiring activity and will easily require half a day. Catch the sound and light show at Gardens By the Bay --> Walk over to Marina Bay Sands --> Catch a boat from MBS to Merlion Park or take the longer route of walking from MBS to Merlion Park --> If you still have enough energy, walk over to Promenade from Merlion and have dinner at Promenade c. Boat Quay to Merlion Park: Visit one of the pubs in Boat Quay --> Walk over to Merlion seeing the Asian Civilisation Museum and Fullerton Hotel --> Or take one of the boats that come from Clarke Quay --> Go over to Promenade after visiting Merlion Park  So, while Merlion Park itself has nofthing much to offer, it has to be part of your Singapore tour itinerary and club it together with your half day visit to the Marina Bay area!

review_title: Finally I saw my brother Merlion
review_content: Your travel to SG will never be complete without visiting this place. Just roaming around the area you can see various kinds of fish, so colorful. I would like to be back soon in this wonderful place in the world.
to be honest best viewed from a passing bum boat, this iconic symbol of Singapore is good to view, but that takes but a minute, nothing else around it, abutting the bay or harbour

This is the location for getting a good Merlion photo. It is also nicely located on Marina Bay so you can see the Marina Bay Sands hotel complex and also the CBD. You can walk here from Clark Quay area so its definitely worth a visit to take a photo.

This is the place everybody targets to go while in Singapore. Neatly decorated and a place for relaxation, enjoying & celebration as well! I passed a cozy afternoon in a lazy manner though haze was a problem there which affect my photo quality as well. I liked the gathering, atmosphere & food around here.
This is a place to catch a 40 minute slow boat ride. Also the place to take picture with the iconic Merlion.

No visit to Singapore is complete without a photo with one of the few Merlions around the country. The symbol of Singapore taking on the head of a lion and the body of fish originated from Singapore's original name 'Singapura' meaning 'Lion City'
Good photos overlooking the water. Worth the visit to see the symbol of Singapore. We loved the atmosphere.

review_title: Must visit, but the kids didn't like it
review_content: For me it's a stunning showcase of the symbol of singapore against the backdrop of manifestations of its success on all sides.   For my kids (both 12 and under) though it was torturous being under the sun. The ridiculously expensive drinks stall around the area didn't help.
Beautiful.And something awe-inspiring about the Merlion..Great for pictures and photo shoots.Nice place to relax and just sight-see.

Merlion Park is a definite landmark you don't want to miss if you're in the Marina Bay area. The merlions themselves are nothing magnificent, but in combination with Marina Bay Sands in the background, it makes for great photos.  Go in the daytime if you want to be in the photos along with the background (otherwise you'll face some nighttime lighting issues), or at night if you want to want to take some landscape pictures of the lights or to see the light show at 8 PM.
It's a symbol of Singapore..must must visit place..from there u can take view of beach n all..overall nice view

Located just outside the Fullerton Hotel, you can come to the park here to get your pictures of the Merlion statue. This is where you can also come for the best view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and their nightly light show. It was crowded when I was there and assume it's like that a lot since it's a big tourist hot spot. There are a couple of small cafes and coffee shops.

I went here and this served as my last stop for the trail before heading to the MRT. Very few people so I guess that's a plus. I reckon it's better at night when all the lights are on. Directly in front of the Marina Bay Sands and from afar you'd see the Singapore Flyer. Enjoy the nice weather and run around in the morning. Not bad
We were in Singapore again and we did not let it out. Nice attraction, The only thing was not perfect that this time the water jet from the mouth of the lion did not work.

review_title: This whole area is just beautiful
review_content: I'm a keen photographer and the architecture in this area is outstanding. If you even only have an hour to spend it's worth it
Have evening leisure walk in this area .. happening area with music and restaurants around Merlion park.

review_title: Nice place to shoot pics. that's it.
review_content: Merlion resides there and so do a few good restaurants and bars. Historically Significant ? No. But great place to get pics of MBS and surrounding.

Is a a statue of Merlion at the end of Marina bay promenada. I will not consider this a special attraction but rather a small part of the Marina Bay Promenade that is indeed spectacular and definitely worth visiting at day but also at night time.

This is the first image i imagine to visit when i have a chance to get to Singapore, however, it ia unfortunate that on that day, I never saw the flowing water that runs from its mouth. But still I am amaze to see Singapore's image and very fun to see people take pictures and enjoy the view from the bay and also the high rise buildings and tower from the other side of the Merlion.

The name is bit misleading as its not actually a park in fact this statue of a lion/mermaid is right in front of Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Behind the statue is another hotel The Fullerton and some restaurants, bars etc so no park in sight (wonder why they call it that) but the whole area has a really lovely atmosphere especially after the sun goes down and the laser light show from the Sands Hotel.
One of the historic place, bcz it has some history related to this Statue and good view and water front to enjoy the evening

review_title: No matter how many times you have been here...
review_content: No matter how many times you have been here... you would want to come over and over again.... you just cant get enough of the view....
We travelled by day around Merlion Park by boat and visited at night on foot to see the nightlights. Great atmosphere and we always felt very safe.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and the statue is magnificent. There is always a lot of tourists around as well as other people. The area around has restaurants and it is especially nice during evening when they do the light show from MBS.
Amazing lighting on the evening, area clean and nice breeze from the water. Simple just walking distance from orchid. Recommend for noon til evening sightseeing.
This is the landmark of Singapore, somebpeaple said you've never been to Singapore if you was visited the merlion, so many tourist attractions around this area

The park is vast and within it is universal studios. It's very good but not as good as Orlando by a long shot. A small bottle of water will set you back £3 but they do have the odd drinking fountain you can top up with. The transport system in Singapore is the best I've seen. So easy and cheap to navigate. From the airport to anywhere via the train system is fool proof. The light show on the beach is very clever but don't waste money on the expensive seats as the view is not a lot better.
We visited Merlion park during day time as a part of tour & liked it so much we visited it again in the evening for a laser show from Bay sands Hotel.
It is a must see in Singapore. Your camer will be very busy with the many photographs you will take. It has great restaurants in the area and it is very enjoyable walking around the bay.

review_title: Come at night too, for a vastly different experience....
review_content: The Merlion is an iconic symbol of Singapore. It is a beautiful creature- half lion, half fish.   The Merlion Park is located in the city, easily accessible via buses & 3 MRT stations ie City Hall ( this is an Interchange station), Promenade & Esplanade ( both Circle Line).  It is about 10 mins walk from City Hall or Esplanade stations. Promenade is further. It is also accessible via Raffles Place station but harder to find for those unfamiliar with the place.  When out of these 2 stations, the first unique structure that catches your eye is The Esplanade Theatre building ie " The Durian."  Walk towards the direction of the Shenton Way office buildings.   You can't miss these many prominent skyscraper buildings sitting so close to each other. As you walk towards there, you will see Marina Bay Sands on the left. And the Merlion is visible  The night scene & atmosphere is very different from the day. Amidst the coolness & huge expanse of the big dark sky above, the dimly lighted environment and the background of so many beautifully lighted up Marina Bay/Shenton Way buildings 'hugging' each other- one can feel the awesomeness of tranquility, beauty & 'freedom.'   It is a romantic place for couples to just relax & spend time together. We come here regularly just to enjoy all these & spend quality time as a couple.  The many colourful Singapore River Cruise boats plying the bay below with tourists snapping away adds lively colour amidst the dark sea.  Oh yes. There is a cute Baby Merlion just few metres behind the main Merlion. You might missed it in the night as it dim.
Well, you have to see it -- the large spouting merlion statue. The area is well-designed so you can get a nice photo of the front of the merlion with the buildings of the city in the background.
The pretty view of the Merlion and the water around is pleasant. Also the light and sound show from the marina Bay is wonderful to watch.
No visit to Singapore is complete without a visit and a picture in Merlion park...It represents the prosperity and modern side of Singapore.

It has the symbol that is Singapore. The whole setup around the place is great. Its really nice to walk around in the evening. There are ton of tourists throughout the day and there are many great spots to have your signature Singapore photo taken.
If you are travelling with your Spouse, this place gives the feel of romantic evening. Cruise ride also available here.

review_title: Great place but can be difficult to find
review_content: We stopped by the night before National Day which was packed for an apparent fireworks display. Views as expected were great. I didnt have a map or phone and MRT station hands gave conflicting directions where to go when I was describing the view I was looking for. At one point we ended up at the hotel directly opposite. Regardless of the problems, the end result was rewarding.

The Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore, though there are many of these in the country the one opposite Marina bay sands is the most popular and a must visit for anyone landing up in Singapore. The actual name of Singapore is Singhapura, land of lion and being originally a fishing village, the Merlion is a perfect embodiment of the spirit of Singapore with a head of a lion and body of a fish.

If you've the time it's worth a visit for the view but it is a bit sad that the merlion isn't really doing its thing at the moment. I'm not sure when it will reopen but hopefully soon! Having said that, if you're visiting raffles place or the river you might as well pop over because the view is pretty great.

As part of our Singapore city tour, we stopped and was given 20 minutes to take pictures and was told that if we're late the bus will leave without us. Apparently the bus was illegally park to let us off and will just come back to pick us up. We hurried, stop and focus our camera and took some pictures. The day was hazy because of all the smoke coming from Indonesia. The Marina Bay Sands in the background was impressive with a boat like structure on top with growing plants.

When I visited there, the bottom part of famous Merlion was being maintained and could see only the upper part. But it was worth visiting there, as I enjoyed a walk around the bay seeing Marina Bay Sands and its light show. Maybe it would be good idea to take a boat cruise and see Merlion from the different angle. If I remember things correct, the walking path around the bay is about 3.5km or so. If it is not too hot or humid, you can take a walk or jog around the bay, too.

With a spare hour to kill, I wandered over to Merlion Park to see what it was about. The icon of Singapore is a familiar and interesting sight but tends to be only a place where tourists grab lots of photos (and selfies) of the merlion against the backdrop of the city or Marina bay. There's not much else of interest here.

The Merlion is undergoing refurbishment and partly obscured by boards to cover the works. There didn't seem to be much going on so not sure how long this will take. It's still possible to take nice photos, just frame the picture nicely to avoid the boarding.
Nice place to click photos. Beautiful place and you get a nice view of Marina bay hotel as well. Starbucks cafe is nearby.
This represents Singapore as nothing else does. Decent place to go and click photos for memory. Nothing much to do otherwise.

review_title: Best place for a group photo or selfie
review_content: If you have not been to the Merlion park, your trip to Singapore is certainly incomplete. Its a must visit, the signature of Singapore. A fantastic place to recap your visit as well an ending note with a fantastic view and a picture.
Again a good spot for a photo op, however for now the Merlion is under restoration. Do visit the park though as it is bustling with people and a very lively place in Singapore in the evenings.
This is the place where all the tourist coming to Singapore is visiting to see Icon of Singapore Merlion. This is the place which you should not miss.
Nice photo stop on walk around to marina bay sands. Good views of the bay and photo with merlion seemingly squirting water on you is a must! Can get crowded at weekends and at times of light show.
Quite a sight to catch the spectacular view of Marina Bay Sands being guarded by the Merlin statue. Excellent photo opportunities to last a lifetime.
This Mermaid.. Lion is the icon of this beautiful city....sings meaning lion. This is in the centre of the Singapore river. .. Good to see during the boat rides of the river.

review_title: Worth stopping by when the Merlion is functioning
review_content: Merlion Park is located in a picturesque area overlooking Marina Bay. It is a great place to take photos. Unfortunately, on this trip the Merlion was boarded up for restoration and the fountain wasn't on. When it is not being worked on, it is worth a visit to the park to see Singapore's national icon and view the Marina Bay Sands, ArtScience Museum, etc. across the bay.
A must see when visiting delightful Sentosa Island. Many attractions modern and clean environment. Many places to eat and drink, and beach area near by

We have been visited the surrounding area in day and on evening as well. Closely to Merlion you can find nice restaurants. They are little fancy but you may not miss the view on the leg. In the night on o posit side of Merlion you have every evening interesting water show with fire works and movie performance.
We were here mid afternoon. It looked pretty and also cooled the atmosphere down. This place also offers a nice view of gardens by the bay

review_title: Peace n quite while in city
review_content: When I went the water fountain was not on. But it was still nice, you can see the changes in the city, the buildings are facing the bay, take water, umberlla due to hot sun, but. After a long walk the mariner bay mall is great place to get in. Nice n cool, with food, the. Just behind is the mariner bay then gardens.
This is a start attraction of Singapore very close to Fullerton hotel. Millions of visitors throng at this place.

For an iconic, much talked about destination the Merlion Park was a letdown. There is the large Merlion, part hidden behind barrier welcoming you to Singapore and then there was a smaller version so you could pose with it. When we went, around 5.30pm, there was no water gushing out from the Merlion either. That made the display even less appreciable.

Visited here on a free bus tour during a stop over in 2013. Returned again recently and it's still a great place to visit. Nice vantage point to view the light show from Marina Bay Sands from an external location. If you see it from here at 8pm you can then go to the Event Plaza at Marina Bay Sands to see the full show at 9.30pm. Perhaps take a water taxi across the bay? There's also a further show at 11pm on Fridays and Saturdays.

I have always wanted to see the Merlion and evening light show. I have to say it was Amazing a must see if you go. There's a Great fish restaurant right next to the merlion where you can watch the show. Amazing chilli prawns and almost candyfloss like rice! Enjoy.

review_title: gret experience all times of the day
review_content: great area for a stroll along the water front. Great place for food and starting point for river cruises

Don't know what they do and how long will it be. The merlion statue was fenced up for construction or renovation work.   Both the big and small statues were fenced up.   The riverside view of the opposite side looking to marina side is nice.

The main thing I was struck by, upon revisiting the Merlion, was how incredibly small it was - we then realised that my childhood recollection of it probably referred to the Sentosa Merlion which is, of course, much bigger. However, I recommend coming here at night as the city is well lit up and there is a great view across the water to Marina Bay Sands. Better as part of a day of sightseeing rather than an attraction so you're not too disappointed... Raffles isn't too far away!!

The Merlion is probably a must-see, but trying to get a picture is difficult. Plenty of tourist running around in this area. Cannot image any local still goes there. Nevertheless, go there, take a picture of the Merlion and Marina Bay and leave. It's ok.
Its a very good place fir taking photos. Many people there but still not too crowded. Nothing much else to do there tho (there are few coffee shops)

review_title: Singapore is beautiful city. Merlion Park is wonder ful place to visit. You will have joy of beautiful skyview there
review_content: Singapore marlion is beautiful place to visit. Marina bay sands hotel appearance huge from merlion park. There is wonderful skyline walk where i feel relax and reached singapore feel. Love to see singapore again i miss singapore.
I went here during the night and it offered the best ambience. Great photo taking opportunity. Seems like many people go here all times of the day.

This place is a must to visit and take pictures in the vicinity. Even possible is a must to visit the Merlion statue. Every tourist surely love Merlion. A good view of this position may see the building MarinaBS, S-Flyer, etc. It would be interesting at night. Footrest you here.
Its a decent place to hangout and click selfies from different angles would be better i u try this in the night so u could also enjoy the light and the night life

During my stay in Batam and Tanjungpinang have often to Singapore, but this is the first time we vacation together to singapore with my colleagues. First time to marlion park, was very crowded and everything is scrambling to take pictures. Beautiful scenery. Do not miss to stop by the Marlion Park each to Singapore :-)
Been here 20 years ago and it is still amazing. People should definitely see this place and take photos.   Again in my previous reviews, definitely don't miss this area.

This is a nice park where you can take a selfie with the Merlion. The park is clean and has food stalls and restaurants around. Across is a shopping center where you can buy souvenir items. It's a nice place to relax and take pictures with friends and family.
Vow! It was like a dream come true when I visited this place. Lovely location. I would suggest to visit this place in the evening or at night.
Enjoyed evening at this photo-op point. Once you are in Singapore, a photo in Merlion back-drop is must.
Best time to be is in the night when the marina bay sands laser show begins. Good place to take in the views of the bay and the surrounding buildings and architecture.

Lots of people standing around trying to get selfies looking as though they had the water from the fountain going into their mouths. Very crowded and not much to see. Worth going to tick it off the list but if you're strapped for time it can be missed.
A must see attraction. Great place to sit and eat lunch.Many people come to look at this water spouting lion/fish.
The Merlion park is an iconic site in Singapore. I visited from the lake and through the park. A tourist point, some souvenir shops a Starbucks and the view.

Visited this place from nov7-nov11 but on none of the days we get to see the water spray coming out of merlion mouth.  Disappointed that we could not get a click on this signature icon of Singapore.  Not sure how much time will they take to repair it.
Visited Merlion Park, a must do when in Singapore. Apart from the wonderful Merlion, there are great views of Marina Bay sands as well as some great restaurants to visit with great views.
There is only 2 of these in Singapore, one here and one in sentosa island. We went on the duck tour and saw the merlion from there. It's a great icon and a must see whilst in Singapore!

I visit the Merlion as first monument proposal by everyone. It is really nice and special and in front of it we can see the skypark building. I taken with my camera the same picture that i see inside tripadvisor. It is really nice. You can walk a lot and many restaurant are around. I suggest to visit it

Nice windy area to sit and relax with views of big Merlion statue and the helix bridge on one side, tall buildings on other and marina bay sands by the bay.  Note: Try to get at least 1 bottle water since its open area so will be very sunny and a 500ml bottle of water at this tourist attraction will cost not less than $3-$5.
enjoy taking a pictures around the merlion and you can walk around Singapore river nearby or buy Singapore souvenir in the shop near Singapore river.
honestly, had a little higher expectation out it. however it was ok. too small & not really a die to sight.
This place, either by day or night is stunning. The fews are fantastic and you couldn't ask for a better location to watch the sunset or sunrise.
A great spot to see the bay from the opposite side of the marina bay towers, closer to downtown, there are a lot of restaurants, bars and shos to walk around.
You have to come here during the day and in the night! the pictures taken are looking fantastic! a little bit crowed, but it's normal, is amazing place!!!

The Merlion, for so long the symbol of Singapore, is closed for renovation. The whole point of visiting Singapore with kids who are eagerly waiting to see the water spouting lion was defeated. Apparently, the Merlion will open again by November end. We visited on a public holiday (Diwali) and there were enough people thronging the ground. However, all of us returned disappointed.

The Merilon Tiger was temporarily being fixed. The place was overflowing with tourists sometimes were annoying and rude. You might getting a lot of photo bombs when you secure a perfect setting to take a picture. Be prepare to broaden your shoulders to get through the crowds.
Was way too hazy to really see the full beauty. Its also crowded. The haze really took away from my time there, the place seem dull and gloomy.
Very very busy area as its the symbol of Singapore - everyone wants to see the Merlion. Lovely views of Marina Bay - A must see!
It is the landmark of Singapore. The view from here is excellent, but the place is always too crowded.
The view from here will blow your mind! Catch the marina Bay light and sound show from this part of the town

This place is symbol for Singapore country. The best time to visit here is early in the morning or late evening. This place will be crowded at 10.00AM and above. You will see a lot of people taking picture of merlion and marina bay. You can get here by MRT and stop at Raffles Station

Three time visit this place with different year but still this place very atractive, many people just come for take a picture or enjoy the view The icon of singapore, never get borred to visit this place

review_title: One of the Must See Places in Singapore
review_content: One of the oldest attraction in Singapore. It was shifted to this location with much difficulty. If you don't come here, its like not visiting Singapore at all. Here you can see the laser show every night. You get a great view of the sky line of Singapore. With Esplanade on the left followed by MBS, MBFC and all the other financial towers of Singapore. A great place to catch sunrise too.
This is the heart of Singapore. Must visited place in Singapore and there is a great view with marina bay and the Singapore flyer.
The River Cruise is an excellent experience. The history of Singapore's formation was explained in brief while cruising the river.
Good to see from a boat cruise! A quick spot to visit and don't necessarily need to get off the boat to experience it.

review_title: Great View of the 9PM laser light show!!
review_content: Great View of the 9PM laser light show!! You can't leave Singapore without seeing the laser light show from this location!!
The area is called esplanade surrounded by tall buildings with office of multinational financial institutions, banks etc. This is attractive tourist spot and pool crowd from all over the world.
Was hoping to get a photo similar to the one highlighted, but the Merlion was undergoing a cleaning and had plywood all around and no water. Will try next time I'm in Singapore.

review_title: The Merlion is under renovation, so you can only see the top portion. And no fountain.
review_content: On a recent tour, we discovered that the Merlion statue is undetrgoing renovation. You can only see the top third and there is a fence around it. Still a sight worth seeing, but here's hoping they finish the work quickly and get the iconic water fountain back in operation.

Merlion is the most well known icon and landmark of Singapore, so you have to visit this place!  There are 5 merlions in the city and this was is the most well known (apart from the giant one in Sentosa).  Would recommend visiting in late afternoon or evenings as it can be very hot and crowded during the day. There's nothing to do but relax and enjoy the views.  Its free and open till late night.  Nearest MRT - Raffles Place (around 15 mins walk around Fullerton hotel and Cavenagh bridge)

The place is accessible via car, taxi, bus and mrt. It is located in Fullerton Road. If you go to Singapore make sure to visit this place for this is their landmark the Merlion. There in no fee in this place. Souvenir shops are available and food kiosks. The place is across Marina Bay Sands Hotel so it is also a nice spot take take photos of the hotel as background.
The place to go for all tourist. The famous singapore lion head. You may need to fight for a spot or wait for a while before you can take any picture.
Simply awesome and one of the most happening attraction of Singapore. Beware of the Hot and Humid Climate if visiting in day time.
The Merlion itself provides a good photo-op but I personally love the area for an evening stroll. There is also a great line of resto-pubs on One Fullerton.

If you are visiting Singapore you must visit Mythical land mark of Singapore which is on waterfront very scenic, colorful in the evening. This place is good for families and couples for having fun and taking pictures/photos.
The view was great. If you come during end of year, there will be many balloons in the river. It is used to celebrate new year.

Our recollection of the Merlion was of a dramatic structure towering over the harbour entrance. We were slightly disappointed by the present re-positioned Merlion but we seemed to be in the minority as there were many people thronging the structure taking pictures and obviously appreciating the sight.
