We re-visited it at night and lit up, it did look more dramatic. The harbourside site was buzzing at night and the combination of Marina Bay Sands in the background and all the regenerated area presented a very dramatic and now iconic scene.
You don't have to spend a long time here but it is a nice spot for some photos both daytime and in the evening.
Finally found after walking from esperada mrt. In the afternoon people and tourist visit here, taking a picture and do jogging. In the nigh its more better view with marina bay backround and skyflier
Its a nice tourist destination... on the background there is the Marina Bays.. Its a good photo taking place..

review_title: Good place to visit as family
review_content: I am having a walk from Clarke to merilion park .. All stretch is full of restaurants and lot of entertainment activities.. there is a boat ride which starts from Clarke to merilion park.. it is really nice to visit this place if you want to see lighting and nightlife
In the park you can see a few examples of the merlion and it is great for taking photos marina bay sands and the rest of the bay.
Never miss this place when you go here. Its a famous but not overrated place! the cleanliness and elegancy is still maintain.

This is another great place to sightsee while in Singapore. It's by the water and there are some great views, enjoyable both day and night. This is also a great place to walk and people watch. Of course, you'll want to get your picture taken from various angles with Merlion in the background.
Much better at night. Not so hot, and not so crowded. Also you can see the light show of Marina Bay at night

review_title: visit the mythical symbol of Singapore
review_content: The Merlion situated on the waterfront is a great place to view Marina Bay Sands.It is centrally located an easy walk down Singapore river to capture the Merlion. A must visit for the tourists. Great place to get a watertaxi to Marina Bay Sands

review_title: A Nice Evening to Spent Time by the Sea.
review_content: - Beautiful Evening in the Sunset !!!! - Boat Rides are nice in the Night - Lay back with a BEER !!!
Merlion itself is amazing and the view of the marina bay is fabulous as well. Good for a visit in the evening.
Visited as part of a city bus tour, the area was crowded mid-morning with all the bus tours. With no official place for the bus to stop it did feel like we were being rushed.

Your visit to Singapore will be incomplete if you have not visited the Merlion which is the trademark attraction of the City.. The place is really beautiful and you can spend an evening sitting and clicking pictures at the Merlion Park.. You can see the light and sound show of Marina Sands sitting at the park.. Simply awesome...

The location allows you to take excellent snaps with 2 of Singapores most famous landmarks...the Merlion & Marina Bay Sands.  Nice place to spend some time & take some good pics. Good restaurants also nearby.

nice spot to take pictures, was a just 15 mins walking from Boat quay , stand behind the status take a picture with the marina sand hotel in the background and try to capture the flag as well , there is a very nice gift shop just 2 mins walking from the Merlion back statue. try to catch the local ice cream small car , take a ice cream sandwish of coffee (my favorite flavor) and it's only for 1.20 SGB ;)

review_title: Why come to Singapore if you don't visit the Merlion?
review_content: The Merlion statue is the icon of Singapore and has always been a stopover of local tours on the ground and on the water. It is a must-go for first-time visitors to Singapore to take some pics and enjoy the view (both day and night) of the CBD, Fullerton Hotel and the Marina Bay. In the evening the Marina Bay Sands will have a laser and lighting display, and the Merlion Park is the best place to watch it.  Merlion Park is near the city centre and is accessible from Esplanade and Raffles Place Stations within walking distance.  Souvenir shops, restaurants, cafes and ice-cream carts are available in close proximity.
Take a walk around the bay, enjoy the view and appreciate the architecture around you. What an amazing modern city.

Of course, if you come to Singapore you need to see the Merlion and the stunning views on Marina Bay Sands and the whole Marina Bay area.  It is not only nice during daytime, also in the late afternoons when the tourists crowds vanished (well, there are still tourists, but far less than during daytime). Try to avoid a visit at weekends...gosh, you can hardly see anything :-) At the moment (as of October 29, 2015) there is maintenance work for the little brother of the Merlion. Not sure when its back to beauty and ready for some more tourist photos :-)

I have been here many times. Mostly to accompany anyone who visits Singapore from my hometown. Almost everyone around here is tourist clicking lot of photographs. A great city skyline view and MBS view adds to the attaraction.
Great view of the bay and the city. Take a walk around the bay to see both sides, a great way to take in the scenery.

This Symbol of Singapore is amazing . People just come and watch the stream of water flowing out. Place provides one of the best views of Singapore, it's heritage and opulence.Singapore visit would be incomplete without seeing this wonderful monument.
user_location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India

review_content: I finally went there after it had renovation. It looked refreshed! I think it was pretty both in day and night.

The icon of Singapore sits proud by the Singapore River waiting to be photographed. I remember this place 20 years ago - it didn't feel like there were many buildings around. But memory can sometimes be deceiving - maybe there were buildings and I just didn't notice. A must visit to Singapore and Boat Quay is just around the corner for some refreshing alcoholic beverages and food.

This is the MERLION, what else to say? The icon of the city, the Lion. Been here a several times, it's super crowded, probably you can avoid visiting this place at peak hours, you will hardly find a chance to take a good photo as the crowd just crazyy.. During the night this place can be so chill, got a cafe, restaurants nearby, and you can see the MBS across the river (at night there's a laser show, fullerton behind, esplanade walk around. Nice view, a must see place.

The main icon for the Singapore nation, the pride of the city. The Merlion. The government really made the location very strategic which we also can see the beauty of Marina bay while at the park. but sadly during my time going there the haze was very dense and all i see everywhere is the fog. not to mention the heat itself, but when the haze is over i'm sure it will become the most attractive place once more.

This area had changed much since our last visit many years ago. You can walk around this area and view the Merlion and then the Marina Bay Sands on the other side of the water. It is also very pretty at night.

review_title: Good to spend an evening in Singapore
review_content: Great place to get clicked and carrry SGP memories. U can enjoy a cruise ride for USD 25 per adult. Clicking with merlion is free. Lots of eateries around to have dinner.

review_title: A symbolic site of the country
review_content: This is a symbolic site of the country, every tourists will come here when visit Singapore at the first time, otherwise, it seems you never come to this country. It is very clean, many beautiful buildings around, can take many nice pictures here.
Not much to see here except for a boat ride and watch the merlion. I could not find anything awesome there.
its ok. we did the tour that the car drives into the water. that was fun. looking at the merlion is ok. its more fun to go to the places they show you(like raffles hotel)

First things first, the Merlion’s tiny and quite anticlimactic! Because of the breeze, the water spouting from its mouth is sprayed all over a radius, so you’ve to be careful with your cameras/mobile. Still, the promenade offers a nice, breezy walk and stunning views of the Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer.

Good place to see water view reflect with light very beautiful and fresh air. We can see alot of place from Merlion Park like Marina Bay Sands Hotel. .. it make you felling to see something new and different.

review_title: Stunning views of MBS in the morning and in the evenings
review_content: Free admission and a must for photographers who wish to take great full shots of MBS. Sunrise and sunset times are the best but if you are a professional, then when it is drizzling, it is also very beautiful as the entire MBS looks as if floating....  Forget about photography during haze season especially when PIS is above 130 as everything is blurred!
Very touristy feeling. Nothing great is happening apart from the f&b scene. Come, take a photograph with the Merlion and move. The laser show is a joke. Don't waste time on it.

review_title: Beware of not getting your eyes poked out by selfie sticks!
review_content: I would not really call it a 'park', but it is a nice concrete spot by the water, which a kind of quay built so that hordes of tourist can do all kinds of photos with that water spouting lion in the back ... when you are in the area, it is worth a look. I would not make a trip extra for it.

Love the view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Merlion and other attractions. A must-see area. It is a great place to take a long walk and the Shoppes at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel are right there so every upscale shop is accessible, as well as many types of dining options.

review_title: If you don't visit Merlin Park, Singapore visit wouldn't be complete!
review_content: If one doesn't visit Merlion park, where in you come face to face with the Merlion, your visit to Singapore will be incomplete. It's a must visit place and you will love the view of the Bay and the Marina Bay Sands.

review_title: Prepare to fight to get a great pic
review_content: Nice view with the skyscrapers in the background, nice view of the Marina Bay and Esplanade. The lion itself was way smaller than expected. It was very crowded, everyone ttying to get a great picture of selfie. I am sure I was phitographed more by others than my own canera.
Great lace to hang out to watch the sunset over marina bay sands, plenty of locals here too do must be good
What else you want to do if you have not visited Singapore Merlion. Its a memnto that you would be carrying forever. The walk near Merlion is awesome.

review_title: Great location to enjoy spore athmosphere
review_content: The hallmark location of singapore. Just sit and take hours to enjoy your singapore, then take the walk around it, everything u need are already there.

Hard to fault the Merlion Park. A simple tourist attraction in the heart of Singapore that affords tourists relevant information about the statue and exquisite views of the city and harbor. A must for everyone to get a photograph!

No one has ever come to Singapore without their artistic shots with the merlion. We came there on a Sunday and it was packed with tourist. Its hard to find a spot without single tourist on the background.   Tips: Dont go midday, singapore is very hot and humid. Try during 5 to 6 pm. Sunrise in sg usually is around 7pm
It's good place to be if you are around this area. Nothing really crazy to see on the day time. Good view across the marina
This area was great to see both during the day & at night. We went into Fullerton Hotel. Wow, wow, wow....

review_title: It's free and a Highlight to your Singapore visit
review_content: I think many tourists that visit Singapore would agree that taking pictures in Merlion Park is a must. We are reguler visitor to Singapore, but we always come to this spot to take some pictures. Even when the Merlion Tower was being "cleaned" on 2011. To come here, you can take the Green line MRT and alight at Raffless Place station. Go to Exit H and take a walk about 400m to One Fullerton where the Merlion located.
If you want to have a souvenir photo in the Lion City, you must drop here. Suggest to go early morning or late afternoon to night time.

Lots of people and were we got our pics it was pretty crowded, everyone want to get the pic taken in front of it doing strange posses to make it look like they were catching the water, which was funny to watch. But other then that, take sun glasses, the glare can get bad depending on the time of day you go, but still worth it. Pretty impressive statue. And there is even a baby one if you want the kids to get nice pics too. Over all, when we go back, will visit again, if only to get better pics. Plenty of places near by to stop and drink and eat too which is good since it does get a little warm waiting for your turn to take pics.

We visited the place on a Monday morning but still plenty of tourist around the Merlion. We find it difficult to take great photo. :( The view is great! You could see the other famous Singapore attractions around the area.

i was dissappointed when i saw this. it looks better in pictures. when we reached the merlion after a long walk, I asked "so this is it?" it looks bigger and better in pictures. it looks near but it's a long walk from the marina bay sands. not worth it. go straight to the gardens by the bay instead.

They say your stay in Singapore is not complete without taking a snapshot at the Merlion Park.   True enough, it is one of the most popular places here in Singapore for tourists.   You'll have a great unrestricted view of the Marina Bay and sure won't get hungry with the restaurants around the area.   I would suggest to complete your stay with River Cruise to see lots of historic places in Singapore in one ride. Me, I spent a nap time while on the river cruise.

review_title: One of the nicest view in SG
review_content: View by night is beautiful. Park surrounded by many bars and restaurants to make the stay longer and enjoy the view

Thought we were going to go to a park where the merlion was located. Instead we found a few steps and a bridge and a overcrowded merlion. The only benefit was the spray coming off the merlion cooled us down. With seeing if you are in the area and you have 10 free minutes but not worth going out of your way to see
Nice spot by the harbour. I would advise going at night so that it is cooler and you can see all of the lights.
The Merlion Park is a nice place to visit. Obviously Merlion is the feature, but there is a great view of the river and Marina Bay Sands.

Nice little area by the water front for some photographs. The Marina Bay hotel is the other side of the water. Some nice little cafes and Ice cream shops in this area too. Worth while stop to get some nice photos particularly on a clear sunny day!

If you are in Singapore you should not miss this place because this place symbolizes Singapore. We went during daytime, but the place is beautiful even in the night due to the lights and laser show. Surprisingly, the place is always crowded, but still you can take a lot of photos and selfies!!

review_title: It is just a statue,  but so much more
review_content: This site is just one of three locations that have an official Merlion statue in Singapore. It is simply a statue of a lion with a mermaid's tail hence the name Merlion, but the statue added to its location, the views and the ever changing ambience and lighting, just make it quite an exciting place. You can stand and take pictures relentlessly of the skyline and the Marina Bay beyond. We had a lot of haze during our visit, so made several visits to this site to try and get better shots. The evening time even when hazy was best as the lights of the buildings seemed to penetrate the haze much better making a really striking picture. There are lots of things to see and do from this area. You can walk the full length of the river. Cross the bridge and walk to th opposite side of the bay. Just stop off and take in the wonder of it, it is free!
This is one place for Tourist as it's symbolic of Singapore. It's in the City Centre and easy to reach plus you see many wonderful sights

review_title: first impression not great with wheelchair as wheelchair lift apparently not suitable for our electric wheelchair
review_content: After our initial problems with the wheelchair lift, we went around the outside and found the Pelican Bar with great staff, we were there for 'happy hour' so even better. Great chips too. The friendly staff made up for the 'wheelchair lift' problem
This place is important to them. If you are in Singapore you should not miss this place because this place symbolizes Singapore. From this place you can see amazing view.

This is a must go place of Singapore. It is also a crowded place with people taking photos of Merlion. You can also check out views of Marina Bay Sands and the Four Seasons Hotel. It is also good to experience nightlife there as there're a slot of bars along the coast to choose from.  How to take good pics of Merlion: Go to the platform next to the Merlion and try to shoot one. Awesome!

review_title: the creative and unique merlion statue and boat rides
review_content: This is probably the first ever milstone of most singapore visitors.  No singapore trip album is complete without a photo around this place. This is an ideal spot to base the visits to fullerton hotel, observation deck and OCBC gardens and other attractions around. The view of water gushing out of the Merlion`s mouth is creative, unique and a landmark of Singapore. There are boat cruises to Boat Quay and Clarke Quay from here.

The Merlion is the iconic symbol of Singapore. I remember him being in a different location when I was a child, however he looks just as good in his new home in front of the Fullerton Hotel. A great place to watch the laser show from across the bay at Marina Bay Sands.

review_title: Majestic view and a lot of fun
review_content: Bang on the straight of Malacca, and Singapore is known by the Merlion. A wonderful location where one side has newly built Casino overseeing Indian Ocean or better still the Straight of Malacca, while on other side entire downtown of Singapore unfolds. The Esplanade of Singapore is on the third side. The garden around the park adds to the glamour and beauty.  A place full of activities, full of fun with shopping street of Bougis just next corner. A never miss destination and it is worth spending a couple of hours here in leisure.

This is actually not a park in a traditional sense with plants & flowers, and it's not too spacious of an area either, but to be seen while one stands here near the iconic "landmark" Merlion which is on a corner of land bordering the Marina Bay is a panoramic view of the bay with other great "landmarks" on the other corners of land touching the bay such as Marina Bay Sands hotel with the SkyPark on top in the shape of a 'boat deck', Singapore Flyer with the peculiar-shaped Helix Bridge nearby and Esplanade - Theatres on the Bay with two "durians" (or two halves of just one) on top; also, right behind this area is the historic Fullerton Hotel which is on one end of a pretty long stretch of the super tall buildings of the central financial district. And, if you're here in the evening after dark, the feeling is just surreal with everything lit up all around you including the jet stream of water (or part of it) coming out of the mouth of the Merlion! :) Also, to enjoy either viewing from here or from a little distance to the right in front of One Fullerton are laser beams coming across the water from the top of Marina Bay Sands hotel as part of the 8 pm and 9 or 9 30 pm "Wonder Full" show.  One way to get here (the way I did but can't say if it's the best way) by public transportation is taking the MRT to Raffles Place station (green & red lines), then walk about 10 minutes underground and come out of the building on the corner of the boardwalk & Marina Boulevard, and then walk along the boardwalk in the direction toward Fullerton Bay Hotel (and go past it) for about another 10 minutes.
This is a large area to cover so plan for most of a day. The lion sculpture is huge and beautiful and worth seeing. Grounds are beautiful.
The Merlion statue is great. A Singapore icon, you should come to see! Good place to see the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands also. Free and good to relax and see a few sites. Can be crowded.
The whole of Singapore's tourists flock to Merlion park and so they should. 360 degree shot of an amazing city right on the river and again a true must do sight

Masses of people all trying to get a photo of themselves with the Merlion - the iconic sight of Singapore. You must do it, though you will find it hard to just get yourself on the pic. There are wonderful views of Marina Bay from here

Breathtaking! My first visit, I was speechless, my second visit, still speechless. The view is just so awesome, but there's a little problem, this park is always crowded. If you are planning to visit, be sure to have your monopod/selfie stick with you.
It's a Singapore icon. We had expected a much bigger Merlion but it was a very average. Beautiful view of the garden by the Bay and marina Sands resorts.

review_title: A Testament to how far Singapore has come
review_content: The Merlion Park isn't a real park in the sense that there isn't much greenery and it isn't a huge open space. However it is a lovely place to just soak in the amazing view of the Singapore skyline. It is a testament to how far Singapore has come from its days as a small trading port. As the port got busier, the Singapore River got dirtier to the extent that a blind person on a bus would know when the bus is near the Singapore River because of the stench. So the massive operation to clean her up began and took TEN WHOLE YEARS. Today, the Singapore River is clean and the pride of many Singaporeans. You can take a bumboat ride from Clark Quay (or several other pick-up points) which will allow you to enjoy the view of the Merlion from the front as opposed to only its side view from the park.   There are lots of FnB options available at along the riverfront, good places to enjoy a good meal or just chill and watch the world go by.   Later in the evening, there is laser show, best viewed from the bridge connecting the Merlion Park to the Esplanade. After that, you can head to the Esplanade Amphitheater where you can enjoy free performances, usually local gigs.

Visiting Singapore without seeing the Merlion is like visiting London and not seeing Big Ben clock tower! This is a MUST attraction, and you will need your camera, This a landmark not to be missed, Singapore's own unique identity.

Beautiful park with the iconic Merlion Statue with Amazing views of Singapore landscape. Can see the Marina Bay and Sands, Singapore flyer and if you go in the evening can see the wonderful light and music show.
Signature Place to mark you have visited Singapore City. Awesome view of The Marina Bay Hotel and Merlion.

We visited during the F1 Grand Prix and found the attraction to be very busy. That said, the lasr lighting on the Merlion made for some spectacular photo's. Its defintely a recognisable tourism symbol of Singapore and worth the viasit if you hapen to be on the Esplanande.
See the Merlion the symbol of Singapore whilst taking in amazing views of the cityscape. It gets crowded with tourists taking pictures under it though.
one can feel all modern city atmosphere when we just reached this park.all surrounding is worth watching

review_title: Must visit place while in Singapore
review_content: The park offers a walk way from where you get good view of the Marina Bay and the Merlion. The only time to visit is during the evenings when the whole place is lit and you could see the singapore skyline. It would be crowded, but probably the only place in singapore which does not charge for entry :-)
You are not in Singapore before visit Merlion Park. There are so many tourist taking photo here. This is a must while visiting Singapore

Merlion Park   Merlion Park, a landmark of Singapore, is a major tourist attraction at One Fullerton, Singapore. Two structures of the Merlion are located at the park. This is the best place for photography as there are nice view all around in all direction. We were pleased to visit this place.
The symbol of Singapore and that's why, I guess it is the first place we all go to. The statue was smaller than I thought it would be and much less impressive.
Merlion Park is a good place for visitors to hang out in Singapore.It is a very hospitable area with decent eating facilities near by and lovely boat rides are also available.

Singapore has a lot of interesting places. That big ferris wheel. That building with a boat on top. That lion mermaid. Interestingly, this is the place to get a picture of all 3 in one. Granted it's gonna be filled with people, it's still interesting to see a curious statue of an unlikely mixture of animals.  Merlion Park is what it is, a park. You can do most of the things you can do in a park here, but there isn't much else to do.
Singapore trade mark sight seeing...must must visit place to go and get yourself clicked in front of the lion fish

review_title: Symbolise the Lion City the Best out of IT!
review_content: The siganature of Singapore of course to be the Merlion, at the Merlion's park. The beautiful scenic view panaromically portays Singapore the best out of it. Facing Marina Bay Sands completes the scenery.  The best place for photoshoot and suggested to be there by 6.30pm and wait till 7.45pm for the musical light show from Marina Bay Sands.   The best suggested route to get there is through Raffles place, embark at Raffles and walk along the riverside at Fullerton Bay behind the Standard&Charted building.

I was in Singapore in 2000 and again in 2015. The Merlion fountain is a Singapore landmark for me, despite all the changes to the bay over the years. The best view was from a boat in the evening with all the lights.
It was a great night experience at this place. Being so close with this attraction makes your Singapore trip memorable. You can also see the Symphony Lights from this site.
Beautiful park with a water spouting lion sculpture as the center point. A relaxing atmosphere with views in all directions.

review_title: Must watch for night activity lovers
review_content: Nice place to spend evening with family and kids.. There will one or other events to watch and enjoy you time.

A trip to Singapore is incomplete without taking a picture in front of the Merlion. Merlion is a symbol of Singapore with a Lion's head and the body of a fish representing the history of Singapore. It is visible from Marina Bay or even if you take a river cruise from Clarke Que, The view from this place is beautiful.

One MUST see this statue, also try to get a souvenir of it, to remind you of Singapore. You can see it during a boat trip of the Clarke Quay," fascinating trip especially by night".. Get your camera ready..

review_title: Worth seeing both day and night
review_content: If you are passing through the area, it is worth going to have a look at this iconic statue.   At night it is well lit up and provides some nice camera shots.

Visiting Merlion Park is a must for anyone visiting Singapore. The views across the harbour and to the city views are excellent! Just catch the train to Raffles Place and then you are just a 10 min walk away from Merlion Park.

This is the symbol of Singapore, so if you have time you should pop down to get a quick snapshot. Try and get there early as this is a very busy attraction. There are a few places close by you can enjoy a coffee
Beautiful location , well laid and attractive for tourists to indulge in selfies and other pics and must see place.
Here is were you can get the iconic view of the Marina Bay Sands and the infamous Merlion statue. It's also a great walking path along with shops and restaurants.

It is an icon of Singapore hence cannot be missed. We did the typical touristy poses and took our photos here. This is also called as the Mama merlion since it is medium sized, behind is another small one which is called the baby Merlion. The Papa Merlion is the huge one inside Sentosa.

There are better places now, but this is the heart and soul of Singapore. You have to be here while in Singapore. Merlion ....the lion is in the name of Singapore. Good place for photos and to see people from all places here.

review_title: Must see for view, laser show and pictures
review_content: Arrive at dusk or night and plan to be there at 8pm for the light show. Take pictures. Centrally located and within walking distance to Clarke Quay, Raffles hotel, Esplanade, business district, Chinatown, etc.

review_title: Nice place to visit and enjoy the view
review_content: I have visited this place many times and never get bored to take a picture and find every possibly nice spot. And when I got tired, i can just sit on thr restaurant nearby, order some food and drinks and watched the tourists action.

review_title: Must visit place to take picture only
review_content: As signature place in singapore (landmark). this place is must visit place. quite take a far walking to reach this place if you using public transport but still fine. Take picture and go to marina bay sands

review_title: Be prepare for a long walk toward the lion fish
review_content: As far as i know unless you join the tour, there in no direct public transport toward merlion. The best direction is alight MRT on raffles place, exit G or H then follow the water front toward the sea. Or you can walk toward landmark such as marina bay sand, esplenade or singapore flyer. Bring umbrella or hat because its going to be a long walk. And don't forget to try "Ice Potong" (chop ice cream) in the street vendor.

can walk there from Clarke Quay station, just follow the river! Great spot for photos, we went at night and it was awesome lit up, very busy. Looked like there were some pretty cool bars to have a drink/cocktails and snack at on the waterside as well as a Starbucks for coffee drinkers.

This is worth the visit as long as you include other areas like Helix Bridge, Marina Bay shopping malls and shop and eat as you go , make a day of it but don't rush . Start at one side and work around to the Merlion later in the day to see the light show.
A bit convoluted to get too but worth it to capture an image of the iconic symbol of Singapore. The place to do a selfie for sure. Near to many other attractions by the quays.

review_title: One of the Top 10 Things to do in SIngapore for FREE!!!
review_content: You have never been to Singapore if you haven't been to its landmark- The Merlion Park.  Note: It is NOT Mermaid-Lion. "Mer" meaning the sea, the fish body represents Singapore's origin as a fishing village. The lion head represents Singapore's original name--Singapura—meaning "lion city"  How to get there:  Take the Red MRT line to Raffles Place. Walk towards the Merlion Park.

Kitchy, but I guess a must see to any trip to Singapore. It is a little hard to navigate around the Merlion, because you alsways stand in the way of tourists taking selfies or trying forced perspective shots (spitting the water back into the Merlions mouth). At night it is the best spot to watch the Marina Bay Sands light show.
Best to see this early in the morning before all the crowds show up which makes it hard to get photos. We hopped on a marina/river cruise from there and it was nice way to see some of the city.
This area is a place to walk around and enjoy the activities going on, the beauty of the water, and the beautiful buildings. You can take a boat ride on the lagoons whihc was enjoyable.

The Merlion is a Singaporean icon so a visit here is a must to any traveler/visitor. I visited at night so I was able to take a picture of the Merlion and the lighted Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer with the Singapore River.
What the point of it was. A statue that sprays water and loads of tourists crammed in to get a photo. I joined them... but don't really get why.

A trip to Singapore will be incomplete without visiting the Merlion Park at Fullerton. The overall experience was amazing. The view was spectacular. There is a very relaxing feeling when you are viewing the Merlion.  If not for the Haze we would have been able to enjoy it a bit more.

review_title: Good view but not during a Mid Sunny day
review_content: The views from this point are so nice and One can enjoy this spot during Evenings or Early in the mornings. We can expect nice sea breeze and good place for photographers to capture Merlion (Singapore Mascot) and Marina Bay Sands building, and also other Skyscrapers. Not preferable to visit when the Sun is Hot.

The Merlion is a must see and is recognized by most everyone around the world as a Singapore icon. It is in a great location to see the bay as well as the nightly laser light show which immunities from the top of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. There is also a river cruise stop adjacent to the Merlion.

Still as imposing as ever. A trip to S/pore is not complete without a visit to the most icon reminder of your holiday. As soon as you arrive a feeling of serenity overcomes you. I love this monument, I don't know why its just one of those reminders that you bond with for some inexplicable reason. A huge tourist attraction - never without admiring people taking photos of every-which-way.

review_title: Click a pic of the symbolic singapore statue
review_content: Merlion is definitely worth a visit simply because noone leaves singapore without catching a glimpse of the merlion. It is like visiting paris and not seeing the eiffel tower or visiting London and not seeing the big ben or the london bridge.   Plenty of photo options with the marina bay sands hotel and flyer in the background.   Although bigger, Do not settle for the merlion at Sentosa. The merlion near marina bay is what originally represented singapore
SIN's main tourist attraction... the Merlion... A visit for all tourist in SIN... Right by the edge of the river over looking the park & Marina Bay Sands HTL, it's a tourist favourite.
If you're in the Marina Bay area, why not stroll over and see it. It is actually quite big. A Singapore river bum-boat ride will take you past it.
Its a Singapore Flagship. If you are in Singapore and don't visit this, your visit is incomplete.  Excellent picture taking opportunity. Great views
Good spot for views of the surrounding buildings and of Marina Bay Sands. An opportunity for creative photos with the Merlion statue.
This park is located at the mouth of Singapore river. That park faces to the Marina Bay Sands mall and casino. Very crowded place, they come to take a photo with merlion.

Merlion is the symbol of singapore . Singa means lion . And mer means the lower part of the fish . Singapore has made a big staue of Merlion in sentosa island where we can climb up and have a nice Ariel view of the beautiful island . This small Merlin they have it in the Shenton way the main business center facing the prime area of singapore ,the marina bay sands .it has water roaring out from its mouth . At night it is beautifully lighted .it is free and it is a must to take a photo with it before leaving singapore as a souvenir .

review_title: Beatiful Park and Statue at Singapore River Mouth
review_content: This park is located at the mouth of Singapore river. Tha park faces to the Marina Bay Sands mall and casino. The main attraction of the park is the Merlion Fountain Statue. It is very beautiful seen from the bay. I recommend you to take the River Boat Cruise.

want a photo with the fishy-lion. head to the merlion. You will find swarms of tourists trying their luck at getting that perfect picture. Best to go on a windy day or early in the morning to get the best shot and avoid the heat

Nothing much to do here... If you need to take a river cruise and have a photo stop... Very hot during hazy conditions... you have to cool yourself under the bridge .. can be avoided or completed within 10 mins...

The Merlion - S'Pore trademak - is now standing in a pleasant park filled with cafés and restaurant. The merman with a lion head is facing Marina Bay and offers a beautiful panorama on Marina Bay Sands & the ArtScience Museum on the south side, the Theatres on the Bay and its skyline on the eastern side. It is worth going there while being in the area of the S'Pore River. A good time to be there on a clear day is in the evening to watch the sunset colors over Marina Bay Sands skyline.

The park is popular, especially at night. There are great views over Marina Bay and a market like atmosphere. Many tourists taking photos. And of course there is the famous Merlion with water spraying out of its mouth.

Everyone must visit Mention park. The views from the park are good. The hotel over the bay is a splendid building day or night. There are places to lounge and dine, as well as the notorious food court areas.
Best to visit is just before sunset. The view is incredible and you might get the chance to enjoy the show that is happening on the other side.
Well while in Singapore. Definitely have to go see this . Took heaps of pictures a great place to visit . Amazing how theve set this all up  Definitely being going back to visit
It was our first visited place in Singapore. Very nice for a break. Beautiful view to Marina Bay Sand.

review_title: People like to pose in a way close to the Merlion statue and pretend that the water is flowing out of their own mouths
review_content: This area is just awesome to walk around especially around sunset and at night! It has all the lights and the Merlion (1/2 lion and 1/2 mermaid) itself stands in contrast as very white against the darkness! Many people just hang out and sit on the steps,etc and chill. All around are very nice things to see and do. One can walk all around the bay area with various light shows and people performing various arts. This is a place one should not miss as it is one of the highlights of Singapore's landmarks. It is also very close to the Fullerton hotel which used to be an old post office in the 18th century and is now a 5 star hotel.

As the symbol of Singapore the Merlion is a must see. The area can get very busy of an evening before sunset but still possible to get a good photo with the Merlion in the background. There are great views of the Marina Sands Building as well which makes for a good photo. We would have spent about 20 minutes here max.

Its a nice relaxing place.We did the duck tour and it gave us lots of information about Merlion Park and how it came to be.There was a lot of haze when we were there but we could still see across.Nice views all around.

A great place for a holiday, so much to do. Sentosa island, botanical gardens, gardens on the bay, China town, little India, raffles hotel and raffles city mall, hop on, hop off bus and the m.r.t. for getting around, very inexpensive

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore, so this is a must visit, near other attractions, so very convenient. The night time atmosphere is a fun experience. Easy to have a photo taken by another visitor.

This is the original Merlion (opposite to marina bay sands) which has that water spray from the lion's mouth.  Unfortunately, I have to say that the time to spend here is like 30 mins max. Go to Sentosa Merlion instead... its huge there (no water spray from the mouth of lion) + remaining exploration of walkable sentosa "items".

review_title: don't miss to take a photograph here
review_content: The merlion is a Singapore icon and this place offers some panoramic views of the marina bay sands..

Located between One Fullerton and The Esplanade is the Merlion Park. Both stretches of the Fullerton and Esplanade makes for a good walk and various F&B options are available.  The Merlion will be hard to miss when you are there and it is a nice place to take in the surrounding sceneries. There is a baby Merlion behind the huge icon, you might miss it if you're not careful.  You can take the 40min River Cruise from here too.

review_title: The MerLion has died and gone to Heaven because of Asphyxiation due to the Haze.
review_content: The MerLion has died and gone to Heaven because of Asphyxiation due to the Haze. If you are easily pleased by nothing please consider this venue, otherwise avoid.

This iconic Merlion is synonymous with Singapore and it is an unforgettable feature that a visitor should not miss. It's location within a famous tourist area with awesome landscapes makes it easy to access for free. It is one of the must-visit attractions here.

The modern day symbol of Singapore, with direct connection to the name of the country itself. Any trip to Singapore is incomplete without getting a selfie taken with this monument in the backdrop. Easily visible by the Marina Bay, you can take an MRT to this place and take in the grand views of Singapore's skyline in the backdrop.

My family visited the Merlion Park on our recently trip to Singapore. This is where the Merlion is in the heart of the city and where all the tourists go. It is a worthwhile place to visit and take pictures with the Merlion to "prove" that one really visited Singapore. Also, as my family did, one can visit here and take a leisurely walk around the bay to the Singapore Flyer or other places in the marina bay area. All in all, this is a must stop for those in Singapore.

Visit to Singapore is incomplete without a photo shoot near Merlion. The whole ambience is serene and peaceful. Can be seen in its awe from the river cruise. A very good lighting arrangement has been made.
Lovely place to see right in the Centre of Singapore. Could do with more seating but the atmosphere is fantastic

The Merlion itself is not the major attraction here, although it is a strong symbol of Singapore itself so it must be included in at least some of your photos.  This is a famous spot for tourists and the photo opportunities are great all throughout the day. The Merlion itself lights up at night and so does the whole city, and i believe this is the best time to visit this spot.  The daily light show would also be potentially captured at this spot as it is directly opposite MBS. Must Visit Spot. Especially for photography.

I visit Merlion just at the time of F1 Qualification race, which I think isn't really good idea. The park is too crowded, should patiently wait to get good photo shot. Don't forget to watch the laser show from Marina Bay Sands hotel. I think it's around 8pm and 9 pm. One more thing, during F1 race, this place only accessible with MRT. You can stop at Raffles Place station and walk for about 10 minutes.

it is a must visit for anyone who travel for pleasure in this country. We were worry cannot access this place during F1 race, however there are a lot of alternative on how to get here.  WE pass Fullerton under pass to get here from Raffles place

Another lovely view in the heart of Singapore if you wanna get wet sweetly try to go in this area. But sometimes it is hard to find a good photo op because there are so many tourists who would like to take pictures too.
Good photo spot, especially at night. packed with tourists and you have to wait best time for your turn. The place is beautiful with buildings around.

Merlion Park is the Singapore icon.. You shouldn't missed to take pictures with the "Lion". You can't say go Singapore, if haven't some moments here. And you can find uncle who sells traditional ice cream at the bridge. Must try!

review_title: Have to Take Picture with this Merlion?
review_content: Your visit to Singapore wont legit unless you have taken pictures in front of this Merlion.. Well, in my opinion, there aren't so-called best time to visit this park because it will always crowded :) Good luck finding your spot there :D

I visited merlion park at about 5.30pm where sun was about to say bye :-)   At this time the view of merlion, merina bay was simply superb. You get to spend time there until sunset.   Note: No entry tickets required.
This would be part of the Singapore City Tour.An opportunity for a Selfie or Photos with family.Souvenir Shopping available close by

review_title: Focus on the pretty sightsts and avoid the over-commercialised sections
review_content: We went on the cable car and to our disappointment, the place was not so clean, the public toilets not well maintained, the area was noisy and over-commercialised. The food choices available were poor and the beach was unattractive and overcrowded, but luckily, not yet privatised. The pathway with tiled features was lovely and reminiscent of Barcelona and the Merlion monument was impressive. But we had no interest at all on the other show-business entertainment that can be seen anywhere else.
Great and serene place. Go there during the night for more visual satisfaction. The walk going to the Merlion Park is also great. You will walk via the river.
It's a great park ever.. Many people coming to visit Merlin park. The view is good writhing the water area..
If you visit singapore this place I recommend for you to come for take a photo with signature of singapore which is merlion. Beautiful place and lot of tourist.
This Lion statue must be seen at night when it is illuminated by 3 light boxes. It is phenomenal to watch the color changes at the Merlion fountain. Not to be missed. The true symbol of Singapore.
Its a bit overrated but is nice for one time visit. You can see the iconic merlion, the protector of singapura

This part of Singapore is spectacular and we often enjoyed wlaking around there for a drink was sun would set (not that the sunset was any good due to haze) but was nice to see the city light up! Very touristy and busy.

When I go to singapore one olace I feel I must visit is the merlion park...across marina bay sands hotel. Merlion park is a famous landmark in singapore. First time see the merlion and its surround place is a wonderful experience that I get in singapore
Another jaunt out. The Merlion seems to be moved periodically as was in a differnet place to last visit 25 years ago. Still very interesting and looks lovely at night with all the different lights.

Merlion park is a must see place when you are in Singapore for a few days. Finding it may not be as easy as it looks on a map if you are new to Singapore (head to fullertons). Parking is not easy and it is best to use public transport and walk to it. You can’t miss it when the bridge is gridlocked with tourist buses….   Located next to the fullerton boat house starbucks, head down the steps and you are greeted by shops and eateries. Walk under the bridge and you re greeted by the amazing Merlions and a view of Marina Bay Sands hotel.    The Merlions are the emblem of Singapore and therefore it will always be busy but take your time and enjoy the views around the bay and you will capture some nice photos.
Well this is a sight and there is also a viewing platform next to it which you can take great pictures of marina bay. Well worth visiting and there is a lot of restaurants around too.

Once upon a time the Merlion and the Merlion park were the eastern edge of the Singapore city development, facing the sea. Now it sits on en enclosed bay with the Marina development turning it into a historical relic. Good view of the new triple tower though.

review_title: Flat level walking for most of the part. Plenty of restaurants and Cafes (Starbucks)!!!Yayyyy...
review_content: Just lovely, although there was a huge problem with the "Haze" (burn off from smoke from Indonesia) so that there was a big impediment to the views.

We went to the Merlion Park in the evening, during our Visit to Singapore in September. We went in the evening time. Very picturesque with the Marina Sand Bay in the background. Worth a Visit When in Singapore

Well it is a must visit spot since it is the symbol of Singapore. It offers a great spot for clicking pictures of not just Merlion but also Marina Bay Sands. It can be reached via road as well as boat. And it looks much bigger in pictures than it actually is.

review_title: A must ...just for the view of MBS
review_content: Tourist attraction that you really have to do yourself. Great views of the bay and MBS. Plenty of shops and eating places along the way that are the usual Singaporean prices.
This would be one of the best places to get a perspective on the harbour and the Merlion has much character. Access is easy go early 7am to beat all the crowds.

This attraction wasn't quite what I was expecting. It's not to far from Chinatown. Really the only thing there was the statue of the Merlion. However it is in a nice location with Marina Bay Sands across the water so some nice photo opportunities. There are food stalls nearby but I couldn't say how much anything was. It is accessible by foot. I'm sure children would love to have their photo taken near the statue, although you can't get too close.
Merlion Parks is great, Lot of people visit this place. Great view of waterfront and the hotel. lots of eating places.
Very good place to visit and relax. Clean and clear. I have a special feeling for this place because it is like my first memory of my husband. Bring your friends and lovers here to enjoy the sunset.

You probably should go here and take your creative shot with merlion pouring out the water. It's like you've never been to singapore when you dont get to have a picture with the iconic merlion. But it's always crowded and you have to be patient for you to have a great photo with merlion. Best to visit at night.

review_title: Good - if you haven't been to Marina Bay before
review_content: Indeed a nice view around the Marina Bay. But once coming to Singapore and seeing the bay and hear about the "Park", you'd expect something more. Good for evening strolls, especially with the lights all around, yet once you've been there, you've seen it. Notice that we are actually very rarely going to Marina Bay / Merlion Park since we are living in Singapore

review_title: A must see if in Singapore
review_content: It is perhaps the most iconic place of Singapore! The merlion is a proud national symbol and one can find oneself always coming in the frame of someone trying to get a perfect picture clicked !  The place is well maintained and beautiful, and offers a great view of the Marina Bay Sands and other important tourist attractions across the bay.  The large number of cafe along the waterfront offer a nice relaxing ambience for a beer with friends
It is worth to go and take walk along the Marina Bay. Sands is there with mall and casino, you could find lovely cafe inside !
Great view overlooking marina bay sands building with the big lion spitting out thousands of gallons of water into the Singapore river and all the other beautiful buildings on the rivers edge
A bunch of tourists taking unoriginal selfies in front of the statue. Not really worth visiting, unless you absolutely want to delight your facebook friends with said selfies.

Merilion statue on Merilion Park. Near Marina Bay, you could clearly see Marina Bay Hotel from this area. It is always crowded in the afternoon. So, you must visit this site in the morning if you really want to take a picture or picture of yourself with no "noise" from other visitor.
A crowd puller. Always full of people clicking there memorable shoots witless merlion. We did enjoy making memories here.
One of the most famous signature places of Singapore is the Merlin thing.  Nice place in the evening. Walk around and have fun
This is the first tourist attraction that I went to the day after I arrived in Singapore. There are 2 merlions so you can take selfie pics from the smaller version of Merlion.
It is a must to come here when you come to Singapore!!! The area gives a good vibe. It is covered with tons of tourists though.
It is quite a picturesque spot. You just take a few photos and continue to other attractions or relax for a while. Either way worth keeping it in the itinerary.
Beautiful view of the entire river and marina bay sands with prominent buildings in the backdrop, this place is for picture perfect setting and a must to visit whilst in Singapore

review_title: It just had to be done
review_content: On our way out to the marina bay gardens we stopped to grab a few pictures and selfies here with the merlion. Added value for us was that our hotel for the stay was in the background - the Fullerton

review_title: Worth stopping off for a cold drink
review_content: An interesting stop off on a walk round the area. Plenty of seating, some cafes and a great view of the Bay Area and the financial district

review_title: Merlion Park - a must for Singapore visit
review_content: This is my favourite spot in Singapore and I always recommend that to my visitors - local & foreign. One can take a stroll along the Fullerton area to enjoy the scenery, the breeze and fantastic sight at night with the "light show" (Marina Bay Sands). There are restaurant cum pubs along that stretch so a nice cool beer or drink with that view is highly recommended. I was there recently for the SG50, fireworks was great!
There were lots of people who were there so it was a bit difficult to have your picture taken without someone barging in. Suggest that you avoid peak time so you can enjoy this attraction

We stopped especially here while on our way to the airport. We had run out of time to visit this Park and look at the Merlion while sightseeing during the day. It is a place for the young at heart to visit and no wonder it has the romance and mystery a myth has attached to it in buckets. Soft lighting on the Merlion and its surrounds it looked very romantic in the night lights. During the day we had seen it from the on off bus so wanted to look closer. Our very obliging cab driver pulled out of the traffic to allow us to run down and look at the park while he waited. Well worth the little extra he charged for the priviledge.
First time in Singapore? I think this is a must for every tourist... A picture with the Merlion... The Merlion is just near the Fullerton Hotel.

The statue is the presentation of the Singapore spirit,but it's a little hard to find a good corner for photo shooting because it was very crowded.You can visit the statue in both daytime and night and you can see the versatile faces of it.

I must tell you if you want to take good photos with nice view.You must avoid weekends and public holidays. Because it was really crowded during holidays. There are good restaurants and hotels nearby with great foods.But not cheep. One of the must visit place in your Singapore tour.Its a really iconic place and its free. If you visit night time you can see the Marina Bay Sands laser show which is great and free.

review_title: Very iconic of SGP, good place to start your walking tour
review_content: Took my friends here on a Saturday mini tour that we did on our own. Near raffles place MRT, lots of history behind the lion-fish statue.   Some history: The Merlion is a combination of 2 animals, head of a lion and body of a fish (represents SG origins as a fishing village), very unique and the setting near Marina Bay is breathtaking.  SG's original name was Singapura or "lion city" (Malay). It is interesting in that it faces East, a direction that signifies prosperity (where the fountain showers water from its mouth). There are 5 of these figures in SG, 2 in Merlion Park and the others at Mt. Faber, Sentosa and the Tourism. (details info from visitacity.com-- a great website to help you plan trips!) Highly recommended and great for fun pics.  After merlion park, we walked to Lau Pasat for some satay and a variety of dishes at this very famous food court. Next we walked through the Shoppes at Marina Bay Sands (always a favorite, any high end store that you can think of is here), walked through the hotel MBS and then finished the night at Gardens by the Bay (lights show at 745 pm). All of these places are close by (walking distance) will take about 1/2 day to leisurely look around and enjoy the views.
Very touristy! Trip would not be complete without a visit to the mythical Merlion. Did not see the anything "special" but trip will not be complete without it!

Good views and decent surroundings. Iconic statue seen on many souvenirs and postcards so might as well.  But if somehow you miss it, its not much different than appears on print.  I wouldn't go out of my way for it but its decent. Better night with the colours!
Symbolic place with surrounding which gives ample scope to have photographs in backdrop. Fellow travellers were having good poses, one can copy some of them.

review_title: More about the statue than a park
review_content: Merlion Park is really about the Lion statue than anything else.  If you visit at night time, Marina Bay Sands puts on a laser show which is great to see, and the lion is lit up.  Free to see.

The park is wonderfully situated to capture the landmark icons of Singapore, photos with the icons in the back ground and photo tricks with the merlion is nice when travelling with kids. Beware of the crowd at peak times, visit during the evening hours is recomeded.
An awesome place to visit choose a time when its not to busy so earlier in the day is good but at night its also very nice
A good place to spend time in the evening hours. It is a must watch place during trip and to click some pics for fb for sure :)

One can definitely not miss the Singapore icon. Best for photo opportunities - although it is difficult to find one due to presence of too many tourists.. There are many roadside vendors, hawkers, ice cream sellers...

the place is so-so.. if its your first time to go to singapore then you better come here just to get a photo since this is one of the icons of the place. other than that there is really nothing much to see. :) it was hot when we were there, so it was kind of draining walking around.

review_title: Best location for an evening out
review_content: A place to spend the sunset at. You can event catch the Marina Bay Sands Lightshow and chill at the bars/restaurants along one fullerton.

review_title: Just a statue that spews out water
review_content: Nothing special. Just stopped by to snap a few photos. Lots of tourists were there on a weekday. It is a great view facing the Shoppes, Helix Bridge, ArtScience Museum, and Marina Bay sands hotel.
Merlion park is a fantastic photo opportunity with a great view of the bay and surrounds. I thought the Merlion might be slightly larger but I glad I made the effort.
A must go to see the merlion, our Singapore icon. Near to some bistros and restaurant and especially the eating place beneath the bridge. A must try. ^_^

The famous merlion but too many tourist there so a bit hard to look for good spot to take a picture.   If come by foot, try find an uncle sell ice cream there after climb the stairs to pedestrian walk. For $1, expect to queue ( sometimes long queue)

Definitely not a place to miss when in Singapore. I already visited Singapore twice, and went here twice as well. First was with my boyfriend at night time, second time was with my girlfriends during sunset. I would suggest to go here during sunset to see both. You can view the Marina Bay Sands Hotel from this place as well.
I think this is the best place to be. Yoy have a beautiful view from the park to all over around of Marina bay and its view. Many angles, you will find a perfect spot for that perfect picture.

Popular park in South East Asia Good for everything Merlion Park, a landmark of Singapore, is a major tourist attraction at One Fullerton,Singapore, near the Central Business District (CBD). Two structures of the Merlion are located at the park. The original merlion structure measures 8.6 metres tall, whilst a Merlion cub located near the original statue measures 2 metres tall. Amazing!!
Too many tourists but definitely the country's most famous landmark with the best landscape at the background perfect for taking photos as souvenirs.

review_title: Visited SG for 4 times and visited here for 3 times.
review_content: Visited SG for 4 times and visited here for 3 times. It's near many attractions, and visitors are easy to reach here.

The Merlion is a traditional creature in western heraldry that depicts a creature with a lion's head and a body of a fish. In Singapore, it has become a marketing icon used as a mascot and national personification of Singapore.  This is a great spot for many photo taking opportunities.

The merlion used to be a Singapore icon and was the marketing symbol of Singapore.  The park is well set out and well developed but if you are visiting pick your time of day  The first visit we had was on a Sunday afternoon and to say the crowds were large would be an understatement. If we had known this we wouldn't have bothered as you couldn't really enjoy it or take any photos.  We returned again a couple of days later in the late afternoon and found a much more peaceful environment and plenty of photo opportunities.  It is free which is a bonus and something you can enjoy for 30 mins on a walk around the marina area as well as views to marina sands
family Friendly area.  no need to worry about food and thirst, restaurants are few steps away from this spot
It is a good landscape view, day and night, with Singapore symbol Merlion there that must be seen. Enjoy please!
This is a happening place where you would find eateries at one end and projections and events happening on the other end.

The park that surrounds the Bay is one of the nicest I've seen in any country. As a running path I'm not sure of the distance but it looks like a nice mile and a half to two mile run with very scenic views at every point. The lion statue always has crowds nearby but you can side skirt that by jumping up on a different bridge. Definitely recommend visiting the bay even if you are not staying nearby. The view of the skyline alone is worth the trip.

went in 2012 but it was closed due to renovation. went there again in august 2015, finally i get to see the oh so famous Merlion. good tourist spot. MRT is within walking distance. coffee shops & souvenir shops are near. great photo location as we can see the Merlion, Marina Bay and Singapore Flyers from here

The park and walkway around the bay is great for the views of the Sands hotel and the city buildings, and a nice area to spend an evening at one of the restaurants or pubs. It also seems very popular with running groups (although the humidity and temperatures may make that hard to believe).  Don't miss the park, even for a short look at the view.

Whilst I agree with most of the comments of recent contributors, I think the MP offers little compared with most Singapore attractions. But, I appear to be in a minority! Nevertheless, if you are in the Raffles Place/Esplanade area, you may as well pay it a wisit and decide for yourself.
Fun thing that everyone has to do when they get to Singapore! It's not huge but it has an amazing view and is an iconic part of Singapore.

review_title: Nice view of river and park
review_content: Singapore National attraction. Nice view and good place to visit but in the evening as day time is hot. Always visit in evening around 5 onwards.
user_location: Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of the Congo

review_content: Merlion park is the icon of singapore, easy to reach the place, always crowed people here, safety area, im forget i have been here maybe 5-6times
i love the view..  one of the "must visit" place of Singapore. i suggest to have some shaded bench in case you want to sit for a while.

review_title: One of the iconic places you must visit
review_content: This is a favorite place I bring my guests to who are here in Singapore for a short trip. It's accessible and is one of the most iconic symbols of Singapore.   I suggest you start your own walking tour from here until the Bayfront or the Gardens by The Bay area to explore the sites of Singapore in a half day. Perfect time is in the afternoon, around 4PM down.

An iconic symbol of Singapore. Local folklore had it that during the old Malay sultanate days, there was a contest between a local strong man called Badang and a visiting strong man from India. During the challenge, Badang threw a large rock from the top of Fort Caning hill and it landed near where Merlion is now, some 1.5km away.   Best to visit before 9pm to watch the light show. Grab a seat and drink from one of the bars and cafes along the walkway to get the best of the show.
go to the icon of singapore at night, it's really beautiful. you can just hang out or jogging in merlion park.

review_title: A must see although not a highlight
review_content: My son called this the "great Disappointment". When we came through the airport, the promotional photos showed the Merlion as a beacon of the harbour. When he got there, it was like a garden gnome at the base of a high rise. Nevertheless, it is a must because it is the merlion and like Raffles, another disappointment, it is a must see because of the history and relevance. Take the ferry from Clarke Quay and walk back, or vice versa, it is a great way to see the city.

Hard to believe its been several months since we visited here on a family vacation. How can anyone come to Singapore without visiting the famous Merlion. We made a stop here during the week day and stroll along the water front. We took some pics and eat at a dessert shop a stone throw away from the Merlion. Close to here, there are couple of up scale restaurants(outdoor dining is available) and Starbuck. Once you're done visiting this place, there is a taxi stop not far from Starbuck that you can ride to your next destination.
Walking along the Singapore river, across the highway and there it is. The merlion park.  The beautiful landmark of Singapore.

It was easily accessible well designed.  Staff were friendly, knowlegible and informative.  Facilities were very good.  Signage provided clarity and maps were easy to follow.  Well maintained.  Gift store esy over the top expensive even tho i had the cadh to spend it was a principal thing.  Poor management of birds near escalators.  I would visit once.  Paul

review_title: A little more than a fountain
review_content: There is a lot of history around the merlion and it is fun to see. Its a good launching point to visit other areas in the marina area.
If you aren't at Marina Bay for the light show this is a good second choice. Great place to enjoy the cool of the evening and hold hands. And nice place to snap a few photos.

Many people shoot their scenic view point here. So crowded. The day I went, waether is hot. Anyway when I get closed to Merlion. I felt sort of like. I took a lot of picture. This place is wonderful. You can see so many attraction far from here. It's very good viewpoint. A lot of hotels around is so well decorated. If I'm a rich. Certainly, I will choose to spend nights here

review_title: The most iconic place in Singapore?
review_content: When hearing park, I imagined more greenery here. But there were only statues of Merlion. Well I guess that's what most people are here for, taking pictures with Merlion background
An iconic landmark worth a visit but mind all the tourists who crouwd around from mid morning onwards. A great pleace to meet up with friends and enjoy magnificent views across the harbour.
Merlion Park....a park which have a statue of Merlion...one of the Singapore's landmark...Merlion is a statue of fish body but the head is a lion...
This is the most amazing sight to see in Singapore, the history behind and most famous buildings of the city accompanying with river

Visit the Merlion Park in the afternoon when the place is not yet to crowded to take photos with the Merlion. But a good shot at night is also one of the nicest. But if you want to have a complete picture with a few people around you, then try to visit the place earlier. Usually the crowd grows at around 4-6 in the afternoon.

review_title: Th colourful lights enhances the beauty of Merlion after sunset.
review_content: A calm & serene place to visit especially after sunset. Spectacular view of Marina Sands and Singapore Flyer.

review_title: Take a snapshots with the merlion, you are officially in Singapore! :)
review_content: Yes, this iconic legendary merlion is in the marina bay area. Just walk a bit either from esplanade station (if you want to visitthe art museum first) or at the raffles mrt (near fullerton area) and you'll find the legendary icon of Singapore is facing marina bay sands. Actually you can find the biggest statue in Sentosa, but this one is the most famous and tourist top-search.  So come here, snap a few shots, and you are officially arrived in the Red Dot - Singapore :)

We took the city tour during the day time. Thiugh it was hot during that time, still the place was thronged by many tourists. The place is famous for its original Merlion being there. The view of Marina Sands Bay is majestic from there. It has plenty of restaurants nearby to relish a drink with some food. The view at night is even more charming.
Nice place to walk around, get pictures, views across the bay, coffee shops, etc - and all for free which is great!
Excellent attraction. No doubt it is one of the most visited places in Singapore.  Expect a little crowd.

review_title: Great part of the marina precinct.
review_content: The Merlion Park is a great part of the Marina precinct. It's main attraction is the Merilion statue/structure of the national icon. Well worth a visit plus some snaps!
Amazing view, a must visit on trip to Singapore.  Try to visit during dusk, offers beautiful water view and great photograph opportunities.
If you have a picture with merlon..it is a proof that you have been to Singapore :) Nice place overall...Must visit in Singapore.

review_title: The iconic for first time visitors
review_content: It's just a place to proved for tourists that they're already arrived. The merlion is cute though. Photogenic people should happy to visit
Near to raffles place mrt station, just by 5 minutes walking distance u can get to the one fullerton road where the Merlion park is located. Overall its a worth visit.
goood place but better coming in the night or in the morning.... too hot in the afternoon and there is too much people to take a pc with the merlion

I think this is there symbol for Singapore Tourism and its worth a visit. Though they could develop it a bit more by building shades for visitors to sit. It gets really hot though we went in the morning by 10am

review_title: This park summarizes what Singapore is -modern, progressive, clean
review_content: One of the first places a visitor visits and have a picture taken, the Merlion Park. The Merlion is the state's symbol, and while visiting the park, one can see the skyscrapers of progressive Singapore. Across the river stands another symbol, the Marina Bay Sands and just near the park is the Durian-inspired Esplanade. One notices how the park and other places in Singapore are well-maintained and clean. This park is equally attractive at night with all the lights. The F1 race passes by the streets near the park.

review_title: An upmarket area to walk with some good restaurants
review_content: The Merlion Park is a nice area to walk as it is well paved and laid out. There are lots of places to stop for a meal or a drink. The area around the Merlion statue is usually busy with tourists taking pictures of this landmark.
Great photo opportunities. Best seen at sunset or sunrise for great colour and try viewing from the river for another angle.

review_title: Splendid half lion and half fish!
review_content: This is one of the amazing attractions in Singapore. Where in you can see the half lion and half fish beside the bay. It's also a must to see this attraction. You can be more creative in taking a selfie or picture with the lion. Like what I did on my picture. Fantastic!

Merlion is the Icon of Singapore that places always full with the tourist visited. Always wanted to be there. Nice walking arrounds too. Lets bring your foot go here for to saw the Merlion taking selfie or with your friends thats could be. Have a great time when be here.  I recommend you were going here on early evening time till night come because thats a great time to see a wonderful place icon of Merlion's with nice view arrounds, you can see colourful of lighting from crossing in Marina Bay Sands also, Enjoying it. Thats Awesome.

Merlion park is to be visited only and only to take pictures. Provides you fantastic images with Marina Bay Sands and Singapore flyer in the background on one side and the famous Mermaid-Lion statue called the Merlion, on the other side! A good memory to take back from Singapore

review_title: Enjoy this walk with great views of Marina Bay and beyond
review_content: Great view from here of so many key Singapore sights. A nice part of walking the city. Have your camera ready.

We visited singapore 4 days during celebrate 50 years singapore. many flag decorate around city withred and white color. The Merlion park is attractive place with SG symbol and good sight seeing around bay, many buildings are special shape.
this water bank is great place to see , One can click good photos . Singaopore Merlion is symbol of Singapore
Very visual attraction on the waterfront in Singapore. Terrific picture taking opportunities. Other attractions in the vicinity. Another good spot for people watching and gathering. Must visit!

Visiting Merlion Park while in Singapore is a must. It is always busy whatever the time of day. The Merlion is a Singapore icon and one of the most photographed landmarks. It is a great place to view the Marina Bay Sands, the Singapore Flyer, the boats on the water and the numerous hotels and other buildings nearby. In the evening it is a great place to view the Laser Light Show.

Iconic view of Singapore Merlion..Main statue was in renovation when we visited so had to be satisfied with a small one..However place was vibrant & you can enjoy the view from there..nice place to visit for sure..
Worth it to go see the Merlion and snap a picture, but as Singapore's icon of tourism it's fairly underwhelming. Extremely crowded with hundreds of tourists with the same idea as you.

review_title: always pleasant to see the Merlion
review_content: This was my third visit - always have liked spending a late afternoon waling around one fullerton and merlion park. The view, merlion and the singapore high rises in the backdrop make the location picturesque.  If you are visting Singapore, this might not be the first one on your list, but if you have some free time and want a have leisurely walk - its a good option.

A little bit crowded but nice area to take photos. In the evening you can enjoy the view of Marina Bay Sands, the Flayer, etc. At the day time, we like to watch the Merlion from the other side, from the Marina Bay Sands Shopping Center.
You can't leave Singapore without being here and taking selfies. But sometimes way too crowded, all you need is good technique of capture your moment

Singapore visit is incomplete without a short stop at the Merlion Park. Merlion is the national symbol of Singapore so a photo session here is on every visitor's list. Easy access makes the stopover quite convenient.
One of the places to see if ever in Singapore, and if your ever in a long wait for your connecting flight at the airport, check out the free Singapore tour!
Love the experience whenever I am there. It is beautiful to look at the Marina Bay Sands from this point specially during the evening time.
Great atmosphere great spot to chill with a cold drink while watching laser show from Marina Bay Sands. Great evening photo opportunities. Very enjoyable.

Prepare to be sprinkled by merlion's water from its mouth. Don't panic, it is merely a drizzle. Make sure to protect your electronic gadgets et al. Make use of the extended walkway for better shots. Make your visit sometime by twilight to avoid the sun and be just in time for the lightshow. Btw, there's a bridge going to Esplanade. I heard this was newly opened. Enjoy!

Merlion Park will always deserve an obligatory selfie. One can never miss this when going to Singapore. It's lovelier at night than in the daylight. The city lights and the Marina Sands Bay Hotel makes a perfect back drop for that Merlion photo. No entrance fee.

With the number I've times I've been to Singapore, I finally realised whilst in a restaurant enjoying high tea, we were close to it. So close, we walked for maybe two minutes and there.... just as I had imagined..... was the Merlion. I find that statue so fascinating and the story behind it. There were stacks of people there. We could even view it from the Club Room at Pan Pacific where we were staying which made it even more special. The crowds were always there and it's a great place to hang out and watch people take hilarious photos of Merlion spewing! Merlion love forever.
The view over there great to take a beautiful pic's and eat a a tasty ice cream and nice walking over there.

We love the story of the Merlion and love the location on Marina Bay. We spent the final night of our trip here and it was a great way to say goodbye to Singapore, a beautiful country of the friendliest people in the world.
It is only a statue of a fish with a lions head spouting water, but wow, what a setting. What a backdrop. A must do photo if there ever was one.

Most people would remember this iconic piece from any souvenirs item from Singapore. Well seeing is worth it. We took the scenic walk towards the Merlion Park from the bustling streets of China Town pass the People's Park. I highly recommend this route since there is no direct bus or MRT station brings you there just follow the free tourist map you can get from the airport. If you are going there during the day, bring lots and lots of water. It gets really sunny and crowded over there. However there are small food stops but a bit too pricey for my budget.  If you can try visiting the spot at night when all the city lights accentuates the park's charm. There more people actually there and you might even be fortunate enough to enjoy the free light shows and other cultural events.
This is a nice place but always too crowded. If you come here, remember to go behind the park and take a photo with the baby merlion behind the big merlion!

I was jogging and happend to see the Merlion on my way. I really don't know what there is to see. It is a statue. This one you can see in the pictues just as well. I'd spend my time in Singapore otherwise.
Showing off the Singapore icon with a great background view of Singapore skyline. I am resident of Singapore, still every time i see it, i find it awesome.
Huge crowd. good place for photograph symbol of singapore singapura to singapore trademark of singapore

We visited last year, we went to the merlion Park. It was ok in all the singapore photos we see merlion or when one visit singapore wish to have a photograph at this place.It was about 12:00 noon when we visited fountains was closed.all the tourist were busy taking picture with the merlion instead of sitting and relaxing and have a nice look around. It was like we should see it if we are in Singapore

As the merlion park is linked to a lot of places such as marina square and esplanade. It is pretty easy to walk here for some photo taking especially near sunset when it's not that hot. Do take note that they do schedule cleaning of the merlion once a while.
Merlion is the symbol of singapore so its worth seeing. There are a lot of people around but it is worth it.
