It's a common landmark in Singapore . It's nice to have a walk around the place specially at night . Been here twice will come back

review_title: You must take your photo here
review_content: Its a must to take your photo from 5 different angles at this spot. It is the ultimate Singapore touristy thing.
Pretty fishy cute kitty thats what my brother said. Its a beautiful statue of a mermaids lowerbody and the head of a lion

Whats better than one merlion? Two merlions!! Anyway its a must go photography spot to mark the visit to singapore. Iconic and beautiful, enjoy the stunning night scene or catch the river ferry for an unforgettable day
one of the most popular places for tourists located in the business center of the city. Nothing special but must go place

You could go this place and walk around the area through the bridge, lot of place nearby, there also have some restaurants around there which it's good!  Worth to visited! It's only just took a photo. It's more thing to do if you love to walk!
Right by the river. This is a Singaporean icon that everyone visits. It's lit up at night so there are some good pictures to be had. Free entry
The symbol of singapore, a bit crowded but great pictures can be had from different angles, there are restaurants to eat at if you want to and then you can take the bride to go to the esplanade
The Merlion is the icon of Sngapore and it's good to see both during the day and at night. A lovely evening walk along the promenade.
Good for photo taking. Feel like not complete when come to singapore without visiting this place.  Always very crowded.

We made an effort and walked the distance,safe at night,so many people taking photos in front of Merlion.differnt at night,so dazzling then light show started.amazing experience,on way back took a taxi.easy done

A lot of tourist buses go her as this is the focal point in Singapore you can catch the mrt nearby and walk the remainder of the way about 20 minutes but its a good walk along the bay. You can take some photos in front of the Merlion and on most days when its hot the wind blows the spray over to cool you down. there are food vendors here and ice cream as well not to mention souvenir shops.

A trademark of Singapore. We went at wrong time. Too much of tourists around, so we just simply get some photo and leave. Yet, it is still a good place for a sign of Singapore, at the back is all the banks building, shows the good economic too.   Typical place to go.

review_title: Dazzling Singapore view from Merlion park
review_content: When I visited Singapore, I was very much excited to see 'Merlion - the mascot of Singapore'. Its a nice sculpture with lion's head and body of a fish. The night view of marina bay sands with Singapore skyline is just amazing from merlion park.
Saw this in real, after seeing it in the picture for so many years. Stunning view especially as the sunsets. Was near there during the F1 rally in Singapore. Awesome and surreal.

There isn't much to do here apart from taking a picture with the Merlion in background (and catching the view to marina bay area, which is gorgeous too). But it's a nice hangout area with loads of eateries nearby on both sides of the bridge. It's fairly crowded most of the times I feel. After lunch times however are slightly quieter so you can grab a bite in peace. Be prepared for the heat though!

come in the early morning for your pictures as you will find that during the day and evening, this place is packed with tourists all taking pictures of the merlion. at around 8+pm singapore time, you can also enjoy a spectacular light show from opposite the bay at the MBS. from this park, you will be able to enjoy the light shows and a chance for some more pictures of the performance.

review_title: Next time I must see the merlion!!!
review_content: Last time I visited Merlion, it was under construction because it was damaged by lightning. This time, I came back to Singapore with the hope to take the picture with Merlion. When I arrived at Merlion Park, the place was reserved for some event of the 50th anniversary celebrations. It was crowded and the guards didn't let me in because they limit the people to get in. So sad.
Great Spectacle and good for photos if you want to have a touristy day. Good views day or night showing the main Marina Bay area of Singapore
Its worth going to see at least once, its not a park, concrete everywhere and not many places to sit and it will be very crowded

i suggested to go by night, you will find the relaxing area where you can walk around the bay with the good weather. Many people made a lovely picnic around there while somebody who love to exercise can make the jogging there too.
Singapore Merlion at Merlion Park near Fulltron Hotel is must do attraction. Merlion is half lion and half fish. Its called guardian of prosperity of Singapore.

review_title: Not impressed, but its a Singapore icon
review_content: I guess for tourist visiting Singapore, you should visit this place for the sake of visiting. Nothing really impressive, just a merlion statue.
the place was nice, a lot of tourist taking picture at the merlion, it was a great view for picture taking, we love it!

This place is situated near a bridge facing the new marina bay sands hotel, and thats also the best thing you will see from there. The merlion is not much more than a statue... dont expect a garden, you will only find some restaurants. If you really want to go there, then pls combine it with a visit to the Lantern bar at the Fullerton bay hotel that is nearby. At least its wirth the walk.

If you're a tourist in Singapore this is one of the more popular areas to check out. A ton of people are taking pictures of Merlion and can be a bit too crowded. Pretty cool at night when it is lit up but busy. If you don't mind crowds, then it's worth checking out.

The official symbol of Singapore, the 28 ft. Merlion statue has about a million visitors a year. It can easily be seen from the promenade of the Marina Bay Sands complex. There's a cub Merlion close by that's approximately 6 ft. tall.

review_title: Merlion Park a place of tourists interest.
review_content: Merlion Park a place of all tourists interest , must take photograph with statue of Sea lion means Merlion .

If you're going to Singapore, then you definitely know that you should check out Singapore's trademark. I believe there's a folklore or old story about this landmark and I have yet to ask my friend about this.  Did you know?  That there's a baby Merlion around the corner? Look for it in the area. Candy Boulevard maybe? It's along one of the underpass near a Starbucks place. ;)
Place is always full of tourist here coming here to click pictures with Merlion the sea lion , been here twice best time to visit in evening when its light up.

We went there a little before sunset. As expected the place was crowded but not claustrophobic. We could get a few good shots not only with the Merlion Statue, but also, with the national day rehearsal parade in the background. The performances that we saw from across the river were lovely! Definitely worth the 2 hours we spent there.

If you visit Singapore be sure to drop by and take photo here. It is like a stamp that you have been to Singapore. The Merlion itself is a symbol of Singapore. Prepare yourself for the big crowd trying to get the best position for pictures. This is one of the stops for bus tours so whether day or night still crowded. We went there daytime as well as night time and both were crowded even at 10 in the evening. It is pleasant at night with the cooling breeze from the bay. Great photos can be taken here for the Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer, Esplanade, Fullerton & business district area. Food places are all over and getting there via SMRT is easy.

Taking a picture with the Marlion is the touristy thing to do when you visit Singapore. The view of the water is great, the people so numerous that it feels like an open air feast is going on. The Marlion in itself is not as big as I expected, but it is the symbol of this great city and is definitely a stop to make.

Visiting Singapore will not be complete without seeing the original Merlion statue, the national personification of Singapore. Near the famous Fullerton Hotel, spend a little time to see this icon before proceeding to Fullerton for a nice Singapore Sling.
This is a nice enough walk. You can get some great shots of the skyline at night. The laser show is mind blowing but kids would enjoy it.

Merrion its self is a nice tourist feature situated in accessible area. However very popular very hard to get a photo shot due to crowds. Bus tours stop here so you may have to wait a while for a photo.

review_title: A must see when in Singapore
review_content: A symbol of a Singapore, the Merlion statue is a must see when here. A bit of fun, and a great photo opportunity to record your visit, you have a great view of the business district and also of Marina Bay Sands.  It's also worth doing a river cruise which shows some key features along the waterway, including the Merlion.
Great place for photos day or night. It over looks the MBS Hotel and is a nice place to see the big Merloin. Warning it is very crowded most of the time
How can you missed this landmark of Singapore..Very famous place to visit..just in front of it is the Marina Bay Sand. Nice scenario on Day and night visiting this place.

Located near the One Fullerton Hotel, this is one iconic tourist attraction that you shouldn't miss on your trip to Singapore.   The 8+ meter statue, along with its smaller 2 meter version, is an emblem of Singapore. The view from the pier of the Singapore shoreline - the Flyer, the Marina Bay Sands Skypark, the business district skyline, and the colorful boats sailing by at regular intervals - is something you can easily spend an hour watching.   Lots of food outlets nearby, and easy access via the MRT. The evening fireworks are magnificient. And it's always fun to watch the tourists and locals try the same trick photography pose in front of the statue. :)  It gets a bit crowded late-eveing, but always a 'must visit'!

The park is easily accessible by train ( if you know your route). If not just ask around lah. Sometimes it was way crowded with people doing all kinds of poses with the merlion statue. View in the eveing was nice and when its not too hot the breeze is kinda pleasant

This is the icon of Singapore and as they say stands on the original shore line of Singapore. Visit to Singapore is incomplete without a visit to the Merlion. Other than that there is nothing fancy here and just one visit is more than enough.  The location is nice and well developed as most of Singapore is. Night time or sun set is the best time to go. There will be a plenty of crowds so do not expect to get a photo without anyone jumping in the background. A general walk in the area is wonderful and many Singapore hallmarks are visible from here. Lots of places for food around too.

review_title: Just a quick shot will do.
review_content: Last night just saw from the opposite (MBS) that the reconstruction work has completed :D Merlion statue worth visiting.. Bravo!
One of the biggest attraction in singapore and we Come when the day still morning, easy to reach from MRT esplanade and nice background for taking photo

We were lucky enough to visit during rehearsals for the 50th anniversary of independence.  This coincided with fireworks, parade and airshow which made for a fantastic last night.  This area is beautiful with amazing views and sculpture of the Merlion.

review_title: STAND IN THE MOUTH OF THE FAMOUS MERLION.
review_content: Any visit to Singapore is incomplete without a visit to SENTOSA ISLAND. One of the new additions to this ever changing and growing centre of entertainment, is a visit and climb INTO THE MOUTH OF THE FAMOUS "MERLION". Great views. Also an unusual spot for a SELFIE or ask one of the many visitors to take your photo, IN_THE MOUTH! The trip to the Island and the MANY OPTIONS FOR ENTERTAINMENT are numerous
The picture of Singapore will not be complete without The most well known landmark of Singapore . The location and the easy access makes all the more to keep it on your iterinary .
Enjoyed the scenery of Sentosa and the various activities. One whole day is not enough to do everything! A must visit in SG!

This area of Singapore is a must for all visitors but go at night as well as during the daytime. It the daylight you can see the amazing hotel with the boat on the top, the science museum as well as high rise offices and hotels. The Merlion that continually gushes out water draws visitors in and the whole bay is brilliant. Going in the evening gives you a completely different feel and for us, dwarfed sights in New York, not for size but for colour and sparkle. It felt so vibrant and alive - fabulous!
Merlion Park is the place to be if you are visiting Singapore for the first time.Good 360 degree view of the city with Marina Bay sand in the background.

review_title: Cruise in Singapore river is so refreshing
review_content: Cruise in Singapore river is the best thing couple can expect in Merlion park. Must visit spot in Singapore

You can never say you had been in Singapore unless you prove yourself having a picture with Merlion! His Gorgeous, a lot of money spent just to relocate the statue from his original place base on the River boats travel video.

Amazing!!! We had plenty of moments of taking family photos! We also had a chance to watch the Laser Show from the Merlion Park! We had many laughs here as we tried to take photos of the water sprouting out and pretending to catch it in our mouths!! We also learnt about the history of the Merlion and its significance in Singapore.
One of The most beautiful place in Singapore where you can enjoy The whole day from breakfast to after dinner.

If you're on the Esplanade or at the Quays anyway, take time for a quick walk across the bridge to Merlion Park for a photo op with Singapore's famous symbol, the Merlion. He's quite photogenic, with his fountain spouting forth! He's not anything like as big as the one on Sentosa Island but somehow that one feels gimmicky, like the rest of its suroundings, and this one is just cute!  I wouldn't make a special trip necessarily but as I say, if you're in the area anyway, pop across for a quick photo. The view of him from the river is very nice too. You'll also be in prime position for photos of the iconic Marina Bay Sands hotel and its twice-nightly (thrice at weekends) sound and laser show, very worthwhile seeing, and that's why the park can get pretty crowded at times.
My first time in Singapore is was wonderful ,easy to go to everywhere ,people are nice. I really like Merlion & Universal.
A nice view by the creek. Lovely restaurants by the river. Always surrounded by lots of tourists. A prime venue to take pictures. A must visit for all first time visitors to SG.

review_title: Gives you a strong sense of "Welcome to Singapore"
review_content: I strongly recommend tourists coming to Singapore to visit this venue as the first sight. The 360 degree view from the merlion park gives you a a succint snapshot of this modern/globalized city. Elements of land, water and soaring skyscrapers can be very breathtaking.  The merlion is a symbol of Singapore Tourism, and very rightly so, it really spits - pun intended:) the message of "Welcome to Singapore"
dont ever forget to visit this place and take lots of pictures when u go on vacation to this country. it's the shall we say, symbol of Singapura.

Apart from its cultural significance, if you are into people watching then Merlion Park is a great spot to spend some time. From the strange to the downright bizarre the selfie reigns supreme and you will see some hilarious and at times gymnastic attempts to capture that perfect shot, all involving the Merlion statue. The Park fronts the Fullerton Hotel, so if you are new to Singapore it is a great starting point to get your bearings. The massive Marina Bay Sands hotel dominates the horizon, over your shoulder is the concrete jungle that is the central business district. The Merlion statue is part of iconic Singapore, whilst you won't linger for long it is worth a visit, Raffles Place MRT, United Overseas Bank plaza exit.

review_title: Beautiful views of Marina Bay - and of course, the Merlion!
review_content: Everyone comes here to see the symbol of Singapore - the Merlion. Back in the day, the Merlion sat on the southern edge of Singapore, facing the sea, and the only way you could get a photo with a Merlion was to stand beside the mini-Merlion that faced inland. Now there is a new pier that means you can get photos of the front of the Merlion, and watch tourists trying to get a shot of themselves catching the water in their mouths...! The area is now an enclosed bay, and the views of the Marina Bay Sands hotel are stunning. Plenty of places to walk, eat, and relax nearby.

Seriously, the view around Merlion Park is awesome. You can witness Marina Bay the other side. It is a nice place to hang out and take pictures. But personally I feel like the place is too open without any gate between the sea and park. It is too dangerous especially for kids. Apart from this concern, I love to visit and snap some lovely pictures there.
The Marina Bay, and close to the famous Fullerton Hotel, this place requires no introduction. A short walk from the Raffles place MRT.

review_title: A sunrise jog around the Bay ...
review_content: The Merlion is strictly for tourists but the park is interesting for the architecture ringing the bay. Good variety of restaurants in the vicinity: great for sunset drinks & dinner.

Merlion Park is a tad disappointing. The area around the Merlion statue is basically concrete. You are surrounded by high rise and pavements. Agreed the view over the river is great, but as for the 'park'...not great and has a tendency to be full of tourists all taking the same photos!

It possibly is a staple tourist destination for all travellers (not so much for maybe the locals). Located in now the most happening area in Singapore - The Marina Bay, and close to the famous Fullerton Hotel, this place requires no introduction. A short walk from the Raffles place MRT, you can either take an underbridge to the park or maybe cross the main intersection (takes some time to cross) via the One Fullerton Mall to this spectacle. There is not much to do here except maybe soak in the atmosphere, click pictures of the area and the MBS, snack up at the ice cream shops and cafes and then possibly plan a trip to the Esplanade or Suntec City mall.

review_title: Worth a visit as it personifies Singapore
review_content: The Merlion does not exist in Singapore myth or legend, but is a great tourist marketing logo and worth a visit. It is close to other attractions such as Marina Bay, Gardens by the Bay and ArtScience Museum so it can easily be incorporated into a day of adventure in a relatively small area. Also a jumping off place for the Singapore River cruise. Just be aware that if you visit during " tourist hours" you be sharing your space with lots of other people. Go early.

review_title: A must see attraction for all Singapore Visitors
review_content: This place deserves at least one visit from anyone going to Singapore . It gives beautiful views of Singapore high rise buildings near river at night and exhibits culture. It also ha a lot of restaurants serving almost every cuisine from different parts of the world.   It is easily approachable by SMRT . A walk in the bay area and mesmerising Idol of Merlion gives a refreshing feeling. Although it is a little crowded but that actually adds to the beauty of this place.  One must spare out 2-3 hours in their evening itineraries to visit this place.

Had a few days spare so instead of staying in Malaysia we picked up a $12.00 fare and flew to Singapore. A big cultural difference and a very clean city. So much to do and this was one of the sites we saw.

Merlion Park is located near Marina Bay, adjacent to the famous hotel The Fullerton. This park is a popular Singapore tourist attraction. You can see the Marina Bay Sands for a nice view in the evening. Come to the park to photograph this world famous icon and enjoy !!

It's one of the landmarks for Singapore. However there are too many tourists here and for a picture with a merlion statue I'd say it wasn't really worth spending time to get here. Singapore has loads more attractions that are worthy of a visit.

review_title: What a nice view in the evening
review_content: Being here 2 times, the 1st time was a couple years ago (dec, 2009). As a tourist I really love the view at evening because the lights of buildings around Merlion Park was so nice and incredible. You can see the Marina Bay Sands building and the lights of the bouts. This is really incredible view.

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and it should be a must visit in Singapore. The iconic statue stands close to Marina Bay Sands. There are a lot of people standing and it may get a task to get a photo without anyone else appearing in the background. The place is easy to reach with various modes of transport.  Do visit and get a picture!

After a short walk from the mrt station, we found Merilion Park. It is a great photo opportunity and the area itself is very pretty. When you walk past you get lightly sprinkled with water and it was so refreshing especially when the sun is beating down on you. There are a few cafes, restaurants to grab a drink. We bought an ice cream and sat on the steps and people watched. The Fullerton Hotel have toilets that the public can use just by the tourist attraction too.
Nice place to watch the MBS laser show in the evenings. Often see loads of tourist taking turns to take photos. Avoid the crowds by going before 10am.

If you travel to singapore for the first time, it has to be on your must visit list, you're not going to singapore if you don't take a picture there hehe. For me it's been a long time a go since I went there, but as long as i can remember, it's a great place to hang out with your family and friends just to enjoy the view and take a little walk.
Noo i've been here yesterday and saw the merlion is under renovation, maybe it is bad timing for visiting this months, but I still enjoying the view of marina bay sands, it is a good view though

Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. This one of the places not worth missing. The beauty of fish and lion is captured wonderfully. This place is thronged with tourists from across the world. Selfies and Groupies are a must. Take a selfie stick if you want to. This is well within the confines of the city located centrally and easily accessible. The metro setup in Singapore makes it even more easier and a cheaper option to travel.

And yet, I'm writing to the world about it. Haha. Anyway, as a few other recent reviewers said, it's really not that fantastic. It's cool, I guess, and the view is great, but you can get the same view by not being down on the platform area and it's just way too touristy. It's like: wait a bit to get in position to take a photo, shuffle through people, dodge other cameras so you don't accidentally photo bomb, try to think of something creative to do w/ the water coming out of the mouth but then do what everyone else is doing (holding your hands up as if the water is spilling in them, or have it land on your head, etc.), or just give up and take a photo of the statue w/ you not in it, blah blah.   It's kind of "on the way" to anything cool around the bay, so might as well stop and get a photo, but as a destination itself, meh, not that great.
Must go place in Singapore. Old is gold, nice view of the marina bay sands building. 5 minutes walk from mrt station. Not much to see, but enjoy the view and the crowd

The Merlion used to stand at the mouth of the Singapore before its shifted to its present location.  Along with the move to its current location, the surroundings were designed and upgraded to have more places for people to take photos.  Directly opposite the Merlion is Marina Bay Sands, the view around the park is also great!  Worth a visit!

The day we went to the Merlion it just bucketed down the whole time but it was kinda refreshing at the beginning to cool down. The view from here is quite nice but once again with so many other attractions there were just so many people. Bought an ice cream and got 1 scoop for S5.50. A total ripoff of course. It's a shame that Clifford Pier and Change Alley are no longer today as newer bolder bigger buildings seem to be the fashion these days.

The Merlion is THE statue of Singapore, is it special...not really but its a must see and you cant miss it. Along the Marina Bay, see it from far already; close to Fullerton hotel. Alot of tourists there, thats true, but guess thats a sign you have to visit. A place to take pictures ..when you find the space because you are never alone there..

review_title: Nice, but a bit crowded & touristy
review_content: Can get quite crowded & if you want to take a photo its tricky to do so without having other tourists ending up in your shot. The Merlion is iconic to Singapore so worth a quick look at.

Is just a fountain of lion with tail, nothing special. Too crowded with tourists and cameras. Is a good place for souvenir photo, but not what I personally would enjoy. We spent less than 10 minutes here but took us 30 minutes walk from Waterfront Promenade, too much effort for this fountain.
Its the famous icon of Singapore, so visiting this site and a photograph will complete a travellers journey to Singapore.
This beautiful park has a lot to see and is a easy walk from the city. Then you can catch a river cruise to see a lot more.

The Merlion is an iconic symbol of singapore. It is so majestic and commands attention . The best time to visit would be the early evening when the lights are on and there is a light breeze This is a must see while in singapore.
This is Singapore, know throughout the world for this statue with its fountain. Great photo opportunity and is iconic tourist attraction, it is a must visit for everyone.

This is a historical & symbolical spot in Singapore. The whole area is developed very beautifully by authorities. One can get good snaps with friends & families, against the backdrop of magnificent Singapore skyline during the day & even at night.
Nice experience....try to time your visit as close as possible to the sunset...nice ambience and you get to experience one of the best light and sound show on the water front...

No trip is complete in Singapore without being next to the Merlion fountain. A big crowd especially in the night and lots of photo opt, the buildings on one side, the Marina Bay Sands or the Esplanade - your choice of backdrop. And a great walk too around this site!

review_title: An Icon worth visiting, amidst the beautiful sea & sights......
review_content: Merlion is an iconic symbol of Singapore. It is a mythical like creature, very unique yet beautiful.  Without visiting Merlion Park to take pictures of/with it , one misses what is symbolic of this city.  Merlion Park is located right in the heart of the city's skylines & Marina Bay. On one side is the bay(sea) & Marina Bay Sands resort, with its iconic Skypark.  On the other side is the Central Business district with its many highrise buildings. Within the 360 degree perimeter are many other beautiful hotels & buildings including the unique Fullerton Hotel.  The Merlion stands out majestic & beautiful at night, lighted up & sprouting water into the sea amidst the vast background darkness.   It is also a nice place for couples on a date to stroll leisurely & enjoy the breeze, peace & beautiful sights together. We have been here many times over the years.  If you come in the day, put on a hat/cap as its hot. And wear a sunglass to shield the strong sun's glare.   To get there, take the MRT either to City Hall or Esplanade station. You need to walk about 10 mins from these station.
Saw this last visit, but went again as it is the symbol of Singapore. It's a large statue, however, the bigger Merlion at Sentosa is even more impressive.

review_title: So much to see in Merlion Park
review_content: It seems like the center of the city, and a must visit place in Singapore to take a pic close to the Mermaid Lion statue. I was lucky when visiting here with my little family in early June, coincided with the SEA Games where we could see the rowing race on the river in the neighborhood, You can also do many things here such as jogging, cycling, skateboarding. There is a fancy ma ll opposite the statue and certainly the amazing laser fountain attraction at night held before the mall.
Great place to relax in an evening.We usually go there most of the times and evenings and nights are the best time to go.During day time,it is really hot/sunny.

review_title: Great Iconic place with an amazing baywalk
review_content: A well built icon, surely signifies as a symbol of Singapore. Photographers delight for sure. The Fullerton Bay side walk is fantastic with a lot of cafe/bar/dining places with lovely ambiance.  There is a Mall opposite where you can do some good shopping!

review_title: The Great Place to take photos
review_content: Great views of the city, amazing to hangout spot to relax with friends or just being alone enjoying the walk on the promenade. Great place to take photos as you walk....

Been to Singapore and not going to merlion, a half mermaid and a lion, hence the name, is not done. A nice place to get good photos and that of the famous ship building on the other side. Not to be missed on your visit to Singapore.
Not your average tourist attraction as the Merlion is so symbolic to Singaporeans. Welcomes an amazing view of both the bay and the cityscape. Caught a bite to eat nearby at the burger restaurant.
The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. A must visit have your photo taken there. Sometimes it is a bit crowded with lots of tourists.

review_title: Merlion Park, very Pretty at night!
review_content: We visited the Merlion on the last night of our trip and saved it for the evening as we also checked out the big light show at the Super Trees in the Gardens by the bay. Singapore definitely has plenty of attractions and things to do operating in the evening. Im actually pretty sure this is so because its so darn hot during the day that all you want to do is wollow in a pool untill the sun goes down. Of all the exciting visual feasts singapore has to offer, the iconic Merlion did not dissapoint! You can not leave singapore without checking in at #MerlionPark
The place where you take a pic with Singapore's famous Merlion. You can see the skyline of the Marina here. :)
An interesting sculpture that's spurting water out into the river. Heard about it from others. Lots of tourists there. An icon for the country. Interesting legend as to the merlion.

We crossed the river from the Marina Bay area on the Singapore River Cruises boat for $6 each. The river boat ride was a great way to arrive here. Once we had taken a few photos we paid $12 to got further up the river to Clarke Quay. This was a good cheap way to have look around the whole Merlion area. The Merlion is half mermaid half lion. Free entry.

Bit of a walk from the raffles place MRT station. The merlion is behind the Fullerton hotel and you will need to cross the road and you should see it by the river. Good views and good place to take a few snaps

I visited this park everytime I visit singapore. I love the view, and the scenery of people crowds taking pictures of merlion. My favorite time visiting this place is in the morning where I can have my brunch or morning coffee at the open air space and the view of merlion and marina bay sands
I think it's a icon that represent Singapore.lots of visitors like me come to here to have a look. Many bars and restaurants nearby. Night view is better.

review_title: Stunning view n Iconic Merlion Park
review_content: We love view at Merlion Park at night, Merlion statue at night is awesome, we can view Marina Bay, helix bridge, Singapore Flyer and esplanade from here. Strategic location to view all Singapore iconic landmark.. Must visit if you are at Singapore...from here, new bridge open, we can walk tru to Esplanade... A Must visit place if you are in Singapore

We did the Merlion visit from a seat in a Duck,, this is a fun way to see the Merlion from the Water, while enjoying a ride on an amphibious boat, it was fun and you heard a bit of history while riding in it,,the water on which it travels is the actual lake which provides water to Singapore for domestic use,,if you need a pit stop then go before you get on, as it is a strictly a boat ride,

This is somekind of mandatory spot to visit in SIngapore as it's well known for its reputation as the symbol of this town. I think only tourists coming here, taking picture with funny pose and also mandatory selfie here. it's always crowded. from this spot you could also enjoy the view of marina bay and the singapore flyer.

Merlion Park is located at One Fullerton, near the Central Business District.  Two structures of the Merlion are located at the park. The original merlion structure measures 8.6 metres tall, whilst a Merlion cub located near the original statue measures 2 metres tall.  This is a symbolic and famous statue in Singapore. It is popular with tourists!!!!!!!

The Merlion is majestic and presides over the water of the Bay. We went to Raffles place by MRT and then got a taxi to Fullerton Hotel. It cost 6 SGD. Opposite the Merlion was the famous Marina Bay Sands Hotel. From a distance we could see the Singapore Flyer. We were lucky as we visited on a weekday. not much crowds. After taking mandatory pictures of the Merlion and Hotel we took the River Cruise. The cruise goes every 20 minutes. The cruise costs 24 SGD for adult and 15 for child. The cruise is very interesting as there is a running commentary on landmarks. The cruise was relaxing . The commentary also covered history of the river and stories behind the Anderson bridge, Reed Bridge , Elgin bridge etc. We got down at Clarke Quay and got MRT back to our hotel. The cruise allows hop on and off only if you get the 40 SGD ticket.

Partner and I visited the Merlion on our last day in Singapore before flying out. Get there early as the buses of tourists (which we were one) arrive and it becomes very crowded with people trying to get the perfect photo. The views of Singapore - Marina Bay sands, the CBD etc are great and worth doing to keep in your photo album
I can't comment as we only passed on tour but several people were seen enjoying themselves liked the view.
The view of the bay from here is gorgeous, but it is very touristy with tons of people trying to get the perfect picture. Nice area to grab a coffee and enjoy the beauty.
The Merlion has a nice position by the water and provides some good photo opportunities. You may have to be patient, however, since everyone else will have the same idea! Dodge the selfie sticks!

We caught the MRT to Raffles Place then to a walk around the waterfront. Boy what a place. the old Fullerton Hotel nestled in amongst the new still looks great. One Fullerton now that''s a nice Hotel. Huge as they come. Plenty of place to ease the appetite or relax with a cold drink before getting to the iconic Merlion itself. Plenty of tourists but wait for a break before getting the perfect pic. A must see landmark of Singapore..

After coming here, you will realise, yes you are in Singapore. Clicking picture in front of this is must. You can't stop yourself clicking more than 10 pictures. A huge lion half fish is know as symbol of Sinapore.

Just about everyone comes here for photos of the Merlion, the symbol of Singapore. There is also another small Merlion nearby, though not spouting water. The views across the bay are quite stunning, though tourists throng to this spot and it can be quite busy.

review_title: The Merlion- a symbol of Singapore
review_content: I was able to visit the Merlion Park. Took the boat ride from Clarke Quay. If you have the time while in Singapore, this is something worth trying. The weather can get quite humid so its advisable to go at night. You will see some of the buildings which has been preserved. In fact, the former Post Office building is now a luxury hotel. When you dock at Merlion Park, after taking the obligatory pictures of the Merlion check out some of the coffee shops and bistros. Definitely a yuppie hangout.
Tourists everywhere clicking pictures with the symbol of Singapore the famous landmark Merlion. I also get the chance to click funny pics with it. Had fun with family there.

We were fortunate to be here during afternoon and evening time. Afternoon time is all hustle and bustle but evening is the time to spend time enjoying cool breeze, a splash of water sprayed from Merlion and see the lighted buildings all around. This area is not to be missed while in Singapore.

The most important landmark to visit in Singapore. Your visit is not complete without a picture of this Singapore icon. It was very crowded, felt like an international gathering to me. People from all around the world came to get the taste of the one and only Merlion. A good place to hang out just hours before sunset and enjoy the view of Marina Sand Bay and other nearby icons.

It is the landmark of Singapore & located right next to the famous Fullerton Hotel. The place is usually full by visitors throughout the day till midnight. It resembles the lower body of a fish & upper-half that of a Lion. Behind the big Merlion is a baby Merlion. One can enjoy a view of the famous architectures in Singapore from this historic place in Singapore.  Must visit if you visit to Singapore
The most beautiful waterfront I have seen at day and night. During the day you can experience the great modern architecture and at night it is a fairyland of light.

review_title: Must visit for a very short time- Take pics and scoot!
review_content: An obvious place to visit during any trip to Singapore, even if you're there for a night's layover. The photo opportunity is probably the only reason to spend time there, so beware of a huge crowd of tourists. You will have to search for the couple of seconds between moving people to snap your pic with the Merlion in the background. Come early, spend 15 minutes taking umpteen pics and scoot- coz it gets quite warm in the day- and the sun's glare can be irritating.

Following a really pleasant walk along the river we came to Merlion Park. Whilst not spectacular in its own right coupled with views and warm weather a really pleasant way to spend some time watching the world go by. You may not think it worth writing a review but unless you do someone may miss something they really like
bring my son for a walk there on 1 sunday afternoon, he really enjoyed, we take a fews photos, and also have a snack there.

Your visit at Singapore wouldn't be complete without the iconic Merlion.  It can be quite crowded but you can always find a nice spot to take pictures with the Merlion ;)  Getting there, exit to Raffles station, then turn right. Then you will see the iconic Fullerton hotel, cross the bridge. Then go through the tunnel to cross the road. Then you will see another bridge, after crossing the bridge, turn left. Go straight then you will see candy boulevard store. Im sure you wont miss it from there since it will be full of crowd.  Have fun!

review_title: a not to be missed icon
review_content: you can't tour Singapore without stopping here, a place that offers grand views of the Singapore River and the backdrop of awesome buildings, including the incredible Marine Bay Sands Hotel that looks like a boat is resting on 3 massive pilings.  The main attraction is the national icon, the 1/2 fish and 1/2 lion fountain. The body symbolizes Singapore's humble beginnings as a fishing town. Back then it was called Temaser which means 'sea town' in old Javanese. The head presents Singapore's original name, Singapura or Lion city in Malay. go here in the morning to avoid the major heat.
You can spend around 2 hrs. Preferably evening time is good as you can watch the area around in day light and in the night. Perfect place to spend quality time.

amazing place! a must see in singapore, a must have a picture at merlion park, lovely...if you are a traveller you must not forget to drop by in this place, once you are here you can also explore a couple of attraction, marina bay sands and gardens by the bay which are also fabulous..a place like no other

review_title: The icon of Singapore, adored by many, both tourist and local alike
review_content: I came here both during the day and night, and it is much more spectacular at night when you have the Merlion gushing waterfront of its mouth with the lights of the skyline behind it. You also get an excellent view of both the Marina Bay Sands complex and the Singapore Flyer from the park, just be mindful of the hordes of tourists and locals that come here to see an icon. There is also what I like to call a "Merlion Jr." statue that sits behind the main Merlion and looks toward the Fullerton Hotel. Just be sure to bring plenty of water to drink, an umbrella, and on sunny days, sunscreen! Also watch out for thunderstorms, they're pretty common here.

review_title: A not- to- be miss attraction for tourists
review_content: Went there on a weekday morning. The morning crowd was already there posing for their photos and viewing the waterfront views. Pretty warm but quite breezy. From here, you can stroll along the waterfront and if hungry, can go to nearby waterfront food outlets or the eateries in Esplanade.

review_title: A sight by day and night
review_content: We've been there twice, once during daytime and once in the evening. Both occasions many tourists and almost impossible to take pictures without catching other people in the picture.
Clean place + interesting point of view in SG + one place with several landmark and interesting views in Singapore. We can se Marina Bay the Sand, Singapore Flyer, Esplanade from this place.
My husband I were very disappointed when we visited the park as the Merlion has no water coming out of its mouth. :(
It was crowded when I get there. It would say the Merlion is worth to visit.   It is one of the must-visit places.

Tours stop here to visit the statue of the Malayan. It's in a nice area with a decent city view. The statue area is very crowded and there are lots of tourists. However, the statue is iconic Singapore, so you have to spend about 5 mins to take a photo.
Watch the laser show done by sands skypark with laser and lights its good to watch and the sands skypark looks good with lighting and all
Nice, tourist attraction. Like everywhere in Singapore it is so clean and safe. Love this country!!!

Well if you're coming to Singapore, you need to see the Merlion. I can be a little underwhelming, but the view is lovely and you can get some great photos of the lion and Marina Bay. There's food available, but it is a bit of a trek from any public transport, so hire a taxi or strap on your sneakers.

review_title: Get a good photo with national icon
review_content: A little memory of going there when I was a kid with my classmates. Used to be quite chill place. Right now its major tourist attraction. Whenever I pass by, I see the place so crowded and noisy. Still a good place for photography. Near the Central Business District, so u get amazing view of buildings

From my childhood, I've seen the national icon of Singapore tourism in the advertisements. But seeing that thing right in front of your eyes is awesome. I'd recommend to go there in late evening to see the Marina Bay Sands laser light show

review_title: One of the icons of Singapore but crowded
review_content: One of the icons of Singapore and a must visit place but it is too crowed for my taste. Nice view of the bay and Marina Bay Sands, esply in the evening around sunset. Good for some photos if you can find a place without people pushing you around.

review_title: A place to get an amazing view of all the major buildings.
review_content: Well worth the visit and easy enough to get to and fit into your walking tour. You can get some great photos here too.

It's a must to visit when you come to Singapore. The beautiful scenery and the air is very good.But i came here at noon so the weather was so hot. Better come here at night but i have no time to visit at night. very memorable...and wanna visit this place sometimes.

The place where all the tourists end up getting their photo taken with the Merlion spraying water into their open mouths. However, stand on the new footbridge at sunset and watch the light change on the 3 towers of Marina Bay Sands. Stay here til the light show commences and watch the light and laser show from MBS.

walking around this area you will get up close to the merlion spouting water can get very crowded to escape the heat go under the bridge for a nice breeze souvenir shop bit pricey places to eat and get coffee well worth the visit

A merlion (Mermaid body, Lion head). No wonder the Merlion is 'single' ... LOL... Ok. enuff jokes. Nothing much but photo taking opportunities. Unless you wanna get a nice sunburn, yes, you heard me right, sunburn, visit in the evenings. Nonetheless, its an icon that represents Singapore. No, wait, I have no idea if this is the icon as there seems to be too many icons sprouting around that simply labelled icon as meaningless...

Shows off Singapore and its progress. It's a great walk crossing through the Helix bridge towards Marina Bay Sands and reflecting on both sides of the City. The Light show and music is amazingly powerful. Nice stroll at sunset.

review_title: Wonderful Journey to Singapura history with splended artwork,
review_content: Amazing Aerial View of Singapore from the top. Heights and details of 7 wonders mentioned at the rooftop. Takes you back to the history of Singapura with a splendid short movie. Greets you back with a gold colored souvenir with merlion imprinted and a Ice-Cream. Have other options to eat as well. Located near to the Waterfront Station at Sentosa Resort World
Don't you ever miss this awesome tourist spot. Better to visit this place at night to witness the lightshow of MBS. It's for free :)

There is no charge to enter Merlion Park (free entry is very rare in Singapore). Merlion is Symbol of Singapore. Its a good place for clicking photos. View of Marina Bay Sands and other buildings is amazing from this place.

A famous tourist spot and a good place for taking pictures. It is a iconic place of singapore and covers the sky rise buildings in its background. Tourists flock the area and u can take pictures of esplanade , marina bay sands at your background from this place. View area is very good but doesnt has any shade for people to stand during sunny day. Don miss this place
very beautiful surroundings, can take picture with marina bay sands, fullerton hotel, esplanade from distance. and all of it is free of charge.
Yet another place all tourists go yo ( me included). Only if you have some extra time, otherwise don't bust your guts. The view of the bay is spectacular, though.

The Merlion is symbol of Singapore. It is worth to have a look. Also there are some symbolic historical buildings around this area. But many tourists. The local staff from the shop are not very friendly.

review_title: Nice statue close to other attractions
review_content: The Merlion is the emblem/identity of Singapore and is located near to the helix bridge and the flyer.   While the statue is nice I would I pay visit as part of seeing the other attractions nearby as well.   It was very busy when I visited but still managed to get some good pics. Can imagine at sunset that you can get some stunning images.

Have been to Singapore for 4 weeks every year for five years when my son was working there and a great place to visit,a great holiday destination,very good people,great restaurants and it was a pleasure to visit that place as I have great memories of Singapore. Dr.Javed Rasheed

review_title: An symbolic fountain that is hard to get to
review_content: Some colleagues and I were walking around the city, and this was something I had read about so I wanted to see it. Given its location, it is a bit of a challenge to walk to from other parts of the city. I took a few pictures, but wasn't overly impressed. Difficult to get a clear picture as the crowds are always trying to get pictures in front of it.

This place is understood as identity of Singapore. Evening is most enjoyable yet entertaining. Lots of tourist roaming around taking water mist shower. Hotel Marina bay is viewed great from this place.  Regards, Vishal

review_title: Nice stroll along the water but nothing more
review_content: Apparently the Merlion is a must see in Singapore but there isn't much to it. The view of Marina Bay Sands is much more impressive. Although I have to admit it lights up nice in the evening. Excellent place to see the MBS lightshow but everybody is thinking the same ;) good spot for an evening walk (continue to Fullerton hotel and Clarke quay to get a nice view of Singapore lights buy night).

During our visit the place is quite crowded due to public holiday and weekend. Nevertheless the place is good if tourists would like to enjoy the beautiful scenery and and laser light show during night. There are few restaurants overlooking Marina Bay Sands building.

review_title: Lovely place for an evening stroll
review_content: We went to watch the light and sound show in the bay, which was not as good as anticipated (we saw the show in the gardens by the bay the night before which was spectacular by comparison) but the Lion fountain is well worth seeing and it's a very pleasant location to while away the evening. Few benches but lots of steps to sit on.
A must place when visiting Singapore, it is just beside the sea. From there, we can saw the Singapore Flyers and another landmark of Singapore. Cool air blow on the face, feel pretty nice.

review_title: a must visit place when u go to singapore
review_content: This place is a must place you should go when you go to Singapore. The iconic Merlion which represent the country stand here. Take a picture here and then take a stroll around the fullerton, or you can take a walk from here to the esplanade. The perfect time to go here is around 3 p.m when the weather is perfectly fine. For me, i enjoyed the walk, the scenery around merlion park.

review_title: An icon of Singapore that is worth the visit
review_content: The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and the statue / fountain at Merlion Park is both impressive and worth the visit. We made two visits to the park, one during the day and one at night. Both spectacular in different ways and there are many vantage points for ggreat photos. Glad to have visited this icon of Singapore.

review_title: Crowded, but this is the place with the iconic image of Singapore
review_content: For many years, thinking of Singapore brought up the image of Merlion in my head - that image was visible in every travel-related brochure, webpage and advertisement. So it made sense to go and see it.  It's an impressive statue and has a great backdrop. The place stays very crowded through the day. If you're in a big group there, it can be difficult to keep track of all group members, especially in the evening.

review_title: Mainstream but still a must visit
review_content: This must be one of the most photographed spots in Singapore. It truly reflects the country's identity. A nice place for photo taking and an evening stroll. Beautiful views from just about every angle. But taking pictures could be quite a challenge here since the place is packed with visitors almost all day long, especially in the evening. An important tip for photography lovers if you wish to avoid the crowd: visit in the morning before 8am as we did the day after our evening visit. There was practically nobody there! Very much in contrast with our visit the previous evening. This did not last long though, as the tour groups started arriving just shortly after 8am as we were leaving.

review_title: A place should visit in Singapore
review_content: Should visit to get a feel of Singapore, small area 1-2 hours is enough, usually covered in all city tour, if you opt for any.

One of the attractions that can not be missed. The sculpture is only few meters high, but is located in a great place to photo Marina Bay and MBS as a background.   We went on foot from MBS along the bay, about 20-30 minutes walking, fantastic photo opportunities. On the way back we had a boat trip across the river, the ticket price was SGD5 and it took less then 10 minutes to get to MBS. The boat station is some metres from the Merlion sculpture.  We went there in the afternoon and it was very crowded. Avoid this time of the day, if possible.
Should been here when you visit Singapore. Your tour is not complete when u visit this lion City without visit this place.

review_title: Do visit to get a feel of Singapore
review_content: If you are in Singapore and have just one evening to explore, i suggest that you choose this place. This is the iconic place in where the mascot of Singapore , the Merlion is placed.   The park is more of concrete walk ways and sitting areas lining the bay, and a few trees here and there. You can just walk about in the park looking at all the other fellow travelers. You also get a good view of the durian shaped esplanade, and Marina Bay Sands(The place with the three towers and the pool/garden on top of it).  There are quite a few restaurants nearby with open air seating areas. Most of them open for dinner at 6. But they start serving drinks by around 5.30, some of them even earlier.   The Singapore flyer is just a short walk from here, so after exploring Merlion park you can walk over to the Flyer. Tip: On the way to Singapore Flyer from there, look out for the guy selling yummy ice cream sandwiches in a handcart. And if you do find him, choose the blueberry flavor :-)

review_title: A really nice walk along the river
review_content: We walked from Clarke Quay along to Boat Quay and to the Merlion to watch the light show. It's a beautiful walk and well worth it at night. Don't miss this.

You can see this picture of Merlion in every tourist advertisement of Singapore. That means this iconic statue is a must visit place.  I went there when it was under maintenance, but I can still see the statue. It was great even the water didnt come out from the statue. But there is another small merlion statue nearby, you can also take a photo with this merlion miniatur.  You will find difficult to take a nice picture because people are very crowded. so you must wait for the moment.
this is a place where you can feel singapore, where you can take some snapshots and memorable events
A must visit if you are in Singapore but don't go to the park, it's just a lot of concrete. Take a river cruise from Clarke's quay (S$24) and get your photos from the comfort of the boat.

Merlion Park is a landmark of Singapore and a mojor tourist attraction. Merlion is a Singapore icon that is half fish half lion, that sit next to the marina, across the Marina Bay Sands. Singapore signature, makes an excellent photo stop. Best time to visit is at night, plus the flashing lights of the Marina Bay Sands. Lots of restaurants nearby, and very easy to get to, the nearest MRT is about 15 minutes walk. A MUST place to visit if you are in Singapore.

The Merlion is a mythical creature with a head of a lion and body of a fish. Singapore has adopted it as a sort of mascot or symbol for the city. The park has a large statue of the Merlion that is also a fountain. The views from the park are fantastic and great with the statue in the foreground. The park is clean and a nice spot to sit and have an ice cream while you take in the view.
Must visit this famous landmark the merlin with water gushing out . can get some lovely photos with marina bay sands in the background. A must on your visit to Singapore

Merlion Park is as clean as a whistle - just like the rest of Singapore. The highlight, of course, is the Merlion spouting water and the extended pier helps you get great pictures. The park is a nice place to visit and I can imagine that it is a great place to sit for a while, chat with friends, and people watch. There is a gift store with post cards and some nice souvenirs, too. The Merlion is a must when visiting Singapore.
This is a great landmark for Singapore that you should not be miss. I spent more time there until the water stop gushing out. So I got some picture with both character of the Merlion. LOL.

If you are in Singapore and don't visit Merlion Park, then don't leave without seeing it.  Its a must Tourist place and a Spectacular view - with marina bay sands at the back drop best time to go during the sunset as day time it will be hot

Yep it's just like all the pictures you see.. A stop you cannot miss... The Merlion with the water gushing out is really cool. Plus the amazing view of Marina Bay sands. Sadly it was drizzling the day we went so it kinda put a damper on the overall experience.

review_title: Just a tourist attraction, nothing more
review_content: Only if you have time otherwise you can skip - Can be refreshing during hot days - Be prepared for a selfie stick battle - Pathetic

I love the whole tale of the Merlion and think it's so awesome how Singapore has something like the Merlion, to add more culture to an already beautiful city.   It's amazing how technically this statue is physically just a water feature, yet it has a purpose built viewing platform that sticks out over the water, due to the huge crowd it attracts!   And everyone there at the time we visit, we're so happy, all smiling and finding the perfect position for the perfect photo. It was really nice to be amongst it.   So it's not a water feature, but an amazing statue full of character and a Singapore 'Must See!' .  Do check out the HUGE Merlion statue on Sentosa Island as well, as it's a great way to learn about the history of the Merlion :)

It's nice especially at night. Located at one Fullerton, nearest mrt is raffles place. There are some cafes and restaurant around there and view at night is beautiful. Don't forget your camera. There is also boat ride from there to go around.

review_title: Singapore Is Incomplete Without the Merlion Photo
review_content: Finally we were able to meet this famous Merlion in person!!! But we were surprised to see it is just a small structure. And when we were in the site it was drizzling so we didn't have much time taking photos. When we went to Sentosa, it was drizzling again on our way to the giant Merlion statue.  Probably go there early morning or late afternoon for best photos. We went in the evening :(
It's a beautiful place to be. You can enjoy good breeze with water sprinkle due to wind. Good experience.

review_title: The ambiance on this place is awesome!
review_content: We went to the Merlion Park on the last day of our tour. Good thing I meet a friend in Chinatown the day before and ask us if we went to the Merlion Park already. Considering this is Singapore's main attraction. After arriving here, there's a lot of tourist of course. Taking lots of picture with the famous Merlion. Any nationality is no exception when you come here, all is excited and happy. The atmosphere is exciting. You can also see the great view of Marina Bay Sands, The Singapore Flyer, and the Art Museum!
Loved the actual story behind the Merlion- its symbolism and history. Great opportunity to capture fantastic photos of surrounding areas.

Had a very short time span to spend in Singapore in day time. Went for a boat cruise from Marina bay sands and got down at Merlion park. The view too spectacular to be missed. Would advise others to go for a boat cruise too which covers clarke quay, marina bay sands, merlion park etc.
It's great at night or in the day. A central location with views across marina bay. Had to do the classic photo with the Merlion.

review_title: nice view of marina bay sands
review_content: Try to visit merlion park during daytime and night time.. daytime for taking nice photos and night time to see the marina bay sands light show! its actually amazing.

It's not something that you would dedicate a substantial amount of time doing, but checking out the Merlion is a must do.  It's not just for the Merlion but also to get a good view of Marina Bay Sands and the Museum.   It's situated in a spot that doesn't open or close so you can see it at anytime. Go early in the morning to avoid heat and crowds.

review_title: You have to do it but don't give too much time to Merlion Park
review_content: So everyone should have a selfie here and the views are impressive and the waterfeature of a lion top and fish bottom spewing water from its mouth is noteworthy but just drop in, see it, take a snap and move on - other bits of Singapore are more impressive!
That part of the city is very good, with the Merlion at the top of attractions and places for taking pictures. Highly recommended!
A creature created by the local tourism authority to barf into the river of Singapore. Absolutely nothing to do with the true history or culture of the country.

review_title: It's an icon, and that's all.
review_content: The Merlion is a Singapore icon, featured on postcards and flyers. See it if you want. It's really not that special, and if you visit, you may only want to stay a few minutes to take some photos. Everyone else around you is a tourist. Do you really want to take a long walk in bad weather to get here? Think about it.

You haven't visited Singapore, if you haven't visited the merlion statue, as the saying goes. Finding the merlion park is quite tricky though, since it's a bit hidden, surrounded by many tall buildings.  I visited it after I visited Asian Civilizations Museum. From the museum, take a left and walk through an underpass, then turn right and cross an old bridge. After crossing a bridge, you will find the nameplate of merlion park on your left, a bit small but surely can be found easily. Just enter the park, and go under a big fly over bridge, and there you are, a merlion statue in front of famous marina bay sands building.  The statue is smaller than in my imagination, but a merlion is a merlion. It is the most iconic of Singapore and a must visit, just because.  Panggah Jogja, Indonesia

The lionmaid is located on the Singapore waterfront and is worth a visit, if only to take photo of this Singapore icon, with the skyline or the Marina Bay. There are bars, restaurants and coffee shops on the waterfront and you are within walking distance of a number of other tourist sites. Definitely worth a visit.

When you used a private transport, your transport will be parked about 250m from Merlion Park, and have to take a walk to reach this place through under the bridge. This place is a clean area, and you will find some cafe arround like Starbuck.  Dont forget to bring your camera, since this place also knowing as Singapore landmark :) Merlion located at the near of several fame place in Singapore, like Art Science Museum, Asian Civilisatium Musium, etc. Of course, from this place you can see how nice some other interrest places, like The Helix Bridge, Water front promenade, etc.  I really suggest you to come to this place for your trip in Singapore. And no entry fee to pay.

review_title: It is a nice place to stop and visit
review_content: It is a great photo opportunity place on the platform in front of the lion. There are plenty of tourists snapping photos. You get some great view of the skyline and the MBS and the other areas surrounding the harbor.

review_title: It is worth a visit, but only for 5 minutes
review_content: The Merlion Park is a bit of a let down, if you have high expectations.  As most people know, the Merlion is the symbol of Indonesia, but I was not sure what I expected.  The Merlion stands on its own, spitting out water and there is a small pontoon to walk on to get a different view for a photo, but, there are so many people you find it difficult to get a good shot.  As stated, worth a visit, but only for 5 minutes

review_title: Thee place to be to take photos.
review_content: This is the place to be together the best sand of two of Singapore's iconic landmarks, the Merrion and Marina Bay sands. There are lots of tourists for just this reason. It is something not to be missed.

We visited Singapore on a 24 hour stopover on the way back from Europe. Prior to visiting we didn't really know much about the place and didn't really have any icons or symbols to associate with it but thanks to the Merlion, now we do! With limited time (and money) (and the fact that we were jetlagged!) we didn't want to do anything too expensive or difficult to plan during our short time there so checking out the Merlion was straightforward, free and not too onerous. We visited once during the middle of the day and again in the early evening. If you are bothered by the heat as I am I suggest going in the early evening while it is still light (we were there in Summer) as there is not a lot of shade near the statue. You have to be fairly patient when it comes to getting a good photo because there are always a lot of other people trying to do the same thing but this is not unusual for landmarks. Walk right around the Marina to view it from every angle but allow a bit of time for this as it's a longer walk than it appears to be and by the end we had to rush a bit to get back to the statue for photos while it was still daylight.
Visit this place just before the Sunset and stay till late night.  View the amazing night life in near by area. A great way to spend evening in Singapore.
You can't leave Singapore before visiting merlion park. It is beautiful, you can see marina bay from there and can click plenty of photographs. One must visit here.

It is the spot where you can take brilliant pictures of merlion Statue or the tall buldings or amazing three buldings "the marina bay sands building" or Marina Sands Hotel and Casino the walk around the place, relaxand walk again have wonderful time. Then go to nearest metro station Raffles Place MRT to go to Sentosa Island afterwards.
this is the best place from where you can see marina bay sands and also the lion character from the famous sentosa.
It's too much good and beautifull that u can imagine.it's all around the bay that every place is as beautifull as the other places I really appriciate that place

Oh!.......this is the icon of Singapore. you are visiting Singapore and not having a selfie with Merlion.....not fare enough. Try to visit the place at afternoon when sun is already mild; you will experience a fabulous view of Singapore flyer and marina bay sands. number of coffee shops are there to help you to find your drink and relaxation.

review_title: TOURIST ATRACTION PHOTO NEAR THE BAY
review_content: First thing come to Tourist most attraction place is Merlion Park is a landmark of Singapore is a major tourist attraction at One Fullerton near the Central Business District. Two which is symbol for Singapore you see there a lots of tourists and first there 3 small Model of Merlion afterthought when you go downstairs it's a Original Merlion Stature and behind it's Malina Bay Sand .The park was designed as a emblem for Singapore Tourism Board on 15 September1972. The park officially open for ceremony of the statute was open by Prime Minister of Singapore Lee Kuan Yew . The Original statue of the merlion stand at the mouth of the Singapore River.

review_title: Merlion nice but not the best in Singapore
review_content: The Merlion is a beautiful statue and a great place to see Singapore from, however, it is not the best place to go in Singapore (Gardens by the Bay is my favourite). The first time i went to Singapore i saw it only from a distance and the next time when i went i made sure to take a closer look. it is nice but not that breath taking and if you're short on time looking from the distance will surfice

It is a touristy thing to do .. and is an icon of Singapore. You must visit if you like to do touristy stuff.  We liked the views of the bay from there but the Merlion itself is no big deal.  You will get pushed around by tourists and taking a clean picture will require a lot of patience. Suggest to visit in the afternoon hours of a weekday so that you can spend some time there with family or friends.

review_title: Not my thing but worth to see it
review_content: We try to walk by the bay to reach out to the sculpture (lion I'd guess) ,as a sign of the Singapore It's worth of time to see it but as I said it before that's not my thing and there's not much to saw or do, I rather the similar one in sentosa island.

Whilst on a walk around the Marina Bay I had to make a stop at the famous Merlion Park. Here you will find a statue which is symbolic and synonymous with both Singapore it's heritage and history. Makes a great spot for photo's not just of the Merlion itself but also of the surrounding skyline and unique structures including the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the museum.

review_title: Great place to view the Bay!
review_content: The Merlion worths the visit! You can have a great view of the bay, the Esplanade and thr Marina Bay Sands! Moreover the Merlion is Singapore's symbol and a beautiful sculpture.

Busloads and busloads of people were there and if you want a clear photo of just the Merlion and yourself (or significant other), you might want to go in the early hours of the morning. They are building a new walkway, but currently access via pram or wheelchair is quite restricted down to the park. We (like many others) carried our stroller down 10 or so steps. There is a mobility lift but you have to ask for assistance. With so many people, I was surprised to see a only a couple of portable like toilets servicing the area. We just walked through the underpass (on the way to Raffles MRT) and popped in to the foyer of the Fullerton Hotel and used their nice and clean and fancy facilities. Not much else to do there, other than have a bite or a drink.

One of those must visit for photos experience. Surrounded by nice restaurants and good views to Marina Bay Sands. Spent 1/2 hour with so many tourists there and enjoying god view surrounding. Quiet a walk to train station, I am sure there are bus stops somewhere, but we needed to go by train. Great looking statue in location with great views.

review_title: A cool place with a great view
review_content: This is a very buys and touristy place. Best to see this early during the day before the crowds arrive. But you must also see it at night when everything is lit. Taking a selfies here is a must because everyone takes silly pictures "drinking water" or "taking showers" with the background of the Merlion spewing water. Just to the side there are food and souvenier concessions so if it gets too hot you can get a drink. I also saw the view from a boat at night, which is another recommendation.

Back then we were so close to it we could have touched it. Jump forward to March 2015 and I instead admired it from both the Infinity Pool at the top of Marina Bay Sands and the Lantern restaurant at the top of the Fullerton Bay Hotel. Best viewed at night, it is truly an icon of both the country and the history of the people. Definite must do in Singapore

No visit to Singapore would be complete without visiting the Merlion! Apart from viewing this icon, there are great views that include the Helix Bridge, Marina Bay Sands, The Float, Esplanade, Art Science Museum and others around the bay.

A Singapore trip is never complete without checking out the Merlion Park. It's absolutely free. And it is very easy to find. Lots of tourists visit this place so expect that you'll rub elbow with fellow travelers. This place looks stunning during night time because of the colorful lighting effects of the nearby buildings and establishments. I'm not going to get tired of visiting the park. See it for yourself.

review_title: Half Day City Tour including the Singapore Flyer with City Discovery Tours
review_content: We visited the Merlion Park at the start of our half day Singapore City discovery tour. We booked this tour prior to leaving Australia at a cost of AUD 32.00 approx. We were picked up from our hotel promptly and transferred to a central meeting point were we boarded a larger coach with others on the tour. We were impressed with the sights and information included on the tour including Merlion Park. This is a very busy area and although we only had about 20 mins here it was long enough. We then made our way to a Chinese temple, Thian Hock Temple and drove through the streets of Singapore with good narration and information provided by the tour guide. Our city tour finished at the Singapore Flyer with tickets to the flyer included in the tour price. A good tour for travelers with limited time who want to see a little of Singapore and go on the Flyer. At the end of our trip on the Flyer we had lunch in the Hakers Market food hall on the ground floor of the complex. Good value for money local fare !!!

The "Merlion" has a lion's head with its bottom part made up from a fish / mermaid. It carries the aura and signature of Singapore. With the water sprout blowing through the mouth, it is supposed to denote prosperity. I was told that the merlion was shifted from its original position with the construction of the bridge, and the new place where it is situated now appears to be ideally suited with the surrounding architecture. The area is landscaped with pink bougainvillia flower troughs which add more colour to the park. You could find food stalls in the vicinity. I made a repeat visit to the park at night when it was all illuminated up and it was a very beautiful sight!
The Merlion is Symbol of Singapore, its head of lion and body of fish, its symbolise place of singa (Lion) and dependence of singapore on sea
I visited in the evening so the Merlion was all lit up.  Great area to walk around and enjoy the views.  I felt really happy here, just soaking in the beauty of Singapore.
Singapore signature one should visit because it is singapore signature and view from there is excellent and in other word it is also photo stop for Marina Bay Sands also
Great view for pictures of major landmarks, not just including the Merlion. Definitely worth the visit.

I visited this park on March 5th, 2015 around 7PM. It was a wonderful experience. There weren't too many people and we totally enjoyed viewing many of the Singapore architectures and the skyline. It was a refreshing experience after a hectic day at work. It felt good to see people in light mood, smiling, laughing, jogging, dining in the area.
your singapore trip is useless without merlion visit..the view from the top is awesome you can see complete singapore .15 min documentary on merion is also very good so must visit price 20$ only

A place you can come two times in a day to take different photo effect in the day and night. Not only you can take photo of the famous Merlion, you can take the whole of Marina Bay Sands and take a slow walk along the hotel under pass to understand the Fullerton hotel which was use to be the post office head office before heading to the Raffles Place MRT.  Plus point- it's free Weakness- well there is no shelter so be prepare to get sun burn. But you can go to the nearby pub to cool down or the coffee bean to enjoy a cup of coffee.  The only transport to go there is cab or you don't mind walking about half an hour from the nearest raffles place MRT

One cannot simply go to Singapore and not visit this place!! This is the first place that should be on your list. You can see the iconic Merlion and also a smaller version of it. You can get a good view of the luxurious hotel Marina Bay . There is also a cruise felicity which takes us around the place in a boat.

A walk around this area gives you an absolutely terrific view of the Marina Bay Area and other Singaporean landmarks. If you're loking to get a great view without the crowds, visit early in the morning as there are some great photo opportunities as the sun rises over MBS. A good place to watch the nightly light show if not willing to embrace the crowds near MBS.

I was at the park in the second day of chinese new year. This place was very crowded and not a lot of things to do here. We only spent 15' here to take some photos and leave. Once i visited this place, i would not want to come back again.

review_title: The best place to be at
review_content: awesome!!!!! breath taking view...:) can easily find food around the place and very convinent . will never regret going here!!!!!!!!!!!!

review_title: Nice place to see the full moon above the marina bay sands
review_content: This is what all the singapore photographs must include... The merlion statue is unique and has some history... But overall riverside walk is very nice thing to experience....

review_title: Good view of Marina Bay area
review_content: Walking along this area you get to see the Marina Bay Sands as well as the old Fulleton hotel and many other Singapore landmarks. At night they have a light show which is great from here then there are some good rooftop bars along Fulleton Road to further your experience of this excellent area of Singapore for the tourist.

review_title: A busy place with a great view
review_content: Great place to see Marina Bay and the light show. Very busy in the evening but the views are well worth it.

This is must see place in Singapore! It will take you max 10 minutes and absolutely worht it. Prepare your cameras, possibilities of taking photos are amazing - Singapore skyline, Marina Bay Sands, Flyer, Merlion...

There's nothing much you can do here except people watching and taking photographs of the Merlion and Singapore's landscapes. The view is beautiful because of Marina Bay Sands and the body of water in between.

Merlion is the icon of Singapore, so that's why this place is must be visited. Take a photograph with the Merlion so people know you have already visited Singapore. Try different angle and pose to get different effect. Come visit at night and you'll see a luminating Merlion. And also you can see the show from Marina Bay Sands at night from here too.
As the sign of singapore, Merlion Park is a great place for sightseeing. Great urban view with relaxing sea sight.

This is a must do attraction in Singapore as if you don't then you have missed out. The views from there are worth the the while alone and you even get to be in photos with singapores icon. There are many nice breezy walk ways from and to the park. About a 10 minute walk toward the downtown area there is a huge food court area that you can dine after or before your visit. But the best part is that this place is free and hassle free.

My friend and I made a special trip from the marina bay sands to met lion park just to view the hotel from across the bay. Again, we took the subway. It was really hot and quite a long distance to walk to the park and once we got there it as absolutely crowded. Difficult to get a good photo without somebody else in the shot. This would be a great place to watch the light show from the MBS at night.
Fantastic & vibrant city We only had two days there but will definitely return to this beautiful city
