Half lion and half mermaid stands majestically. Nice waterfront. The coolest place! Enjoy night view.

The statue of Merlion is stunning, especially on night time when u cn also c the flashing lights from Marina Bay Sands, the statue is the icon of Singapore, try to take funny pics with the Merlion During festival, you cn also c the fireworks If you dunwan to just stand around, there is a lot of restaurants can be choose from along the riverside

This is consider to be must Clicked place is you visit Singapore.  There is nothing great here except a giant Merlion, where is consider to be a icon of Singapore. You will always find this place buzzing with tourists across the world.   I have head about loads of good restaurant too.

A visit to the Merlion Park is a MUST. This is an icon of Singapore and is ideally situated at the end of a promenade which is full of restaurants and fast food outlets offering various cuisines. We went in the afternoon and found it idea to take pictures with the sun BEHIND us. 2 Ferry operators offer very similar trips of about 45 mins. duration each. The one cruising the Bay and out to the Barrage offered little else than a slow trip on the water. But the one cruising up the Singapore River is highly recommended. A very good Video and commentary highlights the scenes as one cruises past, enhanced by the total lack of engine noise and vibration, as the motor is electric. One also has the option to HOP-ON/HOP-OFF at the various stops if you have the time for it, to explore both sides of the River Banks, full of shops & eateries of all types, or staying on board for the round trip. Unfortunately, due to the small size of the boat, there are no facilities of any kind, nor is there any wheel-chair access either.
This statue has always been a symbol associated with Singapore. I definitely recommend visiting but be warned about large tour groups and crowds on the weekends.

Its a bit overrated from a tourist point of view.  But as first timers, i would suggest to just go there take a pic and focus on other attractions. Also, the history behind the status is nice to know.

Merlion itself was a little overrated but ok for a quick photo. The setting and buildings beyond were much more Interesting and hence made this a great spot. It is very touristy so you do have to wait your turn to find a space for a selfie.

This park is on one side of marina bay it is a beautiful park but the most remarkable park is the statue of the merlion that has been moved along the bay. It's has a great history and story behind him. It's a beautiful statue that is also a fountain into the bay.

I've lived in Singapore for over a year now and I do not understand the tourist fascination with the Merlion park. All the bus trips stop there, but to be honest there are much better views for those wanting to take pictures.  The new foot bridge - due to open any day may help but for now I would give it a miss.

The Merlion is a well known tourist icon of Singapore. The place is quite crowded with tourists, and all of them want to take pictures of the Merlion, and of themselves with the Merlion in the background. This place also offers a good view of the Marina Bay Sands. Its fun to walk about the place in the evening.

This is a great area to take a nice walk either in the day or evening. Be prepared for crowds though. There are numerous food stalls so you can grab some fast food, an ice cream or coffee and sit by the water, enjoying the breeze and watching the numerous boats go by . You can even catch one of the of the many boat rides around the Bay or up the River. The view id great.

The Merlion is so important to Singapore - but the setting for the monument is so tacky. As you proceed towards it, from the main road / bridge, you even find an even tackier plastic version that is part of a cafe's advertising. So many tourists believe that this is the Merlion and have their photo taken by it. The local council, or whatever the Singapore administrative body is, should have refused permission for this and made sure that the Merlion is in an appropriate setting. The background view of the three buildings with the "boat" on top is spectacular. Of course, the place is flooded with tourists, but this can't be avoided.

Visited the Merlion Park and of course, did the usual taking a regular and wacky photo! =) I felt like a kid again goofing around. It's a nice place to stop by, walk around and take photos then you can head over to the Marina Bay Sands and Gardens by the Bay by heading towards the Durian inspired musical theater then towards the Helix Bridge (which the geek in me found awesome!).
We visited both night and during the day. At night the place is stunning with the lights and the Merlion looks great. The only down side is that there are large crowds in the evening.

Every time when in Singapore, this is a must place to go to esp since it is within a short walking distance from the Marina Bay area where we usually stay when on holiday. The place is cool and relaxing and it sure is lovely to watch the little boats go by as one sits besides the majestic Merlion spitting out cool water. A short walk soon takes you to the opposite marina Sands if you walk via the esplanade side or to Clark Quay via the main road/ battery road side.
It is just a place to stop, take a few picture and if you are brave enough, get a durian ice cream! Lots of tourist!

This is a great area to take an evening walk to view all the things at the Marina Bay Area. It's a great spot to view the light show and grab something to eat. You can also catch one of the many boat rides for the Bay or up the River. Good place to just relax and enjoy the beautiful view.

review_title: Get there early in the morning !
review_content: i stayed at the hotel nearby which I got a chance to jog in the morning and I found this place is magical if you get there around 7-7.30 which the sun is rising. I recommend you to observe it from the Merlion side and you will see the sun comes up exactly where the lotus sculpture locates.  There's also a watershow on the marina bay sands side every night. Check the time before you go.

Merlion Park is Nice Place if you spend time there. Merlion is a Half Fish and Half Lion which is symbol of singapore.  Watch Story of Merlion Here : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ihK9PI7QIBU  Then you may find it interesting to visit here.

A must see, crowded with tourists busy taking photo shoots. You can get a good panaromic view of the marina bay sands casino & the singapore flyer.. Also has an interesting souvenir shop for those who want a keepsake of the merlion.

review_title: Get Your Photo and Move On
review_content: It was very cool to see such an iconic fountain in person and then to get some fun pictures, but other than that there really isn't that much going on here. The bars/restaurants seemed kind of expensive and not terirbly interesting. Nice view of the skyline too, but again I don't think we could spend too much time here.
Very impressive views of Lion and harbour area and Marina Bay Sands Skypark. An ideal relaxing point and photo ops

Merlion is icon of singapore.. Not really big Park,but very famous. In this Park you can see merlion,marina hotels, etc..  Great place for take foto, but enough far from MRT station (rafles pallace), but its walkable.. LOL  Not really good for visit at evening because really hot wheater.. Better at sunrise or sunset time..

review_title: Merlion Park is a great photo op.
review_content: The Merlion statues of the Lions are really fun to see. They look out over the Bay and represent the power of Singapore. Great photo ops and easy walkway to get there.

there is no park as such. Its a good place to take some pics and see the boats running in the bay. from the near by bridge you can take pics of the giant marina bay sands hotel and the singapore flyer combined. If you want to see the laser and lights of the water and lights show this is the place to be.. please keep in mind this is not the perfect place to see the show because show is displayed by projectors on a water screen which is only visible if you are sitting on the stairs infront of the marina bay sands mall or also known as shoppes at marina sands bay. there is also small bars and a mall nearby
It's worth visiting at marina area including famous Marlion, Marina bay sands, Marina bay sands shopping, financial buildings, etc. It'll be good to visit there at night.

Summary : Worth visiting. Travel : Reachable by Public transport...Rafles place MRT is the nearest station. View of Fullerton hotel is very nice in the evening. Make sure, you book a good place and get a cuppa coffee before the light show begins... Starbucks at the bay is a nice place to hangout...

The place itself is situated in the bay. Merlion is the symbol of Singapore, so the place always is overcrowded. The main problem is to catch the right moment to take a picture. Otherwise there is not much to do. Nearby is ice cream stand. This is really a spot to visit on your way from point A to B, but place and view is nice!

review_title: Attraction itself v dull, but the views around the marina are worth it !
review_content: It's not a park in itself but more a viewing gallery with a white Merlion spouting water from his mouth ! , in itself not that exciting. However the view and surroundings are worth taking in. Best to get the view from MBS viewing platform ,where from high you can see the whole of Singapore on a clear day ! That's very worthwhile !

A great way to see this area ,was by hopping on a boat from Clarke Quay, and having a guided tour telling your all the stand out buildings with a bit of history thrown in. You can then have a stroll around the area with a better understanding of the buildings, and land marks. The Merlion is the centre piece of this area and pulls a lot of people for the small area around it, but is worth a look and great for a photo or two.
The Merlion was under repair at the end of Jan 2015, was disappointed to miss seeing this iconic landmark in operation.

Its a nice surrondings where the merlion statue is present. Wonderful place for shutter-happy blokes. I enjoed the fresh air, clicking lots of selfies with merlion on background.. its a must to click photo if u hv visited singapore..  I also enjoyed a walk along the bridge that leads to merlion statue.. its quite refreshing, all though it can get crowded with lots of tourist..

Anytime there is always a handful of people in this place. Yes the merlon is the symbol of singapore but this is not the special place to be. there is just a merlon and the rest is just a small plot of land. i will recommend other places. if you have a lot of spare time then you can come here and take photo of the merlon statue. skip this if you are here for only a fews days. do not waste your time here

It can get busy here which can make getting your photos difficult at times. Located in the Bay on the CBD side is the Merlion spitting out water into the Singapore River. Not much to do at this site other than look and take photos but there's plenty more to do nearby.

This is the biggie of Singapore.Good for photos from the wharf where it stands.You can feature the Merlion with lots of other buildings in the background.Trouble is,you can view the Merlion from other places.....The flyer,River cruise and so on but being close is something special.Please be aware there is a baby Merlion just a few metres away,in a garden.
Crowded during the day, lots of tourists. There is not a lot of park benches in case you need a beeak. This

review_title: Fantastic views for taking amazing photos!!!
review_content: A Must See Attraction for Singapore is beautiful &  Picturesque is fantastic for taking heaps of photos"""

review_title: A Great view in the heart of Singapore
review_content: The best time to visit Merlion Park i feel is either in the early morning, slightly cooler in February with great shots if you are a photographer, or early evening when again some beautiful evening shots with the Old city behind you with the Fullerton Hotel and Raffles Landing and the modern city skyscrapers and the Marina Bay Hotel. a stunning spot, but if you come back on Sunday 20th September 2015 you would have the added advantage of viewing the Singapore F1 Grand Prix!

review_title: NICE view and best time to spend
review_content: I love that place  we have spent more than 5 hours there  you don't stop taking pictures of this place   Marina Bay, Lion Statue, Commercials buildings around you  and the nice people of Singapore

A must see landmark for Singapore. Very busy attraction day or night, try to see it at night also. The Esplanade, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer, Skypark, Science Museum, and lots of shopping nearby.
A nice spot to take a stroll around the harbour, it's across the road from the Fullerton Hotel. A few take away options, it was a very warm day, so a big cold drink was our priority.
Is one of those places that is a must to go, but nothing special! Good to go and have it ticked in your list! It is nearby and had a good view, though!

review_title: Incomplete trip if not visit this park in Singapore
review_content: Well, as you know this is the landmark of Singapore so you might expect a lot of tourist came down here all day and all night.  The view was nice though, you could see all of the point of interest in Singapore such as Marina Sands Bay, Esplanade, and Singapore Flyer.   Afternoon is the best time to visit this place I think.

No visit to Singapore is complete without visiting the City symbol - the Merlion. This is a hub for tourists and various attractions around the harbour basin and the Singapore River. Views across the water to the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Skypark, the lotus-shaped Science Museum and the Singapore Flyer. The Merlion is at the mouth of the Singapore River - you can take the easy walk up the river, or grab a bumboat ride. The train is handy too. It's rewarding to see the Merlion lit up at night. And if you are there at 8pm, you can join the rest of the crowds and see the amazing laser-light display from the space ship looking Skypark.
Nice sightseen symbol of Singapore Merlion u find here don't forget to take a pic Best time to visit early morning or evening time

The sky line was fabulous on the night we visited Merlion Park. Marina Bay Sands looked gorgeous and the iconi Fullerton Hotel on the other side was spectacular. Had an ice cream sandwich from a vendor to top off the wonderful night

If you ever visit Singapore, Merlion is a must visit attraction. Located just opposite of fullerton hotel, it is easily accessible from Raffles Place, Esplanade or City Hall underpass. The merlion is beautiful during morning and night, good for photography from every angle. The surrounding of the Merlion is the Singapore River, the central business district behind and Marina Bay Sands will just keep you stunning over the breathtaking world of skyscraper

We spent a little time here, mostly because we had just watched The Amazing Race and the lion head here was featured in that TV show, among many other heads throughout the city. This provided a great scenic view of the bay, and the Marina Sands with its interesting structures looming over the bay. Nice place to rest and take the sights of Singapore in.

review_title: Do people seriously get excited about this...
review_content: Do people seriously get excited about this...? ;-)  We honestly don't know what all the fuss is about...  Ho hum... :-P
There is nothing else to say, everything there is just spectacular. The surroundings are just very captivating and the marina bay is just a few kilometres away.

The view is spectacular. Form marina bay to merlion walk is also beautiful.  The show at marina bay sands was super. Nice romantic hotel to have food and time to spent. Very nice for photography location.

review_title: This visit is a must in Singapore
review_content: The Merlion has been moved to this new location some years previously. It is the pinnacle representation of Singapore where you must have your photo taken. The Merlion Park provides a spectacular viewing point of the Singapore river and the many land marks old and new. A walk along the embankment is a photographers dream to capture and experience the many points of interest that can easily be missed. Status depicting historical events not normally recognised but are interesting; the three boys jumping in the river, three little Siamese cats and many more. Highly recommended and there are plenty of bars and restaurants where you can flavour all kinds of food.

review_title: Must visit icon of the country
review_content: This is the place to take that souvenir photo with the iconic Merlion. The view is better at night plus the merlion is drenched in colorful light. You can view the night laser show from this vantage point as well. If youre going by bus or mrt, theres no direct stop. You'll have to walk about 10-20minutes. The landmark is Fullerton Hotel.

Like many reviewers have said, it's not a huge lion, it's a little underwhelming..but it's the symbol of Singapore so our trip was complete with the Merlion photos. A great place to photo Marina Bay and walk along the bay. Go get the Singapore symbol photo for the scrapbook.

As an icon of Singapore, as a tourist, this place must be attended to We can take pics merlion or marina bay sands from distance as background Many people came here to take pics, so you got to be patient for queuing the best spot

Singapore visit is not complete if you could not cover two iconic locations- Merlion and the Marina sands bay. The location of Merlion park at fullerton helps you cover all the wonderful locations! Merlion at the park, Marina Bay Sands hotel view, waterfront walkway, amazing restaurants by the waterfront and a fantastic laser show! Must visit!

Merlion is the status with the body symbolizes Singapore's humble beginnings as a fishing village its head represents Singapore’s original name Singapura. This place is always very crowded with tour groups seeking photos. Best viewed at night, when SIngapore looks its best. Alternatively view from one of the River Cruise boats

review_title: Great place to see Marina Bay Sands
review_content: Great view to the Marina Bay Sands. You can go walking from there. Not much time needed, but worth it.

Not many people know that there are few Merlions in Singapore.  The most famous one is at Fullerton. The second on the list is the one located in Sentosa.   Anyway get ready to be partially disappointed. This sculpture is only few meters high and it's nothing extraordinary.  The only positive aspect is the location. The statue is placed in an area where you can take pictures of MBS as background.   In any case the Merlion is considered the icon of Singapore, it is free, you can take nice pictures, it it worth to go and have a look.   Tips: avoid Saturday and Sunday, overcrowded days.  To reach the Merlion take MRT (subway) to Raffles Place and walk 5 minutes.

review_title: Your Singapore visit isn't complete without a picture of the Merlion
review_content: Merlion Park is the house of the statue of the famous Singapore Merlion. Here you can take a picture of the Merlion with the Esplanade in the background (Or the casino of course). As the site is always awash with tourists from all corners of the world, you can pass an entertaining fifteen minutes watching tourist groups having their pictures taken. Unfortunately, the Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf outlet has ceased operation, so the treat of sitting down with an ice blended drink was denied. We saw that a special pedestrian bridge over the mouth of the Singapore River, parallel with the existing large motor traffic bridge, was near completion. This bridge will simplify access to the Merlion Park from the Esplanade side. Avoid the souvenir shop right under the motor traffic bridge; it sells unnecessary goods for an elevated price to unsuspecting tourists.

The Merlion, The body symbolizes Singapore's humble beginnings as a fishing village its head represents Singapore’s original name, Singapura, or ‘lion city’ in Malay. Today, you can glimpse this legend at Merlion Park. Spouting water from its mouth, the Merlion statue stands tall at 8.6 meters and weighs 70 tonnes. This icon is a ‘must-see’ for tourists visiting Singapore, similar to other significant landmarks around the world. Beware it gets very crowded with tour groups, Ideal location to take pictures. Also note that Gifts in the gift shop are very expensive my suggestion is to purchase elsewhere in Singapore such as china town . I highly recommend the visit.

Standingnext to the Merlion makes you appreciate how modern, civilised and clean Singapore is. First time visitor to the country and I did not expect this. I would like to go back. Amazing skyline scenery. Crowded but a must tick in the box.

review_title: Merlion gift shop - don't make a hasty purchase
review_content: Gifts in the Merlion gift shop are much more expensive than elsewhere in Singapore.. between 2 to 4 times more in some cases.. eg.. Merlion ornament 95SGD, in China town 29SGD for exact same thing.. food stuffs twice the price etc.. Happy Shopping.

The Merlion Park is always very crowded with tour groups seeking the perfect(?) photo opportunity. Other than seeing the Merlion there is little else here to do. Note that there is no shade so on a sunny day it can get very hot. Best viewed at night, when SIngapore looks its best. Alternatively view from one of the River Cruise boats.

One of the attractions that can not be missed. Ideal to take pictures with the fish with the head of a lion. Enjoy walking around the park. Will be blown away by the scenery and the beauty of the place and all that surrounds it. I highly recommend

you can't say that you've been to Singapore if you haven't visited this place. the half-lion-half-mermaid statue is iconic! it is also a perfect spot to make a panoramic photograph of the marina bay sands

It's a famous attraction so of course I visited...and quiet disappointed.  smaller than I expected and way too many tourists..  can't get closer or good photos with so many people there. and a long walk from the smrt station. no bars around some area .. the good thing is that you have a really good view towards marina bay.
The first picture that comes to mind when we think of singapore is the merlion.Good place like any other in singapore but can get very crowded and also very very sunny.

It's the one of the big attraction in Singapore, so of course we visited, but we were quite disappointed. It's smaller than I expected. Too many people were trying to take a picture. so we couldn't get closer. If you want to see and take some picture without other people around ,then better go early morning.
Nothing special, just a Merlion statue and some water. The only good part about it was the view towards the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. It's very crowdy here.

We went here during the day. It was hot and there are many people taking photos with the merlion. We didn't spend much time here. After we got a good photo with the merlion we went to our next destination. You couldn't say you went to Singapore without a picture with the symbol of Singapore.

You can't miss it obviously because no tour guide will strike this off their list of city tours! Anyway, when at Singapore a picture against the Merlion is a must for everyone. Half an hour is enough for images here. Always crowded, so don't think of visiting when no one is around. We found a whole lot of people here even post midnight.  Good for photography and that's about it. You can chill here in the evening as it gets all breezy and the hues of reds and blues color up the sky.  By the way the original Merlion is the Mama Merlion and there's a Baby Merlion as well in the park. Your kids will love it.  There are eateries around so that you can sit, eat and chill. Mind you. If you are not planning to buy grub from them, you'd better not take their chairs outside and sit for a while. The lady will come charging towards you and rebuke you. Better take the staircase and sit okay?
user_location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India

review_title: A must visit but very small
review_content: The Merlion is a must visit and see. However, its smaller than we thought but you still must see it specially and night to see the laser show from the other side of the bay. There are alot of restaurants next to it to enjoy the view.
A very nice place in singapore to spend time with your close ones. Nice place for peace lovers. I must come and everybody to visit merlion park at least once.
When visiting Singapore you must go here. It's wonderful to see the Merlion. Then look around the bay. See all the wonderful buildings and hotel and just relax in the atmosphere

review_title: Merlion Park - A place for clicks:-)
review_content: A cool, open waterfront! Good for some casual, carefree stroll with your family and of course some pics. In the evening this place can really get scenic, we missed it though since we covered this in the morning...
Nice view and worth a visit. You get some nice sunset pictures. If you go along the river, you end up at the garden, which is just amazing.
Quite nice and calm.. Neat as Singapore culture.. Enjoyable... Specially in evening times..  A must visit place if you ever go to singapore

review_title: the symbol of Singapore- the Merlion
review_content: The Merlion is placed there. You have a lot of spots for taking pictures, nice view to Marina Bay sands.

review_title: nice place to spend an evening
review_content: good place at the riverside. take pics with kids. selfiees !! lots of tall buildings around. lots of action going around.

Must do for any trip to Singapore. Try and time it for either sunset or sunrise visit. You will understand what the Merlion means to Singapore once you visit . It's one of those special moments where a picture tells a 1000 words

review_title: A must to be place for photographs
review_content: If you are in Singapore and did not go there, you will miss all the fun of understanding why Merlion mark things are all over Singapore :) The area is developed more of a photoshoot place and you need to be there to get some personal pics clicked here.

review_title: Quick photo op with famous landmark
review_content: My friend took us to the Merlion Park on our last night in Singapore. We parked at the Esplanade and took a short walk over the Esplanade bridge (500m) to get here.   As expected, place was jampacked with tourists having their pics taken with the famous landmark, with some doing trick shots of “catching” the water spray in their mouths.  After waiting for our turn and having our own “we were in Singapore” pics taken at the viewing deck, we were done. I think we were here less than 10 mins.   We walked back to the bridge where we stayed longer to wait and watch the 9:30PM Marina Bay Sands light and water show before heading back to the hotel.

review_title: mandatory spot for a-first timer in Spore
review_content: I will recommend you to visit this iconic landmark of Singapore, the Merlion (small ones) with Marina Bay Sands and Esplanade building as your background, if you will visiting Spore for a first time in your life. It's free yet fotogenic landmark, because you have to have for the one in Sentosa Island. It's smaller than the one in Sentosa but the rest remain the same. You also could spot tall buildings behind the landmark. A really great spot for taking photos.  I don't recommend you to buy the ice cream near the landmark/One Fullerton, it costs 50 SGD but the taste was terrible.

Liked this place a lot. The Merlion obviously the star attraction and the boat trips across the Creek.   View of the marina bay hotel and lights there - from are a spectacle.   Starbucks for coffee, Pelican for the or novelties, few more food and wine joints, place to run, small work out groups, THE FULLERTON are among the other facilities on the location.  Fresh, pleasant and feel - good place.

review_title: Cafes and some funny statues around
review_content: Of course we had to visit the Merlion Park to get the iconic picture of Merlion spitting water with the Marina Bay Sands hotel in the view. I found the place to be a bit of a disappointment, lots of people around, taking pictures and the Merlion himself is... I don't know, seemed as if made from plastic to me. I liked some other statues around, the pug and the Unicorn Elephant. Lots of cafes around to choose from in the vicinity.

review_title: City tour and historical Singapore photo stop
review_content: Historical part of the bay . Good photo opportunity and access to river cruises across the bay. Can get busy with tourist buses.
the location is deal for taking good photos  good sight seeing  also a nice coffee shop under the bridge  can spend a relaxing afternoon there

Merlion is synonymous to singapore, and not taking photograph with merlion means your trip to singapore is unfinished. You can take MRT to raffles place and then reach merlion by walk. All the big finance buildings are located here. You can enjoy the stroll in merlion park , or relax in some of the boutique cafes . Afternoons can be hot but there is sufficient shade to provide you the cool. People with children need to take care as the railing covering the river is wide enough for children to fall.
For few photos of the Marina bay Sands and the Merlion...it is the best place, the best time to go is in the morning around lunch time....less people around
Good place for taking pictures and looks good during sunset. 30 mins to 1 hour is enough to give to this place.

When we say Singapore, we will think of Merlion because it is their symbol and representation. Merlion Park is really an awesome place... from here you can take a picture that has the esplanade, the singapore flyer and also Marina Bay Sands Hotel... You can even take a panorama that includes these three architectures...

We were not entirely impressed with this sight since the Lion is rather small and that's about it. Of course as others mention here, you have some great views of the bay and Marina Bay Sands but basically all around the bay, you have nice views. We were lucky that there was only a few other tourist so we could easily take some nice pictures.

A simple of what has been developed in Las Vegas; the huge lobbies, casinos, the great building, the nice views to the gardens of the bay.   Do not miss the view from the platforms to the Gardens of the bay during the night.

It is easy to go there, just take mtr to raffles place and walk a few minutes, but weather is hot in singapore so be prepare for the heat. Nice view for picture taking, you can see also the singapore flyer and marina bay sans. Lots of tourist, we just stayed around 15 mins bec. It is too hot.
Definitely a must visit when going to Singapore, fantastic view of MBS, esplanades etc. Great view of the light how from MBS!
One of the well-known places in Singapore, the park was nice to visit. We had great time viewing the Merlion and clicking pictures around that place.

Maybe because I’ve seen it so many times on TV and photos so I have imagine the Merlion would be a humongous statue. In fact it isn’t as big as I thought! We visit the Merlion from the water as we took the Ducktours boat. It gave us a very good advantage to take photos and avoid the crowd. It’s strange that it’s an icon of Singapore for a long time but when I went there I was more attracted by the Marina Bay Sands!

Merlion Park is a very beautiful representation of Singapore. We managed to go on a not so busy day. The view is just great. Little shops for coffee and food nearby make for a great afternoon sitting on the water. Next time I want to go after dark. If you are in Singapore, you need to visit Merlion Park

review_title: too many tourist and not so attractive
review_content: good: two merlions (mother + baby merlion). good scene for Marinabay  Bad: too many tourists (almost chinese and Japanese). It was difficult to take a photo at Merlion.  There was lack of resting area or facility. Only one Starbucks coffee shop.

While walking, taking a boat ride, and enjoying all of what Singapore has to offer, the Merlion Park attraction is a must see. However, the TA reviews are correct. It can be very quick. It does not need to be a long attraction. See it. Snap a photo if you must. Move on. There is so much else to see, eat, and enjoy.  But a trip to Singapore seems like it is incomplete without at least a four-second nod. So give it the seconds it is due. And that is all.

review_title: It is time to bring Merlion Park to greater High with Music , Song, light and Show.
review_content: Merlion is an Icon, and is time to bring to greater high during SG50!   During Singapore merlion 40th Anniversary, i remember there was a great 3D HD Video projector video mapping, sound & lighting system at the Park.  The whole area was fun, impressive and feel of touching feeling when the song " Inspiring Journey " was play.   It wow the public with a spectacular show, and it should carry on let all the visitor know this Singapore's mythical mascot and learn about it inspirational journey over the years.  Disneyland got firework every night, can we just see the Merlion park with song , light and sound every night too? As those who visit many times deserve a new unique experience.

review_title: Fun place, great view of skyline!
review_content: Spent about an hour here with my family in the late evening hours and it was amazing! The place looks spectacular in dark with all building/offices/hotels lighted up. Even merlion has some great light effects playing on it. There was also a small light and sound show with fullerton hotel in backdrop which was lovely. Must visit in evening hours ...

I heard someone say that a visit to Singapore won't be complete sans coming to this iconic place. So, despite the road blocks and detours caused by the then on-going Formula 1 race, we found a way to reach this place one afternoon. And we were not disappointed. Coming here was really worth the effort.

This reminds me of Copenhagens "Lille Havfrue " or Brussels "Manneken". A must see attraction according to some, but when you go there you are instantly dissapointed and thinks, was that really it? If you take a walk around Marina Bay you will eventually meet the lion. Say hello and walk on.
Did not really have much time here. As we were in a hurry and it was raining. I think's it's a little bit overrated, but It was worth the time visiting here :D

It is actually part of every Singapore diaries. Merlion is the fabled guardian and the iconic mascot to the city and no trip would be complete without visiting it. Sadly I found the value of the place to be just that. To be able to take a few shots around the statues and kick one task off your bucket list. The views at night are much more impressive compared to the day. Cabs can be a bit tricky to grab at the place. But then you access the place through MTR s as well.

We visited on a Friday but it wasn't very crowded. It was raining though but our Tour operator had organized umbrellas. There is a small merlion right at the entrance to the park but you have to go beyond it to the mouth of the river and see the large merlion. Not really a place you can spend time except to take photographs standing in front of the Merlion!
The good luck of Singapore looks simply beautiful. It's like a you feel the calmness and bliss within.

most people says that it is not going to singapore before going and take picture with merlion in merlion park and it is worthed, every time i visit singapore i go to this site, its the icon of singapore and i enjoy the walk there, i always acsess this area by mrt and walk, a lot of photo site

review_title: Low on my list of places to see in Singapore
review_content: Because the merlion is an iconic image of Singapore, I think there may be a natural draw for tourist to visit the location. If you're the type of person that likes to have photos of yourself next to such icons to prove you were there, then definitely check it out. Otherwise, suggest skipping this for better attractions.

been to Singapore so many times but this is my first time to visit the Merlion, we went there at night and the atmosphere was good, very nice view to the bay area. a bit long queue to get taxi back though, suggest to make an advance booking. an iconic figure so must visit

What is Singapore trip without seeing the Merlion, do visit for a mandatory photo-op in front of the merlion, I could see the allure, especially the whole skyline of tall buildings , the panorama at the marina bay. Do visit, its worth it.

review_title: A must for all visitors to Singapore
review_content: A visit to the iconic Merlion is a must for all visitors to Singapore. Easy to get to by taxi, MRT and walking gives plenty of reasons to not miss it.  Merlion stands majestically in the Marina Bay, with good views to Marina Bay Sands opposite, and the classic Fullerton Hotel. As would be expected, it is teeming with tourists all wanting that classic photograph at Merlion so be prepared to navigate your way around lots of people to get the shot you want. Although it is entitled Merlion Park, there is not much else there. A couple of cafe's in the area which are a welcome relief on a hot Singapore day

Probably a nice attraction to grab a few pictures but not an imposing or impressive monument to Singapore's iconic symbol. It was pretty crowded when I went as tour operators tend to make this a must do stop.
truly love hanging out with friends on this park especially doing selfie & groupie with a great giant half mermaid' halflion background. Cant wait to go back soon!!!

If we are talking about the Merlion, although it is the Singapore icon I have a lot of expectation. When I saw it, I was like "so that's it, really?". I was expecting to see a huge statue but it is not. When I saw it I thought it was a replica. For me, you must see this just to take a picture and to have a proof that you've been in Singapore then just forget and enjoy the view of Marina Bay Sands instead.

A must go place because people will know straight where you are if you take a picture with the Merlion - symbolic icon of Singapore. It is placed just right in the heart of the Marina area. Opposite you will have the Marina Bay Sands View and Singapore Flyer, the side will be Esplanade and Fullerton.
The symbol of Singapore. The park has a good view around the waterfront area. Apart from taking a photo of merlion to signify you have been to Singapore. There is nothing extraordinary in this park.
Please go only in the early morning or in the evening. I suggestion is go there is the evening. and go to Level 33 for for Dinner and continue on to MBS

review_title: Amazing view of marina bay Sands!
review_content: Merlion- the symbolic icon of Singapore with views all around the waterfront area! This place is best to visit at night! Very close to Raffles place MRT station (walk able) The light at lazer show starts at 8 pm at night so plan your trip accordingly! This place is a must visit! there is NO Fee.. find your place before the light show starts! Be ready with your camera!

The panoramic view was good however too many people prevented the taking of the photos that I would have liked. Early morning may not be the best of times as the sun is in the wrong direction for harbour shots, ok for the merlion though.

This is another must visit area in Singapore - the Merlion is their symbol and is directly in front of the river with views all around the waterfront area!! It's near the Fullerton Hotel, which looked great - wish we'd had time to visit!! So much to see and do in the area.....!! Brilliant!!

Our lovely icon - The Merlion with the majestic lion head and a sexy mermaid tail overlooks the flowing Singapore river amidst the water taxi plying up and down with tourists.   Admission is free here. A very good place for videoing and photo shoot of my lovely equatorial Singapore. November to January will disturb your photo scenery as it is raining most times.   Opposite the Merlion is the splendour of The Sands adding another backdrop to complement your photo collections of Singapore. At another angle you will see the Marina Barrage where we hold our National Day parade where the miraculous metal plates extend outwards to the surrounding waters. In the evening one can view band performances at scheduled times.   Bougainvilleas dark and light pink on the walk bridge have been planted to enhance the environment.  There are alot of restaurants nearby to satisfy your different palates.   A must visit tourist attraction.

Worth walk along the river to see the Merlion and watch the people. Plenty of places to sit and have a drink whilst looking at the Singapore skyline and the tourist as well as the locals, but to be honest the inner river is more interesting. Some good views. Whilst you are there go and have a look at the Fullerton Hotel, which is great inside.

This is the place that most of people who went to Singapore must visit. From this place, you can take photos with Marina Bay Sand, Singapore Flyer. The fresh air with beautiful view, especially in the late afternoon, makes this park become a wonderful place for family and friends.
Its my second trip to this beautiful park on the bank of Singapore river. Facing Marina Bay Sand hotel on the other side of river, this place is very good in the evening with family.

review_title: Campy & Touristy Fun On Marina Bay
review_content: This is one of the craziest sensations I have experienced in a while. When you witness tourists from all over the world ogling and shooting pictures like crazy of themselves with a cement red-eyed, 8.6 meter statue of a combination mermaid or fish/lion, the Merlion, famous icon of Singapore, then you have not experienced how a tourist attraction can provoke people do strange things in large crowds. I have never seen so many people, of all ages, laughing hard and pretending in the photo they about to take, that the Merlion is shooting it's massive stream of water into their mouths. What do you expect for a free but famous attraction?  There is a lot of construction with a new pedestrian bridge being built for direct access into Merlion Park so watch the detours accordingly.   The walkway by the statue jetted out over Marina Bay which made the access for nice photos great with less people in the shots. The park is built with other pedestrian walkways around a chunk of Marina Bay and has more to offer than just the Merlion with a giant fountain coming out of its mouth. There is a mini Merlion in ceramic and nice landscaping and concrete chill out areas with little ice cream and coffee shops.  This statue is so dominate that you can see it from the top of the Marina Bay Sands and across the bay at ground level. The lights make it even prettier at night with flashes of purples, pinks and yellows.   We walked to Merlion Park from the south side of the bay by Helix Bridge, past the Esplanade, and to the park. After we went to Merlion Park we went north under the very busy Fullerton Road to the Fullerton Hotel and enjoyed the views of the Singapore River. This park is a close walk to the Asian Civilizations Museum.

review_title: One of Free Attraction in Singapore
review_content: This park simply famous with Merlion statue which is the symbol of this country. With half lion and half fish making this statue iconic around the world. To get there was so easy, easiest way you can call a cab but I wouldn't recommend that since the fare is a bit high. Just take MRT if you want to save some S$. Distance from MRT station near enough. Once you see Fullerton Hotel it means you almost there. Cross the road using crossing bridge, little walk again toward the bridge, then walla! You have reached Merlion Park filled with peoples.

Visit to Singapore is truly meaningless without visit to this place. The Fullerton road, Fullerton hotel are the oldest places of the Singapore. We stayed in Fullerton Hotel and the that was a memorable stay in Singapore. Hotel itself is one of the greatest place in Singapore. Merlion, Merlion Park, Laser show of Marina Bay etc are really pleasure and fun. A full day around this area can make your Singapore visit memorable.

I had visited Singapore during the Light festival and Merlion Park was a must watch on my list. I was on a 2 day business trip and did not have time to do anything else but this was a symbol of Singapore and was a very interesting place to visit during the night. The Light festival made this visit very memorable. Restaurants by the bay, Light show from Marina bay are absolutely delightful. My visit was Jan 2013
Hot and boring. The best thing is that you are near the water and at night their are good sights. Good eating nearby and a short walk to Clarke and Boat Quays.

Visited the Merlion last month and can see lot of changes have happened since I last visited. It's a good place for getting a good view of the Marina Bay,esplande and places around.Good place for taking some photos.You also get tickets for Singapore river cruise here as well as there is a nice souvenir shop.

There is nothing particularly great to see but this symbol of the Lion City is quite nice, you can walk around, take funny pictures, admire the skyline, have an ice cream/drink/dinner along the bay.  Definitively a place to visit if you a visiting Singapore! I recommend it at night.
Merlion statue symbolizes Singapore and hence its a worth visit for taking some beautiful photographs for your memories of the beautiful country.

A must visit park if we come to Singapore. As one stop center for beautiful scenery's photo taking with Merlion fountain, banking skyscrapers, Marina Bay building and Singapore Flyer as panorama background.

Back when I visitted it in the end of January this year, actually one day before the chinese new year (the scenery was so beautiful, because they held a fireworks party from Marina Bay Sands and turned out pretty good). Although maybe the Merlion statue was not that bigger than what I imagined before but it was nice to visit.

We visited here on a very hot day and my husband had to take shelter under a tree while i took lots of pics and selfies with this iconic statue. It was very busy but defo worth a visit. Also good seeing it while on a boat tour for a different perspective.

When in Singapore, they say that it's not official before you have your own picture with this white-half lion half fish-statue in the background. But the problem is, every tourist wants the same thing as you are. Hahaha...! But instead sputtering about the situation, you might as well turn it into a positive thing. You can ask them to take your picture or with your family. Say cheese...!

Along with the statue of Raffles, the Merlion IS Singapore. It must be one of the most photographed attractions in this amazing city. It can be combined with a number of other "must see" places and if you are walking around the Marina Bay Area, you can't miss it.  Close by, you can take the river cruise boat and see the Merlion from a different perspective. At night time, all the buildings etc are lit up and it's cooler as well!

Since this is their national symbol, you can't say that you really went to Singapore without seeing the Merlion 'in person'. Not so much to do in this place except for taking selfies with this in the background. The souvenirs are expensive. Not a stroller-friendly place if you have a baby with you.

review_title: One of the icon of singapore
review_content: If one is visiting singapore then this place is deemed to be on the list & the clicks in the album. The place is nice with great view around of singapore flyer,marina bay sands,skypark etc.
Merlion Park is the icon of Singapore. If you visit Singapore then you must take a snap here..  The place is nice for a walk in the evenings, and you get a view of the Marina Bay Sands from here.

Merlion Park will always be the emblem of Singapore, the old folk tale has taken the park to new heights. Iv been there in 2010 where the Marina Bay Sands was still under construction and came back lately and in total awe seeing everything surrounding the Merlion Park. The Esplanade, The SG skyscrapers, MBS, the Stadium, The LV house, MAkansutra food hawker, Gardens by the Bay and the Singapore Flyer. SG does not fail to continuously construct and impress me. Spending some hours would be fun filled. and by night , we caught some kids flying lighted RC plane and it was joy to watch.

This is a beautiful location with a stunning 360º panorama around you, with the icons of Singapore rising up over the horizon: Merlion, Marina Bay Sands, Science Centre, Downtown skyline, Theatre, Helix Bridge, Ferris wheel and the gardens. Buy a beer from a convenience store and enjoy the atmosphere, especially at sunset or at night.

Singapore is a very clean place and city. Merlion park is one of the iconic symbol of Singapore City. And one of the most visited place. Nice place to take photo and a lovely walk in the afternoon or in the evening or watch the sunset. And if you want to see some parts of the city there is a boat ride that will let you explore the city of Singapore (with fee)

review_title: Be sure to see the light and water show from the Marina Bay Sands
review_content: Be sure to see the light and water show from the Marina Bay Sands! You can get some awesome pictures from this place!

review_title: nice place to take the photo...
review_content: is a very nice place to go take photo with your friends or family..this place will always full with tourists that come here with the same reason like you-to take the photo..highly recommend if u travel to sg.

The most visited place in singaporw since it represents the main symbol of the city if not the country. Beautiful park with overpriced restaurants. You can enjoy the walk from sunset till late evening

Merlion Park was a lovely little walk on an evening after work. It has a beautiful (albeit man-made) view of Marina Bay Sands. And if you walk on to the Esplanade you get a nice view of the the Singapore skyline.  There are also a few places to eat and drink. All in all a pleasant way to spend a quiet evening in Singapore.
This site is remarkably popular with tourists. Certainly the views are impressive, but the Merlion itself is really nothing particularly special. Worth a look as you do a full circuit of Marina Bay.

review_title: Merlion's Beauty and Charm is Timeless
review_content: Even with the emergence of new iconic and modern structures like Marina Sands Bay, Gardens by the Bay, etc. the Merlion Park will stay as an important landmark and major tourist attraction in this Lion City and Island State. Just like other tourists I never get tired coming back to this park everytime I visit Singapore; perhaps there must be something alluring with this mystical statue.

You get a great view of the merlion, a singapore icon which is a half lion half fish creature. Park is free to the public. You also have a great view of the marina bay sand hotel. You'll probably spend 5 minutes here or more depending if you're in a large group and everybody want an individual pic with the merlion
I just love the statue of the Merlion.... although it can be crowded and hot.... early evening could be a bit better but the walk along the waterfront is lovely when the is a nice breeze....
A lovely park for a leisurely stroll in downtown Singapore with nice views of the river and the Singapore skyline.
I love it! The park is lovely, and the Merlion is spectacular. Be sure to go at night and during the day. Views from here are spectacular. I think it's my favorite place in Singapore!

An open park with no admission fees. Near waterfront with occasional breeze. During the day, it may be too hot for some. Suggest coming near sunset time to view both the day view and the night views. They are completely different. Plus, it is more cooling and romantic to walk along the waterfront while viewing the night views of MBS, the Flyer and the lit-up building of the Business District.

review_title: Merlion Park - The Melting Pot for Tourists and Students
review_content: Merlion Park is the first stop of our city tour. We were about 50 on the tourist bus which parked on the side after the bridge in the busy city street. The tour guide explained that we have to rush going down and we have 20 minutes to take pictures and enjoy Merlion Park. At 10:00 a.m. the park was quite crowded not only with tourists but with a lot of elementary and high school students in Singapore. We had to go down the steps and up again where we came from. The park was beside a river and we saw the Merlion, Singapore's main insignia since it is known as the Tiger City...half lion and half mermaid. Several years ago, the park was a nice walk and few people can be seen. Singapore has also increased their population from a mere 2M in the 1990's to about 5M residents both foreigners and locals. You see a lot of Malays, Indians, Chinese and even Filipinos. At Merlion Park, one will see nationalities that has come to Singapore making it truly a melting pot of various cultures.
Great walk and the ultimate Sinaporean photo opportunity . Great views across the bay to many other attractions

This is not as spectacular as you think but has been emerged as Singapore icon and so can't be missed while you are here :) you can cover this place in no time and it is nearby other attractions like Flyer, waterfront walk, sands building which you will not miss for sure. So make an effort to see Singapore icon.

review_title: If you have not seen it, you are not missing anything
review_content: Merlion is a tick mark place in Singapore. Its an Icon of Singapore, so if you are vising the city state you have to have a picture with merlion. When you see it you don't feel anything like you have really been missing anything.   If you are in Singapore then get your picture clicked with merlion, but don't make any extra effort for doing so. Best approach is to stop there for 10 minutes while you are on your way to Marina bay sands.

Your visit to Singapore will be incomplete if you don't visit the iconic Merlion park and click a photo with the Merlion.. Two structures of Merlion are located in the park.. One is the original big Merlion statue and the other one is a smaller Merlion cub...Its a free attraction.. From here you can get a good view of the Marina bay sands, flyer and the central business district skyline.. It is very crowed at all the times.. But try to visit it during evenings, since its an open area without any shade and the seating capacity is also limited, so it can be really hot during day time.. You can see the light show also if you go at night..

review_title: A stop on the waterfront walk
review_content: Not worth making a special effort to see this, make it part of your night walk around the marina. Great views of the Marina Bay Hotel and Helix bridge at night from the merl ion viewing platform. However if you don't get to see it you haven't missed much.
It was my dream to be there. Dream became true. It's amazing to be in landmark of Singapore. I would be there again.

It was one of the most beautiful monuments i have ever seen in my travels...a cool atmosphere with nice pleasant weather and beautiful lights...Merlion monument is like a master piece..a true symbol of Singapore....Visit it and enjoy...cheeersss!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Neat, well maintained small area.you'll be done in five minutes.however since in Singapore one must visit it is cause:- its 'the' symbol here.the marina sands now do rob the view.it takes way too much importance from the merlion.they need to make the lion much bigger or fancier/elegant etc I would say.
So curious to take some photo here since the place so icon. This place could visit at anytime. The place commonly crowded by tourist as me.
We visited this place in year 2012. It was the sweetest place i have ever visited. The view was spectacular and the place which you can visit at any time of the day.

review_title: The LION and the Fish! MERLION!
review_content: Singapore is famous for its Merlion Park. When you go there you will realize that the original Merlion is not as big as you think. The place is crowded with tourist from all over the world. The place is picturesque. There are a lot of small eating joints around it. You can take memorable pictures around it. That is what this Merlion is for right!! A perfect view and the perfect picture! You can see a giant version of it at the Sentosa also.
Gives a nice view over the new marina bay, the Merrlion and the city skyline. Plenty of cheap eateries nearby.

Originally placed on the waterfront by Lee Quan Yew in the early 70's to welcome visitors to Singapore, it is still on the Singapore river but the actual waterfront has moved due to the massive land reclamation that has taken place since then. It is still a welcoming talisman and unique to Singapore.

It was built on a budget about 50 years ago and it's not as big as you think (bit like Tom Cruise). But it's free and there is a great view of the MBS building. If you want the best view of the area, go and have a drink or meal at Level 33. That is getting a real open air view.

review_title: Your time is better spent elsewhere
review_content: Buy a postcard with the Merlion on it. It's almost better than being there yourself. It's heavily thronged with tourists and really, there's not much to see, other than the Marina Bay Sands across the water.

The most iconic symbol of Singapore it has excellent view of the bay with Marina Bay Sands across the Bay and the art museum, durian building all there. I went in the day and in the evening and def worthwhile.
Is a must visite this site,a memorial and an iconic of singapore,and the best view for take the picture,suround by Mbs,the durian and fullerton.

My hubby and I decided to do a bum boat ride along the river, starting at Clarke quay. I'm so glad we did. This is a busy area as the Merilion is one of Singapores biggest attractions. Right outside the Fullerton hotel...we purchased the bum boat guided tour which also includes hop on/hop off, 30 sng at any of the ticketing huts along the river. The boat takes you close for photographing needs. You can get off at boat quay and walk around to the Merilion if you want up close and not so personal. We did hop off at boat quay for lunch at one of the many restaurants lining the river..we have done this twice...food pricing is high end, pub style. Hop on again tell the captain which stop you want too hop off.. Easy as. Thanks for reading my review and hope it is helpful for you. Have fun.
If you are visiting and you don't have a picture with the Merlion, then its considered that you haven't visited Singapore! Its a must see. The beauty of Singapore is 360 degree in this location.
The landmark that tell your friend and family that u have finally visit singapore. Must visit the merlion when u are in singapore
I like the view of course even if I didn't get the picture I want because there were lots of tourists that time.

Since its Singapore, the Merlion Park is the Original Merlion statue which you have to visit because its a landmark place for Singapore. Place tend to be very crowded during the day. Great pictures can be taken here. Just head to Raffles Place station and walk following the river.

review_title: Of course you have to go here
review_content: This is an iconic landmark, of course you have to go here. It is a really pretty area with loads to photograph. There's the Merlion (the symbol of Singapore) itself, but also amazing views of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, the Durian, the Fullerton, and the CBD. Photographers, go wild!
I liked the merlion park. It is unique as this is only to be found in Singapore. Should do this once in a while and it is great.

After three visits to Singapore, I finally went to the Merlion park. I think it's a good thing to do while in Singers because it is so iconic. Also, the view of Marina Sands is really good, as well as the CBD. Budget 15 minutes tops for this activity, as you're really just there to take a few selfies amongst the throngs of other tourists. Then head across the street to the Fullerton Hotel (the old Post Office), have a gander around the grand hotel, and plunk down for a nice cool cocktail :)
Well if you have been to singapore, you cannot miss the Iconic Merlion statue and get a photo in front of it. A little walk and you can also take a bubble boat to many places situated near the river

Take a boat ride and see the Merlion Park from the river it gives you a great view of this very iconic monument. It allows you to enjoy it with out crowds and interrupted views.  Then later walk around and enjoy the area from the shore.   You can't really miss seeing it as it takes centre stage.   From here you can see across the bay at even more now iconic buildings.

This park is overhyped. There's so many tourists during holiday seasons and even during non-holiday seasons, its unbelievable. Yes, you get a good view of the Marina Bay and Central Business District skyline, but honestly, you can get a good view of the city from anywhere along the Promenade of Marina Bay.

review_title: Nice place to visit in evening
review_content: The merlion park and the entire waterfront area is a nice place to visit in the evenings and get some pics clicked. There are lot of tourists here. The place also gives a good view of the marina bay sands, the flyer, and other places.

The Merlion Park is well worth the visit. It is quite something to see and the views across the bay are lovely. The area is lacking in shade and seating is limited so it can be very hot and there are generally LOTS of people there. However, we really wanted to see this Merlion as it completes the set of 3 (that we know of) for us. There is another on top of Mt Faber and one on Sentosa Island. We visited on foot and kept getting lost on the way, but eventually we found it.
clean and this is iconic place of singapore. we are happy here. it's easy place to find from MRT station. If you going to singapore, not complete if you're not going there....

Well you can't leave Singapore without taking the obligatory snap of the iconic Merlion! We spent about half an hour here before walking to see the Cavanagh bridge, Victorial Memoria and Asian Civilizations Museum (all within 5-10 minutes walking distance)

An iconic place in Singapore and it's not complete if you're not going there when you visit this country. Almost crowded all the time and sometimes you need to wait to take a good angle of your photo that you want.

We are happy to find out that Merlion Park is just a few steps away from our hotel and there is no required admission fee to enjoy breathtaking scenery. It is definitely possible to have a budget friendly trip in Singapore which was tagged as the city with the most expensive cost of living.
Had the guide take us there ,more iconic than scenic or historical.The merlion seems to be the centre of Singapore's history for when the prince envisioned it upon landing.
We visited this place at night and the lit Merlion looked beautiful against the Singapore skyline dotted by hotels and banks. The gentle breeze by the bay adds to the charm of this place.

The Icon of Singapore with Marina one side as a backdrop and the skyscrapers and Fullarton Hotel on the other and nestled in the foot of the entry to the river. Free attraction plus see the little merlion also  Can be very busy, lots of tourist pictures, selfies, water shots. Can access across the road, via the river or from the MRT and then walk. Under the bridge to the river is a cafe and gift shop which is extensive but also mostly expensive souveniers  This is the original or real Merlion as opposed to the other one on Sentosa.
Your visit in SG will never be complete without your picture taken in this iconic structure within Marina bay. One of the most tourist-infested structures!

Sure it's packed with tourists cramming to take pictures, but it's a pretty cool and unique symbol of the city. The area around and pier also offer great views of the harbor and skyline. Not the easiest place to get to as you have to go over the bridge or under it, but very cool once you get there. Snap some selfies with the Merlion.
user_location: Union City, New Jersey, United States

review_title: One of the must see things in Singapore
review_content: Being a symbol of Singapore a visit to Merlion Park housing an iconic landmark of Merlion statue located right in the middle of the park. It provides good ops for some great looking pictures and the place is always full of tourists jostling for a space to take pictures of themselves with the backdrop of Merlion to carry as souvenir's back home. Therefore if you miss Merlion on your visit to Singapore you do miss one of its signature spots.
This place is good for visitors to visit - it'll only take about an hour max, as you hang around to take photos of the famous Merlion statue and also the Marina Bay Sands and Flyer.
If you visit singapore, it is a must to see this famous landmark. There is one more of this type in sentosa but this one is within the cbd so it is easier to go here.

review_title: Free attractions you must visit in SG
review_content: The Merlion is singapore's symbol so you really cant miss this esp when its your first time there. We enjoyed the laser light show in the evening.

review_title: One of the MUST DO things in Singapore - The Merlion is iconic!
review_content: I visited Singapore briefly back in around 2007 (before I was a Trip Advisor user) and one of the things I did was go see the Merlion... Now being back for a few days I wanted to still go see this iconic Singapore landmark again.  Merlion Park is free, you have nice views looking back at the Raffles Place Skyline, it's nice to get down by the water, and there are some great photo opportunities (it's a selfie paradise!!).  Much has changed with the vista since I was here 7 years ago as the Marina Bay Sands now dominates the skyline opposite the Merlion and the Singapore Flyer was added too since I was last here... But all good visual additions making the trip to Merlion Park even more worthwhile.  Simply don't visit Singapore without going to say hello to the Merlion! It is also worth going down to Merlion Park at night as well as in the day as the experience is very different and possibly even more beautiful by night with all the lights. (There is also a light show at 8pm and 9:30pm evenings).

You've never been to Singapore if you didn't visit this place. Having a photo with the merlion is in everyone's itinerary, something you should never miss. Late afternoon visit is comfortable because its airy and not so hot plus you'll get to enjoy the city lights when its coming dark :-)

review_title: 'Must Visit' Place while you are in Singapore
review_content: This is 'Must Visit' Pace while you are in Singapore. Clean, beautiful view and the best time for visit are in the morning (before the sun come up) and around 4pm, so it's not really hot.

review_title: The Iconic Singapore symbol - the Merlion stays here!!
review_content: If you go to Singapore - or Singapura you must see the iconic symbol the Merlion - a statue spouting water that's half lion , half fish. Needless to say its a photo opportunity but nothing more than that. But what makes this place a must see is the "wonderfull light and sound" show that's broadcasted from the Marina Bay sands twice every night at 2000 hrs & 2130 hrs. The place is well connected by the MRT and buses. Another nice way to see is by taking a Singapore river cruise. A nice place to hang-out.

My friend who visited here told me it's disappointed, but I enjoyed being here, taking fun photo and rest at close cafe. This is the symbol of Singapore, and worth to visit. Don't forget to see smaller Merlion as well. It's cute.

Even if there's nothing much to do except watching and taking pictures of the Merlion. It is the symbol of singapore and has to be seen. Anyway if you're in the marina you won't be far so for me it's a must go
nothing amazing here. Came a saw Merlion because that's what you doo in Singapore. Great views over the Quay.

review_title: First place to visit when you land in Singapore.
review_content: Merlion Park is most popular attractions in Singapore. Rather Merlion is the first thing that comes to your mind when you not even planning your trip to Singapore:-) If you take 180 degree view from Merlion you will be able to watch all for which Singapore is famous. Start with Merlion, at the back Fullerton Hotel, agreat place with historic value and present charm. In front Marina Bay Sands, at right hand Esplanade theater of Durian Shape. Just next to it is Singapore Flyer. The still water due to Marina Barage. At right corner next to Marina Bay Sands, one can see the Habour Front. Singapore is important port for South East Asia. Next to it the Singapore Skyline. Almost all major banks have offices in Singapore and skyline glitters with those names at night. And at the end water taxies, which I like most.

review_title: Great Place for Photo's of the Merlion & Marina Bay Sands Hotel
review_content: A short walk around 10 minutes from either Raffles Place or City Hall MRT stations and the Merlion is across the road from the Fullarton Hotel (another great place for photo's).

Was searching for this park after my friends and I reached the nearest MRT station. I don't see any signboard leading the way to Merlion Park and was lost for almost half hours. Make sure to ask around.   It is a good spot, full of tourists capturing the Merlion statue as well as the sceneric view of Singapore's MBS and more from an open area.  Con: It is open air so I was wet during my visit because it is drizzling. Best to take an umbrella.

review_title: Been there. Have T shirt,  pleasant place
review_content: Guided tour stopped there. Worth the photo opportunity. Bought Merilion chocolates. plus icecreaam..stood in the water spray to cool off. Would not have wanted to miss it.. Brings back pleasant memories. The icecream shop has exquisite choice..take time to marvel at the 'boat design', good to be alive and well in paradise. A night time stroll and sitdown meal, coffee, icecream etc. at the Merilion, is on the cards, for next time.

Merlion park is what we mainly see in the top of travel guides of Singapore, it's almost like a simple. Hence, going there was a super cliche move to do, yet it was nice to go. Although the lion statue was much more smaller than imagined, when we went there at night it was lighted up and it looked beautiful with the skyscrapers behind.  A must go!

Never bored to visit here. I always visit this place in the afternoon or night. Many people from around the world here. I really enjoyed been here. Feel the air, feel the crowd. I had experience when merlion closed for maintenance. This is the wonderful place.
Good place to stop by and get your picture of the Merlion. I thought getting picture from the boat tour were better that the ones I got on site. It is worth it and does not take much time.

We came here before sunset and it was great! There were a lot of people trying to take pictures but it was not too crowded, you will always have a chance to take your selfie ;) We stayed till around 8:00 PM and watched the light show! Great Experience!
I visited twice and there is always a lot of people here. Great location to view the light show at the Marina Bay at night. Lots of food and bars around here

If you plan to visit Singapore, don't forget to include this in your itenerary. Stunning to visit most specially at night where you can watch their Light Laser Show (for free) just be mindful of your belongings for it tends to get crowded this is in front of the Marina Bay Sands, enjoy the stunning sunset view and the lights worthy of taking pictures that includes the Esplanade, helix bridge, Singapore Flyer. And ofcourse don't forget to take a selfie with their iconic landmark- MERLION.

review_title: Place to see Wonderful Night Beauty of Singapore...
review_content: Good for evening recreation. After watching total Marina Bay area, one can seat over there to see the beautiful night view of Singapore. Esplanade is the nearest MRT station, theater by the bay is also very nearby. This is the place where you can take picture with Beautiful Marina Bay sands and Singapore Flyer together, you can also have river cruise here... One must see this place in Singapore...

review_title: The Icon of Singapore - You need a "selfie" in front of this!
review_content: A fun and even essential part of your trip to Singapore should include a picture of you and your traveling companions in front of the MerLion. This Iconic Symbol of this amazing city is worth even a quick visit. Go after the sun is down and enjoy the lights on the harbor.   ...and keep on pedaling.
just one sentence:  THAT'S THE MOST ATTRACTIVE PLACE AND THE REASON WHY PEOPLE COME TO SINGAPORE  surrounded by skyscraper and beautiful view, especially at night when the lights up.

Anyone visiting Singapore must visit the Merlion at Fullerton Park because it is the iconic landmark and symbol of Singapore. The park also gives you a beautiful view of the Marina Bay Towers, the Esplanade and the Singapore Eye.

review_title: The essence of being in Singapore
review_content: You never went to Singapore if you haven't had a photo with Merlion. Seated in a park facibg the sea, Merlion symolizes Singapore in all aspects. People nornally go here to take a lot of photos and wait til the sun sets.

too much overrated...my friend and i was arguing should we or should we not visit this place.  we eventually visited it. well i insist we must take a selfie in front of this merlion park and then go.  there's like hundreds or thousands people there in the small park just to take pic and hang out in nice cafes.  so, done with the selfie and off we go
Any tourist to Singapore must see the Merlion. Free tourist attraction. Less crowded to see it by boat ie water taxi.

review_title: Must See as a tourist in Singapore!
review_content: Merlion is just too famous and always as an icon represents Singapore. Therefore, it always shown in your guide book. I was not expected too much but still planned it into my itinerary. However, once I arrive, I really think it's worthy visiting! The Merlion park doesn't really look like or feel like a "park" but it doesn't really matter. You can enjoy the view of Marina Bay. Moreover, there are some dining bars nearby and you can dine here while you enjoy the view. If you come here at nights , you own the best place to enjoy the laser show from Marina Bay Sands. If you love photography. You must enjoy snap ping here. There's one reason I recommend this place, it is free for entrance!

The central attraction of Merlion Park is the plain statue of a merlion (mermaid-cum-lion) spouting water from its mouth. It's usually crowded with tourists taking pictures of this Singaporean "landmark".  If you already have a full itinerary, I say you can skip this place. But if you do want to see the merlion, it's best to make your trip at night. That way, you can also enjoy the beautiful night view of the Singaporean skyline.

Singapore is very nice. The place is buzzing in the evening with tourists. There are many places to eat and the walk along the park is great. The synchronized water show is a charm and completely worth one's time. The restaurant Pita Pan is a wonderful place in that area. It serves great vegetarian food. Not a wide variety but what is available is good to eat.
Truly spectacular it is definitely worth seeing we were there during the day can't wait to get pics of a night time . The Merlion is lovely and you get a great view of marina bay
Its was great to see the Singapore mascot standing tall in the right riverside.. nice time to sit & relax.

review_title: If you can only choose 1 place to visit in Singapore, this is the place!
review_content: Merlion Park can be access by SMRT Raffles Place. It's within 5 mins walk. However, I found it was difficult to find the Merlion Park because there is no signboard to show where it is located. So basically you can have to ask people around where is the Merlion Park located.  If you want me to recommend a place to visit in Singapore, I will definitely recommend this place to you because this place is just awesome. Across the river from Merlion Park is the Marina Bay Sands. And there are many skyscrapers behind the Merlion Park. You can snap many pictures here that proved that you have been to Singapore. During the night time, there will be a laser show at the Marina Bay Sands. And you can enjoy the show from Merlion Park too. Time is Sunday-Thursday: 8pm, 9:30pm and Friday, Saturday:  8pm, 9:30pm, 11pm.

review_title: The 1st place in Singapore any Travel Guide will take you
review_content: The Merlion park is one of the first tourist place any travel guide will take you. Though the park as well as the lion is no big deal, the view from the place is worth visiting. Its a small piece of land jutting out into the lake, from where you get an excellent view of some of the tall sky scrapes of Singapore. Ok for a very quick stop over.

We like transportation system and cleanliness. Every corner of the city is amazing to take a picture. Traffic jam is not found. All of the people's activities must be disciplined, fast, and orderly. The government managed to teach the people independent by providing any information they need.

This place gives a spectacular view of the city and bay area. On one side one can see marina bay sand hotel and on other side we can see Singapore flyer and yet on other side it is the banking hub with tall skyscrapers. Place itself is normal but the view is beautiful.
360 great view. Marina bay sand, high rise building, hotels, singapore flyer, harbor and many plca, near by public transport. Try river taxi to get there, see different view of singapore
Stunning views of both the city and the marina bay area. The merlion statue is one of the Singapore icons and a quick visit to this place is really a must.

review_title: Good point to veiw Marina Bay Sand
review_content: Nice place, open area, lots of eateries and attarctions around. Easy to reach by bus or MRT. You can view Marina Bay Sand Hotel and Singapore Flyer from here. Merlion is fabulous. Very lively during evening and night.
The area was easy to go to, lots of eating places around and there was not much of a crowd but it was not as colossal a monument I expected.
Look at the merlion statue, have a drink, leave. Not so much a park as a concrete area with shops. Some nice views of marina bay.

if everyone likes to take pictures in front of the statue of Merlion singapore , I like to take pictures in the back because I think the same background with the identical twin of someone else . I love this area , a lot of people walking , cycling , and while sitting with his girlfriend , and enjoy the lake view.  regard's ronnykeff

The statue of Merlion is very popular for photo taking. The bay and the surrounding buildings are very impressive. You can also book a canal cruise from this point. It is not too pleasant when it is hot and muggy as it offers little shade. Lots of people and only worth the casual visit. Visit with other interests in mind.
