If you are already in the Marina Bay area, then it's worth a quick look to see the Merlion, which is very well known in Singapore. Calling this a park is a misnomer - it's basically a very small, paved area at the edge of the water where people gather to take photos of the large Merlion, which faces into Marina Bay and spits water, and a smaller Merlion statue, which is located nearby. There is an area that juts out into the bay and allows you to take photos of the big Merlion statue. This area is almost always crowded, so you may have to wait to get a good picture, or be prepared to be shoved a bit. You can also get a nice photo of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel across the bay, but there are plenty of other areas along the bay where you can get a similar shot that are less crowded.
U can find the merlion statue in here, the must visit place when come to singapore, but i recomended come around 5-6pm, when the weather is not too hot... Hahaa

review_title: best to visit in the evening
review_content: although we visited the park during day time, I strongly suggest photographers, if any to visit during the night. because from this location you get a clear full height view of the marina bay sands.  generally crowded place.

review_title: Of course you must see it!
review_content: It's free and iconic. Everyone is there taking pictures but that's because this is the symbol of Singapore.
After the waterfront promenade, stop there to enjoy the view! The famous symbol of Singapore is in! Take a pic' with the Merlion fountain!
It is a place where , probably each tourist is going. Near to the Metro station. A place also known as a photo point . The view of city behind the city is just awesome.

There's just a Merlion statue spitting water and two or three restaurants. The best part of it is the view towards the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. If you plan to go, pls go at night, when you see the lights of the skyscrapers too. During the day its just too hot to hang out there. To get there, you can stop at City Hall MRT and walk across the bridge ( 5-10 mins).

A truly beautiful place overlooking the Merlion, Esplanade, Singapore Flyer, Helix Bridge, Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Marina Bay Sands Theatre. Crowded even on weekdays but you have to experience it yourself to know how breathtaking the view is over here.   http://poportion.blogspot.sg/2014/08/tart-blanc-one-day-of-pretending-to-be.html

Amazingly build, peaceful place to sit back and spend your entire evening..you would have a couple of coffee shops and fine restaurants to spend your evening.. Sitting by the bay and just enjoying the sight which is so pleasing, energises your mood.. Amazing place to visit..very romantic and pleasing

This monument is amongst the most attractive attraction of Singapore. This place is quite easily accessible by MRT.You can take the MRT up till Raffles Place and then you can walk down to this place. The time taken by walking is about 15 minutes . You can also take a water taxi for Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands. Buying any souveniers can be very exhorbitant
As this is one of the iconic places in Singapore, it is worth a visit. It's spectacular at night. One could just sit and relax and enjoy the view.
The merlion is definitely a iconic symbol of Singapore. Considering the area around it is a must-see, I would recommend having a look and taking some photos - cause it's in a very beautiful area.
Must go place just for taking picture with the merlion but its Crowded! Took some time to really find good spot to take the picture.
Great place to relax from morning full of sigthseeing. Good place to take pictures of surrounding area.

review_title: The charm of the Merlion Park
review_content: Merlion is a statue of a lion head with a fish body such as, in this place many tourists visiting, this statue is actually simple but Singapore government is able to promote this place which makes it seem even obliged us to visit if we went to Singapore, if we are not to this place then there seems to be less.

review_title: One of those must-have pictures in Singapore
review_content: As a symbol of the city, we felt obliged to visit the Merlion. It's fun to see and made even better by the nearby stand selling icy treats. Great views of the Marina Bay development.

Please visit this attraction in the morning. As the day wears on it just becomes too packed and uncomfortable. We caught a taxi to the site from our hotel...close set down and easy walk to the Merlion. Also early morning is a great time to get good photos. You can catch a bum boat or water taxi from this attraction or you may prefer to catch a taxi or walk to your next destination.
A symbol, but it is better to watch at it and take photos from Marina Bay sands sky park. There are crowds of people all day and even at night!

I have visited this place twice in day time. The weather was very hot. I am planning to go there at night time on my next trip to Singapore. The place was very busy full with tourists who want to take photo with the statue. The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and you must definitely visit when you are in Singapore.
Worth stopping by and checking this out if you are around Marina Bay Promeande. Quite busy, but is free.

review_title: Can get very busy, best viewed in the evening
review_content: The Merlion can be seen from most parts of the bay so even if you weren't planning to see it up close, you eventually end up going to see it just because you've seen it most of the day :-)   It can get very busy there as lots of people taking photos, trying to get the angle right so it looks like the water is pouring on your head (I admit it, we did the same lol).  There is a new pedestrian bridge being built to give you even easier access to the area, which makes going to other parts of the bay easier.   Definitely stay till early evening when the whole area lights up, lovely skyline.
Make sure to stop over by this place during your visit to Singapore. Feel free to take as many pictures as you like. It is best to take pictures at night when the city lights up.

we are came here because we didn't go to singapore if we didn't have photo with merlion, but... it's toooo many of people and we can't get photos with just merlion and us, always with somebody else, maybe we went at wrong time.. :-(

That's Simbol of Singapore , lion country of asian. I went there every weekend, even spent some of my hours for drinking coffee at Starbuck around. Very easy to walk from durian house, you can take MRT to Raffles Place to get there.

review_title: Great place to enjoy the Singapore Bay
review_content: The Singapore Bay has a very nice view, especially during night when the city lights are visible and the Marina Bay Sands boasts its magnificence. The Merlion Park is probably the best place to enjoy the whole view.  But aside from that, there's nothing much to see here. There is only the Merlion statue, which is decreasing in prominence in the face of other iconic structures such as the MBS.  There are restaurants around the place which are great as well.

The get there it is best to use the MRT and the nearest MRT station is the Raffles Place MRT . After you exit it will take you about 5 mins to get there if you walk. It is just over seeing the Marina Bay.   The Merlion Park is a beautiful park installed with the unique Merlion structure. This statue of a creature that is half-mermaid (or fish) and half-lion attracts a number of tourists and has become a an icon of Singapore. With the head of a lion and fish-like body. It looks amazing especially in the glowing lights turned on at night.  The lion head represents the lion that was spotted by Sang Nila Utama, a Srivijayan prince.The fish tail of the Merlion represent the ancient city of Temasek which means sea in the Javanese language. It is 8.6 meter-tall and weights 40 tons.  It is 2,500 square meter park. and it is a breathtaking view of the Merlion against the city skyline and the scenic Marina Bay. The area also comprises a promontory with terraced seating, as well as a boat landing point. The park was first designed as an emblem for the Singapore Tourism Board in 1964.   One famous landmark is the One Fullerton Hotel built adjacent to the park. There are a total of 5 Merlion's in Singapore.

The Merlion, a structure which represents half fish and half lion is an icon in Singapore and is believed to be the guardian of Singapore's prosperity from any intruders of outsiders. The Merlion Park at the Fullerton Bay is a spectacular place to be in the evening to see a awe-inspiring view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel, The MBS Art Science Musuem and the Esplanade. A trip to Singapore will be incomplete without a picture with the Merlion. Best time to go is around 5PM.

Merlion Park contains the legendary merlion statue considered a mascot of Singapore, measuring over 8m high. Merlion park is very busy, so if you want to get good photos of the Merlion try taking a boat to the Park and getting photos from the boat.

Merlion Park can easily be termed as hub centre of Singapore Tourism. The merlion statue considered as mascot of Singapore and measuring over 8 m is located here. While at this park you can see the Singapore skyline from Singapore Flyer , Marina Bay Sands , Helix Bridge , Marina Bay Promenade , Fullerton Hotel and High rise buildings around it housing the offices of Banks of the world. If possible plan to visit this place twice, once during day light and once during night. Both views present different perspective. If short on time, plan your visit during night and wait for the laser show. Spectacular sight.
The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore, so you have to stop here, along with every other tourist in the country.
The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. It's simply iconic. One place that you must definitely visit when you are in Singapore. Visited in May 2013.

review_title: Not yet to Singapore without this Merlion
review_content: The view is ssooo good... This is the symbol of this tiny country in Asia. Surrounded by fascinating buildings, ancient Fullerton hotel at one side, giant frris wheel at another, and now Marina Bay Sands afar... Uniquely they decorated the Merlion in theme according to what's on in Spore. It's extremely clean... I feel not like to go again every time I step my feet on this country!

review_title: Singapore landmark with a nice view
review_content: It's really worth a visit to the Merlion. Whilst it is only a statue of a lion spurting out water, it is located in a great part of town with nice views and a great atmosphere.

review_title: Symbol of Singapore that you must visit
review_content: I could say that if you do not visit Merlion Park where the symbolized Lion Statue stands, you cannot say that you visited Singapore. A Symbol of the Lion island-country that you must see.

The scenic view of a standing Merlion statue at the river is awesome, with other visitors who stop and pose for a picture you must come early so you can take a picture at great angle Must bring umbrella, hats and fan it's hot.

review_title: Landmark in Singapore with nice view to the bay
review_content: This is the main attraction and a nice place to visit when first time to go Singapore. Main area of the Merlion statue is very clean and good to go in the evening/night time to enjoy the light show in the opposite of Marina Bay Sands hotel. Fullerton hotel is also a awesome background in the area. We took the taxi back to hotel in Clark Quay was less than 15 mins that made us feel close and convenient very much.
After the third times going to Singapore, I managed to visit this statue. But if this place became to crowded make us difficult to find spot just to take picture. At night sure this place great

Although I am a Singaporean, I hardly have the time to really visit and appreciate this iconic place of interest. I remember I once sent some relatives here to visit but it was so rush and never even had a nod with the Merlion.   Few days ago, I happened to attend a 2 day course at the nearby Plaza and came here for a visit early in the morning on the 2nd day of the course. The MRT ride was free as I alighted Raffles Place MRT station before 7.45 am. In fact, I was at the Merlion Park at about 7.15 am.   At this hour, the place was not crowded with tourists. You have the full leisure of time to walk casually along the boardway behind Fullerton Bay Hotel to the Merlion Park and slowly admiring the beautiful sunrise that was emerging out of the background of Marina Sands building. The sea was extremely calm and the weather was fine. The view at the Merlion Park was awesome and the metropolis background splendid. It was a relaxing stroll though you could still hear the sound of the car horns and noisy buses plying along Fullerton Road. I took some photos of the sunrise and the Merlion Park and proceeded to the Esplanade and walked to the floating platform (where the National Day event was held annually).   I was perspiring but my eyes and heart were captivated by the sea view as I looked from the floating platform. As the sun shone its morning ray towards the sky scrapers, the sea and the merlion park, the whole scenery was so wonderfully awesome that I kept taking repetitive shots of the place.   It was a different feeling enjoying a scenery with a natural setting and a setting of a magnificient metropolis city but the contentment and joy in appreciating the beauty appears to be the same.  It is a must see iconic place of interest in Singapore.   I will come again but will choose different times of the day - noon and night!.

review_title: Great attraction.  Go early if you want great pictures.
review_content: The Merlion is a must see icon. Took me quite a bit of effort to get this information but I managed to find out (from the Singapore tourist hotline) that whilst the park is open 24 hours, the merlion only sprouts water from 0630 - 0000 hrs (weekdays) and 0630 - 0300 hrs on weekends.. Thought I'd share this in case you wish to visit at a quieter time ..

review_title: Good to see but too crowded
review_content: This place is worth a short visit. the merlion park was too crowded when i went. You get good photo taking opportunities of the marina bay Area and the merlion . The place would be good to visit during evening hours. Avoid mornings as most of the tour groups visit during day time and you pictures will be flooded with random faces :P

I really loved the Merlion Park - the place is very scenic and provides a very good view of the Marina Bay. We visited it twice - the first time in the morning, and the second time in the evening to experience Wonder Full. Both the experiences were awesome.   It is advisable to visit the place in the evenings rather than the mornings as the city more or less comes to life in the evenings. Also the mornings are very hot and bright (especially in summers).

Anytime you go to merlion Park you will see tourist around. taking photos and enjoying there trip. the view at the Marina bay sand is great. The Other side of city is the business centre you can not miss the nice view of esplanade. Lovely place to spend your time

Merlion Park is a beautiful area surrounding with commercial buildings and hotels, there are restaurants onsite available.   Here is one the popular venue which every tourist and group likely to visit and have a pictures with Merlion!   It a great point to have some break enjoy simple food and drink and nice view!
++ its a must visit place to selfie with Merlion when visit Singapore. -- unbearable heat and crowded.
Well,the scenic view were great. We were there for a walk after Singapore Flyer~ It will be crowded but still okay. So pictures time and sit back enjoy the view. ^^

This is obviously a major tourist attraction of Singapore. The place is sure to be crowded but there's a nice view that's worth a visit. I've come to Singapore many times and still, I have to walk down here just to take in the breeze and enjoy the view of massive water.
The park is worth a brief visit. Unfortunately, the view is spoiled by that monstrous building, the Marina Bays Sands. Surely, this is one of the ugliest and most ridiculous buildings in the world.
We go to Merlion park at night...take a foto with Marina Bay Sand Hotel as a background...walking through heliox bridge

I first visited Singapore in 1998. The Merlion stood proudly on a small island guarding the entrance to the City. Since then the authorities have moved it back about 100 yards and have developed the area considerably. The Merlion is now surrounded by tourists and approached from the back where previously you could see it 'face on'. There is an extremely pleasant and ever expanding water front walk (from Fullerton Hotel all the way down to the Merlion). This should be experienced both during the day and at night. At night the Merlion is illuminated a stark white colour. Must admit to being somewhat disappointed but the Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and as such very much a tourist attraction.

review_title: good experience to visit merlion park.
review_content: come directly to site either by bus or taxi no guide needed. visit was mind refreshing for us .statue , garden , view of sea all were of worth .it is good location for photography and movie recording of your belongings.

A must visit place when we go to Singapore, cause this place is Singapore's icon. Better going there in the morning or evening due to hot weather. Many people came to visit this place, so we must queue to take a picture. And, cause I don't want to get wet...I take picture using umbrella...^_^. The view from here also beautiful. We can see Marina Sand Bay, esplanade, and Singapore flyer.

So many tourists that are pushy and rude when we were there. Otherwise it was a cool Merlion fountain. The view of Marina Bay Sands was really cool, including the rest of the Financial District. If you want to escape the tourists and the heat/rain, go check out The Fullerton. Very cool hotel.

I enjoyed watching people take photos of each other using their hands to imply the water was running into their hands...another favourite pose was of the hotel on the opposite side of the lake ...people using their hands to look like they are holding it up......I also had fun on the boat cruise... The Merlion is part of a traditional story and is definitely worth seeing.

We visited this area primarily to get views of Marina Bay, but we what we found was a delightful parkland area which had many different places to enjoy. The colourful playgrounds areas were Very nice and overall park had many different and varied plants as well. We did get some lovely photos of Marina Sands but we spent time in the park as well just enjoying it.

review_title: You should go just because you should.
review_content: There are some places that you should visit just because you are in the area. The Statue of Liberty in New York, the Eiffel Tower in Paris, the Merlion in Singapore. There are many tourist, so prepare yourself but go because you would be upset if you didn't get a picture of it for your photo album.
I make sure to visit this place during my 2nd day of visit in Singapore. A wonderful place at Marina Bay. I love it and will be glad to revisit again if given the chance in the future.
such a nice scenery to take a photo but dont take too near with the lion coz u will get wet ! and please careful the water is stink

When you're in Singapore, don't miss the opportunity to visit the Merlion. First, because it is the symbol of the country and the city view is fantastic. Bring umbrella and hat though because it is very hot if you visit in the morning.

No visit in Singapore is complete without taking a photo with the Merlion. We went there to catch the sunrise and we have the place all by ourselves. I suggest you go there early morning for it gets packed with tourists and to avoid the heat.

review_title: Wonderful afternoon at the Merlion Park
review_content: We spent around an hour at this park just going around and taking some snaps. Also not to be missed in Singapore is a Toy museum called Mint- Museum of Toys and is walkable distance from the metro station.

Good spot for take a photo. I came there after dark. N still there lots of people who take photo with the icon of singapore. Yes you can't say you go to singapore before you take photo with singa air hehehe

review_title: Really cool attraction for walking around and pictures
review_content: Could have nicer cafes nearby to sit and chill out...No shade, so BRING and wear sunglasses and sunscreen

No trip to this city-state is complete without seeing this structure that symbolizes its humble beginning as a former fishing village. Patience is a virtue here as many people at any time of the day take photos. Best capture of course is the Merlion with Marina Bay Sands as backdrop. It sits on a small park near a long chain of restaurants by the bay; so stay as long as you want, sit and relax.

review_title: A great place to spend your evening.. :)
review_content: This is a beautiful landmark which is one of the center of attraction for the people visiting Singapore. Being this much popular, its way too crowded, especially with tourists. Had to wait for 20 - 25 mins to get a good pic, avoiding the crowd. This one is has a chain of restaurants nearby. This should be combined with a boat ride through the scenic Singapore River. This place is easily accessible by Bus or MRT. Get down at Raffles place and walk towards the Merlion Park. If coming by Bus, take the bus towards Fullerton Road Direction. The night views of the Marina Bay Sands hotel and the business towers in Singapore from here is spectacular. A Must see for Sight seers.
You would not probably spend a lot of time there during the day. But morning (5am - 6 am) views of Marina Bay are magnificent.

Don't say you have been went to Singapore before you stopped your feet here.  Merlion Park is one of signature attraction in Singapore, easy access by bus and/or MRT; from the place your staying,.....  - Bus; take Fullerton road direction... - MRT; go down at Raffles Place station, here the map link http://www.streetdirectory.com/sg/merlion-park/20167_1.html  Low budget tourist can enjoy sightseeing in this park as there's no fees apply, beautiful metropolis landscape with other signature buildings/attractions surrounding as background, i.e: Fullerton Hotel, Esplanade, Marina Bay Sand, Garden by the Bay etc [you can also taking your silly memorable pictures here :p]....  As Singapore is a tropical country,... If you plan to go to Merlion Park on day-light, don't forget to bring your hat, sunglasses, sunscreen, including your own mineral water as backup and if you traveling with kids, please take good care of your kids as it is very crowded here with tourist included some construction going onsite now...  Hungry and/or thirsty, snack stall, cafes, restaurants are easy to find in this place.  If you enjoy walking,... You can also go to Clarke Quay just by following the canal with some interesting-historical building along the way....  or if you don't mind spend an extra dollar you can also go by taking one-way river cruise ticket which is enjoyable, suggest you to take this cruise at 6pm - 7pm [just before the sun go down] as the changing view-color of the day-eve will give you different atmosphere.

Merlion is an icon of Singapore, but after visiting this park, I am no further forward as to why. It is a not very good statue that sprays water. While quirky and novel, it isn't really very special. The marina itself is more impressive than the merlion.

I always thought the Merlion statue is bigger than it really is. Nothing can be said about the crowd since 'entrance' is free and most visitors tend to flock and do take photos. Would be better if all be more considerate to family & children.

To enter this area, we no need to pay any enterence fee a.k.a FREE..   We only have to exit from Rafless mrt station and walk for a while before we reach this place.  But nothing else these, beside the lion statue with the water come out from its mouth, in the side of river.  In the other side of river, we can see marina building, so when they have the laser and water fountain show, we can see from this side too.  A nice place to make picture with the merlion as background, as a memories that we already visit Singapore..^.^

review_title: Small merlion, a crowd and the heat
review_content: Among with the fascinated scene of Marina Bay, it come out as a very tiny of landmark, which is super crowed in the heat of the summer is coming. And you know, it's also very hard taking memory picture while there was tons of people open their mouth in sync with the water come out of the merlion.
I have visited the Merlion each time I have been to Singapore. It just draws you to it. Great photos to take home. Visit both in the daytime and at night if you can.

It was a wonderfull expirence going their. Standing in front of merliaon is just supeb. I liked it a lot as its a fav tourist destination. Watch it in both day and night time. For indian friends yeh nahi dhekha tho kuch nahi dhekha.

You cannot go to Singapore and not Visit Merlion Park - which is synonymous with Singapore. Absolute delight to visit it in the evening and witness the laser show as well. The Merlion itself, although not as large as Sentosa Merlion has become a symbol of Singapore worldwide. A must visit.
This is one of the icons of Singapore. Get a picture with the baby merlion...look out for it walking towards the road, away from the Big Merlion!

This place has been an iconic place and is a must visit attraction if you visit Singapore. If you have the time, you can take a walk around from the Merlion Park to Esplanade, Marina Bay Sands, Shenton Way (business district) and then back to Fullerton Hotel.  Do it in the evening so that it won't be so hot and also can take a chance to view the sunset.
The view at sunset was nice, with the Fullerton close by. Anyways, it is quite touristy. It is so hard to get a picture ...

review_title: On the delta od the Singapore river
review_content: The Merlion is a Singapore simple and it's located on the exit of the Singapore river and right in front of the Fullerton Hotel. The location provide great views of Marina Bay and it's very close to other atractions like the Raffles Hotel, Marina Bay Sands, etc.

Its just the matter of a must take photo when you visit Singapore. Nothing much except for the Merlion Statue. Its so damn hot! you may also experience river taxi to go to Marina bay sands from the park. We dont take river taxi because we have to wait for 30mins for the taxi! We decided to take mrt instead to go to Gardens by the bay. nearby merlion park is the esplanade theater, also known as Durian Complex.

It's one of the most attractive point for tourist and locals too.. Their is two merlion with lion headed body with fish bottom part. Mother merlion is facing towards sea and sucking the water from it and throwing back to the sea from her mouth. Which explains why singapore is too developed in less period of time as with the only sea water resource with best oil refineries. In short sucking wealth from the sea

There a river tour for 3 dolar single trip from fullerton hotel to merlion park. Very nice view, n lots restaurant. Near clarke quay too just walk along river side. The most attraction here is the sunset view and big merlion statue.
A good walk near the Merlion where you can take lots of pictures. this is an Icon in Spore & you wouldnt want to miss it.

review_title: Good place to start your city tour and take pics..
review_content: Its gives you a lot of photo opportunities and a good place to start your city tour. There's really nothing else to do. A lot of Singapore attractions can be seen from this one place..

This structure is the icon of Singapore. It's a must-see for all tourists and there's a history to this structure. Do read it up so that the visit will be more meaningful...   Free of charge and lots of eateries nearby.

I was here in November 2013 and it was really nice to visit this place! It's not just with the Merlion but also the surroundings which offered me a great view of a developed Singapore! Sparkle with the lights and crowned at night time!   I love to be back Singapore one day!
Plenty of photo opportunities but that's it. There's really nothing else to do and the food are really expensive around the area.

This review will be short as i dont have much to say other than 'what is all the fuss about?' My partner and i were excited as so many locals recommended Merlion Park...am i missing something? There was no park...just a monument on the waterfront which sprays water from its mouth. That's it. Thousands of people taking photos of this somehow constitutes a tourist attraction? Perhaps someone else's cup of tea but definitely not mine.
This is the symbol of SG. The only thing you do here is take pictures, spend some time and return. But a must visit if you are in SG
It is the trademark of Singapore, strategically located near Fullerton Hotel and Opposite Marina Bay Sands. Amazing place for photography.

review_title: A place to spend relaxing evening...
review_content: A park at the Bay where you get to have good photographic opportunities. Evenings are the best time to spend her where you can see the beautiful and colorful side of the iconic structures ( Merlion and MBS) of Singapore.  You do have so many restaurants, cafes, Coffee shops, Candy shop, Popcorn vendors to much and wild your time here.  Captivating overall !

Very touristy and cheesy. Maybe you could argue it's free and good for people watching - especially an endless parade of selfies. The views over to Marina bay sands are ok as it puts on a mediocre laser show.

review_title: The Merlion of the Lion City
review_content: The Merlion, a creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish, is a prominent sculpture in downtown Singapore and an icon of this modern city. No one should ever leave Singapore without taking a photograph in the famous statue of Merlion. My friend really wanted to come and see the statue so we decided to visit it first. It was very nice seeing it with loads of tourist taking pictures around and so we did also.

review_title: It´s better to go at night
review_content: Its a nice place, you must go and take the picture... we have a lot of funny pictures with my friends like if we were the Merlion throwing water... its nice at night because of the lights of the city from the other perspective, looking at the big boat building.
This is a pleasant area with great chances to take fantastic photographs. Be advised that there are loads of crowds milling around, so be patient to get that perfect picture.
It's worth a look at this attraction & a great photo opportunity but it's not really anything special to be honest.

review_title: Been there done that and got the T-Shirt!
review_content: A visit to Singapore is not complete without taking a photo of the Merlion as well as one with you in it in front of the Merlion.   The Merlion is a mythical creature with the head of a lion and the body of a fish.  The area surrounding the statue is pleasant and located on the water.   Great photo opportunity of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel.

not a long trip, take a few photos and then go have something to eat/drink. Lovely area I preferred the area around the Merlion and Fullerton Hotel to the other Quays which were a bit Like the O2 in London if you know what I mean. EndoChine and Over Easy are both good places to stop and eat or have a drink.
You cannot go to Singapore without going to Merlion Park, but don't plan on staying there for more than an hour. There is not a lot to see and once you take a few photos you will be ready to go.

A Singapore gem. Spectacular photo opportunities abound with plenty of people watching opportunites as well. Also within walking distance of the Fullerton and the Singapore Cricket Club. Train options are not that close and be cautious of the extreme heat and humidity during the day. I took a short boat ride from Clarke Quay to the Merlion and it was totally fab. Some very classy (but very pricey) restaurants and cafes can be found on location as well. Highly recommeded for all ages.

When you think Singapore the first thing that comes to everyone's mind is the merlion statue. And its a must visit mostly for its location, you could get a great view of the city from this location. You will get a good view of the Marina bay sands, Singapore flyer, Esplanade etc from this location. The place is usually crowded during the day time with all the tourists. Try to visit both daytime and evening, you will get a great view of the city during evening time with all the lights on. Opportunity to take some nice photos of the city. And if you are planning to take the ferry ride its best to take during the evening time.
Had to visit to get my obligatory photo of the Merlion - well worth a visit if a little hard to find - some clearer direction would have been helpful for getting there on foot

Where else would you want to be the moment you stepped in in Singapore? The Merlion Park is a good start to explore the area. The park has a 180-degree view of the City. It's also very clean. Sign-ages are very visible and clear.

You simply cant leave Singapore without getting a photo beside this statue. Every boat trip stops beside the Merlion for a few minutes, whether you are on a bum boat or the amphibious Duck tours. Finding it on land is harder. You have to cross a couple of busy roads near the Fullerton Hotel and Anderson Bridge. Its hidden behind a big riverside restaurant. A pier juts out infront of it so you can get good photos looking up at it. Don't miss the small Merlion cub, just behind the main one.

If you had a limited time to visit Singapore, you should at least get a picture with the gigantic Merlion. Getting there is easy enough, and is a walk from the Raffles MRT. Sadly, there are no big signs for tourists, so you'll have to rely on your map. Even if you do check the map, you might go every which way (and I got confused myself the first time), so let me give all tourists some advice to get there (if you're commuting via MRT):  1) Exit via Exit A or B 2) Go through Chevron House. At the end, you'll arrive at the road. 3) Cross the road via the foot bridge, which connects to the front of Fullerton Bay Hotel 4) Turn left and keep walking that way. By this time, you'll have a lot of opportunities to take pictures of the great view of Marina Bay. My advice is to keep walking, as you'll have a lot more opportunities while walking towards the Merlion. This advice isn't heeded at all, usually, so just have fun as you walk and follow the bay. 5) At the end of that walk you'll find the Merlion  The moment you arrive in front of Fullerton Bay Hotel, you'll probably just keep taking pictures all the way towards the Merlion, so just enjoy (no matter the Singapore heat). As an iconic statue that symbolizes Singapore, I think any tourist should come by and visit. So that your visit is not wasted, keep in mind that this is around Marina Bay, and you can definitely walk to Esplanade and have dinner at Gluttons By the Bay, or if it's still early, keep on walking and you'll end up at Marina Bay Sands. Alternatively, you can walk the other way and start out at Marina Bay Sands.  Either way, your day shouldn't be wasted if you go to the Merlion and take some iconic pictures.

The Merlion is something interesting to see as part of our walk from Chinatown to Raffles Hotel. This icon should not be missed. This is comparable to Little Mermaid in Copenhagen, Denmark. It is interesting to view but not sit and contemplate for hours. In the ten minutes we were there, we easily had our photos taken mid afternoon on this April Tuesday.

review_title: Best Place to See Marina Bay Sands
review_content: The landmark of SIngapore City at the bank of Marina Bays. Everyone who visits Singapore must go to this place. Simply go there from Raffles Place MRT station. Take your picture as much as you can. On the weekend evening, you can sit there to see laser show from Marina Bay Sands. Must see show!

The statue is unique and quite the tourist attraction. We fought through the crowds at ground level to get a picture. It is quite difficult to get an unobstructed picture. Everyone is trying to pose on the viewing platform and get a picture taken. It is quite obnoxious what some people try to do in their poses. Some were doing hand stands, taking those stupid pictures of trying to jump up in the air and time it just right. It can be a crazy area. We later took a boat tour of the harbor, and we got an unobstructed view from the water. These were some good pictures. It's very touristy. It's free. Expect the crowds.

review_title: You simply have to go otherwise you weren't in Singapore
review_content: OK lets get this straight. This is a large Merlion statue (one of five 'official' Merlions apparently) and it has water that blows out its mouth. Which on the face of it isn't that awesome. I mean the thing is big but not mammoth so it won't impress you by sheer size or anything. And it doesn't move or do anything.... apart from blow water out of its mouth in an unfaltering stream.  But if you don't go there and have your own particular charmless smile (or maybe you DO have a charming smile) then you weren't really in Singapore were you. The iconic angle of the Merlion looking over towards the awesomely impressive Marina Bay Sands. The iconic angle of the same Merlion with the financial powerhouse of the Singapore CBD behind it. The iconic angle of the Merlion with 'Durian fruit' theatre in the background. I mean, just go with the flow, join the tourist hordes and turn off your inner cynic and enjoy it.  There are nearby facilities and a very well stocked gift store, a couple of casual eateries with friendly staff and it is right near Anderson Bridge which is your gateway to the Asian Civilisations Museum. Or keep on going past Anderson Bridge to check out Clarke and Boat Quay or catch one of the tourist boats that ply Singapore River.
Beautiful Merlion is a must see symbol of Singapore. You can take a few photos and continue from there to the Flyer, ArtScience Museum, Gardens by the Bay or other attractions.

I can't believe they now call this a park and charge for you to get close. A nice, iconic statue that can be easily viewed from the Harbour and other vantage points without paying the entry fee. (Such a cynical exercise to charge for this now!)

review_title: Good to visit but don't expect to be blown away
review_content: As an icon of Singapore, the Merlion is one of those attractions worth visiting to say you've been there. Really though, it's a fairly small statue spitting water back out into the river.   Best to visit it at night as it's much prettier when it's lit up against the backdrop of the city.

Getting to Merlion Park is you need to get to Raffles Place MRT station. It is a short walk away. A visit to the Merlion icon in Singapore is a must. It is very hot during the day, but well worth it for the views. There's nothing really exciting around the icon but it is good to see.

There are a lot of tourists coming to this place. Personally, it's an okay view, not so spectacular for me. But since this one landmark of Singapore, it is a must to go here and get a picture taken. Since this is near the Bay, there are a lot more of views to look at than just the Merlion.

When you come to Singapore and you can only go for one place of interest, then merlion park is the only choice. Had appeared on videos, photos or postcard of an icon of Singapore, this place is a must go choice.
Visited lovely Singapore 4 times,every time I spend a lot of time at this symbol of the city,picturing nice photos and enjoying great view.night visit is better to avoid the hot humid morning weather

Any visit to Singapore is never complete without visiting the iconic merlion water fountain. The best time to visit is in the evenings as its cooler.   There are plenty on bars nearby around the bay and you can get excellent views of the marina bay resort from there.
We went up the Merlion which offered some nice views but otherwise the park was pretty boring. The highlight was getting there on the cable car.

If you haven't had a picture taken in the famous Merlion statue then you haven't really been to Singapore! Hehe.  This area also has a nice view of another famous site in Singapore, the Marina Bay Sands. This is just a quick stopover when your in Singapore, just take a few pics and less than 30 mins would be enough.  There is also a souvenir shop nearby which has pretty decent items as well.

A visit to Singapore is never complete without a shot at the world famous icon Merlion. It's better to visit here at night coz its hot during daytime. You can also visit the nearby bar or grab a cup of coffee or beer while you stare at the Marina Bay Sands .

review_title: A must see if on the Harbor in Singapore
review_content: This is one of the things Singapore is famous for. It's on a million T-shirts. Also it is a good photo shoot area for the Marina Bay Area. Stop and see it as you walk around the Bay.

review_title: Roar! The Merlion is the Symbol of Singapore!
review_content: While you might think that everything is dominated by the towers of the Marina Bay Sands complex, the Merlion is still the symbolic spirit of Singapore. He has a new coat of paint and he is offset by the back drop of the harbour and said towers. The walk there through the park is lovely although much like the little mermaid in Copenhagen, you'll find it difficult to get a photo without a strangers head in it...packed with tourists but hey, if you're going there, you're a tourist too! There are now surrounding cafes, restaurants and ice cream shops - all much needed as it really heats up down on the waterfront!
its a nice attraction and a photogenic place. loved the area and the view of the marina bay sands hotel across the river.
Like: the landmark of gorgeous Merlion. Night view is beautiful.  Dislike: stupid selfish tourists climbing the Merlion

review_title: Great views, perfect for night photography.
review_content: One of the things I wanted from my trip was to take some great night scene shots of skyscrapers and such, and Merlion Park did not disappoint. We went twice, and had dinner in or near City Link Mall or Raffles Place, then walked through and came out by the Theatres by the Bay. From Merlion Park you really appreciate how distinctive the skyline of this city is. The crowds are kind of annoying, but I suspect this would have been ten times worse during the day. There are a few places to eat but they looked very crowded when we went. I would say the views from the place are too good to miss though, and its nice to sit on one of the benches and look out into Marina Bay.
This place is very famous in Singapore and all most people know about it. I and my bf took many photo when we traveled here, but too noise because of a lots people

It located in best view of the Bay. Stand on the Merlion area , you can see all the bay .The nicest thing to see for me is the merlion throwing water .You can take a lot of beautiful photographs for the lifetime memories ( Nightime t is much more beautiful to take photo).

Merlion Park is basically just there for tourists, and as such is incredibly crowded. Probably the most crowded area in Singapore, actually, on a pound for pound basis.  A little known fact is that there is also a baby Merlion in the same area, but of course the main attraction is the big one that spits water into Marina Bay. You can get great views across the Marina to Marina Bay Sands Hotel, the Singapore Flyer, and the Esplanade theatres from here, and it is especially wise to visit at night so you can see the illuminations that occur, especially at MBS. Regarding food and drink at Merlion Park, well there is various small cafes, and a bar or two, although most of these bars are actually part of the One Fullerton complex, and not suitable for families with children.  Merlion Park continues under the bridge and all the way up to the Fullerton Hotel. There is also a Starbucks nearby with free wifi. This bridge of which I speak is a godsend when it starts to pour with rain, as apart from inside the bars, it is the only place to take refuge from the deluge!

Really not that much to see besides the Merlion and of course a view of Marina Bay. However, this is a must see when in Singapore and it is a nice stroll down to see it - unless it is raining of course.

This place is very famous and popular. So many tourist come here to record and save their photo , their memory in Singapore. At night time is the best time to visit here , all the light cover around the Merlion . Standing from there tourist can see the whole Marina Bay , the Maria Bay Sand , The Esplanet , even if you have time , can stay here until early morning to see the Sun Set.

We visited the Merlion Park on the first night of our family vacation. Since this is the must visit place in Singapore, do expect this place to be crowded with many people. The night scene is beautiful with many lighted skyscrapers, views of Marina Bay Sands, Singapore Flyer and Esplanade.

The place is very popular for tourists/travelers, Its nice that they have this place so tourists can visit and relax. You will never get tired of taking beautiful pictures if you visit this awesome place!
the merlion throwing water from its mouth is the main attraction of this place . the view around this place is very good and refreshing with the breeze coming from water .

There is a larger Merlion at Sentosa but this one is more famous. it's a great place for pictures at night....IF you have a camera that takes good night pics. Watch out for the spray from the water and make sure you wipe your lens before shooting, otherwise you'll end up with water spots in your pics. I would've liked to go during the day to get a pic my camera could handle and to ride on the bungy ride but we ran out of time.
It is unfair that spitting in Singapore can send you to jail, but this guy spitting all the time and he become national icon! Very Double Standard.

review_title: Spend the last night of your Singapore experience here
review_content: Each time I visit Singapore I someday the evening with the lights, the city scene, the water and a walk along the promenade. There's no better way to feel the ambiance of this great city. Now there is chance to watch the laser show including fountains and fire. A boat ride is also an option for about $22 per person $12 kids. The food is a bit dear but we found a waterfront Starbucks that served a great beef pie.

review_title: A memorable re-visit, many things change after 10 years
review_content: Was here 10 years ago and it seems the place has changed a lot. the night view of merlion park is amazing, where you can see the river side with many new buidlings like Sands and Garden by the Bay. They even have laser show over the sea and it's very enlightening. It is the trademark of Singapore and I think it's a must visit anyway!

as a traveller you have to find a good place to enjoy your vacation and i found out that singapore is best country to visit / ive been to merloin with my relatives and we enjoyed a lot of things / during our visit we took a pictures as a simple remembrance and served as our souveniers / Merlion is one of the famous tourist spot in singapore and must try are you will never regret it / my friends and i will definetly back in this place.

review_title: Bum Boat night tour with a spectacular coffee and cake to finish
review_content: We got to the bay at 6pm and ate a meal at "The Pelican" along with happy Hour,from there we watched the amazing sunset and caught the 8pm Bumboat.It was amazing as we had already viewed the laser show lights from the other side and the top of the Marina Sands but the 45 min cruise was spectacular and really fascinating commentary as you cruise along the canal.Afterwards we ate amazing cake at a shop directly opposite the ticket booth that sells gourmet cakes,A Must Try.YUM

This is Beautiful place to visit. Everyone visiting to singapore must go there. Merlion is like a landmark for Singapore. people consider Merlion a Holy thing. You can take a lot of beautiful photographs for the lifetime memories.

review_title: Must visit if you're in Singapore!
review_content: My partner and I were visiting Singapore for a few days, and as it was my first visit there, I decided to stop by the park to snap some photos of the Merlion as well as the beautiful view of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel. The view at night is much more beautiful, so if you're looking to snap some lovely touristy photos, I would recommend going at night!

review_title: A nice stop along your walk
review_content: Girlfriend and I stopped here for a few photo ops and to marvel at the skyline. Make this a stop along your walk around the bay.   You MUST do a walk around the bay. Over the helical bridge, and all the way around.
Everybody must come here for photo with her ; there a kids size behind the mother one. Many touristed crowded at evening; Good view of Marina building!!
Well if this is your first time to singapore, then this is a must visit place. Its the icon of singapore and make up for a good photo spot. There's also another one in sentosa.

Singapore's iconic statue sits right by the bay across thew Marina Bay Sands. The half-lion, half-fish statue symbolizes Singapore's vision of being the lion city and it's history of being a fishing village. We were walking from Clarke Quay towards the Fullerton Hotel and it was just right there, off the boardwalk. The best time to go would be in the evening or early morning. It was surprisingly smaller than I expected it to be, but it was still imposing. There's a viewing deck where you can take the best shots with the Merlion or the Marina Bay Sands as your background. There's also a baby Merlion a few steps behind it. And if you'd like to get another version, the Sentosa Merlion is also an attraction.

review_title: The House of Original Merlion Statute
review_content: The Merlion Park houses original Merlion statute- a lion’s head and a fish’s body- The Icon of Singapore. Situated on the Banks of Singapore River it is one of the most enchanting tourist attraction and relaxing point in the Singapore CBD, A not to miss attraction.

I thoroughly enjoyed wandering the streets of Singapore and when I finally came to the Merlion Statue I was slightly disappointed. I expected it to be a bit bigger and more impressive...however, I was still happy to see it and get a photo with it. My advice would be to go early in the morning or late afternoon. The place is swarming with tourists during the day and apart from having to endure the sweltering heat, you also have to fight your way through the crowds to get a decent look at the statue. I found the Fullerton Hotel and St Andrews Cathedral far more impressive but if you are in Singapore, one visit to the Merlion Statue is a must.

Merlion Statue is an overrated attraction opposite Marina Bay Sands hotel. It is an average attraction and should be visited atleast once when in Singapore. Best time to visit is evening, when the sun is not too harsh on top as this place is open from all sides and it can get quite warm. Evening just before sunset will give you best of both worlds - you can see around all the buildings in natural light as well as wait till the night lights of the city come on (and it gets even more beautiful).  The best part of the attraction is the 360 degree view around the statue - with the best one being towards the Singapore flyer and marina bay sands hotel. Should visit atleast once when in Singapore !

Great location. Fullerton Hotel is also worth a visit. It is the old Post Office building and the loby is great. Views around the Merlion are fab. A boat tour is also highly recommended which includes a close up of the Merlion from the water.

... the kids wanted their photos taken with this icon.  Came in the morning, had a breakfast at a nearby food court center at a carpark which is where the locals go. From there it is a walk beside the Fullerton Hotel by the riverbank and through the underpass. Real convenient with young children tagging along.  After the photos ops there is nothing much to do. Definitely a touristy destination ...

review_title: Got to see this, symbol of S'pore
review_content: Not seeing this is equivalent to not visiting Eiffel when in Paris. Nice walk around a park there. Lots of stall selling ice cream and drinks. While there, visit Fullerton.

review_title: Must visit for your Singapore picture
review_content: I never visit Merlion Park when I was a single traveler in Singapore before. I don't know why. But this time, visiting with my 4-year old, I need to take picture of us with the Merlion so He would have a picture to help him remember this vacation.  So off we go first thing in my itinerary. We get there around 5 pm. Crowded, hot and humid but we manage to take lots of marvelous picture here. With the Merlion at the background, the cityscape and on the bridge. We even spent time just to sit together on the bridge and look at the beautiful Singapore Skyline and the merlion park from afar while munching our delicious ice cream sandwich.
Try to come at morning (7-8 am) because if you come above 9 am, this place was very crowded and it would be difficult to take some picture

review_title: You Are Not in Singapore If You Will Miss the Merlion
review_content: It is a must to come here and take your souvenir photo in Singapore. It is one of the great tourists attractions on the Marina Bay Area. If you want to take a picture that it is only you and the Merlion - go to this place just in time of the beautiful sunrise. It will be quite busy and crowded starting 9:00 AM until night time. Start here and walk-around the Marina Bay Area.

The view is nice. Make For a good photo opportunity. If you say you didn't see the Merlion while in Sg people will look at you like you have two heads. While you're here make the trip worth while and go to Lady M New York for a slice of cake. It's right by the Merlion.

This park is very small. I won't even call it a park. You just get to take pictures with the merlions... There are two here... The big one and a baby one behind it! Many people missed the baby merlion and only focus on the big one.   There are many cafe and restaurants at One Fullerton near the merlion. You also get a full view of the fireworks during National Day and Chinese New Year!

review_title: Something you must do when in Singapore
review_content: I've only been to the Merlion at night but at this time it's quite magical - especially if you're lucky enough to catch the laser show at the Marina Sands Hotel opposite it. Although there isn't much to do in the vicinity other than take photos of the Merlion and it's surrounds, it is something you have to do while in Singapore as it is very iconic...and it's free so why not?!
Seeing the city and Marina Bay Sands towers all lit up was fantastic from the Merlion. Great icon of Singapore to put on your to do list.

review_title: The child in you will love it
review_content: We went in the evening and coincidentally managed to arrive just as the laser light show from the Marina Bay Sands Hotel was starting. In spite of being over-the-top, the lights were mesmerizing. You do have to fight crowds but the people-watching is excellent; you will see people from all parts of the world, all ages, all shapes and sizes and styles of clothing. Everywhere you look there's a photo worth taking. Make sure your camera is well-charged with lots of memory!
Great place to take a picture of both Merlion and Marina Bay Sands hotel at no cost at all. When evening comes this is the best place to view the laser light show from Marina Bay Sands.

How can you visit Singapore without seeing the Merlion? You can't! You mustn't! The views of the Singapore Flyer, the Helix Bridge, the Marina Bay Sands and the city are spectacular. Make the effort to see it.  And don't miss the Merlion's big brother over on Sentosa.

The Merlion Park is located at One Fullerton Road. It's a good place to chill and it's free. There you can take a great pictures near the river with the famous Merlion statue, take a River Cruise, while across the river you can see the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands Hotel. It's a bit hot and a bit crowded during the day, but it's worth your visit. I always come back to this place whenever I'm in Singapore and the view of Raffles place never fails to impress me.

review_title: Good place to chill at no cost
review_content: Located at One Fullerton and facing the Marina Bay Sands hotel, you can get a good sight of the Merlion statue by sitting on the steps beside it and at the same time catch the laser lights coming from Marina Bay hotel. Best to visit at night to view the laser show.   If you're into night life then Butter Factory club is located at One Fullerton as well. You could kill two birds with one stone by visiting the Merlion just before a good party time.

View where Merlion is front and Marina Bay Sands Hotel back is probably the most photographed in Singapore. So this is kind of a must and therefore place is usually crowded. Good tip, take water taxi which costs only 3 SGD and you end up next to Merlion

Well nothing much to do but you can see the Singapore Flyer and the Marina Bay Sand Hotel! Its just amazing and you can take lots of pictures! its best to visit at night where everything is glowing which makes it more amazing!

You will get a nice photo of the Merlion and see across Marina Bay. It is nice to visit at night. There are droves of people there during the day. It is a major stop for the tourist buses. It is better to take a river cruise or go to the gardens on the other side of the bay.

There's nothing much to do here but take photos of the merlion statue. It probably is not worth the walk, especially during the day when it gets really hot in the city. However, it feels like any Singapore trip is not complete without a photo of this iconic statue, so we still went to visit this park.   The main attraction here is the merlion statue, but the place itself offers a great vantage point from which to view both the Marina Bay Sands and the other buildings across the river. The sight is spectacular especially late into the afternoon and at night.However, the place can be crowded with tourists, and it never runs out of people. Crowds stay in the area for hours, and it can get a bit noisy as well.  If you want to just take a photo of the merlion statue, without having to compete with other tourists and scuffling with crowds of people, take the Singapore River Cruise from Clarke Quay or Boat Quay instead. The bumboat stops for a short while near the statue and from here, you can take photos from the boat without much obstruction from the crowd. It's perfect to visit the area in the afternoon when it's not so hot and the color of the sky reflects on the surface of the water. It's such an amazing sight that one should not miss.

Whenever Singapore came into my mind, automatically the image of Merlion used to craft into my mind. So, the day I visited Singapore, we rushed for Merlion plaza to see it. Its a nice place to hangout, to click some pictures and to buy some souvenirs.

its a must visit place, but after all, just looking around less than an hour. took photos about 5 time and thats it. im prefer marina bay, which is perfect for taking photos, and hang out with friends.

review_title: marina bay casino is the main star of this area!
review_content: Before the Marina bay development of the casino and hotel etc the Merlion was a photo shoot but the years have made this statue a small piece of history which if you are in the area take a photo, it is not worth a specific visit just to see it. in the last 10 years, Singapore has exploded and with so many iconic buildings! bars & shopping malls etc to visit! the Merlion is no longer a tourist magnet just another photo on your trip of the river views.

It's a must visit place if you go to Singapore. I think the best time to go here is in afternoon. Watching the other tourist taking pictures and a very calm water in front of the merlion statue. There's a public toilet near the food stall but it's so dirty. The flush button didn't work and smells so bad. Don't forget to prepare comfort shoes, because a lot of interesting place nearby but you still have to take a walk.

I liked this place as i could satisfy my hobby for photography, as i could take picture with Lion Statue, Singapore River, Floating Boat on Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Esplanade and Fullerton area and of course enter to this Park is free of charge. I disliked for the weather in daylight as it was too hot and sunny, so our body would be sweating.

review_title: An icon which must be visited
review_content: People say you have not been to Singapore if you do not see the Merlion. Statue of lion-bodied fish that became an icon of Singapore is definitely a tourist destination.  Try visiting this statue by walking from the esplanade, then you will get a spectacular view of skyscrapers.

A visit to Singapore, is not complete without a visit to Sentosa Island. Especially the chairlift to get there was enjoyable. And at night when the lights go on, you wish you didn't have to leave. Bring your walking shoes and a good mood as you are not alone...
Had a fab afternoon with friends just wandering around people watching. Recomended one at least 1 visit to Singapore.

If you haven't been to the merlion park, you haven't been to Singapore! It's a must go attraction for travellers in Singapore! A day trip gives better photo taking shots of the river views together with the merlion.   Don't fret if u come night time. Turn behind and you will see the fullerton building in it's grandeur, all lighted up at night.

Merlion park has become an icon of Singapore since long time ago. It is a place that must be visited and very crowded, especially in the holiday season. We went there in the morning, fortunately the weather was quite cloudy, so free from overheating. Do not forget to wear a hat in the summer. You can have a lot of Singapore's iconic building view from here.  The place is suitable for all family members.

review_title: A must go place when u'r in Singapore
review_content: I've been to Singapore for 6 times and this place is a must vista place for me whenever I'm in Singapore. I usually come there in the afternoon, buy a chilli crab hot dog with a Starbuck coffee, sit on the steps and watching the Marina Bay as well as the Merlion. The feeling is great even though are many people around. Imagine how great it'd be when you with your beloved one sitting there enjoying sunset. There are some restaurants and food stalls around so you can buy something while enjoying the view.  How to get there? There is City Hall MRT nearby or you can go by bus or taxi. My recommendation: using water taxi at S$3/pax drive you through Singapore river to the bay and the last stop is at Merlion. If you have more time, this will be the best option.

Between the Merlion and the Sands hotel, this inner harbour has unique views and things to see. It is not truly a park but rather a walkway around a very artificial "harbour." This is a must see if visiting SIngapore but after 5-10 minutes, you will want to move on. There are a few cafes and a large souvenir shop that has a large variety of typical souvenirs.

review_title: Best photos of Marina Bay Sands
review_content: There is no news that the Marina Bay Sands are arguably becoming the most representative landmark of Singapore, the equivalent to the Petronas twin towers in KL. Lacking an inpressive harbour compared to HK or Sydney these towers are the perfect complement to this bay and there is no better place for a photo than the Merlion Park. Furthermore the Merlion represents the history of Singapore so this place trully combines the past, present and amazing future of this city. There are some eateries and a really good souvenir shop.

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore. Lion because Singapore is the Lion City and merman/mermaid because the fish represents the early fishermen of Singapore. The place is quite crowded with tourist since this park is a great opportunity for picture/photo taking. You will have on your background besides the Merlion is the facade of Marina Bay Sands, the Singapore flyer and the tall skyscrapers lined up. Just a walk from Fullerton Hotel. If you are taking the MRT, get off at Raffles Station. It is just a mere 3 minute walk to the park. Enjoy!!!

Nice place but crowded anytime of the day as its one of the major tourist attraction.. Click snaps around the statue... You get a nice view of the entire sea and feel peaceful.. You can spend just abt less than an hour here...

review_title: It's a nice place to visit
review_content: Merlion park is the sympol of Singapore. You can take a boat to go round the bay and take some photos. There are lots of view for you to capture.
If you travel to Singapore, do not miss this place. This is the first place you must to visit after leaving Changi Airport. Bring a camera because it's photo time:)
After 20 minutes took dozens pictures here, we feel bored, nothing to do except see the view of marina bay sands and took pictures with the lion statue. My friend went to the toilet and it was dirty!

It was a nice experience with my friends to been there! The landmark of singapore! Good time during the day must be 5pm til night so you can see the difference between day and night, both are amazing. Little thing that make me inevitably annoyed is that it was too crowded. Thus, this will make you harder to take a photograph. However, overall, i enjoy it
nothing special about this place, other than you get to take picture with the iconic lion of the city. once took the picture, we just left to find other more interesting tourist attraction.

Entire Singapore is a marvel. It is very clean and neat. The roads, the metro ,the mall and the various sight seeing places.People r very courteous and friendly. The Merlion park is a very beautifully located and a wonderful piece of art. The entire promenade is so beautiful that u don't feel like moving from there. There are lots of restaurants at the venue but at a expensive side.There is a laser show in the evening from the hotel shaped as submarine opposite to the part,its quite a spectacle. park is well connected by metro and buses.
A must visit place in Singapore. Should go during the evenings / night to experience the night view and enjoy the breeze

review_title: Stop by while strolling the Marina Bay area
review_content: The name is slightly deceiving - it's not really a full park as much as a platform that juts out into the water for photos. Definitely stop by here to take some pictures and appreciate the views. I came here while walking along the water in that area and spent probably 15 minutes total by the Merlion.
Bring umbrella whenever you visit Merlion, in Summer it is hot and sunny, and in in winter it is rainy, Merlion is the most famous landmark in Singapore, sometimes the place is crowded too.

review_title: to complete your trip to singapore
review_content: A must see...your singapore trip wouldn't be complete if you dont visit here. a vantage point for the esplanade theater, singapore flyer, marina bay sands hotel...and oh! you should try wall's ice cream sandwich or ice cream wafer...

I went there, Finnaly. there is a lot of people around there. It's nice place for photo :) There has a restaurant, souvenir shop (is more expensive than you buy in outside of Merlion, but you can get unique stuff).. It's not to far also with Singapore flayer...

We went there with an elderly person with limited mobility, it was raining very heavily and we took shelter in outdoor dining area of crab deli restaurant. There weren't any customers and the outdoor dining area was detached and little bit further away from main restaurant. Despite of that, a waiter came al the way, asked if we want to order anything. When we said no, he plainly said "take your belongings and please get out". We were forced to order some hot beverages.  Otherwise a great place for some fantastic Kodak moments. Don't miss out night time lights. There are no vegetarian food available nearby except at Starbucks located under the bridge between Merlion park and Esplanade (durian/jack fruit shaped buildings).  The best way to reach there is to alight at one Fullerton if coming by taxi or alight at raffles place MRT when coming by train. Take exit H when alighting at Raffles place MRT. There are air conditioned pedestrian subways and overhead bridges all the way from Raffles place MRT to one Fullerton. Merlion park is just 100 meters from one Fullerton.  One Fullerton is different from Fullerton hotel. The are both across the road facing each other.

review_title: Most most famous landmark of singapore
review_content: Always lots of people around here and take photos, but it still deserves a visit otherwise it would be a pity leaving Singapore without the Merlion.

review_title: One of the best place in Singapore
review_content: Its one of the best place in Singapore.. I will suggest to on a week day evening instead of weekend .. there is a good sit-out area.. Its cool and calm place ... must visit in SG

review_title: Hard to find, but worth the view
review_content: The Merlion might be Singapore's most famous icon. For tourists, it's recommended to at least see the statue of the Merlion, which has the Marina Bay Sands as its background. We went here at night and the display of lights are just beautiful.

there really isn't much to do here but to get one of the pictures you've got to get from Singapore :) It's crowded all the time and if you want to get some good pictures of the Merlion itself there are plenty of other good spots from where you can snap a picture of it.

review_title: I found it a bit tricky to find
review_content: The travel information I got for the Merlion Park was 'Take the MRT Green to Raffles Place Exit H towards United Overseas Bank (UOB) Plaza and from the middle of the plaza, you'll see Fullerton Hotel. Merlion Park is immediately behind it.' We got off the MRT and headed towards the river front and saw the Fullerton Hotel on the right. We headed toward the Hotel and went NE and then hit a very big street (Esplanade) and finally spotted a sign across the street that said Merlion Park. There is an underpass to cross the street to reach the park. It paid off because the Merlion with the Marina Bay Sands in the background is a beautiful picture worthy site. Very iconic scene of Singapore.
went to this place twice on my first visit to SG. just love the sophisticated view of skycrapers at night. and must take a photo with this famous mermaid-lion!!

review_title: It was a treat to my eyes!!!
review_content: After three years went this week to my favourite singore city wow!!what a delight to be again in the lap of your loved places,merlion park,little India,china town,esplanade and many others in just two days!!merlion park is famous for its water sprinkling cute lion that symbolises the happy,powerful and growing Singapore.the showers on the day made it pleasant as the weather was as usual humid.people gather near by the merlion to click beautiful pics at night the merlion shines bright and marina bay sand 's light show makes it more charming.the constant water sprinkles coming out of merlion mouth let me feel as if the whole sea is being thrown out by this cute little thing.the sea,the little one more merlion behind the back of the big one was peeping through naughty ad if saying we will play on go hotel and sleep or you will miss your flight back to your destination!!!!

review_title: full of people who take a pic
review_content: It was at nite when im reach this park with my friend. That was really tired but happily, because we re already walk from Bugis area to this park. That could be beautifuly if we re come on evening, the sun still have a red rays combine with the modern building also. Still have question, how come all the people come in here, always bring camera either from the cellphone or they are really bring camera. Seeing arround, beside the icon of Singapore that placed in here we can see the sky building arround this place. I get the panorama picture, which is good from side to side for all building and this merlion also.

Come here at night to view the spectacular laser light show. Enjoy the hot humid air blowing onto your face. Expect a crowd since this is a top tourist attraction. Take a ferry to the other side for a different angle of the park

review_title: A good place to spend an evening
review_content: This is a place where it is very pleasant to spend time in the evening. The cool spray of water from the Merlion and the breeze makes sitting here very comfortable. There is nothing much to do, so if you are looking for a photo opportunity it will take you 5 minutes. On week ends it can be crowded with lots of visitors and tourists. However if you want to leisurely spend some time looking at the marina bay and the water and spend some time chatting away with friends and family, this is a good place. There are a couple of eateries and also a ferry ticket point. lots of space to sit. The younger kids do tend to get bored easily and can pester you if they do not have something to do on their own.

it's the of s'pore and a distinctive statue, with a fountain, and d identity of it...merlion, half lion half mermaid...wow, it is adjacent to marina bay and it's a good opportunity n venue to take some pictures. you can also stay from evening to night to experience the day to night scenery changes of the city. it's a very good spot for scenery shooting

This is a place where you can put "Hello, I've been in SG" over your head. You can take photo here, with Merlion background. Also, there's other spots for your eyes pleasure. It's a must to visit here, especially for the first timer like me.

review_title: A Singapore landmark and photo opportunity- overlooking Marina Bay and close to other attractions
review_content: The Merlion is an icon of Singapore. It's a large and distinctive statue, with a fountain. It's located on the waterfront, and adjacent to Marina Bay.  I would include a visit on a day tour- or even at sunset or during the evening- you can see the nightly light show from here.   There are other attractions in the area- going one way is Marina Bay, and the other way there's Clarke Quay. The a Fullerton Hotel is not far away- a good place for a luxurious buffet lunch!  Nearby there are several dining opportunities.  If you go on a Bumboat cruise, they sail past here- presenting a photo opportunity.  Well worth a visit- as part of a day's sightseeing. Entry is free- it's an open monument.
its the place to get your "I went to Singapore photo." beautiful views of the Marina bay and the hotel. its definitely the one place you have to visit in Singapore.

Visited on 17/11/2013,was a cloudy,showering rain day so was very cooling for taking photos.There are 2 Merlion statues, the original stands 8.6m tall,another is 2m tall cub statue standing behind the original statue.The 8.6 Merlion statue is facing the Marina Bay Sand,which is a great place for taking photo.A great scenery.There are so many ppl taking photos, so there will be definitely some other person in your pic.From Esplanade bridge,you can take the whole scene of Merlion Park n Marina Bay Sand.Anderson Bridge is juz above it.

When u go to Singapore, u must at least take a photo here. It's like a stamping in ur passport. We were there during weekends n there are a lot of people taking photo. U might not get the right spot for ur photo but as long as u get the Merlion into the picture, it will worth it.

The park it's self is nothing much more that a concrete area and a lion head with fish body fountain, but it provides one of the best places for photos and the tourist buses lining up show just that. Worth a walk through with camera in hand, you will get the photo you will be showing your friends back home.

Merlion stands majestic facing the Esplanade. Best reached by a ferry ride down the river, one can hop out for a closer view. Merlion park is a must see for anyone coming to Singapore. It's a good place to click pictures of the Singapore skyline, or grab a coffee at the nearby restaurants.

I just walk through it from Esplanada to the Lau pat Sa, So, just take some photos with it, and it's bother (the Marina Bay Sands BLDG.) or you can see the Fullerton Hotel just in front of it too. It's not a MUST GO place on my plan, but just you always walk through it.
if you want to take a photo or just spent some time, better come at night when the weather is friendly and the view of the surrounding is beautiful e.g. the lights, the building.

review_title: Take a photo with the Merlion
review_content: Our family visited the Merlion Park in March 2013 at dusk. Although he's quite popular with the tourists & the crowds, he's a must visit! We took pictures of the Merlion from the ferry and from the pier, to ensure the two vantage points. We suggest you dine near the Merlion Park, or have some ice cream as Marina Bay is stunning to see!

Make sure to vist Merlion as it's the best place ever. Your visit in Singapore won't be complete if you don't see Merlion. We were there at night so the view is amazing. All lights were lit, so windy, and safe to walk around. We were delighted to have come to this place.

a good view with a clear water , such a lovely places to waste your spare time in afternoon. But it's one of the most singapore's famous icon so everybody comes here, just take your time and enjoy the crowd..

Merlion Park was a nice place to visit. You cannot miss the white lion statue with water spouting out of its mouth, it over looks the Marina bay area which has the Marina bay sands hotel which is truly and amazing sight. It was heavily crowded the day my wife and I visited but it was well worth it. Like Singapore it is very clean and very humid but the humidity does not stop you taking in the views of the whole area. You should visit Merlion Park if you are in Singapore, it is a very nice place.

Merlion park is the icon of Singapore. It's a must visit place especially if you went to Singapore for the first time. Actually, this was not a 'real park' where you could sit and relax. It was just a location where you can take pictures with Merlion. Don't forget your hat and mineral water. It was very hot in there. Recommended length of visit would be less than 1 hour. It was a very small location.  How to get there? You can take MRT and alight at Raffles Place, Exit towards to UOB Plaza, and you will see Fullerton Hotel. Merlion park is located behind the Hotel.

Before the opening of the Gardens by the bay the Merlion Park was the only 'motivation' for me to go visit Singapore, anyway this is a landmark you have to pay a visit. It is always packed with people especially during the night time.

review_title: Very nice place to visit with stunning views
review_content: The Merlion Park is a very nice place to visit. Opposite The Fullerton Hotel, which was great for us considering we were staying there, and overlooking the bay with the big wheel and Marina Bay Sands in the background. Also good at night with the lights on
