review_content: Finally got to see the Merlion without having to go to Sentosa. Even though it was overcast and raining, the white statue looked stunning as it poured water into the bay. Would look better on a sunny day, but we were very happy nonethelesss

Most cities have an iconic building or structure you need to visit - this is the one in Singapore (among with a few others!). It has a great position on the water front and provides a great place to appreciate all the Marina Bay Area.  The statue and fountain aren’t as dramatic as I was expecting but it was good to visit just the same.
The statue is bright white and very well lighted. This spot is one of the highlights of Singapore and definitely worth a visit.
Iconic statue great place to get a picture ! Have you been to Singapore if you haven’t visited the merlion? 😂

Great views of bay and Marina Bay Sands property in backdrop. It does get crowded but there are many angles to pick from. Venture under the bridge across the street to purchase local fruit or chilled coconut water from refrigerated displays. Well worth it and affordable and shaded!

Visited Merlion park opposite the Fullerton Hotel it is a must see place but is very busy and you have to be prepared to take time to get the best view and photo opportunity but well worth it and it’s free to see
Tourists favourite place and I think this icon is on the list of most tourists who come to Singapore as their must to visit place in Singapore.

Must place to click your picture with the merlion 😜  Its just an photoshop for all tourist. You will see all people around you would be busy with different pose to capture the picture with water falling from the mouth of merlion.
Liked this place. View is nice.. Wanted to see this statue here. Its same as i saw in images. View from this location is also pretty good.

This is such an icon in Singapore you ha e to go and see it. There are great views over the river to the hotel that has a 'boat' on the roof and the park with the flowers. It's very busy but a must see
This is an iconic Singapore landmark. On a hot day, if you are lucky, you can get a little spray of cooling water from the mouth of the MerLion. Usually crowded - but great photo spot.

review_title: Picture perfect view – The Merlion Park
review_content: This is one of the most visited among the tourist places in Singapore. If you are visiting, you need to take an obligatory photo in this park, for it is the most known landmark in Singapore. They create most of the souvenir items based on the merlion image, making it uniquely Singapore. Best time to go is before the sun sets, around 5-7pm. From Esplanade’s Durian shaped theatre and concert hall, there is a bridge solely constructed for the tourists to take pictures.

Did this on a guided tour, but it is somewhere that you can come and do at your own pace. And if we where to return, that is what I would do. There is lots to see and do here and we only scraped the tip. A visit to the aquarium was lovely. But as I had an elderly person with me, a few extra seats about the place would be wonderful. The Restuurant in the Aquarium gave us the opportunity to have a lovely "cup of tea". Thank you for that.
Your visit to Singapore is not complete without visiting Merlion park.its monumental and big.Great location for fantastic view of the city.Great selections of resturants and cafe alongside the park

I suggest you to go there in the morning to avoid too many tourists taking photos. This is the landmark of Singapore, if Merlion park was not included in your itinerary, you've never been to Singapore 😊

The Merlion is the icon and ideal post-card spot for anyone in Singapore. Apart from being a tourist attraction, it doesn't offer much. It's hot, humid and eateries around are over-priced. The view is great but otherwise there's nothing else it offers. Not worth a visit other than from a tourist perspective as a must do on the regimental list of attractions.
Many tourist take picture here.  Don't forget to gear up your gadget if you want to take selfie or wefie, not all people willing to help you take a picture 😎

review_title: Probably The Most Famous Attraction In Singapore
review_content: If you made it to Singapore, go see the famous Merlion. Always busy with lots of people so just take the picture with everybody else. Situated on the bay also gives you a great view of the entire bay. If you are an adventurist, you can go seek out the other Merlions scattered in Singapore.

The Merlion being the symbol of Singapore is situated at a historic location. It is a spot to appreciate the history of Singapore and te view the Marina Sands Complex and skyline of the city. It hard to believe that this area was the coast before the reclamation took place. Clarke Quay is just a short walk from here.

review_title: Worth a visit only in Night
review_content: This is situated right on the Riverfront Bay Area. This place needs to be visited in the Night will the whole SIngapore Bay Front lit up. You can also take a River Cruise ride which give you a wonderful view of the City Bay Front.
The perfect spot to click a picture to say you have been to Singapore!!  And also a lovely view of the Marina Bay hotel.
Must visit to be the real tourist. Great location for a chill out. Great eateries close by. Sat around and people watched for a while
visited the place, it was awesome, the famous lion of Singapore, lots of tourist in this part of singapore

review_title: Dont need a trip for this.
review_content: The Merlion is very symbolic of Singapore but you need not spend a trip to visit. If you are somewhere around Marina Bay, you can view the Merlion from a distance. To avoid the crowd and the heat in the day, it is better to visit in the evening.
A must see to all visitors/tourist of singapore. It is nice, you can see the view of Marina Bay Sands, Flower Dome, Flyer and one and only the Merlion 👍🏼👍🏼

review_title: The Merlion an Icon of Singapore
review_content: The Merlion is probably an icon of Singapore, you have to visit, the park has great views of Singapore Skyline. It is a great spot for photos.
Here you can take a pict with singapore icon and spend free and relax time, they have a couples of convenience stores and fast food restaurants. But thats it 😁

We came to spend a few hours and had A great experience by seeing all the attractions. Everything is well set and arranged, super clean and also culinary offers are available. Maybe not for a short visit in Singapore but for sure to spend an extra day

review_title: Nice place to relax and enjoy photo taking!
review_content: We enjoyed photo taking with statue and surroundings. As we've visited at evening, the weather is pleasant and I think this place should not missed when you visit singapore as it is the iconic symbol of the country. The scene around the statue is nice.
Cruising around the marina we had a lovely view of Merrion park for the cruise. Evening was busy but enjoyable, love guy show was entertaining
Fun iconic Singapore site. Busy on the weekend. Nice views and some shops and restaurants near by. Worth a visit!
Why is everyone standing with the quite small statue and taking selfies? Bit of a downer but a nice walk around the harbour

review_title: Best Place -A Depiction of Name " Singapore".
review_content: We have been to this place in a taxi from Alexandra Road where we were staying. In the evening there was a lot of rush of joggers, tourists taking pictures here and there. There were cane juice and sweet corn kiosks, tea was also available at nearby hotels. Tea tasted just like Malaysian tea. There were many beautiful and colourful lights were added to enhance its beauty more. We stayed there for attending a live musical concert. It was a nice experience.

It was an amazing experience. We went there in the night, view was amazing.  There are food outlets near the park you can enjoy mouth watering food. Food is not that cheap but it's reasonable.lovely place to visit.
Take the time to see this beautiful aspect of the bay and lion. Great spot for photos of the bay and high rise buildings.
We had a few hours in the evening and decided to spend time outside the hotel. Merlion was our choice being a popular spot. Take pics. So many places to eat around.
The Merlion was under renovation when the visit was made in February. Many uptrend cafes in the complex.

One of the best attraction and iconic symbol that you must visit in SG. You can sit and relax and enjoy the view of Marina Bay and best place for taking photos. We visited it at night (to avoid getting tanned) and the weather is good so we stay here for 3 hrs.and luckily ended up watching fireworks display at 9pm I guess.After a long walk you can go and dine at night market on the other side and choose what to eat/drink with a friendly price 😉 and enjoy the music and vibe of the place.
The small Merlion was available the larger one was closed. I had heard so much about it I was expecting more. However the architecture around the area was AMAZING!!

review_title: Light show and lots of walking
review_content: It's on the sentosa island. There is a 10 minutes light show in evening which is great. The merlion statue is huge and there is ample area of relaxed walking. It is a great cool natural oasis in the hustle bustle of the city.  Perfect relaxing destination.

What a bummer, this lovely lion on its bath time, well there's nothing we can do, so my friend and I just snap some pictures around, and it's nice too, around the Lion Statue, you can find many cool and nice place to sit around, staring and admiring the river, the scenery, do some pictures taking, and we're visiting this place like 3 times in 2 days ^^ my feet kinda want to give up.  You can find the little lion in the back of the bigger one, it's not far.  At night, when we arrived, there's mini concert, well we don't know about it, but it really lift up our tired feet, thank you. we take the pictures of magnificent sparkling building, bridge, and river, so cool.
We were expecting this to be a great photo and how surprising to see most of it barricaded up for repairs. I believe it should be operating by March 2017

Merlion Park is very accessible. You can walk from the bay and it will take you maybe 10-15mins to go there. It will not bore you because the lights of the hotels around the area are nice in the evening. There are really plenty of tourists there. Make sure that you check with the hotel's concierge if Merlion is open. The first time that we visited singapore, it was closed for maintenance. Lucky that i came back so I managed to have a selfie with the lion!
If you are in Singapore and haven't visited Merlion Park means you haven't seen Singapore 🇸🇬. Superbly recommended place for family and friends.

Calling this a park is misleading. It's basically a fifteen foot tall statue outside a swanky shopping area.  The lion wasn't spitting water when I was there.  The view is nice, but no better than dozens of other places along the waterfront.  All in all, I was annoyed that I made the long walk here, as Singapore cabs are useless and all.
This is a must if this is your first visit to Singapore. Not only for the statue but also for the view! You are able to take the very nice River Cruise from here, S$25 p.pers, 40min.
Merlion where all tourists will be going to. The history of Singapore & further the less if u never visited the Merlion it's mean that u have not yet reach Singapore 🇸🇬
Merlion shouts Singapore. nice place to spend time, to take selfie or just to sit n chat with other visitors.

This tourist attraction is strategically located as being here gives an awesome view of The Fullerton, Marina Bay Sands, Esplanade and other nearby landmarks. This is also locates near restaurants. Expect this area to be almost always crowded.

It is pointless to attempt to review Merlion Park from an artistic sense - it is much bigger than that. The Merlion is at the very heart of Singaporean history & culture and we tourists ought to visit it for this reason alone. As it happens, it's also a very beautiful and peaceful place.

review_title: A must visit for 1st time visit
review_content: Merlion park is a must visit if you are 1st time in singapore. Merlion is a half fish half lion statue. If you are in a group of 4 i am suggesting ride a taxi much cheaper than mrt.
Nice place for photos but there are just too many people there. Seems like all the tourists visiting singapore are brought to this place. You can see Marina Bay Sands from this place.

From Garden by the bay we went there directly,we entered marina bay hotel and shoping stores passing through the Helix bridge its great experience even I'm kinda tired. Many people also visit this site. Bring some water to drink 💦
Merlion Park and the actual Merlion is a great place to visit. Located conveniently close to MRT for transportation. Gift shop available as well.
Merilion is considered as Singapore's indetity. This place is one of the popular tourist spots, and best for taking snaps. You can be as creative as posisble.

review_title: Great place to relax with some good views
review_content: After a long walk in the city, this was the best place where I was able to relax a bit. You can have a good view of the Marina Bay area and the place has many restaurants around for a good meal looking at the Merlion statue.

review_title: Must visit place if you are in Singapore
review_content: A very lively place with people from many nationalities hanging around.. busy in taking pics, enjoying their moments and keeping memories for life. Multistorey buildings, bay and water bodies add on to the attraction of place. Although a bit crowded in evening but If one is going to Singapore for first time than it is a must visit place...

review_title: Not much to see or do
review_content: This was listed by many as a must see, so we obeyed. An average sized statue surrounded by over priced vendors. If you're in the area, check it out. Otherwise, this is a definite meh. 😴

review_title: This is the picture which says Singapore!!
review_content: This Merlion (Head of Lion and Body of Fish) is the symbol which we have been watching since childhood to depict Singapore. This park is small park having this Merlion Fountain and few restaurant. One can spend 30-45 min approx and have the pictures clicked. The place can feel heavy rush on weekends.

review_title: Nice for a stroll at night
review_content: At some point all visitors to Singapore end up here. I recommend going in the evening to see the lights of the city around you

I was here as a part of the half day city tour. The stop here is not a long one and u get abt half hr or so to visit if ur part of a group. But it has merely 2 merlions( half mermaid half lion) here..the mother and kid.the mother has the fountain flowing from its mouth which is a good picture taking spot.the father merlion is situated in the sentosa island.although no fountain from his or the kids mouth. Overall a good visit.
A nice place to take your picture. Although the restaurant or food stalls sell drinking water at a very high price. 😂 limited choices for restaurants tho marina bay is just near the area.
The Merlion is certainly smaller than I thought it would be. It's a must see though and to be honest a nice walk around Marina Bay to see tge Merlion.
I went there at night and the view was amazing! The city lights and the beautiful waters were awesome sights! Spent 3 hours taking pictures, strolling and even sat down and had a long talk!
The mythical Merlion with the head of a lion and the body of a fish is Singapore's national icon. A must see especially at night..
If you went to Singapore and never went to see the Merlion then you didn't really went to Singapore 😅
It was really my dream to see the lion amd mbs shopping plaza markete and flyer of singapore it os very good place to visit

A must see  Great view of the marina and the statue half lion half fish water coming out of his mouth   Don't be fooled like my Friend Ty thinking the little one in the courtyard is it, it is on the water front LOLZ
Nice view towards Marina Bay. But quite crowded as it's still one of Singapore icon. Would be nice if completed with reasonable amount of light on the park.
One of main destination for tourists 😀😀 Spent an hour here taking pics and enjoying the view of the city. So crowded even on Monday!

Located in front of Fullerton Hotel and overlooking Marina Bay, the mythical Merlion with the head of a lion and the body of a fish is a must-see! It stands tall at 8.6 metres and weighs 70 tonnes. Other Merlion statues can be spotted here: there’s a giant version on Sentosa, one at Tourism Court near Grange Road and another at Mount Faber.

review_title: The most iconic place to visit in Singapore
review_content: At night, the view there is spectacular. I love it 😍.... Many tourists and even locals are there, taking beautiful photos.📸

review_title: A must visit when you're in spore
review_content: One of landmark in spore, near esplanade & easily reach by bus/mrt. Clean & free of entrance. Nice place to get photos of light show from marina bay (show start on 8pm).

It's an outside place a small merlion and a massive merlion at its back which faces the marina bay sands. It's a must see. But bearing in mind it's a very busy place with many holiday makers. It won't take 20 mins of your time to enjoy the views.
The area can be busy with tourist but it worth the walk along the waterfront.There are boat tours from Clarke quay easier than walking. but you then miss the atmosphere
Nice place facing to sea and showing one side entire skyline of the city. Always full of tourists and enthusiasts
It has been always my dream to see the merlion and I made it a point that it will be my top priority during our visit. 😍

review_title: The Symbol of Singapore and must visit.
review_content: The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and a great place to catch up with the locals and see the fantastic 360 degree views of Singapore. Catch the laser show from the Marina Bay Sands at 20.00 and 21.30, a must see whilst in Singapore.

I went to Merlion Park in Singapore in the afternoon and it makes me feel hot and humid. It is a landmark of Singapore, which attracts many tourists’ visit. Lots of people are going there to have photos taken with Merlion. I raise my head and then open my mouth as if I am catching the water spurted from Merlion while standing away from it. A wonderful picture is done! I think it is a better choice to go walking in evening. The waterfront is alive with lights and buzzing people around during night time. It is also comfortable in the evening when you are walking along the bay and enjoy the cool breeze. There are some performances and entertainments in bleachers as well. You can go shopping and eating nearby when getting exhausted. I had a great view of the city in Merlion, which is a choice for family trips. Well worth a visit.
Didn't expect it to be this big. One of the things that you should see in Singapore, nice restaurants around. Make a day of it. So much to do in the area.

review_title: Looks big in pics. But not that big actually
review_content: This merlion statue looks gigantic in pics. But when I actually visited this place, I found it to be small. And not that attractive as well.
It is the orginal merlion in Singapore, so you must go there.  There are many tourist, but you don't stay there for long.

If you visit singapore there is not completed if you not visit this statu or park. Yes merlion park, there was 2 statu small and the big one. At that time our bus was parking around 15 minute from park. So you has to walk..but worthed because you can take many picture of singapore view..

As part of our city tour we visited the site of the Merlion. We were told about the history of this (mythical) beast and how it was a symbol for the local people. Again, we did not really have long enough here to have a proper look around.

What a great experience! Even though we've been to this place too hot in the afternoon, we still manage to have a big smile on our faces. That very huge statue of Mermaid-Lion (Merlion) in that area will be a great place to remember. Now, we have had some experience/adventure to share in our friends, relatives and more, that we've been to that place and we have had our footprints leave there with a great experience. Very much terrific! 👌👌

review_title: Beautiful backdrop- Go early before the crowd
review_content: First visit to SIN, and my first stop was at 8am. Amazing backdrop since it is across from the Marina Bay Hotel and the Science Museum also close to many different restaurants and other scenic views. Lovely spot to watch the night show across the water.  *** BY 9am the place is crowded with tourist groups, by the statue grab your pics quickly and go.
You can choose either MRT or the Cable car to visit this place. From harbour front station, you can choose them.  You can climb up to the Merlion Statue if you get a ticket.
Saw this along the bum boat ride then caught the MRT back to have a closer look. Great views at night a real must do.
If you're looking for a nice background or selfie, you should probably go and visit here. Just don't forget to apply a sunblock coz it's quite hot by September. All photos were worth the sunblock 😊

review_title: Good views but nothing much to do
review_content: We wanted to go to Marina Bay Sands Observation deck for sunset, so decided to visit Merlion Park before that. We reached around 4:30pm and had enough time to kill after photography session. It was too hot too, so could not stay for long. Its not a park as such..dunno why it is called so. There are some eateries closeby so we had some sandwiches etc there and then walked to the Marina Bay Sands hotel. Its good to visit if you are in Singapore for the first time because Merlion is their national symbol, but otherwise nothing to do.
This is a great place to visit during evening or night to see the show but not day time. They are too crowded and hot. A great view of Marina Bay.
We are family of four with kids 12 n 8 and we enjoy this place.. The Lion looks awesome when it reflects with colors. Beautiful scenery. Must visit.

review_title: See the Merlion the signature of Singapore
review_content: Visited Merlion Park in the afternoon, was ideal in terms of the crowd rush. A place to spend some good time amongst flocking foreign tourists and lot of photo op for all family.

review_title: A nice view of the Merlion and Marina Bay sands
review_content: The park features the large statue of the Merlion, Singapore's symbol. It is extremely popular and often has a large number of tourists taking photo's of the area. Well worth a visit to take a photo (or two), especially on a fine clear day.

😁😁😁😁😁 first of all I am glad to be back at the Merlion Park the last time I came here it was under construction but today and as a further notice it is completely fixed and renovated and it's a spectacular view you get to see the weird looking Marina Bay hotel as well as the district's downtown business buildings and of course the land itself which spits out water. Definitely a must-see perfect for the early morning when it's not crowded!

I wonder what drive people here, maybe the marketing. Over a period of time, this lion fountain has become synonymous with Singapore. If you google Singapore this image will pop up for sure, once you get here a feeling of ïs this all"will hit you for sure. It's right next to the lake but so is Marina Bay. There is nothing special about this place, they do light it up in the evening. If the boredom won't kill you then the heat will surely get you. There are no shades in the vicinity no place to sit down and relax for a while because it's always too crowded. My honest suggestion will be to skip this and head over to Clarke Quay , its much more lively there.

This statue is famous to Singapore. So, if you are in Singapore I think it's a must see. During peak hours it gets very crowded. You can get some great pictures of not only the Merlion but other unique buildings of Singapore. There is a souvenir shop and places to eat there. Also, the Fullerton is across the street,
It's a great park when we visited in 1978.it's an awesome fountain in those days.try to go there in the evening to enjoy a lot. You can watch wonderful view.

I dont know if its because its peak season when we visit Singapore or there are really too many people now in Singapore. Thats why we didnt enjoy much the Merlion Park because there are a lot of people.

Singapore, it was a small country but really disciplined And that's really amazing!! My sister and I took a tour package from the airport for like $85 each, (it comes with the city tour, boat ride and the Singapore zoo entrance ticket as well, and a train card each) not knowing that its a walking tour, I was just shocked,coz we're a bit tired of walking, coming from our place to go anywhere, bus here, and ride a train then transfer to another and another train again (and I've never try to have a walking tour :) ) And every place we go, the tour guide will just give us 10 mins to take picture and then move to another destination! So yeah, 10 minutes won't be enough for you not just to take pictures but to appreciate and roam around a bit on that certain place. and the thing is, its hard to find room to have a picture in front of the Merlion! it took us around 5 mins to get a good spot! ''long queue'' seriously! :) and there was an old man (his Chinese) while my sister is taking my photo he just get near of me and touch my arm and tell me to move! because he wants to take lots of photos again! (knowing we waited for them to finished first) and my camera is a Polaroid what a waste of film!, he did it like thrice :) but we just ignored him and then leave! We need to hurry coz we we're the only missing from our group and proceed to the boat ride! and that's he best part of the tour!  The Tour Guide is really nice tho,   But yeah, I suggest if you'll come to SG just search where you wanna go! Coz as I said, its a small country so, and all the train stations are connected and usually downstairs there'll be a bus station, you just need to check the number, coz each number travels different ways, and yeah, before I forget better visit SG on 2020 coz when we went there last June (2016) and there are a lot of road works there, and he said that those road workers are planned to be tunnels, for train, coz the gov't. wants to make a train that would bring their people home in just 7 mins, in other words they'll have train station near their houses. Amazing aye?! Hope we can go there again! So we can see the difference 😊  All in all, it was really nice experience, but I think, its kinda pricey there, but my sister and I are good with budgeting our money, so yeah, we usually eat in the food stands in train station to save money! For just like $2.5-$4 each we got rice and dish already its yummy and healthy! and we're full! Rather than eating in fast foods and restos which is way expensive! Coz we once ate in burger king and we spent $25. 😊😊

Been here for about 5yrs back and its always facinating! This month when i visited its just simply awesome!! As Marina Bay Sands added to its unique landscape as well as the newly built linking bridge to esplane. It continued to amazed tourists! Going to singapore dont you dare missed this iconic park!

review_title: Always the most sought after Singapore landmark for photo ops
review_content: Although I had been here in 2007 and 2009; still the need to have a photograph in this Singapore's famous landmark is still an allure as this is my husbands first visit in Singapore😘When in Singapore this a must. We were accompanied by our friend Siti and we did enjoy several photos here . The Merlion Park is one tourism hub that is very Singapore clean very orderly Here you can see the Marina Bay Sands Hitel that also provide a good background for pictures😍
If you visit Singapore for first time I think it's good to have city tour and 100% they will take you to Merlion Park with guide tour who will tell you the story of lions land and so on ! ...

It's very easy to reach the park. Ride MRT then go down at Raffles Place. Few walks and then you're already there. There were a lot of tourists. At the Merlion Park you have a great view of Marina Bay Sands. It's cool! A must-see!
Recommend to visit this place at night (especially for tourist with jet lag), it is not hot, amazing city lights. Perfect for romantic walk.

This is a beautiful Park at by the marina. If you have to see anywhere in Singapore, this is it. Lots of people are around. Tons of stores to buy souvenirs. Great place for food and snacks to escape the heat under the bridge
The iconic Merlion is worth a look, but the park is overrun by people doing the same! You can catch water tours from here as well if you're keen.

I would say, this is Singapore's national attraction where one would want to visit. History of Singapore starts from here and one will also be able to learn the transformation Singapore has made dated back from the 1960s or even earlier! ✌😉

review_title: Spend evening and see light show
review_content: Merlion park is iconic place to visit. Get some coffee and sit on the bank to ser sun set. When we went it was crowded and was bit humid. Still we had good time seeing light show. One can take Ferry during light show. Nearby mall had some music concert going on. Plan for a evening covering Flyer, Merlion and light show.

review_title: A symbol of Singapore worth a visit
review_content: A very nice attraction, iconic of Singapore, next to the Fullerton Hotel and on the Marina Bay, with great views on the Financial District and Marina Bay Sands.
We thought we were in the wrong place as the statue is rather small. We took the mandatory photo and left because there isn't much to see or do there.

If you been to singapore; U must need to visit unless people won't believe you were in Singapore :P Its the history of the Singapore you must go there while you are in City Tour or you go personally. (city tour includes this free attraction).

Well visited their just to see the landmark, nothing to brag about. But it seems to be very popular with the newly weds and there is always some photoshoot happening. But the view is nice from here, specially at afternoon.

Every time I am in transit in Singapore, I always go to the Merlion Park to enjoy the scenic view of the city. It's better to visit in the late afternoon though because it tends to get very hot in mid afternoon. Facing the Merlion Park is the Marina Sands Bay and Singapore Flyer to the left separated only by the Marina River. I just enjoy the bliss in that area.

I really enjoyed what they've done here. You get to climb into the Merlion's mouth for some lovely views (and photo opportunities) as well as learn some history about Singapore in the displays along the way. Well worth it.

The best time to stroll around is at night where the glittering lights appear. If you want a long walk to enjoy the view you can start from Marina bay, it's too far for me 😥 Raffles and Esplanade are the nearest. Try to find the baby merlion within thw area it's kinda cute. If already tired and hungry fo straight to makansutra.Wait until 8-9pm and see the spectacular light show of the marina.
This is the place is you wanna get instagram worthy pictures. Really good view and everyone takes the cliche photo of drinking the Merlion's water.

Lovely views of Singapore's lucky merlion, the Singapore flyer, financial district and the marina bay sands.  There are a couple of food stands and some washrooms located behind them tucked away in the corner behind the staircase.
There is not much to see there. Its nice to get a picture of the merlions, but nothing else really to do.
Relaxing park after a long day of traveling/touring Singapore. Try taking fun photos and take in all the sights near the bay. Try to arrive close the 8:00 pm to see the light show across the bay.
The Merlion - one of Singapore's famous landmarks. A must photo op when in Singapore..  Don't forget to take a snap of the "Mercub" just behind his dad... 😋
Over rated but is the signature site of Singapore. Trip to singapore is incomplete without a selfie in front of the Merlion .

Amazing Hotel... We had a 4 days stay at the hotel, service was excellent , location is the best, accessible to train station without going out on a hot days, Marina Bay Shoppes is superb, within walking distance from most attractions restaurants everywhere close by staff are excellent and no problem on anything, Infinity pool is the best Experience so far, will definitely come back for a longer stay... Overall visit in Singapore is a pleasant experience, we've been in many countries and places but SG is the most of everything... Transportation specially... No worries of going late anywhere you go....specially catching a flight..👍👍🎉🎉👌👌👏👏👏💥⚡️
We got there by public bus.It was a lovely evening with lot of people.It's nice in the evening with the weather i's say.The view of the Marina Bay sands hotel from this park is fantastic.
From long time The Merlion has been the Iconic landmark for singapore. Beautiful view of Marina bay sands.

No visit to Singapore is complete until you pop by this park and take some pictures of yourself with the Merlion the iconic symbol of Singapore. Be prepared to pay a lot more for food and drinks in this area.
This merlion located near to Singapore river and near from Marina bay sand. this used most tourist especially from ASEAN to take picture. clean and quiet.
Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and all visitors end up here to take photos with the city as a backdrop.
This is a beautiful place to visit. The Merlion is the famous statue of Singapore. You get a scenic view of the skyline. It is worth visiting.

Situated centrally at Singapore waterfront this park provides photo taking area with the famous water throwing Merlion Statue in thr background. There are many cafes, restaurants and.bars adjacent to the park and the Fullerton Hotel is just opposite the park. Area is easily accessiblr by Train. Taxi and buses. Recommend to visit in the late afternoon and evening when the sun id not do hot.

review_title: Your visit is incomplete without seeing MERLION!
review_content: Day, Night, Down or dusk. Doesn't matter.  One of the best attractions of SG.  STUNNING views in any direction and in any time of the day!  If r visitor then this attraction is a must & your visit is incomplete without seeing MERLION!  🌟⭐️🌟⭐️🌟

Beware. There are lots of people taking pictures here. It's quite difficult to get a nice spot 😆.   But if you do, it's one of those postcard-perfect places aside from The Marina Bay Sands.   It's better to be here at night as it can get quite hot in Singapore even when the weather is cloudy.

review_title: This is probably the most photo'd spot in Singapore
review_content: The Merlion is Singapore's Icon. It would be hard to say you've finished a trip to Singapore without coming here and taking a couple of photo's. My recommendation is to see the Merlion while you walk around Marina Bay and just enjoy the sights. It's such a beautiful area.   Special mention to the Ice Cream shop next to the Merlion. It's pretty good on a hot day.

We got up a bit early (6:00am) took the SMRT down to Merlion to catch the sunrise. Took some photos along the way at twilight as we walked toward the park and once we got there we found a spot and set our time lapse cameras up and enjoyed the view. It was a great way to see the sunrise.

One of my main Agenda l purpose in Singapore, was to visit the Famous Merlion Statue. The Majestic Merlion which is a half Lion & Half Fish is Landmark in Singapore.  I have read & Heard a Lot about the story of foundation of Singapore & the role of Lion in it, It was my dream to visit Singapore & to see the majestic Merlion. However when I saw it , it was a white Majestic beauty standing Tall & Proud in the Park. Sight worth travelling & seeing, was delighted to see it.  Though we didn't Plan it, we happen to visit the Park at 6:30 in the dusk & stayed there till about 7:30. Its the best time to see the Merlion. However its also good in the Day light. But the best time according to me at night when all the light is lit up in Singapore its a lovely sight.

This is something that no tourist misses. Of course for a foto session with the Merlion. Apart from that, this point also gives a beatiful view of the bay area and the buildings around. Excellent for photo seekers. Open 24 hours, you can hang around here even at night.  Nearest MRT is Raffles Place. 10minutes of walk from MRT
Just one word ... Felt like a kid again when I visited Candyland and then not to mention Universal studios ..one of a kind and Amazing ... Will let the photos do the talking 😄
Everybody recognize this! Merlion Park with sculpture is very popular. You have to take a photo with it.

review_title: Don't miss the whole waterfront experience
review_content: This is such a nice area to walk and explore...don't miss this area of the financial district of Singapore.
Very nice place to take photos. Crowded place. Nice view with water, Singapore flyer and marina by the bay.
This place has always been the most memorable place for me and wife. We have spent many of memories around the place before we are married.
Enjoy 😉 nice walking 🚶‍♂️ along are side being in heart of the city. Many attraction around to visit or just having rest in the park
Bring your camera here. The Merlion looks great, as does the backdrop, so it's a wonderful photo opportunity. A must do, if one is on a walkabout (see my YouTube) in the Lion City.
a great park and wonderful location to place selfies and pics. had a great time here. lots of people around
The water area of Singapore is really lovely and a look at the Merlion is a must. Great photo opportunities.
One of the best places to check out in Singapore. If you are not here, then you have not seen Singapore at all. Lot of visitors at any given point in time.
nothing so special, but the view is pretty beautiful. Some people says that we are not really in singapore but to merlion.. 😆😆 from Merlion, we can also see marina tower and arround city central

review_title: Its the Merlion - You have too see it
review_content: We went down to take the photo of the Merlion. It is a nice little area day or night with a cafe and ice cream venue.

The merlion itself is fairly unimpressive, but serves as a landmark and focal point along around which the city can be viewed. And the city views are truly stunning! The spot does get quite crowded, with loads of tourists jostling to take photos and selfies.  Worth a visit, as part of a visit to the Marina.

review_title: Beautiful area to take a stroll
review_content: Merlin Park is a beautiful area to take a stroll and enjoy the vibrant tourist area, the big wheel, the Merliion and it famous fountain or just people watch. Plenty of vendors selling cold drinks, ice cream etc. Or watch the boats as they manoeuvre around the bay, or take a ride on one of the many boats offering trips around the bay.

For this place you need atleast one whole day as many attractions are available. The cable car ride with luge is a great attraction. The Merlion looks so majestic. Free train and bus is available to visit other attraction like dolphin show and aquarium.
A wow experience . A place which is excellent for photography. A place that signifies the symbol of Singapore the Merlion

If you go to singapore you have to go here. I think its not valid if you dont take your picture here ..hahahaaa Its nice .. the view of marina bay sands, singapore flyer, esplanade. Everyone went here 😊
One of the place a tourist MUST visit. The Earth is transformed into magical land. Have fun.. And keep roaming.. Cheers.
Fantastic view of the Merlion, Casino & various waterfront structures... great place to have a coffee & chill by the river to watch the world go by...

The Merlion is the symbol of Singapore and is certainly a must visit. Do not however plan an exclusive outing just for the Merlion, you can visit it en route to many of the attractions - its takes 15 min on average to walk the park and take photos. Very safe area and ample public transport available nearby.

Visited the merlion park and we saw the small merlion but the main one is currently under wraps so cannot be seen.   The view from the platform is still good as you can see the Marina Bay complex and the main skyline
Sadly we r not able to see the Merlion as it is under renovation. And we were exited for the water fountains too.. we waited at 8pm.. no show and we waited till 9pm still no show... 😰

Such a Nice Place to Visit,  A must see if you are going to Singapore, you should not forget to put this on your list, i think this is a very must place to visit, its a national symbol and seeing this icon once in a while is so worth it!
Bit of a disappointment as had been looking forward to seeing. But instead we were greeted with a boxed off canopy. Not to worry just another excuse for us to come back to Singapore

Its is famous park and it is a Singapore landmark and major tourist attraction, located near One Fullerton, Singapore, near the Central Business District, The Merlion is a mythical creature with a lion's head and the body of a fish.There are two statues in the park. It unique symbol of Singapore you must see it and take some photos.
We went here in the evening and observed the nice view of Marina Bay Sands, worth a visit for a short stay.
This is a nice park but somewhat overrated. It has the Merlion (or one of the five of them) and enjoys some spectacular views of the city. Good restaurants nearby too.
If you are in Singapore must visit merlion park. We went there 2 times, during day we did our photography and at night for light show. Every day at 8pm there is a light show. You cant miss that 😍

Made a point to walk over and take all the photos with the Merlion. The area is nice and there are some shops or hawkers nearby for food. Wonderful views of the bay. Definitely a place to stop to take photos with iconic statue. You don't want to miss this opportunity!
we always come here everytime we visit singapore. we love the ambience, and there is always difference form time to time.

"If you did not visit this place, you did not go to Singapore." This is the usual line I hear from other people, or read from magazines whenever Singapore will be brought into topic. Now I know the reason behind that line: Because this is what SG is most commonly known; this is its symbol.  Of course, you have to visit this place when you go to Singapore since this is one of your tour/trip's highlight. No entrance fee required. Wear a cap/hat/bandana, sunglass, and put sunblock lotion since Mr. Sunshine or Mr. Rain will unexpectedly say hello once in a while. You're lucky if it is cloudy since it will be good for a perfect photo (base on my opinion).  The only dilemma you will encouter: lots of people/tourists will always be there so have fun posting for a picture.
Because this is the Landmark of Singapore so many people come here everyday. I think if you want to avoid others be in your frame, you should arrive at7am.
This place always crowd, tourist from all over the world will come to this place if they come to singapore. This place is the most must go place if you are in singapore. Beautiful place......😀
Just a picture with the merlion head statue and your done with this place. At might a good spot to watch the marina bay sans fountain and lights show
Is a must to visit the merlion park if you landed in singapore. Attract lots of tourist. Hardly can take picture if visit during weekend or holiday season.

i had great memories of singapore from my first visit with my family way back in 1962....wow its changed,so clean and organised,very friendly.we stayed in the fullarton which was a great spot to do lots of walks from.can't wait to go back and explore more.

This park so cute and very nice to taking a picture there in the afternoon .  The brightness so nice if you like to selfie or ootd 😂  This is the most favorite place in singapore and there are a lot of tourism

review_title: A stroll in the park towards the Waterfront Promenade - highly recommended !
review_content: We thought it a good idea to combine a stroll in Merlion Park with a day-time visit to Waterfront Promenade. It turned out to be a very pleasant walk, enjoying the greenery, viewing the Merlion, MBS, the sky-scrappers, harbour-front, and watching locals and tourists taking selfies. Besides, no "entrance fees", it is a public park, with wide open spaces, easy for strollers and wheel-chairs, for young and old. A great place to "catch the breeze" and work up an appetite or work off a great lunch, depending on when to go there. We thoroughly enjoyed a relaxing walk heading towards the waterfront promenade. Highly recommended if you are in this part of the CBD.
Breathtaking place! My husband and I enjoyed the happy vibe this place brings. Very clean and well-maintained.

take a selfie with the merlon !! stroll around its surroundings... pose with the marina bay sands in the background!  just soak the touristy feeling... enjoy the wafer ice-cream,singapore is known for....  help others by clicking their snaps... !   the merlion park is walkable from the flyer... we enjoyed our walk around it... serene!!   for food lovers, there is a section of street food which is supposed to be good.. buy good comfy shoes/footwear for walking extensively!

One of the best photo ops in singapore. Asked a bunch of singaporeans where can the merlion be found but they didnt seem to understand us. Finally, we asked an indian janitor and suprisingly he was the one who pointed where the statue was. 😉

Saw it in the daylight before but the view is even more magnificent at night. We were very lucky to be there at the right place at the right time because they were having the rehearsal of Singapore's national day.

Everyone needs to visit the Merlion whilst in Singapore. We walked down from Clarke quay via the river . it was crowded due to rehearsals for 50th celebrations but we were able to get plenty of photos.a must visit

This has got to be the most beautiful place in Singapore during sunset. We were told to go here in the evening by the hotel staff to witness the beautiful sunset and yes we enjoyed it. 3minutes walk to fullerton bay hotel which used to be the post office back then.

There's not much to do here but take a few pictures in front of the Merlion or against the backdrop of the Marina Bay Sands. It's usually mobbed by tourists, so it can be a bit challenging to get a picture without someone walking in front of the camera...

This is place is way too crowded.. You can appreciate this iconic view if you are a bit too far.. If your too close to this crowd i bet you wont enjoy that kind of smell of people. 😂   Merlion is one of the Iconic place in singapore visit this place if its your first time.. But for your 2nd or 3rd a big no.. No..
Well you see the Merlion in every Singapore pic i travel guides. So u must go for click'n nice pics with the Merlion!!

I visit this place every time I visit Singapore. Take a walk around the marina bay, which has a floating Soccer stadium, a huge giant wheel across, from which you get a complete view of Singapore. This place is rich and attracts tourist's. Best time to visit Merlion Park is after 5 in the evening.
One of our friend showed us the nightlife in Singapore and the view from the Merlion is amazing. We had great pictures too.

The views are amazing and well worth the visit. It is refreshing to walk in the spray especially on a hot day. The day we were there, there were many tourists so it was difficult to get some good photos of the lions.

Whenever my tourist friends comes over, I would definitely bring them here since it's near my work place. It has the best background for photoshoot my it by day or night. Tip for those who wants to get there from raffles place mrt, take the exit H (Six Battery road), then turn right to the river then walk towards fullerton hotel, get in the hotel, go to basement 1 then turn left, walk until you see another stairs going down then you'll see a walkalator. After two escalor going up, you'll see starbucks then you turn left and yes, you've arrived :)

When you go to Singapore, it's MUST see this Merlion, the Icon of S'pore. am too excited when arrived near it and stared about 5 mins before SELFIE time.. With Great scenery too.. Attention!! don't climb up on the statue, its annoying!.. that's all from Nad2..

Singapore is lucky to have such a wonderful landmark. Me and my husband went to see this place in May. This place is always full of people, I think that is because this is the land mark of Singapore. Must visit because your traveling will be useless if you are not visited to the land mark of the country.
merlion park - saw in daytime and nighttime. Beautiful at night on clear night with views of singapore flyer etc across the water. Merlion lit up with water gushing out - well worth seeing.
You're not a singspore traveler if not going to this place. But, it's my bad luck when visiting merlion on a rehab so it's not good to take a picture. Maybe someday.

An excellent place to catch views of the Marina Bay sands. The famous fountain is also very nice with the Singapore skyline in the background. Gets pretty busy around the fountain but being patient you can still get the pictures that you want. From there it's a very pleasant walk around the bay to the Marina Bay Sands.
This place is cheap and free, so why not go look at a sea lion with water in its mouth! It's such a grand statue to be proud of!!

This is a must visit park to see the world famous symbol for Singapore. The size of the statue was not huge but the ambience is whay you get you. And obviously lots of photo ops with the lion cum mermaid statue and the water coming out of its mouth - some people are pretending to drink , some taking in hand, some on head...it's a fun place and the park itself is a good time to spend at least 1 hr.

Merlion is world famous symbol of Singapore. Walking from the bridge to merlion fountain we see marina bay hotel , Singapore theatres, flyer,central bank area and Singapore river all together which looks beautiful. It’s a busy place with lots of tourist taking pictures. Some small cages are around where you can sit back to enjoy the view. Around 30-4o minutes will be enough.

The Merlion Park has the world famous symbol of Singapore, the Merlion. The place is beautifully lit by night and there are always tourists busy clicking photos of this famous icon !!! One can sit by the cafes around and relax. The water flowing from the mouth of Merlion and the lighting looks stunning by night.

review_title: Nice place to visit but too many people
review_content: Being the icon of Singapore, the Merlion Park is a must-visit tourist spot during a Singapore trip. Undoubtedly, It is a really nice place to have a walk in, and the Merlion is awesome. Also, seeing the Merina Bay Sand over the lake is nice. But it really is merely a place for a walk and photo and the number of people there will definitely make you want to leave.

It was an awesome experience seeing one of the world's most famous landmarks right before your eyes! Seeing the Merlion for the first time is just, it complete's our vacation. You just can't stop taking pictures especially if from that view everything is just all there, when you look to your right you'll see the Merlion, when you look to your left you'll meet awesome travellers, when you look in front of you you'll see the Marina Bay Sands that features some Light Show at night! Everything is just sooo great! When you visit Singapore, make sure to drop by at the Merlion! It's just great! ;) Singapore is ♥

review_title: A grand view of the waterfront
review_content: I visited the park at day time and during a balmy evening. Situated in a location that has postcard view of the waterfront snd close to other tourist attractions. There are lovely restaurants and cafes too. Great place for photo opportunities.

Any Singapore trip has to have a trip to this monument of this country. Best times to go would be from 9-11 am and from 7.00-9.00pm to see how sunlight and the night lighting casts a different aura on the attraction. Lots of people are here so strategize how to get the best spots quickly.

Really this place had been hyped up by travellers . its like the eifffel tower or Pisa photo situation . YOU MUST HAVE ONE WITH THE merlion . do not even bother if u missed it . we keprt it last on our trip and visited it on our final day walk in Singapore . its a small square and your be shocked at the no of people there . Boat quay or Clarke quay is so much better scenic wise and rewarding . you decide , we went to see it so I guess now I know .

Going to Singapore and not having visited the Merlion near Fullerton One would be a mistake. We spent some time walking around along the place - there are a few restaurants and places one can get a snack or a full meal.   Access over the Bridge from the Esplanade or walking along the Boat Quay from Raffles Place. Like many other places easy Access by using (S)MRT.

review_title: Not a park, Be warned before getting disappointed
review_content: It's iconic and every tourist goes there, so you are obliged to go there . But here is the reality check:- It's just a medium sized statue with water coming out of a pipe within the lions mouth. There isn't much to do apart from taking photograph amidst the crowd. Go here in the evening to tick the place in your list of places to visit.

review_title: you shouldnt miss it if you're in sg
review_content: we went there in the morning so the sun was up high but you wont mind the the scorching heat of the sun when you feel excited to take a picture with the Merlion at your back :) its a must-see for tourists and a must picture to have when you are in this side of the world so there would be so many tourists hanging around this area. (tip: sunscreens/sunblock is a musthave for a singapore trip; hats/umbrellas/fans too!) if you want decent pictures one must bring a monopod/selfiepod so that your pictures would look ok eventhough there would be like many hands/shoulders/elbows/flaglets/hats etc. (i was there early summer 2014) there are restaurants in the area as well as a souvenirs shop so there area is definitely an all-in for tourists how to get there?!? researching online and the use of maps and signs is easy to go to this famous SG landmark! additional tip: look at how pictures were taken. on what side? the backdrop? you can take it with the MarinaSands like the thumbnail above ♡

Visited last August. The Singa-pore Merlion is an iconic must see when you are in Singapore. Having seen it from the water it was so nice to wander around the park and see it. There are lots of coffee shops nearby to watch the world go by or just to admire the wonderful view.
The closest you can come to the mythical understanding of the beginning of this island nation. But the part lion, part mermaid is an icon for tourist wanting to capture a picture of Singapore.

review_title: My son loves to see the Merlion
review_content: It is a must visit place when u are in singapore. The view from the park is great. Lots of cafes & restaurants around.

The park itself is nothing special, nor is the Merlion. But it provides one of the best and most iconic photo opportunities in Singapore. You can take pics with the lion, Marina Bay Sands and the skyline in the background.
A must to go to. The bay of this city. Nice view. Sometimes really crowded with tourist. You are never alone when you stop here.
The light show on the Merlion once it gets dark is amazing. You can stand there mesmerized for ages as it rotated through different designs.

So it’s just a statue of a half lion - half mermaid and is ALWAYS full of tourists trying to take that icon shot. There’s really not much to see around it, and the one time it actually looks good is at night but then that picture you always wanted cannot be taken then. Honestly the statue isn’t even of a big size or anything. Just take a look if you really want to else skip it coz it ain’t that much 😔
Half-fish and half-lion, the Merlion is iconic to Singapore and resides at the waterfront Merlion Park located opposite to the Marina bay Sands. Very nice statue but quite over-crowded.

The Merlion Park is located on the marina sands bay. It’s a short walk and has lots of destabilise in the statue. The statue is half lion half mermaid, the top half is lion whereas the bottom half is a mermaids tail. There is also a bigger version on Sentosa island just by Singapore.

review_title: Crowded but the magic still works !
review_content: This is the first time my kids visited this park as we don’t really like huge crowd. The view from this park which just across MBS is breath taking, especially so that we were there sunset time. We love the milkshakes and sliders offered by restaurants around the area. Mind you , a bit pricey . For three milkshakes, 2 french fries and 4 tiny sliders we paid Sgd 76. Well sitting there watching the view and feeling so at Peace is worth more than 76Sgd . ❤️😘❤️
This is probably the most well known landmarks in Singapore. You can walk here from Marina Bay Sands or from the Gardens by the Bay.
I’ve been living in Singapore for a few months and I walk through merlion park every time I’m nearby. It’s always lively and pleasant and I’m always happier for the visit.
So far the best picture will get on the park and so beautifully it was designed. Have lots and accessories available in the park.
This place is so packed it's so difficult to get a nice picture but It's cute though. Must go there again.

review_title: Get ready to take lots of pictures
review_content: Dont miss! Such a lovely area along the waterfront. Iconic Merlion will fill your scrapbook with pictures
Its a work of imagination.Great mind with great imagination. Its a marvel to contemplate the beauty of the place with people all round...

This is undoubtedly the only place one can recognize while speaking about singapore. The locations is easily accessible through public transport. Was a 10 min cab drive from the place I was staying in Katong. Being the tourist place it is mostly crowded but worth a visit. Try visiting during dawn or evening hours to experience both sunset/sunrise & night lights. Has a good view of Marina bay & singpore flyer. A couple of hawker centers nearby makes it economical to grab a quick bite as the onboard restaurants can be a bit pricey. But a great place to spend the evening enjoying the breeze & admiring the beauty.
